67Ypd6qZOrb3pkI4Yn6ZLA.text: I come here quite often due to the fact I have a bartender that works here and I work a few stores down. I give it 4 stars. Reason why?   Answer: all the burgers are cooked to the way you want it. Burgers can be customized-there is no limit. THIS IS NOT A FAST FOOD BURGER! so if you're expecting a $2 ... don't enter this establishment. I believe the burgers are priced right especially for the quality. Presentation is great as well. If you are unsure of what to order... ask. Every time I keep coming here, the menu seems to expand. A year ago (or less) they didn't have a desert section...now they do! Staff is very outgoing providing a laid back experience. However, don't always expect the staff to be there for every refill... They may have a habit of socializing amongst each other. (now I'm not sure since there are many new faces) Seating is very cramped especially sitting in the tables that are in the middle of the restaurant. Normally I sit at the bar... Much more comfortable.

5GPKOASC8Q_EHlJwmxaG8A.text: Horrible experience. Our order was wrong and the food was mediocre at best. Don't go there it is overpriced and poor service!

BFBLE4dlsdEvjvODMiuOBg.text: Nice selection of beer, burgers were good, and the prices were reasonable. Service was a little slow though.   Solid restaurant, but I don't feel the need to really go back

W-a0VDjpDjvNWgV6JF2zWw.text: In my opinion, there is not much to come to Mandalay Bay for outside of this restaurant.   I had the black angus beef burger with american cheese on a sesasme bun. I wasn't a HUGE fan of the bun but overall the burger was juicy, well cooked and very satisfying. The fries and onion rings were also great.  But the best part was the black & white milkshake. OMG was it worth the calories.   This was a fun restaurant to go to. Everything is solid and although it's not the "best" burger I've ever had, I think it's a MUST GO for vegas.

UlOsyHeQ9_INltq7HeYMZQ.text: This is a nice place if you're looking for a different burger. They have lots to choose from.  I had the lamb burger and it was just ok.  No, spicy ketchup does not make it worth $20.00.  Now, the twinkie shake....that's the B O M B!  The staff was nice and polite but the music is way too loud to enjoy a normal conversation.  I'd go back....

S-4FHhuKBicwEI42W1uX2g.text: The Veggie burger is a must-try! Service was wonderful and the zucchini fries were heavenly:)

ZzkjiZ4uTqMx3dFBYMSH1Q.text: I'm not much of a burger person, so take my review with a grain of salt. My friend really hyped Burger Bar up for me, so I was expecting something amazing. In the end, I realized I prefer In 'n' Out.  I just got bleu cheese, avocado, and bacon on my burger, and the bacon was crispy and spectacular. As a whole though, it was just okay. Considering we spent more than $50 for two burgers, two orders of fries, and one soda, I was unimpressed.  I've also tried Burger Brasserie and Gordon Ramsay BURGR, and I found them to both be delicious, unique, and worth the outrageous cost. But Burger Bar just didn't do it for me. I'll give it another shot if someone insists but will never choose this place on my own.

BByieaHrdPimd3drNd2FzA.text: Don't bother with this place.  You will pay a pretty penny for a subpar burger.  I had the Kobe burger with cheddar. Sweet potato fries. And a nutella milkshake.  The burger was overcooked which always bothers me, as the meat loses its flavor when it is burnt.  I like Kobe burgers and this one tasted like nothing more than a middle of the road restaurant burger.  The sweet potato fries were nothing to write home about either.  Just a note, I got my burger on a ciabatta bun and I would not recommend this, as it was too dry and really took away from the burger.    Chef veggie burger with buttermilk zucchini fries was also pretty blah as far as the burger is concerned, but the zucchini fries were pretty good, these I would recommend.  All in all I would not recommend this place nor come back to it.

3OEbr6HWU3xQTiYeSjNbNA.text: Kobe beef burger is really good.  One of my favorites here in Vegas.  If you are on this end of the strip and want a good burger, I def. would eat here.   I like Burger Brasserie in Paris too, but this place wins because of the awesomeness of the Kobe burger!

Oex0rq01uMNScmCKsR6VPw.text: The burgers ate Red Robin taste better than the ones here.  The medium burgers were overdone and dry.  The skinny fries were kinda mushy.  Disappointing and expensive for what it is.  Nothing special.  Even below average for restaurant burgers.

Cs_E8qfHfJD7Pr7ur96f3w.text: This place just falls into that "it's oky if I gain the weight because it was that good category" . They have wide selection and many different varieties. You can not go wrong here!

WKmtehH6iFemGFsE00hCsg.text: When in Vegas and staying at Mandalay Bay, we always come here for our burger needs.  Hubby loves his kobe beef burger and I just stick with something more simple, the angus burger.  Burgers come with the normal fixings of lettuce, tomatoe and onion, if you want to order any extras like bacon or cheese, there is a charge.  Burgers range anywhere between $10-60.  Damn, I can't imagine getting a burger for $60, but to each their own!    I get my angus burger on ciabatta bread and order bacon to be added.   For drinks, try their Strawberry Mojito.  Yummy!   Nothing really special about the atmosphere of this place, but the burgers are to my liking.

oGBZiVhJamlL0psOjdvCig.text: We went here mainly out of convenience, we stayed at THEhotel. Awesome burgers and very customizable to fit your needs. I liked that when we ordered medium done, they made sure it was just that, perfectly pink in the middle. Despite our large party of 11, our food came out in good time and there were absolutely no mistakes. Their fries and sweet potato fries were good.   I'm reading the reviews and I wish I had gotten a milkshake or a beer to go with my meal now. That definitely would have been a good end to the already great meal.

xzKnVG-b_FpUho75aXZnYQ.text: Service was friendly, fast and efficient. Some were also eye-candy as the waitresses there are probably forced to wear belly exposing tank tops.  Burgers were below average. I love burgers and was starving, but at best these burgers were not good.  The burgers needed seasoning and was not juicy.  About $20-25 for a burger is over priced, especially for bland, near tasteless food.  Decor was generic of any typical burger joint.

_kOG-r0slGY9TeaaYaUI2w.text: Phenomenon culinary experience! Flawlessly execution of concept. The Service was unmatched. The menu will amaze. Best restaurant in Vegas!

spO_PQfF0vuow8uV8hlg2g.text: I have to be honest the hamburgers are good, nothing crazy, but the real reason why I ever go there is their spiked shakes, now those are bomb!

BzicuKRJ8dVrivWVVV2GtQ.text: Our food was great! I had the Greek burger and really enjoyed it. My only complaint is that sides are ala carte and $4 for 8 onion rings. They tasted delicious, I just don't know that $17 for a burger and 1 side was worth the money. I'd recommend giving it a try. My friend loved her Chicken and Brie burger.

-YhHjw1ct-ZmIt4QdOUGFw.text: Hit or miss on menu items. My husband ordered a buffalo burger medium rare and it was cooked perfectly and tasted good. I made the mistake of ordering the sliders. I'm not sure it would have been possible for them to have been any drier. I didn't even finish them. Service was ok. I wouldn't go back when there are so many other great places to eat in Vegas. BTW, the best burger I've ever had in Vegas was actually at the All-American Bar and Grille in the Rio hotel.

HJdnvJn_00lOdeWW2TJBWw.text: Always a great time and always a great burger. No matter what I order here, I am always satisfied. I used to work nearby and would frequent Burger Bar for their Sweet Potato fries and turkey burgers. The level of variety is quite impressive and they seem to always be updating with new and interesting menu items and burger ingredient selections.

g8hR01hvLsrVDXG8CB8ckQ.text: Best. Burgers. In Vegas.   My favorite place to eat whilst staying in Vegas. The service, food and prices are just amazing. From the servers to the bus boy, personality is unparalleled. We go with the natural burger with wheat buns and sweet potato fries. I just love this place. We're sure to dine hear AT LEAST twice during our weekly stays in Vegas.

VwqGzxkG7nJQ1cfekjv5-g.text: A bit underwhelming. Everything was under seasoned, but was rich. So it was heavy on your palette but had  little flavor.  I got the Hubert Keller burger, modified to kobe beef and smoked gouda. Couldn't taste the cheese, couldn't taste the meat, all i could taste was the steamed spinach, which was off setting.  Quick guide: Buffalo meat = more lean, robust meaty flavor -- recommended. Kobe beef = Soft texture, under seasoned, very mild flavor.  I'd try a different burger place in vegas before I return.

Fg98CmoaLXgdwwBO1cvDrQ.text: Great service, one star food.  Ceasar salad was terrible and burger was just so so.  Lemonade did not taste made from fresh lemons.

OEacrg90X5EktKQVCxIDWw.text: One of the best burgers places.  I had the Kobe beef burger and I usually get that burger, if the place offers it. The Kobe beef tasted great, succulent spot one with medium rare. The sides are alright. The cocktails are surprising good. I haven't tried the desserts cause I'm usually too full by than.  This place will fill you up cause the portions are bigger than usual.   As for services nothing spectacular, but when you ask them particular questions like is this sauce made here or where did you get the meat if they don't know they come back and gather that info for you.    Overall, they are known for their burgers and if you want a burger come to this place skip the rest.

3AcL-wDRhoYB37skoF7HlA.text: I've eaten here a long long long time ago. With so many options for burgers popping up and I never seem to be at Mandalay, I haven't been back.   I "created my own burger" with a naturesource patty, jalapeno bacon, aioli, lettuce, tomato, onion. I just wanted to keep it simple. The patty was decent sized and cooked to medium as asked. They give you sauces on the side, and their aioli is garlicky great. Awesome on fries, too. The husband made his own as well. Both of the burgers were decent.   I think the best thing is the sides. I like the zucchini fries and their french fries were solid.   Back when this was one of the few burger spots, I thought it was really good. I've been a few times years ago. I've found many a burger I would trek to a casino for and this isn't a special trip place for me. It's still a solid spot and a go-to if you are in the Mandalay Bay.

beSF9eBTuEDtxM2YlVq7-A.text: Everytime I'm in Vegas I always stop in for a burger.  The food is always delicious and the staff is friendly.  I like the setup of the restaurant and also the quickness of ordering my meal and having it delivered without any issues.    It's a place where I know the food and service will always be great.  Thanks for not letting me down

i-p0JKeJg2kKJ9nr4MUtkg.text: My review is based on the bar and drinks only as well did not eat.  However, everything I saw looked amazing.  We sat at the bar and ordered a few beers.  Service was great the whole time.  They were very knowledgeable about the beer, which is harder to find then you would think.  They had a good selection and had several beers that are hard to find as well as some we had not tried before.  They were also willing to do some different half and half for my husband.  Also, during happy hour the prices are reasonable.  I would definitely be back here to drink as well as hopefully eat next time.  Its also nice to be out of the casinos, so the location is good, but it is a relatively small restaurant for how many people they pack in.

JTn1ZrpACd3KJFG3wMr81g.text: Decent place, "New Vegas" pricing for food, you know, $17.95 for a Kobe burger - but it does come with fries! If I read the menu correctly, $3.95 for a soda so get the water or order a cocktail instead. Lots of beer choices and they also have a full bar. Busy place on the weekend (like almost every place on the Strip) but they do have a rather large bar (runs from the front of the bar almost all the way to the back) so if you have a smaller party, belly up to the bar for faster seating and service.  Probably worth going to at least once for the experience but a bit overpriced for me for what we received. Good service, good food, just priced higher than I expected for the food received. Hope you enjoy it if you give it a try.

P2v_AbLv2zjRWglKq-L4Sg.text: Not sure if can add anything too restaurant that has over thousand reviews. Why not?? It was not even my idea but after pre drinking for concert at the House of Blues, no dinner, and concert of heavy metal Amon Amarth nothing better then going carnivore style. Me and two other friends went too concert headed up too Burger Bar. I always wanted too check it out just never got around too it. Now knowing location so close too House of Blues looking for greasy food soak up the alcohol Burger Bar solid solid choice.   It was my first time so had no idea the menu worked. None of us have ever been here so asked our waiter questions. He did awesome job of explaining everything too us. You can either build your own burger or go with ones that have on the menu. We optioned for the the ones that not build your own cause other ones it comes with fries. Maybe the build your own does but as far from my four PBR recollection or more  in could is negative. LOL!  I had the Peppercorn Burger. It was awesome. I know drinking but still the balance between the dijon mustard spread and the peppercorns (plus the peppercorn cream sauce serve on the side; put some of that cream-a-licous on top) slice tomato, lettuce, and onion. It was nice hearty burger at the perfect time in life. The burger meat was cooked perfect medium. The only thing that was disappointment was the fries was average at best. The burger which reality is the reason come here was Awesome.   Service could not say what an amazing job our waiter did! Not only with the questions. Two of my friends had the craving for nice over easy egg on top of their Hangover burger. You can add too the burgers already on the menu item ones. One of my friends notice his egg was way over done. The waiter apologize went back fixed the problem and came back with perfectly cooked over easy egg. You know perfect second break that seal have the egg yolk spreading all over its the bomb. Just knowing that do over easy egg right way on any burger. Always reason for me too go back!   Pricey. It Hubert Keller and on the strip so comes as no surprise. Too see $60 burger on menu blows my mind. Still most of the burgers average $15-20. I think your definitely getting quality burger. Fries could be better and meet the standards they set with the burgers. Just my take.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Peppercorn Burger

vpKchkJpvXJ-uCWrHcAoXg.text: What a horrible experience! Let's start at the beginning. We were quoted a 15 minute wait time. It took 21 minutes to be seated. This normally wouldn't be so bad, except the app that they force you to download to check in doesn't allow you to get real time updates.   Issue 2. Our drinks came out incorrectly...granted, one diet Pepsi, 3 waters and two sweet teas is a difficult order but at the same time, when told of the error, it took 7 minutes to get our accurate drinks.   Issue 3. The food was Luke warm for 3 of us and completely COLD for another. When we advised the waiter that the burger was cold, we told him that we didn't have time to wait and one of us didn't get a chance to eat lunch.   Issue 4. Upon inspection of the replaced burger in the car, the add ons that we paid for weren't on the "fresh" burger.   Issue 5. Our server must have joined the witness protection program because he came around as often as Haley's Comet.   Between the walk, the subpar food and massive mess ups, feel free to frequent burger bar at your own risk.   My Thank You lunch for my team is now an experience that we will never forget.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

iH5EwklMsIf8q1gKw42BcQ.text: This place isn't bad so to speak. It might be wonderful if you eat meat. But, for vegetarians, it wasn't that good. The veggie patty was basically a rice cake. It also didn't really have much flavor. And the total cost for 2 people was close to $60 (including taxation and tipping). The food wasn't bad. But if you're paying out $60, there is probably much better food elsewhere.

pc3f_p5nmpISQ_axedS0cQ.text: Brie burger and fries are delicious! Great service, our server was super nice and helped us to make a decision on what to drink (strawberry mojitos). Nice atmosphere with tv screens at the booth. Defiantly coming back if anything for the fries....drool!!

DTem8fuRBsCXBpQOs7ugLQ.text: My hide at spot when at the hotel. Get away from the noise with excellent bar service and quality food. Love that they're open late too.

93ZaIsCiV729g9baa5U8ng.text: Yum yum and more yum. We ate here last year and it was great so thought we'd try it again this year and definitely not disappointed. I had the vegan veggie burger (I'm not even a vegan) which was grilled eggplant, capsicum (I think you call them red peppers here) zucchini, on a mushroom cap bun (no bread) and it was delicious and super filling!! My partner had the All American Classic which he loved as well.  The service was fabulous despite being packed and even allowed me to change my skinny fries to sweet potato fries a few minutes after I ordered without a hiccup. They had a great service where instead of just waiting they just messaged us when our table was free and we were seated 2 minutes after we put our names down.  Will we come back here? Definitely!!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegan veggie burger

kI4pi07lhS8ozByGRUt8Lg.text: We had a $50 food credit to use and thought that Burger Bar would give us the best bang for our buck. Burger Bar is located one level 2 in the Shoppes area of Mandalay Bay, not in the Fleur/1oak nightclub area. Got there for an early dinner on a Saturday and there was no wait. We called to put our name down but they said it was first come, first serve. I guess they changed their policy based on previous Yelp reviews where people made reservations.   We were seated at a booth which had a USB/110 on the wall! Perfect if you have your cable on you and have been depleting your battery while wandering around Vegas all day! Being the purist that I am, I went for taste and ordered the Kobe burger for $18 and added foie gras $13 which I can't get in California. The burgers come with lettuce, tomato, red onion and a pickle. K got the regular Angus for $10 with various toppings. We also got skinny fries for $4 and mozzarella sticks $7(!). The foie gras was pretty good and a decent portion for $13. It wasn't the best I had but it doesn't matter as much when you're smashing it on a burger. I had to have a few initial stand-alone bites. My burger was so juicy and flavorful, I just constructed it with the lettuce and tomato and that pretty much made it. Figured if I was paying $18 for a burger then I wanted to taste the burger and not a bunch of condiments. It was super filling too.   I had a few of the skinny fries which were just fries. K loved his mozzarella sticks but I don't think it's worth it for $7.   We had great service although when we asked about different menu items, she answered "awesome" to it all. Which was True but just hard to gauge the level of awesomeness for each item.   Prices weren't cheap but not too outrageous. I felt for a hotel restaurant and location, it was a good experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Foie gras $13 and Wagyu $18. So good I would do it again.
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My foie gras Wagyu burger. Delicious.
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. USB chargers on the wall at my booth! Wish I had a cable on me.

fucd244Js31owj3Ft096QA.text: I have eaten here many times over the past few years when I come to Vegas.  The food never disappoints, and the service has been consistently good.  I recommend the buffalo, or even the veggie burger if you are looking for something different. Regardless of which burger you choose, get the seeet potato fries!  Instead of a cocktail, consider having an alcoholic shake instead for dessert.

1M1BspOn6bf3QgkBMADzHg.text: The purpose of this review is to warn everyone, they do NOT take reservations.   Their site on Yelp and their one website on Mandalay Bay states they do, but they do NOT.    If you are a party of 10, with more than 24 hours notice, then they have a process where you can email someone.

HnIESCs8_xSbtdXuRky94A.text: Ordered the sliders sampler and it was sooo good my favorite was the caramelized onions one!! also this place plays the SLAPS whoever made the playlist deserves 5 stars

R-KCGFDr9pEGLaybVbN0kg.text: My Wife and I went here and we were not happy. I ordered the Build your own Kobe burger w/ sweet potato fries and my Wife ordered the bar wings and fries. The fries were the only hot items on our trays.  The burger was just OK and it was room temperature.  The wings were cold. We waited 40 minutes for our food. People that sat down next to us 10-15 minutes after we were sitting got there wings and burgers before us. I ordered a medium burger ao that didn't cause the delay.  Overall not the 4 star experience as stated here on Yelp. I was so excited.  I mean it is called the Burger Bar and burgers are my comfort food. I was not comforted nor happy.  I will not be coming back to this establishment and wouldn't recommend it to anyone.   The manager apologized and comped the wings and my beer but it still didn't make up for the bad experience.  Ahe said her kitchen was having a melt down. If your number one and main item is burgers then at least that should be good. I could have gone five guys for the same quality burger.  Sorry Burger Bar you did not live up to the Yelp hype for this burger connisuer.

0Mlu64264F1fDuiVYfGp8g.text: Been here a few times and am never disappointed!  The food is always delicious and the staff is always friendly.  The service can be a little slow but it's worth the wait! Oh...and the alcohol milkshakes. ..TRY THESE. Your life won't be the same!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gdtX2tEGKDja9FE5HcfAcw.text: After much debate we decided to make our own burger rather than choosing one of the burgers straight from the menu.   I chose the barbecued marinated beef with bacon,  sauteed mushrooms and blue cheese.   The Burger was juicy and cooked to perfection at a medium grill.   I could tell the beef was high quality however I couldn't taste any type of bbq marinade.   The bun I chose was the pretzel bun which was just the right texture,  chewy and tasty.   Sol chose a grass feed beef burger with bacon,  a fried egg and American cheese.  He had it put on a chibatta bun.  He had his burger well done which to me is too done but to each his own.   We also split a sweet potato fry.  Sol also ordered a side salad which was very disappointing.   It was lettuce and vignette,  that's it.   No other toppings.   Weird.   We drank water.   Alcohol drinks were on the menu for $12.50 each.   Milk shakes were $9 each.   They were good size but yikes!   Even the tea was $3.95, really?  For tea?     Our bill was $50 for 2 hamburgers, 1 order of fries and 1 side salad.  Even though the food was good,  it wasn't anything I couldn't have made at home.   Two thumbs up for the burgers.  Two thumbs down for the prices and the side salad.   Fries were fries.

ytm7lDCFIO1YjSDFVQMXVw.text: Over-hyped.  Build your own Kobe burger was good, but you have to add everything and that's where it really adds up. $24 not worth it.   Fried pickles were whatever. The batter didn't even stick to the pickles so you ate the pickle alone and then the batter. (Came with 6 little ones.. For $6.95!)   Fries were good but still not worth the overall price. (Also small portion)   My friend got the build your own Atlantic salmon and it was a mess to eat.

F6tBlRHLfWh1rkNw8eWQsw.text: Great selection of beers get this place it's 2 stars but that's where all the fun stops..  -Waitress was less than enthusiastic  -ordered slider trio, comes with fries.. With all these good reviews about how good the burgers are I thought this place would be perfect but these were definitely the worst sliders I've ever had. Dry dry dry.

ZvpVLojI0pOexxacf8xpaw.text: Honestly $70 for a burger with foie and truffle isn't worth it.  Cuz honestly the burger wasn't that amazing.  My buddy and I had shake shack, fatburger, and burger bar and thought the rating was 1.  Shake shack, 2. Fatburger, 3. Burger Bar.  Even if Burger Bar's burger was same price, I would still rather get shake shack.

ccGuQBUnndqMrjULXJifCg.text: Not was I was expecting. 6 of us went for lunch (at an off time), so we didn't have to wait.   We ordered all the sides, milkshakes, and burgers. The sides were my favorite part. The milkshake was really just too rich. the veggie burger was ok.   I'm not going back. Hubert disappointed me here, and at Fleur (terrible experience).

NwRq4EtpKn2K_uLIod_Z9Q.text: they Burgers are what its about and if you like them than you are surer to like this place. Kobe beef is good, black angus beef..they really do it up right.

7gd6mwj0Ajh3R5jsoGHWqA.text: We ended up here late on a Saturday night. This was not our first choice (amazing how many restaurants close at 11pm!) I am super glad we ended up here. The burgers were awesome and since I am not a huge burger lover, I was pleasantly surprised. There are several options for the type of meat you want and I went with the hormone free usda beef. It was extremely flavorful. My husband, who loves a good burger, was also impressed. We would both like to return and try another type of meat. The only negative was the service. It wasn't awful but it definitely could have been better. We were sitting 2ft from the bar but it took forever to get a beer after we ordered and our server was just hanging out at the end of the bar talking with co-workers. That is kind of ridiculous. I would still give it another try though the burger was that good.

2Pdtb53iwU_o_YamHqNgxg.text: This is probably the 3rd time we have come here. The first time was in Vegas, second time in San Francisco and the third back in Vegas, because my daughter wanted to celebrate her birthday over here. The meat on the burgers were not seasoned well. I had informed the hostess that we were celebrating a birthday and they did not bring her anything with a candle on it! Very disappointed!!!

jdKba1VPyEw2SWwQ9Zrurg.text: Have you ever had a hamburger? are you sure? ok.   Have you ever had a hamburger from Burger Bar? NO? then you lied, you've never had a hamburger.  This place is AMAZING!!!  Where else can you get a Kobe beef burger or have foie gras or black truffles on your burger?    Not only are the burgers out of this world but their fries always come out perfectly.  I'm not a huge fan of sweet potato fries but I'll always take a few from my friends if they order some.

e9NcG8ZCE4Fhv2zlQzNopQ.text: I was really worried I gotta admit from some of the review but I came here anyway today and had the Rossini $60 burger.  I can tell you it's a combination of greasy, fatty flavors that I've never had before.  You HAVE to salt it and add black crushed peppercorns AND the sauce they give you and I promise you it is the most extravagent burger (if you can even call it that at this point) you'll ever have.  My wife had the surf & turf burger with lobster and asparagus...A-M-A-Z-I-N-G.  Now that's it's over it all was totally worth the bill.  Don't buy this stuff if your strapped for cash...it's skews your opinion too much.  Come and eat this if the prices don't scare you and you'll think it's the best lunch you've ever had.  Period.

ugxKYsTFjoFV1UiQoV1imQ.text: I went to Vegas in January.  I ate here the majority of the time.  These burgers were the shit, dude!  Very fresh, and well prepared. I don't quite remember what I got on most of the burger. Can you blame me? My family came to Vegas before this time, and said this place was awesome. They did not lie.

aTbw-0gWV2IAQ5pDQ3MW0Q.text: I love the way they text you and let you know so you don't have to stay there for awhile. The food is nothing too special for the price. I have nothing to complain about other than the vegi pattie being a bit plain. I personally don't think it's worth the money.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

tkLV8iCx6EPXlu_1guX8wA.text: Long wait for large parties (2 hours +), but if you split up your group to like 5 people / table, the wait is less than 30 minutes.   Lamb burger medium rare - lamb was not good (not fond of the spice)  Sliders - good Sweet potato fries - good with the aioli sauce  Zucchini fries - kinda mushy but okay  Hangover burger medium - pretty good  Wings - meh Shrimp salad - jumbo shrimps and decent vinegrette   Overall, good if around Mandalay Bay but not something I'd come running back to anytime soon! But if I do come back, I'd definitely try one of their shakes next time. Looks amazing!

1OvvH3qiRUEupc0uISs1ig.text: Haven't been here for a while but decided to come here for lunch today.  Food and service was just ok this time around.  Our server didn't really have a personality and was hardly around.  We saw her when she took our order, when we got our order and whenever my coke needed a refill she popped in to fill the glass, and for the check.   When our food was dropped off,  it was literally dropped at the table and he said enjoy as he already started walking away.  We've had better service here before.

Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

eJzphWzcZSzB25JQQnaXwQ.text: Thanks to all the great Yelp reviews and the fact that it was close to our hotel, we decided to try the Burger Bar. It was late when we went in for dinner, about 11:30pm or so. The restaurant was fairly empty, I think there were about 2 or 3 other tables that were occupied. Our waiter was helpful and seemed to be very busy.   The burgers here were so-so, nothing great but I've had better. My husband had a lamb burger which was nice, mainly because it came with spicy ketchup. The sliders I ordered were ok. They were a little dry, but not bad. I asked for some ranch with my fries and it came semi-frozen. We also ordered the Salted Caramel Milk Shake, which was excellent as was my husband's Mai Tai.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salted Caramel Milk Shake!

3v4T3PIhobu508u28gIoOQ.text: Great burger, a little shy on lettuce and tomato. Experience dampened by the nickel and diming charges; virtually everything on the menu is an up charge. Onion rings were ordinary.  I've had much better onion rings: Two Heys in Alhambra and Top's in Pasadena.    Booze shakes were exemplary.  I think that Bobby Flay still wins here.  Pricey. A burger and booze shake after tax and tip?  $35!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Q374eyJe6f-5cV_s6B-UXQ.text: This place was delicious!!! Fun atmosphere and friendly staff. We are glad we came here but so many good places to eat here in Vega so won't come back until our next visit

UmtK3naF7ek1zQZJ0kZQyA.text: We were hungry for some good food while in Vegas.  During out search, I remembered that Hubert Keller has the Burger Bar at Mandalay Bay. So we went there. What a great decision!  While we had to wait for about 45 minutes to be seated, but once we were seated, the service and the food blew us away.   Our server was super nice, friendly, and attentive. The food server knew which of us ordered what, which I had not expected from such a casual place.  That's great service.   The burgers were simply amazing!  I made my own burger for almost $21 but it was worth every penny!  It was honestly the best burger I've ever had.   The drinks were also amazing as were the dessert milkshakes!!!  We've been to Hubert Keller's famed Fleur de Lys - that was wonderful, and this is an even better experience!!

9FPPJShVKDELadkhbYUggQ.text: Wait. Wait some more. I hope it's worth the wait. Still waiting. The hostesses have attitudes, why? So hungry. Still waiting. Glare from hostess. Wait. Was that my stomach making that noise? Wait some more. Do I hear the theme song to Jeopardy in my head?  Finally, our table is ready!   I am starving, so I will let the rude hostesses slide, lets do this! I order the Vegan Burger, which I know you are now thinking to yourself, what a dumb veggie head and you will now discount my whole review....... Well here it is. It was just meh and I have had better. All the veggies were grilled but the whole thing was so greasy that I had to use a fork to eat it. What didn't help it was the side of fries that were cold. So looking back on my evening, I should have just stuck to ordering a milkshake and possibly that would have turned this into a three star review, maybe.

J3ugxnG_ZL_6WC1fNbjEyw.text: Note: I'm a burger and beer gal.  I'm giving burger bar a 2 because the burger was just flat out not worth it. $24 for a mediocre burger? No thanks.  A few of us started with the american "kobe" beef as our foundation. I added guacamole, provolone, and bacon and a side of chipotle mayo to mine. First of all, to charge that much for "kobe" beef would typically lead a person to believe that it just *might* be worth the extra change. It wasn't. The meat tasted incredibly LEAN and dry, in fact, and it kind of showed when my meat patty crumbled into multiple chunks. What the?? Sadly, the toppings couldn't save the burger from its miserable demise as I tried to pick up its pieces and enjoy what I could.  The boyfriend's kobe burger didn't crumble, but one of the other kobe burgers that were ordered also suffered the same ending mine had. A fluke? Did they run out of the good meat and think it would suffice to give us the norm? Meh.  Whatever the case, I've had burgers 10x as good for less than half the price so burger bar was a complete fail.  As far as beer was concerned... nothing was appealing. I peeped out the bottle list just for fun and was completely taken aback by a $20something bottle of sculpin... you must be delusional.

8xC3cJjn2jTusOgaod-UXw.text: The most delicious burgers and an amazing variety.  The Kobe beef is very tasty and worth the extra bucks.  I added cheddar cheese, onion, and tomato, and the spicy burger bar ketchup.  We also order a Kobe with peppered bacon, and carmelized onion.  For dessert we had a chocolate milkshake and a chocolate burger.  I've eaten there twice and plan to go again when I'm in town next.

5zifx5cnmKceAjbmMsHI7Q.text: After not really eating in vegas...to look good in my bikini we decided to indulge and get the best burger in town.....I am so glad this was spot we chose. It was a Monday and our waiter was amazing...so attentive, had to be the best service I have had in a while, wish I remembered his name.

rQRR_U88z8OyHSlpSHt95A.text: Great place near Mandalay's casino. The burgers are really good. I got the burger medium on ciabatta with an egg and jalapeno bacon. Super delicious! The onion rings were also really good - cooked perfectly. I love the customized burger and am craving to go back!

vwvfQysxpIPm6rdKegDSGQ.text: Great build your own burger menu with gluten free options that fit the bill too.   Delicious.   Don't forget to check out the alcoholic milk shakes :)

tXmLsRoyRW7lTQu_95OjGQ.text: See profile site for full review with formatted pics.  Perhaps it was Boulud, perhaps Keller.....at some point someone decided that a 99cent cheeseburger at McDonalds simply wasn't enough.  Foie Gras, Truffles, Shrimp, Lobster.....you name it, you got it.  While I do find it odd that I found myself being led into Burger Bar by my friend when I don't particularly like beef and don't eat burgers, I will admit to have had a few in the past and my all-time was the Thurman Burger in Columbus Ohio, a famous one in its own right.  In a day that included Tableau for breakfast and Alex for dinner I must say I didn't expect much from the Burger Bar....but I was pleasantly surprised.   While the Bar was located in a shopping mall at Mandalay Bay I didn't judge....most of Vegas feels like a mall anyhow and Per Se in NYC is located in a mall, as well.  Arriving around 2:30pm there was a line...a good sign I guess....our names were taken and 10 minutes later we found ourselves seated at a 4-top in the middle of the restaurant.  While the place was quite loud, conversation was quite easy and our menus were delivered quickly.  With 5-6 bread options, 5-6 meat options, 40-50 topping options, plus desserts it actually took longer to order than we had imagined.  Eventually I settled on the Turkey Burger on Ciabatta with grilled Shrimp, Pesto, and a side order of Sweet Potato fries while my buddy opted for the Kobe Beef Burger with Sharp Cheddar and Hickory Bacon on Whole Wheat with Spicy Skinny Fries and a sampler of beers.   As the place was busy we chatted for a bit and I decided to get up and explore.  Much to my surprise the kitchen was wide open for viewing and I wandered about to realize how fresh all the ingredients were, the bread being baked in visible ovens, and the meats stored in large lockers.  Everything appeared very hygienic and clean, very much unlike your average burger shack.  By the time I arrived back at the table my buddy was working on his beer and approximately two minutes later the food arrived.  While I spent a moment dressing my burger and eating my incredibly garlicky pickle spear, I heard my buddy partially-moan....clearly he was loving this burger.   Once my burger was adequately dressed and I had a large pile of ketchup for my fries it was time to dig in.  Crisp ciabatta with a fluffy interior first greeted my tongue followed by the wonderful basil blast of the pesto mingling with plump and tender shrimp and well cooked yet juicy turkey.  Great texture, quality ingredients, wonderful flavor, well cooked....what more can you ask for in a burger?  I next dug into the fries which were simply fantastic and #3 only to Michael Mina's Duck Fat Fries and Michael Symon's Lola Fries in terms of crispy outside and soft/salty inside.  I do find it rather unfortunate that the restaurant did not order an organic/original ketchup given the quality of the ingredients otherwise, but I guess a minimal amount of HFCS won't kill me.   Having finished off our burgers and laughing more at the PTI analysis of the USC/Oregon State result my buddy and I opted for a dessert burger - the chocolate version featuring a split donut topped with a chocolate gnache puck, mango "cheese", and strawberries.  Humorous in presentation and tasty in flavor, this choice was excellent and split down the middle this "burger" was just enough after the huge burger/fries.  The mango cheese was especially surprising in its fresh taste and jello-like texture while the chocolate puck was so rich I doubt I'd have finished one myself.  The donut was a tad dry, IMO, but didn't hurt the burger overall.   All told I liked the energy and the food at Burger Bar.  While certainly our most "low class" meal, I actually enjoyed the experience and the pricetag more than Sensi and Craftsteak and my buddy loved it which was excellent since he humored me in going to so many French restaurants on the weekend.  IMO, foie and truffles are best served by a chef like Stratta or Savoy and not on a piece of beef and buried under toppings...the concept of the Rossini Burger is ludicrous and anyone ordering it is showing off and missing out on the opportunity for more originality and customization at a lower price.  Regardless, to each his/her own and I think the concept of designer burgers has a lot to offer...even if the underdressed and uncustomizable option at Father's Office is still the standard by which most burgers are judged.

qsDOQMfrcl8mRKyT3GILqA.text: It was good but not great. I had the sliders and onion rings.  My meat was good but the sliders were pretty plain otherwise. I expect more of a burger only joint.   The rings had a unappealing aftertaste and there was nothing special about them or the sauce.   My husband had a Harlem Shake which was fun. Service was rudimentry.

aDqek2JD1QL8e-nRCCpMvg.text: Earlier in the evening, last Friday, I visited Hubert Keller's other place, Fleur de Lys. So after experiencing amazing service and food, we dropped in his casual Burger Bar for a snack.  Well, I wish I had never had gone.***  They have a funny system where you basically pick your choice of meat, an array of toppings, various buns, etc. I decided I didn't have enough brain power to do all that so I ordered the sliders. Everything initially tasted good but as the food cooled and our appetites were satiated, everything started tasting a bit off. I ended up not eating the buns for the sliders and stopped eating the fries. Even the wonderfully fried onion rings were weird.  They did have some burgers that you didn't have to do a thing but order like the foie gras burger ($60) but after explaining to my group what foie gras was, they all decided it was disgusting so I didn't get to order it.  But still, nothing was horrible. It just didn't seem to be worth the price (except for maybe my $15 22 oz Doc's Draft Pear Cider). However, one in our party really didn't like her food so the manager ended up taking 10% off our entire bill. That was very kind of them.  Late night you see a lot of drunks walking to and fro. This seems more like a frat/ sports bar anything with the crowd seemingly made up of 80% guys. I did witness a waitress help a girl in an extremely short skirt to the restroom. She later stumbled back to her table with her skirt hitched almost up to her crotch. Oh wow. Note to drunk girls, Burger Bar is not dark enough to hide bare thighs.  *** We only went because we meant to grab late night happy hour next door but they just closed at 11 p.m.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. sliders
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $15 for Doc&#39;s Draft Pear Cider (22 oz)

Oox3KI9n2Aew5mymtr9xkw.text: My wife and I have been here four times now, twice as tourists and twice as locals. We've watched the menu evolve and grow, and had (mostly) successful visits.  Each time I end up getting a wagyu burger with a bunch of elaborate toppings and all three sauces from Keller's other restaurant at Mandalay, Fleur de Lys. It's an epic feast and hits the spot every time.  One notable exception was a couple of years ago when we came an hour before 2 a.m. closing. At that hour, the service was weak and the food seemed cold. Otherwise, they cook it a solid medium rare each time - something that a lot of other hamburger places have trouble with.  Solid hamburgers, with quality ingredients, at strip prices. And if you get lucky you'll see Hubert himself walking around.

UVO1H6i2XDiGDefDFptFEg.text: BEST BURGER I HAD IN A LONG TIME :)   5 stars: *prompt seating *great customer service -- our waitress kept coming back to check up on us and kept refilling our drinks without me requesting for a refill. i love that! *The meat wasn't dry! *A creative way to dress up your burger  I will call my burger "The Morning Beast burger" (don't laugh because it was GOOD) *Turkey burger *Dry whole wheat bun *Blue Cheese *Caramelized Onions *FRIED EGG!!  It was really good! The turkey burger wasn't dry at all! i know in the past  turkey burgers tend to get dry due to lack of fat but it was grill to perfection.  PS. Try the Sweet Potato fries! :)   Total bill for two people was wound $40 with drinks so it wasn't THAT bad. I rather spend a lot of money on good food :)  Have anyone tried the Truffles?! $35 each?!!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. my turkey burger -- onions, blue cheese &amp; fried egg
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. tv in booth

8GxWD7Uvgy-QLAbkEUe7Gw.text: I can definitely go back to Burger Bar right now! I am still thinking and drooling about it as I write this. The last time we were at Vegas, we couldn't find this place for some reason but we were adamant this time and found it.  At first, I thought it was just another burger joint as The Counter but Burger Bar is much better in every way. The service was great and the food was sooooo GOOD!  I ordered the Atlantic Salmon burger ($8.50) on a wheat bun and added on spinach and avocado. The burger already comes with red onions, lettuce, tomato, and a pickle as basics. The add-ons cost a little more but for all that, it came to be like 10 something. The salmon was cooked to moist, tender and juicy and everything complimented the flavors very well. Since I am not going back to Vegas anytime soon, I am definitely going to make this at home.  Of course, I can't have a burger without fries! We ordered a side of sweet potato fries and their buttermilk fried zucchinis. The sweet potato fries has the right crispiness without the grease. It could have used a little more seasoning but I was okay with it. On the other hand, the buttermilk zucchinis was seasoned to perfection with a slight crunch and the perfect crispness. (Oh my..I want more now!)  This was a great experience at the Burger bar and it is an A + in my book.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Atlantic Salmon Burger with added avocado and spinach

HXIOgVZMdVXLS7Hs8QBWYA.text: These burgers are nothing special unless you are willing to fork up way too much money for a burger.  I assume that the more expensive burgers are probably pretty good, but even the basic burger at a burger place should be decent, right? However, the cheapest burgers here were kind of dry and flavorless without lots of ketchup and toppings. I suppose that's Vegas for you, eh?  The sweet potato fries are pretty good, and the variety of toppings available is impressive.  The sad news is that each one is something like another dollar. Fail.

lwN4azrslas0kekyugbSAQ.text: My boyfriend and I's ever so often treat is coming here for a Kobe burger. At $16 it isn't cheap, but we share it (it's a good size), and it's soooo good.   We always add provolone cheese, cheddar cheese, cinnamon bacon, and oyster mushrooms. All delicious and to die for.   They carry some awesome beers (try the Wailea wheat!), and service has always been good. The wait sucks, but there's a reason wy this place always has a wait.

OjtpeIkqQSzrpsgU0pZ4hw.text: Great service and great food! My hat's off to Erin our server who was by far the best we have seen in a long time. The burger was just as ordered and quick. Erin never let our glasses get even half way empty. She had about five tables or more and she ran them like a pro! This place is in the shops area between Mandalay bay and Luxor. I would totally recommend this burger place! Thanks again to Erin!!!

pZLIlLDT0lXV0cb6bDEmqg.text: So I'm walking through the Mandalay Place after exiting Luxor and pick up a magazine that shows this huge hamburger on it, a story about the best burgers in town.  Sure enough, Burger Bar is at the top of the list. This is Super Bowl Sunday, so right before the game starts, I see that it's not too busy inside and the maitre 'd tells me I can sit at the bar, but anything over an hour may cost me an extra 25 bucks.  No problem, I didn't plan on being there that long.  Had to catch a plane back to Cali.  I pick me out the Salmon Burger.  This thing is awesome; large and very tasty, cooked just right and comes on a variety of buns.  I chose the potato bun.  Great choice.  For what I got, as a single patron, this place was great.  Easy, friendly, great service, stunning waitresses.  I hope to make my way back.

GWSkhLwGGleNCRGiPiyEww.text: I love this place! I heard about it through a friend who saw it on the Food Network. They were featured because of their $60 Rossini burger, which is a Kobe Beef with sauteed foie gras, shaved truffles, and Madiera sauce on an onion bun. *They have the same burger at a restaurant in the Wynn (next to the big waterfall) for $32! My fave is the American Kobe Beef Burger! It's SOOO good! If you're there, you also need to try their sweet potato fries. All the burgers can be customized with toppings of your choice. If you have room for dessert (which I always do!), you definitely have to try their dessert burgers. I've tried their chocolate burger (the best one), which has the warm donuts as the buns, chocolate ganache as the meat patty, passion fruit as the cheese, strawberry as the tomato, and mint as the lettuce! SOOO good! I have also had their Creamy Cheese Cake burger, which has cheesecake and carmelized pineapple on it. It is definitely one of the best burger places in Vegas! Btw, it's located in Mandalay Place (the shopping area) of the Mandalay Bay casino. Be prepared for a 30min -1 1/2 hour wait though. It's worth it! You can always walk around the mall or check out the great dessert place next door... Here is a little script from the Mandalay Bay website on the restaurant: The ultimate burger experience, from the famous restaurateur Hubert Keller of Fleur de Lys, comes to Mandalay Place. Incorporating the finest varieties of beef, buffalo, turkey, vegetarian and vegan products, a range of gourmet toppings and delicious buns, Burger Bar has a little bit of everything for the creative eater. Complete the experience with a Sweet Burger dessert or a hand-crafted micro brew. Here is their menu, if you want to check out what they have to offer as well as the prices: usmenuguide.com/burgerba... YOU HAVE TO EAT THERE!

Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheesecake Burger
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

CUOLzulDFvsQYpvuIfKPsA.text: I have been going to burger bar since 2007 every trip to Vegas. Year in year out the best burger I had in Vegas is here. I love Mandalay and this just adds to the experience. Perfect place for lunch you can't miss this place if you're in this neck of the woods!

MNadi3iQEMmEBSox5TJu2w.text: THANK YOU for having a Veggie Burger - this allows me to come here with my husband!  I am in search of the perfect burger and this one was REALLY GOOD.  I also LOVE Top Chef Masters and Hubert Keller.  I love the fact the Hubert has 2 higher end restaurants and then the Burger Bar - shows me he does not take himself too seriously.    Had the Hubert Keller burger (Chef's Favorite) with Ciabatta bread, soft blue cheese, spinach and onions.  It was FANTASTIC.  The blue cheese was perfect, not overwhelming at all.  A perfect blend.  Also tried the fried Pickled Jalapenos - WOW.   Next time I want to share the Rossini burger with someone (Kobe beef, Foi Gras and truffles) - right up my alley!   Great selection of beer as well.

wGvJuoz3CtTAekZeCFFqUA.text: The burgers here are awesome! My husband and I have a habit of ordering the same thing. I try not to but we both adore Buffalo Burgers and well we found the best one yet. Also the first time I ever saw sweet potato fries was here also. We didn't order them because we were scared to and the waitress said she was sick of them. She also said she was surprised that we didn't order them because she said everyone orders them. I have had them since this experience and I kind of wish I had ordered them. The waitress was sick of them because she ate to many of them as would I.   I showed my husband the dessert burger off this page and he was pissed that he didn't get to order that. How could we eat that after eating our Buffalo Burger? Did you see that thing? I'm know what I'm getting next time.

rZc_gBLgv9gSABdfhlcLsg.text: This was the best burger I have ever tried. The service was great and the Twinkie shakes are so good.

1HAjEOKW842RTf_fHO1edA.text: This is our burger hideout. We have taken every possible family member, business associate, and friend to dine in this establishment. We have always had a great meal - every damn time. Sometimes the hostesses are a little snotty, but the snotty ones don't last long and the management always makes sure you're happy and full.  The burger selection is fantastic - your choice of buffalo, beef, turkey, chicken, salmon, or lamb (that's relatively new option). Topping choices are extensive as well. There's something for everyone. My favorite is buffalo with a fried egg, bacon, and roasted peppers with no bun. Other times I'll do zucchini, spinach, and roasted pepper. I've had their burgers a dozen ways and they always come out delicious.  Also, they have their sweet potato fries down pat. Love them.  Oh, and do yourself a favor and get a shake after you're done eating. They're huge and filling and will most likely ruin your appetite (do I sound like your mum?).

6j2HNRFs8rFA3dK6CwWa1Q.text: 3 friends and I came to the burger for an early dinner on a Saturday night. We were greeted and seated quickly. Our waiter Sergio was the best! He was friendly and very attentive. Will definitely be back!

83rmyC0PQmpU0HQ_pmc9Dw.text: Delicious GF bun for burgers!!  Stopped by during happy hour, split a burger on Gluten free bun and GF steak fries. SO tasty.   Friendly bartenders, relaxed atmosphere inside the Mandalay bay shopping area. Would definitely stop by again during my next trip to Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great GF beer and cider options

kRqYMyhmCUxEfN1zKtmh9A.text: My husband and I just left from lunch here and everything was amazing. I really like their menu as they have a variety of interesting burger options along with chicken and salmon and healthier choices as well. The burgers were so good and the buffalo tots were awesome. Levi was our server and I can't say enough great things about the service, he answered all of our questions, made great suggestions, and was so friendly, he's really a great server who continued to make sure our experience was a good one. A+ all around and I highly recommend trying Burger Bar, we'll definitely come back.

h62xbLfHCzkQlyMcCdvMqQ.text: A friend was staying at Mandalay so we thought it would be the perfect opportunity to try it.  It's located in the second level Shoppes at Mandalay towards the Luxor.    To start we all shared the Jalapeno Onion Petals.  Very tasty! At first I couldn't taste any of the jalapeno kick but after a few bites it showed up.  It's served with BBQ sauce and ranch.  There was a large amount so it was easily split with three people.    For my meal I chose the Burger Bar Sliders.   Three cute little burgers just calling my name.  They are topped with plain bacon, cheese and grilled onions.  I used some of the leftover sauce from our appetizer as well.  Really good! Of course I had to get the sweet potato fries on the side.  They give you plenty with your meal.  I almost didn't finish them... Almost.  I enjoyed every bite.    I also had a taste of my husbands burger.  He built his own with angus, grilled onions, pepper jack cheese and jalapeno bacon.  They cooked this perfectly.  Plus the jalapeno bacon is fricken awesome! Definitely better than the plain bacon on the sliders.    Service here could have been a bit better and more attentive.  Our drinks sat empty for a while until a different waitress came by.  But I did appreciate the others taking our finished plates promptly.    Even though it is pricey for burgers and drinks, i wouldn't hesitate to dine here again.  I think everything nowadays is pricey so I'll just roll with it.

Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jalapeño onion petals
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Build your own- angus beef, pepper jack cheese, grilled onion &amp; jalapeño bacon

knAVGqeT8XQPYD0kxc8otA.text: Came here one night with a friend from out of town. He's a burger lover so whenever he's in town, we always try a different burger place. So this time, it's time to try Burger Bar!  Burger Bar is located between Mandalay Bay and Luxor in the shopping strip area by the swarovski store.   We had a party of 4 and we were seated fairly quickly. Then again, it was also like 10 PM at night so it wasn't particularly busy anyways. The establishment itself was pretty big. It had a huge bar on top of that.   I'm not exactly a burger lover so my opinion is pretty neutral. However, what I do believe is that when you're trying out a burger place, you should always go with a classic. With that, you are more able to taste their ingredients clearly. Extra ingredients won't be getting in your taste bud's way.   I ended up with their "American Classic" --  black angus beef patty topped with American cheese, crispy bacon, tomato, onion on a sesame bun served with a side of skinny fries. I opted to put their crispy bacon on the side. I don't like bacon on my burger because it ruins the texture for me.   While I'm sure that they use good quality ingredients, their seasoning department is quite lacking. Not only was my burger under seasoned, my fries were under salted. Perhaps some people like that? I'm not one of them though. I ended up putting salt on everything like my life depended on it. And before you think that the bacon would've made a difference -- I'm not the only one in my party that thought the patty was under seasoned. Speaking of that crispy bacon, it wasn't crispy at all. It was more soggy than anything. Limp even.   The price was a little bit on the higher end of things, especially for a burger. My American Classic was almost $16. So with tax and tip, you'll probably looking at around $20. Though you do have to factor in that you're on the strip and it's advertised as a gourmet burger. The good part about it is that the burger they give you are decently sized. I got pretty full after eating half of my burger. I actually needed my friend to help me finish my burger :) Needless to say, he was stuffed to the bone afterwards.   Overall, Burger Bar didn't quite capture my taste buds or my attention. It's decent and not a bad place to hang out with friends when you're in the area. AKA when your friends are in town. I personally wouldn't be back to this establishment as .. I think there are better burger places in town.

QvuBHME4LZ54RZdBL_0b8w.text: Located just a couple turns from Luxor in Mandalay Place.  After hearing that Pete Rose was around the corner signing autographs at the sports place, we ventured upon Burger Bar and ordered something to go. Why to go? Why not stop here for a regular meal?  Well one reason is that we were in a rush.  Well then why stop here?  Because, my friends, they have something that is called the Nutella burger. The Nutella burger? What? I've never heard of that! The Nutella burger is on a glazed "doughnut" with a nutella mousse, strawberries, and a passion fruit gelatin. And nutella. Lots of nutella. The nutella was as thick as a regular patty. All that for $7. So here's what you'll think. I can get a burger for $7? Yes and no. First off, it's a dessert burger, so naturally it'll be small. Hahaha yeah it was small. I kinda guessed that since it was Vegas and I saw the prices of their other burgers. There's a Kobe burger for a price that I'm not going to repeat on here, but if anyone has ordered it, I wonder if that is good :P (you can check pics if you want :P )  The nutella burger was... interesting. Obviously it was a dessert burger and the donut thankfully, was glazed. The nutella overwhelmed the entire burger and you couldn't really make out the fresh fruit that was on the bottom of the burger. It had decent flavor, was surrounded by the Nutella (which obviously was the star).  Something interesting to try here, but probably one and done, unless someone else comes with me to Vegas and wants to try it out. :D  Friendly service, as the person who was seating at front was knowledgeable, kept us updated with our to go order, and was nice. :D

xpHkrKmZyUAXgP7OyTveSw.text: The s'mores milkshake was unbelievable the burgers are fantastic the fries are great freaking restaurant.... one problem though... the guy that goes around clearing plates accidentally spilled a plate on me with food ..so other than that probably would have got five stars..

rBoQTVWishy4yDK-2KJPpg.text: We ate here 3 times on a recent visit to Vegas since we loved the burgers so much. I recommend the Naturesource beef cooked either medium or medium rare, and add avocados with your favorite cheese and anything else you like. I also liked the jalapeno bacon and the jalapenos plus some lettuce and pepper jack cheese. Makes for tons of flavor for the burger.  We also got the gluten free buns and gluten free steak fries which were both very good.  Decent beer selection too, and they have some interesting malts if you still have room (we didn't). I liked the Snakebite mixed beer too (Guinness and hard apple cider).  It is a bit expensive, so minus 1 star for the price, otherwise we really enjoyed our meals here. Thanks for reading.
