y5ijAMdahVuesntmRmHk8A.text: Years ago this place was great.  Very high end in quality and ambiance.   The last two times we went it went down the drain.  Maybe Hubert Kellar isn't involved in it anymore.  The food is now sub par.  The kitchen can't get the orders right.  The taste of the food is lackluster and way over priced for the quality. We had to return a hamburger because the meat was bad.  Replaced with grilled chicken which was dry and flavorless.  The shakes are $13 and don't taste all that special.  You can't taste all the different flavors in the specialty shakes.  The cookie dough tasted sour/bad.  The General Manager isn't even aware of the food specials that have been advertised for game days.   We gave it two tries and will never come back.  It's really sad because years ago this was a great restaurant.

3n3IYtbdbIiwNRkiBimrxg.text: Poor service. Took a long tome to order our food, and once the burgers arrived they were burnt on the outside.  I would rate this as one of the worst burgers I have ever had and do not understand how they can F up a burger.  Pure Vegas complacency.

dKZTzFfI2vIwVvqgLXyf_g.text: I loved being able to create my own burger. But you gotta watch the add on's. Before we knew it, my husbands burger was over $25 bucks. But they were definitely tasty. The wait staff was friends and quick.  Wedge salad was a bust. Wouldn't recommend that.

sBielUI_621O-fR8E5Ctjw.text: My wife and I went on a Thursday night. There was no wait and the service was great. I got the American classic and my wife created her own burger. The patties are fat and juicy. My wife got the Nutella milkshake, it looked good. Unfortunately, she didn't want to share

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. American Classic

v0Tt-ulGiNlFMZdGoqMH5A.text: Bartenders were fantastic! Drinks great. We happened to hit happy hour and ordered sliders. They came promptly and were awful!! Dry, no taste and barely melted cheese. The sweet potato fries were wonderful however.

4yWmVb5voGD1yGx6BL9qig.text: We ate here because the Veggie Burger sounded amazing. It had so many yummy things in the patty. However, this was definitely a case of the description sounding betting than the food actually tasted.  First off, there were only 2 vegetarian things on the menu, and the wrap was (I think) $14, so we went with the $10 burger. Unless we wanted to pay $1 or more extra per topping, even for sauces, we opted to just have the lettuce, tomato, and onion it came with, and some ketchup from the table.  Pretty much, the toppings were the only flavor.  The patty itself was incredibly bland, with no discernable seasoning at all. The worst part, though, was the consistency. It was SO mushy, it squished out the sides of the bun when we took a bite. It was like trying to eat mashed potatoes on a bun. We both ended up using our forks to eat them...not even knives, it was that mushy. Such a disappointment, after the menu made is sound so great.  The non-vegetarian food might be better, no idea. A couple good points, they had a pretty large beer selection, and the sweet potato fries were good, though the portion you get for $4 (the burger doesn't come with a side) is really small, and not worth it. Our server, Andres, was nice and attentive, which is appreciated, especially since they were fairly busy.  It was one of the less expensive places we could find for dinner, Vegas is getting ridiculous, so it was fine for that one time. We wouldn't go back though, and at least for vegetarians, we wouldn't recommend it.

i5C_U_QnvWIkHvCJluLmxg.text: Disclaimer: I'm not a huge fan of burgers and only came here for my boyfriend who loves them. But I'm trying to be fair and judging based on if I did like burgers lol.  We came here on a Wednesday around noon before Thanksgiving. It wasn't too crowded so we got seated immediately. The waiter was really friendly and promptly took care of us. I got the chef's milkshake (called black & white I think). At first I thought $10.50 for a milkshake was super expensive, but when I got it I understood why - it was super big and had tons of stuff inside - chocolate, cookies (I think), chocolate whipped cream, and tons of both vanilla and chocolate ice cream made of real dairy. Maybe avoid if you're lactose intolerant and share with someone if possible. We almost got the fries sampler which was interesting but decided against it after the large milkshake came. I got the turkey burger with onion buns. Never had onion buns in my life but fell in love - it wasn't pungent and smelled and tasted amazing like cooked onions. The buns were fluffy as well. I felt the turkey patty was "too high quality" for me though - felt like I was eating angus beef. I prefer the frozen patties from Costco just because I don't really care for meat and I think those are more flavorful as they probably use more flavoring to mask the lower meat quality, but I'm ok with it! Would probably come back again for happy hour to try their cocktails, wings and sliders, which might be easier for me to eat since I'm not a big burger or meat fan.

xAzYgQlOqQ4826F-gKlEjA.text: So good! Perfect hangover meal. I went with the Philly cheesesteak burger, and chili cheese garlic fries. Service was fast, and with a smile. Definitely worth hitting this place instead of over rated shake shack next door.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic chili cheese fries
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Philly

gh4aVjUPcBKwpeXmlxgKYg.text: Service was speedy and efficient. My lettuce wrap buffalo burger was on point. Check them out you won't regret it.

k6KQhYYemCxXtQYL5hWRew.text: The one star is for the food that isn't bad - it's pretty good... But when you buy two burgers and two shakes, the $95 bill just doesn't add up.   I couldn't flag down my server. She seemed to be avoiding my table, well, she was avoiding work. I barely saw her. I called the restaurant repeatedly over the week to discuss my bill, but they never picked up. I ate my loss, literally. This isn't an establishment for locals and I definitely won't be doing back.

A3I2rymmRhYQEj5WkUVf9g.text: Great place! I had a business lunch here today and ordered the sliders with skinny fries.   There aren't many people in there... Maybe 10. But the top 40 music is at a loud enough level that it feels like I am somewhere fairly awesome but low enough that I don't want to kill myself. The service is top notch. These guys are really on top of things.   This is my first encounter with Hubert Keller (exec chef from Fleur). First impressions are important, and this food didn't let me down. The sliders were cooked to perfection. They were three very basic burgers. The focus was on the quality of the basic ingredients. Keller's staff was putting on a clinic for me of how to present a classic burger with no frills or fancy schmancy sauces and ingredients. I welcome truffles with open arms... In the right dish. You don't need to put them on my burger. I appreciated the sliders for their raw beauty and taste. Of course, if you want truffles, or triple cream Brie, knock yourself out... You can pile on gourmet ingredients all you like.   I was going to get a shake, but at $9 opted to stick to my Diet Pepsi. I think that's where I had the biggest problem. This is definitely a quality burger place. Of the gourmet burger joints in town, this has my vote (for now). However, it is hard for a place like this to dethrone the simplicity and tastiness, and price tag of a good ole single w cheese at In N Out. I know they are not the same. But when I want a burger, INO is the benchmark of a burger. You can certainly get better, but at a $15-$30 premium? $9 for a shake? I'm not sure if that is money well spent.   I'll be back. But not when I am just craving a burger. The next time I get a huge commission and I want to celebrate with my wife or a few of my buddies, the Burger Bar has my name all over it.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sliders with Skinny fries and a side of chipotle aioli.
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zpN_-BntmzTN1UHyTRf0og.text: Fantastic burgers. Our group had a couple Kobe burgers and Buffalo burgers and a regular. All cooked perfectly with lots of flavor. The Beers was nice and cold with lots of choices.  The staff was very friendly and outgoing.  Definitely a return trip is needed

vmhJmumI0nwOgxjfDBCy4Q.text: Always a wonderful time at Burger Bar!  The menu has something for everyone!  We usually start out with the truffle fries and the zucchini fries...  yum!  Load up your burger with all of your favorites...  they even have grilled asparagus and zucchini that you can add to your burger!  Amazing value...  the portions were so big that we took half of our meal home for the next day.  Make a reservation as it fills up quickly!

LLcIhuoezLdL3hB6WLU1TA.text: Stay in Vegas with the Fam and everyone wanted a good burger. Service was great, Burgers were very tasty with plenty of choices for toppings. Kids loved the shakes, The Nutella shake was awesome. Was a bit pricey for what it was even for Vegas.  That being said was a very good burger.  Loved the TV in the booth.

DlQXGHqV29NFwJ6LO0fkuQ.text: One of the best burgers in Las Vegas. I got the Kobe with brie, bacon, spinach, Caramelized onions and garlic aioli - wouldn't have it any other way. Their shakes are also to die for, but are big enough to be an entree so don't order too much!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing build your own kobe burger
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vanilla milkshake with Krispy Kreme and Nutella, has Krispy Kreme actually blended in!

xIOCePyNoDVGTCBZDLuUgA.text: Got off the plane an hour before showing up here, we didn't realize it would be so packed given CES so we had a half hour wait so we decided to go get Fat Tuesday's in the meanwhile.    Brownie points for them having mini TVs in the booths, got to catch the LAL/OKC game while we waited for our food.   I ordered the lamb burger (medium well) topped with what I remember to be fried egg, mushrooms, caramelized onions, avocado, and a few other things I can't remember on ciabatta.   It was damn massive and having not eaten since 12 pm (it was 9 pm by now), I somehow found the courage to wolf it down in 7 minutes. Perhaps it was my hunger but damn, that was probably one of the best burgers I've had. Everything came together so perfectly and 7 minutes later, I was a happy, well-fed person.   Fries I'm not too crazy on but I stole a few from my girlfriend's plate as she struggled to finish hers and I must say: very good.   Definitely gonna have to come back here soon. Didn't dabble with beer as we were still nursing our Fat Tuesday's, but the menu looked quite voluminous.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lamb burger with a fried egg and other toppings I can&#39;t remember on ciabatta

tWcSY6wDMuuvTgojjswwlw.text: Sadly, but most certainly, in the top 3 most tasteless and overly expensive burgers I have eaten in my 55 years on Earth.  $13 for a "black angus" burger on a mass-produced ciabatta bun with a slice of lettuce, tomato, onion and a pickle spear.  A small basket (the trendy metal ones that most customers hate) of so-so fries was an extra $4.25?  The burger had zero flavor.  Luckily, we did not have to pay extra for salt, pepper and hot sauce.   That was the only way to eat it.  Ketchup was served in a small cup?  Really - the owners can't spring for ketchup and mustard at each table, but they will give you a "sticky" bottle of hot sauce?  Service was too slow for making a simple burger and fries - even for the weekend grillmeister.  The restrooms are outside the restaurant in a hallway used by the shopping mall?  No - I am not joking.  Sodas are $4 each and if the waitresses could learn how to refill them, it still would be a cheap rip-off.  Maybe the higher-star raters had enough alcohol to dull their memories.  In the end, a very expensive meal - $53 for the restaurant's "classic black angus" burger, a turkey burger, one order of fries and 2 sodas (never re-filled).  As a local, we will not be coming back, our friends and family will not be coming and for the money we paid, we could have gotten twice the food at Shake Shack and 200% better service.  This place is the typical shopping mall sports bar that does have lots of TVs.   Re-name this place, "Don't Bother Bar."

wNOMvvVbJjmNaqG8BvHuZQ.text: Harmony offered maybe the greatest service I've ever received at a restaurant. She took a volatile situation from a misguided and insecure server and completely transformed the situation into truly a pleasure. Also much thanks to the 30's pinup, hairstyled manager. I forgot her name, but her intervention was noteworthy.  Now onto the food: the Rossini is the best burger I've ever had. And the fries with the different sauces are so, so tasty. If you top it off with the krispy kreme shake you may experience actualized Americana.

6Q6w04YDjRRySEIsCyTnwQ.text: Went for dinner and I am so glad I came here.   With the server's help, I got the kobe style wagu beef (was recommended to get it medium), oh whole wheat bun, with spinach, sprouts, smoked Gouda, skinny fries and a side of chipotle aioli. (at this point, I am not sure how else to describe this burger other than delicious and that you need to try it for yourself.I did not find anything wrong with my burger.) I wanted to go back for seconds the next day.  my guest got the angus beef burger on whole wheat with some toppings I don't remember.... all I remembered was eating the foie gras that was a part of the burger. The foie gras really tied together that burger.   We has a really great server that helped us as we were first timers.

4Zck7s6ap3WSlcj8VJhuvQ.text: Not sure what the fuss is here. Overpriced for quality of food : $35 for a chicken sandwich with Swiss cheese, turkey burger with avocado slices, one side order of sweet potato fries, and one Pepsi . . Turkey burger was very dry and bland. I ordered the homemade Dijon mustard as a side (they charge you for side sauces) and it was not flavorful, not even mildly the nostril opening good stuff of even a store bought brand. The chicken had some flavor to the exterior skin but was also not juicy inside. Very disappointing lunch we chose due to such good reviews. Will definitely not return or recommend.

btrzLOpZbLSq_TXkHdQr5g.text: The burger possibilities here are endless.. but at a price of course. Though they are ever-so-delicious, $30 burgers are realistic outcomes if you're trigger happy with ordering. I enjoyed the Kobe beef but hate myself for not ordering the lamb burger.  Normally I would rate this establishment a 4 for a reasonable balance between quality, service and price yet we had an experience here where my cousin-in-law accidentally left his wallet and the crew here kept it for him and returned it with every single dollar and card accounted for. Candor experiences like this make for an automatic 5-star review in my book.

o3BXZ7Vv3xvU-PkLAB_kSg.text: Sort of a weird location between the Luxor and Mandalay Bay. A friend of mine suggested I try it. I stopped in and sat at the bar. Place was clean and about half full or so. I ordered a beer and the lamb burger, or Greek burger as they call it. Took a little while for it to come out, but it was delicious as were the fries and the beer! I will come back here for sure. A good dining option in a sea of bad ones in Vegas.

MPjkCMYs3pcWofuOqSqM9A.text: I come here quite often when I am visiting Mandalay Bay, MGM, Luxor or The Palazzo. it has a great vibe and wonderful energy. Very attractive bar and wait staff. I did not try any of the adult libation as I'd already had quite a few myself..... but what I did see going past me and at the tables looked delicious...and very potent.   A very large selection of hamburgers or at least four to five  hamburgers that can be fully customized with special breads, cheeses. bacons and a myriad of other choices. they truly wicked roster of side dishes as well....... with stand out such as spicy onion petals and everyone's favourite onion rings.  the staff was very busy that night with an unexpected rush of people around 10 o'clock which included a table of 25 or 30. I wanted to sit at that table because there were some very handsome men!  The interior was spotless without being antiseptic. and the Barkers must not be charged grilled because there was no smoke in the main dining area.  If had one suggestion it would be this....  season the meat generously with both salt and coarse black pepper.  I will so be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Something he is about to happen... my hunch is Walmart Heiress...answer for making a visit.
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. It never hurts to ask....extra pickle spears.
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I can barely contain myself.... zero calories onion rings. And a spirited lamb burger.

SQ2SdvywixMNSBUfRwuLZw.text: Great burgers made from fresh in-house ground beef daily. No wonder they taste so amazing and juicy! Definitely the best burger in Vegas!! I had the baguette burger, which was amazing with just the perfect amount of melted brie on a fresh  baguette.  Also tons of add-ons and build your own including gluten-free buns and a great selection of beer (boozy shakes also served but didn't try one). Can't wait to try all of their burger creations!

3H5vqdpKA7fgvV4YnjhKkw.text: Utterly disappointed. Wasn't able to get dinner here. Was so excited to come here and eat. Had been planning this for weeks. There happened to be a power outage that lasted most of the morning throughout early afternoon. Now for this, I can't fault them and give them the one star.   The one star comes from the despicable host on Thursday afternoon and her sub-par customer service skills. We approached, totally stoked to see them open and we asked to be seated and we were informed that they weren't serving food.   Hmmmm, there was a table that was sat that was having food delivered to them right as we spoke.   WTF is that all about. We were there for a 36 hour mission and this was our main place to go eat, what we had been longing for, was shut down by this person. Learn some better skills and have a better approach. Ended up with a not so impressive meal from a back up plan that we weren't hoping to use.   Thanks for nothing. I hope you're still around the next time I make it down there...

XLgH8U61KjFkXbXVHhdO9w.text: Nice place.... great service. But, they brought my friends burger raw. Took care of it. Off the check, so cool. Food rating ahhh... I like a double double at in and out way more at one third the price. French fries are great. But, I wouldn't recommend it.

QGr69QFZj71ZWU-xirW4ng.text: Good food! Amazing Shakes! The service was quick. There was a 35min wait, even though we were told a hour, but so worth it! Can't wait to come back and try different shakes on the menu. I got the  Irish Coffee with hot fudge added to it, I highly recommend it!

vHzQdd-ZvY-8GBW24qsmvQ.text: We brought 4 adults and 4 kids to this restaurant! Our waitress was amazing!!! She brought the kids meals out first to keep them occupied! We had one little hiccup with our order and they corrected it with no hassle! The manager brought out a whole new order and was very apologetic! He has a great sense of humor and the employees were all awesome!   They make the BEST Long Island ice teas I've ever had! I was very impressed! No skimping on the alcohol here!!! Haha   Also being a burger bar, I have to add that the 4 burgers we got, were all absolutely amazing! The garlic fries and sweet potatoes fries are to die for!!!   Thanks for an awesome experience and for working with so many babies! 4 under 3 years old to be exact!

b-vwTYxRPpQtsbcohnoCoA.text: I'm such a fan of the uber casual dinner I had here last night!!!  I had this nagging urge for a chicken sandwich and the Burger Bar provided it well.  My picture looks like a rainbow of colors thanks to the carrot/celery "add" option!  The bread on my sandwich was squishy and fresh, the portion of chicken was huge and the fries were a perfect compliment of crispy heaven.  The price was right and the service was happy.  Thank you Burger Bar for not only having chicken on the menu, but doing it right--you were exactly what I needed!

Og60fLSJXH-ESjz1TGTQ2g.text: My husband and I went here late one night, because this was always on my bucket list while we stayed at the Mandalay Bay. I ordered a kobe beef burger with carmelized onions with cheese and top with the fleur de lys sauce, the black perigord truffle sauce. It was the best burger I've ever had. Together my husband and I paid about $60 for the two of us. It was by far worth every penny. My suggestion would be to come hungry, because you want to save extra room for this delicious burger. For the best gourmet burgers, you have to come here.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My husband and his kobe burger with sweet potato fries and aioli sauce
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kobe burgers

4tIfqhZVx9ZWKDL-ohjGYA.text: i've always told myself that the best burger i'll have will be reasonably priced.  it will be simple, with the most basic of fixings and in a basic setting.  man was i ever wrong.  the setting was as gaudy, arrogant, and loud [vegas] and the burger was just as much all of these things as possible.  but it was beautiful, much like vegas itself.  i ordered an angus burger with cinnamon bacon [i know, crazy, right?], a fried egg, pepper jack, on a wheat bun.  you can even get froie gras and truffles on your goddamn burger if you so pleased, although it'll cost you $60.  this place, being in the mandalay bay hotel and casino [?], is of course going to be expensive, right?  well, yes and no.  had i been in seattle and someone told me to pay $25 a head, i'd have told them to fuck off.  but in vegas, you spend all to get all.  so whatevs.  i also had their unfiltered amber beer, which was actually pretty decent.  one of my friends ordered onion rings, which were pretty good, but not the best i'd had and the fries were pretty meh.  the chocolate shake was pretty good, though a little thin for my tastes.  all in all, that was probably the best burger that i've had so far that i've paid someone else to make me.  the service was so-so, but they were busy as shit, in their defense.  all in all, it was the perfect pre-fight-spectacle meal.

3E7fj_OluSjZYlmHulZ8_Q.text: I love burgers. Even got a list dedicated solely to my pursuit of the perfect burger.  Did Burger Bar crack my top three? Not quite but they do make one hell of a burger. I also appreciate the different 'fries' options - skinny, sweet potato, steak and onion rings. The sweet potato were good but pale in comparison to the onion rings. Oh, the onion rings. I can't wait for the SF outlet of Burger bar to open so I can get some of your crunchy goodness on a weekly basis.

yVok6KmtZy-WoWhCMGCpCQ.text: I went to the Burger Bar and had a kobi burger with camelized onions and thought it was one of the best tasting burgers i have ever had. My brother had a buffalo burger and also enjoyed it very much. We also had onion rings and fried zucchini. It was all great and a nice place, but very busy so you will probably have to wait about 30 minutes. I do not eat meat anymore but when i cheat once or twice a year it will be here.

8HNf9Sh-vnXoWG5nftAPeQ.text: FYI: Most expensive burger or at least... most i ever spent on a burger  Decoration: Trendy   Food: Compare to 2.00 In N Out, worth your money??? MOst definately yes to Try every now and then  Service: Kind staff

STyAFb9sMXMPHnpC-HguTQ.text: Good food. Pricey.  Service wasn't very good considering it was slooow.  If I was craving a burger I would go there again.

F_O7xJ10hmGFmhIFmA6P8w.text: 2nd time here last saturday. the wait sux but it's worth it. good quality food at affordable prices. we split one kobe and turkey burger amongst 4 girls and added a side of sweet potato fries and fried zucchini. (they charged a $2 split fee per burger) we were trying to save our tummies for dinner. we had to wait about an hour to sit and it took awhile to order and get our food. by the time we were done, it was 3 hours till dinner time. =/  the turkey burger was better than the kobe beef burger. it was juicy and seasoned perfectly. kobe patty was bland. the fried zucchini and sweet potato fries were excellent. service was so so, just really slow. there were a bunch of open tables but still a lot of ppl waiting. maybe they're understaffed?

qc5_PmcftfgaZ3e9Xe8vbw.text: Sat at the bar and had a great experience.  Service was quick, friendly, and refreshing after a recent experience at Gordon Ramsey's.  I LOVE Burger Bar and as a local, always recommend.

NibA-_CjtbF09v3ulr64aQ.text: Went on a Thursday night and were told 15mins for a table of five, we walked away grabbed a drink elsewhere and came back. Were told they are just waiting for a table large enough to fit us. No problem, seated soon after that. The music got a little repetitive, like it sounded as if one song was stuck on repeat. The burger came out cooked exactly like I asked to medium rare. Had foie gras on it and thick cut fries with aioli. Great taste, great bun. A friend at the table got the "truffle sauce" and it was more like a broth that they drizzled truffle oil into 5 hours ago. No truffle taste what so ever. Ive had better burgers, but this was one of the few times it actually came out perfectly to the temp ordered by everyone at the table!  The server sighed as we asked him to pay the check with 3 cards as if pressing the button to split on the POS system and having to swipe not one but 3 cards was some painful process. Love to see him when the POS system goes down and he actually has to go old school on the knuckle busters and have to actually write out totals. Sorry to be so difficult.  On the way out we couldnt even get the 3 hostess to look up and acknowledge we were leaving and say good bye or thank you. The bussers dont care about the right of way either twice we were nearly run over as we were walking out and it wasnt like they were doing 700 covers that night. Overall the food was way better then expected but the service needs some serious work and improvement. Would go back again and just sit at the bar.

E0PhO45cbmXfO6fskPLE0w.text: mmmm..yummy.  of course I don't eat meat anymore.  By that, I mean I only eat chicken, turkey, fish and sooometimes bacon.  Which also means that I ate a turkey burger that was hey!  A-ok!  We have The Counter out here in good old L.A. so the price comparison was like (Kristy puts two hands on either side of her face and wiggles her eyeballs rapidly back and forth) "CUCKOO, CUCKOO".  But you know it's Vegas and we expected as much.  I got turkey with shrooms and gouda.  Also tried the burger bar beer, very good.  On the way out these guys were all, "how come your friend didn't finish her beer?"  to which she replied, "this is my third!" so the guys said they weren't leaving till she chugged it......  the burgers looked a little more rare the second time we saw them.

krkb2WysixZSbMlpSIju9g.text: This is my favorite burger anywhere.  The Kobe burger built as you want it, Sweet Potato fries and eat it as slow as you can so you can enjoy it as long as possible.  I recommend this place to everyone going to vegas and make sure I hit it every time I am there. Oh, and the sliders are fantastic too.

N4Vqfg2HkgL4eo6mOhkk6w.text: Very good! Even have veggie burgers for all of us vegetarians!  But if you are into eating dead cow ass, this place is good for you too :)  Great selection, awesome fries, fabulous service....and best of all....not too pricey either!  This is a great place if you're looking for somewhere casual and fun. Located in the shops between Luxor and Mandalay Bay

iZ0jp5Q1bfLbbohU8VZCRQ.text: A must hit stop on any Vegas trip, although the 35 minute wait for a table at lunchtime shows word is getting around.  The Kobe beef burger is amazing, large topping selection, onion rings are ridiculous, TVs at every booth, what more could you want?

n0Pk4wn45671wWhlDD_K9g.text: Stopped by Burger Bar in Mandalay Bay while having a great weekend with old college friends in Vegas.  Burger Bar definitely added to the great weekend.  Let's start with the drinks - they have an excellent beer selection, including fat tire which is one of my favorites.  Pitcher for $22 = very happy me.  Their burgers were cooked to perfection and included fresh, very tasty ingrediants that matched some of the other upscale burger places I've been - like Five Napkin in Manhatten.  I had the Black Jack Burger, which I can attest was fantastic.  My friends also enjoyed the American Classic, Black Angus Beef and Original Ultimate Burgers.  As far as sides, I tried their sweet potato fries as others on Yelp have said they are fantastic - I thought they were good but nothing special.  If I were to go back and I would probably go with regular fries.  Finally, the atmosphere was great.  Very modern place and it was packed, everyone was having a great time.  Great experience, I would definitely recommend.

-a3b98Ugxf5guO-_G6iBTw.text: Always a good choice.  What is interesting about this place is that I have been here many times and never ordered the same thing and never been disappointed.  The servers can be really slow, even when they aren't busy.  Ultimately, the food is too good for a medium priced restaurant to care :)  With all of the toppings, the choices are endless, but my personal favorite is the turkey burger on wheat, with sprouts, pickles, asparagus, swiss, and pesto.  Gotta love it.... wish I was there now...

1Q1afil4KdXHU_DNwzxHEw.text: friendly service and yummy food: the Hubert Keller burger is a must, although the chicken wings were a bit too dry, they were still very tasty!

sJPyC2RGDq3S1ynmgWUQWw.text: Long before yelp, I remember we ended up at this place by chance, as we were catching Carrot Top at Luxor.  I can't remember what kind of burger I had, but looking back on it, I thought "that burger I had at that place was really good."  Now, of course we all know what Burger Bar has become and that the place is pretty good.  Have returned on several occasions, which is rare, since I promise I don't live in Vegas. I want try the Surf and Turf burger, but I'm a little scared to change things up from the norm.

OBwlBbxdcD5x_CakKzII1w.text: Nothing that special here, service was okay. Ordered the American Kobe Beef Burger & sweet potato fries, was expecting a bit more!

L6VAc6qUEw4ngoc6gk4zKg.text: So I get a call from one of my sisters. She was in Vegas and tells that I have to try Keller's Burger Bar as we are Top Chef Fans, that it is super delicious and how I will love the waitresses. Well I did and she was right on both counts. The burgers are so uber yummy. My girl and I had the Kobe burgers.....simply wonderful. Oh so Juicy. They stay open a bit later which is great. Regarding the waitresses, they are all young very attractive brunets, Keller and I have similar taste in women.

VZ_Dz0nyOy71xDFGPnE92w.text: 3-stars.  Average.  Middle of the road.  The taint.  Someone help me understand how there can be so many people - legendary Las Vegas-based Yelpers that I have much respect for - that live in a town that has BLT Burger, StripBurger, Bradley Ogden, Daniel Boulud, Stack... and yet still stamp the holy, golden '5-star' on Burger Bar.  When it comes to burgers, unless it's a $1000 burger served in some back alley by a gorilla, I personally don't really care about the price, venue, wait, or even the service.  If you're gonna give this joint 5-stars, I think you need to be prepared to tell me that this is gonna be the BEST...[grrr]... BURGER... [arrrrgh!]...EVVVVERRRR!! [HULKSMASH]!!!!!   (Oh, and compare it to a known quantity, please.)  1) THE TEST I strolled into Burger Bar the other day (after waving to & observing the flirtatious "Minus 5 girls" for a minute - big ups to 'Leo C' for the mention in his review) & bought two burgers:   This "Rossini Burger" & this other Angus Beef Burger with grilled onions, avocado, and swiss.  That's right.  Eff it.  I'm on vacation, b-tches.  2) THE TASTE I hunkered down and tried each of these things, disregarding size or accompaniments. -- Rossini:  It was pretty GOOD... but it just wasn't OMGWTFGREAT. The beef was quite tasty and rich but the one thing I expected more of was the robust truffle flavor that I thought would be there and that didn't really come through... I question why they even add it.  And the Foie Gras thing was weird - I suppose I expected something a little more... "fois gras-like" and what I got... wasn't.  Did they make my burger, right?  I mean it still tasted good but the texture wasn't what I'd expected.  -- Angus:  Again, not BAD... but just not that GOOD.  The beef wasn't nearly as juicy as the Rossini nor was it as flavorful which is to be expected I guess but to put this into perspective, I think a slightly better burger is purchasable through the Venetian's Room Service.  That's all I'll have to say about that.  3) THE COMPARATIVES Think of this as, "Two burgers go in; one burger comes out".  I'm going to dump the Angus burger since I didn't think it was outstanding & nuanced enough to 'compete' and strictly compare the Rossini against some other burgers I've had from memory.  With the exception of Bradley Ogden, you may assume that I expressly order their best beef with avocado and some onions.  -- BRADLEY OGDEN beats Burger Bar -- BLT BURGER beats Burger Bar (this was close) -- BURGER BAR beats Stack (this was even closer) -- BURGER BAR beats StripBurger  CONCLUSION I don't think Burger Bar produces the finest burger in Las Vegas.  It's more like something somewhere in the middle... which of course is fine.  I boxed the Rossini Burger, because... well, I'm not gonna leave behind a frickin' $60+tax+tip burger on a plate for them to dump.  But it's sitting here in my hotel room after having made the taxi ride home and sadly I don't think I'm going to finish it.  Nor do I think I'll go back for another when Red Square's got such tasty casual tapas dishes on the other side of the hotel.    3-stars.  ------------- FUTURE PATRONS OF MINUS 5: I think that it's important that I verify for all gentlemen approaching Minus 5 for beverages, that based on my interaction & careful observation of the youthful Minus 5 marketing staff, that the area in & around the Ice Lounge is definitely "chilly".

7Sv09BN_PrXLfxknKeh9aw.text: BEST burger ever.... You must try this place it's an experience. Go there hungry you are not going to be disappointed....

AiJ1ePGo__jj_WFuvdpVlA.text: Oh burger bar, the love hate I have with you. I love the big juicy burgers. I love Kobe or even the natural source. Love the fry sampler. Love the spicy ketchup. But hate hate how you charge for everything. How can I get a burger and not want to put everything you have available on it. And then slowly cry while I consume the most delicious $30 burger I ever had

TCTao0w9Cb-l7SHeLggELg.text: This is one of the best places I've been in Vegas, and considering I've been there four times, that's saying something.  This restaurant was more my vibe than most.  Tons of delicious beer on tap really won me over, and the burgers definitely helped.  Considering this was one of the cheapest meals in Vegas, I was surprised it was so satisfying.  My boyfriend and I loved this place so much that we went two nights in a row.  The first night I had a buffalo burger with caramelized onions, avocado and pepperjack cheese on a whole wheat bun.  The burger was cooked perfectly and was juicy and delicious.  The next night, I had a turkey burger with caramelized onions, pesto and mozzarella.  Yet again, the burger was absolutely delicious and cooked perfectly.  I love everything about this place, but mostly I love the "choose your own burger" experience and the delicious, delicious beer.

umatLm9HfjS-AAfvKwHMEA.text: I love how you can build your own burger! It reminds me of a place called The Counter in LA...same concept but different items on the menu.  So my friend and I shared the kobe beef burger with grilled onions, sauted button mushrooms, and provolone cheese all on a whole wheat bun. The meat was cooked medium rare and it was the best burger I've had! It was so juicy and flavorful!   Oh and the sweet potato fries are good too!

CoWqaiJSjm2rlKWv6FBmnQ.text: OVERALL RATING: Service: 1 Decor: 2 Food: 1 Dog-friendly: NA -------------------------------------------------- Plus (+): It's in the Mandalay Bay, so you're very close to something better  Minus (-): Burgers and price -------------------------------------------------- Unfortunately, this is the absolute worst burger I've ever had. I wanted to like this place since Hubert Keller designed the menu. We tried the $16 Kobe burger which should have been moist and delicious, but instead it was a over-cooked, scrawny little hockey puck on a so-so bun. The fries were just OK. I've had better...everywhere else.  My advice:  Save the money and go to Keller's absolutely fabulous Fleur de Lys. Go to the Las Vegas location, not the flagship San Francisco one. I tried both and they don't even come close to each other...so wierd.

1s47nFaAzcuLBALJWnVX9Q.text: My boyfriend is a fan of Hubert Keller and Fleur de Lys, so this was like a must stop place for us when we were in Vegas last week.  We ordered 2 burgers.... 1 kinda indulgent and 1 kinda plain.  - Angus beef, bleu cheese, carmelized onions, oyster mushrooms, bacon, and a side of black truffle sauce on wheat.  - Angus beef, pepperjack cheese, guacamole, salsa on an onion bun.      We also had thick fries & zucchini.  Everything was delicious.  I was pouring the truffle sauce on every bite even after we put some on the burger.  The only reason I'm not giving 5 stars is because of the prices.  It hurts a little to pay more than $50 for a hamburger + french fry lunch.  I'll admit though, it was worth it and I'll definitely be coming back when I'm in Vegas again next month.

nDdKUpwFBe1zS4uuefef2A.text: I'm not too impressed. My last burger experience was Tyler's in Palm Springs which blew me away. Burger Bar just didn't cut it for me.  I'm guessing that even with all the different meat choices, the normal taster isn't going to be able to distinguish between the cheaper and medium priced beef. Throw in the fact that no one's going to be going to eat just a normal cheeseburger (who wants to when there are 7 types of cheese, tons of toppings, and even foie gras and truffles to be added), it's just not worth it to go for the more expensive meats.  I'm not a big fan of allowing the guest to create their own dish. It smacks of the chef not having a great menu. Just think of Father's Office in Santa Monica: one burger, no substitutions, no additions and no one complains. Why? We know perfection when we taste it. Burger Bar's concept is too "of the masses." An edited menu would have shown the owner's concept better.  Sliders at the Burger Bar were cute, but instead of showing me three different slider possibilities, why not create the "perfect" slider and show me why it's perfect?  So many reviews for this place on yelp, I'm pretty sure my review is going to get lost in the masses.

srMOValwtKc2CHUHaINZCQ.text: When i come to Vegas i make to stop by here, the Burgers are delicious!! Give it a try you will not be disappointed.

JzjgmboHtqGtYMjmYwnO4Q.text: Loved my Vegan Burger here - have never had something like that before.  It was two portabella mushrooms with peppers etc. inside.  Also had sweet potato fries. Everything was absolutely delicious. Waiter was exceptional. Would have given 5 stars except we sat at the entrance next to a busy, kind of run down mall.  If you are looking for great food at reasonable prices - without too much fuss - this is it.

4X81iNq9zvwyj5N9dWiL1Q.text: my friends and i were absolutely ravenous after our 4 hour drive into vegas. our wait time was about 20 minutes and we were getting grumpier by the second due to the lack of food in our stomachs. also that overpowering scent from lush was nuts.  food portions are enormous. you definitely get your bang for the buck but just be warned that you're paying for premium products and the fact that all of vegas is overpriced.  i ordered the plain black angus with fat fries. my friend ordered the sliders and my other friend got the vegetarian patty. my burger was huge. and the fries were delicious. the meat was cooked perfectly medium and was bursting with flavor. the sliders each come with different topping which was a surprise, but a nice one.   they have a long list of delicious beers as well.

KrJLCpeGLL3QSvWZI7MqFA.text: Be forewarned: If you have trouble spending $20 on a burger, do not come to Burger Bar. I have been to BB many 'o times. It has become a staple when any of my family visits. It seems like the only times people are not satisfied is when they have a mental block regarding the price because it is a simple (and usually cheap) American standard. For my money, BB is well worth it - and I am not even a burger lover by any means. The ingredients are high quality and the food is usually executed perfectly. The beer selection is great and they throw in just enough wine options. The service is usually decent, but there has been some suspect service for a Strip property (especially considering how easy of a job it is at this joint). The blah decor, and a little inconsistency on the food and more so on the service is what holds BB back from five stars. Tip: All of the meat here is high quality. Skip the more expensive beef options and go with the least expensive. I have tried them all and more expensive options are not worth the extra dough.

CE4pdSzCpJD13xK1h_4nbg.text: Great concept for a restaurant, but very disappointing Mr. Keller! Any time you use the main item in the name it better be good.  Both my husband and I felt the food was dry and over cooked. The  buffalo had great flavor but it was ruined by pairing it with a dry bun.  The fries, onion rings and mozzarella sticks were all over cooked. One thing they did get right about this restaurant is their aioli. It is probably the best I've had.

g_clJNCI5MSjaYBSWEfRvQ.text: I wasn't that impressed. I ordered the Kobe burger and it was mediocre to say the least. I have not returned since.

OQQfqdGtPYdk7LTMYYQvzw.text: To sum this place up... GREAT burgers, OVER priced, IMPRESSIVE beer selection.  The food won't disappoint you, the burgers are great.  But anytime you're nearing $20 or more for a burger, you're kind of crossing the burger price ceiling.  Nonetheless, if you want to shell out the cash, your stomach will thank you.  Your ass probably won't though.

qnNG7IQPGZ6yWNPhvYF6iw.text: I love their food here, the service is always excellent, the drinks are always good! I mean you can't really ask for more right?!?!!? If your at the Mandalay Bay or THEhotel, it's almost a must!!!

7m8aXPtfu63JMhouWHTymg.text: The Zucchini & Sweet Potato Fries are my Weakness!!! Their burgers which are a bit pricey, but really good as well! Casual atmosphere, but it does get crowded at lunchtime or dinnertime! So, it's best to make Reservations ahead of time, or you'll be standing out in the mall, waiting for your number to be called. =)

cYwofV9fqFsmUfdMyW6obA.text: Love this place! You can't go wrong for a great burger! Usually hit this place once per month and have been going for the last year.  The Buffalo is my regular choice, however, I haven't had a bad choice on the menu yet. Milkshakes are great if you're going low octane. If you're not going low octane, their beer list is huge. Lots of Dog Fish Head selections and they all rock.  Regular food, always good, slightly pricey but its on the Strip. Great place to go before a night at House of Blues rocking out.

cPzOzLqhbXCpFnNLF8C9Jg.text: I will keep this short...overrated.  I would go back to have a beer here before I would go back for a burger.  Susan's review with wheres the beef is on point...had black jack burger and found myself eating bread with no meat.  The bill made my experience even less palatable.

pqymUikPiCDDXAKkXaoakg.text: Looking for an easy place to eat before heading home on a Sunday, we found the Burger Bar in Mandalay Place, between Mandalay Bay and Luxor.  The staff was pleasant and the music playing was just our speed.  There are a lot of beers on tap here, and the bartender (we sat at the bar) brought me a sample of something he thought I might like after I ordered.  He was right, it was good.    The "design your own burger" concept is not new, but they have great options, better than any place I've seen before.  I went with an Angus patty, ciabatta bun, jalapeno bacon, blue cheese crumbles, and caramelized onions.  Perfection, served medium rare.  My wife opted for the buffalo patty on whole wheat and kept it simple with cheddar cheese.  This is not usual for her, but whatever, she enjoyed it.  Sweet potato fries were good, about average for what we've had before.  We both walked away satisfied until an hour or so later at the airport when our dinner made an emergency evacuation.  Both of us.  This is the reason I gave 3 stars instead of 4.  Hopefully just a fluke.

ArRDcPaAcuMlCqkiMK1i1A.text: Incredible Burgers!!  I'm not a big burger fan but the burgers here give me major cravings.  During my first visit, I had the turkey burger and it was juicy and super flavorful.  The next visit I tried the angus burger and there is no turning back.  The burger is full of flavor and is very "tender" (if that makes sense)...it almost falls apart in my mouth.  The fries and shakes are really good as well.  One note: in cooking their burgers, the chefs err on the side of caution and make them a little better done then at other places.  I always get medium burgers at other restaurants, but here I go with medium rare and it's perfect and pink every time.

T6Gvq__1IFM_ZebFP1j0_w.text: Was in LV for the wknd was looking for a place to have dinner that wouldn't cost $$$$ this place was it. I didn't have the Kobe but will next time, instead I customized my burger and it was delicious. I recommend this place to anyone looking for a good tasty juicy burger lets not forget the fries and beer. =] Although it took 45mins to get a table it was worth the wait.  **Burger Bar right between Mandalay Bay and Luxor**

1pfOMcZyYL2wVzhPkf7nuw.text: The Kobe burger was amazing.  Cooked exactly the way I had ordered it.  Caramelized onions...so good.  Sadly the side items we tried, the mozzarella sticks and onion rings were pretty "meh" and tasted like bag frozen bar food.  Why establishments will serve amazing food next to mediocre food will forever elude me.  The $15 strawberry mojito was ok, though if it had any liquor in it, sadly the flavor went undetected  The thing that really brings the expirence down for me, was the service.   It initially started out quick and attentive, but like water in the desert, it quickly vanished.  We sat with empty drinks at the end of the table, both liquor and then water, for the better part of 20min without anyone stopping by.  By the time we finally got our ticket, Id forgotten who our server was.  This place could be so much better...but i guess with the throngs of people, theres really no motivation to make a good place great.

jEbYKWA_1BQtaUjn90PYMA.text: Last time I was out there I ate hear four times! Tried three different style burgers that are awesome. The fries and onion rings were sort of a disappointment, but I didn't go there for the fries and onion rings. They have adult milkshakes which is always a plus. to sum things up I'll be back!

1ctlueiBwG5q6OQrj3RBHw.text: You cant beat the burger bar. Thats why it has survived while other restaurants come and go so quickly in vegas. I always get the buffalo burger. Its meaty and juicy. Cant find anything else like it, so dont go wasting your time looking. Stop by and try it. Its definitely worth the money

5YuQb1OYP3GU2V7PtBKsaw.text: Ok gotta say it : BEST MILK SHAKE EVER !! Burger was great. You pick the meat, bun, cheese, toppings ! What could be better? You only have yourself to blame if you screw up your own burger. Great place nice staff fast service.

CpEeUIRefoNA7c3YZvWVcg.text: We sat at the bar to wait for a booth and I ordered a salted caramel martini. I love salted caramel anything, but this was a little much for first thing in my tummy for the day. I did love the sugared/salted rim. Yum.  We sat down and I ordered a Killian's and my husband got a Chimay Blue. For lunch, I ordered the Wagyu burger, medium, with aioli, fried egg, and pepper jack. My husband got the Prime Choice burger, MW, with sliced cucumbers, dijon, spicy ketchup, and cheddar.  We also ordered the fried pepper jack shotz, sweet potato fries and fried zucchini.  It took only about 15 minutes to get our food. The zucchini fries were freaking AMAZING. Wow, they were good. The fried cheese was so yummy - nice and spicy and we loved the sweet potato fries too.  I put some aioli on my bun, took a bite and the damn fried egg yolk exploded down the front of my shirt. I'[d ordered the egg  over medium, so that surprised me (and dismayed me too). When I looked at the burger, it was dripping blood and was almost all pink/red, so that was definitely NOT medium. The waitress came over and was very nice about sending it back. She gave me some club soda for my shirt. My husband really enjoyed his burger. Mine came back perfect medium and I pierced the yolk this time. Live and learn. It was super good. Very tender, flavorful and just delicious. I really wish we had one of these in Austin!!  We didn't have any room for a milkshake, but the ones I saw going by looked very yummy.

R8TLkTXURuX1gKVLNzRoPg.text: After reading all the rave reviews about this place, I had to see what this place was all about. Came here midweek, and there was no wait.   Items ordered were: -American Kobe Beef with Provolone -Black Angus Beef with American and Sprouts -Skinny Fries -Hefeweizen  Everything was so GOOD!!! Medium rare burgers were juicy and the fries crisp. The burgers were devoured literally within minutes. The bill came out to be about $40.

vo9MxyfK0pNtd9rGpfDjDg.text: I don't usually write reviews but this time I just can't miss. It is the second time we have been disappointed. Burger Bar is a great place. Me and my co-workers come in at least once a month. Over the last couple of months this place is going down. I don't see any of the older servers here and the customer service is just sooo...bad.  I am in the industry myself and some things you just can't do.  The reason we come here is for the good burgers and the good selection of beers, but you can not ask your server for a beer advise and be answered "I'm sorry but I don't drink beer" This is a beer joint you got to know your beers girl.  So we come in and the first thing is the hostess, we ask for our favorite server, the server who usually serves us, the hostess tells us that the only way we can be served by her is if we have a reservation or we need to wait over an hour. If we don't want to wait an hour we can be seated with Hillda or Hadia ... don't really remember the name in only 20 min. So we agree to wait 20 min and go with the other server. OMG was this a mistake. We wish we waited an hour.   Later we meet the girl who usually serves us and she tells us that actually she was not busy and she actually had had empty tables all along.   So we not only got bad service, but we had to wait extra time for the bad service after we actually requested someone else to serve us.   NOW THIS IS JUST OUTRAGEOUS!   IF I would to do this in my restaurant ... I'd be fired on the spot.  You can't sit guest to your friend's tables, you can't tell me you can not recommend me a beer because you don't drink beer, when I ask for ranch I want it with my food, not after I'm done with it, and you need to check with me when the food arrives to make sure nothing is missing.   The management need to do something about teaching their stuff what is waiting tables about. You can't run Hubert Keller's joint with amateurs.   The chances that we won't come back anymore are very big.   Food is good though...

glEWP7ZcES4NmqDNOG6jgw.text: Fabulous burger and shake! My waitress actually liked her job - and it showed   A bit of a wait to get in - but right across from Burger Bar is Lush - the best natural bath products in the world.

HlT9wOCQK19q5QGuhY7Nlw.text: Surprisingly good! I was just expecting regular drunk food, but their burgers are a delicacy. They were cooked to perfection and I loved that even the condiments on the burger were cooked well!

4eAyvv027IOqy2kCcuTILw.text: Enjoyed a Coffee Malt, Black Angus Burger, and a Kobe Burger.

xdOypcmFV72OpS6z-FMcUA.text: Husband and I visited the Burger Bar a couple of weekends ago during our "staycation" on the Strip.  We went on a Friday night, so  it was jam-packed. Upon checking in with the (very disinterested) hostess, we found out that the wait was going to be at least 30 minutes unless we found a seat at the bar. We scoped out the bar and finally found two handicapped accessible seats at the very back. Hey, I'd sit at the kids table if it meant that I'd get to eat sooner. Luckily, two people at the main bar left and husband was able to snag their seats. No kiddie table for us, yay!  Of course, sitting at the bar meant that the service was a little slow, but it wasn't horrible. The bartender was friendly, so that goes a long way.  The food definitely made up for it.  We got an appetizer of the jalepeno beer-battered fried pickles, which stayed piping hot all the way to the last bite. Husband got the surf and turf burger and fries ($24) while I made my own: American "Kobe", medium-well, oyster mushrooms, monterey-jack cheese, and bacon. Side of sweet-potato fries ($22). I don't know if it was a $22 burger- I could have done without the bacon, but it was fantastic. DH couldn't keep his hands off my sweet potato fries, either.  We were too full for shakes or desserts, but enjoyed our experience there and can check it off our list of burger joints!

pLn1IxUOFOQts2NSUSvNBw.text: During every trip to Las Vegas, I make it a point to visit Burger Bar. IMHO it's hands down the best burger in Las Vegas even with new contenders popping up over the past few years. This time, I ordered the NatureSource USDA Burger, cooked medium, on a plain bun with cheddar and pepperjack, jalapeno bacon, avocado, roasted peppers and chipotle aioli and a side of skinny fries with truffle mayo to dip.  The burger was thick, juicy and flavourful and I was surprised that the jalapeno bacon shone through in a delightful way.  The truffle mayo may have almost upstaged the burger.  It's so good I could drink buckets of it! A must try and delicious with fries. Great beer selection and our server was equally great and made a quick recovery when missing one order of fries. One out of the four of us had the Salmon burger and said it was mediocre but the other two who had beef burgers were incredibly impressed.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burger Bar&#39;s Naturesource USDA burger on a plain bun with cheddar, pepperjack, avocado, jalapeno bacon, chipotle aioli and roasted peppers.
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nature Source Burger w/Jalapeño Bacon, Pepper Jack, Avocado, Roasted Peppers w/side of skinny fries with truffle mayo. Amazing!

0YK7qrdoq6RrcnmYXrg8Qw.text: If price isn't an issue for you, get the Kobe burger. It's well worth the upgrade. I absolutely love it here. Ate here for the first time and came back the very next day. The booths have their own separate TVs which was great for watching whatever game was on. Now, it's a little bit expensive, but I was expecting that so it wasn't a huge shock. Might be the best burger I've ever had, and I taste burgers everywhere. The service was VERY good. The place was packed and I never had to ask for a refill, and I never had to wait to order anything. Very impressive burger joint.

dGzmQpA9yZE-WSPBwcLIwQ.text: They Changed a few things on their menu. They change the Veggie and Turkey patties. The new ones are not that good. Lower quality.  Use to be our to go place. this is gonna change us coming once a month .  Looking for a a better burger joint.

BsCVJ3V_25Y4hcucDGMR7Q.text: Came here with the Mister and his burger alone was $40! That's because he got all crazy with Kobe Beef and added lobster tail, foie gras and all the other expensive toppings, lol. My burger alone came out to around $20 (Compared to the Counter or Slater's in LA/OC, my burger would have been around $15) so not bad for Vegas food!  ---------------------------------------------------  Turkey on Ciabatta - $8.50 Baby Spinach - $0.80 Avocado - $1.55 Peppers - $0.95 Caramelized Onions - $0.95 Fried Egg - $1.95 Chili - $3.00 Chipotle Aioli - $0.45 Bacon - $1.15  ---------------------------------------------------  The food was good, but the wait was forever! They told us it would take an hour to get a table but it felt like two, and that's because it was two hours until we were finally seated! And I swear the hostess skipped us because when I had approached her and asked how much longer it would take, she gave me a shocked look and said, "Uh...right now" - how convenient that right when I asked, a table was available. Oh well.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried Zucchinis
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sweet Potoato Fries
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burger

e85W_3gSgKbne7xgUpDxAA.text: I got the salmon burger and the burger was weak. I got it medium rare with no additional toppings, but regret not adding some. The burger was regular size, the toppings that were included: onions, tomatoes, lettuce were flavorless and didn't do much to the burger once added. I used my friends aoli sauce to try to add flavor to the burger, some salt and pepper, but in the end it was still flavorless.  The burger was $11 bucks and didn't even come with fries! weeeeakkk. We were still hungry so we ordered their mac and cheese croquettes, which turned out hella weak too! I was imagining big chucks of mac and cheese in little balls, but they looked like triangles and the mac and cheese were the small baby kind.  I probably wouldn't hit this spot up again.

A-JCupl2LhUoUjv4SH4Ojg.text: I am giving four stars due to the fact that the service while great, was a little slow, but that is just nitpicking. A few times during the meal my girlfriend and I were looking around for our server. On the otherside, our meal was amazing. I got a milkshake to start out, and i finished it before our meal came out. She got the perfect 10! And there wasn't anything left by the end. I built my own burger and the temperatures on both were perfect. Will definately recommend to coworkers and friends as a great place to relax and chill on the strip for good food and drinks.

ayJI7gvLjMQaJpVQlLPvFw.text: Trendy burger restaurant by famed chef Hubert Keller. Great burger, atmosphere & service - expensive (average price per burger is about $20-25, up to $60 for a special Kobe beef burger; shakes are $8+, depending on your toppings) but I wasn't disappointed.  Had the Hubert Keller burger [from the menu - "Buffalo, caramelized onions, baby spinach, blue cheese on a ciabatta bun (Hubert's favorite choice)"] at $20 - it was good.   You also have the "build your own burger" option.

RBgAffTeOL_EE5WZSkbIJA.text: bring on the burger!  one of my favorite spots to go every time i go to vegas. mac n cheese croquettes are amazing. you must try it! i'm very curious as to how they make something magical like that. ordered the kobe beef (on onion bread) with fried egg, spinach, american cheese, mushroom & caramelized onions. very juicy and worth every penny. also ordered zucchini parmesan on the side - good coating and tasty with ranch dressing. if you're sick and tired of other "fast food" burgers, try burger bar! definitely worth it. will definitely come back again and try other things on the menu! check out the picture i posted.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. burger bar w/ @ideniturtle &amp; @austintatiousss

ebAsdgFM6PzWPO972PUFGw.text: Very Good burger but overpriced.  The Counter is still Better!

iZn5ztJgBhvo9dUis_lS_Q.text: build your own burgers, extensive beer menu, tvs with sports at the tables. Great, cheap place for a casual meal at the Mandalay. Highly recommended!

8NfbZHZGcBWu_slFgR-79w.text: Loved the food, loved the service and the atmosphere was great (I mean is Vegas baby) and I have been here twice.  One of the two times I did not try the Kobe Burger the second time I did.  In a nutshell if you don't get the Kobe meat you are really missing out.  It is a little pricey, you have to choose your meat which you pay for and then you build your burger, everything you add cost a little something.  By the time you finish and add a drink and fries you will  probably walk out for $25 to $30.  Just know what you are walking into and you will have a good time.

zFsYce9U6kDXXQSeVM1tbg.text: I came here 2 years ago for lunch and I haven't been able to stop my mouth from watering every time I think about the burger I had here. The build your own burger is an awesome idea! I forgot which bun I had with my kobe beef, swiss, portobello, and avocado burger with a side of sweet potato fries, but it was the best burger I've had so far. I didn't get a chance to go back when I was in Vegas last year but I will not leave until I have my burger from Burger Bar when I go next month!

jtdTi09zAsCBW-d-2f78Xg.text: One of the best burgers I've ever had.  I stuck to the fairly simple varieties, didn't try any of the crazy expensive ones...  Went two days in a row, Kobe burger one day, the regular (angus?) the next...  Actually found the Angus to be more flavorful, but they were both incredible.  Fries (reg and sweet potato) are fantastic.  Milkshakes are also actually worth the $9 or whatever they cost (and I'm not a person that's particularly keen on sweets).  If you're in town and you like burgers, you shouldn't miss this place.

jbby7NZ0Mc6LcqFjMGXRIg.text: Great burgers and boozy shakes! I had the lamb buger which was fantastic, and my husband ate the kobe beef which was perfect. Great service, especially since we had a party of 12.

LevDyfL3oaOH8K2XgF1Ahw.text: After hearing about the Burger Bar for the last two years I finally got a chance to try it and the gourmet burgers are very good. I went with a business associate and we both ordered the Kobe Beef burger which, according to the menu, is produced in the Snake River area. Our burgers were cooked perfectly and were tasty. I ordered the buttermilk onion rings and they were excellent. Maybe the best onion rings I have ever eaten!  Burger Bar offers a huge selection of condiments to pile on your burger but every item will add a buck or two the the cost of the meal. The Kobe Burger will run $20 so be prepared.  Service was very good and the iced tea and lemonade are both perfectly prepared. The restaurant reminds me of a loud sports bar and there is loud music playing over the speaker system.  It is very difficult to hear and carry on a conversation.  It is a good choice for quick meal, once you are seated, and a tasty burger.

W4VlraMR8uuiTfRzNKe5Ng.text: I wish there was a way to give another half star.  This place is really great.  The burgers, of which there is every imaginable combination of proteins, cheeses, and other toppings are delicious.  on top of that there is a tremendous beer selection.  and they have fried pickles.  the only down side is the restaurant is nowhere near the casino or other restaurants.

872CgL02zdpa9UXvqS-pGw.text: Confirmed.  Went back for lunch this past weekend with some guys for a friend's bachelor party and this time had the Country Natural with bacon, blue cheese, and chipotle aioli on ciabatta.  It was a really good burger, and the ciabatta is a nice touch, but it loses two stars for two reasons:  1) If I'm "designing" it myself, where is the added value of having Hubert Keller associated with the place?  It's really just some guy in the back who cooks the ingredients that I've chosen for him.  2) Again, it costs more than Father's Office in LA, which is my favorite burger.  You have to make a better burger to charge more for it - nuff said.

0BYc73T3FEZESBjB24L83w.text: Four of us went here and had a great time.  What really impressed me was that our waitress (Harmony) and the manager (Randy) really understand taking care of customers.  They brought our appetizers but forgot to bring the sauces.  They gave us a free drink and more appetizers.  I had the buffalo burger and it was really good.

Npx8Jn1hWn3SXQAzti65rQ.text: LOVE Hubert Keller. Granted, I have never actually met the French chef but I feel like after watching Top Chef Masters, I am convinced that he is a wonderful person who makes mouth-watering food. Fiance and I went here while watching my cousin's 16month old baby. It was a fantastic night. First, it was exactly what we were looking for - delicious food in a casual setting so that baby Cami could make all the noise he wanted and no one would mind. I had their sliders (three kinds - buffalo, kobe and classic mini-burgers) with sweet potato fries - yummm! Fiance built his own burger - kobe beef, grilled onions, cheddar cheese on focaccia with deep-fried zucchini spears. Delicious! Fiance has declared that it was the best burger he'd ever had. I must admit that I thought the zucchini spears were even better than my sweet potato fries. We ended it all with one of their decadent milkshakes - the caramel latte. oh man, it was a bit too sweet for me but fiance drank it down in seconds.   there are lots of other things we definitely want to come back and try  (BUT only when we really are feeling the big-spending Vegas mood), especially their luxurious $60 burger that comes with kobe, foie gras AND black truffles. ridiculous!

hUgFTAz5JXwZo7rLpyJyTQ.text: Really really good burger. Tried the Kobe w/ blue cheese & grilled onions. Wow--it was YUM. Great beer selection, too.

A03b6CqbRXsMqMI_w4A9Hg.text: Always busy and packed, this place made me go back twice during my stay in Mandalay bay. Very nice Kobe burgers, def can compete for the 1st place out of the ones i've tried so far. Finely chopped salads which i love and can't find too often (the feature of BB or Las Vegas food style in general?) the only thing i'd slightly modify is the cocktail menu. The bartenders are doing their best, but the recipes themselves are a bit off ( at least for the pumpkin martini).

orwgwtjVo1NAwmtGtZ7wog.text: Freaking amazing.  A burger fan's heaven.  You can order ANYTHING, and I mean ANYTHING, on a burger.  It took me 10 minutes of browsing up and down the menu to figure out what the hell I was going to try.  I ended up ordering the B.B. Double Dog, a burger bun with Hebrew sausage and sauerkraut.  Mouthwatering.  It was too gigantic for me to even think about finishing it.

5nPvuyaZIKCejVOottLigQ.text: One of my friends that was on the trip with us raved about this place for 3 days straight, so our last night there we all walked over for dinner.  They sat our table of 10 pretty quick and got us beers right away.  The menu was interesting, with choices of Angus Beer, Buffalo and Kobe it was pretty unique and average price as far as Vegas goes.  I got the Angus burger with cheddar, some mushrooms and bacon and it was decent.  Not the most amazing thing ever but definitely interesting.  I would probably splurge for the Buffalo or Kobe burger if I went back.

5kdFnachI95F4kGyxuLZ1Q.text: Good burger.  Just as good as Red Robin, but not better and twice as pricey.  Ok service but poor atmosphere.  LOUD!  If you want blasting noise, RumJungle is just a short walk away.  Why not leave the loud dance tunes up to the REAL DJ's?  This place is catering to the young d-bag crowd.  No thanks, never again.

qUmy4jMzQeSfnShPgQFwcw.text: My friends first heard about this place after watching a show on Food Network with Giada DiLaurentis that featured this show.  At first I thought that it was gonna be just another overpriced burger joint.  I was wrong though... I have visited this place every time I have been to Vegas since that trip almost 2 years ago.  I am absolutely in love with the turkey burger as the patty is juicy and incredibly delicious.  The portion is generous and they offer an array of toppings you can put on your burger.  I usually stick to the pepper jack, grilled onions, and bacon (if I really feel like treating myself).  I recommend also ordering a helping of sweet potato fries or zucchini fries.  It definitely will not disappoint!

RjJExWnF7dLcmzJZQInI-Q.text: i love Huber Keller!!!! In my experience the service from beginning to end was great! But i have to say i went for lunch and it was not as packed as I saw when i passed by at dinner time.  We had the strawberry beer and the chocolate alcohol milkshake thingy it was everything you would love if you love thick milkshakes with a little happy in it ;0)!! The burgers were very tasty as are the sweet potato fries!!! A must go in Vegas!!!

YucKFKuNyecSEkSV4GD6AA.text: I normally don't like eating hamburgers, but I was curious about this place since the owner is the famous chef,  Hubert Keller.  I had the Black Angus Beef burger which was very tasty and tender.  I also had sweet potato fries which was also very good. Burgers here are more pricey than your normal hamburgers but well worth it.

wsYouQ2CPCabi6YAtN1x1w.text: I came here and I was like, now why didn't I think of this restaurant idea first??  It's very simple: you get to pick what goes on your burger. The prices are hefty for what it is: a burger. But I guess it's understandable because you pick what goes on it. To be fair, it IS a big burger. Even the veggie burgers come with 2 patties. They also have different kinds of fries - which are good - but I wish they would have given more. I think I'd go again because now I'll be more ready with a full wallet.

zoeglkhQDhIbMk6G2uqDTQ.text: Love this place!  Same owner as our other fav restaurant in Vegas (Fleur de Lys) and we tried their Kobe burger with blue cheese, bacon, string fries, and the buffalo burger with fried egg and fries  Not cheap and rather long wait but man was it worth it!  Meat were cooked to exactly how we ordered and well, if you don't like the toppings, you have no one to blame but yourself since you pick your own!

uA1Hafyrx9bldpQWpsxO4g.text: I don't know what the hype is. Food is just ok for me. I've had better burgers in Los Angeles (25 Degrees and Grill em all) pricey and not. I wouldn't pay $20 again for one regular burger.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Angus beef, fried egg, peppered bacon, caramelized onion, monterey jack on ciabatta bread $17.30 + tax - not worth it
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kobe burger, pepper jack cheese, grilled onion and jalapeno bacon $20.45 + tax

fG12nBRMRIw8RZSExYtjkg.text: Ok, aside from the price, these burgers are super-legit.  My husband and I went here on the evening of New Year's Day after seeing O.  For dinner, he did a make-your-own burger with a lamb patty that was really juicy and delicious, and I got the baguette burger which was also really good.  The meat oozed delicious, umami juicy goodness all into the crunchy yet perfectly chewy baguette.  The only thing I would do is add a tad more cheese.  The fries (regular and sweet potato) were both stellar, especially with the spicy ketchup.  I was a little afraid it would just be some tabasco-splashed ketchup, but this stuff is super good, and you can tell it's made from scratch with little bits of peppers in it.  The service was just meh... it was pretty much the equivalent of ordering on a touch-screen which might have actually been a little more fun.  The hostess, however, was very sweet and talked to us more in 5 minutes than our server did the entire time.  For 2 burgers with fries and 2 waters it was $45, so it is definitely your typical overpriced strip restaurant, albeit with damn good burgers.

nte4HZR1Ns8oiGRR23M-9Q.text: This is the first place I tried zucchini fries and this will forever be the pace to get them! The burger I had was good and the service was a little on the delayed side but if I am ever in the area, i'll stop by and have a coke and fries.

avpQYs39Ubhp359EdSdRMw.text: Odd, actually. One server and one bus person running like mad. Three servers standing in the back talking the entire time. Thought strange enough to clock the time from ordering a draft beer and 10 minutes later reminding them to please bring the draft beer. Burgers were good, not great. Never did get a water refill. Won't be going back. Too many other good places to eat nearby. Disappointing and slow slow slow.

2RNbgLcZQyQHTaa0M2pPJQ.text: Burger Bar. Burger Bar. Burger Bar.  Let's list the pros and the cons. List are a lot more fun.  PRO: It's a cool concept, pick your protein. (Turkey, Beef, Salmon, Buffalo, etc.) Lots of different toppings to choose from (from sprouts to lobster to truffles). An extensive BEER and WINE list. They have beers from micro breweries around the country.  Everything was fresh.  Cons: The food was pretty bland.  The service was sub-par.  I was in a party of 6 and they included gratuity. The places was LOUD. The seating was cramped. The hostesses were really rude. Everything was overpriced (to be expected on the Strip).  Burger Bar is located in Mandalay Place. It is a trek to get to just eat. I was there on a busy Saturday night. We had to wait for everyone to get there before we were seated. The hostess was really rude about all of this too.   We were seated in a booth that comfortably sat 6 people. Our waitress looked like she was juggling about  5 tables, one of which had about 20 people. She could really use a hand.  I ordered a veggie burger, which was quite bland and really need some spice and seasoning. I added grilled onions and guacamole and opted for a whole wheat bun. I ordered a side salad, which was $2.55 for some field greens and a balsamic vinaigrette. A bunch of my friends ordered the sweet potato fries, which are yummy, but they were't any better or any worse than I've had before. Again, nothing spectacular.  In all honesty, I would have been much happier with a Double-Double from IN-N-OUT.   Burger Bar has a good idea, but it really just felt like a dressed up "Fudruckers" in an Applebee's setting.

dCi1sSNPSpLs6o31AceO6Q.text: Best thing going at this place are the shakes.  We have quite a few tasty burger joints in the Bay, so you have to have one lip smackin' burger to impress me.  Don't get me wrong, the food was good, just not great in my opinion.  The shake on the other hand was delish.  I had some sort of chocolate concoction with whiskey.  Burger Bar is definitely worth checking out.

EcY92nVSPjxIFoXYAbv8jg.text: I heard a lot about this place so decided to check it out.  Many choices available to 'build your own' burger. You can even choose the type of meat you want.   I tried the Slider plate which is 3 small sliders each made with a different type of meat. It was good, but not great.  $13.25   We also had the appetizer sampler in the cone. We ordered onion rings, sweet potato fries and mac and cheese bites. All were good, but nothing special.  $11.80  This place is basically just overpriced burgers with a twist.  But you PAY for that twist.  our bill was $68 (before the tip) for 3 burgers, 3 sodas and the appetizer.   We had a hot little waitress with a total bitchy attitude...  This place hires lotsa eye candy but not much substance.

UqfiBzhBz2GvfZm79b_nyQ.text: I am a caesar aficionado and wanted to sample the dressing before I ordered. They were very very nice at the bar and got me a teeny bit to try. So good and so was the salad. Wish there were croutons or some additional texture but for me it's all about the dressing either way so it's 5 stars. Good service and quick. Seemed busy so they must be doing something rite with the burgers too!

J3MXZ_D1BkR9p0uxXkWF4g.text: Great beer selection, good service and one of the best burgers I've had in a long time.

NRyKIlzs65fLjI9exqjCvA.text: Decent burger, decent fries and sides, competent service.  I've avoided the Burger Bar in San Francisco because of previous disappointment with Hubert Keller's Fleur de Lys in SF (one of The City's most over-rated eateries), but this establishment is both tasty and semi-reasonable (for Vegas).  If the noise level had been lower they might have gotten another 1/2 star of so, but the all-hard-surface dining room is very noisy when full.

J6Kh37KnDBEOqK_PuAvXYQ.text: AMAZING! Loved Burger Bar!!  Got a custom burger, can't remember now everything I put on it but it rocked. Sweet potato fries are the way to go. Great selection of beers, ciders and whatnot.  Got a pear cider that was exceptional and came in a huge ass bottle. I think it was made in NYC. Our bartender was great too, very friendly and down-to-earth.  Price was great for the quality of food, drink and service!!

ePx_qpUyuOfL7r-75WkpzQ.text: This was great back in the day, its lost some of it's touch...OK for a quick fix...

LRf_WAuSKf-5SIrc0-0pNg.text: Hubert Keller is a genius! I loved being able to build my own burger with the best ingredients out there. I topped mine with a fried egg, prosciutto, smoked gouda, and some greens. Mmmmm! The beer list was also impressive. This place is the best for lunch - just don't forget to make a reservation!

KFM-v6-12O2-4snWWYdV-A.text: The only problem with this place is that it will take you two dozen trips to Vegas to try everything on the menu!

ZBqjzPv6ACfYDWjkFOe6mg.text: The burger portions are small for the price they are charging and the sweet potato fries are way too salty

GXX2RBMdLs7w-uXu5QYSXA.text: HUBERT KELLER! Love watching him on PBS.   The Burger Bar is the best pre- or post- House of Blues show dining. There is a burger for every taste. Every burger I have had has been amazing. For those first time diners, I highly recommend the sliders. You get three different burgers and fries. Don't expect McDonald's prices, but I believe the cheapest burger is around 8 bucks. If you don't mind sitting at the bar, the bartenders are pretty entertaining and very attentive.  GET THE TWINKIE SHAKE. SOOO GOOOD!

-X0HaVO7vSTUn_rqaxGyuQ.text: This place is definitely worth the long wait to get a table. Their food is really good and they offer a lot of choices on their menu, they also have an extensive liquor selection. I will definitely return.

5v4tiL4N9hN2gv5spmSEJg.text: So we had a lion king show at 7....and we needed something to eat because who knows how long the show will last right....two hours to be exact....with some intermission!
