The kobe meat melted in my in mouth, it was tender and was full of flavor...delicious!! We also ordered onion rings, skinny fries, and fat fries. I thought they were average.  I probably wouldn't come back though, $20 for a burger is quite a lot.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kobe Burger w/ swiss, portobello mushrooms &amp; caramelized onions.

QNeUcRI92q80eIay_zQeOw.text: Great Yelp discovery in Vegas.. the service was terrible because we kept being passed from one server to another and finally couldn't find anyone to request a check for 15mnts before we went up to the hostess.   The veggie burger was actually pretty good - it was homemade with mushroom, bread, rice and some other vegetables. We had it on the onion bun and liked our combo. Also, the veggie burger was only $9 (unlike some of the $22-24 burgers in some reviews here).   We did try the sweet potato fried and definitely lived up to its hype. We also indulged with a Nutella milkshake but with vanilla icecream (it comes with chocolate icecream otherwise) and liked it lots.   I'd say if in the area, try it out. Not something to make a trip for though.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nutella milkshake

DuzGo8CeZ2M5oPCMvhc0Nw.text: I must say that Hubert Keller can definitely make some stellar burgers.   The Burger Bar is LOCATED in the Mandalay Palace (Between The Mandalay Bay and Luxor walkway) is one of my favorite places to get a burger in LV. One, I love the   QUALITY OF MEAT. They have great choices to choose from such as Angus, Lamb, Buffalo and my favorite Kobe. Not only is the meat good, they also have great buns. I think they work out a lot. PRICES here are very reasonable and in my opinion, excellent for the quality of food. If you a balla or if you just won a few bucks gambling then I would recommend you try the ROSSINI. It's a 60 dollar burger that is made with Wagyu Beef and foie gras.  I can tell you that it's worth it (If your a burger lover and like foie gras that is) Similar to other burger joints, the Burger Bar offers specialty burgers or you can customize your own. My recommendation would be to do both if your with someone else or if your really hungry.   The ENVIRONMENT here looks like  your average bar and grill. Dim lighting and lots of TV's.  They even have TV's in every booth. This place has always been crowded and there was always a wait list whenever I ate here. I have said this in many of my other reviews but if you don't like to wait then go and eat early to beat the crowd.   The SERVICE has been good on both visits. They took care of us well which was pretty impressive considering how busy they get.  Overall, I can always count on this place to satisfy my burger needs whenever I am in LV.  I give this place 5 stars because I believe that the quality of food for the PRICE to go along with their SERVICE is worth it.

HDhbiXDcIYkmY9gzjJ8lgw.text: FOOD - 5 stars AMBIENCE - 3 stars (meh - boring/any old bar and grill feel) SERVICE - 3 stars (meh - passable/not bad enough to complain)  This was our first time at Hubert Keller's Burger Bar.  We selected:  1) Chef's favorite burger with two changes: swapped out buffalo for Kobe beef; swap ciabatta for a soft whole wheat bun.  (Chef's favorite is buffalo with spinach, carmelized onions and blue cheese with a red wine and shallot reduction sauce on ciabatta) -  approx. $25  2) Build-Your-Own - Angus beef with green asparagus, oyster mushrooms, bacon and peppercorn cream sauce on a soft onion bun - approx. $17  3) Skinny (plain) fries - approx. $3  4) Glass of house merlot ($7) and glass of Red Diamond cabernet ($10)  Both burgers were amazing.  They nailed medium rare on both.  We split them in half and shared.  We savored every bite.  We couldn't really decide which we liked better.  The flavor on the Chef's Favorite might've won by a hair, but the texture on the Build-Your-Own was much nicer than the texture on the other (the crisp bacon, al dente asparagus and earthy, slightly chewy oyster mushrooms were all a nice contrast to the tender burger and soft bun; the Chef's favorite was pretty much all soft, melt-in-your-mouth-no-teeth-necessary kind of mouthfeel.)  Fries were good; not too greasy, not too salty.  We rarely ever finish an order of fries, but we ate all of these and dipped some in our burger sauces!  House merlot was fabulous minus (boring, a bit watery, not fruity like a Merlot should be.)  Red Diamond cab was much better.  It's a $10-11 solid table wine you can find at Sam's Club.  Would've liked to see a little bit bigger selection on the wine list (there were only about 4 reds by the glass and 6-7 total.)  But I guess they want you to drink beer (extensive beer list by country.)  Service was hit-and-miss with server forgetting about us twice for a long time.  Also, right after we sat down, she came by to take our order; we asked for a couple minutes, and when she returned she brought us a check.  She had already set it on the table and started to move on before she realized she had the wrong table.  That was a precursor on the service.  It wasn't horrible, it was just thoughtless.  Either she was distracted or tired or somewhat indifferent to her job (not sure which.)  Ambience was also a disappointment.  I would've expected something unique or inventive.  Nada.  Take away the menu and the food and I could've been in any average burger place anywhere.  No hint I was in a top-tier chef's restaurant at Mandalay Bay.  Kinda noisy; too many little kids and crying babies for my thinking (we had a 10:30 PM dinner.)  But for me, food is king, and the food was grand.  We were pleasantly surprised by the bill; under $65 before gratuity.  It was yummy enough that I actually thought, "I could come back here again...tomorrow."

wD-dp2PYoSy7Hrav9E4dLQ.text: Food just ok but location and service solid for mid day lunch meeting. Easy atmosphere to have conversation.

CDO_WDuVlJTnyUcZvLLGSg.text: I was at Manadalay Bay for a convention and was parked at Luxor. I was strolling through the shops and saw this place had a lot of people, and was craving a burger. This place is as good as it gets! Yummiest burger I've ever had! I had the wagyu beef burger with some toppings I choose myself. I then saw on the menu that this restaurant was by Hubert Keller, an awesome chef, that also runs Fleur at Mandalay which I had previously had, with amazing food! Burger was perfect. Fries were amazing. Service was good! I would definitely  come back when I'm back in Vegas!

U3aBZYJAbUm-MUeWlFdCJA.text: A burger place for everyone is hard to find, but Burger Bar is just that! From a vegan to a fine dining snoot, all types are bound to find something they can enjoy on the menu.   We used to go here regularly for their veggie burger. Even though it was a bit mushy, it was delicious, and we would order it "well-done" to give it a bit of extra crunch. And, now that we are back into the meat-eating world, there are even more options to select from, including turkey and the pricey Kobe, even buffalo. You can get salmon too, fish-lovers.  But, what I truly enjoy about Hubert's burgers are the endless options for customization. There are around 50 choices of toppings, which means your burger never has to be the same thing twice. You can throw foie gras on top if you're fancy (I am not). Or grilled zucchini if you have a thing for green (I do). And, you can get a very simple mixed green salad on the side for $2.50 instead of fries. I have never ordered the "Chef's Burgers" because I prefer to dress my patty up my way.   They also have a nice selection of beer and a TV for virtually every table. Service has always been good, and really, if you order smart, the prices are darn reasonable for dining on The Strip. Note: They do accept M Life!

iiOeB-WOk3Ko-TNmQF_1-g.text: My last day in Vegas I decided to give this place a shot before I headed to the airport.  I opted for the build your own burger, with ground beef, smoked gouda, spinach and caramelized onions on a ciabata bun.  It was really yummy and perfectly cooked.  The fat fries were also great, came out very hot, crispy on the outside and fluffy on the inside.  The chipotle aioli was delicious with the fries.  And as far as Vegas goes, its not a bad deal -- about $16 for the burger and fries.

q63zk5HWrEd8DxYFW-Jg0A.text: It took FOREVER to get our food (party of 6) and this place is so freaking overpriced. I wouldn't go with a party larger than 2. Burgers are good, but not that good.

708SAJ0izwA3Ea_zMwPa4Q.text: First restaurant we tried in third trip to Las Vegas, I really liked the burgers but feel in love with the milkshakes we had, service was quick and straight to the point and the bill wasnt that bad.

QK1v6b3tCkTJ2TzML2WHpw.text: The burgers here are pretty good and for the price, is actually a STEAL when compared to other eateries on the strip.  I mean, it IS las vegas!  Most of the time, there's a pretty long wait here so prepare to get boozed up before you finally get to sit down and eat.  I think there was only ONE time I actually fully remembered the meal LOL!    Anyway, they have great beers on draft here that seem to creep up on you if you're not careful.  The burgers are pretty good, just make sure you order it medium rare.  Put some carmelized onions on there, baby spinach, blue cheese, gruyere cheese, and you've got yourself a BOMB.COM burger.

QeSe2GcS1rpHeb0fu0oufg.text: 3.5 stars.  I ordered the Black Jack burger, which came with monterey jack and tapenade on a ciabatta bun. I absolutely loved the bun, but didn't care much for the tapenade. The fries it came with were so addicting. Try the white BBQ sauce, which is just BBQ sauce and mayo mixed together.   I ordered the Chocolate Burger to take back to the hotel. Oh, man. One of the best decisions I made while in Vegas. Warm donut "bun," Nutella mousse "patty," passion fruit jelly "cheese," kiwi "pickles," and strawberry "tomatoes." It even came with a side of raspberry sauce, but I didn't bother using that... as you could expect, the "burger" was already sweet as is. But definitely order this if you love sweets! Very cute and very tasty.  I'll have to come back to Burger Bar on my next trip to Vegas and try a different burger, or make my own. The shakes also looked and sounded really great. Very affordable dinner for Vegas, especially for a restaurant owned by a celebrity chef!

kSdd5-4XPaEXuIlaQowdqA.text: Excellent find in the marketplace between Luxor and Mandalay Bay.  Don't settle for pizza or other quick and easy options....eat the good stuff!  Definitely worth checking out.  Amazing beer selection.  Buffalo burger was well prepared.  Bottom bun was soggy.  They should provide a second bottom bun or allow the juices to settle prior to serving.

vmqE5OWN4JlJzrqbrbNEwA.text: 3 and 1/2 stars.    It's a build a burger type restaurant, named #2 burger joint in Las Vegas.  You pick your type of burger meat including kobe, sustainable, sirloin, etc and other including veggie patty, salmon, turkey, etc.  Then you can pick your bun - onion, sesame, whole wheat, ciabatta, etc, cheeses - pepperjack, swiss, american, cheddar, etc, and fixings:  lobster, asparagus, mushrooms, onions, etc, sauces - truffle, shallot reduction, etc.  Some burgers are already built for you and you got your schmancy ones including a $60 truffle burger, Lobster/asparagus burger, etc.  Pick your side of fries:  Skinny, steak, sweet potato.  First time here I picked the lobster burger which was pretty tasty, but I don't remember too much about it.  Second time I ordered a sustainable on wheat w/swiss cheese and shallot reduction.. honestly, patty didn't have much flavor, and the sauce didn't either so my burger tasted pretty bland.    Good selection of beers and small TV for each booth.  While the prices for a typical burger isn't through the roof, (around $20) your best bet if you're pinching your wallet would be the slider appetizer, three cute sliders w/fries for only $12.95.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. lobster burger
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. sliders

xsRuntkRjzyDg6E8FofL0A.text: This place is home to the most delicious milkshakes I've ever had!  Favorites are the Irish coffee (alcoholic) shake and the plain ole chocolate shake.  Yum!  The first time I came here, I splurged and ordered the $60 Rossini burger.  It was good, but definitely not the best burger I've ever had, and absolutely not worth the price.  I am embarrassed to even admit spending that much on a burger!  For less than the price of that single burger, on a return visit we got two Angus burgers with our choice of toppings, sweet potato fries and skinny fries, and an Irish coffee shake.   All were delicious except for the skinny fries which were just meh.   Not as skinny or crispy as I would have liked.  Standout toppings were the bacon, mushrooms, dijon mustard and the peppercorn sauce.

uVcxGYQPMzgob9FOCAETZQ.text: This hidden gem is a great place to get a nice late night burger. Its deep within the labyrinths of Mandalay Bay. Go in the lobby and follow the signs to the Shoppes. I had the sliders they were very good. Figure 20$ each minimum.

81fVtaoTTKqxUlxqO2jGkg.text: If you want a top notch high quality burger this place is it. I had the turkey burger with the fry sampler and it was sinful. Great onion rings and the fried zucchini melts in your mouth. And price wise they are affordable. I loved every bit of my food here. I'm still thinking about it

Y5aXGiBuc52Lcfu_ZXRbBg.text: How the heck am I supposed to every enjoy a burger at another place now! Their burgers are far superior to any other I've ever had and I had the veggie burger LOL.  We were in town for EDC, on a one meal a day budget and this place was perfect for it.   The meals are huge and filled us up for the entire day.  The beer selection is excellent as well.  Would definitely come here again next time I'm in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

rneUJ1ae0EZ_1KbSXxaumQ.text: Not worth the money. The Kobe burger was not season well. It's overrated don't waste your money or time.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is crazy.. Don&#39;t do it! Had the regular $17 Kobe burger not good.

Eh_KBaje-sxIoNLSMYhsiQ.text: Decent burger, decent draft beer selection and great service!  What's even better is the price.  $15 for a burger with fries.  For Vegas, the quality for the price point was excellent.  Would definitely come back.

hYTwzTy6aKWpxbNJEblVbw.text: Sliders are the size of a dollar pancake. You'll pay $17 for a smattering of junk beer with subpar ice cream in it.  Another $17 for a good, but heinously, disgustingly overpriced hamburger. Are you paying for atmosphere? Certainly not.  This place is effectively in the middle of a mall. You're paying for Vegas real estate and getting what is, in the world of gourmet hamburgers, pretty darn mediocre food. Save your money for something useful. This place is criminally overpriced for what you get.  They'll charge you for every single add on.

6JlduoD32avx6nw3NgAJgA.text: After seeing the commercial over and over on the Vegas/"default" channel in our room, we took a pit stop here towards the end of our stay.  Y'all know I'm a burger junkie, so I had to try theirs.  I was a little disappointed... I ordered the Hubert Keller Burger (his "favorite choice") - and ummm, it was ALRIGHT. I saw the description: Buffalo, caramelized onions, baby spinach, blue cheese, I'm thinking - WINNER! Fell short!  The buffalo lacked the gamey flavor I like about the meat. It tasted like the Angus burger my boyfriend ordered, but with a higher price tag!  I must say the Buttermilk Zucchini Fries were pretty damn good! It almost tasted like a mozzarella stick because the zucchini has a melty, gooey consistency inside.  That was probably the highlight of our meal.  For it being Vegas, I thought everything would be up a notch.  Maybe I should go to the Burger Bar here in San Francisco and compare...??....

Csi4bd1WQdPdCjKLqhvkcA.text: I've been wanting to try Hubert Keller's Burger Bar for so long.  Stopping here before seeing Aziz Ansari at Mandalay Bay made such an amazing night!  Hubby and I sat at the bar and I had the Med-Rare NatureSource burger with Brie, Sauteed baby spinach, and truffle mayo on the plain bun.   Oh Em Gee!  Probably the best burger I've ever eaten.  Hubs had the Kobe burger with brie and a fried egg with L&T on a plain bun.  His was killer as well ... though my "Annie Burger" was tops in my book -- and that's the beauty of BYOB!  Fat fries. Couple of glasses of wine, a decent (for LV, we're from SD!) glass or two of beer and we were happy,. happy, and ready to laugh :)

XwHosXczrhz6dZQqPBM59w.text: The burgers are beautifully made and full of flavor. The waitress was helpful and the orders came out promptly.  The price was a little high, but its Vegas! I'm still thinking about the juicy hamburger in my hands. Delicious.  There's a Chef Special burger called "Wagyu".  One day, when I think $60 for a hamburger is super affordable, I will indulge.   I ordered: $17.99- Wagyu Burger: Wagyu meat is a high quality beef used in burgers.  It is comparable to Kobe beef in that Kobe Beef is from a Wagyu cattle but it is raised in special conditions.  My google-ling taught me that Wagyu cattle "produces a higher percentage of oleaginous, unsaturated fat than any other breed of cattle known in the world".  Anyways, I got a Medium Wagyu Burger and it was juicy, tender, flavorful, and simply delicious.  Maybe I should have added some grilled onions or avocado to intensify the flavors, but I like plain.   Overall: Everyone in my party was in deep love with their hamburgers! Delicious!

_vkPzGH9f0OIt4i6P1Hkag.text: So good! Everything from their burgers to shakes. We always build our own burger. Ingredients taste vibrant but they're definitely fresh. Can't wait to go back!

CgpYxcqlGeErbr4xuhIiSg.text: I'm not a burger person so take this comment as a grain of salt.   We got the, (1) American Kobe Beef for $16.00 - very juicy (according to the person who got it) but it wasn't all that special or anything and they charge for additional toppings, including cheese, FYI. (2) Sweet potato fries for $2.55 - like any other sweet potato fries I've had. (3) Shake for $5.50 - WONDERFUL, but THICK and RICH.  Place was rowdy (great for Vegas) and the service was great!  Come here if it's convenient, but don't go out of your way.  And if you do, get their signature baffalo burger since that's what they're known for.

341pzWocSytUGr0pz_uzHg.text: I finally made my way to dine at the infamous Burger Bar after my cousin came to town.   Luckily we arrived at 4pm, just before the Saturday night dinner rush. We were seated quickly and had our drinks in hand within minutes. The ambiance was eclectic: there was a small television in our booth playing a sports channel, but I do not recall any audio. The lighting was dim, matching the dark mahogany wood seating. As expected, the crowd mostly consisted of visiting tourists. Attire is casual.   I ordered a Hawaiian "burger", er chicken sandwich. Why didn't I order a BURGER? I am not sure. I suppose the pineapple just sounded so appealing to me. Even more ironic, my cousin ordered the Salmon. I know - who orders salmon at a Burger joint?! Apparently fresh fish , particularly salmon, is hard to come by where she lives.   Anyway, my chicken sandwich arrived and to my chagrin, the chicken tasted very dry. The pineapple I was craving didn't really compliment the chicken as I had anticipated. I suppose I can't discount them too much since I didn't order a burger; but how hard is it to cook chicken?   The salmon, however, was reportedly delicious - and I think that is what was important. My cousin was visiting, not me.   Maybe next time I will actually order a burger. Hopefully it will be a little better prepared than my chicken - juicy and delicious- as one would expect it to be.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hawaiian burger

M2DkA1lOoWZ1IULYnkZieA.text: Waygu beef burgers to die for!    Went twice on this trip, last nights service SUCKED!  She left our order sit or something, because the buns were all dried out and crispy on tip and soft on bottom by the time we got our order.  We had to ask for refills, etc.  From the time we walked in until we got our meal it was 45 minutes!  Missed the twins both nights!  Ask for one of the twins and you'll have an awesome experience!!!!!  I'm knocking off a star because of the slow, unfriendly, ridiculous service last night.

8H-ez_rNg_CP2kSmMSoM_g.text: We ate here a couple of times now.  I always get the Kobe burger, it is awesome.   The service is hit or miss.  Never seems to be consistent.    It does get crowded, so go early or you'll have to wait.

vIEb4ow_PN49jX9vq-OZxw.text: Chef's burger?  Delicious. Sweet potato fries with cinnamon honey something?  Sweet 'n tasty. Deep fried mac & cheese?  The undergrad in me was drooling. Hazelnut nutella milkshake?  I will take 8 lactaids because you cannot keep me away from it!  I haven't had a milkshake in ages (stupid lactose intolerance).  But this was worth popping one of those chalky white pills every few sips.  I am looking up the address in San Francisco because I am not waiting until the next time I'm in Vegas for the sweet or savory goodness that is Burger Bar.  I hear there's one in St. Louis too.  (Oh, and I have a little crush on Hubert Keller.  Shhhh - don't tell.)

B0FtD2iiYHNkZyPxxihbrA.text: Menu was disappointing small selection, with build your own options being the only way to go. Fry sampler was bland with overpriced (welcome to the Las Vegas strip) dipping sauce options. Waiter couldn't answer a basic question, "How spicy is your spicy ketchup dip?" Over priced, under delivered!   I would not recommend this place to anyone.

kmgAI2zZ1FRKBPZXIrXf2g.text: Good lunch spot when visiting Vegas. I enjoyed our food. We ordered an appetizer(hot wings) they were yummy and the bloody marries tasted oh so good. Great burger wonderful choices and fantastic customer service. I'll be back for sure.

iTiyYglata9HSmPb3CW42A.text: First off, I only review burgers.  This place has got a great name.  I can't believe someone didn't snatch it up sooner.  This is world renown chef Hubert Keller's baby.  He has some great restaurants in Las Vegas including Fleur de Lys.  First impression of the Burger Bar is that it's laid out pretty simply and looks like a place I would enjoy coming to.  The staff was friendly.  The burgers were surprisingly not that special.  I expected a much higher quality burger coming from Chef Keller.  They were good, but not great.  Many better burgers are out there in Las Vegas.  This is a good place to go if you're already there and are craving a burger, but I wouldn't make a trip just to eat the burgers here.  WHAT I ORDERED: Main --- - American Kobe Beef Burger: 3/5 (meat was better than other patties, but lacking in flavor): 3/5 - American Classic: 3/5 - Black Jack Burger: 3/5  Sides --- - Skinny Fries: 3/5 - Buttermilk Onion Rings: 4/5 (good but not enough)  STAFF: Friendly  WAIT TIME: Come at the wrong time, and you'll be waiting, but at least there are some shops nearby to kill time.  PORTION: Generous  BANG FOR YOUR BUCK: A tad overpriced probably because the reputable chef  WOULD I RETURN: Maybe

tatys-g-77JlAzMNyQ9wIA.text: Amazing.  Went in to just grab something to eat and can say that this service was by far better then some fine dining establishments.   Felt like royalty on how well and attentive the staff was with our needs.  We ordered the mac and cheese bites which were amazing and then a burger and shared it.  My husband had a beer and I had a vodka cran.  Everything was prompt and delicious.  We were table touched by three different servers walking by and then our own.  You would have thought we were royalty.  Wonderful place, would go back again!

duScHL9rv9QV610vz2Y7XA.text: Lil pricey but that's the price to pay for excellence.  Look, you're on the strip and you're hungry.  Your Mrs. wants a salad, your friends want to try the latest celebrity chef spot and the guy that tagged along just wants to know what time we're getting to the club, strip club, concert, cirque show, etc.  Tell everyone to relax and just go to burger bar.  Its a local favorite stop prior to all things MBay/Luxor for a number of reasons. 1. get the burger you want, built how you want it. 2. nobody doesn't like hamburgers (even you veggies, pretty sure they have your options too) 3. milkshakes and those spicy cheese popper things because your inner fat kid deserves to be let loose from time to time. 4. It's not JUST burgers, they've got plenty of other choices on the menu. Excellence does take time and is a little pricey but in the end you'll have a satisfied bunch.  Then you can take your Mrs. to the cirque show, your friends will head to the concert and the creeper can catch a cab to the strip club.  Everybody wins.

bt8LRsQ88eiqDF1LKhn3lA.text: The best turkey burger I have ever eaten. I recommend requesting to sit in Erin's area... she is an amazing waitress. Never had to ask for one thing... very nice and attentive. My mother had the American Classic hamburger and she ate the entire burger along with fries and a Vanilla milkshake... that tells me that she truly enjoyed her meal. Kudos to the professional chef for creating an amazing restaurant that you can sit and actually enjoy your meal and get your money's worth. Will definitely come again.

2jq8ttClZhtfQS4psBwahw.text: I would really give this 2 stars, but I'm upping it a little bit because the other people liked their burgers. So here is the good: we ordered one of their adult millkshakes (has alcohol) - the mint chocolate chip flavored one - which was AWESOME. Mint and chocolate and so drinkable with mounds of chocolate whipped cream and an oreo - what's not to like? It actually didn't taste like alcohol at all, which was good for me, but got us wondering what we were paying for.That came before all our food so I was kinda stuffed by the time I got my burger. My mom had the chicken burger on a wheat bun without additional toppings and my friend had the salmon burger with blue cheese on a sesame bun. Both said that their meats were cooked really well.   I was way waaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaay less impressed. I had the veggie burger since I'm vegetarian, which had an awesome description but was pretty effing bland. It was made of mushrooms, brown and white rice, lentils, caramelized onions, peas, and potatoes. It tasted just faintly of lentils and the mushy texture added nothing to the experience. I had mine on ciabatta bread, which wasn't toasted enough to my liking so it was kinda too soft. We also ordered sweet potato fries which were good, but nothing special. Same with the zucchini fries, which actually seemed like every generic burger joint zucchini sticks which you can buy in a freezer section. I was SUPER excited about their deep-fried pickles, and sorely disappointed - they were pickle spears, not chips, and the beer batter was crispy but way too heavy.   I don't get why people think this place is so good - must be all the toppings. But if you have to rely on toppings, anything will taste good for a price, won't it?  When the milkshake is the best part of my meal, suffice it to say that I won't be coming back. Too bad. When you go to a top chef restaurant, you expect top chef food.

BvnkYTagtAahDz7F4Gaw5g.text: Burger Bar was just meh... Especially for the price! The four of us got lucky, and ended up finding spots at the bar, or else the wait was over an hour long (ridiculous!) My friends, who are lovers of foie gras, were excited to try the Kobe burger with seared foie gras (which is now banned in CA). This burger was an expensive $60, and my friends were really disappointed by the taste. The foie gras pieces were small and not of good quality. Good thing I opted out of the foie gras burger! I ended up just getting the American Classic, which was not any better. Nothing super great about it, meat was whatevers, and the burger actually came out a lil cold. It did not taste like "right off the grill" temperature. Would not spend the money or come back!

LjZRz8GKbpda1Ibs3L1h0A.text: The bison burger is delicious. I sat for a few minutes after dinner not thinking about dessert but if I should have another burger!  Bison, chibatta bread, egg and Jack cheese... Gotta remember this.

y-JPLYb_KZL2cnUZXn99sA.text: What this place lacks in charm and funky/stylish decor, it more than makes up for with a whole lot of prime grade A certified meaty goodness.. Most Vegas establishments on the strip are overpriced joints with poor food, and a whole lot of glitz. Burger Bar is quite the opposite.   Quality, reasonably priced food without the glam. On top of that I love the fact that I can create my own slice of meaty goodness. They have a whole slew of toppings to choose from- from basic cheese and guacamole to foie gras for those with more discriminating palates... Bonus points for the alcoholic milkshakes.. Love it!!

adrXNmCKowFvjGICppb-DA.text: What can I say about this place that hasn't been said by 1500 other people? Hands down the best burger I've ever had in my life!  I've been here twice, and the first time I rated this as the 4th or 5th best burger in town. But the issue was that I got one of their pre-made selections on the left side of the menu. I think I got a Peppercorn burger or something, but it was a "good" not "great" experience.   The next time I got adventurous and made my own burger. When you mix a high quality meat with the bun/cheese/toppings that you like, this burger will blow your minds. It was a little more expensive with the high-quality beef, but worth every penny.  What's that, and they have a good beer selection?  Make-your-own milskshakes you say?  I only have good things to say about this place. Go here. Go here now.

boBet69Mp5l6rTY_QRLxtw.text: I still have the same burger but, the waitress suggested I add "Jalapeno Bacon" !!!! OMG How did I not think of that before?!?!  say, YES to jalapeno bacon.  i'm in love.

JUrvv9ldhMV6Z0CZZ3m2-A.text: I was enjoying my vacation till I stopped by the burger bar Jessica our server was less then pleasant and Scott the manager would not honor the happy hour specials think twice before stopping by for happy hour. Food was great though!!

sUmV5pi6x6iBS9Lb-SCUxA.text: Great Burger~ I had the Hubert Keller burger--buffalo with blue cheese, spinach and caramelized onion on ciabatta--is $22 I am a big fan of Buffalo. With the blue cheese, spinach and caramelized Onion on Ciabatta bread made this burger a Father's Office yelp.com/biz/fathers-off... burger with buffalo. I LOVE Father's office burger and now I love Hubert Keller's burger! I really don't know why I like Buffalo burger so much, but I just find them so flavorful and juicy but with texture and not mushy like beef tends to be sometime when it is too juicy. $22 IS a bit overpriced for a burger. But attaching a name like Hubert Keller is like buying a $2,000 Prada bag if you love good food lol. The restaurant is literally a Burger Bar. It looks like a kick back sports bar that serves burgers. There seems to be always a wait to get seated at this restaurant, but if you don't mind sitting at the bar, it's pretty easy to grab a seat since people who sit at the bar are always on the go. Hubert Keller said on Top Chef masters that he serves $5,000 burgers and they people actually order them... I wonder what's in his $5,000 burger! Next time I come here, I want to try building my own burger :) yummy!!! *edit* I made a mistake, his $5000 burger is served at Fleur de Lys, his other restaurant at Mandalay Bay. "Created by French chef Hubert Keller, Fleur Burger 5000 Fleur Burger 5000 The Fleur Burger 5000 is a luxury burger served at Fleur de Lys at Las Vegas' Mandalay Bay. The Fluer Burger 5000 is made from Kobe beef and topped with black truffles, foie gras, and served on a brioche truffle bun with a special truffle sauce. The burger is served with a bottle of 1990 Chateau Petrus in imported Ichendorf Brunello stemware, which they let you keep. Looking at their menu, some of the appetizers include burgundy escargot with garlic and parmesan gnocchi and smoked salmon raviolis with guacamole. A sample of the entrees include filet mignon with braised oxtail tortellini and slow roasted Alaskan king salmon with a parmesan and herb crust, artichokes, lemon, and capers. The Fleur Burger will set you back $5k, but hey at least they send you a certificate of authenticity and some Italian Ichendorf Brunello stemware."

9H9HmC28dm0VwjKRt1u2zg.text: Wow! I never even knew this place existed and now I can't wait to go back. My amazing girlfriend brought me here on our recent Vegas getaway. This is one of the best burgers I have ever had. Yes I just said that. One of the best burgers I have ever had and I have had a lot of them. I love cheeseburgers. I think I am ruined on burgers after this. It is a nice place. One long bar with tables and some cool booths. I think it is great that they can text you now when your table is ready. No buzzer to carry around and if the wait is long you can wander farther away. It is a sign that this was the busiest place in this little area. There are a lot of other restaurants in this little area but this was the busiest. I now know why. You can build your own burger and shake. Anything you want. Really anything. If you really go crazy you can get a $100 burger. You think that is crazy but I would say from the first bite you would say it was worth it. Mine came in about $20 and it was so good. From the first bite to the last. I didn't even get anything crazy. I just got an Angus patty, cooked medium, jalapeno bacon, Swiss cheese, a fried egg and their spicy ketchup. It is tempting to pile stuff on because you see so many toppings that you like but trust me 4 is enough. Too many and you have too many flavors going on and you overwhelm the burger. Mine was just about perfect. Cooked just right. It feel apart when you bit into it and melted in your mouth. The jalapeno bacon and the spicy ketchup had just the right amount of kick. Just what I was looking for. For the shake I got chocolate ice cream with Oreos, hot fudge and mini marshmallows with whipped cream on top. The straw is huge. Almost hard to get your mouth around but big enough so nothing gets caught. It was so good too. Creamy and chocolaty. So good. The service was great too. Water always full. They gave us time to pick out exactly what we wanted. I really can't wait to go back. We almost went back a few times but wanted to try other places. Guaranteed when we come back to Vegas this will be one of our first stops. For sure.

tPWYhRhFt5OfHTb0uF7H5w.text: This is the one place I have to go to for my birthday every year.  Burgers GOOOD, Fries GOOD, shakes GOOOOOOOOOOOOD!!!

UBALUZUZecXSD3R3L4C9nA.text: We were told we needed to come here, so we trekked all the way from Harrahs. (far) We had the Hubert Keller burger. 24.95. The platter came out with one small lonely burger. I was thinking no way... anyhow we asked and she brought us our fries. I said, I think there was supposed to be some sauce also. She gets it, it was supposed to be a red wine shallot. We received teriyaki. It was icky.  Ruined the burger. We got 1 burger & 1 beer and it was almost 38.00.  So I'm not happy.  She brought us a discounted check. The manager took off 3.00. Sorry but that didn't cut making me feel better for feeling ripped off that bad.  It was alright but surely not even better than habit burger or something  in the 6-8.00 range. Ruth chris has a 12.00 burger twice the size and 100 times more yummy. I have major buyers remorse.

jIxPh9DV4Jvt9QoBtli4XA.text: Went to Burger Bar with a large group of yelpers (Shawn H's UYE).  I ordered the angus burger with pepper jack, jalapeno bacon, avocado on ciabatta and a side of truffle mayo.  I opted to skip the fries and get a chocolate peanut butter milk shake instead.  The shake was amazing.  One of the best shakes I've had.  When our food came my plate had fries and it looked like the wrong burger because I didn't see any avocado but I didn't want to touch it to check.  I told the waitress that I thought it was wrong and she said it was right.  She argued with me saying I didn't order avocado and then finally brought me some avocado on a plate for me to put on my burger.  I open up my burger to add the avocado and the cheese was all white with no peppers at all so I didn't think it was pepper jack, and the bacon was definitely pepper bacon and not jalapeno bacon.  I think she might have confused the pepper jack with pepper bacon? I'm not sure.  It was very loud in the restaurant so that could have been part of it also. I don't appreciate the waitress arguing with me though.  I know what I freaking ordered.  I'm a yelper.  I looked at the menu and knew what I was going to order before I got here.  So I ate the burger with the avocado she brought and just left the wrong cheese and bacon.  After the avocado fiasco I didn't want to deal with her anymore.  I didn't enjoy the burger at all.  Not sure if the right bacon and cheese would have changed that.  It just wasn't good.  I didn't even eat half the burger and I was starving when I got there.  She didn't charge me for the fries even though I said I would pay for them.  My total for the burger, shake and auto gratuity was $30.  Pretty pricey for a burger, especially one that wasn't very good.  A few others at our table didn't care for their meal either.  I'm wondering if I just got Burger Bar on a off day.  I have heard such good things I will be back to give them another try.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Supposed to be angus burger with pepper jack, jalapeno bacon, avocado on ciabatta and a side of truffle mayo
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate Peanut Butter Shake

OR6073ZdakMw9Fql09nWzQ.text: This place is cool! It was our first time on this restaurant, and the waiter suggested to us the buffalo burger. He said its lean and good for you. "Why not?" So that night, we ordered the buffalo burger with ingredients of Monterey Jack, red onion, and potato bun. It was our first time eating a buffalo meat. To me it tasted just like beef but lighter or not heavy in the stomach. The meat was medium done, so it has a little bet blood in the middle. It was very good but gamey.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Buffalo burger

Aa6zeIHaRWTCa8oPVABA8A.text: Man, I am so bummed about this one.  We flew in and headed straight for the burger bar.  I loved Hubert Keller's "Fleur de Lys" on our last trip and I love burgers so this seemed like the natural progression.  I have noted before that I am on the quest for the best burger.  This place was not it.  We had the slider trio and the house burger.  They were all good and the temperature was correct but I was expecting to have crazy flavors bursting to my palate.  Not so much.  They also seemed to have a considerable amount of beer to choose from but their wine list was atrocious.  When I asked for a taste of a cab, the wine glass was dinky and thick and the wine was rancid.  This is such a bummer for me.

dc0-VsnsXky-Npp-DKDm2Q.text: The food was good. We tried the Baguette burger and Hangover Burger. Both were very delicious (but nothing special/mind blowing) along with the fries they came with. However very disappointed with the portion size compared to the price you get (possibly the smallest burger I've tried). Also tried buttermilk  onions, nothing special about these. Just tasted like an ordinary onion  ring that doesn't taste it has buttermilk in it.

Gj9om3Vjxl7BKmiZP4GnGw.text: Not bad, somewhat memorable. I love the variety of ingredients and "stuff" all over their menu, I am all about adding different things and love access to lots of sauces. I assume that as a tourist trap, the burgers have become what they have for feeding the masses. Reading the descriptions I was very intrigued; upon tasting the burgers, I was not. Not disgusted by any means, but just not impressed. The buffalo meat was delicious though.  I'd also assume that the fries a place like this offers should be great in one way or another and I found none in both types.   Overrated is quite the perfect word for this place, just like most of Vegas. Some places are, while being overrated, worth trying just, or at least, once. This place, I found no merit for. Reminds me of an airport restaurant. I'm not mad I tried it, but I wouldn't be recommending anyone to go out of their way to.

6xalgcaKaJ7CttRs-Ff0rQ.text: I'm happy to report both the food and the staff at this restaurant are both still great.  The menu has changed slightly with different beef choices, an Angus and a Waygu instead of American Kobe.  Stuck with the standard Angus which was delicious.  Discovered they have picked green tomatoes as a side which were fantastic.  Got an order of the Burger Bar Ketchup which was fantastic as well.  Nutella shake was very rich and tasty, but I think I could make a decent reproduction at home and save myself $8 and change.  (I mostly tried it to see what it tasted like so I could recreate it at home)  Our waitress was excellent and always made sure our drinks were filled.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. interior
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shake section of the menu

siwcBL-vzd87RmYh58_fUQ.text: Dessert burgers to die for! Sweet potato fries that are so good they will instantly become your favourites*! Why exactly am I shouting!!!?  Currently, actively working my way through their Chef's Burgers portion of their menu -- I have had the Surf/Turf (not my favourite), the namestake Hubert Keller Burger, and a third one that I am not sure of which one it was now -- only on one occasion was my burger not cooked to temperature (asked for 'medium rare'; was brought 'well done').   Back to the dessert burgers. Goddamn is that creamy cheese cake burger one good.   The service has been hit or miss for us here. They can be busy -- and I can understand busy -- but there are other places that are busy but still take your order fairly quickly and more importantly bring you your desserts after ordering them in a timely manner.   The weaknesses in this area force me hand in a four-star versus a five, although anyone can come here and easily have their five-star experience on a routine basis. Food is great; boy, those dessert burgers cannot be overstated though. - E  *That is until you try the sweet potato fries at BurGR.

qMKnSLnRSKB_zTToyUndvg.text: I like herbs and spices and the burger tasted boring... The fries were very fat and droopy... Not my place, but friendly staff.

zckA_CAU4Aiwxj1mff4AcQ.text: Building your own burger is the reason to visit this place.  A small, somewhat-cramped eatery in the halls of the Mandalay Bay, Burger Bar is exactly what you'd expect from a Las Vegas casino restaurant:  A little over-priced because of the location, but with plenty of options and a solid effort at quality.  My burger wasn't delicious. It was good, but that's it.  It's hard to find a place that'll cook a medium rare burger, and this place only came close.  But it has a nice set of options, including gluten-free buns and kobe beef.  I definitely recommend the sweet potato fries and a few different sauces (truffled mayo anyone?).  I had a decent chocolate milk-shake while I was there, too.  I wanted to rave about this place.  I loved the menu and got excited about my order.  But I ended up finishing my meal without one of those "MMMMMMM" moments.  If you crave a good burger and don't feel like leaving the casino, it's a fine offering.

P8ExSi59Y2OBi8V2-yE1lg.text: Drink: I ordered the Nutella Shake with 3 people and my party enjoyed ever sip of it and I am sure every yelp review can contest to that.  Burger: I had the Veggie Burger and Lamb Burger: The Veggie Burger tasted like Rice and beans that had been smashed together. The second you bite into it the whole thing comes apart like rice I guess. I had better else where, and was very disappointed. The Lamb burger had a smell to it and was not all that to say the least. I had better and cheaper Lamb burgers elsewhere and was very disappointed with my experience,   I find this place to be Extremely Overrated and a Rip-off to your wallet. I would not come here again to be honest. As I was eating my $15 burger I was thinking...I could of have bought me 4: In-n-Out Burgers and indulge in that experience rather than forcing my self to eat this.

NPYLMRPQQNOK2fyM0QcUgA.text: Not impressed.    For $20 I was expecting an awesome, mouth-watering, pure burger bliss experience.  However, that was not the case.  My burger was decent and the only thing that was good there was the spicy ketchup (but I'm not sure if it was worth paying an extra $1 for it... I can mix tabasco with my ketchup for free).    Anyway, I tried their "American Classic" which consists of an angus burger on sesame bun with lettuce, onion, and tomato.  You can have the burger cooked the way you like and it comes with a side of "skinny fries".  No ladies... that does not mean less calorie like the "Skinny Girl" drinks.  What "skinny fries" mean here is slender looking fries (like McDonald's).  What was pretty awesome was how they let you do a mixture of fries and sweet potato fries.    Overall, not a place I would ever recommend anyone visiting. I would rather tell you to take that $20, place a $15 bet on a blackjack table and use the other $5 to get yourself a burger from McDonald's.

QViRau9Z9PPS5mU42QZVeA.text: I would say 3.5 but with this one had to side with the 3.0 mainly due to the fact that service wasn't that good for the price that you pay.   The burger's weren't cooked correctly the first time out but once they came back after a disgusting look from the waitress for bothering her when she was too busy to help were delicious.  The pricing was also very high for a basic burger, I actually would prefer in and out or Five Guy's Burgers over this place due to the price and the service.

nPWQoT9HYiodO6v-wvdSsw.text: Been her multiply times and every time it is truly a great experience. Went for lunch today so no wait which was nice.   My brother and i both had the rossini burger which was kobe style wagyu beef from australia, seared foie, fresh pepper & salt, a rich brown sauce, and truffles on an onion bun. My favorite thing to eat is burgers and this is on my top 2 list with the blue cheese burger @ bubba burgers in hawaii.  Foie gras and truffles = an experience in itself, i could eat both of these things 3 meals a day and die a very happy man  Skinny fries perfectly cooked and seasoned  Onion rings with ranch = say no more  Mac & Cheese + fryer = duh, amazing  Beers on their list for days, bottles and draft, had a pitcher of an IPA today, great pick with a burger.  Service was good, not great, but i had the burger so didn't need anything else  Def going back soon.

9DqjDb83g_EUr74WXbwwvg.text: WOw is all I can say about this place. I came in here with zero expectations but left with the highest praise. As soon as I took my first bite I hailed it the best burger I've ever had. I'm not much of a gourmet burger kind of guy, but maybe thats because I've never had Burger Bar before.  I opted to get the angus beef burger cause that seemed like the most popular choice. I also added bacon to my burger because cmon...bacon... We just got into vegas that day and was already pretty tired from the drive so I was ready to eat and knock out.   The burger itself was so juicy and so flavorful. The 2 main things I always look for in a meal is texture and flavor, and man did this burger deliver. Every bite seemed to taste better and better as I went on. The bacon that was in my burger was just the icing on the cake. It was cooked exactly the way I like it, which is right on the border of soft and crispy. This made the texture of each bite soft, juicy and chewy all at the same time while packing a punch of flavor.  I definitely would recommend this place to pretty much anybody. Even though each burger ended up being close to $20, I felt like I completely got my money's worth. Next time I go, I definitely want to try some of the more expensive options

LDBdtF2i97Xg_gFsW9ZArA.text: Solid burgers, but not sure if it's worth the price. I got the American Classic burger. The bun was nice and soft and the bacon was crisp. Wish the cheese was a bit more melted. I ordered it medium, but it came out to be more like medium well as it was not very pink in the middle. I was pretty disappointed in the somewhat limp fries. They should come out more crisp. As a caloric  indulgence, I also got the Black & White milkshake. For $8, I really wish that there was more milk shake and less whipped cream! The glass is also very tall, skinny, and deceiving. You think you get a lot of milkshake, but you really don't. And there's no stainless steel cup with the overflow. Sad face.

Slc2cqN32Qp2GOah1pyZGg.text: I've been here twice ands was pretty dang satisfied both times! I honestly don't know if I'd come back now that Vegas has seriously stepped up their burger game and has competitive prices (Burger Bar is pretty pricey).... But for a long time Burger Bar was the only solid option for a burger snob such as my self.

bb0T2LiEeaUlNJU3CBgveQ.text: Burger Bar I wish you weren't so far....from me! :)  Well in actuality I am glad cus I would be 400lbs if there was a burger bar in the Bay Area.  I have been coming here for years and am a loyal customer.  Mandalay Bay is not a centralized location for where I like to stay on the strip but I make a point to come here every trip.  I like it that much.  There are a few tricks to this place though.  You get to pick your burger meat and I honestly think when a reviewer chooses the wrong meat, they feel like this place isn't good.  The trick is that you only need to order the Angus beef burger.  If you get the vegetarian fed beef selection you are simply not going to get that fatty, juicy flavor a burger needs!  Come on people, if you were in the Donner party, would you have selected the skinny person or the fat guy to eat?....lol  The fat is what makes a burger juicy and delicious.  Also, a burger is really only supposed to be cooked medium at the most.  If you really want a juicy burger, anything else will dry it out.  I love the fat fries but my friend swears by the skinny ones.  Maybe I am just prejudice against anything skinny, i dunno :)  I read a review on here about the Nutella milkshake.....OMG!  That was a freaking awesome choice.  I almost couldn't finish that and the meal.  It is almost too much....Notice I said ALMOST?  That's right, I kicked it into FAT GUY gear and took it all down baby!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nutella Milkshake

TtdgqG3sP7M-jsw-eXhC9g.text: Took us a bit to locate the Burger Bar, but we are glad we did! I had a build your own angus beef burger with bacon and a fried egg on a ciabatta roll!  Came out cooked as requested and was great!  Loved the sweet potato and zucchini fries with their special sauce!  Delish, must try!  AND lastly don't leave without getting a shake!

4NNfu-374djDtKVrJ89u3g.text: My server Sergio and hostesses josselyn and Marissa made the best meal even better. We had the black Angus burger and skinny fries. Allan had the black and white milkshake. Great diet.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fgQ4U6WHxDjiKKpyTyPOZg.text: It was good. Nothing mind-blowing, but certainly overpriced. I ordered my burger medium, and it was overcooked, hardly even pink. The fat fries are more starchy and less crispy than I normally expect for steak fries. They were fine, but I'd probably try the skinny fries next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-GHZl6KzwGhhtQwuMm7ADQ.text: My husband and I split the Angus burger.  We added pepper jack cheese, carmelized onions and truffle mayo.  VERY tasty!  In addition, we shared the truffle fries....outstanding!  Sharing was just the right amount for lunch.  I would definitely go back!

GY2XMlrRSVW7q2umbKCTsg.text: Amazing burger! I made my own - Kobe patty, crispy fried bacon, truffle mayo, seared foie gras, caramelized onion... Truly amazing! Loved every bite!  Based on the book by Larry Olmstead, this patty was most likely not real Kobe - but man it was delicious!! I'd still get it again :)

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Jl9gXxIi5_7CC86UB-SiWQ.text: Not bad put patties are on the small side or buns are too big. Lol Had the Kobe burger and couldn't really taste the difference between the regular burger my wife got. Don't waste your money on the Kobe.

s7YRsFGQmubcWQLdgjvStg.text: Great burgers, chicken and veggie burger options.  Full bar too, so everyone is happy here.  A little pricey for a burger, but it's Vegas and was one of the more reasonable meals while we were there. I had a burger and the meat was fresh and cooked perfectly.  Will visit again.

yBxXdmSe6MUpminoItFLBg.text: WHOO! This is by far one of the best burger places I have eaten! I am not a huge fan of a big hamburger patty, but this one hit the spot. You can select from a generous amount of toppings for your burger which was really nice. It was a little pricey depending on what toppings you wanted, but nothing you wouldn't expect for it being on the strip in Vegas. Last but not least, the milkshake!! So good. You can also customize it the way you want, and it was to die for. Great customer service, awesome tv's in each little booth, and amazing food. I will definitely be returning when I go to Vegas again.

fACRbnkO2MyI3fsqxQlFDg.text: Walking in the music is not to loud, there is a bit of a wait except for the bar which we ran to :)  Happy hour is minimal some small thin things to entice your palette, chose the firestone a very lovely beer.  Ordered the American classic burger,the meal, well less than stellar very dry meat and buns...on the good side if your liking for zero sodium and no taste the fries are your best choice,to be honest the$6 Burger at Carl's Jr it's a better choice...too bad as I was looking forward to a decent meal at these prices  Bartenders seem attentive, or bartender was good so that saved it from getting a 2 star rating  Overall not the place you want to spend money at :(

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. American classic

nqpt3K1qtql3cGdD50kftQ.text: Burger bar has been on our list for quite some time. The timing has never been right as we rarely visit the strip but a few nights ago after taking my little brother to scope out some UFC fighters after the event at Mandalay bay we thought what better timing, kill 2 birds with one stone if you know what I mean.   Menu is simple burgers can come from a burger menu where toppings are already picked for you with a set price or build your own. I Chose the option choose my protein and build my own burger. They have angus beef, buffalo,Kobe beef, even salmon and chicken and other options if meat isn't your thing.   Build your own burger option can be kind of pricey if you're not careful each topping is an additional price. It can also be a bit much if you're drunk and can't decide or if you're like me and are very indecisive. It's best if you know what you like.   My custom burger - Angus beef patty medium on a potato roll with grilled pineapple, pepper jack cheese and jalapeno bacon. Chipotle aioli on the side.   The fiance chose a angus beef patty medium on a sesame roll with Swiss and an over easy egg.   Sides - skinny fries and jalapeno onion petals.   My burger was juicy and flavorful. Peoperjac didn't add much heat like I thought and the jalapeno bacon tasted like regular bacon. The sweetness from the pineapple went well with the chipotle mayo. Overall I was happy with my burger. The fiance however had a huge mess as the burger fell apart and he was left with a piece of burger with a yolky mess as everything fell apart and he ended up finishing it with a fork. He's not one to send back his food, because he thinks they'll tamper with it, so he did not want to say anything and just bit his lip about it.   Skinny fries were standard fries and the jalapeno petals weren't spicy like I had hoped no kick at all.   Overall service was a ok and my burger was great but I don't think my guy would like to come back to this place. After all we try to avoid the strip unless we have to go there. 3 stars since my juicy burger was the perfect way to curve my midnight munchies.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. No idea how the fiancés burger just fell apart to pieces  -_____-
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Juicy angus burger done medium on a potato roll with grilled pineapple,pepper jack and jalapeño bacon with chipotle aioli.

uiIaJiYRc7xy17uJsl_u-Q.text: Right smack dab in the midst of Mandalay Place.  Super convenient.  I simply LOVE this place. It's a great venue for large groups as well as smaller crowds.  I have eaten here numerous times. 1st time I ever saw and tried the now popular "sweet potato fries."  I did find my last few times here that rather than ordering my burger "medium rare" or "medium" I had to tell them what color I wanted it.  I had to send my burger back 2 or 3x otherwise.  Now I know.  Tell them what color you want it and see how they define that before you place your order. Then you'll get to enjoy your meal with your date or your friends, not 1 hour later.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Enjoying the chocolate milkshare
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. GREAT chocolate milkshake!
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

P5Oc46_xmwjtuDm7Q_94Qw.text: YELP 365 CHALLENGE 2014-(208/365) "Not Like It Was Before"  Sorry Burger Bar, gonna have to deduct from my former rating...You just aren't like you used to be. Your burgers seem to have gotten much smaller even though our waitress said they were half pound burgers. Your toppings/add on's seem to have shrunk as well.  The only thing that changed were the prices, and these burgers cost a pretty penny now, especially if you want to customize your burger, you may end up with a little sticker shock.  ALOHA!!!  Shaka Meter:  \uuu/  \uuu/  \uuu/  \uu  3.5

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Customized Angus Burger,  caramelized onions, blue cheese,  and a fried egg,  about $15

VScTXyodyIXuiKvBU4j6xg.text: We went here with 5 people and we all opted for a build your own burger. NOTE: if you don't get a chef's choice burger, everything (and I mean everything is ala carte).   I got an angus burger with guac, American cheese, & caramelized onions on ciabatta bread with a side of onion rings. The bread and onion rings were great. The burger tasted like it was grilled/smoky (it had the grill taste) but i did not like the caramelized onions. They were mushy and too sweet. Side note, they forgot my guac so it was separate in a container. Also, it comes with lettuce, pickle, red onion, & tomato on the side. I tried the cinnamon honey mustard and it was good.  The only downside is that it's really rich and I couldn't eat all of it.   Ps. After we left, it got really crowded (line outside the door)! Reservations recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Build your own burger with onion rings

yfwa47wAsGtKGb2s2dq9HQ.text: The shake was delicious I enjoyed it so much and yes I had dessert before my food ;)   The build your burger was good and the Cobb salad was so good, might try them again for lunch today

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Black &amp; White Milkshake

CAMlZ9_LZi5gSYMNq_4NQg.text: I really wanted to love Burger Bar, but sadly on the particular night we went our expectations fell short.  The service was atrocious.  We are pretty sure that our waitress was newer, although it was hard to tell since we only saw her for our orders and then check.  We had to flag other servers down for silverware and drink refills.  We went late, far after the dinner rush so there really was no excuse.  The wait time for the food was ridiculous, especially since it wasn't cooked perfectly.  Our food was okay.  Both got build your own burgers.  We asked for medium well and probably a fourth (and not in the middle, but on the side) was rare.  We waited soooo long foe our food though that I just ate what I could and left the rest.  Sauces were excellent.  Skinny fries were tasty.  Overall, not impressed.  I'm so bummed that it didn't live up to the hype.

34C9FQNtdYKvt9H-8GSWAw.text: If you're going to be this pricey for a burger in Mandalay - you must do better.   Let's make this simple with a pro and con list  Pros - We sat at the bar, and thus did not experience service problems as some reviews have state, bartender was quick, friendly and on point - Dirty Dog IPA was awesome - all of our beer from draft was perfect temps and poured correctly - Fat fries, salad, all that was excellent  Cons - Where this is located is a pain.  It's pretty much dead middle in the walk between Mandalay and Luxor - maybe not a con for others but wasn't convenient for us - The burgers were undercooked - all 3 of us ordered medium and all 3 got blood on the plate and the bun.   Was way to hungry to send it back, unfortunately. - The burgers were not well seasoned; if not for having pepperjack on it, it probably would have tasted like nothing at all.  The prices were pretty brutal for a burger and fries, but that is expected on the strip, so not going to put that on either list.  Bottom line is if you are going to showcase yourself as a burger joint and name your restaurant on it, you should be a perfectionist on it.

wg1Z7uhxVjMl5-zkC4iS2A.text: Fantastic Burger cook exactly is at like it crispy french fries friendly waitress great selection of draft beers highly recommend this place in Mandalay Bay

oPOjtkJvk9biGw6OaEsHIA.text: Had an amazing burger experience. Of course I created my own, the first time. Needless to say during my stay I returned two additional times. Every time I got a new burger and they were all amazing. The bloody Mary's were epic, pretty much a meal in a cup. The mozzarella sticks were amazing. What truly made this an outstanding experience was the service. Erin and her twin sister Ashley were sweethearts and never let the water cups run lower than a quarter empty. Great place

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Create a burger
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing bloody Mary. Meal in a cup

u4tUnQtLu7ZTW7jJ0j6tLA.text: Burger Bar sits on the pool front of the Mandalay Bay Resort in Vegas.  It's a convenient restaurant that has the typical salads, burgers, appetizers, and small entrees.  It's a convenient place at the hotel.   We ordered the cheese quesedilla, which came with sour cream, fresh salsa, and a type of guacamole sauce (looked like a green mayo).  Typical quesedilla.  $12 (OUCH on the price).  A side order of fries was $5.  I ordered the cesar salad with chicken ($16) and asked for some onions to add to the salad.  The salad was nicely prepared, but the salad dressing tasted a bit cheap and bland.  I only ate half of the salad.  Best thing of the meal was the great customer service from Heather.  She really took the time to be patient with our tables and she was very helpful throughout the meal!  Thanks a bunch!  Food Grade:  C Service Grade:  B+ Worth the money Grade:  C Overall Impression Grade:  C

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cesar salad with requested onions

fxYReVaaW4V0kTxhLxFDQA.text: Not worth the money just a regular burger nothing special trust me  ....Gordon Ramsey is much better

DmcN-hMAa2Sjocyscl0pwQ.text: I enjoyed this restaurant, they had good food and a nice selection but I hated how small and cramped it was. Maybe that's considered part of its charm but not in my book. I recommend getting the zucchini fries or poblano poppers. I got the "Low Carb" burger which was very good and I appreciated an alternative to a bun was available. The vibe of this restaurant was more "food chainy" so I wasn't too excited about it. I think going to Vegas you want to eat at places with a lot of character and this just didn't make the cut. It felt very ordinary, nothing wrong with the food though.

HTcocOC52wQ8O363eWGMcQ.text: Found on the concourse between Mandalay and Luxor. This burger place has been featured on some of the food channels.   There was a modest wait for a little after lunch. Staff was not too friendly nor incredibly anxious to help. After getting seated, staff took a few minutes to get in order beverage requests and food order.   Good variety of items to try and we tried various burgers. I ordered the house special for the lunch at a medium rare. Burger was seasoned appropriately. Lightly sauced. The beef out closer to medium well. A side of golden steak fries were served along side. Water refills through the meal had to be requested.   Check settlement took a bit longer after finishing the meal.   Good: fries were tasty. Burger was seasoned appropriately.  Bad: mediocre service, slightly overcooked for my liking was the burger, and a little overpriced for being away from center of the main strip.   Willing to try again someday but so many options.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. House

nO1COwFiOYVh21j6AFaGdA.text: I thought I was getting a big fat juicy burger. Not bigger than a slider burger, very dry too. The flavor and seasoning of the burgers were good. Fries were good. Waited like 30 minutes for the food after we ordered.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kobe burger
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Buffalo burger

IK_HR6cjIaVNLagbYivIrw.text: Stopped in for a late lunch as staying at the Luxor. Waitress seated is straight away and was very attentive and friendly. Ordered the trio of sliders cooked medium, burger patties were cooked to order but the actual sliders were not very flavorful. My husband ordered beef burger with blue cheese and caramelized onions, cooked to order but didnt have much flavour. Burgers are overpriced for what your getting and you need to add sides as well.

h3j_i9C-sIpdxPGqlRWEJA.text: Still the same quality meat and one of the best burgers that I've tasted. First time I came here was 10 years ago and still remains one of my top, if not the best burger place on the strip. Yes it's expensive ($17 for burger and fries) and has many craft beers on tap, with lots of tvs for booths and at the bar.   They cook the beef per request and mine came out a juicy medium burger. Yum. Next time I'll have to try one of their adult milkshakes.   If staying near Luxor, Mandalay Bay, Excalibur, I highly recommend this burger place.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. American classic for $16.80

d3duB3qV356DPoIXK0j8ZA.text: Super tasty, high quality food here. The wait is little bit long but it definitely worth it! I'll recommend to build your own burger and get portobello mushrooms and their truffle mayo!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jM5QlhmLcC9nh5UWxeIAMA.text: Burger joints are a dime a dozen but having been to Burger Bar on 2 different trips to Vegas I can attest that this place is the absolute real deal.   The burger menu here is pretty good and you can always build your own burger if you somehow don't like any of the delicious combinations they have.  I was very tempted to order the $65 Wagyu Truffle burger but my vendor who was taking us to lunch would have bitch-slapped me into the Luxor.    We started with some wings and various appetizers which I tried in vain not to fill up on.  I ended up doing a Kobe build a burger and wow was it amazing! My co-workers somehow had room for milkshakes and they said they were incredible.    For a casual high end burger joint with a full bar you really can't go wrong here especially if you are staying in the Mandalay or Luxor.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kobe build a burger is pretty good

uKXjo9ozVlFfcK8Mn9uPtg.text: My part was seated right away.  We ordered our drinks and food.  The shake was very good.  When our food came, it took about 10 minutes to get our waitresses attention. One of our burgers was missing an addition, so by the time we got it I was cold.  My burger was hot and fresh.  The patty was juicy and had lots of flavor.  My fries were hot and crisp.    Burger Bar was a 3.5 star experience.  I wish we got more attention to detail, but the food is good.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burger
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wings
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shake

WQY5FYrha7Kr1vLm57dBrg.text: I actually had a pretty good time at this place. Yes, it is a fancy cheeseburger place in the middle of Vegas, but I thought the food and the boozy shake were well worth it! My brother and I got the build your own burgers and got both reliable toppings and a couple of premium and fancy condiments! Both of us enjoyed our burgers and I got a vanilla shake with, yes, vanilla vodka.   The only thing I will say is that the food is a little on the expensive side (even for a burger!). Still, I enjoyed it so I guess that is all that matters at the end of the day!

3NxJAHPNc7oi5DolSl08bw.text: Bison burger prepared medium with grilled sweet onions served on a brioche bun.... Totally awesome... No doubt the best burger one could ask for...

IMWFTKFlVXaAYZK32M79nA.text: On the beer menu,I had to get the 3rd option - 1st 2 choices (on the menu) were not available... I wanted to try a very fancy burger (The Rossini). really good, yes - worth $65 - definitely not. Overall good experience.

HBqLVaNxRbqbHa1pnKGUlQ.text: Atmosphere is nice  I had a low carb burger it was bland and took forever to arrive  Fried zucchini's were excellent  I wouldn't go again unless i was staying at the hotel

0M3yoaX5ntwKDNjIbndA9A.text: This is my 3rd or 4th time here. Today the bun was hard and chewy, meat more well done than I like. Fries were good. Just not up to HK standards I think...too bad

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy Hour at Burger Bar

KogIOgwAQgI0Wmi1hDTwkQ.text: This place is amazing.   This is my 3rd time here and it's only getting better.    I recently had the Burger with lobster on it and tomorrow I'm going back.  The service is out standing and the food is amazing.  Great burgers, fries and salads too.    We had some liquor infused milkshakes and those were outstanding.  If your in Vegas or staying at Mandalay Bay and you like burgers then this is a must.

VxQEJlCY5K2d20xzIoEpbw.text: The food was not as good as it's been in previous visits.  The service was ok, the server dropped of drinks and couldn't find stars.  He came around once afterr requesting additional drinks.

SShCPZV7AmvogNyd3lo52g.text: The food was good but I gave a 3 star due to service. Our server was not very attentive. We spent $80 plus a tip. No check backs for refills, when ordering meal no walk thru with help with the large menu or explanations, our meals were good. I would recommend the food but the services needs help. Harmony was our server for our first visit. Con- everything on the menu is charged separate. Your meals you build your own and charged per item in burger.

AdScCYNpLcnhaOK4-q8BPA.text: Amazing food. I come to Vegas almost every summer and I look forward to eating here. The wings appetizers are amazing. All burgers are amazing and filling. Scott was our waiter today and he was awesome. Perfect customer service and amazing food!!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. must try the wing appetizers!!
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. angus burger

4-qSJrG2Whcgpi4ZhSes6w.text: Atmosphere was nice and the bartender was great. We didn't get to have a full meal but after our drinks and snack I decided it probably wasn't worthwhile to come back for more. The ultimate bloody Mary itself was great but the slider on top was horribly dry, tasteless and I'm pretty sure the bun was stale. Sure it is a drink topper but that doesn't mean it shouldn't be done well especially for $20 a pop. I also had zucchini fries and while I appreciated that they did not disintegrate into goo as some do the breading was just too much, thick and strongly flavored like frozen mozzarella stick breading so you could hardly taste the zucchini.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Aq5pMbAG9TYFHfeTyS4Hgw.text: This place was fabulous! We stayed at the Luxor and wanted to grab a bite at somewhere close to eat and we came to the right spot! We ended up doing a make your own burger and I ended up getting the wagyu burger with spinach and provolone. The burger was amazing and probably one of the best burgers I've ever had. We also got 3 different fries in our fry sampler. We got the truffle, garlic and steak fries. My favorite had to be a toss up between the truffle and garlic fries. I actually ended up spreading the truffle and garlic aioli into my burger and it transformed it into a Wagyu truffle garlic burger. It was ahh-mazing! This place is definitely worth checking out and was my first good meal in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

SgS2kVb2djCDOd3QtaXHaw.text: My wife and I finally went back to this restaurant after a sabbatical.   In the past this was our go to Burger place, as the burgers were homemade using freshly ground beef, including Black Angus and Kolby.   However, what really differentiated the Burger Bar from the myriad of competitors was the service, in particular the twins, Erin and Ashley, who were a fixture of this eatery.   Their knowledge of the menu, engaging personalities and customer service was amongst the best we have ever had in Vegas!  Which is why they had a loyal following to boot.   Unfortunately, they have moved on and our last few visits indicates that they are sorely missed.    Our waiters and waitresses in subsequent visits were not up to the mark in any manner shape or form.   They had sub-zero persona's and paid zero attention to to their customers which made for an unsatisfactory experience.  They also had a limited breath and scope of the menu, which to a couple of our dining associates caused a lot of unneeded frustration.   My wife and I actually knew more about the menu than they did (not good).   In one instance we ordered their jalapeno bacon as an appetizer and they delivered it when we finished our entree. Really? We also ordered a medium burger which came out dry as a bone and on a stale bun.    Alas, competition has in many instances equaled or surpassed the Burger Bar, a scenario which makes customer satisfaction a keen component in the "Burger Wars".   If the Burger Bar doesn't improve their customer service they will lose out to competition.   On a last note, please stop serving frozen fries, it's beneath a chef like Hubert Keller's pedigree.

sHZJhIBspm2HNdAF1I4T3w.text: I had got a chicken caesar salad and then a milkshake, originally just going in for a milkshake.  The food was pretty good, just took a while to get out.  Also, the main reason for the absence of stars, is the unwelcoming attitude of our server.  The hostess was great and sincere, as someone in my party is gluten-free because of an allergy.  She was truthful and knowledgeable that they had gluten-free foods available.  However, our waitress was not very cordial and overall seemed unhappy to be serving us. It was a major disappointment considering our experience would have been great without this problem.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caesar Salad with grilled chicken
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate Milkshake

svyWjGuHy9o_5ZxODYq-Sw.text: This is probably not my favorite place in town. I like the music. It has great atmosphere. The beer is awesome! I drink Modelo. The staff is very friendly. One visit needed in a lifetime for the food but I will keep coming back for the drinks plus people treat you soooooo nice.  If I had a resturant I want them to work for me

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bar area

aaETWNquwKdIE49VcezApQ.text: The Burger Bar is another solid choice when you want to eat without spending all of your gambling cash.  The Salmon Burger is delicious and very moist, especially with portabella mushrooms and cheese.  The zuccini fries are pretty good also, and an affordable choice for about $4. One star down for the Veggie Burger which is an acquired taste and pretty dry.  Otherwise, highly recommended.

VskmS4JmySmO8O2uPjDCGA.text: There's nothing better than customized burgers. Really...there isn't.   This was our last meal before we left for home. My friends and I shared the fries sampler with sweet potato fries, zucchini fries, and onion rings, and 5 dipping sauces. The sampler came in a holder shaped in three cones. You can imagine that not a lot onion rings fit into that cone. but, they were yummy.  I was not too keen on some of the sauces. The white bbq sauce was ok and so was the basil aioli. homemade mustard was forgettable. chipotle aioli was ok. cinnamon honey mustard was recommended for our sweet potato fries but i definitely wouldn't dip my sweet potato fries in that.   2 friends shared a nutella milkshake. soooo yummy!!! so my other friend and i decided to order another milk shake. We ordered the black and white which was vanilla ice cream and cookie dough shake with chocolate whipped cream. it was ok. not worth $8.75.   i had the turkey burger on a wheat bun with pepperjack cheese, caramelized onions, and avocado. turkey patty was overseasoned, but the overall taste of it was good.   Spent about $25 on my meal including tax and tip. A bit steep for a burger joint.

9uTlAr7IqSjSyatih4kVbg.text: I'd give the Burger Bar one star but I think we expected too much coming in based on some recommendations from friends.  I should start this by saying that my fiance and I love burgers, we go to every gourmet and dive burger place and anything in between, that claims to have great burgers.  This was to be our first time in Las Vegas and a few friends said we had to come here - match made in heaven, etc. etc.  The walk through Mandalay Bay to get to the Burger Bar was fun, lots to see!  I did some window-shopping at Lush while we waited for a table.  The service was good, friendly, and nothing exceptional but we weren't expecting that here.  The beer selection was fantastic, and we started off by ordering a nice cold, tall beer to get started.
