The chicken sandwich was a little bland even after putting on the chipotle sauce that my friend asked for but it wasn't dry which was nice.   The wings were very good but not as spicy as I was hoping for, but my friend did feel that they were very spicy. The wings also came with fries which were seasoned well and cooked well along with some carrots and celery. I did have a bite of the burger my other friend made that came with some au ju sauce which was also very good  Prices were pretty standard for a sit down burger place and the service was great. The only thing that kept me from giving it a 5 star was the bland chicken. I would return to try another creation if I am down in the mandalay our lucite area.

WsefgJ2Hwv1-HoaY884F8A.text: Had the most amazing burger ever. My southwestern burger had jalapeno bacon, guacamole, crumbled cheese and tortilla chips. My wife had a burger topped with cheese steak and was just as good. We also had their garlic fries which were equally good. If you are ever in LV, you need to head to NY NY and eat at Briad

eT4OnbK1KmSaw74TY9AV5A.text: awesome place, l was here for convention week the food is delicious, definitely recommend this place and will stop by for my next visitation

6tq2pb_DNDTKM1McrRa5bw.text: Walking through the Mandalay Bay's shopping center, it seems as if not many people go to the shops, but once you walk by Burger Bar, you find out where everyone is at.  I called to make a reservation, but we still had to wait 2 hours for a table.  It was worth every minute.  I wish they would make it larger because there are restaurants on each side of it that are dead.   I had the Kobe Burger with Peppered Bacon and cheddar cheese.  They have a great beer selection where you can get samplers as well.  They had buffalo flavored fries, but the second time I went, I was sadly informed that they no longer serve them.  Everyone I went with loved the sweet potato fries.  The chipotle aioli I strongly recommend as it complents the burger just as much as the fries.

vmv0tdxGLJ5Akk-JpIn9ZA.text: Loves it! Ate here twice during a 5 night stay at Mandalay Bay. First time they were packed but offered seating at the milkshake bar - where we received amazing service.  The burgers are delicious and the service is awesome! Well worth the money!

fZ9QM7Hd5PYoSYmpIPpRPw.text: I haven't Yelped in a while, so I'm picking one of my 27 unfinished reviews at random.  And here I am! Note to Yelp...let me review from my iPhone.  I'll have to say this was all kinds of awesome. I love places that give me so much choice and freedom to create something exactly how I like it. It can get a bit pricey...especially if you order up the truffles, but it's well worth experiencing at least once if you're in Vegas!

kVhxisBRAO_Od6xZ5UgI1Q.text: I came with a very large group, which has its own challenges.  The service was a little slow (to be expected with our size), but the food was pretty good.  I didn't think it was the best burger I'd ever had, but the sauces for the burgers were all divine.  I've been back to this hotel a handful of times looking for things to eat, and I end up walking past Burger Bar without any hesitation.  It was good, but once was enough for me.

Tr3HUN2V2cbAV0Ae7VDITQ.text: After researching for the best burger place in Vegas, I finally settled on Burger Bar and the hubby and I were both somewhat disappointed. Burgers were cooked as we ordered them but I felt like mine was dry and he agreed. Fries were pretty tasty and my milkshake was very good. Not sure what all the fuss is about. I much preferred Strip Burger!  It was nice to have a little tv at our booth to watch some ESPN, but that's about all the great things I have to say about it!

IWpbr_1IBhVdkeu7XRaYfA.text: Awesome Place!! My husband bought me a ticket to the Micheal Jackson One show for my b-day and I didn't have much time to eat so told the waitress and she made sure my food was out promptly so I could make the show on time. I had the sliders with 3 different toppings, french fries, and margarita. My hubby ordered one of the burgers and everything was delicious!! It was also a little light on the sodium which is good. Very filling and I was happy!! I will be back. Recommended when making a trip to the Mandalay Bay Hotel on the strip. Great service, great food!!!

bSW1fCfkJz0KOvB49YMjGg.text: EXCELLENT SERVICE, good food and great ambiance.  A bit too loud for my taste.  Not a place I would bring a child.  Prices are pricey!

Zsil7IzVXSvDZI3C3Ww2AA.text: I decided to take out from here while staying at Mandalay.   Good Burger!  I had the Traditional American with the fat fries.   It is a gourmet burger so expect to pay more than usual.

3eMqIXyFTw1dPFJJteOtTg.text: Food was delish! We got the sampler with Mac & Cheese Croquettes (boring, tasted like boxed m&c inside), mozz sticks (less than amazing) and poblano poppers (these were actually good, but it's debatable whether it was a poblano inside). I had the Peppercorn Burger and it was fantastic! The scoop of peppercorns was genius! The veggie burger looked fresh and house-made. And the drinks were strong.  But was it appropriate to have employees eating behind the bar? No.

XloF-Sz8z2XCvmy7ZrZjVA.text: I thought I made great burgers.  I now think I make good burgers. I had the Kobe burger with cheddar, blue cheese and sauteed onions.  My wife had the Hangover burger.  We both thought they were extraordinary!  My wife's fries were very good and my onion rings average at best.  We ate at the bar and our server was very animated and funny though he disappeared near the end of our meal and we finished with another server (odd).

LcfZcDbvqAREiGf9RySJFg.text: I love the burgers at Burger Bar. You can tell that they use high quality of beef. The fries are top too. In general I like the bar, it's classy... A place like you find it in Europe. Good wines and beers as well.

SclivHNiz7D5fjqLIX7z4w.text: This restaurant, by famed restaurateur Heubert Keller touts itself as the best burger in Las Vegas and the ultimate burger experience.  Instead this place is everything you would expect from a stuck up gourmet who wouldn't know a great burger if it hit him in the face.  Don't get me wrong, you won't get food poisening here and you won't come away saying that the burgers were inedible, in fact for the most part the end result is a good burger.  I am certain however, Mr. Keller and his chefs have never seen the parking lot of a sporting event with a charcol grille and a spatula.   First, what I don't like about this place.  The burgers were cooked like a gourmet would, meaning good for a steak, bad for a burger.  All the burgers we tried were underdone and we asked for them medium.  Second, the prices are outrageous.  You will not get out of here below $20.00 per person and for a burger, that is just wrong.  Third, the service is absolutely attrocious for the price.  This is supposed to be a burger place but they treat you like the fine dining establishments, meaning rude service and slow service.  Fourth, the Kobe burger is a waste of time.  The flavor is lacking and quite honestly, you don't need the best meat to make a good burger. Fifth, the bun is boring. I expect better from a 20 dollar burger joint.  The buns we had were dry inside and soggy outside.  Now, for the good about this place. 1) you can get just about anything on your burger and you pick and choose what is on it. 2) you can get just about any type of meat on your burger from kobe to buffalo to ostrich. 3) the burger is tasty if you get them to cook it right.  The sides and drinks deliver.  Still searching, let me know your favorite burger place so I can try.

RE7COfwtOZDun8MLCTvfAA.text: I just stopped in after some shopping and had their buffalo burger with sweet potato fries. Burger was impeccable and mouth watering. Excellent little place for a quick bite.

wskpEMmkQEzWK8mImrkSnw.text: This place was pricey ($22 for a buffalo burger), but damn, was my burger slamming.   I think it was called the Herbert Keller burger (or some other old white guy name) and it was a massive, tender and juicy treat (pause). The meat was flavorful, the ciabatta bun was a perfect complement, and the the grilled onions tasted like they'd been scooped out of the best french onion soup. Add to this the spinach and bleu cheese that had melded together, and you have the recipe for bliss.  The salmon burger was also good, sizable and a healthy alternative to a regular beef burger. Unfortunately, the delicious fries and onion rings probably offset any health value to be found in this meal.  Still, this place impressed me, as burger places can often disappoint, and I'd probably give it five stars if it weren't for the high prices.  Oh, and I should remark that the beer selection here was enviable. Great selection of international bottles, plus Fat Tire on draft. Fat Tire, son.

0GpmK66YXpI3RHP7pbN0EQ.text: I realy thought we'd have to wait for a table for long time, but we were seated pretty quickly, may be 5 minutes and that was around noon on a Saturday!  May be most peeps were sleeping in from a night of partying? ;)  I almost almost ordered the grilled chicken burger since I'm trying to watch what I eat since I'm getting married in June, but OMG, I'm so glad I "wised up" and ordered the Kobe burger!!!   It was the best burger I've ever had to date.  I ordered my burger medium with aioli and grilled onions on a wheat bun. It was cooked to perfection. I didn't order any fries, so I "stole" skinny fries from my df - boy, they were quite good! Just the way I like them. Service was attentive and friendly.   Our server really was on top of things.    My df and FBIL ordered the buffalo burger, they said it was very good though my df thought his burger could've been cooked a little more (he ordered medium but it looked medium rare).  My FSIL (Christine T. ) ordered the kobe beef burger also, but she ordered it medium rare. She said she should've ordered it medium instead.  Must get the chocolate burger!!  The four of us shared it and it was just enough for a taste.  If I'm craving a burger, I'm going to hit up the San Francisco location - hopefully, it's just as good!

qnrRnRUmgChmq4XZN1GvZQ.text: I had the pleasure of dining here a few months ago with my girlfriend and don't regret it one bit. These guys are one of the first restaurants in town to make gourmet and specialty burgers a cornerstone of their business so their pioneering efforts alone make them worthy of your business... in my opinion. The decor is rather nondescript, but the beer selection is noteworthy.   I decided to try the buffalo burger medium, on an onion bun with shitake mushrooms and blue cheese crumble.  It was pretty fantastic and easily one of the burgers I have ever had. It was rich and flavorful without being excessively greasy. The steak fries were solid. My girlfriend opted for the turkey burger with fresh made guacamole which was good, but I really wouldn't recommend it unless you have a strict diet or avoid red meat for religious reasons. The bottom line is that there are many different kinds of burgers here for the various tastes and preferences of burger lovers Prices were ok considering this is located in Mandalay bay and has garnered quite a bit of attention over the years. In my opinion this is THE place to go for a burger if you are in Mandalay Bay--without question.

rcRcInWPpQ0OswoT3bxmcQ.text: I have been here 3 times and have never been disappointed! Unfortunately I'm lactose intolerant,but with the customization of your food this has never been a problem! The servers are great. The beer flight delicious. They did take the pickled green tomatoes off the menu, disappointing for me! ( bring them back please?) Everyone else immensely enjoyed their shakes ( they looked like perfection) The guys liked that you could watch sports right on the little tvs at the booths:) If your looking for a decent burger on the strip this is a definite recommendation!

aUaDVFSewW3serMSroNJfA.text: Amazing. Simply amazing. Cannot go wrong with the menu and the alcoholic milkshakes are a must!

XE0px5MR8-NNyk1S4NHBVw.text: Ok selection of beers. The menu looks ok, but after being at the bar for twenty minutes, and watching the bartenders ignore my party, serve folks that were seated after us, and be chatty with each other, we were done. As Mr. Pink would say, busy isn't a word that should be in a servers dictionary. When the server finally came by, we settled up our bar tab and we went elsewhere to eat. Shame, too, because the jalapeno bacon sounded good. But the bar tenders' attitude made it easy.  Won't be back. Was looking forward to a good burger place in LV, guess I'll keep on looking.

T2C09IYALkl47tW4Jv6SGA.text: awesome place! wouldnt have known about it if it wasnt for a friend who yelped for the nearest place to grub with good reviews.  this place is basically a place where you can build your own burger if you dont want the standard.  i had the salmon burger, no additional condiments or toppings, and a side of sweet potato fries.  i was a little hesitant ordering it without any sauces because they tell you that it's served dry. but once i got it, the salmon was VERY juicy so no sauce was needed. but then, they also left out the fact that they bring you ranch sauce and mayo with your order any way.  i tasted the burger slider and the american angus from the others in my party and they were all pretty good. i'm not a big beef eater so i have no rave reviews about it.    burger sliders with fries - $12 salmon burger - $8 sweet potato fries - $3 american angus - $9  not too bad at all. good price for good tasting sandwiches. one of the unique thing about this place is the tv's in each booth so you can change the channel at your booth if you want. also, i can see how this place can get pretty packed because it's not a super big restaurant. it's expected considering it's inside the mall area at mandalay bay.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. salmon burger with sweet potato fries
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. sliders

40KteCPz0hrQ2vG84OZ8IQ.text: I returned again, and again left quite happy.  I love being able to pick from so many toppings on my burger.  I also like having a television playing sports in the booth.  The burgers are growing on me.  I had a twinkie shake as well this time and it was excellent.  My only issue is with the ranch sauce.  I requested some for my fries.  It is water thin.  I do not understand why anyone would want that.

OZyYwyxQuw92aaKAbc_7ow.text: BELIEVE THE HYPE!! Experience a "burgasm" like you've never experienced before. Yeah I said it, a burger orgasm that you can't get from eating a Big Mac or In-n-Out burger, but right here, right now, Burger Bar.  Can I get an angus burger on a sesame bun with chopped jalapenos, jalapeno bacon, a fried egg (over-easy!), grilled onions, and chipotle aioli sauce? YES, I CAN! My creation was so amazing with the right amount of spices and flavors mixed so well together with the thickness of the angus beef. To be honest, the fried egg really did it for me... you cannot go wrong with that!!! My only suggestion is to pass on the $5 beer battered pickles: NOT WORTH IT...trust me. (The fat fries were also alright). What IS worth it is the +$15 you will spend on one burger that will leave you wondering how'd a burger make you feel so completely satisfied?! & if the cost is what's stopping you from coming here, bet $20 on black at the roulette tables and cross your fingers for a win that'll be spent on something you won't regret!!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. fried pickles, fat fries, &amp; 2 angus beef burgers

EWH3isaItxWFok8Xi1Ziug.text: We were seated almost immediately.  Service was good, but $8+ for shakes? and $21 for a burger and a shake?  Eh, LV pricing even though this is place is a less expensive fast casual option.  I was trying to be healthy, so I opted for the turkey burger with no additional toppings.  It was good.  I'd say it was the best turkey burger I've eaten.  The burger was swimming on the plate since I didn't order fries.  I ordered a pumpkin shake w/my burger and it was delicious.  I'd definitely order it again.    The BB did have a lot of TVs mounted on the walls with ESPN and games on and guests seated in booths had their own TV.  Noise level was a little high, so don't try to have deep conversation here.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. turkey burger
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. pumpkin shake minus graham crackers

T3rNrMUF5HpjIm5mwf4DSw.text: Really good. I had the Kobe beef, which was pretty good, but not worth the $17 I paid.  Fries (couple different types to choose from) and the various sauces were real good. Being able to add whatever you want to your burger is very nice, but of course you pay for it.  Wife had to check the burger twice to ensure it was turkey; it tasted so good. Lots of TVs and your pop is constantly full.  Great selection of beer on tap and in the bottle.  Not a whole lot of flavor on the burger would be my only complaint.

W0l54f9sTF5jz3hNnmRNIA.text: this is the only time I have had a medium rare burger that was cooked medium rare. great selection, great burger and lots of beers. Oh and awesome Sweet Potato Fries

RJID3BWp0tniy1a_-RCywQ.text: My wife and I dined here on a recent trip to LV.  We both liked it but I hoestly didn't think the kobe beef burger was worth the price.  They have a great beer list and from a diversity and creativity standpoint, this place is second to none and is worth a visit.

fcXJscAhms56h4UodYJ1yQ.text: Excellent burgers and good place to get some grease in your stomach before all the drinking.  It's also a nice place to get away from all the hustle and bustle of the casinos.  It's low key and delish!

fATkAMAq2fx0lVLLIKaQAw.text: It was a great thing after the Richard Petty Driving Experience, but definitely not worth the big money.

La3nHtaQIqeF-KNZR6_74w.text: So..I guess Burger Bar is the more casual side to Hubert Keller. I've seen Hubert many times on the streets of Union Square and at food and wine festivals and I always wanted to try his food. I guess this day was the perfect day. I was craving a burger and I thought what a better place than to finally experience a Hubert Keller burger.  I must say I was expecting my server to show of their tummies and for them to look like they had a good time at a bar. So I was really crossed on what kind of burger to get and I ended up getting the classic Hubert Keller burger....I must say it was a very strange tasted. I ended up taking only a couple of bits and putting it down. I tried my friend's Burgers and they tasted great. For a restaurant that focus' on burgers I was definitely disappointed. It lacked a lot of good mixtures of flavor. The fries were ok too. The sauces that they gave you were good. The servers were pleasant and nice. They were accommodation especially when the burger came out to be the wrong temperature. You would think they would have it down because it is a burger bar. I guess everyone has their slip once in a while. None the less, they were very nice about it and the manager gave him a whole new plate.

GPhBQOnJHwrg0iCSUusclg.text: Went with 6 people. Basic score for the group is 6 out of 10. What about the cheap frozen fries?  Shakes are good. Burgers are ok but quality doesn't match the price. Very good service.

BpfI52E3JkNIqE_6lxih5A.text: Little brother and I had dinner at Hubert Keller's Burger Bar at the Mandalay Bay Resort last night.  We both had the Buffalo Burger with bleu cheese (you can get a Chef's burger or "build your own").  I had a toasted sesame seed bun and my brother had the toasted plain bun.  I have to say that it was a REALLY tasty burger.  The other ingredients (lettuce, red onion, and tomato) were unremarkable but let the meat stand out.  The Skinny fries were unremarkable but I did find myself nibbling at my brother's sweet potato fries which I actually liked better than the Skinny fries (and I don't normally prefer sweet potato fries).  We were seated immediately (didn't like our table and were shown to a booth without hesitation by the hostess) and our server appeared right away to take our drink orders (lots of beer to choose from).  Drinks arrived quickly and our orders were taken efficiently and all of our menu questions were answered cheerfully with enough detail for us to decide.  The servers all around seemed like they like to work there; she checked on us peridocially but didn't seem intrusive.  The place had the up-beat vibe of a sports bar (screens all over the place including a small flat-panel in our booth) and the buzz that comes with a lot of tourists--it's Vegas, after all--oh, and there were a couple of crying kids but we were too into our food so they were drowned out plus it's so big, asking to be moved should not be a problem.  I would like to go back, or maybe hit the Burger Bar in my hometown, to try the Rossini burger: for $60.00 you get Kobe beef, sauteed foie gras, shaved truffles, Madeira sauce, on onion bun.

m7DCQ9IJkhozmgEywBwyXg.text: My husband and I came here for lunch due to a friend's recommendation.  We liked it so much we returned the next day!  Day One: Hubs - peppercorn burger and fat fries Me - black angus burger with peanut butter and bacon, zucchini fries Beers - Abita Amber, Dogfish Head Indian Brown, Dogfish Head Palo Santo Marron  For me, the best things on the menu were not the burgers, although they were tasty.  The zucchini fries were delicious and amazing - hot with a crispy coating.  As Oklahomans, where decent beer cannot even enter the borders, we appreciated the extensive and tasty small brewery beer selection.  Day Two:  Hubs - same as Day One (not so adventuresome, or maybe he just really liked it), Black and White milkshake (vanilla ice cream, cookie dough, chocolate whipped cream) Me - black angus with proscuitto and mozzarella cheese, zuc. fries,  custom milkshake with vanilla ice cream, oreos, and caramel sauce.    I rarely, and by that I mean almost never, eat to the point of pain.  The milkshake was worth it.  In fact, I was tempted to keep eating it despite feeling like I just might throw up from fullness.   We enjoyed everything we ate, had good service, and found the quality for price point to be high given the crappy overpriced offerings in the casinos.

Oee5S00waZ4FBbb_SB53Uw.text: The concept appeared new and the food looked good, but I dont know we never got to try it.  I already had this place scoped out before our vacation to Vegas... I had actually thought it was inside Mandalay Bay... I didnt know 'Mandalay Place' existed (Its a interior corridor between Luxor, where we stayed, and Mandalay Bay with restaurants and shops). I was looking forward to building a juicy burger and adding some toppings with a little extra heat and flavor in them and devouring it with some sweet potato fries.  We were seated... hostess was nice... I guess. The crowd was a little obnoxious and the waitresses seemed a little prude (in their short shorts, small tops, and platform boots).. and this was lunch time. We had about 4-5 minutes of looking over the menu when a gentl... guy came over (not sure if he was our waiter or busser.. he had a full lenth apron on). He didnt introduce himself as our waiter, didnt ask if we had been there before, didnt go over anything on the menu... just took our drink orders... Well, he did bring those back... and left again! This had been at least 10 minutes since we plopped our buns in the booth ( with a tv showing sports... news) The dude made no mention still if he was our waiter or not, just dropped off the drinks and left. Still didnt ask us if we've had time to go over the menu, or if we had any questions. Meh, it was already past the point of no return... I could tell already what the service was going to be like. We had seen other tables being serviced, and plenty of other employees walking past us... we were close to the rear/kitchen, probably noticing we hadnt really been helped, but kept on moving (like I said, I thought this place was a little.... ya know).  So 15 minutes, Im sure had past. My fiancee and I looked at each other, knew what one was thinking, got up, and left.  I swear I heard our dude holler across the restaurant, "Hey guys come back". Maybe that's what I wanted to hear so I could turn his way and....  Oh how I wanted a burger from here... Maybe next time. For now, One Star

XNpqP4cEvbk2NV4fFv8LAQ.text: My wife and I came here for lunch while in town for our honeymoon. The place was fairly crowded, but we chose to sit at the bar (I never mind doing this at a burger place, because the service always seems to be faster). My wife had already grabbed sushi earlier, so this meal was all me. I spotted the Spicy Lamb Burger in the bottom corner of the menu, and was not disappointed. The combination of spicy ketchup, perfect medium rare lamb, so thick my wife had trouble taking a bite, and the soft ciabatta bun (most places have ciabatta that's too crunchy for me), made for a wonderful lunch. The fries were done well, but not superior to other fries I've had. I was so full from the burger that I forgot to order a Nutella shake for desert. Our bartender was friendly, we talked Halloween costumes (my wife had just picked up a sailor outfit and tutu at Frederick's, right across the way from Burger Bar). My only complaint is that I had asked for a Coca-Cola, the only have Pepsi, so I ordered a Sprite and was brought... a Pepsi. Barely a complaint at all, I didn't bother correcting the order, but a tiny bit irritating. The food came exactly as ordered however, so it was a good experience overall.

5n8-JaVw2bu-BR245J6rkg.text: After throwing my money away on the slots and blackjack tables, i said lets spend some serious money on some good greasy food.  That's just what I did..ordered the Kobe Burger and for 16 bucks thought "this better be fucking good"  well it was..and more..I cannot describe how good it was without curling up in a ball on the floor and crying, the meat was like buttah(I ordered it medium rare) and I added carmelized onions, sauteed oyster mushrooms and some pepper jack cheese.. Every bite was like the first and by the time I was finished I felt like lighting up a cigarette...lol..and I don't even smoke!

RHuPzWzI0C24K5FgpAbLSA.text: Love of my life, you are not a person. You come in the form of a burger. And you reside here, so very far away from me. ::Single tear:: This was the last place I ate during my first trek to Sin City, and what a way to end the trip. The menu is fantastically huge, with all kinds of goodies to pile onto your Burger. And when I say "your burger", it truly becomes YOUR burger, because you make it what you want. Care for some chipotle aioli? Go for it. More of a grilled onion person? Be my guest? Oh, no, you say you want CARAMELIZED onions instead? They have those too! I mean, portabellos, spinach, fried egg, bacon.... peanut butter?? So many different reason I need to get back there. It's a shame that my tummy and pain threshold are not as strong as I would like them to be, otherwise I would have added one of the yummy-sounding milkshakes to my order as well. What's so special about a milkshake? Well, the fact that they have a list of shakes with alcohol in them is pretty friggin' special to me, so back off. :) Perfectly done, medium Angus beef with Swiss cheese, sprouts, avocado, mushrooms and aioli.... this is called "The Ali".... at least in my head. Oh. Em. Gee. Love love LOVE on a bun. Do it. You know you want to!

u7WBhReb9Rj-uvSKJ3YNhQ.text: Great burger place. I don't eat beef so I opted for the veggie patty which was huge and delicious. The toppings they have available seemed never ending and the waiter even suggest a beer for someone like me who doesn't like beer. I would definitely eat here again. Yum!

-CLx4OLVSlCU3KkwkbdKVg.text: I had the lobster burger with sweet potato fries.  It was pretty good.  My burger was cooked medium and came out with just the right pinkness for me.  It was kind of hard to eat because the burger was stacked pretty high.  The sweet potato fries were good as well, but I've had better.  Everyone in my party enjoyed their burgers, but I don't see us coming back.  It's a pretty pricy place for burgers...and maybe my taste buds aren't refined enough, but I enjoy a regular burger grilled at home just as much.

OvPLqVAoIljulpQLJwFZPw.text: What the hell have I been eating my entire life that people call Burgers and Milkshakes? Hubert Keller totally redefined my definition of a tasty burger.. Also, that Nutella Milkshake is best milkshake I have ever tasted.. Hell, this place is such a good burger joint and being all the way from Texas I'm willing to take the flight back JUST for this place..

yJ7ra_Zwo7Rp-K1MTEi3Bw.text: A concept table service burger joint plus full bar in the shopping zone of Mandalay Place, from chef Hubert Keller of Fleur-de-Lys fame.  The concept is that you choose a base burger (3 kinds of beef, lamb, turkey, garden, etc), one of five buns, and then pile on your choice of about 40 toppings at extra cost, ranging from homemade beet pickles to a half lobster or a fried egg.  The $60 Rossini burger (with foie gras, sliced black truffles, and madeira sauce) is something to try at least once and the $16 regular Kobe burger is good too.  Knowledgeable and courteous waitstaff, great ingredients.  A real temple of burger-dom.  Only two reason for four stars instead of five are: 1) bar concept though ineeds work and better mixed drinks (but does have 24 beers on tap); and 2) prices a little high, and really, after all that it's still a hamburger.

yhpwndYcaPbnihBm3ROBRQ.text: I've heard alot of good reviews about this place, so over my last Vegas weekend trip we came here to eat dinner. The wait took FOREVER, the service was good, but I think the food is overrated.  Maybe, it was because I was really tired, or ordered the wrong item, but my burger was alright. Nothing special about it, tasted pretty plain. Maybe next time I'll order something else.

WPBMPAzPqrR8mMRtKe9dXw.text: For a celebrity chef's burger restaurant it was very disappointing! Had sliders and they were poor to fair. First order arrived cold and sent it back - refire was cold too! Tasted pre made and industrial. A disappointment and I just had a simpler from the happy our menu. Glad I was out only 10 bucks for my sliders and a beer. Again, disappointing !

F-DB9tvywrpGfjG4oq8dcg.text: Every Tuesday I am in Vegas, I make the long trek down to Mandalay Place and eat at my favorite burger joint. The staff is amazing. The food is off the charts. Love the American Kobe burger. Ciabatta bun just soaks up all the juices coming out of the beef. I have had the best skinny fries here and some amazing onion rings. The american kobe isn't the cheapest option on the menu but it is worth every penny. the toppings take up a nice piece of real estate on the menu and have almost anything you would want on a burger, even a lobster tail to turn your burger to the surf and turf. amazing place and hot hot hot bartenders.

EjFXfmXNOKwdU0qwm6yccA.text: This place is amazing! I am saddened that I have to give only 4 stars because my server was such a snob. Otherwise it would have been perfection.  Thanks for all of the tips from everyone. I ended up getting the Kobe burger with pepper jack cheese, avocado, grilled onion, jalapeno bacon with Truffle Mayo. OMG- this was the best burger I have ever had.   I also had the skinny fries and ordered the sauce sampler (5 choices) with: Basil Aioli, Truffle mayo, White BBQ Sauce, Spicy Ketchup and Chipotle Aioli. Let me tell you that they were all very good sauces. But that Truffle Mayo is so good I think I could just drink it out of a glass. Not a joke!   I also ordered the Beer Sampler of course. I can't remember all of the names of beer that I got, except I did get Stella Artois, and the Sin City beer.  This was really cool and I loved all of the beer I chose.  Everyone at my table loved this experience. We would have stayed for dessert but our waiter the snob seemed like he wanted us to leave. So that is exactly what we did. So much for my Nutella Milkshake and Chocolate Burger. Maybe next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kobe yumminess!!
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beer Sampler
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

U0uricSQ8o3q1pe0LQOfIg.text: Two words: Lamb Burger!   I. Just. Can't. I'm the kind of girl that loves to eat a burger than a salads not that salads aren't yummy, just a different kind of yummy. You gotta try the fries sample with reg fries, sweet potato and zucchini fries, yum!   Also, no taking the burger to go, you gotta experience the whole burger there, or else it won't taste the same!

W4uONYElH9CqKPPkpJr03w.text: Came here here for date night around 6 pm on a Sunday.   The interior is bigger than what it looks like from the outside. The side booth we were sested in had a TV inside the wall so if you don't want to talk to your dining companions there's always that haha! I forgot what the exact name of our appetizer was but the way our waitress explained it made it seem totally different than what I was expecting. It basically tasted like a jalapeno popper that came with a side of garlic aioli. The size was really small though.   I ended up ordering the baguette burger and added jalapeno bacon. It's served on what looks like a metal cafeteria lunch tray which I thought was cute and unique. My burger wasn't bad but it wasn't great. The jalapeno bacon was chewy and it didn't taste any different than regular bacon. The baguette was also a bit tough, making it hard to eat. The side of skinny fries  tasted average but there was definitely a lot of them! The best part was how perfectly the meat was cooked. My boyfriend and I both got ours medium and both were cooked just right. I swear my boyfriend ate his in about 10 min because he didn't want to put it down!   What makes a burger for me is mostly the toppings, which this one didn't have much of. But if you're all about the meat then I'm sure you'll enjoy this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baguette burger with skinny fries
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

x1KpC3sZSBxMq5kBuE9UaQ.text: Awesome burgers!  We tried it out one night while in Vegas and it was so good we went back the same travel week.    Harmony and Jessica were fabulous Servers!  Cheers to Burger Bar!

Rx64WZQxTDTHza5c2Uw9hg.text: This place is so under rated. If you want to go to a nice place for a good burger this is the place. The service is great and the burgers are freshly made to your liking. Oh and the Jalapeno Margarita is so good. Great service from Harmony & Jessica (We went twice during our stay in Vegas)

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

OXtD88etM6Af3rxru-9NZQ.text: I can't believe I waited so long to try Burger Bar.  But then again anything worth having is worth waiting for.  This Hubert Keller establishment is less expensive than his other restaurants.  Since, I enjoyed his Fleur burger when I went to Fleur a few months ago, I had to get a similar burger at Burger Bar.  An old friend raves about the Nutella milkshake and he knows how much I love Nutella so eventhough I'm lactose intolerant, I had to get a Nutella milkshake.   It came before my meal came so I was basically having dessert before entree - and there's absolutely nothing wrong with that.  I was instantly addicted to it.  My friend had to pry it from my tiger claws.  It's a chocolate and Nutella milkshake with chocolate whipped cream topped with whole hazelnuts.  Definitely the best milkshake ever!!!  I got the Rossini burger (Kobe beef, foie gras and black truffles on onion bun) with Skinny Truffle fries.  It's $60 but you have to consider the fact that you're getting the best burger you could ever have plus, it includes fries and dessert!  Fleur charges the same price for  the same burger but your dessert won't be free!  So, for what you're getting, it's definitely worth the price.  The friend copied what I got except he had Fat Truffle fries.  The Skinny and the Fat fries were equally good.    The free dessert that came with our Rossini burgers, we got a white burger and a chocolate burger.  The white burger has cheesecake with fruits on a Krispy Kreme doughnut.  The chocolate burger has a Nutella fudge "patty" with passion fruit gelee "cheese", kiwi and strawberries.  They were good but I'm biased towards anything with Nutella so the chocolate burger was a clear favorite.  The service was excellent as well.  Our server Gina checked on us from time to time.  She remembered having a Yelp event there a month ago.  It was an awesome first experience for me and I want more Nutella milkshake!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nutella milkshake with Frangelico
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Double that Nutella milkshake! Yeah, it&#39;s that good
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Build your own burger: Angus, foie gras, perigord truffle on ciabatta. With truffle fries

Dr8DiPIdWMg_AGqPcoFT7A.text: Burger Bar is On-The-Strip-Dining, with that being said, it's really one of the better dining options to consider when you're on the south end of the Vegas Strip. The burgers are decent, and the prices are fairly reasonable.   FOOD The burger choices on the menu appeal to a variety of tastes. There's also the option to create your own burger masterpiece with an array of condiments, buns, and patties if none of the menu choices don't appeal to your belly.   On my last visit, I kept it simple and ordered the American Classic  (AC). The AC is a basic cheeseburger with onions, lettuce, tomatoes, a pickle, and bacon. It also comes with a good amount of crispy skinny fries. I ordered my burger to be cooked at medium-rare, but it was just too rare for my preference -- medium-well might be a better option.   SERVICE I've been here on a number of different occasions, and this place is always packed. When I arrived on a Saturday afternoon, before dinnertime, the restaurant was already filled with diners. You can choose to ride those hunger pangs and wait for a table, or grab an empty spot at the bar be served immediately. The bar service is fine, but I would've preferred sitting at a booth or table.  OTHER The restrooms are located outside of the restaurant, and it's kind of a long trek just to get there no matter if you exit the restaurant from the front or back.  OVERALL A decent dining choice located inside The Mandalay Bay, but I would check if it's possible to make a reservation in advance.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. American Classic.

UAk0Mm6s9W2qTDaLd_GzQw.text: I have been to this place each time I'm in Vegas (I'm from LA) and it's so good each and every time! I always get the turkey burger and fries but I've also had the onion rings and fried zucchini which is so good! It's a must when in LV!

UiWQ1743miRvSemEvrNGpQ.text: Came with a group for dinner (Burger for dinner, really?). However, I got the $24 Huber Keller burger (Buffalo meat, Caramelized onion, baby spinach and blue cheese on a Ciabatta Bun. Served with red wine and shallot sauce) and a side of onion rings (substitute for skinny fries) and it was the best burger I ever had - hands down.  With a glass of red wine - heaven.

RhGpIGnhfqkaNMSGDg8hRg.text: Arrived 45 minutes before they are scheduled to close. People were ordering food and eating. They stated that they are closed. We informed the hostess that it stated they do not close until 45 minutes, she just stated that they are close and referred us to another restaurant. Don't waste your time.

rxis4DcYNmZvLWNDQMb6QA.text: It's been a while since I gave 5 stars but this place rocks! We had just arrived to Las Vegas and checked into the Mandalay Bay hotel and were starving. Looking through the hotel guide this place caught my eye as the beer selection looked sweet, boy was it! I would guess easily a couple dozen draft beers on tap ranging from local microbrews through the great mid-sized breweries like Sierra and Firestone all the way across the pond to Guinness and Duvel. Over a hundred bottled beers to choose from as well. I settled on a Victory IPA from Hop Devil brewery, a tasty adult beverage for sure! Nice and lip puckering bitter with a taste of German malts rounding out at 6.7abv.    Now for food, ordering a burger was a no brainer. After all the place is called burger bar right? I went for the "Perfect 10", a huge free range beef patty that was BBQ marinated and perfectly cooked with smoked gouda cheese and caramelized onions served on a pretzel bun. YUMMY!  Man this one hit the spot like a cannon! Highly recommended.  The burgers are pretty pricey but they come with a good portion of tasty shoestring french fries and this is Vegas...    Burgers and beer, gotta love it.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half the taps... lots of beer
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#39;Perfect 10&#34; close up
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The &#34;perfect 10&#34;

f2TXKlbhff2sAr3DLOMOYA.text: I think it might be time for Hubert to schedule his departure from the Luxor and his arrival to Aria or Cosmo.   We made the mistake of dining at Holstein's, which I absolutely loved the first time we visited last year.   What makes Burger Bar a 4 star dining experience for us is actually overlooked quite often by Yelpers like me. I have been to Burger Bar in Vegas 3 times, SF 5 times and both locations offer exactly the same quality, the same freshness, flavors are identical each and every time. Consistency is clearly the end result of hard work, dedication and a high level of execution.   I decided to add some additional options to my burger this go around and I am glad I do. I typically order up the same things, but this time, I added grilled onions, which were cooked to perfection and tasted delicious atop my burger.   I also ordered up a Virgin strawberry mojito and damn was it good!  I think I just wanted to give Hubert and his team another 4 star review to remind them that their dedication is noticed and that I love em, even if we have to visit this particular hotel to see them.

57f3OqUJa9CWj_urRQXO4g.text: Much better experience this time...I went back with the below Yelper..Joe.  And this time we were seated and waited a shirt time for someone to assist. It wasn't busy and the food was AMAZING. ...  so the experience has increased 2 fold which is good...

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My lunch
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Look how tall!
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Custom pumpkin spice milkshake

PehTb5BvGJNBxy5gZBDJKA.text: Absolutely, over the top service! My husband and I went to Las Vegas this weekend and this was the first place we went to eat. Our server was super friendly and the food was wonderful! The second evening we were their we stoped in to grab just a beer. Normally servers treat you poorly if you don't order food too, but not ours! She was super friendly and even offered me samples of other beer options! This place was over the top, thank you for marking our trip that much more enjoyable!!

-HRA6W9WC88oyJiAgcaniA.text: I have been here twice already and for the second time recently on my last trip to Vegas over the summer. Each time that I have gone, we were seated right again, but then again both times were on weekdays when it tends to be less busy. Overall, I like being able to sit at a booth because of the comfort level, as well as the tiny tv on the wall that allows you to catch up on the latest sports scores, news, etc. I like that at Burger Bar you can create and customize your own burger instead of picking a burger and asking for them to take off ingredients you don't like. At my last visit, I decided to go big or go home and went with the Kobe burger on a sesame bun. Alongside with it I had to go with some pepper jack cheese, as well as BACON! Anyone that knows me knows that if bacon is on the menu, 9 out of 10 times I will order it jeje and this time was no different. Last but not least, I had to get some truffle fries to go along with my customized burger. The burger was super juicy and the meat was cooked perfectly. Can't wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Customized Kobe Burger on sesame bread with bacon and pepper jack cheese. Also, a side of truffle fries #yum

CfFOcMEaVxBlKnY23GNcdQ.text: Tried the lamb burger, it was freshly ground and very tasty. Very creative presentation in a pita with tzatsiki sauce. Also had the skinny sweet potato fries and a side salad. Fast and attentive service, they refilled my iced tea three times without me asking. Would definitely eat here again.

PBeSCNyaJjfg3mY5bO_s7w.text: Been here a few times, and Burger Bar is great.  I love Hubert Keller restaurants, and Burger Bar is his casual burger place.  I have always had a great meal, with good service.  The TVs that they have in the Booths were great for watching football.  We came here on a Sunday late morning, and with football and pitchers of beer, this meal made for a great Sunday Funday.  You can't really go wrong with your selection, as long as you put on the burger what you like.  Great idea, great food, great service, great atmosphere.

p3RXF-BaePYvl7nFJtaE6Q.text: My experience here was great. I had the grilled chicken burger and it tasted great. The Nutella shake is amazing, a must.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled Chicken burger.

7F01L7K3vOKyxkvMit7U0g.text: DISCLAIMER: I AM VEGETARIAN  I came here for lunch while craving a vegetarian burger. I know burger joints aren't known for vegetarian burgers, and frankly most places just throw some sort of dry black bean patty on the menu and call it a vegetarian option, but I find it refreshing when burger places have multiple vegetarian options for their patrons. That being said, the Burger Bar had a decent vegetarian patty on their menu. It was comprised of unique ingredients like peas and potatoes, it was soft and moist and although I felt like my patty needed some salt, it masked by the ingredients within my burger.   My $9.95 vegetarian burger included a leaf of romaine lettuce, a slice of tomato and a slice of onion. Everything else is extra!! Cheese: 0.95, avocado: 1.75, aioli: 0.75. I also ordered a side of sweet potato fries for 3.65 and paid an extra 0.75 for aioli with my fries. I paid about $24 for a vegetarian burger and a side of fries with tax and tip.  I'm all for paying for great food and exceptional service, but I hate over paying for mediocre food and okay service. I feel like Hubert Keller nickel and dimed me for a lackluster burger and I'm not pleased.  I wouldn't come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Apparently Hubert Keller is in the business of nickel and diming patrons at his new Burger Bar restaurant.

NDP-jn7oq10t-M8z_28eKg.text: As we were contemplating on what and where to eat for dinner on Friday, my BIL suggested this place.  It's located in Mandalay Place (the mall between Mandalay Bay and Luxor).  We arrived around 6:00ish and had to wait about 25 minutes (party of 8 here), which wasn't too bad since we spent most of that time checking out the candies in Lick (a colorful candy store nearby).  The concept of building your own burger is fun, but can get pricey.  I got the naturesource patty on a sesame bun ($10.50) + pepper jack cheese ($0.95) + grilled onions ($0.95) + peppers ($0.95) + chipotle aioli ($0.45) = $13.80 (lettuce, tomatoes, onions, and dill pickle already included).  Not too bad price wise, but that's for a burger only.  One of my kids (who eats like a horse) wanted a burger that included grilled shrimp ($6.00) + a side of mozzarella sticks ($5.95) that would've cost $25 to which I said HELLL NOOO (she only took out the shrimp so it still was about $20).  My burger was pretty good.  The patty was nicely pink (medium well) and juicy with a kick from the pepper jack cheese and chipotle aioli.  It was also pretty filling too, so I didn't need a side after all (because I stole some mozzarella sticks, skinny fries, fat fries, zucchini fries, and pepper jack cheese shots from others...needless to say, I couldn't finish my burger).  Maybe next time I'll try their $60 burger.  HAHAHAHAHA.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crabby Patty with skinny fries from kid&#39;s menu
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My kid&#39;s custom burger on sesame bun with a side of mozzarella sticks
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My custom burger on sesame bun with chipotle aioli

icNIW_BzD_YKNHs2-7bWlg.text: Love going here but had a terrible experience. Waited 30 minutes to get food. My husbands burger was made wrong. They brought it back and it was suppose to be well done and wasn't so they took it back again. My food was cold but went ahead and ate it. Once he finally got his burger I was finished eating. Not a good dining experience. The manager never even came over.  We paid our 40.00 bill. My husband called and talked to the manager after we left and she said she would call him back but didn't.  They don't seemed very concerned about their customers.

OAiQA_v80pUui9MUonW4CQ.text: Bar tender with French accent was very friendly and so was our waitress.  Get the Onion Rings but make sure they're hot extra crispy and fresh out of the kitchen, you will not regret that!  Do not hesitate to send them back if they're not good.  Good beer choices.  Get a sampler, but we liked the Victory Hop Devil and the Dogfish Head 90.  We also got the Cobb Salad.  Very good and fresh.

HJpDAQLEfwFOKxt8bc_QAg.text: Completely disappointed, under seasoned and overpriced...the Rossini did not even resemble the picture. The fries were stale and dry...all of the batter fried food were terrible...it has chunks of batter that is as hard as rocks.

hDiGO3HNUozuxiFuGYDASg.text: Been here several times now so I think it's about time for a review. Our waitress I think has been here since day one, she is always our waitress. I'm ashamed to say I didn't catch her name (again) but she is wonderful. Eureka! Her name was on the bill, it's Ashley. Hold the phone- she's a twin! So maybe we havent had Ashley every time but either way the girls are great. I've had the turkey burger- excellent, the shrimp salad- wonderfully flavorful and now the salmon burger ( minus bun but with spinach and oyster mushroom)- Devine! This place always delivers!

L4FzYpOLS-aMABQbkfkWGg.text: An outstanding dining experience, and one that I would insist is a "must do" in Las Vegas.  My meal consisted of an American Kobe burger with blue cheese, bacon and carmelized onion on focaccia, washed down with a Nutella milkshake.  This was a sexy meal, no doubt about it.  Do not let price dictate what you are going to do in here.  Bring $40 and prepare to spend all of it on burger.  If you don't, that's great.  Go gamble that money away on a full stomach.

oC3jvtgUcijx0I-fE3YNaw.text: Burger Bar has a great name.  Who doesn't enjoy a good beer to go along with a good burger?  They have the variety of toppings and selection of beer to deserve their name.  Yet I don't think their food deserves their prices.  I had the Kobe Burger and topped it with japaleno bacon, carmelized onions, and got their black truffle sauce on the side.  With the price of my burger now above $20, I expected heaven on an onion bun.  When the food was brought out, my heart sank.    One of my burger pet peeves is when the bun is bigger than the patty.  If I'm paying this much for a burger, it's disappointing when 25% of the burger was all bun and no meat.  Perhaps the cost and size is offset by the quality of the beef?  After all, the menu states, "This American Kobe Beef from Snake River melts in your mouth, tender with an unmatched flavor, the most expensive beef in the world for the most discriminating palate."    Unfortunately I agree with only half of that.  It was a very tender burger; they're not too far off by saying it melts in your mouth.  But unmatched flavor?  When I was asked how the burger tasted, my only reply was, "It's really tender."  Sadly, the unmatched flavor was nowhere to be found.  I didn't use the truffle sauce at all for the first half; after that I was pouring that sauce all over in an effort to give the burger flavor.  In the end I'm suspecting that is was an off day, since many people have enjoyed the Kobe burger during their visits.  But based on this first experience, I can't see myself coming back anytime soon.

5TJvcZL6jcprSEO9_kfD5g.text: Worst burgers ever. This place is over priced and just gross. All of our food was cold and dry. Cobb salad had old or overcooked eggs in it (you can tell when there is a dark line between the yolk and the white). Staff are very friendly and attentive.....but the food...GROSS.

cuF3RaZU7DIYaDzBew7qBA.text: I visited Las Vegas a few weeks ago with family and we had looked up this place since we were staying at Mandalay bay. We had it delivered and some how our order got mixed up. We weren't upset, things happen- but the manager delivered the food himself and apologized for the wait.  We were extremely impressed with how he handled that situation. We weren't looking for any kind of apology but we greatly appreciated it. It also was probably the best burger sliders I've ever had in my life. Great place

pS7anH0zXrgLr8tzdGcIog.text: We stopped in just to grab a beer at the bar before a show at House of Blues ,which was very costly,and after looking at the delicious and costly menu,decided not to eat here.I was on a budget that night and my belgian beer on tap cost me $10 as it was, so we left after that. They only have burgers, fries, and shakes. And a bar. No appetizers. Perhaps if I get a paycheck I can blow I'll try a burger from there, but the cheapass in me thinks I can find a better one less than half the cost.

18eQo6lAiTWa2FqWw1m-xA.text: Nothing bad to say about this place. The waitress was gorgeous and attentive and we both got their signature bison burgers (named after some chef). It had blue cheese, spinach and was wrapped in ciabatta bread. OMG it was heavenly. I think it was like a $20 burger but it's worth it.  We asked what their seasonal Dogfish Head was and when she mentioned Dogfish Head 190, I was hooked. Of course this beer is $15 a glass but it's made once a year! We both splurged and had a helluva lunch.

VOHqkW3j3o3mfePQvTalxg.text: Two Words: Jalapeno Bacon! Inspiring and begging to be replicated.   Otherwise, The Burger Bar makes a good standard burger. I was surprised they actually have barely any pre-concocted burgers, but actually base their menu on build-your-own burgers, which I didn't like. I want what the "house specialty" is, but wasn't impressed by their list of standbys. Also, by making all the toppings ala carte, you can really inflate your check.   I ordered the organic beef burger, which after cooked to my preference of medium well it could have been from a Kroger beef log and I wouldn't have known. So, it wasn't amazing beef. After my losing streak downtown the night before, no Kobe for me! Like I mentioned, the highlight of the sandwich was the jalapeno bacon where they cure the bacon in pickled jalapeno juice according the the waitress. The fried egg was cooked over medium when it was stated over easy. Bummer. Ala carte Sweet potato fries can be passed on. When one of my table mates ordered cheese fries, they actually just melt 3 slices of cheese onto your fries and then charge you for each slice of cheese. Hilarious!!! Fat Tire on tap made the boys happy. Iced tea was fresh and refreshing!  I liked the rock decor and rock themed wait staff. Our service was good. By Monday at 12:30 There was already a wait so, you know it's popular. I'd definitely be back if I'm down at the South end of the Strip or staying at Mandalay, but I'm not making a special trip out. I mean, it's just burgers.

UJCRlr5cBONigJcITJa-qw.text: Hubert Keller has always been one of those chefs that I admired so when I came across this place, I had to check it out. It was great. Very casual and affordable. Huge beer selection (which I appreciate). You can build your own burger or choose from one of the gourmet ones. I built my own and loved it. I tried 5 different beers, too. If you love burgers ( or just feel like having one), this is a place to go in LV. Highly recommend and look forward to trying HK more upscale restaurants

DOMHkEiQ8oXtuZMlloC9dQ.text: An affordable delicious meal in Vegas...who knew?  Located in Mandalay Place, The Burger Bar is a must stop.  From Kobe, Angus, Veggie and even Buffalo, the burger combinations are endless.  This is a build your own burger establishment and there are a plethora of toppings to choose from.  Too many mind boggling choices.  I could have used a few "favorite" combinations from the menu.  It's easy to get confused with all the possibilities.    The sides were good too.  They have skinny fries, which I love (and I think fat fries too...but who wants those?) and the onion rings were awesome.  Hubby had the sweet potato fries which he thoroughly enjoyed.  By the time it was all said and done we were gorged on all  that burgery goodness.  The service was friendly and fast, but not so fast they are rushing you out.  Oh, and they had little flat screen TVs in all the booths if you are interested in sports.      My only regret is that I didn't try a donut made to look a burger dessert.  Because I think we need to incorporate donuts into more than just a breakfast treat.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

x5nqGSk13oDjpwmdyTKd8w.text: Great burger!! There were many options as far as meat, bun, cheese, toppings, and sauces. Loved it!! It was a very causal bar setting. There was a mini tv screen in the booth which was cool. Our waitress was very nice and cool throughout our time there.  I ordered the kobe burger (australian wagyu $17) with cheddar cheese and button mushrooms and a sesame bun (cheese and toppings are at an additional cost. ) Also a side of sweet potato fries. The burger was great. I ordered it a medium well and they couldn't have made it more perfect. My only complaint is I like my burgers a little on the greasy side and there was virtually no grease in my burger at all but I'd imagine that is a good thing for most normal people!! Sweet potato fries were really really addicting!!!   For the price and the quality of meat, I thought it was a good deal!! I would definitely go back!!

KvY6HB24Cjkl_RPBq05sQw.text: 2 stars, and that is being generous....  First of all let me say that I'm shocked by all of the great reviews. This place doesn't hold a candle to East Coast burger places like Z Burger and 5 guys. Want an overprice burger that doesn't have much to offer, come here. Want to say after your meal, jeez I wish I would have just went through the drive through at McDonalds, come here. I came here with a friend and we both ordered 2 dressed up burgers with a side of fries and a coke, the price was close to $60. The burgers were overcooked when we asked for medium. The fries tasted like they had come out of a bag in the frozen food section and then been deep fat fried when they were put on our plates there was an excess amount of oil. The only part of the meal they excelled in was the cokes, but how hard is it to put together a fountain soda these days.  Not coming back.....

PAXb8soO4VhdM86MqubSYQ.text: Loved this place. I had the Hubert Keller Burger. The buffalo was nice and medium as i ordered it. Caramelized onions and some crumbled blue cheese were the perfect accessories to this already flavorful burger. It came with some auju on the side that was spot on.The onion rings were good but i really enjoyed the Mozzarella sticks, with a nice side of marinara sauce. I wish i was not full after the meal, i really wanted to try the Nutella shake, SOON!!

ck9d6kRanz2RYYFva9S0vw.text: lame... over priced and below avg quality. dont waste your time.

FP6G_haB3vhrgR_FkwkSyg.text: My boyfriend was recommend this place as the place to go for burgers; especially, since they had a $60 burger that was worth the price. I was excited! I'm a carnivore myself and  what carnivore wouldn't love a burger late at night? He ordered his $60 burger and I tried another burger.   Needless to say, I was disappointed with my burger...The ground beef had several little pieces of nerves in it, yuck, I could not enjoy my burger. I took a bite out of the $60 burger and so worth the price. We ended up telling the waitress about my burger, she apologized and explained that the ground beef was made fresh daily and it tends to happen. I do not know if that's a good or bad thing?! Fresh ground beef but with little pieces of nerves, hmmmm?! We did get 50% off my burger but I would have rather paid full price for a delicious burger I would have enjoyed to the last bite.   Oh well, I might give this place another try next time I'm in town but that's a big might. The ambiance was cool, casual, they had a bar, and tvs. The night we we went it was pretty empty for a Saturday night in Vegas, weird. But give it a shot and you might just like it!

B9wzxx70kZ3UDI6m1UVF4A.text: I have lived in Vegas all my life and every time I get an opportunity to go to Burger Bar- I go.  In my opinion the Kobe burger is one of the most elegant burgers that money can buy. The best part is I can eat like a king for a reasonable price point, in a casual environment with plenty of beers to choose from.

H2fsnm-qC1oikSiX-I2f3g.text: It was fair to middling, and not as great as the reviews I've read. I had the Kobe beef burger with lettuce, tomato, avocado, and cheddar cheese. The beef was fantastic, but the toppings were actually pretty bad. The avocado was under-ripe and the bacon was way overcooked. It was like a beautiful Italian sports car with a bunch of stupid bumper stickers on it (think "COEXIST" and Calvin peeing on something); a tremendous foundation with garnishes that only subtract.  The sweet potato fries, while tasty, were lukewarm and kind of soggy. Not the best I've had, to be sure.  The Nutella Shake, however, is worth all the hype and more. It was so rich and amazing that I'd come back here just for that. Too bad it's a four hour flight...  I'd give Burger Bar another try next time I'm in Vegas, but I'm disappointed I didn't have the experience everyone else on Yelp seems to have had.

8__5qEVZkJw-CdBPQSQZuw.text: Quite an excellent burger. Ask for medium rare, and that's how I got it. The onion rings were really good, and the wedge salad wasn't overwhelming.  Service was excellent. I was well cared for.

0ZQOs95x5gmc6oJ8bsc5iw.text: I think this place should change its name to Milkshake Bar.    The burger was good, but the salted caramel shake was AMAZING!    I got the build your own burger with the Angus beef.  While it far exceeds burgers from the Micky D's (of course), Five Guy's, and nearly every 'regular' burger place, it doesn't hold a candle to the Britannia burger from BurGR at Planet Hollywood or even the burgers from Cheesecake Factory.   The shake however...  oh my.   I think the heavens parted and angels started singing when I took the first sip.   I wanted to grab it and shriek 'my precious' and claw at anyone thinking of touching my glorious glass of sugary goodness.  Get this dang shake.   You will thank me  I would give a five star on the shake alone but it IS a BURGER bar after all.  It's worth the stop if you are here and he shake is worth going out of your way for if you have a sweet tooth like mine.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salted Caramel Shake... glorious and wonderful and something to go out of your way for!

-HVwkji6MZWm7a5wJHJEzw.text: We hadn't been to the Burger Bar in quite some time, we use to frequent it often. It went downhill but the prices went the other way, up! I got the Kobe burger and Doug got the Baguette burger with skinny fries. Both cooked medium. Both of our burgers were medium rare, soaking my bun with bloody juice. My burger was just very bland, the bun was greasy. Dougs was greasy too. The fries had that old grease taste. All the food was disappointing. I have zero plans on returning

GQG7H9QH6u9m0E4PzGze1A.text: I still have a handful of places to try, but this is probably my favorite burger place in Las Vegas. There's a set menu of burgers, but you can still customize your burger if you want. There is a varied selection of proteins for your burger, the sides are solid, the beer list is lengthy, and you can customize a shake or sundae for dessert. It's usually busy and on a wait, so service is usually relevant to the time you dine.  Our party of five came when they lifted the gate at 11 AM on Mother's Day. We had a reservation via Open Table, but didn't need it. The restaurant though was at capacity by the time we left. We sat in one of the booths which are each equipped with their own television. Service was sufficient as our server wasn't too busy. The kitchen was timely most likely for the same reason. Their efficiency also included the food runner, who was aware of seat numbers and brought the food to each of us describing the dish without having to inquire who ordered it.  I've had the Austarlian Wagyu burger on my last visit and it was delicious and quite memorable. This time, I ordered the Hubert Keller Burger ($24.85) which they were able to keep the lean buffalo meat juicy. The portion of blue cheese wasn't too large and overpowering and the red wine shallot reduction added to the depth of flavor with an acidic note. The skinny fries were hot with crispy exterior crunch. I did miss on the beer pairing as my Firestone Union Jack IPA was a little too high in the IBU units. That's my bad and I'll get it right next time. Also ordered was an angus burger, a turkey burger, the burger bar sliders, and a chicken caesar salad. I had a bite of my wife's angus burger and it was still juicy even though she ordered it well done (she should be punished accordingly for ordering her burger at that temp). Next time, I'll have to try the lamb.  Pricing is expected for a gourmet burger joint on the Strip with alcohol ordered. Before tip, our bill was $133. If the third visit is as good as my first two, then I'll have to put Burger Bar at the top of the list.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hubert Keller- buffalo meat, caramelized onion, baby spinach, blue cheese on ciabatta bun. Served with red wine and shallot sauce
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burger Bar sliders- Buffalo with carmelized onions, Angus with bacon, NatureSource beef with American cheese
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Turkey burger

4RfSq2vCgc2cmX1nHxRGQQ.text: The food here is incredible. A friend recommended we check it out, and it definitely didn't disappoint! We did a build-your-own burger with bleu cheese, bacon, and caramelized onions. The bleu cheese was really good (something that not a lot of restaurants get right). And the truffle fries were to die for. And then the shakes... they were so amazing. Definitely go in with an appetite as you'll leave incredibly full!

lsjm5ij-YIHdl3rUyUpm6Q.text: How do I feel about the Burger Bar?  Honestly, I am not sure, but let me see if I can shed some light on my one experience.  As I had never been there, I asked the server what she recommended, and she point to he $60 buffalo burger.  This should have been my hint that she wasn't that great of server.  I ordered an Angus burger and added cheese and sweet potato fries.  My friend had a Kobe burger with spinach and feta with truffle fries.    The food was good, not amazing, but decent.  At issue, when we got the bill, we had an entire other table's bill on ours.  I had to go find our server because she couldn't bother to return.  She was texting on her phone at the service area.  She barely apologized for the bill being double.    (Was she just a crappy server or was she trying to take advantage of us because we had been drinking?)  So, here's the thing.  Do you need to eat and you're in the area?  Eat there.  Special trip to go there?  Nope.  There are a lot of options in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle fries!
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Angus burger and sweet potato fries

bbNP088CL9hV6s2DXL80Zw.text: Excellent vegetarian burger!! Had it with the garlic fries and couldn't ask for a better combo!! Awesome choice for vegetarians and much better than a regular black bean patty other places offer!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VQeuW9GfnHxjXkPSKREj3Q.text: Juicy and good size burgers.  I got the mix beef and lamp burger, and it was off the hook.  The only thing is missing is good beer.  If you are burger guys then this is a must visit place.  My last comment will be burger, burger and good burger.

OaX0ILEts3FeFadZM75Hpg.text: Place is pretty nice and clean first time here didn't thought the place go way back to the end. Pretty decent amount of tables and a long bar. Me and my friend came here for quick bite the service is quite long waited roughly 30-35mins for the food. We ordered a grill chicken burger and the black angus burger. Everything was ok hostess were nice and our server is ok I guess. The issue was with my order I req no pickles, when the food came everything looks good when I cut into the burger in half ate it I was ok then start finishing the half and in the middle of it I was like it kinda taste bland so when I finish it because I was so hungry I said wait there's no dressing no tomato no lettuce no onion just the extra cheese I added. Called the server and ask does my burger comes with anything else like lettuce or something she was like YES IT SHOULD BE ON THE didnt it came with it? (And I was like nope) and then she said oh sorry my bad I THOUGHT U SAID NOTHING ON IT and I told her the only thing I said is NO PICKLES. And then after having our food she came to ask if we need anything else my friend said the mayo that she initially asked upon ordering and when she was done with her burger and when the server came she was like oh your mayo didn't came and we were like just horrible. She didn't refill my soda just a bad experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

URtVKW67UuFYvSfb0MAXUg.text: Pretty happy with our meal here. Our server Rachel waa very nice and attentive. Only complaint is we were asked what kind of bun we wanted on our burgers. We chose pretzel bun and we got our bill and was charged $2.00 extra for the pretzel bun. No mention this was an upcharge nor mentioned on the menu. I don't appreciate the nickle and dime crap that Vegas seems to try to get away with. We would have tipped more if we weren't scammed. Overall food was tasty.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ultimate Bloody Mary- Hungry &amp; Thirsty!

nUwZS2fe_HiDAA0O6gWBrA.text: In short: The Hangover Burger was mediocre, the S'mores Milkshake was phenomenal, and the apps of zucchini fries and onions rings were good.   Hangover Burger: Angus beef smothered in their Hangover Sauce (Thousand Island and Chopped Lettuce), with onions and ketchup on a sesame bun. Also added an egg over easy to the burger. Ordered it medium, but definitively came medium-well. The sauce was fine, but the burger wasn't all that special.  S'mores Milkshake: Highlight of the meal, and would go back just for the shake. Chocolate fudge on the inside of the glass, two graham crackers, marshmallow cream, and ice cream! The only improvement would be to serve it in the glass, with the extras in a stainless steel The only improvement would be to serve the remaining milkshake in a steel mixing cup with a long spoon. The Milkshake moves my overall ranking from a 3 to a 4.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Hangover Burger with an added over easy egg on top

w96SLi-VUzcGcBEIetRujQ.text: Overpriced burger where taste is average. The place is empty and yet it took them 30 minutes to make our waygu burger. To add insult, they charged $2 to cut it in half since we were sharing it. That was a first. Don't waste your time or money here. There are so many other places with better burgers, service, and price.

CM-QNFF0GvnsPapL8Vyxeg.text: Eat here if you're not in a rush. Otherwise, I found the burgers to be delicious. Meat was of quality and wasn't oozing with oil, which makes me not feel so guilty. They also have a variety of healthy options. Whatever you do, get any of their fries and try them with any of their aioli sauces. The garlic aioli was so good with my fries and went well with my burger as I am not a ketchup gal.   Service - it was nook on a Sunday and it was barely half filled up. Service was way slow and it took even longer to get our food. Waiters were nice though.  In all, wouldn't go out of my way for Burger Bar but if I were staying at the Mandalay Bay or any of the conjoining hotels, I'd probably stop by again.

voISLskzow_DtPCtIX4pkg.text: Since I am a dessert junkie I mostly came here to try the milkshakes. They looked so good on the website and they had a Nutella milkshake so I of course had to try it. It was so yummy! I wish there wasn't as much whipped cream though and more of the milkshake.   The burger was good. I tired Kobe beef with the Gouda cheese and pretzel bun. I wish there was more cheese, I couldn't really taste it. The beef was good and it was very filling. I had leftovers but sadly forgot them there :(   The restaurant is expensive but I knew that since it was on the strip it would be more money. If you do at least try the milkshakes! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Make your own burger.
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nutella milkshake.

iuaPUON9dFV3ScBLdlthAg.text: Definite drop in quality since the last time we ate here. Not nearly as busy, but the service, prices and portions took a turn for the worse.   We had a big party, but it took about 45 minutes to get our food! Unacceptable!  Disappointing visit for us, but this place went backwards and there are better options for burgers in Vegas now.

bVxUqRprGnUq-HoHM00ZhQ.text: If you would have told me a few years ago that I would pay $70.00 ish for a burger I would have laughed..It's worth every penny. The staff was very attentive and very helpful.

4RXLVl59iwUfTduSsl5qQQ.text: Tried the sweet burger for the first time and it was delicious!! Friendly staff and very interesting menu. Will be back to try the milkshakes and other burgers

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LBiflkcG84KTeoKwH4WM4w.text: Igreat happy hour for cheap eats in LV. I ordered the wings and a beer. The wings were 9 big wings with veggies, I was pleasantly surprised and very full when I left. For $12.00 + tip I had a great late lunch. You can't beat that.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy hour chicken wings. 9 wings for 6.95

0CzOVWG-mZSjiWi_OdsIVA.text: I stopped in to have a 'comfort food' lunch while attending a conference on a chilly, rainy day in Vegas. (Atypical I know'!) i ordered the burger sliders accompanied by skinny fries and a glass of chardonnay. The burgers were made medium-rare and I asked for a side of the garlic aoli for the fries. The burgers were made well but pretty skimpy on the dressing; they came with a tiny 1'x1' pale piece of green with an anemic tiny slice of tomato. One of them had about the same size piece of bacon. Another has a small mushy pile of supposedly carmelized onions and the third had barely any cheese. All for $15! The wine was good but was also miniature sized. It was not a white wine glass but resembled a cordial glass, for $9! Honestly, I could get twice the food and drink for that price, even at a tourist trap on the strip!

qEuTm2FC-KPZI4lJhjPH7Q.text: Food in Las Vegas is pricey, pretty much everywhere. The burger with fries was about $18, but absolutely worth it. Burgers are big and delicious! The staff was friendly and the atmosphere was nice. Only reason it's not 5 stars is the bathroom isn't close or ideal. overall good place to stop for a good burger.

MHq9-PNYkFYU-OngYsK0oQ.text: Good food but small portions and a lack of a lot of regular condiments like ranch dressing. Wouldn't go back.

fXaXTcGmXfFDHe5AqmYexA.text: Being a vegetarian, I was a bit skeptical to try this burger place.  But when I noticed the veggie burger on the menu, I decided to give it a try.  I must say, all my friends loved their burgers.  But my review is solely based on the vegetarian burger I got.  My order was the following: - Skinny Fries: Delicious - Onion Rings: Delicious - Caramel Milkshake: Amazing - Chef's Veggie Burger: I was a bit disappointed with this burger.  I was very excited as I took my first bite.  But realized that there was absolutely no salt.  The burger was very bland.  I had to put some spicy sauce on it to get some flavor.  I couldn't even finish half of it.  So as a vegetarian, I was disappointed.  But I am sure the other burgers are amazing (as per my friends).

MTuc6lN5X-BgM25lhprRbw.text: This hotel is located inside of Mandalay Bay which was convenient for us since that was where we were staying. We didn't want to eat too much because we wanted to save room for drinking later. We ordered sweet potato fries, zucchini fries & an order of chicken wings. We didn't order a burger because when I looked around, they seemed pretty big and I knew I wouldn't be able to finish it. I thought what we ordered would be something for us to munch on and keep us full temporarily until later that night but we were pretty filled up and didn't even end up eating dinner later!  We didn't have much of a wait but then again, we went at an odd time (4:00-4:30pm). Our waitress was very friendly and our food came out really fast. Overall, we were very satisfied and will definitely eat here again the next time we're in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sweet potato &amp; zucchini fries. Zucchini fries are the best I&#39;ve ever tasted!
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken wings

bk-HkMQYW7zIVEqaWB9mFg.text: This place has ruined all other burgers for me.  The Rossini has set a standard that no other burger can even come close to reaching.  My husband and I make sure to stop here every time we are in town and have yet to be dissapointed.

qqGdI0KWV1pXbmkQC362cw.text: Good burgers and friendly staff. a little to loud in my opinion. And with good food as they have, why bother hanging all these TVs up on the wall? I'd go again
