Ill explain later about our not so awesome server....Mom ordered a strawberry mojito, eh I can make better. I had the best milkshake I've ever tasted....EVER! Salted caramel o M g this thing was the best texture and flavor and creamy and sexy and amazing and every positive word in the dictionary all at once. It took every fiber of my being not to chug it in one drink!   Now onto my burger I had a naturesource burger on an onion bun with jalapeno bacon, mushrooms, caramelized onions, and truffle mayo.the combination was perfect and the burger was juicy and messy and I couldn't stop eating it! It was cooked to a perfect medium and I've never tasted anything like it! The truffle mayo was a perfect compliment and made the burger. I ordered the fat fries which were awesome. Mom ordered the onion rings which I didn't care for...  Now onto the service. We were sitting between two side stations, both of which we got to see our very social server be extra social when we needed things. She would say I'm going to drop this drink off and come right back....after telling the other server how last night was right? The food deserves 5 stars, easily. The screaming hostess' and gossipy server take that very well deserved star away. Will I be back? ABSO FREAKING LUTELY!

H6YGyBdtp-kpLHm-Vg6qmQ.text: Milkshakes are amazing. Pretty decent burger. Our waitress was really attentive and her suggestions were spot on. Now I need to start my diet. Lol

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salted caramel and Nutella milkshakes.
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

H5ARtIZy31JehsXuwu17mQ.text: To be honest underwhelmed. The food could've used more seasoning (I had the veggie club and sweet potato fries my friend had the all American burger). I wasn't that impressed with the peach basil smoothie either. Service was decent but not special. All and all I was expecting more.

kgdp-WRvrRwimIwbbQX1bQ.text: Had a party of 20 here last night! BB management and staff were more than accommodating, and our night went extremely smooth and amazing as always! The food and service here is great, whether I come here by myself or with 18 other Yelpers! I came up with a new creation. I call it, the Shawn H. Burger! Give it a try :P yelp.com/biz_photos/burg... Angus on Ciabatta, Foie Gras, Truffle Mayo, Black Perigord Truffle Sauce! My best combination and burger to date!! I usually spend the money on Angus here, because even their most basic burger trumps the other guys in town. I've had their Waygu here, but it is NOT necessary, and I'd rather spend that extra $7-8 towards the Foie Gras personally! The Foie Gras melts in your mouth, and is like butter on top of your burger! The truffle mayo is perfection on top of everything and blends perfection in each bite. The Black Perigord Truffle Sauce was very subtle, but it adds to the moisture in the bread. You could skip this last element if you need to, but make sure you have the other options! And the ciabatta is the perfect bread to absorb those medium rare juices...staying firm and keeping your hands clean, even with all those juices hitting the plate. And don't forget to finish with a Nutella Shake! One of the best things you'll eat if you are a nutella fan!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crabby Patty kids meal! Comes with a little slider and fries :P
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Angus on Ciabatta, Foie Gras, Truffle Mayo, and Black Truffle Perigord Sauce with Truffle Fries :)
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nutella Milkshake! Best thing ever!

RM30KUKoKbuOz2XEeWbK2g.text: Great size burgers! Nice Atmosphere! Nice service!  Last time I was here was 2010. LoL And now yelping about it.

2umnsnimOV53SQrwMdvpQw.text: We had the buffalo and the Kobe beef burgers which were amazing but we were blown away by the decadence of the   Chocolate burger!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Decadent Chocolate burger!!!

9XudPCHZi6NbTVpRch3Ggw.text: Stopped by on a Tuesday night and had 1/2 hour wait.  That's ok because you get a pager that allows you to shop.  After seated, high noise level is very noticeable.  Our family all went with various burgers and all liked our choices.  The fries were also good.  The service was professional and quick to help.  Not the lowest cost option, but I'd recommend for a nice sit down place.

JSn1sBlIMDG8AJ0FptBkog.text: The American Classic burger with skinny fries is great and, DH loved the sweet potato fries; both fries came nice and, crispy!   Only negative, the first time we ate here we all got fat fries which were mushy on the inside and, not crispy on the outside; 0/3 of us finished those fries :( reviewing the photos many look like mine did but, the lucky few actual get crispy fat fries!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. American Classic with skinny fries!

iz_QimaZZ9HCRAxwm-1HxA.text: The food was pretty good. And the service was okay. For the price, I thought it would be better. I had the Angus burger on a plain bun with blue cheese and peppered bacon. I will say that the burger was cooked exactly how I ordered it. I ordered it medium well and there was the perfect amount of pink. I just feel like it tasted great but it was a little pricey.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dWGwGLhqcaYXC1iBeackng.text: The Burger Bar lives up to it's hype.  Great burgers Period.  I had the American Beef with bacon and blue cheese.  It was cooked perfectly.  Awesome sides, friendly service.  If you're craving a good burger go to the Burger Bar!

YyF1UNYdeiIFuv-jYvOExg.text: This Burger Bar is much better than the one in Union Square, San Francisco.  Kobe - med rare Seared Foie Gras Potato Bun Black Truffle Sauce  No fries.  Burger cooked perfect and piping hot.  Sauce as well.  Awesome flavors, blended so good.

IaLLMLgWYe7aDT3mY8D1wA.text: I ordered the Nutella milkshake, Kobe beef burger on an onion bun with bacon, cheddar, and truffle mayo, and our table split the fried macaroni and cheese, fried zucchini, and onion rings. I don't know if I ordered wrong but my beef didn't have a lot of flavor. The fried macaroni and cheese was my favorite! The Nutella milkshake was pretty yummy as well. For the price and since there are so many other delicious dining options in Vegas, I would not recommend The Burger Bar. Our waiter however was very attentive and split our bill for us to include the shared fried foods we ordered which was pretty awesome!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kobe beef with Swiss, bacon, and truffle mayo
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nutella shake

F6OwCxmg4qimgx3ZVK4VrA.text: One of our favorite burger places. Great service and the food is on point. A bit pricey as everything is an a la carte style resulting in everything adding up once you get it your way. Overall very fun atmosphere. Don't be fooled by it being in a mall. You will appreciate the great burgers!

9P1-TLMTS7qzkMp9nDz5lw.text: Stopped here for lunch before heading to the airport and this was definitely a good way to end our trip! We started with a wedge salad which was pretty good. Then we ordered burgers...my burger was cooked medium-well and tasted great! We asked for different sauces to try and our waiter had no problem suggesting some and bringing a little extra for us.  We also tried The Fry Sampler with onion rings, skinny fries, and fat fries...they were all great additions to the burger. We ended with adult milkshakes and they were delicious!! Will definitely go back to Burger Bar whenever I'm craving a burger in Las Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Adult Milkshake
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Build Your Own Burger with The Fry Sampler (skinny fries, fat fries, onion rings)

-aRnL1wbeTwBumqBoL32Jw.text: The best burgers! Better than Gordon Ramsey's place. The truffle fries are to die for and they stay open late. Love this place!

bQ0jhldMXnN7gFjDX82i1g.text: I don't know what it is but since we were in Vegas I actually was considering the Rossini $60 burger.  As much as I wanted some Foie gras  I just decided on the kobe beef burger with some smoked gouda, fried egg, portabella mushrooms, caramelized onions all on a ciabatta bun.  DAMN!! that first bite was vegas worthy and worth the $25. Hahaha  Also ordered the salted caramel shake and ga-damn that hit the spot.  LOVE this place.  Check it out if your ever in the area.

Hydq9NMLlHKYAUZ25kf6lA.text: What can I say? I saw this place on the Food Network and it didn't disappoint.   Highly recommended and very fast service. Delish! Order the sweet potato fries, too!

7jspzxH21K4URqKDNEXqrQ.text: I had heard about the Burger Bar on the Food Network and made it a point to visit the establishment. The burgers and fries were amazing ~ so many different options / toppings to choose from that one can go crazy trying to figure out what one wants!  I finally decided on the turkey burger with portobella mushrooms and caramelized onions.  I definitely recommend the sweet potato fries as they did not disappoint.  Portions were HUGE as they absolutely do not skimp over there. The waitstaff was extremely friendly and patient, however, the hostesses were a bit snippy and rude.

RWFHOtSdgbll0MAre2NyOw.text: This place is AMAZING!  Make sure to get the ADULT Milkshake and the Zuchinni (sp) Fries!  YUMMM!!!!!

0qee7UAk3ExlTgwRtgEnQg.text: Burgers are fantastic. Totally customizable in every detail. I had a burger with pepper-jack cheese and jalapeno bacon on an onion bun. It was crazy good. But the shakes are the show stoppers. Hands down, best ice cream shakes I've ever had. And the fact that you can add any liquor to any shake doesn't hurt. Service was pretty good, nothing special. Prices are high, but it's worth it.

ZqMV1IYBukiaX62-KAtXKw.text: Burger Bar has THE best burgers, period.  They're located in Mandalay Place (between Luxor and Mandalay Bay) and there is always a wait (you can call ahead and put your name down).  They have an extensive beer menu (I love the Framboise, my husband likes the black and blonde- Guiness and Heffy).  They have great fries (sweet potato, zucchini, pickles, skinny, fat) and you build your own burger.  You can choose from a variety of patties- 3 kinds of beef (including Kobe), turkey, salmon, and a delicious house-made veggie burger (the best I have ever had).  You can choose from a variety of buns including ciabatta, various sauces and interesting toppings (including pickled green tomatoes).  This is Hubert Keller's restaurant, the same chef from Fleur De Lys.  One of my fav restaurants in Vegas!

KfVPnoSHO-JgM3sop4eS0Q.text: This is the first time I'll review the burger bar but this has been my fourth time there.  This is my go to place prior to heading to the airport and for some reason I have luck afterwards to gain some money gambling at Mandalay Bay. But enough about my lucky streak; you're here to read my review.  The chefs who cook the burgers always get it the way I wanted whether medium or medium-rare.  Choice of bread or condiments is top notch and the fries ( the skinny ones) is great.  Service is very attentive and friendly.  Reason I gave them four stars is it is still very noisy even on a quiet friday  afternoon.  P.s., splurge a little and order an american kobe beef  burger(rare) with skinny fries and Primo beer.  Condiments are up to you(my was with guacamole).

-484oXXrAaeH-H16SWFIiA.text: Love this place.  Its not a Vegas trip without a stop here.  Fantastic food, good atmosphere and a world class beer list.  Sooo good.

MQTe9hJFW_sHbJvaoc_SFQ.text: I was there with a large group of 12 mid August.  This was my 4th time there and it's still the best burger I have had anywhere.  Love the choices, and as a reviewer mentioned not sure I can taste the difference in meat choices.  It's probably because I customize with too many toppings.  Service is always good and the shakes are excellent (Tried the mint chocolate chip this time).  Usually get some sides of rings and sweet potato fries to share.  Beer choice is excellent, over 100 on tap? Tried a beer sampler as well this time...very filling.  Every time I have eaten here, I 've had to wait about 30-45 minutes.  I did take the advice of someone that said you can call ahead to be put on the waitlist so our party of twelve waited only 5 minutes to be seated with a call about 30 minutes prior.  This place does not dissapoint...casual comfort food but quality eats for the price (avg bill was $25/each including drinks and sides).

D-FffGNDftMDE5vU-I1DoQ.text: Now, my poor rating could possibly be from what i ordered, but that wasn't the full story. I ordered the sliders which came with 3 small different burgers. None of them impressed me much, they were cooked medium which is the only choice for sliders but it was only medium in the very center, the rest was a little too cooked (probably due to the small size). The Hostess seemed extremely unhappy when I arrived with my friends and when i left i said bye, she bid me farewell with the same sad state of emotion... kinda killed it. As i was saying, the burgers lacked any "interesting" flavors despite the delicious description in the menu. The sliders were quite small and overall just didn't impress me as far as taste. Even though each burgers used different beef, they all tasted much the same. Presentation was pretty and the fat fries were pretty good but that just didn't cut it for a $20+ bill... i was gonna go for the ballin 60 dollar burger with truffles etc but opted not to at the last moment. Now im curious how that would have been. hahaha

SHOA018JHN1iXzP6RjVfiQ.text: Ate my first Kobe burger her in Nov. 2011.  VERY good and under $20!  Tender and awesome!

thzscWawUZ7KZgxqfrKGPg.text: I just had the most delicious hamburger I've ever had.  It was the black angus burger with blue cheese and bacon.  Everything was perfect.  I'm not one to write glowing reviews on just anything but this definately deserves it.

PnB4-6lIwGE7FX1gnkVO2Q.text: Maybe my expectations were too high, but I didn't think Burger Bar was anything even remotely special.  The burger I had was standard - nothing more, nothing less.  I would say the same of the service and the ambiance. I had an angus burger with the usual fixings plus avocado... cooked perfectly, I noted, otherwise forgettable.  As a table we also ordered the skinny fries and the onion rings, the former being much better than the latter.  I tried my friend's Ridgefield burger and I thought that meat was a lot more flavorful despite being told the Angus would be the superior option.  I'd say go with a Ridgefield burger with more toppings to add some kick and an order of the skinny fries to share.  I would go again and try something different and give my buddy Hubert and his excellent reputation another chance, but definitely disappointing, I'm sorry to say.

fmxcmVip3WLmLJjE1vQ0qw.text: A burger in Vegas?  Not what you'd expect to dine on with sooooo many buffets and prime rib specials available within a 1 square mile radius.  The Burger Bar is conveniently located in the shopping wing, Mandalay Place at Mandalay Bay.  It's not really so much a bar...it reminds me more of like an upscale ice cream parlor.  The place is pretty spacious with counter seating and wood booths with granite tables. They offer a wide range of beers, both domestic and imported specialties, along with their version of the 'six dollar' burger.  The burgers are gourmet style, courtesy of Hubert Keller and are actually worth their inflated price.  They use some real top grade beef...Ridgefield Farms corn fed beef to Black Angus beef to American Kobe beef...they have something to satisfy the most discerning beef lover.  Not fond of beef, try their lamb, buffalo, chicken, or turkey burger.  For something more healthy, they also have salmon steaks and a veggie burger.  I tried the Ridgefield Farms American Classic burger, which came with bacon, lettuce, and a tomato slice.  The surprise on the menu, next to the $60 Rossini burger (Kobe beef laced with foie gras and truffles), are the many condiments that one can add to your burger...over 40 different choices.  I opted for the jalepenos and peppered jack cheese.  And here, when you ask for medium rare, it comes medium rare...it came out perfect.  Also a surprise, the service...excellent and attentive.  Worth the splurge...go have one!

W-5J6SOoDrwD8f0YVvjNzg.text: This place is so good! I have a regular burger, medium, swiss cheese, lettuce, tomato and fat fries. Everything was amazing, the meat just melted in my mouth. Our waitress was very friendly and gave us prompt service. I will certainly be coming back her

e0g2q3-DjvXF16X8Z54uvg.text: these burgers are the bomb-diggity!!! The first time I had them I was drunk and it was delicious, came back sober and it was even better!!! Good pricing and staff!!! One of the better burger joints in Vegas...

et1cdNeLTXcqusswOK-C7Q.text: mmm! very delicious burgers.  i just got the angus beef burger and it was meaty and delicious! don't forget to add  grilled onions and avocado slices! the mixture of tastes is so yummy!  we wanted to come back the next day to eat! their buffalo fries are tasty as well! ask for ranch to dip.

ehrcABlDYRAUcPKWRUIeRw.text: Okay, its a bit pricey but its VEGAS BABY! Its fresh ground meat that has no soy additives, preservatives or filler.  I was recovering from an evening of WHOO HOO and needed some protein that wasn't covered in grease or had mystery "cheese food" on it. Two people ordered the mini slider plates and said they were the best burgers they have ever had! I had the turkey burger with carmelized onions, cranberry sauce and blue cheese on an onion bun...and MAN, that was one hang-over cure! Another friend who embraces the "stinky cheese", had the Hubert Keller Burger and his only complaint was there needed to be MORE of the blue cheese (but he's an over-the-top kind of guy anyway).  The skinny fries and the sweet potatoe fries were just heavenly....I didn't order my own, but scrounged off other people b/c I didn't think they would be as wonderful as they were....my loss... We were all full, but the Chocolate Burger sounded all kinds of yummy, so we just ordered one to have a little taste...I wish I had ordered my own....I am dedicated to now try making my own at home for a special b.b.q. party this summer! It was to die for chocolate-y and the presentation delightful. The bill for five people, with a couple of alcoholic drinks each, tax and tip was a respectable $120. Being as it was a late lunch, i didn't need dinner later so it really was a good deal. Some reviewers have said that its very noisy, but we found it just pub-like: a constant, gentle murmur with sudden peaks of laughter and clinking, but not obtrusive or a detriment to conversation. But that could have been b/c of the very cosy booth having such tall backs. I would go there again in a flash.  MacDonald's lovers please try some real burger for a change!

6GTFdo4tKuiY7a3QQBqDuA.text: After reading the reviews, I had to visit Burger Bar. I ended up going two days in a a row! The burgers were delicious. The meat was of high quality and very thick. I am actually not a fan of burgers but was impressed. The only downside was mediocre service both times I went. However, I will come here for sure next time I am in Vegas :)

3Ij2mSpz5W4j-Uwpw3Idrg.text: Everyone at my table seemed to love their burgers (one person even said it might be the best he's ever eaten - this was the Angus burger). Being a non-carnivore, I did not have a burger, or even a veggie burger, but opted for the Cobb salad. It was pretty good - I'd probably order it again. It would have been great but I didn't really care for the vinaigrette dressing, although I think that the dressing definitely made it feel a bit lighter, which is a good thing in Las Vegas. I did try the fries, onion rings and sweet potato fries and all were very good. I really enjoyed the sweet potato fries. They're served with ketchup but if you ask for a side of ranch dressing, they'll gladly bring it to you, and the ranch went nicely with the sweet potato fries as well as the onion rings. I also tried the vanilla milkshake and it was pretty delicious. The service was friendly, it was easy to get in for a late lunch, and the prices are not outrageous. I'd return.

kaMHRf61IdI9gzdKF4VSmQ.text: We go here just about every Vegas trip.  The burgers are really good although I can think of a few better ones.  The ability to add almost any toppings is cool.  Sweet potatoe fries - yum. Always a busy place, good selection of beer on tap, great service.

wZha61NKjSP0Ef2acWji0g.text: MAKE YOUR OWN SHAKES, SAY WHAAA?! Bomb.com. Went here for lunch and they are packed. I can see why. There's was a 30-45 minute wait, but it was most definitely worth it. The person I was with order the veggie burger(very inexpensive & still good), the jalapeno appetizer, fries, onion rings, and their special burger($20 burger). Wow, best $20 burger I have ever had and I've had Gordon Ramsay BURGR. Most def recommend if ur willing to spend $ on a burger and shake!

hoVvct7SUzDzKvnP25Useg.text: A group of us ate here during Frozen Fury a couple of weeks ago. Very cool decor, tables and giant sized booth. There was six of us and we all fit in the booth. Plus the booth had a tv which was playing hockey! I had the hangover burger and not only was it delicious it actually worked (could have been a placebo) but whatever works. Great place to grab some food!

u1dZqioHv-TmwdWQ9AsseQ.text: Great burgers, good beer selection. Priced about what you'd expect from an upscale burger place in Vegas. One thing though...the dessert burgers are amazing. Both the chocolate one with Nutella and the cheese cake one were crazy good. They are too good to pass up!

B2RPxne1xFC8TkQmbfV4uA.text: Yummy food. Good Service.  Custom burgers: great Fat Fries: good Zucchini Fries: great, and good portion.  Kind of a pricey lunch, but great place to try out.

ZAz_ztUVwGsu0mNamz1wHw.text: Lots of outstanding reviews here. I can't say I fully agree.   I had an angus burger. It was OK. Nothing special, though.  The service was outstanding. I don't think my soda level ever fell below 1 inch from the top.   The salted caramel milkshake was delish! Almost makes me want to give this place an extra star. Unless you really love it, you might ask for no or a little bit of whipped cream. My shake was at least 1/4 whipped cream.   Cool, casual atmosphere.

69zATAZoMBtcch7IFVYfOw.text: Food: Food here was great! I had a burger with chili and skinny fries. The chili was not bad, the burger was so tasty, and the fries were great!  Price: Prices here were cheap. There was this really expensive burger on the menu which my group was checking out but most other items were $15 and under.  Service: We were seated immediately and service was not bad.  Atmosphere: Not a super casual place, kind of reminded me of a Red Robin or something.  There also was a bar located directly behind our table. There were also tvs in some of the booths.  Location: Located in Mandalay Bay near Urban Outfitters upstairs.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burger with Chili and skinny fries!

AAXmZzS8n9cHRzVy-6DL4Q.text: The only thing I've had here are the Dessert Burgers.  I had the Nutella one and OMG!!!! It was AWESOME!!! I'm sure they are packed with calories, but it was worth it!!! I saw another table receiving shakes that look equally AWESOME!  I hope to go back and try something else on the menu.  I just wan't hungry my first time there.

J7vUWb680m7bUdoJxvUbDA.text: I'd like to think of myself as a burger connoisseur of sorts as I've eaten the best and worst burgers throughout the country. Burger bar falls in the middle, there's absolutely nothing special about this burger. It didn't make my mouth water, it didn't leave me counting down to the next visit, but it didn't leave me needing some water to wash the taste out of my mouth either.  The best thing about the place was the fries. I had the fat fries and they were delicious...maybe they should consider a name change to Fry Bar? They have fat fries, skinny fries, and sweet potato fries. My mom had the sweet potato fries and she said they were average, but loved my fat fries.  The best thing about the burger was it's size. It's a pretty thick burger. The worst thing about it, was that it was dry. I ordered my burger medium rare, I expect to see at least a little blood, there was none.  The service gets 2 stars. I went on a Sunday for lunch, probably my first mistake being a local and fighting the masses of hungover zombie looking folks. The wait was 30 minutes, not what I was looking for, but by the time I would've gone elsewhere, the 30 minutes would've been up. I ended up getting a seat in the bar about 10 minutes into my wait. It took an additional 10 minutes for the bartender standing directly in front of me to take my drink order. Another 10 for him to bring me my rootbeer, and then when my burger came, there was nothing on it! No cheese, not lettuce, no pickle, no tomato...all of which says comes on it, except the cheese, which I ordered as an add on. My mom's veggie burger was cold.  I will not be back to this place

AnuOSC-KMuoDJ0PgXSqXkQ.text: Muy delicioso. I love the fried pickles! I swear they are godsent.

m-Ov_YKfdKW1zOIFjkbtlA.text: The Kobe beef burger was the best burger I've had. The bf and I made this our first stop when we got to Vegas. We (aka "me") also wanted to try one of their dessert burgers, so we decided to split a Kobe burger and then split the Cheesecake burger.   We got the Kobe burger, cooked medium, without any toppings *partially because we wanted to see the no frills version, partially because we just couldn't pick what to put on it*, and with a side of zucchini fries. There is a charge for splitting the plate, but they warn you ahead of time and make sure all the dressings *lettuce, tomato, onion* are provided for both burger halves.   I didn't realize no toppings literally meant nothing on the burger. It was a patty and a bun. Add the dressings to preference. No condiments on the burger already. After dressing my burger, I was ready to put some ketchup on my burger, but my bf reminded me that "real" burgers don't use ketchup. I took a bite, and was glad I didn't ruin it with ketchup. The meat was juicy enough that it didn't need ANYTHING. I probably would have eaten the patty by itself. I secretly regretted splitting the burger with the bf. I bet he did too. The zucchini fries were great too. Cut thinner than I usually see, and not soggy at all. Fried goodness.   I didn't expect too much from the cheesecake burger. I knew it was just a gimmick, but that's okay. I wanted to try the cute little donut burger. It was surprisingly good! The cheesecake was more like a mousse, and the drizzled some raspberry syrup on it as well.   However, if I went back, I'd opt for my own Kobe burger, and skip the dessert. I prefer a good beef burger over a good cheesecake burger any day .

EsbwwEQxZodIlp8yP9MVWg.text: We ate here based on a recommendation from a wonderful worker of this hotel. Seemed great. We came as a group of 4 on a Monday night. Not busy at all and was seated promptly.  We ordered some beers and waters along with appetizer. .fried pickles yummy. We got our drinks but no appetizers.  So in the meantime we ordered our food. Mind you our waiter was great however the food service was extremely slow. We built our own burgers and all but one person ordered med-well and the other well done. We figured since she orderd hers well that what was taking so long. We go out food and but into a raw mooing burgers.  My husband isn't one to cause a scene about returning food so we just ate what we could and prayed we didn't throw it up later. I wasn't happy at all. The 2 stars are for the server.

1aXar3pP9fa-9aWMje_rkA.text: I loved it, I got to pick what I wanted on my burger and it was delicious! The meat perfectly prepared and delicious. I loved the truffle mayo it added such a delicious flavour to the burger. Define rely will be back next time I'm in vegas.

h_UewjEzFWhBkCQEwq4uPA.text: The American Kobe Burger ($16 without any cheese, special toppings or fries) was probably the best burger I have ever had, but at its price, it was probably also the most expensive one.  The skinny fries ($2.50) were just okay - sort of tasted like McDonald's.   We also tried the peanut butter burger ($3.95) at the end of our meal.  It's a donut with peanut butter mousse, jelly and kiwi, built to resemble a hamburger.  It was different and was worth a try.    Bottom line:  I would have easily given this place 5 stars if not for the lousy service (which was cold and inattentive).

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Peanut Butter Burger
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. American Kobe Burger

HxZmTg_-N3U6-ukWs47TNA.text: This will most likely be the best burger that I will ever eat in my life. For people not familiar with the Burger Bar they let you customize your burger. You can even add lobster into your burger if you want. Basically there is something for everyone here.  This was actually my second time back and this time I tried the Kobe Beef Patty. I added cheddar jack cheese, jalapeno bacon, jalapenos, fried egg, onions, ( I forgot to add mushrooms =**( )and got a side of buttermilk fried zucchini fries. They have all kind of fries at the burger bar.  I always have a hard time eating slowly and completely enjoying my food but I forced myself to eat slower than usual for this one. All I can say is WOW. My first bite was incredible!! As Homer would say "MMMMMMM MMMMMM BURGEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEER". The kobe patty was so juicy...truly an explosion of flavor. This is something that I could probably eat everyday during my trips to Vegas.  My trips to Vegas will never be complete until I make a stop at the Burger Bar. I also recommend going to Fat Tuesday for a monster drink, which is down a couple stores from Burger Bar, after you finish your burger.  5 STARS

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kobe

B8AXvZvv4yJmVJVf8wh1xQ.text: Me and boyfriend went to the burger bar after reading the great reviews on yelp . Let me say that I luved the burgers . My burger was juicy and cooked just like I ordered it ( medium well) I ordered the onion rings as well and the portion was not overwhelming . The only thing that stopped me from Giving it 5 stars was our waitress she was very bland and not energetic at all.

ZkR1MHTDfvkKKAWXg5wVJA.text: 2nd visit here was not nearly as good.   It was busy, and the wait was long, which I understand.  But they have either switched to "FROZEN" French fries or they just use frozen when they are too busy to cut up fresh potatoes.   Sorry, I don't pay these prices for ore-Ida.    Fail.

70YAe3YLwSqkNZ0xRNSZCw.text: Great, burger place, nothing too extraordinary, good side sauces to try with the fries...

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Floor

-rzAm7jq4iHrl1hOqX2muQ.text: I just had dinner but thinking of Burger Bar just makes my mouth melt.   The burgers are amazing and you can customize them yourself. The beer selection would make any beer snob happy.If you don't like beer, they have Nutella milkshakes! Yummy! The two times that I've come here has been with bigger groups. The wait for this place is long but worth it. We usually end up window shopping in the area and come back. Because of the size, it's not really the best place for large groups but it's still worth it.   PS Finding the restroom is a journey but it's pretty cool because they have a bunch of cool picture of Keller in the hallways. Oh, and they sell the coolest Hubert Keller shirt.

xTFzG8fCxpDGfeeMVBv-3A.text: The burgers here are pretty good. I've definitely had better. The price is decent for what you get. Customer service was great I didn't run into any problems. I would give this place 3.5 stars if that were possible.

tKlCBtzJgC00H-Yp8z3qfg.text: I saw that this was a restaurant owned by acclaimed celebrity chef Herbert Keller.  Recently he was featured on Top Chef Masters.  This was an economical opportunity to check out his culinary offerings. The place is located in the small mall that connects Mandalay Bay and Luxor.  It has sort of a grill and bar feel to it.  Super casual.    Their menu includes a build your own burger option, build your own milkshake and build your own sundae option.   Great it you are super picky, not good if you are indecisive!  I tried the top sirloin burger and added a few fixings.  I noticed that they had about everything you could think of to make your perfect standard to gourmet burger.  I was in the mood for a Hawaiian burger, but noticed they have everything BUT teriyaki sauce.   Bummer.  When I got my well done (by choice) burger, I noticed that the bun to meat ratio was a bit off.  "Where's the beef?"  I would have preferred a flatter patty so that it covers the span of the bread.  My first bite included everything but meat.  Verdict.  It was good, but not entirely great.  I could have settled for an In-N-Out burger.  Ouch.  Service was excellent.  You gotta love Vegas for that reason.    There are TV's at each booth which is set to ESPN and a few huge TV's at the bar.  TIP #1: If you like mayo, ask for the chipotle aioli.  It's a hint of smoky, garlicky pepper aioli (mayo).  Surprisingly tasty.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Check out the meat to bun ratio

gDCzq5rkPSx41JGbM3C0Zw.text: Love the Burger Bar, visit often and food and service is alway's great.  I love the veggie burger and the vegas vegan.. thank you.

Le1xK_gg9utFfbHjz_0mXA.text: Granted I wasn't overly adventerous with my selection, but it was a hamburger and was average at best.

xqMl3SzEvHZzJSrLvqAGMg.text: Took my Dad here for his birthday. The food was prepared perfectly. The burger was juicy, and I love the sweet potatoe fries. The desert was in the shape of a burger too. Very fun place to eat. The only draw back is that everything you want on your burger is a price.

UdQ2YskvWLdhxbwauNAcxQ.text: We were at Mandalay Bay Aquarium and yelped this place. The wait was about 20 minutes and they wanted us to sit at a table near the entrance which was an awkward looking location as people were coming close to it when they were entering and leaving. we declined and opted instead to wait an additional 15 minutes for something else. 5 minutes later we were seated at a comfy booth. They even let us bring our fat Tuesday drinks in. The atmosphere is sports bar like and fun. The waitress was nice and helpful when it came to the menu as it was our first time. She had some great recommendations. I had the Lamb Burger with customized toppings of caramelized onions and Jack cheese. The waitress warned that it wasn't for everyone and you either love it or hate it. I love gamey meats so to me it was flavorful and juicy. The zucchini fries could have been thicker cut because it seemed to be mostly batter but the fried batter was crisp and tasty so i enjoyed them. My girlfriend had the Hubert Keller Burger which was very tasty with just the right combination of toppings to satisfy. The skinny fries were decent French fries. We tried the martinis and they were good too. Would definitely go back to try one of their other creations!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lamb Burger with zucchini fries

GoQgBvgAnZ68u-9krjjX4g.text: So was looking for a traditional burger bar, my girlfriend (the yelp queen) discovered this establishment. It was not what I was thinking about but hey we were there so lets try it. I had the lamb burger, with jalapenos bacon...damn that was the bomb! I will visit them again!

1ja42L1CgJT3oHif7GNd4w.text: We ate lunch here New Years Day 2009...after touring the Shark Reef at Mandalay Bay Hotel. I must say this was the best lunch we had in Vegas and one of the best burgers ever. It is pricey but that is because these aren't the nasty McDonald style burgers. These are what I call gourmet burgers.   What is so unique about this place is that you get to create your burger by picking the meat, the bun and a variety of toppings...not your basics like lettuce, tomato, pickle but toppings like portabella mushrooms, fried egg, guacamole, etc.   We ordered the buffalo Burger on wheat with a fried egg and white american cheese and the grilled chicken on focaccia bread with guacamole, salsa and pepperjack cheese, both of us ordered the sweet potato fries. Every bite was wonderful. It is hard to find a place that serves sweet potatoe fries (which is a favorite of ours)!   We also had drinks from the bar. I had washington apple martinis and my husband had long island iced teas...made perfectly.   Service was ok...but then again it was VERY busy. We got lucky to find a seat at the bar otherwise we would have had to wait 40 mins for a table at 2pm. Very popular place so either make reservations or go at an very unusual dining time....  We still talk about this place and definitely plan to go back next time in Vegas.

TPuxcfb80R_L6-5An6MhqA.text: I make my yearly trip out to vegas for our fantasy football draft.  We usually stay at the mandalay, but I always get cheap if not free rooms at the luxor (which is within walking distance internally to Mandalay)....so we always end up walking past this burger bar.    But ever since we saw it, we visit it every year.  We should be making our annual trip soon...but figured I would review it so I can update it later with my Kobe experience.  I usually get the American Classic $12.75 Ridgefield farm beef, American cheese, crispy bacon, tomato, onion, on sesame bun and that thing is delicious.    Or you can make your own and add topings as you wish.  This burger really hits the spot right before or during the draft.  Sometimes there is a wait as it is pretty popular.  I will have to revisit and update on how it tastes compared to the burger places I've been to in so cali....and I will try the kobe this year.

d0DTeELwiIjYS0CPRsXklA.text: This place does customized burgers, and does it well. On a weekday just minutes after opening for lunch, the place was already packed with people. I watched Giada on Food Network eat here a while ago, and ever since then I've had it at the back of my mind to check this place out.   I ordered an Angus beef burger on ciabatta bread, with toppings of carmelized onion and peppered bacon. All the ingredients tasted fresh and blended well together. If I had to nit pick, the ciabatta bread was a bit on the dry side. It was begging to be oven warmed or briefly toasted on the grill. But I was so hungry, there was no way that burger was leaving my grasp.   As for the sides, the crown jewel had to be the buttermilk dipped fried zucchini fries. Piping hot fresh zucchini interior, crispy not-too-heavy breading exterior, and nice seasoning. Dip it in some ranch sauce, and it was the perfect compliment to our burgers. We also had sweet potato fries, which was good as well, but didn't quite hold up a candle next to the zucchini fries.   Prices are reasonable, and service was efficient and friendly. Next time, I'll have to spring for the Kobe beef burger, with pepper jack cheese and grilled mushrooms. Yes, I've given it some thought. So if you're ever in the mood for a good burger in a casual atmosphere in Vegas, you'll know where to go.

L7DUlSsZq4_Mj90DwKBUeQ.text: SOOO GOOD!!  I loved it!!  Juicy, flavorful burger!! I would eat there all the time if I  could. Next time I will split a burger with the fiance so we can try the chocolate burger! !

2cNKOKd8VVIhr27I9ACzcg.text: The BUFFET has bequeathed to us all many things to be thankful for.  In all seriousness though, think about it.  When "most" people think buffet they think all you can eat (ayce) and average food quality, right? Right; However, the reason I think buffet's are ever so popular and important to the epicurean theology is not because of the quantity but rather another keystone of the American English vernacular... FREEDOM.   Freedom is a very powerful "gimmick" restaurants employ [which we all fall victim too] to coerce patrons into thinking they are the captain, el presidente, la luchadora, and the head honcho of their own food eating destiny.  Breaking this nonscientific hypothesis down one begins to realize we have become a society filled of imaginative free thinking charlatan's [aka pansies] who scoff and laugh at menus containing such disclaimers as "no substitutions!" or "additional fee's may apply".  Many existentialists relate this chickenheartedness of linear movement to a consternation of structure and organization; similar to its analogous nature much like rusty shackles placed on man's progression towards lifes many possibilites.   Now, while many readers are thinking wtmfs (what the motha f'n shits) does this rambling of philosophical food mumbo jumbo have to do with patties of meat???? Well, its sets the stage and illustrates the progression and direction of culinary "fast" food by placating to society's wants and needs.  Why do you think the Chipotles, Yogurt Lands, and the Burger Bars of the world are becoming so popular? It's the freedom of choice and limitless possibilities all stemming from the belly busting buffet.   finally I digress....   Burger Bar is an A-OK place that provides almost limitless possibilities to feed your meat addiction. You pick the type of patty, Black Angus Beef, Kobe Beef, Colorado Lamb, turkey, and veggie. Then comes the different buns/breads. Then comes the toppings which each have their own subcategory like the Garden, Grill, Ocean, Dairy, Farm, Pantry, and Earth. Lastly you choose the fried goodies.   I can only speak based on my concoction. I got a lamb burger with spinach, cucumber, feta cheese, pesto sauce, and side of fried pickles. The burger was okay, outside the steep price tag, nothing was different than any of the other "made to order" burger joints. The fried pickles however were the best item. In honer of full disclosure however, if I didn't drop a couple of Benjamen's at the craps table while waiting to be seated the burger might have tasted a bit better. Just a smidgen though.   I was lucky enough to get a taste of my friends [the famous michelle t.] angus beef, foie gras, truffle burger and it was as heavy as a thanksgiving dinner at the klump's house. For $30+ it tasted amazing but probably would have put me to sleep and then a stomach ache had I eaten any more.   All in all, fun place, nice staff, good service, okay food, but a bit overpriced.

L8SM4MMZ1CBcmXyjJy961w.text: I've been trying to try this place out for so long! Something always came up and I wasn't able to go!  I ordered the American Kobe with pepper jack cheese, spinach, jalapeno and aioli!  It was sooo good!!  The meat was tender and juicy! mmmm yummmy!   My boyfriend got the buffalo burger and I think I like it more than the american kobe!  It was more tasty.    For sides we got the jalapeno friend pickles - yummmmy The sweet potato fries - a must get! The fried zucchini - for some reason, theirs were so good! And some onion rings - I can skip these next time  I love how they have burgers for the people who don't like to build their burgers and of course having the option of building your own burgers.  What else is cool is that you can even build your own milkshakes!! =)  I think this place is pretty awesome!  Both in the menu and the food!

XhgNVrqkzFIpWNkNGKmQow.text: My girlfriend told us that the burgers are delicious at Mon Ami Gabi. I believed her because she is a burger fanatic. I tried it Sat night in Vegas and sadly it did not hit the spot...  We went to the Burger Bar the next day for lunch and to my delight, it was "phenomenal". I had the Peppercorn burger. Yummy beef patties cooked medium rare with honey dijon, fresh peppercorn, lettuce, tomato on a plain white bun with a fresh and a yummy peppercorn sauce to top it all off!   Little did we know the restaurant was owned by Chef Hubert Keller. He also owns Fleur de Lys. Somewhere my friends and I have always wanted to try... it's just a bit $$$. There is a $60 burger you can try at Burger Bar. It is the Rossini burger. It is Kobe beef, american cheese, foie gras, and truffle shavings on an onion bun. Sounds like something to try next trip around!  Worth a visit. Next time Fleur de Lys or even Robuchon!

mE-NLzW4YK69wQniU2Y-bg.text: My husband and I love going to Burger Bar.  There is always a wait, but that's just because it's really good!   On my most recent visit, I tried the buffalo burger on a whole wheat bun, and it was delicious!  I've had the Kobe and the black Angus burgers as well, and they are fabulous, too.  The skinny fries are always amazing.   My husband always orders the beer sampler-- they have a great selection on tap, and the sampler offers generous portions of any beers you wish to try.   My recommendation is that you get there a little early-- you'll probably have a 30-minute wait at about 6 on a Saturday, but if you get there later, you'll be waiting a while.  Oh, and bring a hearty appetite!

tIxn4t0-QFq3cmhANJLctg.text: Mediocre burger and foodservice fries. What a below average burger joint. Any inspiration left the building a long while ago. Avoid.

ZB9a6WSgVDB-Y-mXq4QF-Q.text: I had heard about this place a long time ago and wanted to try their famous Kobe + truffle burger.  But when I finally had a chance to eat here recently, I felt it was too indulgent to blow $60 for a burger! I opted for building my own burger instead that would be like Hubert's burger but with Kobe beef instead of buffalo. I think the watiress accidentally brought me the buffalo anyways because the meat was chewy.  Overall, I prefer Father's Office burger over this one...even if the meat had been juicy Kobe instead of tough dry buffalo.

PGQxmqXER38p_oC_D48kQQ.text: Kobe burger done medium with swiss and a side of sweet potato fries and a cold beer or two for lunch.  What else do you want for lunch?  Even lunch during the week there was a line for groups, so go with a group no more than 4 to avoid the wait (isn't it always 4), there is also a long bar that you can grab a seat at.  The decor: think traditional diner turn the lights down, and throw some wood in place of shiny stuff.  The burger came out quickly and done right.  There are several chef burgers for you to choose from but than you can select your bun, your patty of choice, cheese, and any condiment you want.  But think carefully, for me: kobe beef so I went with the swiss because it is lighter in taste but salty and cheesy still, its a kobe buger so don't even think about putting some crazy topping that will overpower the meat.  I digress, the service was prompt, the burger was great, the sweet potato fries were good, the beers were cold.  Yeah, I will be back.

qO_I7wnPLCoxW5lQTjP_Dw.text: YAY i'm a fan of the buffalo burger! Who would of thought. I ordered it because it is more lean than regular beef burger & I enjoyed all the toppings i put in it. Some might say it can be dry, but that is how i like my burgers... weird yeah. We had some sweet potato fries, small fries, and fried zucchini, can't go wrong with fried stuff, so no complaints there. Favorite was being able to choose what i wanted on my burger.... downfall, paying extra for the delicious toppings.  On a side note, our waitress was great in the beginning but we kinda lost her part way through our meal. kinda irritating, but my burger was still good.

hUoZAT4gEO5rYTOt_xmjqA.text: The first night my friends and I were in Vegas, I kept saying we had to go here. They weren't all that excited.. until we started eating. My boyfriend said, while half way through his burger "it's not gone but i miss it already."   We had a party of 6, and we called in for reservations, they said it was going to be about an hour. No biggie, we're in Vegas, we passed time.   Three of us got the Kobe Beef burger: AMAZING. I was VERY skeptical about this meat. I really didnt understand the big deal. BOY WAS I WRONG. It was like steak in burger form. Oh lord. One of us got cinnamon bacon. Yes, i just said CINNAMON BACON. (They have many types: Black pepper, jalapeno bacon, cinnamon bacon, ..and i cant remember the other two)  Two of us got the Surf n Turf burger, with the lobster tail. They were in heaven. One of them got the shallot and wine reduction sauce, which she was VERY pleased with.  The last person got a veggie burger, sadly to say, i dont think she enjoyed it much. But c'mon, there's nothing better than real meat anyway.   There was very little conversation throughout dinner, which one of us had brought up, but we had decided it was due to the fact that everyone couldnt stop eating!  We got zucchini fries which were, absolutely delicious. They weren't super thick, nor super thin. The breading was crunchy, and herby, with the soft (yet firm) veggie inside.   As for the dessert burgers, eh, they were ok. Not needed, nothing to write home about.   The price can be anywhere from $12-60 per burger. It all depends on what you put on it of course (for example, lobster and black truffles will be hella expensive. Where as asparagus and pesto will be much cheaper.)  Go here. Get the Kobe beef. Enjoy. And sob endlessly when you've finished it. :D

4BQj3Y8KIB8D74yxg4pKpQ.text: The key to this place's success is options.  They give them to you in spades.  With both a vast beer and burger selection, you can come back again and again and not have the same thing for a year it seems.  You pick type of meat (or non-meat) you want in your burger, the kind of bun, and then start picking and chooseing from a laundry list of extras to pack on top of your patty.  It's all there, trust me.  They even have a few pre-packaged deals including one $60 burger.  They even had dessert burgers!  If you aren't going to be all that adventurous with your burger selection then you might be better off finding a burger joint that will let you have a plain cheeseburger for much less though.  It's about going all out when you have a burger here.

vo1ISRk8XGFtjTtWedI2gA.text: Don't go to In and Out or Fatburger, Come Here! Hell, you could even have dinner here one night instead of going to a "fancier" establishment. This will be one of the best burgers you will ever have in your lifetime. Go straight for the Kobe Burger! But there are plenty of other items to pick from if you want to spend less or try something else. You can build your burger however you see fit. You get to pick not only your preferred cheese of course but also the type of bread and there are MANY toppings to pick from. Not too many places let you put avocado on top of a burger. Wash it down with a beer, a float, or one of their shakes. You might find this menu much more useful than what you will find on the listed website. It really will give you an appreciation for the toppings and other items like sweet potato fries. usmenuguide.com/burgerba... I wish I didn't have to go to Las Vegas to eat here. Yes, the decor is very Fox and Houndish but the food is worth it.

ZC4es0wHL9klUIAVbkBf2A.text: I didn't eat a burger here but I did get one of the boozy milkshakes. One of the best boozy milkshakes I've ever had. I had the Irish Coffee milkshake. The Bailey's just made it taste so good. The chocolate covered coffee beans were also just the right touch. My cousin had a dessert burger that looked like a real burger. Would come back here to try a burger next time!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mexican and Irish coffee boozy milkshakes

6jDGcAIuoxvFuuw6Gkk3sA.text: Premium burger experience at a premium price.  Nice, but not special enough for Vegas.  The burgers here are good.  Very good.  You can even get an expensive Wagyu beef burger.  Or truffles.  Why?  Because you can.  If paying an extra $30 to put truffles on a burger, or using wagyu for ground beef, sounds like a good deal to you, this is your place!  Service for my table was excellent, really above average, even at this price point.  I was quite pleased. (Thanks Sergio.)  The concept here is elevating burgers, but the fundamental problem is it's a mashup of flavors, and trying load so many premium ingredients, well, they get lost.  And Wagyu?  Not to say beef selection doesn't matter, but the reasons wagyu commands a premium, doesn't make a difference here.  I'd give it 4* if not for the excesses in pushing brands.  That said, if I wanted a real good burger with good service, I'd come back and try the Classic.  Meanwhile, there's plenty of boutique burger chains elsewhere to compete for the experience.

7Q45dFRztXZUOGsRhZ3w4Q.text: Completely ruined burgers everywhere else for me! How have I not been here out of the millions of times I've been to Vegas?   Anyway, everything was very good and full of flavor. I opted for the classic with a fried egg with garlic fries and it was cooked perfectly and deliciously. My wife had The Hangover burger with buffalo tots and man oh man, it probably did cure the hangover.   Long story short, amazing food, amazing service, great little spot. A must have here in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

aGh7P8Q_X_nXO4fyLtcOUw.text: Chicken wings appetizer that comes with skinny fries (which I upgraded to the garlic fries for $2).  Garlic fries - rather boring for garlic. Even the aioli was rather plain.  The mild buffalo sauce was good - not too hot and not too mild. The ranch was good as well. They also come with blue cheese and BBQ (not sure about the BBQ, but I guess if you get them plain?)  I sat at the bar and the bartender/server was very friendly.

XzfVlqjkql43BM00n8M5bw.text: I wish the burgers were as good as the service. The burgers were all a little overcooked and came out dry. But the service was prompt, friendly, and consistent. Regardless, I still ate them burgers like they're groceries. Also, my friend keeps saying the fries are crazy good, but I dont see it. The chili is quite good though.  --- Sweet: fries are amazing, good cheese Bitter: patty was overcooked :(

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. These fries are amazing though.

gT4qIuZTeWXG9oA7at0lIA.text: Very disappointing. Ordered a burger medium and it came out raw. I addressed it with the server and she was very resistant, denying the fact that it was clearly cold and raw in the center. I said it wouldn't be a problem to pay full price, but I wanted the cooks and management to know what quality food was coming out of the kitchen. As far as I know, this did not happen. Their business went on as usual. I would not recommend this restaurant based on the service and quality of food provided. They didn't care that they served clearly raw meat to their customers.

F9KLtl8J5M-MzrKkvIXyNw.text: Damn, these guys got a mighty fine burger!  Mixed that with a hundred brews, and you got yourself a winner.  Located in the shops of Mandalay, it was a quick hop into it from my hotel room at Delano.  Servers: Melody & Harmony, laying down some great service with personality aplenty.  Beers: Innis & Gunn Rum barreled beer [$9, 4.0 stars] -- crazy good, but I liked Bourbon barreled better (they make and serve that, too).  Burgers: lots of choices, but I went with an MYO Angus Burger [$22.25, 4.5 stars] -- pretzel bun, caramelized onion, button mushrooms, avocado, and Zucchini fries.  Wonderful, great quality, HUGE 8 oz'er, but very very pricey!  Good vibe (people) and energy (them service, the place) -- I like!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. MYO Angus Burger [$22.25, 4.5 stars] -- pretzel bun, caramelized onion, button mushrooms, avocado, and Zucchini fries.
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. MYO Angus Burger [$22.25, 4.5 stars] -- pretzel bun, caramelized onion, button mushrooms, and avocado

K-JfSCzvMKvVPjz9p5yyFg.text: 5 stars is rare for me. I'm of the opinion of "no room for improvement " so my real score is 4.6. Great service, great bartenders, great management, food...perfect. But.....food was the ultimate bloody Mary and chicken parm sliders.  First of all the ultimate bloody was exceptional and enough for a meal. Group of 4 of us. Everyone was happy. Must visit if your close.

2PdaViYWhNxxA2xBHBD5Ag.text: I hate to give this place a 3 Star rating because their Angus Hamburger is very delicious.   The burger becomes very expensive due to paying extra for each additional item.  I added grilled onions, button mushrooms, pepper jack cheese, and chipotle sauce.  It made the price of it go over $20.  Again the burger tastes great but a little too expensive.  The waiter started out being very patient on explaining the menu.  The place was not busy during our meal.  He seemed to forget about us throughout our time in the restaurant.  We never did receive the glass of water and hot sauce we requested.  He just forgot?  It is difficult to recommend this place due to price and service.  But, if you want a great burger, this is the place.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Angus Beef Burger with Fat Fries
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1JiZ5GZD3eFiqbCq0ko83w.text: Our family went here for dinner on Monday. We really enjoyed the food. The service was very fast as well and only took 15 minutes. I ordered the chicken wings and they were really excellent.  I would definitely come to eat here in the future.

JFsDuR8y-Hbl-iS6hFDXXw.text: If you get the chance to visit this place, the food and service are well worth it. Brian at the bar is a freakin rad human being who works hard and takes care of his patrons.

QnbynfH4INQddNCDR2GNVw.text: Came here with some friends before going to a concert. Burger Bar is located on the bridge/walkway that connects Mandalay Bay to the Luxor. They are pretty pricey for the food but it's on the Strip so that's to be expected.   We sat at the bar and had a wonderful server. I wish I asked for his name! He was attentive and gave opinions on what his favorite food items were on the menu.  I got the baguette burger (cooked medium) which came with melted truffle Brie cheese, tomatoes, onions, lettuce, and pickles. The words "truffle" and "Brie" is what made me order this dish. I was a little worried the baguette would be too hard but to my surprise, it wasn't at all! My burger was cooked perfectly. The meat itself didn't have a whole lot of flavor, however, the truffle Brie cheese made up for that. This came with skinny fries (my favorite) because their fries are more crunchy which is what I prefer.   If I had an event that's either at Luxor or MB, I would eat here again. It's a great restaurant to just chill, relax, and eat.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baguette burger with a side of skinny fries

gMl3zhUDySjWFtIMRatcTQ.text: The place had a cozy, fun vibe, and it was busy, which is usually a good sign!  We ordered a Burger with Fries and a Milk Shake and a Caesar Salad.  We were in a very big rush, and thus I opted to keep the salad I received, even though it was a Cobb (which was tasty!) - that was served to me.  All of the food was great, though, and I opted not to mention this to the server, again, because we were in a big rush, and didn't want the wait.  Also, the pricing was reasonable.  We'd return - yep!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cobb Salad
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Interior
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burger and Fries

2w1uiqn_KMqnyEfxAEhoXQ.text: The food was good, and the desert burger was fabulous. Went in later in the night and it was not super busy so the food came fast.

2I65heku58Dpig54wJ5PYw.text: We stopped in here several times over the course of a conference.  We came in for happy hour, milkshakes and snacks. Service is great, and atmosphere is what you would expect for a burger bar - casual with a fun decor. One night, we had amazing adult milkshakes.  You can even create your own shake with toppings, syrups and liquors. Everyone raved about the burgers. I didn't get to try one, but they looked and smelled amazing. I had the happy hour grilled cheese and pulled beef. The service was great!  This is a great spot on the walkway between Mandalay Bay and Luxor!  Do yourself a favor and stop by.

ATk61OF9OPUdyXyen0n29g.text: As far as burgers go, I love this place! We stopped in prior to a country concert, so we were dressed casually. The restaurant itself is modern and plenty of seating available. Each booth offers a small personal TV so you can watch sports which is awesome!  The menu only had a handful of specialty burgers that the kitchen creates, otherwise it is a build your own burger place. Everything is priced a la carte. I got the buffalo burger with pepper jack cheese and a spicy ketchup. Simple, but soo delicious. The burger patties are very thick and I highly suggest cutting it in half to eat it LOL they have so many different options for your side, I stuck to the skinny fries but the tater tots my boyfriend got were pretty tasty too.   I also had a lavender lemon drop martini that I would highly recommend. The prices are a bit high for burgers, but they are really amazing and this restaurant is located on the strip so expect everything to be expensive. We were in and out of the restaurant within 1 hour so it's a fairly quick dining experience which worked perfectly with our concert start time.

hk8XA2ixlNQzjB0sBpSXgg.text: Very good! We got the original burger and a side of onion rings and tater tots. Food was well priced and very good!

0_VLApi24CjjoCX-BnaAdQ.text: Looking for a burger? This is the place.  Plenty of options.  Prices are reasonable... average $18 a burger.  Some come with fries,  others don't.  Fries are really good! I got the Kobe beef burger.  It was so tiny! My hubby got the Reuben.  It was ok, he says. Much larger amount of beef.   Chocolate shake was good,  he says.  Always nice staff.   It's where we eat before a show at the Luxor.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tiny piece of beef for the Kobe burger
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Reuben
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half of a Cobb. Very good,  just lacking flavor.  I added salt and it was better.  Needs maybe lemon?

lzdrsxN-vLP_OdKt0GHY6w.text: Enjoyed the Veggie Burger as it was done perfectly. Where the kitchen fell flat is when they served us mescslun salad and claimed it was a "special" kind of kale. It would have been one thing to say they ran out of kale. But to insult your guests and think you could pass off lettuce as kale ... Fail  I did feel bad for the server as he appeared genuine when returning from the kitchen what the news. Unfortunately I had to inform the server he was lied to. The gentlemen did not appear pleased so I'm sure there was conversation afterwards over the kitchen causing him embarrassment.

MAAwwOg5WMg7INuVhedUNg.text: Food: 4/5 Service: 4/5 Cleanliness: 4/5 Decor & Style: 4/5  Angus beef burger was huge and very good. Was not the best ever, but good enough for me wanting to come back and try another dish. The wings were crispy but not as meaty as I would like. Sweet potato fries were okay, but the regular fries were great! Nice looking restaurant (it's Vegas after all).  The next time I wanted to come here the line was WAY too long so I passed. Hopefully next time I will get another chance to dine here again.

j4F0mL6zmqCJXMrPeUxToQ.text: Service a bit slow but the wagyu burger and their jalapeno margaritas were both superb! Our waiter though...had zero personality! Over all I would try it again because the food was great! I would school the wait staff on how to 1.smile and 2. Act like they don't hate their job!

yx3FKxyv9miKi382iPem7w.text: The prices where very reasonable and the food was amazing. My waitress was very nice and the atmosphere was welcoming and fun. It was not to busy and the music is very good. It is kid friendly and the ice cream is amazing. I will definitely come back here.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

pYkSnQyIk3Jqi1gzwu_76w.text: This place FAILED miserably. I was staying at Mandalay Bay and craving a good burger. I was going to go to Shake Shack but decided to give this joint a shot since there are so many good reviews. It was an early afternoon on a Sunday. I was surprised not too many in there to watch the NFL games. So I sat at the bar. I placed my order Kobe Beef Burger (~$18) Truffle Fries (~$8) and a beer. The guy who sat next to me placed his order 10 minutes after I did and his came out first. Had to track my waiter down just to check on my order. Even the guy sat next to me was shocked.   Back to the food. I had Kobe Beef burger before and this was not even close to it. Tasted more like regular plain beef. I should've just order the regular burger and save me some money. The truffle fries were ok. Nothing special. Next time I'm in Vegas I'll pass this place. Not worth the money. This place failed me and so does Yelp this time.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kobe Beef Burger

3oi-ACmUhzr2QsYq992bRA.text: Phenomenal hamburger! We were very lucky to find this place. With so many choices in Las Vegas, it is tricky to find good value.  This is one of the best hamburgers i ever had.

rXGvejMi8vmq5GssLYJjYw.text: The burger is fine. Not the best I've ever had and certainly not worth the $20 price tag. But this is Las Vegas.   Angus Burger, medium Sesame bun Pepper Jack cheese  Caramelized onions Spicy ketchup Skinny fries  $20.19 with tax  Service was fine. It's a bit loud.  I would come back if I was at Mandalay Bay or Luxor and craved a burger. The shakes menu is extensive but I didn't sample anything.

q-U-nLpaocBfHXzGaeYzzg.text: Super delicious burger but our waitress forgot my cocktail. She brought if when we were almost done with our meal even though I asked her about it. The drink was so strong i had to drink it like a shot. No very good customer service. I would probably go back again cause the food was awesome but just hope we get better service next time

C3PHLrocwKvrgITA_7TKtQ.text: The service was excellent!  Top notch.  I had a sandwich without the meat.  Great sandwich!  Small restaurant but pretty good.  Beer is good and the $12 milkshakes were very filling.  The fry plate is too much.  Great place!  $116 for 3 for lunch was a lot!

nxgySsvCRWJmlzXvnaG3Zg.text: Ordered the Kobe burger. Cooked over done. No taste at all. Asked for aioli sauce with it, no aioli sauce. Wait staff was friendly and nice but the kitchen have no clue what they are doing. Just not good at all!

9uzOhU55DcyCHB1kKfeb9A.text: You have to come to Burger Bar if you come to Vegas! The burgers are amazing! We came here for dinner and they had happy hour!!!! ( from 9-11pm )! Our bartender, Patrick was amazing! Super funny and a great host! Made good drinks and every recommendation he had, he was on point with! We will definitely be back!

xcLLz3jc4lEENJ5Teju9uA.text: Utter disappointment.  I am like Jules in Pulp Fiction in that I love the taste of a Juicy Burger. With this in mind I figured Burger Bar at Mandalay Bay would have been a stone cold lock. Hundreds of beers to choose from, a masculine yet inviting interior, a packed house and even great bartenders had me sprung from the onset. In fact, I was seriously digging Burger Bar up to the point the Burger arrived!  I decided to try the "Perfect Ten" Burger which really was more like a Perfect 5. Maybe Vegas grades on a curve? Basically they put down a (perfectly cooked) medium rare patty and top it with Gouda Cheese, carmelized Onions and serve it on a dry and stale Pretzel bun. With exception of the bun, the ingredients were fresh enough and the Burger was juicy and bold, it is just that there was no "pop" factor for me and at $16.00 it should have all kinds of wonderful in every bite. Frustrating.  It being Vegas, I gambled big but lost in the flavor department. If you are going to drop some serious duckets on a Burger, I would suggest going elsewhere.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dogfish Head 90 Minute.
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burger Bar.

UOIRAQgaXStPR5AJEyfgig.text: The $60 burger with foie and truffles is quite good. I've returned several times to have it. But the rest of the burgers are just ok. Little to no seasoning and kinda dry. Service was ok, our server was friendly but disappeared on us once he dropped the main dishes so we never got refills on drinks.

Zm4fTDapnpCQ3WDqeumO2g.text: I would give this place 5 stars for the food by itself.  We went on a Monday or Tuesday evening around 6pm and it was packed and extremely loud.  I'm not sure if it was due to music playing or just loud drunk patrons, but it was hard to have a conversation.  Their buffalo burger is the best I've ever had - the 2nd best was at the Trainwreck in St. Louis.  It's rather expensive, but I think the food was worth it.  $100 for 2 of us with a few beers, salad, burgers, and fries.  A little steep, but expected for Vegas.  We will probably come back if it doesn't look too busy next year.

Mm8R5dwk4CuSIg5oPUnCMg.text: Decent burger and fries. I had the sliders and fries w a beer and pop. Total cost over $27 before tip. Wait wasn't as bad as it sounds like others experienced but i sat at the bar alone so that probably helped. The waiter was personable. The three variations of burger were highly redundant but cooked very correctly so were moist and delicious.  It is as advertised with burgers and a bar. Worth a try.

7YrKJtgwG5Q9Z_13bu2dJA.text: Good service and the skinny fries were crispy and tasty. Unfortunately my veggie burger was quite soggy despite requesting it well done. We had already waited about an hour for lunch and I'm not the type to send things back so I ended up not eating most of it. My friend did end up sending back her burger since she requested it well done but it was still pink inside.  Overly long wait plus subpar food not cooked to order makes for a meh experience.

r8UUQ288hwMbtr7pMcll3Q.text: They've made improvements recently, maybe new manager? Food quality has been consistently good the last couple times we have been. Figure it warranted a new review. Vast beer selection, something for everyone. Have a signature burger or build your own. The sliders are great if you can't decide. Not in the mood? Have a sandwich or salad. Cobb salad is spectacular. There's a few good options for kids, and menu is an activity page with crayons.  The onion rings and sweet potato fries are excellent. Can't comment on the desserts because we've never had room. Service is always very friendly.

7UaSndXKlI8QG_cVL5Py5w.text: Cleanliness 4 Service 5 Food Quality 4 Likelihood 4 1-5 (5 Best!) 4.3  Lunch for 3 please.  It was my first time there.  I was visiting out of town and two friends who live in Vegas brought me here.  They said we MUST try it.  GOOD CHOICE!  Their "thing" is that we must be intentional about "building" our sandwich.  Choose your: bun, the "meat", the cheese, the toppings, additions, sides, etc.  There is no "pre grouped" option, you build your meal from ground up.  I am 47 years old, and I have worked in hospitality for many years, and of course I have eaten in restaurants all of my life.  I have NEVER had a meal that was SO intentionally created and presented for me.  I could tell the placement of my two cheeses was precise, the placement of the burger on the bun was precise, the placing of the crown of the bun was precise... EVERYTHING was precise.  That made me appreciate it more.  The server was INCREDIBLE... never missed an opportunity to wow us with flair, friendliness, and refills.  Great job.  It will be a place I will re-visit when I am back in vegas... in a year or two... :)

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

sZwqP8t-8bIoGhsFOyyCmA.text: Same here for dinner during a business trip. Party of 1 took 30-45 mins to get a seat which was okay since I had nothing else to do, but still, 30-45 mins? Anyways, got seated and I ordered the Hangover Burger, basically it was a burger with In N Out Spread so for $13, definitely not worth it. Replaced the fat fries with onion rings as well. Onion rings had way too much dough on it, could barely taste the onions themselves.   Anyways, looks like I learned my lesson, either order the $65 Rossini or make my own burger with foie gras and the Kobe wagyu beef. Will give this place another shot when I come back, but the wait time is just ridiculous.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. hangover burger with onion ringsss

Qb1bjBs8xZItIvGW4sogzg.text: Excellent burgers (wife had the lamb, I had the black angus beef), and the poblano poppers were delicious. Good service, cold beer (great selection). If you're interested in a burger, this is a good choice.

L2-rZ1AFqTKXMg2h2p0FiA.text: Located conveniently between Mandalay Bay and The Luxor, Burger Bar delivers a juicy meaty burger for a decent price!  The Burger Bar is a casual place with pop music piping throughout the restaurant and sports on the millions of televisions they have.  Each booth has their own television for you to catch a game or two so you'll never miss a game.  It's clean and modern and just dimly lit enough for you to feel relaxed.    I had "The American Classic" while the dude-man had the "Hubert Keller Burger."  Both were super delicious, hit the spot, and cooked to a perfect medium..  I really enjoyed the buffalo meat in the HK burger and that red wine and shallots sauce was crazy good.  I liked dipping my skinny fries in there.  My burger was crazy big while the HK seemed to be a smaller portion.  Is this normal?  It was my first time stopping by!  I had originally wanted to try the "Spicy Lamb Burger" but I was afraid it would be too spicy.  While Burger Bar isn't my burger place of choice on The Strip, I definitely wouldn't hesitate to stop in again!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;The Classic.&#34; cooked medium. Super juicy and full of flavor! Sorry it&#39;s so blurry.

HWAjWAL5WiA8j6GD1qMfaQ.text: Service was great and the waitress was very helpful with recommendations. The bison burgers were so tender and juicy and tasted delicious and the shakes were beyond good! I'll definitely be coming back!

ndwx_6YtWj2lIf9Inx6T5w.text: Had dinner a few nights ago and overall had a good experience - wait time was 90+ minutes so we sat at the bar. Bartender was awesome and burger was pretty good. Salad had a bit too much dressing for my liking, but overall it was pretty good.

_lRJ7AbmQzxZ_AKz9As6vw.text: It was good, not great.  But, really, how can you eff up a burger?  I got the kobe 1/2lb burger on a potato bun and added pepper jack, chipotle aoli, and guacamole.  Add some onion rings and a soda and . . . $36?!    You would think at that price, it would've at least been a damn good burger.  It wasn't.  A double-double at In-n-Out is better -- at $2.80.    I'll pass.

LSU1O-LccYMVDLWdNBtE_w.text: Had some WONDERFUL burgers here last weekend!! I had the sliders and they were so incredible. I know it might sound weird to way, but I could almost taste the grass the cow had eaten it was so fresh and well-raised!! The patties were cooked so nicely that a firm squeeze released not a single drop of any fatty oil like you get with some burgers. I loved the MYSTERY TAP too! A place we took a chance on and will definitely return to!

qoBpmrKsHcD-w_IpLEksvA.text: Been here a couple times, good wait times and good food. Always have leftovers. Place is pretty small but somehow always fits our party of 2-4 . They have a pretty simple menu but satisfies ur hunger

loYrBm_CcOspvztc24ywJQ.text: Good spot. Good bartenders and staff. Menu was good and lots of beers if you're into that. Won't say it was the greatest hamburger I've had but not bad.

8DZbAfhQLGOX-PGsmo-oCQ.text: Seems to me that almost every casino has a restaurant that specializes in gourmet hamburgers.  Even though this place was not directly inside the casino, it is in the mall attached to the Mandalay Bay.  There always seems to be a wait every time I come here and sometimes I don't have the patience and chose another restaurant.  It's a nice place and they have a fun menu.  The restaurant is long and narrow and small.  It makes you realize why you have to wait.  The burger was tasty although it may not be the best of Vegas. Service was friendly.   Believe it or not, I thought the burger at the Irish bar next door was better.  Still a good burger and experience and I will return only if I don't have to wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8oAiUh830yFpTXKr5UJ7pw.text: Boyfriend and I went here after going to Jay Z's concert. Both got Kobe Beef Burger with onion rings; it was alright. Portions are big. Service is ok. I don't think I'll be back again. I'd rather go to Holstein's in Cosmopolitan for burgers on the strip, or Bachi Burger off the strip.

Oo1rIQNTmXVgsAZTxYBtgQ.text: After reading all reviews on burger places in Vegas, we decided on Burger Bar. Not disappointed. The poblano poppers were delicious. Each of 6 poppers is served in a shot glass with a creamy aioli sauce. Great presentation and soooo good. I did not have a shake, as I opted for alcohol, but the other 3 people in my party did. Again, great presentation and creamy, deliciousness. The burgers were tasty, made with high quality beef. The choices for types of meat and add-ons are plentiful. The margarita I had was one of the best I had in Vegas!  Friendly staff, great food. You gotta try it!

C1gxosfUha6beU48q5Ut9w.text: This place serves some damn good burgers. There's a lot of ways to customize the burger you want and how you want to eat them.  I really had sliders and a side of fries and I was full, but definitely the food was delectable and a great spot to stop off and grab a burger.  Sit at the bar and talk to the bartenders, they are a great bunch and they definitely will do their best to make sure you have a great meal!

dz548Cmd11SQ5Nk1YlzKbA.text: Great spot in the shops at Mandalay Bay... they had a Vegan BLT which was INCREDIBLE... bar was empty, but they had the game on I wanted to watch... bar tender was attentive, fries were good... not much else to say, if their Vegan sandwich was that good I imagine the rest of their stuff is equally delicious... highly recommended...

Y5FWqWViW82fppcZFNKjMA.text: OUTRAGEOUSLY PRICED!  Had waygu beef, lamb burger, surf and turf and buffalo burgers. Split four ways. The lamb was my fav but seriously everything else made me feel really sick after. My best friend puked up everything too. So I don't know, maybe because we didn't order everything well done but still I don't think I'll come back.
