aD8Z3rteeQUyH3LFriMk3Q.text: My second favorite burger place on the strip after Gordon Ramsay's BurGR. Definitely a good option if you're on this end if the strip (located in Mandalay Bay Shoppes, area connecting to Luxor).  Huge selection including a build your own. Downside to this place is the cost - hubby's burger alone added up to $25 pretty quickly with the bison plus cheese, bacon and some extra fillings. Ouch!  I had the turkey burger which was awesome! My pineapple addition was super skimpy but the jalepeno bacon add in was totally worth it. Sides are $4/each and we each loved our onion rings and zucchini fries.  Great service. Lots of TVs including an individual one at your booth to watch a game. A good burger but a bit too pricey for what it is.

gSdiSuCmYKBfMHWDl4TFBg.text: We made our own burgers and they were great!!! My burger was medium rare Kobe style wagyu beef with an onion bun with truffle mayo, grilled onions, lettuce, and Brie cheese. Also got truffle fries. My boyfriend got a medium rare Kobe style wagyu beef with a ciabatta bun with truffle mayo, caramelized onion, lettuce, tomato, and cheddar cheese. He also got garlic fries that came with Aioli. Everything was really really awesome! I wish our hotel would have had a mini fridge so I could of brought back my left overs. Definitely a place you want to eat at if you love burgers!!! A lot of people are saying it gets busy we went at 3 pm on a Sunday and wasn't that busy.

5tAg4OU772Abja3wd4jmFg.text: For a place that has "Burger" in its name I was a little disappointed. The actual patty was over cooked and very dry. The menu description of the burger I had (the hangover) was kind of misleading. But I did have an amazing Bloody Mary, and all the staff were super friendly. If I come back here I would do a build your own burger.

Z5-m9ViwJoVhgERR0tG35g.text: I ordered the infamous "ROSSINI" burger and I would not recommend it. I love foie gras and truffles, so I thought it would be the perfect burger but it was surprisingly lacking in taste despite the toppings. First of all the burger patty itself DOES NOT come salted.  It came with a side of coarse sea salt and black peppercorns to sprinkle on your burger, along with a "black perigord truffle sauce" (which sounds cool but was nothing special). Even after adding all of the salt to my burger and using the sauce it came with, it still did nothing spectacular for my taste buds. Not to mention it took about 3 or 4 bites of just the plain bun and patty until I got to the actual foie gras and truffle part (which were both tiny pieces and low quality as I could barely taste them). The "kobe style wagyu beef" didn't taste any better than regular beef. The fries it came with were just mediocre fries.   TL;DR-- the Rossini burger is not worth the $65 price tag.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rossini burger
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rossini Burger

y86KjPIj_BNDhhEaRKbBJA.text: This was my first time trying out this restaurant. It's located upstairs near the shopping mall area. I saw the great yelp reviews and wanted to try it. I came with the intention of ordering the Buffalo burger, but they still had the Happy Hour specials going so my husband and I opted for the burger sliders, lamb lollipops, and the wedge salad. Unfortunately, the only thing I liked was the wedge salad but then again it's hard to mess up a salad.  Not sure if the regular menu has better options, but the food I tasted wasn't anything spectacular. Probably won't return, prices were too high for some light appetizers that didn't taste good. Oh well, you live and learn.

EwBCiKEhs-FE2ffHs7z12A.text: One of my favorite places to get burgers, they make it so fun and it tastes sooooo good.

lWjQmcdOUXpxyzrBcKDZkQ.text: i love hamburgers. and this is my favorite place to get them. only if i came to vegas more often :( they have different types of beef, i don't remember off the top of my head which one i order, but it's delicious. they also have desserts that are shaped like burgers.

6mGfCr2ogK19sX0rUlVd4A.text: the best burger we ever had - each of us - that is for sure  my wife and I went thereon our first night in vegas. we saw the reviews and figured this is right for us  restaurant is nice sports bar, very casual, not uptight at all. service was very good.  i had a kobe beef burger just to try cause i figured i need to know if you really need to waist such good cut of meet in a burger. to tell the truth i still do not know. it was a very delicious burger, cooked perfectly they way i love but not sure it was really  the kobe beef vs regular beef with 30% fat.....  my wife had a lean buffalo burger which was also out of this world.  we each had a different fries with our meals - both were great!  the toppings you chose to put on the burgers were disappointing and expensive. disappointing cause we felt they take a way from the pure burger taste and some that were over 4$ just is too much for a little bit of this or that...... my wife also took a "salad" side which was just a 7$ very very small ball of very few leafs(less then a hand full) of this and that.....really a joke under any salad standard and a total waist of time  add to that 2 beers and you are looking at $80 evening that had a pint + a burger.....so certainly  on the high end side for 2 burgers in a sport bar.  But and a huge but - they were the best burgers we ever had!!!

_Wiq660HhO5--CHCyf2wPw.text: The burgers, fries, and drinks are great. Unfortunately, the service is not that great. We come here every time we come to Vegas, because we like the food and Hubert is adorable, but pretty much every person you come in contact with, from hostess to bartender to waitress (they probably have male servers but I've not seen one) ranges from inattentive to surly. Maybe because we are a married couple instead of a bunch of single dudes who will probably tip better if given the chance to ogle the goodies? Who knows. Food wins. It is really hard to get a rare burger that is not goopy with juice and can be eaten without crumbling into a blob of ground meat, but at BB they succeed every time. Next time I fully intend to have a Guinness shake, for which I never manage to save room.

9ZNruCsVnFFJaL3L0m5-Rg.text: My wife and I were going from Mandalay Bay to the Luxor when we saw a long line standing outside a restaurant at about 1:30 in the afternoon.  The curiosity got to us so we went over to take a look and discovered that people were waiting in line for an opportunity to eat, what they say, is the best burger in Las Vegas.  I gave up eating meat 9 years ago, however, my wife, the carnevor, desperately wanted to go back the next day so I tagged along hoping to find something for a non meat eater to munch on.  Well. to my surprise, they served this KILLER Salmon burger with a broiled Maine lobster tail as a topping.  YUMI YUMI.  My wife had her KOBE burger,  medium rare with roasted Foir Gras as a topping on a home mad Ciabatta bun.  It smelled and looked so good I almost converted back to meat, but I didn't..  Anyway, you gotta try this place.  My wife spoke to the owner/chef, Hubert Keller, and he told her that he will be opening a new Burger Bar in San Francisco at Union Square.(We live in San Francisco)  We are looking forward to another great experience at the Burger Bar.  The service was great...

ssslLZ_LeWmKrS82c2mLeA.text: I am a big Vegas fan and have been there more than I have places around where I live. I do not eat red meat or pork as I have mentioned before so I thrive on turkey burgers.  Finding a good turkey burger is a pretty hard thing to do, let me tell you. Most are frozen patty's that taste like cardboard.  Burger bar is situated inside of the amazing hotel/casino Mandalay Bay and is a great spot to hang out with some friends and have a couple drinks with your meal.  It is a neat menu where you choose everything you want from your burger with the type of bun and what you want on top.  Like I said I always get the turkey burger and it is a very good size, and juicy not dry like many others.  The downfalls are that you have to pay for each individual topping and the sides that you want with it.  You have your choice of fat steak fries, skinny fries, zucchini fries (my favorite) and some others.  I have a hard time choosing between the three so every time I go I usually rotate them.  I have never had a bad experience with the food nor the service.  The atmosphere is great (first of all its Vegas!). I love hockey so during the winter months they usually have a game on with their many TVs (located in every booth and some overhead at the bar), They have a full bar and some good beers on tap (blue moon always a fave).  I love it here and every time I go to Vega$ which has been happening a lot I have to go at least once if not more.  They are opened late (I believe 2am on the weekends) so when you are fed up at losing at the casinos, or drunk from gambling too much at the tables,  come here and give it a try!

SYVmX9vMzs-ZO94hVSU57g.text: we came here for lunch on our vegas trip.  it's located in the shopping area of mandalay bay.  i ordered the sliders and was pleasantly pleased - each slider was different; one had bacon, which was yummy, another had caramelized onions, which was pretty good, and the last one was just a cheeseburger with a crunchy pickle.  a couple of my friends said the burgers they ordered were pretty good as well.  their skinny fries tasted like the kind they used to have at jack in the box, which isn't really a bad thing.  overall, it was ok...everything wasn't to die for, which i kind of expect at an overpriced burger place.  i still have yet to try the burger places on my list in LA, so I can't really compare.  i just have a hard time justifying paying $15 for a pretty good burger...i need it to be great...

gudR8fQZiDKWjbm0PyjEGQ.text: One of my favorite burger places in LV!  I always get the turkey burger, and it's always juicy and delicious (many turkey burgers at other restaurants are often dry and bland, but BB knows their turkey burgers)!  I've had a few bites of the Kobe Beef burgers (my hubby's favorite) and they are extremely tender and juicy :)  I was also ecstatic to find a place that has sweet potato fries (some pretty damn good sweet potato fries to be more specific).  It's also great that they are open later :)

FO8fJJlbXYp5CurDw-nk_Q.text: vegan vegas burger is pretty good here! buttttt the best part was the skinny fries *drool* i love fries!!!

3g4iepF2wySfCbXcfq4HPQ.text: Lunch 4PM Wednesday...busy but seated more quickly than quoted, service was charming and fast, food tasty, great beer menu....try the "Corie D."....Onion Bun, Beef, Caramelized Onions,Portobello Mushrooms and Blue Cheese.

gWav207VClY_lFNKauWQ_A.text: Had their Kobe burger, sweet potatoe fries and a glass of wine. Good burger & fries. OK wine. It was busy when I was there but I think the server should have spent a little more time with each patron. Think the lamb burger at BLT is better!

vtrdYO0FH9VezQbPu6HmOQ.text: I regret eating at the Burger Bar, now I am back in Chicago searching for a burger that only exists in Vegas. During my visit, I had the Hubert Keller Burger medium rare, which was medium rare and juicy. By far the BEST burger I ever had. My favorite part was the spinach and blue cheese that complemented each other so well. And the caramelized onions was so sweet (in a good way). When I visit again, I hope they' still have the Hubert Keller!

YfWTGRaVczaiaMOq2IN2ig.text: I think my experience at Burger Bar was just OK because I didn't actually get a burger (I had the chicken sandwich), so keep that in mind. It also took a little while to get seated (though not the 45 mins they quoted us, luckily!) For the cost, the chicken sandwich was just OK. WAY too big (but really most things in Vegas are out-of-control huge anyway). The zucchini fries that were recommended to me weren't as good as I'd hoped. A bit too greasy and not zucchini-y enough, if that makes sense. I think they had too much breading. The sweet potato fries I tried off someone else's plate were great, though. I love sweet potato fries! Those at my table who got burgers seemed a lot more happy with what they got than I did... So definitely go for a burger if you go there. I was also intrigued by the build-your-own milkshake, but after the HUGE amount of food (and seeing the $7 price point) I wasn't in the mood for one. Maybe someday!

OTcLbi5UajHs5Mjl5_NqvQ.text: the quality of meat and selection of beers are the best things here.  the burgers, sliders, fries, fried zucchini were all boring and overcooked, and the decor, ambiance and service were all pretty stale. better than most other options in the area probably, but not worth getting excited about.

2-tfpqxLw2LvvHTy6eu8BQ.text: Some of the best burgers around.  This place is located in the Shops at Mandalay Place, between Luxor and Mandalay Bay.  A totally unique burger menu where you can top your burger with pretty much anything under the sun.  If you are in the mood for a lobster tail or foie gras on your burger, they have it.  For the meat, you can choose from beef (they offer regular, Black Angus, and Kobe), lamb, turkey and veggie burger.  I actually prefer the turkey burger over the rest.  It comes out perfectly seasoned and so tender.  The beef and lamb are always great too.  After you pick your meat, you pick your bun type, your cheese type and then all the rest of your toppings.  My favorite concoction is a turkey burger served on an onion bun with American cheese, peppered bacon, and button mushrooms.  All the usual toppings such as lettuce, tomato, and onion come standard with all the burgers.  They make great fries here which come in both the skinny or thick varieties.  For something different, try their delicious zucchini fries.  They also have a big beer and drink selection here.  If you are lucky enough to sit at a booth, they are equipped with flat panel televisions.  The service has always been great here.  I have never been here when there was not a wait, but the wait is usually only 10 or 15 minutes and there are plenty of nearby shops to browse around while you wait.

pA_8rJyUK4TQsmsmbdWXQw.text: all of the fried goods=AMAZING!   im a vegetarian, & didnt love the veggie burger...  but the fries were perfect & the shakes were DELICIOUS!!

RhIRYMCYfp-jBOIZHUT4TA.text: Ate here on my last night in Vegas. Very welcoming staff and was seated within five minutes. I loved the decor of the restaurant/bar. The beer was great and my girlfriend had a sombrero (khalua/milk) which was also very tasty. But now onto the nitty gritty. We tried the fries sampler with fat fries, skinny fries, and onion rings and all were cooked to perfection. I enjoyed every bite of them. Now....One of the BEST burgers I have ever had. Was the one they let me create through their nifty "Create a burger" section on their menu. You get to choose the type of meat, bun, toppings, cheese, anything you can think of to create your perfect burger. I got mine with a Wheat bun, Kobe Beef, Red wine sauce, pepper jack cheese, and jalapenos. The burger was soooo JUICY. Incredible. Delicious. Mouth watering! It is very hard to compare to any other burger I have had in recent memory. Although the Kobe beef makes it a little more pricey at $24 for the entire burger it was definitely worth the money. Enjoy your own burger creations!

aQLWWGtEBtPygbtILw3xEw.text: This was my first lunch stop on my first trip to Vegas (last year).  In terms of atmosphere, Burger Bar is virtually indistinguishable from any other sports bar or mall restaurant. The schtick is the diner's ability to customize everything from meat to bun to toppings. I opted for the Kobe beef burger (which was $16), cooked rare and topped with swiss cheese, caramelized onions, and oyster mushrooms (these ranged from about sixty cents to two dollars). I also added a side of sweet potato fries (I believe they were just under $3). The burger was absolutely enormous, and it was more or less tartare-style with just a touch of char around the outside. The combination of toppings worked well together and added some dimension, but they didn't mask the flavor of the beef. The sweet potato fries were good and crunchy, but they weren't anything special and actually tasted like standard frozen ones. I also didn't eat much of the whole wheat bun I had chosen--next time, I'll just pass on the carbs. Service was mediocre (I waited almost 15 minutes for someone to acknowledge my presence at the bar), but the draft beer list was surprisingly varied (most domestic drafts hovered around $5).  Next time, I think I'll hail a cab and go to In-N-Out!

Mvb1XHBkNTWTzzrgXsu3Bg.text: Went to Burger Bar on a Friday night late for a dinner and was surprised there wasnt a wait, especially on the weekend of a UFC fight at Mandalay. The service was just soso, but then again im just being served a burger and fries so dont expect much. Was interesting that they offered a variety of burgers from Kobe Beef, Buffalo, all the way to a chicken and even Salmon Burger. I went for the American Classic ($13) as when it comes to a burger i want to keep it simple and enjoy the flavor of the meat. Ordered medium rare and it came out well cooked and tasted quite well 9/10 (the bacon helped that). The skinny fries are good but i will suggest you to order the Zucchini fries with a side of ranch cause they are slammin. All in all it was a good meal and i would probably go back if i was in the area and wanting a simple meal with no frills but a $13 hamburger is not something i want to buy to often as i can do that at home with minimal effort.

vNZB8ybdOgai0-5L6oOWEw.text: when i first heard about this place on food network i gave it a try and it was good..but after that the 2-3rd time sucked, the food didn't taste the same and the price was pretty to high sorry burger bar but BLT at the mirage kicks your butt hands down

YJcjxeLi0_WRwwEMyamAfg.text: Went here late Friday night to get a bite (10pm).  Sat at the bar and was served quickly.  Got the sliders which were small, but cooked to perfection.  Medium, seasoned well and not too squished so the texture was good.  Got a side of hangover sauce for the fries which was great.  Spicy ketchup was also really good.  Not the typical ketchup + cocktail sauce. More complex flavor. Very attentive bar manager.  Would eat here again in a second.

p3eoDKwvCxHoqS1kWXt4Pg.text: Service is fairly average but everyone is very nice. Burgers are good, but the toppings steal the show. Every time I have been there I have tried a new delicious topping including: caramelized onions, jalepeno bacon, aged white cheddar, avocado, bbq sauce, foie gras... The list goes on and on. I would save your money and get the regular burger and load up on add-ons, as opposed to splurging on the kobe burger. It's not real Kobe Beef even though it sounds nice to say.;) Wouldn't make a trip to Mandalay Bay just for this place, but if I'm hungry and I happen to be in the area, why not.

RyKQQF67zJYfd8pQSBdN1A.text: The Hubert Keller burger is divine.  Fries, eh.  Beer selection is great.    Probably the best food for the price you'll find around there.

9bKMMIBx76d7ZwBoVf-KEw.text: Quite expensive for burgers, but so worth it. I had the Hubert Keller Burger - oh my word! Incredible, messy, beyond words really. There is definitely a reason he puts his name on this burger. It was my first buffalo meat experience and I wouldn't change a thing about it although I was admittedly nervous about trying buffalo! My husband had a build your own with Kobe, bacon, and cheese. He was certainly not disappointed! We had the skinny fries as well, nice and crispy. Felt like the wait staff was a little on the snobby side, but I was too busy focusing on the incredible taste experience going on in my mouth to notice :)

VkZCBSt2cGN5M2JqL5wTyg.text: Great little spot with killer burgers and a good beer selection. They carry far more beers than your standard run of the mill beer menus. The ingredients  are fresh and the burgers on point. The fry sampler is the way to go as you can choose your favorite types of fries. Get you a selection of dipping sauces and you are in heaven. I opt for the veggie burger and have never been let down. My meat eating friends loved their selections as well and the service was top notch.

s9bmzpMjnqKjGWVap4tKzg.text: I LOVE Burger Bar. So much. As a local, I really try to avoid the Strip as much as possible. But this place has become a staple in my family. When we think burgers, we think Burger Bar...so it's well worth the drive down the Strip to get there.  Depending on when you go dictates how long the wait is. We've waited anywhere from 10 minutes to over an hour. They won't seat you unless everyone in your party is present (which I can appreciate, having worked in the restaurant industry), so if you're waiting for people to arrive, I recommend at least getting your name on the list. That way, when everyone DOES arrive, you can just let the hostess know your party is ready and your wait time will be shortened.  It's usually pretty loud in there. If you're looking for a quiet meal, this definitely isn't the place to go. It's got a bit of a sports bar feel to it, with sports games playing on both the big screens and the small TV screens inside the booths. But everybody always seems to be having a good time, and I can still manage to have a conversation with my table without having to shout at anybody.  They have the Chef's burgers menu, and also have build-your-own options for burgers and milkshakes (both alcoholic and not). They have non-beef options, such as chicken, turkey, or salmon. They even have a veggie burger and a specialty vegan burger, along with various salad options for all the non-meat eaters out there. All of the Chef's burgers come with skinny fries, but you can change those out for any of their other side options. (I usually opt for sweet potato fries.) If you do a build-your-own, you can add on those side options for $3-6.  I personally am OBSESSED with the Hubert Keller burger. I mean, I dream about this burger. I wake up craving it. And then I bug everyone I know to give me an excuse to go get one. It's a buffalo burger topped with sauteed baby spinach, caramelized onions, and blue cheese. Each component on that burger compliments every other component. It comes with a Red Wine Shallot reduction on the side, and it just puts the burger over the top. It took a couple visits for me to get my dad to try it (he was scared of buffalo meat for some reason), but I practically shoved a bite down his throat and now he's hooked. Buffalo meat is amazing!  A close second (in my opinion) would have to be the Peppercorn burger. If you're a fan of pepper and mustard, THIS is the burger for you.  Then of course, there are the milkshakes. Holy crap! So yummy! I've had both the Nutella and the Salted Caramel milkshakes. Both are sooo delicious. When ordering shakes "for here" they are decorated beautifully. Very artistic. But you can also order them to-go, and they'll put it in a plastic cup with a nice wide straw so you can take it with you.   I also recommend the Creamy Cheese Cake burger. This is a dessert alternative to the milkshake, filled with sweetened cream cheese and caramelized pineapple. The "bun" is made with fresh donuts! Mmm Mmm! They're a little small though, so...unless you just want a bite, I recommend skipping the "Let's split a dessert" part of the conversation and just keep it all to yourself.  We've never once had a bad experience here. Our servers have always been friendly, they are mindful of any modifications we make, and our burgers are always cooked to perfection. Service CAN be a little slow though. Depending on how busy they are, it may be hard to track down said server for drink refills or extra sauce. And once they take your order, you can expect to be sitting there twiddling your thumbs for 15-20 minutes with nothing on the table but beverages. (There is also a longer wait on the dessert burgers.) But! They DO cook everything to order, so it's completely understandable and well worth that wait.

SDoMzes-e7CnvulOdnHWXA.text: The food was good. The fries were fresh and the burger tasted above average. The service here is what really shines.  The waiter was friendly and we never had to worry about running low on beverages or food.

yRjwoImZjJKzsLYMi2LZcw.text: Very good service. Friendly people but it's still a hamburger. You get several choices of  toppings, over 30 at least. About 100 beers to choose from but it's still a burger and a beer $50 bucks plus tip.

Iult-8773auSwKyTaoqGvQ.text: I was introduced to this place by a friend while i lived in vegas for almost a decade. Located inside Mandalay Bay it is in their upstairs shopping area and has a great atmosphere. Service was great and booths are nice and roomy and four of us adults sat comfortably in there.  Burgers were great as were the sides and drinks. I ordered a custom made burger which does add up when you start piling on things like pineapple and different cheeses. Also added some foie gras to my burger which was delish.  The only gripe i have which i assume has nothing to do with the restaurant itself is that Yelp* has this as a $$ which i think it should be a $$$ considering there cheapest burger is in the $19 range. Other than that i have always had a great experience there and now that i live out of state Burger Bar is a must whenever i go to Las Vegas which is usually twice a year.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Foie Gras ordered on the side for my meal!
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kobe burger with foie gras. Yummmmmmm!

Idj0ZU8lkO73xWSK6BNFDA.text: been to burger bar in san francisco and I am a HUGE fan. The service here however was terrible. It is obvious that  servers here DO NOT split the tips by the way every single waiter but the guy who took my order ignored me when I was standing up out of my seat waving a waiter down for a check. Not once did my "waiter" come and ask how the food was. NOT once did i get a refill on my water. Worse service I have ever experienced anywhere in Las Vegas.

ScKyIZFgsOPF9i-sDJxQRA.text: Awesome burgers and sweet potato fires.  Blackjack Burger - 4 Stars Buffalo Burger - 4 Stars Sweet Potato Fires - 4 Stars  Pricey but good food.

3ONeWUbQwbLVrXwMX9uugg.text: Being this is Vegas and all prices are inflated (burgers start around $14 and go up quickly), it is easy to be skeptical. However, I was widely impressed by the burgers.   The Spicy Lamb Burger was very good. It had a nice kick without being spicy just for the sake of being spicy. Definitely not a burger that will ruin your taste buds and throw you into a flop sweat. The Hubert Keller burger (made with Buffalo meat), was awesome. Carmelized onions and blue cheese, tough to go wrong there. My favorite, though, was the Peppercorn Burger. It had peppercorns (obviously) along with Dijon mustard and a peppercorn sauce. I usually skip the sauces or get them on the side as I fear they will be either overpowering or make the sandwich too messy. However this sauce was outstanding. I'm not a fan of creamy sauces and although the menu states it is a "peppercorn cream sauce," it was not at all what I expected. It was not a mayo-based sauce so not super thick. Tough to describe, but it was fabulous. Here's a great tip, get the zucchini fries rather than regular fries. They are awesome.  I was very happy with the Burger Bar. Nice selection of beers as well.

Kxxonzpu8qXOR42h6ovqpg.text: Loved my burger (asked for medium well and it was exactly how I like it with some pink all the way through). Also thought the fat fries and onion rings were good with the various dipping sauces (I recommend the chipotle aioli for a kick and the basil aioli for the flavor). Had the Chocolate Cowboy adult milk shake and it was the stuff dreams are made of. Asked for it to go since we were in a rush and it was presented really nice! We went at noon at were seated immediately, service was fast and reliable throughout. Would definitely go back for my burger fix.

m52VfxJYGt_8qmKHLHusoA.text: I love, love, love this place.  Solid beer selection. Solid burger. Great staff.    Even their salads are great!  Their low carb burger is delicious, too.  There is not one item I've ordered here that I haven't fully enjoyed.    When we visit, we usually sit in Erin's section, she's an awesome waitress.

ay_gxLE84-CSqRa7e83bLA.text: I made a big mistake when I tried to come here with a large group. If you have more than 4 people, find a way to ditch most of them, then run as fast as you can to Burger Bar.  OK, full disclosure: I'm a vegetarian rating a burger place. Most people will think I don't know what I'm talking about. Fine, whatever. Since I don't eat meat, I have become very picky about my veggie burgers. Most places that serve them give you a frozen patty that was made in a factory somewhere and the waitress has no idea what it is. Blah... Burger Bar is NOT like that. They may emphasize the meat, but it was one of the best veggie burgers I've ever had. (Only one better is the black bean burger at Malibu Grill in Bloomington, Indiana).  My dining companions enjoyed their meaty burgers, and they said their sweet potato fries were very tasty. I was in the mood for more exotic fare, so I got the zucchini fries. WOW!!! Freaking awesome! Gimme more!  For dessert I had the nutella milkshake. Most people at the table were sharing and passing around desserts but not me. You will pry this shake from my cold dead fingers. It was perfection.

C-IyJxMeQKNWXsmMLoak8Q.text: I've been to Burger Bar a few times now and I am a fan. I couldn't decide between 3 or 4 stars but decided on 3 because there are so many other better options in Vegas. If you are in Mandalay Bay Border Grill is the best restaurant but Burger Bar is not a bad option.   They have pretty much anything you can think of for your burger. Start out with beef, chicken, turkey, lamb, or many other types of meat. Add whatever cheese and toppings. Then you get to pick your bun from many options (pretzel, wheat, potato, etc). Once you have your burger you have the option for many different types of sides (fries, sweet potato fries, fried zucchini, etc). There are so many options you could get something different every time you come here, even though it is pretty much just burgers. I think they do have a few salads if there are people in your group that would prefer something other than a burger.   The burger itself was very good. Very juicy and cooked perfectly. Service is a little slow, but not awful. It was slightly overpriced, but comparable for everything in Vegas.   If I'm in the mood for a burger in Vegas I might return to Burger Bar

XbL55pHs7bFRWPq3FIxy_A.text: We were told to sit at the rear bar for quicker service. It took almost 10 min before anyone realized we were there! Just as we were about to leave, we were able to grab someone's attention to receive menus. Once that was accomplished, service was friendly, glasses refilled, etc.  1 of the few places open past 10pm - after the Lion King show.  They have a great assortment of beers that anything you could imagine and have a craving for - they can produce it or something similar.  Had a Black Jack burger w/fries. The burger patty was thick and moist. Would've been possible to simply eat the burger patty alone (without the bun). For quicker service and avoiding custom orders, they bring the lettuce, tomato, and onions on the side and you pick and choose what to do.  TVs are on ESPN, ESPN2, and Prime Ticket. Music and such for others so it is a win-win for all.  $25 for burger, fries, and a beer is not what I envisioned at a burger joint but it'll do!

XCA9OrJ133oiGyzYCjtaEQ.text: This was a good place only went one time don't know why I haven't been back but it was really good everything was clean and fresh there

FObz3XB-qtfRUVf-RWQIbQ.text: I am a burger-lover and Burger Bar's Kobe beef burgers are #1 IN THE WORLD on my personal list of top 4 (still searching for #5) burgers ahead of:  25 Degrees' (Hollywood, CA) ground sirloin burgers (my personal #2 rated burger in the world), Morton's Steakhouse's ground prime rib burger (#3), and Cattlemens (Northern California) Motherlode burger (#4); all of which can be purchased in the same price range ($15-$30 including side orders).  As a premium burger, the Burger Bar offers complete customization, cooked to order with all premium ingredients.  They offer premium meats, cheeses, toppings, and sauces which allow you to make EXACTLY WHAT YOU ARE LOOKING FOR.  In this regard, the Burger Bar is superior to Morton's prime burger and 25 Degrees' ground sirloin and garnishes.   The side orders (mac and cheese croquettes, fries, and onion rings) are cooked perfectly:  not too crisp, not soggy, not hard.  The ambiance at the Burger Bar, Las Vegas is a classy yet casual expression of the modern American diner/bar.  Located in one of Sin City's premier hotels and casinos, the Mandalay Bay, expect the Burger Bar to be constantly busy and loud.  Service is accurate and attentive without being intrusive or overbearing.  I have not tried other premium burgers in Vegas.  As such, in Las Vegas, where culinary experts are in constant competition, there may be a better burger than the Burger Bar's. But with over 1,400 Yelp reviews of burger restaurants in Las Vegas at the time of my review, the Burger Bar is hundreds of ratings past any possible competitors.  Cooked perfectly as ordered with almost every conceivable ingredient from which to choose, the Burger Bar's Kobe beef burger is the single best burger I have ever had.  My search continues for the next burger contender alongside Morton's and 25 Degrees.

QmLuOzyJPnjJmIfWx1lirA.text: Stopped in because it was the only thing open, without much expectation, and pleasantly surprised! I got the sliders and they were delicious! it was a variation of three kinds and all were good. Fries were cooked just right! I would reccomend this place! Even though there were closing shortly, the staff was extra friendly!

lBJLXbOKT0kkWQ8QlXscTw.text: When does a the burger ever justify the price? When we think about expensive burgers (or anything, for that matter) one of the first thoughts we have is a comparison to a cheaper alternative. If I eat a $20 burger, it is because I'm assuming its going to be levels better than the likes of other slightly cheaper, but expensive, burgerse like Shake Shack or Umami Burger and it definitely MUST be better than the best value burger of all: In N Out, am I right?  Let's start with the service. Reservation was set for 8, but we pushed it back to 9 with no problem. Loved that. More than half of us arrived and were seated quickly. Loved that too. Our waiter started out cool and informative. Then, the rest of us came and ordered drinks, but only the first half of us received them; the ones who didn't waited over 30 minutes before their drinks were delivered. Upon notifying the waiter, he apologized, went to the back, but returned soon after and sarcastically looked at my friend in the face and said "30 minutes???" *sarcasm*.   WTF. We're a party of 9 paying for $25 burgers that are about as good as In N Out with extra toppings in Las Vegas and you want to put your tip in jeopardy by being testy over your mistake??   Now lets move on to the food. It was good and I have no complaints, but it wasn't great. The cheapest burger on the menu was $17 while the most expensive burger was $65.   TL;DR - the food was good, but overpriced - something that would have been offset by the hole in our service.  P.S. He still got his tip.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. American burger with fries + egg, came out to about $23 plus beer, approx. $30 without tax.

sQZSxL71ZlXjrI5fmImI2A.text: Very delicious burgers! I want to say one of the best ones i had! Get it medium and taste the beef it's yummm!

49nHHsVM4foI7AaO4fG7nQ.text: Came to Burger Bar with simi high expectations.  Coming in hungry looking for a place close to our hotel room.  With that we decided to check out Burger Bar.  The place seems like a good place to check out a sports game.  There are numerous TV in the bar in addition to the personal TV in each booth.  The second thing I noticed was the price.  Be preferred to spend around 20 dollars for a burger.  The other shocker if your looking for a shake be prepared to spend 12 dollars for a shake.    For food I got sliders l, my advisory is if your hungry and not a kid.  Don't get the sliders they are small and not to much out of the ordinary.  I guess the highlight was the bun, which tasted better than most.  The toppings change from each burger , but not much variation in taste.  The shoe string fries were just alright not much else to say.  My wife had the classic burger which was about the same taste wise as my burger.    My main beef with burger bar is for the price what you get in return.  Granted I imagine there are better items on the menu, I'm not sure it's worth spending any more to have something that may not be really really good.  If your staying on Mandalay Bay property and really want a burger you may want to try this place.  If not try either Shake Shack or Burgur, both places I prefer over Burger Bar.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

tvGflPmd7i1ABhj5u9umHQ.text: Great choice of burgers and fixins- service from Jessica was great - except food from kitchen was slow. Busy on Saturday night.  Would definitely recommend trying out once- good vegan / vegetarian option too.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

F10cTHKer6X8D28JUb4OcQ.text: Nothing better than a burger and a beer. Custom made, I added aged cheddar cheese, grilled onions and sweet peppers. Garlic fries a must with jalapeno ketchup.   Good  food and the service was fantastic!  Gustavo was our server. Very personable, provided spot in recommendations and a fun story about his move to Vegas from MexiCali.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef burger,cheddar, grilled onions and peppers with  garlic fries...Yum!

y-aqE8Wx-x5qdnnW1Ks_ig.text: If you're going to charge a minimum of 19.50 for a burger, and you have the word "burger" in the name of your restaurant, you better have an amazing burger.   Unfortunately, this place does not. Lukewarm burger that is missing any sense of seasoning. The fries lacked salt as well. Skinny fries were fine, fat fries a bit soggy. The "hangover sauce", was just watery thousand island dressing with shredded lettuce mixed in.  Also, who puts a burger on a goddamn baguette? The burger falls out as does the toppings as you're pulling on the baguette with your teeth, like a dog pulling on a rope.

7IwRBP9hUbNplIwKmKzqZw.text: I decided to give this place a try but was disappointed with the burgers.   The interior was beautiful. I love restaurants with mahogany wood and dim lighting. The restaurant was busy but there was no wait.   The menu had a small selection of specially crafted burgers and gave you an option of crafting your own. My friends ordered the Reuben burger and the Greek burger. I ordered the baguette burger.   My friends stated their burgers were bland and too small. They did not think the price was worth it but they did like that the burgers come with fries. I agree that the burger was not worth the price. I ordered my burger medium rare and it was not. The spinach in my burger tasted like they were not properly washed. The brie cheese did not work well with the burger. I could only manage to eat half of it even though I was hungry. Keep in mind the burger is tiny, you can see my picture to what I am talking about. I would not recommend anyone coming to this place for burgers.   I figured people would come here for the big selection of beers.   I'm clearly not Vegan/Vegetarian but I assume that Vegans/Vegetarians would be upset to find out that their fries are being fried in the same oil as bacon. I found a piece of bacon at the bottom of my sweet potato fries.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I would assume vegans would not be happy to find a piece of bacon in their fries.
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2oypVYZv-1ezZixiIdDb9g.text: Wandering around trying to find food in the mandalay bay...well a burger joint!  A nice young woman at the front showed us the happy hour menu Incase we decided to wait the extra half hour which I thought was nice of her!  We decided to eat anyway and our server was very pleasant. He got out drinks right away and our order in. Food came out pretty quickly and the deschutes beer hit the spot!  They have a full bar with plenty of seats, tables and booths. The restaurant is long so it seems deceiving!  We split our meal and figured they would just bring an extra plate but our waiter, Nicholas, literally split it all for us. So nice! The burger was GREAT and so was our service. We had the hangover burger it's almost like a thousand island with lettuce. They also put the toppings on the side of the plate so you can choose what to put on. It's also nice they have outlets and USB ports in the booths Incase your phone needs some fuel from Your long escapades in vegas!  Thank my reason it's missing the one star is because it is in the mall in the casino.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

PkolI3WEwKF2nRYfskDlaA.text: I'm kind of a control freak and did my research on each hotel to see what they had to offer. I see that burger bar offered Bloody Mary with the fixings on top. Starting off our Vegas trip this was the first stop. Austin was our server who was just starting and still In training but seemed like he was a veteran. He was an excellent server. The bloody Mary's were great.. they do come with horseradish so we requested without(not a fan). The drink is $20 and i thought it would have been a little bit bigger but everything was perfect.The mini burger on top didn't have much flavor but just needed to add some ketchup.we ordered the appetizer of chicken wings-Hot... soo tasty. Me and my sister split a burger since we got an appetizer and the drink came with food on it. Knowing that me and my sister was splitting Austin already had cut and separated on plates for us.I was sooo full I couldn't even finish my half burger. Located in the Mandalay Bay; stop by and see Austin you won't be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken wings -hot
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The ultimate Bloody Mary
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MwwoHFethf_9TSfZFF1OSw.text: I'd reserved a lunchtime table in advance for our group of 18, and we were seated immediately when we arrived. One reason I chose Burger Bar, aside from its location, is that the full menu was available to us. Many restaurants in Mandalay Bay & Luxor offer a scaled-down menu for group reservations, which defeats the purpose of choosing a restaurant with a broad menu for our picky eaters.  I started with a Long Beach Tea, which was strong yet yummy. Then I ordered the Kobe beef burger, cooked medium rare, and added baby spinach & provolone. This burger was amazing! Its not often that I remember a menu description as being 100% accurate, but this burger really did melt in my mouth. I also chose steak fries, which were equally delicious. In fact, I ate some cold fries over the next couple of days and was surprised at how tasty they still were.  Our server on this day was simply outstanding. And the kitchen was on its toes as well. I was hoping to have an opportunity to stop by here again during my Vegas visit, so I could try one of their alcoholic milkshakes, but I unfortunately ran out of time. Nonetheless, I thoroughly enjoyed our lunch experience here at Burger Bar, and definitely plan to return.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My burger... Kobe beef, medium-rare, with provolone, spinach, &amp; mayo, plus steak fries (which were outstanding cold).
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Long Beach Tea

A-jJncAMNdUhe5VkcS5LyA.text: Back again. This time with kids. I was really surprised to see the kids pasta come out with a fruit dish and carrots/celery with ranch. Pretty nice setup. The rest of my party (of adults) were pretty jealous lol.  We had a variety of make your own burgers...all good.  They were out of some beers and the flame to make the s'mores dessert so that's kinda sad. A restaurant should stay stocked or at least tell people what they're out of before we order it.

ygD2cOwBD1joD4eabQer2g.text: YUUUUUUUMMY! We come here every time we stay at Mandalay Bay. Love the TVs at the tables where you can catch a game while you eat. Today we had wings, onion rings, zucchini fries, skinny fries, fat fries, & burgers. We ate until we were so full it hurt. All of it was so good. I've never had anything here I didn't love. It's consistently excellent.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gxDDqMfzZT0rbak9V_2BvQ.text: Last night, it happened... I finally found the best milkshake I have EVER tasted!   Okay, let me start from the beginning.   We wanted a laid back, yet high quality experience for our anniversary dinner last night. After researching all of the restaurants at the Mandalay Bay(where we are staying), The Burger Bar really caught our eye. We called ahead 30 minutes to get our name on the list & when we arrived we were immediately seated. Ps. This was 8pm on a Sunday night.   The restaurant was clean, organized for such a small space, and a super fun atmosphere! My husband was excited to see a small TV in our booth playing the basketball game.   Our waitress, was super friendly & helpful! Nothing but positive things to say about any of the staff members we came in contact with.   We started out with the mozzarella sticks + marinara sauce. YUM! The sticks themselves were probably a 7/10, but the marinara sauce was TO DIE FOR! I was eating the leftover sauce out of the bowl with my fork LOL  Next we did the "Build Your Burger Experience." So many meat, bun, toppings, and sauce choices! I had the grilled chicken sandwich on a sesame bun, with avocado, Brie, and caramelized onion. I tried every aspect by itself & as a whole. Amazing ingredients!! Nothing tasted frozen or like it had been sitting around. My husband had the angus beef burger with avocado, pepper jack, grilled onion, on a sesame bun. He wasn't blown away by his burger, but he also commented that he feels it's his on fault for not putting any sauce on it. I just feel like you shouldn't need sauce for a really good burger though, ya feel?   Finally, on to the best milkshake I've ever had..  We shared the "Build Your Own" milkshake! We did a coffee ice cream base, Nutella sauce, Oreo, and chocolate whip cream! The chocolate whip cream was homemade! It was so far from Hershey. Almost like it had a European taste. This milkshake was rich in flavor, but didn't taste like it had any extra sugary "fillers ." You could just tell that every ingredient was high quality.  I cannot wait to go back for this milkshake, but next time I'm getting my own ;-)  Overall, really great experience! I would absolutely recommend to friends/family & hopefully will be back soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JhWat1wxZGt94jm8h1Cwsw.text: We were at the Tropicana and were craving burgers. This seemed to be the nearest quality place within a reasonable walk and it did the job!  THE WAIT: None on a Saturday around 10pm for two of us. We got our own booth, with our own TV and all.   THE COST: $42 before tips for 2 beers, a side of fries, and a burger.   * Fat Fries ($3.95) - 3.5 stars I was craving potato wedges and these were good. A tad on the soft side, could have used slightly more crisp.   * Reuben Burger ($20.20) - 3.5 stars Juicy and full of flavor, great melty cheese and corned beef. Good way to kick off our weekend in Vegas.

8COSyWQG9kVEVhDY-yizNw.text: I've been here a few times before and remember having a better experience, but I just came for a happy hour and we got the chicken parm sliders and the burger sliders. The bread was nearly stale, very chewy and just not what I expect out of a nicer burger place. The burger seemed like it had American cheese on it too, and the chicken slider was very dry. I was VERY hungry coming here today so anything should have been good, but I've had way better sliders elsewhere.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Slider

hC3KrX3VF2Lp_Fi0KJSqKQ.text: Mets some friends here for a quick bite and beer talk. Probably the most expensive burger & fries I've ever had. Build your own with Kobe beef, black truffles, truffle sauce, and truffle fries. Almost $70, lol. Add a few beers, and you're looking at a $100 snack before tip. Was it worth it? Yes & No. I'm glad I tried it, but probably wouldn't do it again. After all of the hype, it wasn't even that memorable. I was truly hoping for more. It's all good. Overall, I enjoyed my experience. Come on. Twas Las Vegas, baby.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

IDHNusABkZq_LTHXLjmd0Q.text: Burgers were phenomenal! I had the Philly cheesesteak burger, it was prepared a very accurate "medium." It was so big I couldn't finish it. My family also had a bacon burger, regular cheeseburger, and the chili burger which were also raved about. The onion rings were very crispy and delicious. Definitely check it out.

YFuXaW8tagEXBi5Fq3xiAQ.text: Pretty good pick for a burger joint if you are staying at Luxor or Mandalay Bay. Lots of options for burgers here at fairly standard Vegas food prices, but I went immediately for the custom burger option due to the wide variety of options. The meat was tender and juicy while the buns and toppings were great. Size of the burger is pretty standard but they pack it with content (if you're a fatass like me) so it's nice and filling. Their hangover sauce is interesting too, so definitely the right pick if you want some good burger s after a night out on the strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Custom buffalo burger

HEeZzR1zCQ3D2UPSyB8HvQ.text: I had been told of this place by friends for years and the experience did not disappoint.  An amazing menu of different burgs and sides with amazing flavors and styles.  The presentation and customer service were over the top and the craft beers were a perfect compliment. I'll be back

RLXU55qjho7y_WK6T6uBXQ.text: This place is everything the food channel said it was..except it also has great bar service too! Clements our bartender had great recommendations and provided great service. Our Kobe, black truffle burger with zucchini fries was magical. This burger is the bulgari of burgers!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Black truffle Kobe make your own burger with mushroom bun and black truffle sauce...MAGICAL.
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Black truffle sauce that we used for our burger and zucchini fries!!!

xlh4xCz7l_KuvtSv7fWU4A.text: Burger Bar...what a welcome you gave us as our first meal in Vegas...   We live near enough to SF that we shouldn't have to travel to Vegas to try the place, but it was on my itinerary anyway.  It did not disappoint.    I went classic with my burger- beef, cheddar, the normal stuff...it was phenomenal.  They have about a million beers on tap so the boyfriend was happy too.  We sat at the counter so there was no wait because at 3:00 on a Friday afternoon, the place was pretty busy.   It's not cheap, but it's quality and well worth it.  I was a happy, stuffed camper after my meal here.    Job well done, Hubert.

mCT8kD6_2ZIuax5JcBS0Ng.text: $60 burger sounds crazy but it is that good. You have to try the Rossini once in your life time. Kobe beef patty topped with a thick pc of foie gras and black truffle on a truffle bun. How can you beat that? It is a little rich and might be a good idea to share one. Everyone that I have brought here loves it. You will not regret it.

lvTzGk0jqI2Kg2RZ8swZWw.text: Best burger in Vegas. Funniest part about my experience at Burger Bar was watching Criss Angel walk out as I was walking in. The best part was the burger, obviously.  I order the Kobe burger, medium-rare, with Swiss cheese and a lobster tail. The burger, alone, is the tastiest piece of meat I've ever eaten on a bun. Perfectly cooked, juicy, and delicious. Great, fresh lobster tail, as well. I also love the way Swiss cheese compliments the burger, it was nice for a change.  Burger Bar is always on my Hit-List when I'm in Vegas.

uHfNQA-6sQCsxmNyYO2Esg.text: Had a great lunch here.  Took about 15 minutes to get seated but it was worth it.  Service was excellent.  My Hangover Burger was perfectly cooked and very tasty.  I would recommend this place to anyone who shares my love of burgers!

1hRq_IEO5jwgn7igpvGaDQ.text: Surf and Turf burger was delicious!!! Lobster and asparagus...amazing! Would highly recommend this place.

0vKKaF-eUp8jQDk17mQ7ug.text: Burger Bar in the mall area of Mandalay Bay has excellent service and good food.   Ordered the best beef "Kobe" with button mushroom, jalapeno  Jack cheese, jalapeno, bacon, on wheat with  skinney fries. Ice tea.   Used the build your own burger. Don't forget to order a flavor or sauce. This would of been great with BBQ sauce.  They even have option of flavors like pesto. They also serve lobster with burgers.  No need for lobster this meal kept me full the entire day.   Noticed they had pumpkin flavor beer. Not a beer drinker just went for lunch but their was a full bar. Great place to eat and walk around after. Atmosphere was great. Everyone was friendly and the drink refills kept coming.  My only beef "no pun intended" with this place is if Im going to eat at one of your fancy Mandalay bay restaurants, I should be able to Valet.

uWREl_on4JCg30RQi94PbA.text: i had the veggie burger with wheat bread and peperjack cheese and onion rings. it was a great first vegas meal while waiting to check in. prices were reasonable and the service was awesome. i would recommend this place if you're in the mood for a good burger and i would definitely eat her again.

mZQ5X413u3HWGnCqZ1RfNg.text: Great burger, great people watching, and great beer.  What more do you need?   Good selection of burgers - ranging from organic to kobe - and all the toppings you could ever want.  I went with the organic burger on a sesame seed bun with american cheese.  You can't go wrong.  It was cooked perfectly medium and with great flavor.  The side of zucchini sticks (think mozzarella sticks, but zucchini instead of mozzarella) were great option if you don't want the fries.    Well worth the trip to Mandalay Bay for this burger.

V6EOlHf0Kwp5B0yRHvvBJA.text: Been here a few times.  Really if you are in the mood for a burger and want variety and choice at a good price...definitely hit it up. I had the lamb burger my third time there and have had buffalo and regular.  All taste great, great selection of toppings etc  Ive tried a coupel shakes. really great. The Sangria  was just average.  I guess this is not the place to get Sangria.  Check it out. Its a nice place, its not really a scene if you want that, but otherwise thumbs up

1QHhaj-WyIFuVD4EZru0qg.text: Amazing service and amazing food. The angus beef is soft, juicey and prepared perfectly. The portion is huge that I shared with my hubs. Do yourself a favor and get skinny fries or sweet potatoe fries with honey cinnamon.

xA0l0iFQYMtWpvHejEtKmw.text: Oh how I love this place.I felt bad because I ordered the wings this time (burger sinner!) but they were still great.Very good beer selection.This place is always a go when we're in Vegas.

jnseDPh9R3M_JmUU52ZzUw.text: This place was just alright. We went to dinner here before heading to the Lady Gaga concert at MGM. For the price I expected a better meal. I probably wont go back here again.

utPe6zFVkmVx3KlXHeGfJg.text: In a word: Yum!  I shared the Hubert Keller burger, surf-n-turf burger, and one of the alcoholic milkshakes (you heard me) with my friend.  The Hubert Keller burger (buffalo meat, blue cheese, caramelized onions) was TO DIE FOR!  I would definitely recommend it.  The surf and turf was a little disappointing, which is why I'm only giving this review 4 stars, but that may be because the beef just didn't compare to the buffalo.  I don't think alcoholic milkshakes require additional explanation.  Our server was super friendly and helpful and it was a trip to see her twin working on the opposite side of the restaurant.  I will definitely stop by the next time I'm on the south end of the strip.

xRmCPvYV5iVmoTfSeGUogg.text: This is #2 out of the best burgers ever #1 is in NYC  and #3 is in NJ.  I had the Kobe Beef burger and it was amazing.  If you are in the area and want a memorable burger this is the place.

hYIhITmYh3FDJnim0200xQ.text: We had the Kobe Burger and the American Classic, with sweet potato fries, onion rings, and the Pink Monkey milkshake (strawberries, bananas, and whipped cream).  The Kobe Burger was quite tasty although pricey at $17. The American Classic was topped with a plentiful amount of bacon which made it very good. The milkshake was also very good - you can taste the real fruit ingredients they used to make it but again was pretty expensive at $8.75.   Although I enjoyed the meal it was not amazing - there are better options in Vegas for your money.

mhyQvT96AZovGjIbD52lzg.text: Turning a burger into fine food is like trying to convert a trailer into a mansion. You can throw all the Ethan Allen you like at it, it's still going to be just a trailer. If I'm going to pay $60 for a burger named after some dead French dude, I want it topped with more than just foie gras and truffles.  I call it the "Screw You Burger":  Organic Wild Sustainable Space Beef Fragrant Cheese from a Virgin Goat Amaebi stuffed in Lobster Tails Deep-Fried Elephant Testicles Heinz Catsup  Regal dining at its best.  But I settled for the $9 double-pattied veggie burger instead, and I was more than satisfied...

1sdgS8LhE50gpGAJFhI5Aw.text: Best lunch I've ever had. Got the Kobe burger and beer float sampler. If you haven't had beer floats before, don't worry. These are awesome. And the burger was probably the best I've ever had. Go here. You won't regret it.

qr3Y90IKVa68c_m4ttgBQQ.text: First time trying this place. Food is great but our service was awful! The busboy did more for us than our waitress. Food is also a little pricey, but still good flavor.

N2kfpbXndybXTVQaatvfaQ.text: This is the 2nd time I have been to burger bar and I love it.. there are actually nights that I dream about the Hubert Keller burger... spinach, ciabatta bun, blue cheese, and mushrooms. The flavors are fantastic and both times I've been everyone in my party had their burgers cooked to perfect temperature.   Skinny fries and zucchini fries are great, don't miss an opportunity to order the sauces for dipping. Simply delicious!  It is a little pricey, but worth it. The boozy milkshakes are delicious and the beer list of imports and craft beers are fantastic.   Service has been unobtrusive both times, although the first time we went the waitress seamed a little overwhelmed, but the 2nd time we loved our server.  Great place and I wll keep dreaming about those burgers until the next time I go.

jHBuLPQloQaYnEFMWcPWsw.text: Where else can you get a burger that's made the way you want. If there is another place by all means let me know. You can pick the meat the bun even the type of French fries you want. The milkshakes are great too.

tWNAsXb0_M3L1DzxNTlInw.text: We ordered happy hour sliders and they were delicious!  The bun was soft and fresh and the meat was done medium just the way we like it!  It was definitely pretty pricy for what you get and that's why this place was given 4 stars instead of 5.

BjlnmGlO4jA3D24rcNB6aQ.text: My husband and I were searching for a place to have dinner while staying at the Mandalay Bay and we decided upon the Burger Bar.  Although the Yelp app stats this restaurant takes reservations it in fact DOES NOT.  When we arrived we were told that there would be a 15 minute wait.  It was actually more like a 5 minute wait. Upon entering there was loud music playing overhead and TVs in the booths.  We ended up sitting at a table which was nice because it was more intimate.  We checked out the menu and decided to build our own burger.  The choices they have to build your own burger are limited but they did have selections that I liked. I ordered the angus beef with provolone, avocado and portobello mushrooms on a ciabatta bun with a raspberry ice tea. We also ordered the Fry Sampler with mozzarella cheese sticks, onion rings and skinny fries.  When I asked our waitress Daylene (which is a pretty name by the way) if they had honey mustard, she gave me a heads up saying some customers DID LIKE and some customers DID NOT LIKE the honey mustard sauce.  Our sampler came out pretty quickly and the honey mustard was good.  When our burgers arrived I realized they did not come with fries on the plate. That was okay because we still had the fries from the sampler.  I have to say, my burger was tasty. Better than a Slaters burger. I actually was only able to eat half of my burger.  I'm not sure how kid friendly this restaurant is, but it sure is adult friendly. Would we go back, heck yah we would!!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Build your own: angus beef, provolone, portobello mushrooms and avocado on a ciabatta bun.  Yummy!

XhIJubMkTgb_QrmIOIDhvQ.text: I didn't have a yelp account but with the service I got today I had to make one! Andres was our server today, and let me just say I've never experienced such a great customer service like we did today!!! People like him need to be acknowledged! He took the time to explain all the questions we had in regards to the menu and even though we could tell he was busy, he did not seem annoyed or in a hurry to explain everything!! Which I find that amazing! And he also had a sense of humor! He was very attentive with us and with other tables as well! We did not have to ask him for refills or really anything because he was on top of everything!! Knowing how busy he was, he did not stop giving us an excellent service!!! Thank you Andres so much for everything you did tonight! I also work at a restaurant and I know how stressful it can be! As much as you try to please people sometimes you just can't. Thanks to your service and the delicious burgers we had, We will be coming back for sure!! Thanks again!!!!

tbWGpeRzn35-fQ8Q66YS3g.text: Burger Bar @ Mandalay Bay LV: Strip Saturday April 24, 2011 Four Stars  30 Minute Wait.  No Problem.  Slip the Hostess a $20 and the wait seemed to disappear.  I love Vegas b/c all propriety does not exist.  There was a great beer selection but I did not partake b/c I was already wrecked for the last few nights. The waitress filled my water glass at least 15 times. The Surf and Turf Burger was amazing.  The Build Your Own Burger was great too.  Thats all I really remember.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Decadence: Beef and Lobster and Asparagus.

3L23CVSXqZGrfYBBfQEnSQ.text: Great burgers! You can create your own and they split the burger, fries & condiments for you if you're sharing with another person. Liked that they had shoestring fries and the burger was cooked just right. Will definitely come back again!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half of a build your own burger &amp; fries.

ICmI42IT3krhQEmiqp-aJQ.text: This was my first time to Burger Bar and only knew of this place from Yelp and ironically, friends from out of town. Most of my Yelp buds gave Burger Bar good ratings, so I knew a meat feast was inevitable.   Shawn H. put out a UYE for Burger Bar and I took advantage of this opportunity. Keep in mind that Burger Bar is located inside Mandalay Bay.  Most restaurants tend to cost a little more in a casino on the strip.  But at Burger Bar, prices are fairly cheap considering its location.  Burger Bar has a huge selection and you can also create your own burger.  These are all great call outs for a burger joint. But first things first, I need to point out is that this visit was during Lent in which red meat is currently being sidelined. Second, I don't drink much.  So, my review might not be a fair one at the moment because I am not reviewing Burger Bar for what they are known for, which is a burger and a bar.    This visit and rating is for their service and their Salmon Burger. The Salmon Burger is huge at a half pound and prepared medium well. Price is about $10 which is a good start. However, I felt that taste was lacking and the salmon patty was dry. I know salmon isn't flavorful in the first place, but I have had tasty salmon burgers at other restaurants (ie. Halphen Red in San Diego).  Since I was eating 8 oz of this stuff, I at least got about 40 grams of protein and Omega 3's.  In all, I was disappointed with my salmon burger.   The service is pretty good considering that our party was fairly big.  Burger Bar is very accommodating and the staff is excellent.  You can say that the service almost cancelled out the poor taste of the salmon burger.  I have not given up on Burger Bar. I still have their real burgers to try and based on what other Yelpers have stated already, this is what they are known for.   PS:  This was a Shawn H's UYE.  I had a great time with other Yelp friends.  Thanks again Shawn for putting this together.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Thick piece of Salmon
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon Burger w/Fries

jwuoZQECCTsfIjIeReE_-Q.text: While it's not the best burger on the strip, it's still a pretty good one. I would say that the main draw to go to this place is because of the super customizable burger menu. You can pick your bread, meat, and all your toppings. Which I really love. A great place for someone who doesn't like to order the burgers offered on the menu. Fun atmosphere as well. If you are looking for a chill, not too crazy busy place, without a super long wait like Gordon Ramsey's burgr, this is a great place to check out.

9UBTkDbUDIr7fRtgDjyoSg.text: Boyfriend and I came here on a whim.  It was our first day on our Vegas Vacation, and we came in hungry.  We both love burgers, and we were staying in the Luxor.  As Luxor is connected to Mandalay Bay, Burger bar was close.  Absolutely delicious.  I made my own burger and my boyfriend got the buffalo burger.  We were both blown away.  Serious deliciousness.  The service was also prompt.  We came in for lunch, so I don't know if the dinner crowd and service may be different, but our experience was quick, friendly, and hands down delicious.  We will definitely be back.  YAY for BURGER BAR!!

28vmLpOhiTqOB-K35HY8-g.text: Loved this place!  I heard the best burger of your life is here... it is, pay lots and try The Rossini: "Kobe Style Wagyu Beef from Australia, sauteed foie gras and shaved truffles on an onion bun. Named after a XIXth Century Italian composer whose love for fine food was legendary. The preparation always includes foie gras, truffles and a rich brown sauce - in this case, Black Perigord Truffle."  It was amazing although a bit small (it comes with yummy fries though).  Also, had grilled shrimp salad yumminess.  Finally had the chocolate donut burger dessert which was good.  Staff was very friendly and the ambiance was nice (TV at each booth!).

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled Shrimp Salad
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Rossini

6XiiQ6-NzqTqhyVwzILbwg.text: The four of us did the build your own burger option, and all of ours came out cooked to the right temp and delicious! The service was fast and attentive, the food was tasty, and the beer and cocktail list was expansive. Would definitely come back next time we're in Vegas!

dxAhSS29aoqvVhv96lmcPg.text: I stopped by here this weekend with a friend, hearing that these are the some of the best burgers in Vegas. We were seated quickly upon arriving and the place wasn't very crowded, even on a Saturday eve.  I had a Kobe beef burger with Truffle fries. The meat was solid, albeit not spectacular; I'm not sure it was worth the extra cost in comparison to the standard Angus beef. However, the truffle fries with the truffle mayo were absolutely amazing and were absolutely worth paying the extra money for. Some of the best I'd ever had.   The service was OK. It took at least 30 minutes from ordering to get our food, despite the place being about half full.  I would come back if only just for the Truffle fries!

erz27CK99aUugGDx6l6Z3Q.text: I ordered the burger with the melted brie. It was amazing. But that wasn't the best part... Erin's service was some of the best I have ever received at a restaurant. No exaggeration.

x-r0kO1TK8JOZWMEsxCPYg.text: Great hamburgers the best, great service and really friendly staff and also the milk shakes are delicious

mMPQhnioZwjG9IvGwvrdpw.text: My buddy and I were looking for a place to eat and saw this place had great reviews.  I am a big burger guy and Los Angeles has a lot of competitive burger places.  My favorite, if you have been to LA, is Father's Office in Culver City.    I had the Hubert Keller burger for about $25.  It was a solid burger.  My quip is that I do not think it was worth $25.  Maybe $15.  Considering that we can get an In-N-Out Double double for about $8, I would expect twice as good or three times as good and it did not live up to that metric.  The atmosphere is great and the waitresses are hot.  My buddy and I grabbed a seat at the counter quickly and easily.  It was easy to watch the bowl games.  If you are looking for a decent alternative to the other more pricey places on the strip, give this place a try.  Given that this is Vegas, nothing on the strip will be cheap, so if you are looking for more affordable options, plan to drive a bit off the strip.

Met9jlr-IpHT7dDVJjW5Tg.text: We went here to have lunch with a friend that works at the "Delano" Nothing really special about this place except their zucchini fries, hands down the best zucchini fries I've had other than that I'm not really a big fan of burgers but how do you mess up a burger? Their burgers were cold and bland and our food took about 30 mins to come out.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Zucchini fries
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The &#34;All American&#34;

oNKjrw1a-QBNNRWe_bD2iA.text: Burgers on point. Couldnt ask for anymore.. Wings are bomb too.. Sweet potato fries even better with a heineken..

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

UtDIgH4jDeh-Jd46Bl4vXQ.text: The waitress was not a fake "over the top" nice waitress but rather a more genuine nice person. The burger as cooked perfectly and the ingredients were high quality. I also asked a milkshake that was pretty good. To finish off they also have Italian expresso! Perfect meal! I definitely recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Expresso

NtlmhkIHZyxkbz9ppS6TnQ.text: Came in the night of the canelo fight.  Hostess said bar was the fastest service  Sat there for a min. Meaning like 10 minutes. Ordered a beer and what i wanted I ordered wings . Waited 30 mins for cold wings and fries .  My server was patrick  And idk if the food runners are slow at taking food out but the experience was horrible.

tbdiPUr_GOi5NtFc1FfdIQ.text: That is a TASTY BURGER!!! Yes the burgers here are some of the best in Vegas!! The toppings list is a work of art, as is the various choices of meat to make the burgers. The bar is a nice place to sit and eat the burger as there is an impressive choice of beers on tap and in bottles. The staff is friendly and efficient, and the burgers are cooked to order, so a Med/rare comes out exactly that!! Well worth the price and the trip to MB!!

LeEVTG-REZ4gK6Gv1d6rSQ.text: Burger Bar is pretty cool. Love the extensive BYOB (Build Your Own Burger) menu, which includes specialty items like Kobe beef patties, homemade dijon, jalepeno bacon, and other tasty options for a little extra $$. Obviously, it caaan get kinda pricy once you start adding more & more & more to your burger... but overall, decent prices for a good burger on the Strip.

n89XFiyxUXs83Qy9VikmMw.text: Get the Rossini. Don't look back. Best burger ever. It comes with a dessert burger that is also amazing. Their fries are great too, especially with the truffle oil.

LxbhVl4yMo1jMdIYm4r8IA.text: Four of us were looking to have dinner here last week during our last night in Vegas after a trade show ended.  The two hostesses said there would be a 15 minute wait.  I walked to the back and saw two open booths.  They said they were for larger parties.  After a few moments of pleading we got our booth.  Burgers were decent although BLT at Mirage is nicer with a better ambiance also.  Burger Bar has a lot of hard surfaces so loud voices were bouncing at us from everywhere.    Decent place at a reasonable price.

ygU2sfhI62urAZQDGpmlaw.text: I was a tad disappointed with this burger bar. With Hubert Keller i had high hopes. I had watched him on PBS make the vegeterian burger and decided to go for it with the skinny fries. It was A-OK burger nothing that made me swoon. Husband ordered the Keller special again not spectacular, what was good were the steak fries, fresh and delicious. Maybe my expectations were very high, the burgers didnt pack the punch i expected.

wvtkPRj5XDsMqHJ-EZPb6g.text: the burgers were absolutely delicious definitely one of the best burgers i've ever had the pleasure of eating. you can't go wrong with anything on the menu. but what actually made me write this review and give this place a 5 star rating were our servers Erin and her twin sister Ashley. actually it was pretty crazy cuz at first we didn't realize that they were twins and that more than one person was our server. there were times where she'd exit from the right side of the restaurant and two seconds later magically appear from the left side. i swear for a while i thought she had some kind of teleporting super power and i'd found a real live mutant (x-men reference).   the service they provided was absolutely brilliant my glass literally never reached the bottom without either of them coming to our table to refill our drinks our orders were taken right away and arrived relatively quickly. they were so nice and friendly and awesome. These women definitely deserve a raise or a promotion or something because the service they provided at this burger joint was even better than the service i've gotten in much fancier much more expensive fine dining restaurants. if you're ever at Burger Bar look for either Erin or Ashley (or bothe of them) and i will guarantee that your dining experience will be as good as the transcendentally excellent burgers.

5VgDv2SudwE-YaLe_OUWJw.text: A friend of mine suggested this place. I have to say I enjoyed it very much. I ordered the Surf & Turf burger which had lobster. Lobster was a little tough and some garlic butter would have been nice. The patty itself was great. Nice and juicy. Bun was fresh. The fries were awesome. I'm a huge fan of french fries and I have to rank Burger Bar's as one of the best. Service was good. They took our order quickly but they did not rush us. Next Vegas trip I am definitely going back.

NVLqja5LRIecHXJBd7lxWw.text: We were most disappointed to find that this place does not at all live up to the hype.  My husband ordered the Kobe burger and I ordered the Black Angus beef burger.  Honestly, these burgers were completely average, comparable to something you'd find at Red Robin, and not worth the price, the wait time, or the dingbat waitresses.  The sides were good, as was the huge selections of beers, but a better value can be found elsewhere, even in Vegas.

1u3KXObpf8J0C5Bx6lQjeQ.text: This place is a great concept.  Just needs some fine tuning. Service for example.  Horrendous.  Worst service of our whole trip which was five days!! I had a angus burger cause I couldn't pony up the cash for buffalo or american kobe.  Buffalo burgers in SF cost less than HALF of that by the way. So I put pesto and carmelized onions with peppered bacon and extra pickles.  I also added the sweet potato fries which were nothing to write home about.  The buffalo fries were much better but still nothing special. Basically this is an overpriced version of the Counter.  EXCEPT they have dessert burgers. We tried the chocolate burger - a donut with no hole cut in half with a "burger" of chocolate ganache which looked like a turd, strawberries, and this slice of yellow "cheese" that was passionfruit jelly.  One bite was enough.   It was a fun experience but WAY too pricy for what it is.  And bad service too.

_3-6rMHGqjx4yRjrnd2vUw.text: Went here with a couple of friends on my first trip to Vegas. What a neat concept! You build your own burger by picking the bun, type of meat and any toppings you like. Interesting options including truffles, red wine reduction sauce, and kobe beef.

VFqU__vO-Cr6TAaEDhfF8g.text: Fantastic burger, maybe the best burger. I go to Vegas for a convention every year and make the pilgrimage to Mandalay every time I'm in town. The Chef is the auspicious Hubert Keller of Fluer des Lys Restaurant (SF/LV). At the Vegas restaurant they have an on-site butcher, all the ingredients are fresh, they even have a vegan burger for the non-meat eater. I usually go with 'the Traditional', BB also has a full bar, hence the name. The service is good, and the prices are indicative of a 4 or 5 star restaurant, but at the end of the day, it's worth the splurge. Burger Bar will be opening soon in Union Square for those that stay closer to home. Defn. worth the wait. . . .

xxlAoW2q3JeAru577KEUxQ.text: Yes it's expensive but it's very much worth it. The ground beef is shredded fresh daily from good steaks and so you can safely eat the burgers with a little pink in them. They hubby ordered the Kobe beef burger with sprouts, bacon, swiss and barbecue sauce. I ordered the turkey burger with portobello, swiss and carmelized onions. It was the tastiest burger I've ever eaten. The shoestring fries are to die for as well. The service was great and everyone was very nice. We spent $50 for 2 burgers, a side of fries to share, two sodas and a 20% tip. It was well worth it!!!

cJJKqnuBGHr1DhVRoUjoeg.text: I really was not too impressed with this place.  The service was insanely slow.  The burger I had was alright, but it wasn't the best burger I've ever had.  My friend and I ordered the dessert burger out of curiosity.  It was kind of gross.  I'm not really sure why this place is so popular.
