6Y4zsGs5G7PL9uktqxuzsg.text: After checking out the Bodies exhibit at the Luxor, my man and I decided to have dinner at this place..  It was such a fun experience to pick out and create our own burgers! I had the sweet potato fries with mine, which rocked. The service and burgers were pretty good, and it was a unique experience, but it didn't blow me out of the water quite like I had expected..   4 out of 5 :)

PVqLPdAGCNLrSf6yGIIbyg.text: YUM!  Great burgers and a nice selection of beers from all over.  I did not try the Kobe, truffle, fois gras $60 burger.  Instead, I ordered the turkey burger topped with avocado, homemade dijon, and cucumber slices (let, tom, onion on the side).  Delicious and super filling.  Would definitely go back when in Vegas.

uMZcR420y254AfdxXq9Z5w.text: One of my favorite burgers is Burger Bar's American Kobe Beef burger.  It has great flavor but does come at a price $16.00.  When you visit try to call ahead to reserve a table as they often have long waits.  They also feature a great selection of beers so if you get there early find a spot at the bar.

-aPyC1geW1jwu-cHS7UNnQ.text: Three of my friends got food poisoning from eating here.  Buyer beware!

e8kUwiKup_Y3t5MuzxzXqQ.text: Of course I had the Kobe, how can you not? I had it with Blue Cheese on wheat. I also split a side of sweat potato fries and onion rings and washed it all down with a pint of Dogfish Head IPA. Was this a darn good burger? Yes. Was it one of the best burgers I've ever had? Yes. Was it the best burger I've ever had? No. If you're a True connoisseur of the hamburger, then my friends look no further than Seattle's own Lunchbox Laboratory for the best burger you'll ever consume. yelp.com/biz/lunchbox-la...

Kcgt_Z51vZzsJBJJFv0iVQ.text: Don't remember what I had...it's been a few years...all I remember is that I enjoyed making my own creation....and the rest of the four people in my party enjoyed their meals as well:)

9s5st6pSCSjSPAMLV3gVlA.text: I can't accurately rate this place as I was here when I was sooo tired, that I'm surprised that I didn't pass out with my face in my food.  From what I recall the burger was pretty good, the wait was pretty long and the place was a little dark.  That is about all I can remember from this place.

kn68axsd0LPs3XNE_rkePA.text: This place was yummy!  They basically set it up so you can build your own burger plate and have the experience you want.  They have all sorts of different fries and all sorts of different burgers.  I want to go back already.  They also have an excellent selection of beers to wet your whistle with while enjoying your food.  Its hard to find a place to enjoy a Hoegaarden and your meal at the same time.

wEUXzhxpTrMZccT7d6RoFw.text: I went her again last night before the John Mayer concert.  I was blown away with how great the buffalo burger was, make sure you get it no more than medium.  They have also upped the beer selection!

nByVXVLWYdTNwJxVFBUpAA.text: We came here for the burgers and they were good but not the best we have had. They do have an awesome variety of beers including Prohibition and Stone from our local area of San Diego. We went to watch the Monday night football game and don't recommend it. I would go to a different place to watch games. But food was good and beer was also.

hdpYrVUgxIKtYI739eRyhg.text: Terrible. We ordered a kobe beef burger which tasted watery. The lamb burger which we ordered was not any better.  This was after a 40 minute wait for our food - plus a 20 minute wait for a table. There are so many better options out there.

Mp3kSX4oSrUwoVvcjHISdQ.text: In & Out is nice and all, but sometimes I like a little ambience with my burger.  This is by far the best place to get a burger in Las Vegas.  It's not convenient to get to but its worth the effort (and the extra walking will maybe burn 50 calories!)  The best part of ordering a burger here are your options.  EVERYTHING is a la carte: the burger, the buns, condiments, extras, fries.  You choose your favorite toppings to go with your favorite meat (kobe, turkey, veggie, Angus) and bun (sesame, ciabatta, etc).  You can order truffles, bacon, foie gras, and many different types of cheese to go on top.  The fries are an extra cost but we each ordered different fries to try them all out.    The tastes were very good on all facets of our meal.  My son had the choice of a burger (krabby patties) or grilled cheese; you'd think at a burger joint he would've ordered the burger but no.  The ambience here is great: servers are excellent, the lighting is cool without being too dark. The best part is the tv's at our booth which had the NFL game on from that night.    It's a little expensive but you get what you pay for in my opinion.  Looking at the other reviews here, 240 Yelpers can't be wrong!

i-I4ikb2L9nDLHJpRZpfnQ.text: This is a top notch burger joint.  If you like burgers, I don't know how you can't like this restaurant.  They make burgers the way you want them.  We couldn't believe they had a Kobe burger that was $60!  Holy crap, that better be a good burger.  Anyways, that was not what I ordered.  I had their Turkey burger on wheat with my individualized toppings and it was really tasty.  My husband ordered their Black Angus Beef burger medium rare with his selection of toppings and he loved it.  We also ordered their fat fries and their sweet potato fries, both were delicious.  I would love to return here to try some of their other burgers.  Great service, great food and therefore it gets 5 stars!!

xbuAFaTlxeJrpsV12k-MyQ.text: I absolutely love the Burger bar.  The Buffalo Burger is best burger I have ever had, and I would recommend this to anyone looking to try something different.  It is a little expensive but worth every penny.

YswMH4KaANximw3S1g43mA.text: I've eaten here several times. It's always the same....  I get my burger. I bite into my burger. I have an epiphany that this is the greatest burger I have ever had in my life. Then I realize for eighteen bucks, it better be.  Fantastic meal.... not cheap.

97YJHidmsk9A_hmNIQf60w.text: 2 stars: Meh. I've experienced better.  Nothing is as polarizing as the simple hamburger.  There's so many different arguments that can be made as to what makes the best burger.   Simple and cheap at some stand that's been around since the turn of the century? Gourmet and requiring a credit application to order at a celebrity chef's latest brainchild?  And every single combination and permutation in between.   Hubert Keller is kind of accomplished in the same way one would say Matisse was a good painter, or Larry Bird was a good shot with a basketball.   With that kind of resume, comes a certain amount of pressure to perform.   And that's my fundamental issue with Burger Bar.  It's been around for a while now, and it's definitely on its way down.  I've been here more than a few times, and after the novelty of the Rossini burger wore off, including texting pictures of the receipt to prove my street cred, and the novelty of making a few custom burgers - ooh, i can choose from different grades of meat, that are all pretty good, and don't really make a substantial difference once ground up and seasoned, to 99.97% of eaters,  this place strikes me as a big buck version of Fuddruckers that happens to have a celebrity chef endorsement.   Seriously. Think about it.   They both offer hamburgers with different grades of beef.  They both offer burgers with different types of meat. They both offer customized toppings. They both offer multiple types of fries. They both have milkshakes and floats. They both serve beer. They both cost more than in & out.   The last 2-3 times I went to Burger Bar, the service has been mediocre and delivered with absentee-level attention.   The food has been inconsistent as well, and what kind of irked me the most recent time was that I created a spicy burger, and when I told the waitress that there weren't enough jalapeno's, she brought me a thimble sized cup with more sliced peppers, and I found an extra charge for them on my bill.   Seriously?   You're charging $14 bucks for a burger and you want to put another $0.85 cents on my tab because I mentioned that the burger didn't have enough jalapenos on it when it came out of the kitchen?   Some nerve.   There are so many other burger spots and so many other celebrity chefs in Vegas with burger spots that this place is completely irrelevant at this point.   Unless you are here to try the Rossini on an expense account meal, don't bother.

AESS6pD7BON-CediE6Ma6w.text: One of my favorite places to eat in Vegas.  It's always a great place to take folks who don't get to Vegas very often and don't know where to venture out to eat outside of their hotel.    The Burger Bar has something for everybody.  They have a list of menu items they've put together as well as a create your own burger side.  Basically, you pick your bun, burger, cheese, vegetables, other toppings, and fries.  They have all kids of cheese, three or four types of bacon, many veggies, several types of onion, and even some uncommon items such as fois gras.  They have steak fries, skinny fries, sweet potato fries, seasoned fries, and zucchini fries.  You can pile it as high as you want.  The burgers are big and as delicious as you want to make them.    They even have a few dessert burgers where a doughnut serves as the bun.  Originally, they only had one and it wasn't anything great to me.  Since then, they have added a few more options that I have yet to try.  Their milkshakes are delish as well.  I usually make my own burger, but last time I ordered the sliders and they were very good.  It was a perfect choice when you're not hungry enough for a big burger.  The sliders are three mini burgers that are each different.  I'll definitely order that again.  Time and time again, this is a great place and always has something for everyone, carnivores and herbivores alike.  I'm not sure about the vegan folks though...  They do get super busy and I would highly recommend making a reservation.  Roll up your sleeves, head to the Burger Bar and see who can build a better burger!

bGG70epFZ-5k9CeBNOLJow.text: Located at the Mandalay Bay and run by the famous gourmet chef Hubert Keller, this place is a burger connoisseur's dream. Straight up burgers, from a regular old fashioned burger to grourmet kobe burgers.   I sat at the bar at the bar while I ate, and it was a week day so the place wasn't too crowded, hence I don't know how to rate the service. But as far as burgers go, if you like burgers, you must go here. For the vegetarians, they have veggie burger on the menu, and for the adventurous, they even have a buffalo burger - and no not the buffalo that accompanies the sauce - I am talking a real buffalo burger.   They also have some real funky desserts to match their burger theme. Like a donut burger or a chocolate burger. I didn't try any desserts though.   Only thing to watch out for - it may be a place that sells burgers, but its no McDonalds. Don't expect a 99 cent menu. It is a touch pricey.

FxqQ8K2wRxZhHICvhOmjQw.text: Great burgers. Lives up to the hype in my opinion. They're not the biggest burgers, but that's fine with me because I didn't feel like a complete fat slob when I devoured the whole thing. I love that you can customize your burger, although the price will add up with all the toppings. The kobe beef burger was amazing! It was tender, juicy, and perfectly cooked. Definitely one of the best burgers I've had. My wife's veggie burger was the best that she has ever had also. The size of the toppings are pretty big so if you're looking to save a little cash split the toppings with whoever you're with. The caramelized onions they gave me were plenty for two burgers. The skinny fries were nothing special but the onion rings were large, crispy and delicious. Next time I'll have to try the sweet potato fries. The black and white milkshake was tasty, with good sized chunks of cookie dough in it.

PtS0XW0TFq4819HUbCvSvw.text: The good stuff.  Good basic burgers (skip the high end stuff), good beer list, and a good menu of ingredients and sides.  The bad stuff, most things overpriced, and the service.  Sorry Todd (the server), I know we were a big table (10), but that food took forever, one order was completely forgotten, and one burger was medium well instead of medium rare.  And while my wife got the $16 buffalo burger you raved about, I got the $9 Angus and mine was better.  The fatty cow is always tastier than the lean healthy buffalo in my experience, and at double the price for lean and healthy, I am not willing to give up flava.  Fooled me once and got me to buy your pricey burger while you had an automatic 18% tip for a big group, but it won't happen again, and hopefully all the Yelpers will be on to you now.  Oh yeah, Karen got the $12 foie gras option and it was nothing to write home about. Cool that it is on the menu, but I would like it to pay it's own way too.  While I don't mind spending $88 for burgers at lunch while in Vegas, it better be over the top spectacular at that price, and this simply wasn't.    Other notes: The zucchini fries were pretty good, though a bit mushier than I would have preferred.  And this would be a 3 star place if we had just gone in, got the Angus burgers at $9+options, had our food prepared right, and got our food in less than 50 minutes, which is kind of ridiculous for a burger.  Oh yeah, also cool that this place has about 4 different fresh bun options, 3 different bacons, and about 20 or so other interesting sides.  Jsut skip the foie gras and probably the lobster, though no one in our group tried the lobster so Ic an't speak first hand for it.

73b8zzUjMf1Ndvq_lEbZXw.text: Just ate at Burger Bar. I had a Kobe burger rare with pepper bacon Monterey Jack, avacado and a fried egg. It was amazing. We also drank a bottle Justin Isosceles Reserve Wine ( there was no corkage ). This is the best burger in Vegas.

Lw40HaXo2J_WCI6-mrtlkA.text: I love their mushroom burger it's so gooood!! The staff is very friendly and I always feel welcomed.

_2vvrGCW6pfwDkyapeacNQ.text: The mouthfeel of the American Classic is like going down on a burger-flavored vagina. Do not succumb to the temptation to switch in a fancier cheese- the melted American cheese, in all of its processed glory, is what makes the burger. Soft grilled onions, gooey cheese, perfectly cooked black angus beef (medium rare or less for the right texture)... it's a gooey beefy ambrosia. I'm having a flashback just writing this review.  Yes, it's great that you can make all sorts of wacky burger combos, but stick to the classic here people. It will transport you to new levels of beefy bliss, like Bear weekend in Provincetown or the first cook-out of the summer.  It's a bit of a hike from the casino in the Mandalay (it's tucked away back in the shopping area) but it's worth the walk.

pG9RuYCSuYaxR8D63_FU7A.text: Great little spot. Bison sliders were a hit and it was definitely enough food to keep a hungry guy happy for at least a few hours. The waitress was cool as hell, and hot to boot. Had the suicide girls thing going on with tats and all.   We were a party of 7 and our high roller decided to go with the $60 burger. He said it was good but wouldn't get it again.   Another of our party lit up a cigarette and one of the bus boys came over and pretty rudely told her to put it out. I see where the guy was coming from but the attitude was unnecessary.  Shakes with alcohol were very appealing. Someone at my table got one and said it was delicious so that's something on my list next time I head to vegas.

iXbdgsBb3relE57P93AnNQ.text: If you are craving a burger...you can't top this in Vegas. OPTIONS OPTIONS OPTIONS!!! You start by selecting your meat...generous options. Then your bun type and then almost half a page of toppings. Including something like 9 types of bacon, different types of onions...all the way up to lobster. Cheap sides too...all delicious. A MUST!

cosVrVfqFP2g4YeP9mFvlQ.text: We made it a point to go to Mandalay specifically for Burger Bar since the reviews are so spectacular.    The food was fantastic, the service was fantastic, and it was the only place in Mandalay packed at 12 in the afternoon.  That speaks for itself.  My only gripe is that they didn't have any beer or drink specials.  That's pretty lame.  I thought it would be more chic for some reason.   Other than that, Burger Bar met the expectation.  I'll be hitting them up EVERY TRIP!

a24tTtBo_TnJcaBsyFeneQ.text: Excellent food, excellent service!!! We were so pleased and couldn't stop talking about it. Beer, fry, fry sauce, and even "beer float" flights on a paddle.  Fun! We sat at the bar-Ordered skinny fries, fried pickles, mozzarella sticks, buffalo chef burger, and a make your own burger. Hoppy beers on tap and truffle mayo put it over the top.

M10JuJsLgulH7GelVBpd0g.text: 1. choose your meat: angus beef, kobe, lamb... 2. pick your toppings (this is where the fun begins...): choose from items like anchovies, black truffles, prociutto, fried egg... 3. pick your cheese (all different kinds) 4. pick your fries: sweet potato, zucchini, onion  Viola! And you have yourself the best burger EVER custom made with all your favorite items.

6rWV152_JLLjwdfz0EsZjg.text: I had a great time dining here and thought it was a unique experience.  I was a bit overwhelmed by the multiple choices for my burger : on buns there's  Sesame / Onion / Whole Wheat / Plain / Ciabatta.  And they have a  variety of choices to fill your burger and  other options to replace the regular burger patty like lobster or salmon.  Their burgers are a bit on the expensive side, but what isn't expensive dining in Vegas.  Also there's salad options, kids meal and sweet burgers ( choco burger, pb and j burger, and creamy cheese cake burger).

fxcrT8ebayqponUPctIXmw.text: Had a great time at the burger bar. Drinks were great, appetizer was very filling, build your burger was a great option. We had the raspberry and lemon sorbets. If just a couple, recommend one, it was enough to feed 4-6 people.

5sJ-HqmgaWcrC38-lvqyRw.text: I had the Hells Kitchen Burger and my husband had the Farm Burger. Both burgers were delicious!  My husband said he did not want to swallow his burger because it tasted so good. We also had truffle fries which were super delicious!  I would definitely return!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hells Kitchen Burger

U_-sC22JKNDctkLWnLWquA.text: I've been to Burger Bar several times on trips to Vegas. Good burger at a decent price for Vegas.  My wife and I had the milkshake, which was meh. I enjoy the ability to substitute the fat fries for the skinny.  All in all, a good option for the mid-range budget in LV.

0eBJ188s85AcSSlgw1W72w.text: Decent burgers and friendly service (kind of, read on...). Found it because a few of us were craving a gourmet burger one morning in Vegas. This place seemed to be one of the top recommendations. Eh...  The burger was okay. I forget what we ordered, but we had four different kinds. All were probably just below the level of The Counter (pretty common in southern California), which isn't saying much.   Service started off pretty good, and then suddenly turned ridiculously rude towards the end of our meal. I'm not quite sure what went wrong. We were all pretty friendly, and given that we were all slightly hungover, we weren't exactly loud or obnoxious. We didn't send our server running back for numerous things right after she came back, we didn't talk to her rudely, we didn't grab the wrong server and demand service, we ordered a good amount of beers and food for our group, we didn't order the cheapest thing on the menu and ask for waters all-around... in summary: we really didn't do anything that would piss off a server (and I've waited tables for years during college, so I know what those are)...   Luckily, we were too hungry, hungover, and close to finishing our meal to give much of a shit. We got the bill, left a sizeable tip to let her know we weren't going to stoop to her level of rudeness, and walked out. Given better (or at least more consistent) service, I'd say 3.5 stars, but a 1.5-2 for managing to almost ruin a fairly-OK meal...

JYshpG29gzW_PWaWR0sZVA.text: My burger of choice is alway build your own. I usually just get standard angus medium with chipotle aioli and either prosciutto or jalapeno bacon with fat fries with a side chipotle aioli to dip. So good!! I alway want desert but too full when done. They also have a good beer selection with some hard to find hefeweisens   The burgers are definately 5 stars and the value is very good. You get to truly customize your burgers and it is hard to decide without the usual set options.  The service and seating are really bad though at times. Our waitress went on break at some point during our meal and could not get refils or our check without flagging down people. The seating was also bad because if you were a duo you werent allowed to sit in a booth. so, we had to sit at small table in the middle of the narrow aisles in the way of everything.  I have been here a lot now and I feel it is the best burger in town. Still the service is sporadic.

7S0FyXpdbJdH7_9-O9t8cg.text: Great Food and Excellent Service!! I recently met a client who was staying at the Mandalay Bay, he suggested that we try Burger Bar as it was convenient and he had heard good things about it.  I was pleasantly surprised to find out that they grind their own meat, plus they have a lot of options like lamb, bison and grass fed beef burgers, and sweet potato fries.  I will definitely be going back soon!

6wBlV0ANhgoovhS9_dECtQ.text: I was very suprised to see low reviews for this place. We Really liked the burger bar. I got the Hangover burger and my girlfriend built her own. We both love a good burger and we were both more than pleased. Great selection of different meats (kobe, grass fed beef, Buffalo and others). Great fries and dipping sauces as well.  Also, check out the selection of alcoholic and non - alcoholic milkshakes and a "dessert burger"

9S74FO4XAUG-FiO9ABdYiw.text: After a lot of the great reviews, I had much higher hopes.  Our service was really poor. The restaurant was 85-95% full at the tables, but there were seats at the burger bar. The server was slow to get around to take our order and just didn't seem like she wanted to be there or help us.  The zucchini fries were just okay. People were really all about them in reviews, but the breading wasn't much more than basic bar provolone stick breading. A few times the zucchini inside just slipped out leaving a sheath of uninteresting breading. Not awesome. The sweet potato fries were very good and the mac n cheese bites were good, but I seriously think it was just Kraft mac n cheese that was fried. That's not a complaint because I have a nostalgic fondness for that, and I have to say at least it was full of mac n cheese. Some fried mac n cheese I've had (like at state fairs) is mostly just breading.  For my burger, I was very undecided. I went with the natural source beef with brie, the red wine reduction sauce, mushrooms, and carmelized onions. It was appetizing and filling, but the bottom of my bun deteriorated. I went with the plain bun; maybe others are more substantial. I ended up eating the last half of my burger with a fork. Medium is more like medium rare. This doesn't bother me, but FYI in case you expect your burgers to be more cooked through.    The TV in our booth was not in our control, though the server did get the staff to change it. The TV was beat up with a good 20% section of poor/damaged pixels.  Our milkshake was the best part.  Not the worst meal I've had, but not good enough to make me come back.

yuvLoRHDm_CdNZ6ycxOdXw.text: This is a review only for their happy hour.    Between 2 of my girlfriends and I, we ordered all the appetizers on the HH menu and a drink each.  As for drinks, 2 of us had the Summertime Splash which had gin in it and 1 of us had the Strawberry Mojito.  Both drinks were very yummy and I don't even like gin usually.  We could hardly taste the alcohol, so we asked the bartender if there was a lot of alcohol and he said yes.  He actually added an extra shot of alcohol in our drink after we said that, but honestly, I enjoyed the original much better.  Needless to say, the bartender and the other servers were all very friendly.  For the HH menu, there was a truffled grilled cheese sandwich, burger sliders, pulled pork sliders and buffalo wings.  Every item was good.  The meat in the sliders was moist and flavorful.  My favorite was the buffalo wings.  It was not the traditional saucy buffalo wing that you might picture.  They were prepared with a dry rub, but was not at all tough or dry.  It was the best buffalo wings I've ever had.  I definitely recommend this place and would love to go back the next time I'm in Vegas again.

Ro9DNDo4qKDOQKAhOSt4og.text: This place is very goood! I ended up building my own burger instead of picking one from the chefs menu. I had a Black Angus beef with buttermilk zucchini fries and a Chimay Blue. Yummmy!!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ice cold Chimay blue to go with that yummy burger
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. oh so yummy!

2NFJaSz8uPAmJU28Kb-ZVQ.text: It's funny when someone hypes up a restaurant so much, that when you get there. You're not overly impressed. That might have been the situation here. I had the organic burger with mushrooms and swiss. Which is what I was feeling like at the moment. This burger was pretty juicy, I ordered it medium rare. Which, typically is how I like my burgers. Well done, and you're set to get a dry burger.   I figured, I just had a kobe beef burger and a buffalo burger a little while ago. It was just an all right burger, nothing to go crazy for, or go back for.  I was with 3 other people, and one had the buffalo sliders. Not one had agreed that they absolutely loved the place. I chose the sesame seed bun for my bread and zuch fries. Get the sweet potato fries, my sister had ordered them, and they were delicious. With a side of chipotle aioli. The perfect combination. The zucchini fries in itself were a little disappointing. Pretty much all breading, and no zucchini.   In the sea of overpriced restaurants, this place is probably the most reasonable, unless you want to stuff your face at a buffet. The best place to sit, is in the super comfy booths. They have a little lcd tv. We watched the riot in Vancouver after the Canuck's lost.

enNGwuzHjF4SDooUaoyUHQ.text: No cheese curds... But Burger was tasty they offer alot of dipping sauce and the mini chilli rellano was good

2Ndu-hisokZPl49nJ81aCg.text: Good burgers large variety all sorts of specials and add ons amazing milkshakes and yummy zuchinni fries good drinks and friendly service this place can be busy and a wait but usually not long and worth it

JBVNWodmupEU_I17lxmZ1w.text: Good food. Overwhelming menu (kinda). Poor service. Super overpriced for a burger. But it was tasty.

2HgjI6-cH8ef-jnJiNocIQ.text: Just a great burger.  Waiter was great and helpful. We designed our burgers. Unfortunately they made two if them wrong.  Burgers tasted great. Beer menu is huge and has some great beers available.  Kobe burger is a must. Those who didn't order it...regretted it.

W3NA_PghCgb9eB3uJC6cuA.text: Great everything!  See Pat at the bar-  great guy and knows the menu!  Wonderful drinks- lots of beer choices and way lots of toppings for your burgers !

QWw83bZv9NvhOgAcR_I5BQ.text: Two words: Hubert Keller  Their infamous $60 Wagyu Beef burger topped with premium truffle shavings and foie gras all on a delectable onion bun is worth a one-time try.  Been there a few times and tried other items on their menu, but his Rossini burger is probably the main reason why I would want to come here to eat again.  As for appetizers, if you're indecisive like I am, then I would strongly encourage you to order their THE FRY sampler.  It's a decent amount for a party of 2-4 people, and it has a little bit of everything delicious there.  They also have a full-bar, so you can definitely pair your meals with a nice cocktail, beer or wine.  Good food, casual joint, and nice servers.  PLUS - if you're lucky, the one & only Hubert Keller may be there himself.  So don't be shy to shake his hand and chat with him.  He's a pretty down to earth guy.

3WnF-aYQ07Zqz3nUq1A_CA.text: My friends and I went here on a recent trip to vegas. Saw all the yelp reviews and figured we had to give it a shot.........   We all had burgers of various kinds with fries and a soda. None of the burgers stood out because the only thing we really tasted was the ton of salt that had been put on it and the fries. We all three left feeling Ill from the OD of salt.

etHRSG9xmRpDv82shdrS4g.text: My family and I were here last Christmas and we were highly disappointed in our burgers. The only one in our group that liked the food was my mother...and she did NOT order a burger!! She had wings! So that says a lot. lol   The rest of us agreed that our burgers were bland and tasteless and just not good. I've had way better burgers at Five Guys or IN N' Out or Astro Burger.  Very disappointed!

uBDAaU9UJHSm9XQPIv0rUg.text: Seriously the $60 burger is the WORST burger I've ever had. The foie was greasy and overly gamy and NOT SEASONED AT ALL! The rest of the burger was also not seasoned. I doubt that was wagyu beef - it was super dry and flavorless. Nothing about this burger warrants $60.  The lamb burger was excellent. I ordered provolone (I think it was provolone) cheese for my lamb burger. Probably one of the BEST burgers I've ever had in my life!  The zucchini fries tasted like nothing and I think are frozen / bulk but can't be sure.   Service was not great. I will never go back.

uIT9y6F7ba-LxoGzBDpWcg.text: The bugers here are excellent and the prices are great too. The only reason this place is not getting 5 stars from me is that the front reception people are very unfriendly and seem stressed out. I've eaten here twice and thought the same thing both times. Thankfully the wait staff inside are better.  I've tried the Guiness float, The Buffalo Burger with Mozerella, the Turkey Burger, skinny fries, fat fries, sweet potato fries. All yummy. I will definitely go back during a future visit to Vegas. Their burgers are moist and tasty.. and the buns are perfectly toasted.

qwqjh7wTOWKnObNw9gTbBw.text: Burger Bar is awesome for vegetarians. The vegetarian burger is the BEST veggie burger I've ever had in the 11 years I've been a vegetarian. Boca & Morningstar, you may call yourself a veggie burger but you're really just some soy slime with a faux funky meat taste. Gross.   The Burger Bar veggie patty is the real deal - thick, fresh, and deliciously full of vegetables. I was a little worried by the description (pumpkin puree? weird), but was so delighted by my first bite. It bursts with flavor. I would have been happy to make a meal solely from a few patties, nothing else, that's how good & satisfying this burger was. Also, the beer battered jalapeno pickles were bomb! Crunchy & fried on the outside, yummy on the inside.   There were some disappointments - the bun wasn't really all that great. The homemade dijon mustard (one of the extra costs) didn't taste as good as grey poupon off the shelf. The cheese was broiled too long on both mine & my boyfriend's burgers, so it was thin and hard instead of being thick & cheesy. Overall, the meal was awesome and I hope I can go back to try some of the desserts & milkshakes (alcoholic milkshakes! does it really get better than that?).

0a_VzYSCihE9BuUd3OvA4g.text: So I ate here once with my company who gave us per diem and almost couldn't afford a meal.  Whatever not my money, but the burger came out and was almost too big! Lol. I'm American but jesus, these seemed big.  Maybe I'm not too big on gourmet burgers.  Anyway, cant complain about more food so i guess that's it. lol. Seemed very pricey and I ate better at less pricey burger joints. Plus their burgers weren't THAT good. Fatburger anybody? In n Out? lol  CLIFFNOTES: Meh. If you really want to. I wont give it a BAD review.

RiAKng-QHbi8n6d_IRTCng.text: Loved the concept, but the execution failed.  Onion rings tasted like Ore-Ida frozen rings, burger was sloppy and wet, wife's sliders were served without explanation of which was which meat...just poor play.  Won't return.

ONkWW6LqFXqIyT9lbX_pOQ.text: My favorite burger place in Vegas, hands down.  Love the fact that you can customize your burger to how you like it and you get it exactly how you order it.  The sweet potato fries and the zucchini fries are just great addition to your meal.  Definitely great stuff.  Highly recommended!

iFpk05HOXpQKs3EQ9mOZtQ.text: The actual food is good. Not super memorable. Service is bad. Decent beer selection. In Mandalay Place so it's an activity to park, walk down there, then wait to be seated. So don't go hungry. You'll just be mad. If you are going to go to a casino to pay a lot for a thick burger there are other options.

XAHrB_L5D8LZPtZ0qMNIbA.text: This is by far the BEST burger I've ever had.    I had their rossini burger, which is the burger with foie gras and black truffles.  $60 for a burger but let me tell you; it is worth it to the very last bite.  If you're skeptical about trying this - you NEED to go.   The wait can be long - we had to wait 40 mins and they don't take reservations; but once you're seated, the food comes out fast and the staff are friendly.   Will def go again next time I'm in Vegas.

Okt_tWpqxWXEkAJ8OPoX9Q.text: I know I've said this before, but this really is the best burger I've ever had.  The Burger Bar at Mandalay Bay is Chef Hubert Keller's awesome restaurant and is supposed to be the original build your own burger.  I had the Kobe beef burger (cooked medium) with baby spinach, blue cheese, bacon, foie gras, and truffle sauce.  It was amazing (see pics).  The milkshakes (with alcohol) also looked incredible, but the burger and sweet potato fries were all I could handle.  The service was friendly and very helpful.  They have a full bar with delicious Bloody Marys, and a huge selection of beer.  There is nothing not to love about this restaurant...but bring your money.   Hamburgers at this restaurant can easily get into the $20-$40 range without much effort.  The price of the burger depends on the type of meat you choose and the toppings you add.  I'm embarrassed to say that my crazy burger cost slightly over $40, but I did go crazy when I ordered with absolutely no consideration for price.  I'd definitely go back and order the exact same thing or maybe try a different variation (aka get any type of meat burger topped with lobster).  Food-5 stars, Service-5 stars, Originality of bar drinks-5 stars, value-3 stars, burger joint ambiance-5 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kobe beef burger with baby spinach, bacon, foie gras, truffle sauce, and a sesame bun. With sweet potato fries.
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2I521LGLZTZ4SR34Scv9wA.text: Great gourmet burger place. Service was great. Food was fantastic. Only problem, for me personally, is the pricing. It's kind of over priced. If you dont mind paying a higher price for burgers, its a great place to go.

gn6PnXlNj5i6REE8_l1PiA.text: HOLY BURGER!  best burger ive had!  this was my first stop when I got to Vegas and it made my start a wonderful one.  i was craving it the whole trip though... and i am not a huge burger person.  mmm just thinking about it makes me sad i dont live near.

8hcc0HeLbvxgOGmBtolWuA.text: good burger.  but man, the music they play was so loud I couldn't hear the waiter talk, and she got our order wrong because she couldn't hear us either.  Seats on the tables were really uncomfortable.  Not sure why Hubert Keller gets such bad seats for his restaurants, as we hated the seats at Fleur as well.  This is on par with LBS Burger at Red Rock and would go here again, when I know it isn't busy.  Not worth the hassle when it is busy.  *updating this because I put this in my beer list without mentioning, as 1000000 people already have, that Burger Bar has a pretty noteworthy and awesome beer selection and I always try something when I go here.

FU8YgrTMHUywd2Pf2PAd0A.text: The 4 star average for this place is pretty accurate.  Ate here twice during my visit and the overall experience was great.  There's already a ton of reviews so I'll try to keep this short and to the point.  The good: - This place can cook a RARE burger. Thank you! - The buns are great.  Crusty and perfect for soaking up all those burger juices. - Great variety of toppings.  There's definately something to be said for getting a burger with exactly what you want on it. - Sweet potato fries were tasty.  Zuicchini fries were just ok, dipped them in ranch which reminded me of fried mushrooms and veggies at other run of the mill restos. (Side note: noticed in other reviews mention of runny ranch, this was not.)  The not so good: - Fleur de Lys sauces weren't that great.  Tried 2 and both lacked the flavor to stand up to the rest of the burger. - Music was loud.  I understand going for the "bar" feel, but honestly it was hard to hear our server (or anyone else further than 2 ft from you).  Other thoughts: - If you're looking for a plain burger, this may not be your place.  There's really nothing wrong with their burgers, but the thing that makes this place great is the extrordinary toppings. - If you've only had burgers at Chili's or Fudruckers type places, you may want to order your burger one doneness level up from your usual.  Those places notoriously overcook their burgers, so if you're used to their medium rare, it's really more like medium.

XvsRkIXG1wN15CguMlAjZA.text: yum! yum! yum!  they have the best appetizers (yummy sweet potato fries, onion rings, zuccini fries, macaroni bites..)  and good burgers.  I took some out of town guests here and they loved it!  Must try if you're on the strip for a great meal

pECjEjdREuE1NpyNn3g16Q.text: I first heard about this place when I saw Hubert Keller on PBS. Was in Vegas and decided to seek the BB out. Perhaps my expectations were too high but I was not terribly impressed. My wife's salmon burger was very good but the Angus burger lacked sufficient seasoning. The french fry dipping sauce arrangement was the star of the show (very good). Our son's burger plate was adequate (definately salmonella free).

MZh0H_vZk3yn-mjjoLhvGQ.text: My husband and I had lunch here and it was amazing! Service was great, the bloody marys are good and the food was delicious! It is one of our Vegas favorites!

LlPGyRSNzYH7G_M41ojrtw.text: I'm a guy who likes a good burger and this place does them well, but what really blew me away was the beer selection! There are some gems on the beer list- don't skip it!

5mk0ksbJPKIGLP588qJWfA.text: This is the place where you treat your burger like a pizza! There are so many topping that it would take years before you have tried every combination.  Its one of the few places where a person can spend $60+ on a burger (which includes Kobe beef topped with a lobster tail and a portabello mushrooms). Vegas baby!  If Vegas is too far for you to have a customizable burger, I suggest The Counter over in the LA / Santa Monica area ifyou live in So Cal. Not as glam as the Burger Bar, but delicious nevertheless.

m5BihfIB6c-CzfjTXw8x1w.text: Stumbled upon this place after an afternoon's drinking, and a visit to see Mamma Mia.  First off, the beer selection was extensive and tasty, and the cocktails looked tempting.  But the burger... oh, the burger!  I plumped for the Kobe beef on a sesame bun with mozzarella, bacon and a fried egg, with sweet potato fries, and my word, I was in heaven.  The flavours melded together perfectly into one lovely meaty, cheesy, greasy mouthful of awesomeness.  The one disappointment is that we only found this place the night before heading home.  I guess I'll just have to make my next Vegas trip sooner rather than later.

GX7_N-Vt_pQLN_mqSzl0fA.text: Burger Bar is heaven on earth. I like Burgers but here I had the privilege of actually finding out what a real burger should taste like. Kobe Beef and topped with cheese, mushrooms and Foie Gras (its Vegas after all) and some delicious Zucchini fries.  Only thing I am sad about is that I did not have room for their sweet burgers...but I know I will be back.  Ambience is casual and they have a lot of beers to chose from. Go there - its worth it!!

Tve8PwRnj6Qks3cIA0jd8Q.text: Burger Bar is located between the walkway of Luxor and Mandalay Bay at Mandalay Place.  We went there around 830ish and were told to wait for half an hour.  We walked around, gambled a little bit and came back in about 20 minutes, they called a few names but no one showed up so we were able to get a seat pretty quick.  I am a burger fan and Burger Bar really hits the spot when you are craving for one.  The menu offers some already constructed burgers, but the fun part is the ability to "build your own burger."  Whether it's fancy kobe beef burger with fois gras and truffles for about $60 or a black angus burger for $10, it is satisfying that the big burger you order will be cooked to perfection with the toppings you want.  I ordered a burger with jalapeno bacon, portabello mushrooms and pepper jack cheese on an onion bun, it was delicious.    The burger doesn't come with fries so we ordered onion rings, fat fries, and shoestring buffalo fries for an addtional cost.  They were alright, I would prefer some seasoning on my fries and they were a little dry.  I've had better.  Overall I liked the atmosphere and the convenience of the place since we stayed at Mandalay Bay.  I would definitely come back and build another burger.

fQRVTQ8HX9kt9gbNVF6QGA.text: Going out for a fancy hamburger sounds silly, right?  Well, it's not.  This is one of my favorite places because the atmosphere is good, the food is excellent, and it's a great place to take friends to visit--the booths are perfect for private conversations.  The fries and dipping sauce flights are fun, and the burgers are juicy and flavorful.  Try to make a reservation if you can because weekend dinner-times seem to have a lot of walk-ins and you could be waiting a while....

0wabZe60IzKiiPGZMOhyjQ.text: I've been here several times and I like this place a lot. This time though the buffalo burger was just okay. We sat at the bar.. Our server wasn't the friendliest I've ever run across. I'll give this place another chance since I've had so many good experiences here in the past.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Buffalo burger

KsCsgMrNtONh7qDjj0nKHA.text: Every time I am in Vegas, we make it a point of going to the Burger Bar for a meal. The burgers are cooked to your liking perfectly and the toppings that you can add are almost excessive. The fries are great as well, and I love all the different dips for them. Lastly they have a desert burger (don't worry, no actual meat) that is a glazed doughnut, chocolate fudge and some fruits to resemble the burdgr fixins, and even if I am not hungry I will order one to take back to the room. Decadent and delicious! It is all Las Vegas expensive though, so don't expect cheap burgers and fries, but worth the $$

dnoL73iDaZ_Okau-xKg1Og.text: Went here since I am a fan of Hubert Keller and had been hearing good feedback about Burger Bar. Came in expecting a good burger at $$$ prices. Boy was I pleasantly surprised!  I ordered the American Kobe Beef burger with sprouts, avocado, and beet root pickle. I wish I had known that the burger itself already comes with lettuce, tomato, onion and pickle as I read the menu as all accompaniments must be ordered separately but I was very happy I got all the extras that I did. I would definitely recommend getting the beet root pickle. I loved it since I am both a fan of pickled things and beets. It really helped cut through the richness of the burger. I didn't notice a huge difference in my Kobe burger since as a whole it still tastes like a burger, albeit a darn good one. My table mates ordered the Buffalo burger (which was a bit more noticeable difference and very good) and the Hubert Keller burger (which again was yummy). I also vouch for the sweet potato fries as they are crispy, ketchup delivering perfection.  For dessert the table split the Chocolate burger which came out beautifully presented. The chocolate "patty" was chocolate hazlenut between two donuts with strawberries, kiwis, mint and a passion fruit "cheese". It was a great ending and very unique.  All in all, yes Burger Bar is expensive for a burger but I do believe that we paid for quality and craftsmanship and the portions were more than enough for everyone.

lvjNImnhgygFFk3wOHVEgw.text: This is another of those places run by a celeb chef jumping into the burger craze that has hit everyone on this planet.  Tried the American Classic, Peppercorn, fries and the Caesar Salad.  The burgers were okay.  They did come at the desired temperature but its not like the pate was anything special.  The Peppercorn burger in fact has too find a grind on the pepper resulting almost a dusty tasting burger.  The bun these come in was quite good, but not good enough to make me succumb to eating it.  The fries were excellent, crunchy outside and light and fluffy inside.  The surprise was the salad, which was excellent.  This looked like hand torn leaves definitely a house made dressing with the perfect touch of creaminess with the gentlest hint of anchovy in the back, just delicious.  Very pricey, but hey if you are going to gamble on a burger, where else would you do it but Vegas!

-Sx_7uc9ZQ5tYjGXYSACjg.text: STILL AWESOME!!!  We had a 20 minute wait on a Saturday night at 7pm... but we figured that into our plan, so it wasn't a big deal.  They have a huge menu and the Huber Keller Burger is amazing, but didn't really need the extra fried egg on top.  I like that they have an open kitchen... no one can spit in your food!  I noticed the long bar would be a good place for dining solo.  Only drawback is that it's a trek to the bathroom... but awesome food and a great time with our friends in the booth.  We liked trying all he different varieties of fries... my favorites were the sweet potato & zucchini fries.  I will be back to Burger Bar every time I go to Vegas!  Vegas Trip 10/20-23/11

4Ts0RTfwMaCJx9YBfoLb3Q.text: Excellent burgers, great fries, exceptional selection of toppings and more types of milkshakes than one can imagine. The only problem I had with this place is that they have little TVs at each booth, which makes it too easy to bet Oklahoma City in the under only to watch the Clippers put up 100+ points on the road and kill my bet. Other than that-- great.   Also, service-- from the friendly hostesses to the patient waiter-- was excellent. We spent $65 for three people (including tip) and had a great time and meal. Would have been better if Oklahoma City knew how to get some defensive rebounds, but so be it.

j3ZBMl4HOJDW59RwIziyDg.text: I'm a huge fan of Chef Hubert Keller, so to get a chance to try some of his food while in Vegas meant a must stop here.  The place is ascetically pleasing. Dark wood, open feel and a very modern take on a bar. The service was amazing. Beers were ordered quickly and shortly after so was our meal.   I decided to try the sliders with three different kinds of meat. Buffalo, American Kobe, and Angus. All were great and flavorful. It was great as I really didn't think I'd be able to tell the difference from one to another, but they had subtle flavors that allowed me to do so. I chose naked burgers because I really wanted to taste the meat.  The sweet potato fries were tasty and the regular ones were too. One of my friends got a Peanut Butter milkshake that was amazing. Wow!  It's Vegas, so remember things cost a bit more, but if you want a great burger, at a nice location with friendly service, this is the place.

sn6DvzqPQTFw_tTMwUQmdQ.text: I love Hubert but,  not impressed.  I wanted to love this burger, I wanted to crave this burger in between trips to Vegas. It was overpriced and underwhelming.  I'm sad

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3_BkA54XS5LRr032GR0abQ.text: It's a bit of a pain to find - first off, The Mandalay is set back from the strip, so you have to take a (free) tram to get there.  Once you do, walk through the casino hugging the right til you get to the shops (up the stairs).  Then walk most of the way through the shops towards the Luxor, and it'll be a small, unassuming restaurant front on your left.    It's a chill atmosphere, with whatever music playing the staff feels like listening to (my night it was 90s satellite radio), and personal TVs in the booths.  Nothing pretentious whatsoever.  Grabbed a solo seat at the bar, and was promptly greeted and set up/given water by multiple servers.  Patrick was super duper friendly and made my night very enjoyable.   He and another guy behind the bar seem to call everyone "baby," which I found rather cute and enjoyable (although I'm taken), but I had the thought that a different woman dining solo as I was might have found it unnerving.    Whatever, I had a great time chatting and hanging out with Patrick throughout the night, and he was an attentive and informative server.  He seemed to really enjoy his job and is great at it.  Service can often make or break a meal, and it definitely made mine.  I ordered the Hubert Keller burger, with a few changes.  I got the Kobe instead of the Buffalo, and an onion bun instead of the Ciabatta.  I also ordered the zucchini fries, with a couple sides of sauce (truffle aioli and pesto).  The burger was very good.  Piled high with the toppings, and the shallot and red wine sauce was sooooo goood.  My only complaint was that the bottom bun was soggy as soon as I got my plate.  Not cool.  All in all not the best burger I've ever had, but a great one and it hit the spot.    The zucchini fries were AWESOME.  I've rarely had fried veggies that are juicy and taste fresh while maintaining a thick coat of batter.  Also, the serving portion is ample.  The sauces were great.  Sadly they don't make their own ice cream, which was more noticeable when I decided on a sundae instead of a milkshake.  I got coffee ice cream with nutella, caramel, and graham cracker (I was feeling a big pig-ish).  It came in a banana split style dish - very long and narrow - with two huge scoops of ice cream, shmears of nutella on either side and a couple of graham cracker pieces on either side as well.  The caramel was sadly missing, but it was brought over as soon as he realized.  It was difficult to eat - there was too much ice cream for the dish, the nutella wasn't incorporated and is hard to do so yourself when it gets cold, and the graham crackers were whole which meant I had to break them up myself and there was no space to put them really without them fall off the ice cream on to  the table.  So - bottom line - this place is good if you're in the mood for a very good burger, and some inventive fries/sauce choices.  For dessert, maybe stick with the milkshakes over a sundae.

Nsytp7JbR_QrjMjRtVvgvg.text: I was seriously disappointed by this place on multiple levels. First, the service wasn't great; our server missed a few items we ordered and took a long time to get us drinks or refills, yet her tables of young men seemed to be well taken care of.  The food was alright and the beer selection was great. I ordered a veggie burger with onion rings. The onion rings were fantastic, but the veggie burger had no flavor. I was excited that this burger place had plenty of vegetarian options on the menu, but this was just gross. Highly disappointing.

CZU5i8YUPlAK8QEo_rMLkA.text: Came here with a large group for my 21st birthday and had an excellent time!   I'll be the first to admit that I was drunk, but I do remember loving the burger I ordered. What burger did I get, you ask? Who knows! It was good, though.  My boyfriend got a flight of their alcoholic shakes, and I'm pretty sure he died and went to alcohol heaven.   Definitely recommend this for dinner in Vegas! Cheap (comparatively to other places on The Strip), and the service was friendly (as far as I can remember in my drunken stupor).

TuASApiYoduRBOSjVuT50g.text: I try not to eat burgers too often but if I have a craving I will make a trip to Burger Bar. It is the best place for burgers in Vegas and probably anywhere I have been. The Kobe/Wagyu beef burger is my favorite. A good way to get it is on a potato bun, caramelized mushrooms/onions, swiss cheese & peppered bacon.  I highly recommend the zucchini fries as a side.   If you have room for dessert the sundaes and milkshakes are great but the only time I have been able to try them is when i only eat half of my meal and take the other half to go.

06RrJgdiLKLRcoCgW_gXWg.text: Great find in Mandalay bay.  Perfect service, Fantastic burger menu.. Organic, angus, Kobe, lamb, with a la carte options for all toppings and buns. Then you get to the shakes....   Amazing alcoholic and non alcoholic options.  If your a vegetation or vegan, not to fret. .. They have a really great section including entrees for both.  Then you get to the beer.....  Mother of god the beer selection....  Drop mike.

Sl0bwPtdhk5hPpZhi6JZFw.text: Booze, boobs and burgers are all found at The Burger Bar on the second floor in a mall atmosphere. Price of burgers start from 9.50 to 23 dollars. If you like milkshakes you're doing yourself a disservice if you don't go here.  A regular angus beef burger costs 9.50 while a Hubert Keller burger is 22. Carmelized onions and bleu cheese are that big of a mark up? They place it on a ciabatta bread that is extremely fluffy and not chewy so that's a plus. Next time I'll order the angus beef and put 3 cheeses on it and get some spf's next time. The quality of meat is fine. The buns are spectacular. Went back on another occasion and tried the Kobe beef burger. It didn't stand out like I thought it would. Still, you can't go wrong eating here.  Great service. All the girls have something attractive for everyone and come in different varieties while wearing a small top and yoga pants. You have the blonde athletic type, the very skinny and perky asian, the curvy alternative gal, the drop dead gorgeous latina with caramel skin and big, curly highlighted hair and a big, curvy butt in an extra tight shirt. I fell in love with this particular girl and tried not to look at her so much during my stay. This girl was bad ass. She is making some lucky guy out there really happy. Once you see a highlight like that at a restaurant I believe my taste buds take a back seat.   You should go. For the food of course. It can get busy so watch out for the hours and wait time. It can get noisy and they can sometimes play grating music.

CfeBvW13DN40pE7AcN71Qg.text: I'm not a red meat fan so my review probably doesn't count ... but I was talked into coming here with a few other burger officianados who said this place was to die for. I saw on the Yelp reviews that this place was a hot spot for vegetarians so I agreed.  I ordered the quinoa burger which was pretty good. Kind of a crumbly burger versus a more cohesive one (which I dont like) but the flavor I did like. We shared a fries trio which was great!

2IF9monjLJCE2HCDP2ylQw.text: This place is AWESOME! We ALWAYS come here when we visit Vegas! I always get the same burger (the Hangover Burger, which, I describe as a 'higher-end IN-N-OUT Burger). I also LOVE the salted caramel martini!   The service is ALWAYS excellent and they are always friendly!   I really can't say enough good things about this place. It's definitely worth a visit!

A0zP4o2KhOZkGRovRlBv8g.text: Love it.  Don't get too carried away with the options when you order your burger...some combinations will just not work!  I do wish they had a few more pre-created options on the menu...the ones listed felt a little mundane.  The burger was delicious..as were the onion rings.  I'm pretty picky about my burger so a 4 star out of me is a great review here.  It's a little pricey..its Vegas so you expect that.    This is located in the little mall-like area between Luxor and Mandalay.  I'd go here again.

wT-ubwbtt51ky0AUfpSp9w.text: Energetic atmosphere, service is okay but not great, the fries are nice and crispy & delicious, but my surf & turf burger was definitely not great.  Interesting combination to put asparagus, lobster, and a [perfectly cooked but underseasoned] burger together on a nice soft bun but how you can charge $25 for a burger and not even include a condiment is beyond me.  You have bottles of ketchup, mustard, and A-1 in front of you - which one of these would go well with a surf & turf burger?  None.  This thing was dying for a nice aioli or something which would have made it less dry and a whole lot more tasty.  Alas, no luck - and from a French chef no less where you would expect aioli to be readily available for the fries and everything.  The restaurant is crazy busy but has 2 long bar seating areas as well as quite a few tables.  They do a great business and the vibe is good, I'll try to return at some point but it just annoys me when restaurants take good food and ruin it by forgetting about the little things like seasoning and in this case condiments.  Maybe the other burgers are better, presumably that's the case unless everyone is there just based on the hype.  In Vegas, it could be either one.

PyjPyE0C3QOn7Wy4njM5yA.text: The service wasn't that great.  The food made up for it though.  I had the vegetarian burger which I have to say was quite strange.  I have been a vegetarian for 6 years now and have had many a veggie burger.  This was was very very mush.  Think the texture of a rice casserole on a bun.  I finally had to take it out the ciabatta bun to finish it because the texture was freaking me out.  It was very tasty though... loved the many ingredients and thought it was cool that the veggie burger was made with pumpkin puree.  I got blue cheese, button mushrooms and asparagus as toppings.  The asparagus was the PERFECT  burger topping.  The blue cheese was big chunks and the perfect amount.  I would skip the mushrooms next time.  Just nothing to write home about.  The skinny fries didn't look like much were DELICIOUS!!  The nutella milkshake was so unbelievably amazing.  You must splurge and have one!!  My husband had their signature buffallo burger and really enjoyed it.  It looked fabulous.  I was suprised by the ambiance.   I was expecting a counter service type place.  But this is a sit down, darker bar atmosphere.  I also hated how you had to walk down a long hallway and then out of the restaurant to get to the bathroom.  Go before you come.  ;)

8PHgO_B7CIp5X_hSbFYQaA.text: This is our go to spot for a least one meal. Service was a little slow but the staff & food more than made up for it. Trust your server's recommendations, they totally steered us in the right direction. Stand out favorites were the Buffalo tater tots and the sundae.

q-SWhM3Bcwv9hUYamsCJbg.text: Do NOT go here. Don't grace this establishment with your presence. This place is absolute crap.   We had reservations for 35 people and when we checked in we told them that there would only be 25 people. They took one of the tables away. Naturally. We then ate mediocre burgers that you would expect to be much better at a place that calls themselves Burger Bar. Not impressive at all.   Time for the bill. They charged us $200 for the reservation then proceeded to make us pay for 35 people when we only had 25 that actually ate. Everyone talked to the managers and they had no empathy or understanding and really could less about why it is completely absurd to charge us for 10 people that didn't eat. The place wasn't crowded so it's not like they were turning people away so they could have waived that rule but clearly had no interest in having any decency. Out of all the places to go in Vegas, do not waste your time here

yS2biP9fI9IzJfVelhqlIw.text: So good.  I'm a sucker for a build your own burger restaurant.  This was our first stop in Vegas, and it did not disappoint.  I'm a fan of the text when your tables ready. It allowed us to wonder the mall area and not have to worry about wondering too far.  My burger was cooked perfect, there "some pink" is more red then most but I like that, warning to those who don't.  There was a few fry options, fat and skinny fries and then zucchini. I went with zucchini and it was a refreshing change.  Drinks were expensive but I was expecting that.  Our waitress was great.  I would 100% return here.

mYXamU3UekucsQa2EsKyuA.text: After walking the strip we were starving and I found this little gem on Yelp.  It was past lunch and not quite dinner time but the place was packed so we sat at the bar.    Let me just say that the burgers were really good.  I got the sampler so that I could try the different types of burgers offered. My husband loved his burger.  He did a build your own with the jalapeno bacon, pepper jack, and pineapple.  Let me repeat, he LOVED his burger.    I hate to give this place only 3 stars but the burgers were not enough to make up for the lack of service.  We has to ask for our drinks to be refilled although people were constantly walking by us at the bar.  We also had to ask for our check and when we finally got it, we were charged for things we didn't order OR receive.  The fixed the check for us, but it still took a while since we again had to get someone attention.   I really hope that the service gets better because I would love to go back there on our next Vegas trip!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8SyN4kZJh2QkhaDBG0yV5Q.text: Pros Whipped cream Buttermilk onion rings Service Variety  Cons Expensive No twinkies (for milkshake) Bland burgers  Doubt I would ever come back here again... but maybe for whipped cream and onion rings

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Black &amp; white milkshake

rncFcWDKIX5yM-XgDndmXA.text: My husband enjoys his burger an he's hard to please bit pricy 2 burgers and Cobb salad with 2 diet sodas was 60$ but the quality of food an having the burger actually cooked right is worth it ! The negative to me was lighting we were in a booth and hard to see menus I was glad I looked online prior

yowrpEmmfKYBCAiQLB8cww.text: Not a big yelper but this place deserves a shout out. With all the places to eat in Vegas, it stands out among the crowd. Sat at the bar and had great service. My GF wasn't sure what she wanted so she gave the bartenders some cravings and he returned with a great drink that fit the bill. We had burgers,skinny fries, onion rings. All were delicious, burgers cooked perfectly. Great beer menu. Prices were good considering the location. If you are on the south end of strip, give this place a try. I don't think you will be disappointed.

zUYuR0Ek5_i8Yq7pXiGDXg.text: Visited burger bar after coming from the ice bar down the hall, and the food was absolutely amazing! Will definitely recommend!

7TGtT092LZTlIKeNT8sMnA.text: I was here awhile back, I enjoyed this place. The hostess greeted me right away, I sat at the bar. The bartenders were professional and courteous. All the employees smile including the people who bring the food out. Service was a plus and you will notice it right away. The decor and ambience was good. The energy was even excellent. I ordered a bacon cheddar cheeseburger, onion rings, fries, sweet potato fries, cole slaw and a vanilla milkshake. The burger was above average, you can build your own burger and choose your burger patty. I liked the onion rings better than the fries. The milkshake was excellent and they have a lot of options.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burger, fries, sweet potato fries, onion rings, cole slaw and a great milkshake.

mb4t9jNL4GyfXLi5ZYH-iw.text: Pretty solid on-the-strip burger restaurant. Burger Bar is located at Mandalay Place...their hotel shopping area upstairs. There's plenty of other stuff on the menu too besides just burgers. They got appetizers, salads, "low carb healthy" stuff, "vegetarian options". Also got some "special" meats you can order for your burger...like turkey, lamb or buffalo.   I ordered The Hangover Burger which is basically a regular hamburger with onions, tomatoes and lettuce. They give you a pickle spear on the side. (no cheese...I'm sure that costs extra if you want that option.) My burger automatically came with fat fries. Even though it was only a hamburger....this tasted really good. They had a "hangover" sauce in my burger and to me, it kinda sorta tasted like thousand island. I truly enjoyed my burger. Price was...eh...average. $13.95 including fries. Not bad when it comes to food prices on the strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Hangover Burger. Comes with fat fries.

i66wjIELclV543zcWR49Yw.text: Beer selection is great, food is tasty, service on point and deserts are very good, inside Mandalay Bay shops, you get a good meal and can go back to shopping!

cmhoKICmuf-NMiXi4EG19g.text: I ABSOLUTELY LOVED THIS PLACE.  I came here to celebrate my boyfriend's 21st birthday with his family, and we had an amazing time! Our server was so fun and easy-going; and he was also very attentive and gave some great suggestions when it came to ordering our meals.   I ended up making my own burger, which included a black Angus patty, a sesame seed bun with jalapenos, cheddar cheese, a fried egg and the BEST, I really mean the BEST PESTO SAUCE EVER!!! It came with a side of fries and I can tell you that I devoured that meal so fast because of how delicious it was! To accompany my burger, I ordered a Cosmo, and being my first time ordering that drink, I was quite satisfied!   The ambiance of the restaurant is great for groups; definitely perfect for celebrating birthdays, especially because of the full bar and an amazing menu fit for all palettes.   This place is awesome and its an establishment I see myself going to a lot!   If you're a Vegas visitor, you just have to go to this place and give it a try, you'll probably end up going a second time before leaving.  \_()_/

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BYOB: sesame bun, black angus burger, jalapeños, cheddar cheese, fried egg, and pesto.

hJjJeS_Ai3VmNYURd9vcEg.text: This place is good, but probably a little pricier than I'd like to spend on a burger. I do recommend it though. If you're in Vegas you might as well. I got the American classic burger n added avocado. It was great. Way bigger than I thought n I had to bring the rest to go. My boyfriend got the Hubert Keller which I took a bite of n it was ok. I'm not that fancy so the American classic was better imo. Plus I'm not too keen on buffalo burgers. The fries were great I like the skinny ones. The leftover fries were even good which we all know leftover fries are 9 times outta 10 disgusting, but luckily not these.

UJO89N_eR5tXB9IEwzVOgw.text: The burgers are great but a bit pricey. Build-your-own is the way to go here, lots of options to suit a variety of tastes.

E_Wc6zgiiil7-zN4NwwGtg.text: If you are going to put the name of a food in the name of your company, you better know how to make a fantastic version of it.  Burger Bar delivers.   Sitting at the bar was a good alternative to  waiting  for a  table at lunch. They have some standard burger configurations (from $12 to $65), but they also have a make your own section. So I concocted an angus beef burger on sesame seed bun with caramelized onions,  peppers and American cheese. And a side order of a combo of fat fries and onion rings (ask nicely and they might combo it for you, too).   The burger was amazing. Cooked perfectly medium with a  pink center, and quite juicy. The burger and toppings were perfectly sized to each other and the bun, which is something you don't often see. And the toppings were plentiful. This is one of the best burgers I've had. The fries were nothing to write home about, but the onion rings were crispy rings of perfection.   The price is a bit steep ($18 for the above) but I think well worth it. After all, a quick burger at the Mandalay pool costs $12.   A new favorite place to go In Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Perfectly matched burger, bun and toppings. A thing of burger beauty.
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Angus burger, sesame bun, peppers, caramelized onions, and American cheese. Fat fries / onion rings on side.

XxkMhnc82sMuQd1bGsADYQ.text: We journeyed here from the opposite end of the strip just for their amazing Nuttella milkshakes with rich dark chocolate and hazelnuts! It was well worth the walk!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fKMZCQvCPlYLgeTQuZi9dw.text: This is an amazing place. There are few around and some are not as good as here. One of the examples where a Las Vegas copy is better than the original.

A6WwkZetXLXyutcunuuJyQ.text: Was in Vegas for a business trip and read many reviews and articles on the goodness of burger bar. My experience was fine but it definitely did not live up to any hype that I had going into my visit. The hangover burger was good but not something I necessarily need to have again or that was that memorable. Skinny fries were decent. The establishment was a bit loud.

9kAs4Qf1Mr9PKLRIx54ctw.text: Ultimate Bloody Mary: a little too salty for my taste but that was probably due to the bacon that was in it. This appetizer/drink combo was an interesting taste can't say I loved or disliked it. Probably wouldn't get it again though. Didn't taste the alcohol but you may start feeling it a little later.   Customized Kobe Burger: medium rare was cooked to perfection nice, juicy, red center and melts in your mouth. Not sure if they actually gave me the pepper jack though because I couldn't taste the spice it was more like regular american cheese. Caramelized onion was slightly more soggy than I am use to.   Burger Sliders: Good but not great. Pretty normal. Although the "natural" burger had a strange odor to it. My friend said she didn't like it but the rest of the burger sliders were good.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burger sliders
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kobe Burger (Wagyu beef) with pepper jack and caramelized onions.
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ultimate Bloody Mary

JlZtfFvZwZLnbK3lvBw1vw.text: This might have been the best hamburger I've ever had. Perfectly cooked and seasoned. I added a hot fudge shake which was really good as well.  Only down side was the price; $32 after tax and to for a burger, fries and shake is a little steep. But if you want a great burger no matter the price, you won't go wrong here.

t1p1Qv972v6iMYMeZFCaIQ.text: The original celebrity chef burger joint in Vegas and still the best.   100+ visits, it's all about consistency.  High quality proteins, fresh baked buns, well sourced cheeses, well made toppings that could adorn any steakhouse menu, proper cooking to temp and bar friendly service.  Expensive, yes but quality justifies the price (dollars and calories).  Review by "build your own" mouthwatering examples:  1.  Lamb burger (onion bun, sauteed spinach, jalapeno bacon) - Blend of lamb and beef, heavily seasoned with a merguez spice blend.  Nice chew on the rich, moist burger.  Upfront spice flavor that finishes with the pleasant gaminess of lamb.  The thick layer of well drained sauteed spinach and spiciness of the jalapeno bacon make the burger sing.  2.  Turkey burger (onion bun, caramelized onions, grilled pineapple, jalapeno bacon, bleu cheese) - Whoa, it taste like turkey.  Well seasoned, very moist (press it with a fork and juices flow).  Extremely well caramelized onions with incredible sweetness that pairs well with the juicy pineapple.  Heat from the bacon and earthiness of the bleu cheese round out the flavor.  3.  Australian Wagyu (ciabatta bun, pan seared foie, black truffle) - Heaven.  The burger, very rich and juicy, not overly dense.  The livery notes of the foie add complexity albeit richness, the truffle earthy umami that heightens the natural sweetness of the beef.    With every burger, the usual burger toppings (lettuce, tomato, raw onion) always eaten as a salad with the ranch dressing provided with an order of buttermilk zucchini fries; another winner.  50+ beers on tap backed by a solid list of bottles.  Full bar if you're not feeling the burger and beer pairing.  Outstanding, friendly, efficient service especially at the bar.  Solid.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Build your own burger (Lamb w/ sauteed spinach and jalapeno bacon
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Build your own burger (lamb) - Blend of ground lamb and beef seasoned with merguez spices

jYc0xw8d5bbdq4kohqCxiQ.text: I had heard such good things about this place and I'm thinking maybe I just came here on a weird day. It seems like a lot of people really dig this place and the service they've received in the past.  We came in here after going to Happy Place with some friends since we were a bit hungry after and hadn't had dinner yet. We were seated almost immediately which was awesome. I was super excited to try this place out since again, the reviews seemed like it was a hit. One of the coolest parts about our booth was that it had its own TV in it, which was amazing. There was a button and no one really explained how to change the channel, but I'm assuming that's how you do it. My husband didn't want me to change the channel because that was the game he wanted to watch hah!  And here's probably why my star rating was a bit lower. The service was super slow. It took about 15 minutes before a server finally came over. To be quite honest, it felt like we were being ignored for most of the experience, which was a real bummer. When we ordered, we ordered a side of ranch and didn't get it. Once we got our food and noticed we didn't get the ranch, it took a while for her to come back and check on us before we could mention that we never got our side of ranch.   The food was super delicious though. We all ordered sliders and really enjoyed all of them. I loved the way the food was plated, too! The fries came in a paper bag, which was pretty cute. I also got a shake to go, too. Which was super chocolatey (just the way I like it!).  To be honest, I'll probably give this place another chance and come back in another time when I'm in the area.

0ot7ySso4bhIQniMIP-CEg.text: It's been a good 5+ years since the last visit.  I had a good time then...still having good times at Burger Bar...  Burger Bar Service & Ambiance:   The main entrance is small but this restaurant runs deep like a tunnel with plenty of tables, booths, a full bar  burger and contemporary classy upscale sports bar feel.  I love how some of the booths have their own monitors to watch sports.  Our server was super friendly and got along super well with my friend's daughter and were buddies by the time we left. The kitchen got our boujie burgers to us pretty quickly.  Burger Bar...Burgers& truffle fries:  I went with the Lamb burger.  It's 50/50 Australian Lamb/Angus beef but 100% delicious.  This was a unique burger that I thoroughly enjoyed.  My progressive friend from California went with the Beyond Meat Burger which is a plant based burger that identifies with being meat and she enjoyed hers as well.  FYI the burgers don't come with fries so we shared the truffle fries with the truffle mayo.  We dug the double truffle action on the fries..  Overall, the Burger Bar still offers a great boujie boutique burger experience.   The more creative or boujie the burgers start getting close to $20 quickly but you knew that coming in here.  Or at least you do now after reading this review.  =)  I'm sure my next visit won't be so long as there were some other interesting burgers that caught my eye.  Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

yAJHxDicqMQ0gZZ_h7AiZg.text: I've been wanting to come here for years to try their $65 dollar Rossini burger.  It's been a long time coming and the big question is, was it worth it?   Yes, and no.  First the the Rossini burger is actually quite good.  Is it worth $65? No, it's not.  It's good, but for a burger with some truffle sauce and foie gras, it's really not worth it.    Still, the food was good, but the wait was a little too long as our server seemed to be a bit out of it.  She seemed very overwhelmed and not prepared.  Still, I enjoyed the place, but it could have been better.

cr-wpjJidGvKa7dZAWlgDw.text: Ok, this is one special burger bar!   They've got all kinds and Rachel was nice to give us some time to decide on what we wanted.   My husband decided on a lamb burger.   He said it was good and that it was enough.   I ordered a salmon burger with grilled onions and avocado.   Yummmmm!! Oh and we shared skinny fries!   For our drinks, we had the pink monkey and it was refreshing!!!  Rachel checked on us regularly and we knew we were in good hands.  The environment was cozy and the ambiance was perfect as we were entertained by ESPN caged fighting on our private tv in our booth wall.

38-8pqFmRRP4L-Xi-Gy6xA.text: Great sliders!!!! Order the ranch tater tots, you won't be disappointed.  I got the Lavender Lemon Drop cocktail. It was the best cocktail I have ever had.  The right amount of sweet and kick. We had the BEST waitress!  You want to ask for Monica.  She was so attentive and knowledgeable and treated us like we were her only table when we weren't.  My new fav burger joint!
