5vp8gpoe6QNjq3yM14I5tg.text: This yummy spot is located inside of the Mandalay Bay Resort and also accesible from The Delano Resort.   My boyfriend and I shared a bunch of appetizers rather than ordering an entree each.   I highly recommend their French fries - SO TASTY! Try the lemon aioli as well, super yummy.   The service was a bit slow but the waiter seemed she was attending various tables. Nonetheless, our food was hot and tasted fresh.

5j77q4Or7lbuUE6rVpJF0Q.text: This was a big disappointment. Food took forever to get to our table and it wasn't busy at all. By the time we got it, sweet potato fries were a bit soft and soggy and flavor less. I got the build your own burger with cheese and fried egg. Burger had no flavor either, it didn't come with mayo or other condiments. Guess you had to pay extra for it. My husband got the same and says it wasn't worth the price.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0XwyZcj7JytnNa-DDIjnRQ.text: Brian and the rest of the guys behind the bar are excellent! Service was impeccable.  AND they have Happy Hour!!!  Sliders and fried mozzarella was a perfect late lunch

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. HH Sliders!

XBxirS_xgnUkA7lg9UstiA.text: I wanted to love this place because burgers are my favorite, but it was not meant to be. We came here after seeing a show as a party of 6. At 8:30, we were told it would be a 10 minute wait, which was fine. We were seated a little before the 10 minute mark.   Our first waitress came over to take our drink order, which our second waitress delivered to us. She then told us she was taking over because our first waitress got busy and so she took our food order. We then waited and waited and waited for over 30 minutes. No waitress in sight, no food. Another waiter then came over and said our food was up next, but when he brought it over to us, it wasn't our food. It belonged to the table next to us. So we waited some more. Finally our food trickled out and it was honestly mediocre at best. 3 of our burgers were super dry, my husband loved his however.  The service was very slow, even with 3 waiters/waitresses serving us. The sad thing was, it wasn't even busy so not sure what happened.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Classic burger with fries
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Classic burger

_wma_yl3xLhI_1qE5zEh2A.text: A real bummer of an experience. After a good friend of mine talked this place up, seeing it on travel Chanel and hearing good things I was excited to give it a go.  Real quick on the service: place was busy but not packed. Water spilled water on me twice and the bussers dropped two used utensils on my lap. The waitress was slow. I tried to order appetizers twice and she walked past me. So service was sub-par to say the least. Also, the waitress asked me how I wanted my burger. I told her medium and she gave me some long winded explanation on what medium is then asked me again if that's what. Might be my least favorite interaction with a waitstaff of all time.  I don't mind pricey gourmet burgers and there are so many of them on the strip. Even by those standard these are pricy. I went pretty basic and it was still over $60 for two people. I guess about the same as other high end burger spots, but I didn't feel like I got as much in quality or quantity.   The burger height was the saving grace. I got pepper jack cheese and chipotle aioli. Kept it simple wanted to mostly taste what I anticipated was a high quality of meat. To that end there wasn't anything special about the meat. Beyond that the chipotle aioli was bland. The onion bun was soft, but otherwise forgetful. So what makes this "gourmet" burger place special? Definitely not the soggy onion rings.   This place also has the most absurd reservation policy/fine system I've ever heard of. Didn't effect me but listening to the host explain it to someone I found myself thinking "Never make reservations here unless you're willing to risk your soul on being able to make them." Not a ton of space for groups of more than 8 comfortably.   The burger alone with price is an averages gourmet burger. Factor in subpar service. Lackluster toppings and sides. And I'm left wondering what people see in this place.

70JjxieyhZYNTOUZSrGG5w.text: Great stop between Luxor & Mandalay Bay, this restaurant boasts a wide selection of burgers to choose from.  Loosen your definition of burger here.  They have Kobe beef, black angus, salmon, vegetarian, buffalo, turkey & vegan options.  Whoa!  I tried both the turkey and buffalo (on separate occasions), and both were delicious and well prepared.  Did you know that buffalo is actually leaner than chicken? The staff informed me and I tried it.  It was just as delicious, if not more so, than the finest traditional burger I've ever tasted.   Prices reasonable for quality, and Patrick & Brian at the bar were on-point service providers.  Great experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Turkey burger - yum!

7D8btBXkaL7p7DmMnZ54cA.text: Of all the burger places, I choose this one due to offering a bison burger. I am a huge fan of bison, so I ordered medium cook with gouda cheese, avocado, lettuce, tomato, onion and truffle mayo on sesame buns. Wow, this was a delicious burger! Probably one of the best I've had from a restaurant in a long time. The truffle mayo really made this a decadant meal, especially with the texture of the grilled buns. The only drawback is the price. One burger cost $22, which isn't so bad for Las Vegas strip and for the variety and quality of ingredients, definitely worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bison burger w truffle mayo

5ETg0yjmmY3cmfPMUZvnQQ.text: After meeting Hubert Keller and finding out he had another restaurant in Mandalay Bay, we had to try it! It's a bar type atmosphere in the shops that connect Mandalay Bay to Luxor.   They have a big menu with tons of options! If you don't want one of their burgers on the menu, there's a huge list of toppings that you can build your own. They also have multiple options for the side such as fries, tator tots, etc. The food was good but honestly just another burger place. I would be interested in going back to try one of their specialty burgers because I ordered a basic bacon cheeseburger the first time. The fries were too big and not cooked well enough. (Soft inside)   For dessert, we ordered make your own s'mores...always a great idea! They provided many toppings, in addition to the normal chocolate and marshmallows.   We sat at a booth in the bar and each one had a TV.

HF9R1tG0Yg4KjDV24OS5KA.text: I've visited this restaurant EVERY SINGLE TIME I've visited Vegas, and it has very much been worth it. I adore their build-your-own burger concept, and I like their shakes. Their burgers are always great (though I often choose perhaps too many veggies to add to my meal), and the milkshakes really do hit the spot after a busy day on the strip.   I have never had trouble with my friends finding something to eat on their menu. And the service we get here is pretty good considering just how busy this location gets. Perhaps it was once the best Burger restaurant on the strip, but for me it is always just one of my favourite Vegas restaurants. It's a great place for burgers and I'll always seek it out given a trip to Vegas. Located between the Luxor and the Mandalay Bay Casino, it is pretty easy to find and well worth a visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shakes!

4orijP_j_eJQi0NuwMxNPQ.text: ***3.5 Stars***  The Burger Bar in Mandalay Bay's restaurant row has been around a while, having been one of the first upscale burger restaurants in Las Vegas--and it continues to serve delicious burgers, fries and shakes.  When can a hamburger be worth $65? When it's built with Kobe beef, foie gras and truffle shavings and dubbed the Rossini burger by Chef Hubert Keller. Most menu options are more down-to-earth. You can select gourmet burger toppings and pair them with skinny fries and a liquor-spiked milkshake or beer float.  You'll find plenty of gourmet touches to these quality hamburgers. Patties made from beef, buffalo, and turkey are topped off with things like tapenade, roasted pineapple, or fried egg. While the American Classic is everything a burger lover could want--Angus beef, cheese, bacon, tomato and onion.

aXJKVsOMAilr6kRAPWspJg.text: July 26, 2019 we decided to have lunch here before heading over to the WNBA All-Star festivities.  Customer service was great they're located  in the shopping area second floor.  The food was great we had a couple of Kobe burgers which I asked for a little medium rare paint but it seemed a little dry to me but it was still good keep in mind you buy the burger and whatever you add to it is extra charge and also fries are sold separately so you probably end up walking out of their pay $55-$65 a couple. But the food is delicious excellent customer service

MvUqrHtxWuzBZlUQNyOsWw.text: Overall- On the fence (Will come back) I enjoyed the tenderness of the meat but the toppings were underwhelming. I will build my own next time and render a final judgement.   Parking Paid self parking at Mandalay (free for Pearl M Life members) or valet.  Service Service was friendly but slow at times even though there was only a couple tables.  Food Reuben The Black Angus beef really stood out in this case it was very tender and juicy. The flavoring was off from a typical Reuben sandwich, the sauerkraut in particular was very weak. The corned beef was non-existent as well. Reubens has a very distinct flavor and this burger was severely lacking in that flavor. 1 star  Chocolate burger This was an interesting dessert. I found it a tad too sweet for my taste, which I blame the thick chocolate for. The donut bun was just a mediocre donut. Thicker slices of kiwi and strawberry would have been nice.

_ACjb9llkVK4VtqcSqOVpg.text: Skylar made our experience amazing with his custom skinny jalapeno margarita he crafted for me to go with the delicious low carb angus burger entree. DELICIOUS!!! Thank you Skylar!

ZKguTLAocK_ZHP7YVO-Tlw.text: Burger Bar is the way to define this fancy burger joint. Think Taco Bar. Endless way to make your own burger!  We came across to this while walking from Luxor to Mandalay Bay.  What convinced us to eat at this place was that the booths are equipped with our own small TV. Perfect for March Madness (go KU!)  They have plenty of suggestions, but they also have crafted your own burgers. This was what we opted for.   I got their chicken sandwich with skinny fries.  I'm not a big on fries person, but skinny fries? Bring them!  As for chicken sandwich, most of the time we need condiments to add flavors. This chicken sandwich didn't need it!  I could taste the rosemary and it was juicy, glistened when I opened the bun to add onion and tomato to it.   The hubs crafted his own burger and said it was really good with his buffalo tots.   Our little one got their chicken fingers with fruits.   We just need to remind ourselves this is on the strip in Las Vegas so the tab will come out a little pricey.  4 stars is for the price although it was expected.

GCbbK55G9idJJ645ne_uHw.text: Great food, great staff, and an unbelievable selection of craft and specialty beers.  The even had Duchesse on tap the day we were there.

oWCagAsOiJaaby0vHMw--g.text: Great place for a burger!  All kinds of different meat or veggie to choose from!  Love the large variety of toppings.  I got asparagus on my burger!  They also have adult milkshakes!

9rlQ4-K8Jr1yrQHdWpYiMg.text: Solid burger joint...mine was cooked perfectly and the staff/service was great.  Good selection of beer as well.

vYagEWvSvUMq07Qfume7OA.text: Wow, was the manager of this restaurant incredibly rude! We had a guest in our party with food allergies and while simply inquiring how their fair was prepared we were greeted with hostility and frustration, seemingly wasting his time.  We had zero expectation of accommodation, only inquiring how their food was prepared. You would think we asked them to give us their top secret recipes for, of all things, a burger joint for crying out loud.  While the manager was startlingly rude, the hostess was pleasant and was at least sensitive to our plight.  I'm not sure I'd give this place another chance, but if you have possible food issues, I'd go ahead and skip this one. They're not likely to care.

U7sBqkTDRh0T_tG1vZAIFg.text: Service is alright. I'm a turkey burger person, this place doesn't impress me at all. The pepper jack shots are my favorite thing on the menu. I've had beef burgers and they're alright but not for the price I don't think. They do have a fun make your own milk shake menu which is fun. I'm sure ill be back as my friends are big fans but save your money for a better burger.

r2PWSep2_dgQh2UDVDL9wQ.text: Yum... Kobe burger cooked perfect (can add any topping, for $) Fries hot and crispy. Pitcher of beer ice cold.  Went on a Satuday afternoon. It was crowded but not over packed.The wait was less than 5 mins. Staff was friendly.

-AfK3K0eLb3zHId_Q16mAg.text: What a find! My boyfriend did some research and found this place to surprise me. I am so glad he did. The burgers were delicious and the mint chocolate shake was perfection. And the service was phenomenal. Our waiter was very attentive and made sure our group had a fantastic experience.  I would definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone who loves a good burger. Go and enjoy!

INlR3Co52UcMog22DUTrMA.text: Pro: bar in Mandalay, clean bar, atmosphere, TV everything.  Con: low selection on tap while forcing you to buy overpriced bottles.  Ordered Jack and Coke and Jameson on Rock, run down 16 dollars. All ice, low booze. Good place, but yea.

efJmR60gdpbN0flQarXelg.text: With all the hip, new burger joints popping up everywhere (especially on the strip) this one still sets the bar. Friendly service and amazing burgers with a good beer selection.

S6HMDZzjKi7Ox2KApKqAxQ.text: Pretty awesome burger.   Burger Bar is basically an upscale sports bar. Many of the booths have private TV's and tables have views of flat screens everywhere. The beer selection is glorious as they have large selections of Belgian and German beers.   The menu is simple and to the point. You can either build your own burger or select some of the ones they recommend. We built two burgers:   Burger 1: Country Natural Beef, Pepper Jack, Onion, Jalapeno Bacon, Fried Egg, Truffle Sauce on Onion Bun.  Burger 2: Chicken Breast, Sprouts, Fried Egg, Tomato, Button Mushrooms, Cucumber on Ciabatta.   Burger 1 was great. Highlights were the beef and Jalapeno bacon. I thought the onion bun was just okay.   Burger 2 might have been the best Chicken Burger/Sandwich that I ever tried.  Next time I'd like to save room for deserts/sweets. They have a nice selection of interesting shakes and even a beer-ice cream paddle.

q82JLDpVKhudI_d_U3H-bA.text: Tasty burgers with a wonderful selection of toppings.  They also have gluten free buns and steak fries (dedicated fryer).  Loved the alcoholic milkshake made with coffee ice cream, coffee and chocolate liquors. Definitely would come here again if I want a burger!

MVQbEZOFdixtutDRwEPnGg.text: Great place to eat. Service was quick and the food was good. Always a good spot to hit for a quick lunch

eeydao71QIiD1Nh9Nxj6og.text: Mmmm, burgers. One of my favorite foods.  I'm not much for fancy burgers but I made an exception for this place. I was in Vegas for a week (!) for work and stuck in Mandalay Bay. Now, I'm not saying Mandalay is bad place but a week indoors anywhere is rough. My birthday happened to fall that week so a group of about 35 of us ditched the company-sponsored festivities one night and headed to the Burger Bar in Mandalay Place to celebrate my 34th year of existence.  First, I will give the staff kudos for arranging seating for us. When 35 people roll up with no reservation, I'm sure it's not easy but my guess is the check for 35 justifies the hassle. We had to wait for a while but only because some large group with little kids was already in the place. Sidebar: Vegas is no place for a family vacation. Take your fucking kids to Disneyland, not a place famous for gambling, sex and getting piss-drunk. I don't fuck up your Legoland vacation by getting hammered and then hitting on your wife after spending $500 in a strip club so don't fuck up my vacation by bringing your hyper kids to Vegas and letting them run around while screaming their heads off. Deal?  But I digress, on to the food. I ordered the "Hubert Keller Burger." I mean, it's named after the owner (and world-renowned chef) - it's gotta be the shit, right? It's actually a buffalo burger, not beef, with caramelized onions, blue cheese and baby spinach on a ciabatta bun. It was indeed the shit. One of the best burgers I have ever had, in fact. I also ate half of my boss' Kobe beef burger, also excellent. And they don't mess around when you order rare or medium-rare. You better like it bloody if you order it that way, not like those chain restaurants that are afraid to leave any pink in the meat. It makes me nervous to order food in those places. I mean, why are you afraid to serve your food a little underdone? What does that say about the quality of your ingredients?  The sides (sweet potato fries, regular fries) were good but nothing special. I wish I had ordered dessert. They had some good looking "Sweet Burgers" and milkshakes on the menu. Maybe next time. The beer menu is very impressive and they serve pitchers.  The service was very good. They were quick and came by often. With 35 people in the party, I was less concerned with their friendliness, I just wanted them to get the orders correct in a timely fashion, which they did. I willl definitely go back the next time I am at Mandalay.

LOKWWEOC8NeJ7mhBOK70CQ.text: Most things Vegas has to offer are AmAZing but this is one of my favorite places.  It's a martini bar that specializes in burgers.  Can you get any better than that?  I mean, really!?!  The burgers are delicous and you have several options: beef, kobe beef, turkey, veggie and buffalo along with several other sandwich options.  The best is the dessert burger.  This is awesome!  You won't get anything anywhere else that tastes as good!  This restaurant is a great choice for a casual day in Vegas.  It's reasonably priced, has a full bar and is not the same boring places that you go to at home.

b4ZA1iNvYz14SRseGDMM1w.text: This is a great place to get a burger, in Vegas or anywhere else for that matter.  The fries are good too.  What's really awesome about Burger Bar is the options that are available.  You can choose the meat, bun, cheese, and other toppings, all adding up to a great burger. The kobe beef burger is definitely my favorite.  It is so juicy and tasty!   The portions are large as well, so if you are not too hungry you could split a burger and be pretty satisfied.  But why would you want to share a burger this good?!?   Only downsides are the wait for a table or booth, and that it is on the pricey side...but not too bad by Vegas standards. Definitely worth checking out if you are in the south strip or staying in Mandalay Bay!

DWo8ZLNq0ccWX2NTc-Cxnw.text: I have NO idea what I ate here, but I remember that I did drink a little.  I mean come on, it's Vegas.  Line has always been out the door every time I have passed by.  Pretty pricey, but a lot of options.  They had a vegetarian option for my friend, which I thought was a nice touch!!  Service was great and very accommodating.  I came a bit late, but the waitress was quick to help.

muY81zMTIex5qrOixv00sg.text: i've experienced one of the best burger here but NOT FROM the $60 Rossini  I did however tried the Rossini but not my favorite.  I understand all the  wonderful ingredients in it but it still didn't do anything for me.  We came back another day and had our own custom burger and it was delicious!!!!  Our custom burger: which is BOMB! - BLACK ANGUS BEEF (i preferred this one over the kobe from their rossini) -PEPPERED BACON -BLEU CHEESE -MOZZARELLA CHESE -FRIED EGG -PORTOBELLO MUSHROOMS -AVOCADO -ALFAFA SPROUTS -on wheat bread ... oh man, i'm going to the SF location now just to have this burger again!  Besides  the Custom Burger we had: - ROSSINI .... not worth the $60 - NUTELLA MILKSHAKE  ... it's so heavy but so delicious if you love nutella like i do - FRENCH KISS MILKSHAKE & IRISH CREAM  ... both are good but i prefer the french kiss - SWEET POTATO FRIES ... can't go wrong  -DESSERT: CHOCOLATE BURGER ... not my fave, this came with the Rossini

IvWuMLnYZO9yviT4vye20w.text: The Burger Bar is one of my favorite burgers in Vegas.  One thing I remember from my previous visits years ago was how the staff had a holier than thou attitude and that attitude still remains.  Chill out, it's a friggin burger joint.  I laughed at the hostess after she told me it was 20 minutes for a table for one.  When I started to walk away she alerted me that I could sit at the bar if I liked.  I happily took her up on that offer.  Lunch started with a fantastic pint of Blue Moon.  This glass of beer set things right.  It was the perfect temperature and had a substantial orange wedge.  I'd rather have too much orange than too little.  I'm the same with Corona. The beer lasted just long enough for an awesome bacon cheeseburger to arrive.  The burger was packed with one of two types of "Jack" cheese (I told them to surprise me and I don't remember which I had) and accompanied by a side of skinny fries.  The burger was prepared medium and was nice and juicy.  The bacon was fantastic and, although I'm not much of a fry guy, the fries were nice, crisp and tasty.  I'm sure I need to explore other fancy burger places on the strip, but Burger Bar still holds up as a favorite.

LqxKTDUO9EDpTIvz-R5YFQ.text: There was 6 of us on a Friday night, took about an hour to get seated. First things first, they do not offer Coke or Dr. Pepper. This is a staple for me when I have a burger. Pepsi is not the same thing so that was a disappointment. I went with the Kobe burger and split some fries and onion rings with my friends. The kobe beef was quite good. Fries and Onion rings above average. Total bill was $170 for 6 of us including drinks and gratuity.  If you are looking for a fun night out with friends or want to try this place once I would rec it. If you are just looking to satisfy your burger fix I would go elsewhere.

HjKGJ3DQ0dfmN1UOCk5mEA.text: Best burger joint in Vegas. Sometimes a bit of a wait due to location and popularity, but definitely worth the wait. Huge selection great prices.

RTe33G_8aMU5CpSXHUbyKA.text: What a pleasant surprise!  Talk about JUICY BURGER...this place cooks/grills to order.  I had the buffalo burger that just melted in my mouth.  highly recommend this place if you want a good burger in Vegas.

MNiYaTo2j9NN2oL3hjtF4A.text: i love burger bar!  sure you can go to red robin and pay $20 less.  but everything is so good!  i had a turkey burger with swiss cheese, spinach, and grilled asparagus and sweet potatoe fries on the side.  it was amazing!    i love the atmosphere too!  it's such a great place.

yc9hJAtdeYuhaaWiqiK_lg.text: this is by far the best burger i've ever had.. i try to come here every vegas trip.. this is now my 4th or 5th time being here, and every time the burger is absolutely perfect.  the sweet potato fries and the great selection of brews on tap helps too.  they have many excellent toppings to choose from, but lets face it - a burger is about the meat and the bun... and the bacon... and all of it is so tasty.. and every body i kno that tries this place tells me they r gunna make it a point to come here on every vegas trip.  one bit of advice - go for the angus burger.. don't bother spending the xtra money on the kobe beef burger.. its good but not any better than the angus.  kobe beef is known for its marbling and is meant to be eaten as a steak so its a waste to grind it up and throw it on a grill where all that marbling gets lost - but whatever you get im sure you'll like it

bR2elMysvIiCk5GtX3_bPw.text: Food-wise, this place is okay. I mean, it may be a little overrated for "gourmet" burgers, but it's almost worth it.   I was, however, absolutely appalled at their service standards here. My friend and I had dinner here tonight and ordered a split of champagne they were offering as a special or highlight or whatever. After realizing it was not what we expected, we tried sending it back, only half expecting them to take it off the bill.   Maybe it's their policy to try to comp as little as possible, but the entire situation was handled extremely poorly. Both my friend and I are involved in the fine dining food and beverage industry in one way or another, we are well aware of how most good restaurants on the strip will bend over backwards to make customers happy. Instead of apologizing and/or offering some kind of compensation for the dissatisfaction, the manager came out and proceeded to argue with us for a good 10 minutes about their general policy about unsatisfactory items, and as long as nothing was technically wrong with the product (i.e. spoiled or whatever) they wouldn't do anything else about the situation. And then he had the nerve to tell us about how he would only take it off the bill if we were going to leave "extremely unhappy", and that he was already losing money on the sale as it was. This, after a bottle of champagne was sitting out at room temp for over 20 minutes, becoming warm and flat. After a while we just got tired of all the arguing and told him to do what he had to do, paid the bill, and left.    Needless to say he's lost at least 2 repeat customers, not to mention our significant others and countless number of friends who I'll make sure will never go here.

CaUkiaJhMKUgPg3Dm7sRwQ.text: I actually liked the sports bar atmosphere of this place  Great place to watch your football wagers win while filling up.  also love the beer selection(chimay and fat tire on tap).  Tried the surf and turf burger with bacon.  Burger was good, maybe a little underseasoned.  Lobster was a tad bit over cooked.  Wish it were grilled instead of steamed Bun was good.  The kicker on this burger was asparagus.  Surprisingly good!  Overall the burger was a bit dry, could have benefitted from some sort of sauce.  This place cooks its burgers to steak temps which maybe a little rare for a lot of people.  The fries were the most disappointing part of the meal.  The skinny fries came with my meal.  They tasted very generic.  they were the type that has that crispy coating(potato flour I think)  But they were uninspired for a a burger joint.  Thought in/n/out's fries blew these away.  Not too expensive for a celebrity chef joint.

0jnLBGZPcqe2hA15uXsf5A.text: The Burger Bar will make you any custom burger that you want and they make it good! Their burgers are close to perfection and they have great fries to go along with them. The menu is pricey and there is usually a little wait. This isn't your typical burger joint by any means they make you pay for the quaility burger that you get. There service was so-so because of how packed it was but it wasn't anything too bad. Give it try if you want an awesome burger.

76l6e5kmVcWofUx6BGzLDA.text: i expected a lot from the hype. $60 kobe beef burger? pass on it.

_SBQ4dbvMrYsp8IakisRAg.text: i go vegas every year and i have to eat burger bar everytime i go. i hate eatin burgers, but not when i go to burger bar. it's the best burgers i ever had. the sweet potato fries are the best! u can also build ur own burger too.

Q8kMX7jeAngWuOrfCuReIQ.text: i love the sweet potato fries!  good burger, good fries, good service.  the dessert was interesting.  it was a chocolate dessert burger.  a donut sliced in half (buns), a chocolate block (patty), mint leaves (lettuce) and some sliced strawberries (tomato).  you can't really go wrong with chocolate, donuts and strawberries.  i coulda gone without the mint leaves.  i think they were mint leaves.  i would go back.  great burger place.

k0NaUEkpNKok2RU6DuVyqw.text: Two weeks separated from our recent trip to Vegas, I am still thinking of the Kobe beef burger I devoured at Burger Bar. Sometimes you just want to say "no more buffets" and just get a good piece of meat between 2 pieces of bread. This wasn't just a piece of meat though. Being my first kobe beef burger ever, I had to order it medium rare. I usually order bacon with my burger, but oh no, not on this one. Oh,  this thing is a piece of art, I tell you. I took a moment as it sit there daring me to pick it up and eat it. But no, as if to torture myself a few minutes more knowing that relief is right in front of me (almost like when you want to take a shit so bad, u finally reach a toilet bowl, u hold it in just a few seconds longer). I sit there admiring this man made creation. I could kiss the chef in th ass. It was beyond delicious. While you're there, go on and order the Nutella milkshake, holy moly. It's just beyond amazing. Oh, and people who gave this place less than 4 stars didn't order the Kobe burger, haha.

CErN-OAgFr8iQiW9LQ9hFw.text: 4.5 stars. Great burgers, nice beer list, nice ambiance. Be aware that when you order medium rare, you are going to get REAL medium rare, not the "medium rare" that we've all grown accustomed to ordering to get a bit of pink in the middle.  My burger was juicy - incredibly meaty-tasting and generously portioned. Loved the sweet potato fries and the beer. A definite win at Vegas...

sakmqllXQVhvyrQFByny2Q.text: Excellent Kobe burger. Be prepared to spend $20 for a burger once you load your cheese, mushrooms and bacon! Great beer selection and friendly staff. My friend had one of the milkshakes and it looked rich and awesome. Go, you'll enjoy it.

dMKdTTSCQbXKFy4SCgK37Q.text: The veggie burger here is one of the best i've had at any restaurant.  I love that it had pumpkin in it.  And the whole wheat bun was the best I've had ever.  The sweet potato fries were also great.  It was cool that they had a "vegas vegan" portobello/vegetable option too and a vegan shake with soy whip.

Vma_xM20GEhucLwPaaOSng.text: I might have come here with expectations that were too high or perhaps I just ordered the wrong burger, but I was a bit disappointed by this place.  I also wasn't able to get a table so ate at the bar, which was surprising given the time that we came and the fact that parts of the restaurant were empty.  I think next time I am back, I will try one of the other burger places in Vegas than come back here.

HxpnLf51TNfXBQvHGFR-HQ.text: This place is awesome.  I go there at least once every time I am in Vegas.  The different cheeses and toppings are a bonus, I love the egg and carmelized onions.  Great selection of beer, great service at the bar.  This place is a winner.

9F-N8KJYq6NvDp9Y45y4GA.text: ok, just love the burger bar.  its a fancy/expensive burger joint, but the food and atmosphere are awesome.  see you start with the standard burger and then can add any type of topping you can think of.  fried eggs, avocado, lobster.  anything goes.  they also have preset exotic burgers done.  i had the surf & turf burger, nothing like a huge meat patty topped with lobster tails.   just fantastic.  even their standard burger is good.  they also have a huge selection of draft beers here.  and the best part is the little lcd tv's that are in each both.  gotta love that extra special touch.

DxMnx-FeQC59gcahdnZ4ag.text: What a great (and yummy) find!  Like some of the other yelpers, I am a vegetarian and at a place with the name of Burger Bar, I was sceptical to say the least.  I was wrong - their homemade veggie burger is to die for!  And, the sweet potato fries are the very best I've ever had!  My husband had the kobe beef and absolutely loved it as well.  It is a bit pricey, all the fixings are an additional cost, but you're in Vegas, so go for it!  They're usually crowded, but if you're in a hurry, hit up the bar, where service is fast and very good.

-5kSA8ZQa37Bdqa7IhBQaw.text: OK...so after reading all the reviews we went to the Burger Bar to make our own opinion. Let me say- any poor reviews are because people are expecting their burger to be made of gold and the wait staff to hand them a new car with every order. The waitresses were all nice(we went 3 times  during our 4 day stay). The food? Ummmmm DELISH!!! we tried to get something different everytime and it was never bad, in fact it was amazing. the kobe burger, i want to drive four hours just to eat it. my boyfriend is a health nut with a burger weakness and is now obsessed with the buffalo burger. The burgers are divine....sorry to all the people who wrote bad reviews....pretty much means they forgot they are reviewing a BURGER..not a 5 star establishment. Will we go back? At least 2 times everytime we are in Vegas.

DXKWBjgX5nTTBkF-bfbzPA.text: if you are looking for an awesome burger, then this is the place.  Loved that you can build your own, and have tons of options. The Kobe beef option is the way to go.  Also, awesome sweet potato fries!!!  Will definitely go back when looking for a quick bite.

wK3muRbnWQEMeSplMmXJWg.text: Best burgers I have ever had hands down!  I went to this place everyday I was in Vegas.  If you like burgers, then you need to go here.

U5wYGSIgZkuMEu8gzk49kg.text: This place is amazing! They serve the best burger that I have ever had. Not only do they have your classic burgers but they have specialty burgers such as Kobe, Buffalo, burgers with lobster on them ect. If you are in Vegas and hungry stop by and try this place. It will be a little pricey, but you get what you pay for.

t8S0mDXfC2usww671VsIKg.text: A large group of us ate here after the Michael Jackson show.  Food was great, had the buffalo burger and added my toppings on. Fries were great.  Shakes were yummy and creamy as well.  My only complaint was the service. But, the Tv's they had on the side of the booth made it ok to wait.  Check it out if you are looking for a casual dinner place in Vegas.

hxfFUWvG68YXW7LpyT9JZg.text: I love trying new restaurants when in Las Vegas!  I took one for the team, loving vegetarian wife that I am, and we headed here.  We were told the wait was 30 minutes for lunch, but oh no, it was more like 45 mins.  I hate that.    Anywho.  We had a really, really friendly waitress and got a great booth with our own television.  My husband took forevaaaaa picking a beer, but was impressed by the extensive selection.  For food I went with the greek salad, sweet potatoes fries, and a chocolate shake.  Who would've thought that they'd have a delicious greek salad for me to eat?!?!!  And the sweet potatoes fries were just right.  And the chocolate shake!  Wowsa!  I think part of my satisfaction is due to the fact that I NEVER eat fries or chocolate shakes, but still.    Definitely a good stand by when we return, but I'm not sure we'll make this our number one stop.  There's too many other places to eat!

m3Fsm5Bxs1JSCLZUb6-tNw.text: Burger bar uses quality meat and excellent execution to make some really great burgers. Not the best burger I've ever had in my life, but pretty great. My favorites are the peppercorn burger and the Hubert burger.  They have an excellent beer selection as well.

m-moozWSADP907v_4k9AeQ.text: I had a Greek burger plus jalapeno .. it is not exactly a burger , as it has a pita bread instead. it was awesome and delicious

E01BYcw-7x3VWYmnQsWwhw.text: My boyfriend and I were excited to visit Hubert Keller's Burger Bar in the Mandalay Place after Keller's appearance on Top Chef Masters.   My boyfriend customized a Natural Burger(?) with Swiss cheese and portabella mushroom on a wheat bun with a side of onion rings, while I customized my Kobe Burger with mozzarella, caramelized onions, and garlic aioli on a sesame bun, and I got mine with a side of sweet potato fries.  Now, don't get me wrong. These were good burgers. But there was nothing more to it. They were good, but not exceptional. We were expecting in-your-face goodness but the burgers certainly failed to meet that expectation, considering the chef's reputation. Quite honestly, Umami in LA has better burgers; the patties are incredibly juicy at Umami. For what the Burger Bar is charging, i.e. anywhere from $10 ~ $16 for a burger that comes with fries, or $16~$21 customized burger and sides, they need to do better than what they are serving now.   The only things that were memorable were the garlic aioli and the onion rings; other than that, I would consider this place as "been there, done that" and something that I have checked off my list, but do not expect to visit again.

XB2eHS1TYx9TM8oPokAKwQ.text: I guess I was pretty lucky.  The three of us got here on a late Monday afternoon and there was no wait at all.  Since I was at Hubert Keller's Burger Bar...I wanted the full experience.  Burger, skinny fries, sweet potato fries and a strawberry shake.   I swear my meal was 3000 calories in itself!  Hopefully what happens in Vegas, will stay in Vegas.  I had to walk off the extra weight afterwards!      I wanted to order the $60 Kobe beef burger with foie gras and shaved truffles...but that seemed a little extravagent for a late lunch.  Also, build your own burgers always seem to fail me.  There are always too many options and I tend to add too much to my burger.  So I decided to keep it simple and I ordered the sliders.  I figured it was the best way to sample 3 different burgers.  The first was the American Classic which consisted of cheese, sliced tomato, lettuce & pickle.  The second consisted of bacon and the third had caramelized onions.  Honestly, I couldn't tell the difference of which patty was Kobe beef, Buffalo and Ridgefield Farm beef.  They were supposed to be cooked to medium, but it was well done when I got them.  The patties were a little on the cold side and a little dry.  Also, I didn't like the bun on these sliders at all.  I prefer a moist, soft bun.  These were not.  If there is a next time, I'll have to order a regular sized burger.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sliders
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caesar Salad
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. American Classic Burger

bc9ZuJsKcnEBFpDPk6Rh5Q.text: So here's the thing about Burger Bar: you have to believe that a $15-$30 burger can be worth the money.  I know what you're thinking: "No f-ing way."  Well, that's fine.  I used to be like you: uneducated, unknowing.  Unenlightened.  And then I went, and my eyes were opened to the top of the burger world.  First, you gotta choose your meat: you can get Angus, Kobe, hell, even Buffalo and Vegetarian.  Then you choose your toppings, and this is where the fun starts.  You like lobster?  Bam!  Throw it on top of your Kobe burger.  You like shrimp?  Bam!  Throw it on top of your Buffalo burger.  You like lobster AND shrimp?  Bam!  You're crazy.  But you can throw both of them on top of your Angus.  They've got different kinds of bacon, different kinds of lettuce, cheese, mushrooms... hell, they even have shaved truffles, which launches your burger into the price stratosphere.  Somehow, everything is cooked so well that it all goes together, even if you've got a Vegetarian burger topped with eggs, asparagus, and applewood bacon.  Then you have sides.  They have a great selection of those, too.  Normal fries, sweet potato fries.... they're wonderfully crisp with just enough of the potato matter.  My personal favorite is the fried zucchini; way better than anything you'll get at a carnival or random schmuck burger joint.  The decor is pretty nice; it's sort of like a gentrified sports bar.... that occasionally serves $65 burgers with truffles.  But it's comfortable, warm and inviting, with tons of wood bars, tables, and booths.  I haven't really had a chance to try the beers, as I think I'm usually too busy stuffing my face.  Anyway, give it a shot.  I never thought a $25 burger could be worth it, but they've made a True believer out of me.

1lDcGQ556UN11kEqrYHSHQ.text: Wow.  What a great concept.  All the fixin's you want.  Custom made to order.  Angus beef, kobe... whatever.   Cheeses?  Every kind made to man.   You can get some high class truffles and stuff like that.   Sides are decent.   If you're too lazy to think up of something original, the chef has a menu set to pick from.    There's a full bar, but a BIG plus is the beer menu.  They have an extensive import selection.  Stuff you don't see anywhere.  I got a Delirius and a Lambic Apple Cider Ale from the Belgium menu.  Some good stuff.   Ahhhh, beer.

xiEd2_JG8pgl_H_ciT4YkA.text: What hasn't already been said about this place?   I can honestly say that their kobe burger(named after the great Kobe Bryant.  lol jp) is the best damn burger I have eaten in my 25 years of existence. Prior to dining at this gem, I'd be damned if I would pay 20 bucks for a slab of beef between a bun. But I've never had hamburger meat literally melt in my mouth. DamN!  I'd gladly pay it over and over again if I werent 300 miles away   =(  The salmon burger is the bomb too!

2qJ6Zns6AQgWNsYBi4xd-g.text: I absolutely loved this place! A small group of us were there for my friend's birthday and I had the Hubert Keller Burger with buffalo, baby spinach, blue cheese, caramelized onions, a shallot reduction sauce on a ciabatta bun.... um... AMAZING! I've never had buffalo before and found it very flavorful and lean. The shallot reduction sauce was a little underwhelming and kinda made the burger a big mess.... but a delicious mess!  Remember... it is Las Vegas so it is a bit pricey.... my burger was about $20, but worth it for Vegas. You spend $20 on a spin at the roulette table so why not for an amazing burger.   Also had some onion rings and fried zucchini which was great. Some of the best fried zucchini I've ever had. They have a HUGE beer selection which I loved... had a amber ale which was perfect with the burger.   Our server was great.... very prompt and always had a smile. The hostess however, seemed like she checked out for the day. While she was physically there and seated us quickly, she had -0- personality.  This is definitely on my list of places to return to when I'm in Vegas :)

fQWBtZa0coNCyeeIN2Ko9A.text: The french fry sauces were the best thing here.  I ended up getting sliders to try three types of burgers and none of them stood out.  The sauce sampler is worth the try.  A decent place for lunch if your at Mandalay Bay and need a bite.

uAjhwwubLFRs6Y1la8MFfw.text: The angus burger was good, but I thought the fries were kind of mushy.  Also tried the jalapeno bacon, which was a mistake.  The spiciness overwhelmed the burger.  Lastly, the service was pretty bad.  I think our waitress didn't come by at all after dropping off the food and it wasn't that busy at the time.  Overall, I thought it was over-rated.

MOV6G5Sd_xJ102vc2u8TcQ.text: If I could give this place zero stars I would.  Burger was bloody -- didn't want it that way. Iced tea is made from powder -- disgusting. Had to ask for ketchup 3 times -- the bottled was on the table empty to begin with.  Nothing good to say, would've been better off at Red Robin.

7Rq2ULOuElpW5vejq7MLzw.text: Went here a month ago and then went again this past week...this place just gets better and better!  This time we ordered the American Kobe Beef burger...the meat was so tender and juicy and it made all the difference!  We also ordered the Cobb Salad which I expected to be just OK but it was EXCELLENT!  The wait staff was also super friendly/attentive which makes the experience all the better.

2CLI2IlN7Ngmt2LhmA-WmA.text: Burger Bar is awesome.  Try the Kobe.  Yes, its almost 20 bucks for a hamburger.  You're in Vegas, not Idaho.  Order it medium, have the shoe string fries, and you're set.  I usually like adding shrimp and roasted peppers to my burgers (because its Vegas, because I CAN).    Good place to go see, be seen, and chill before a crazy night out.  You want a jumbo jack for .99 cents?  You know where to find those.  This isn't that place.

bnLh_kMfgcmnRE2Ye7UvsQ.text: This is one of the best burger joints out there. Sure it may be spend y, but where else can you choose between Kobe or Angus beef. So many choices so little time. The staff is friendly and is very attentive. This is a must stop for any burger lover!

Wy9NCThoTg_hgefY8cfXgA.text: The Burger Bar had slipped a bit over the last couple of year but this year they've rebounded considerably. I ate there twice this trip and both times the burgers were outstanding as were the fat fries. (skip the skinny fries - they tend to come out cold). I still wish they offered brown or deli mustard along with the plethora of other dipping goodies.  I have to knock off 1.5 stars for the table service which is indifferent at best. The best bet for service is sit at the bar.

QYiZ0RFnP69GkVwgVj4zjw.text: Went here one night for dinner, ordered the American Burger and a Fat Tire.  Instead of the regular fries, ordered the sweet potato fries.  My friend ordered the Kobe Burger and Onion Rings and an Alcoholic Mint Shake.  Overall, we felt that the meal was just so-so.  My burger was pretty much your typical burger with cheese, bacon, lettuce, tomato, etc. His burger was a little more tender than mine, but still nothing to rave about.  His shake was supposed to have alcohol in it, but who knows if there was any actually in there.  You cant really go wrong with a Fat Tire.   When we went, it was about dinner time, so they were pretty crowded.  We were told there was about a 20 min wait, unless we wanted to sit at the bar.  We were starving so we elected to sit at the bar only to walk to the back to find that the only seats open were the last 2, one of which is IN the walkway for the servers to get to the kitchen.  We ended up sitting there, where we noticed that almost the whole back half of the restaurant was empty.  Apparently they werent seating in that area because they didnt have enough servers.  That sucks.  One good thing about this place was conveniently located in a mall, so you can walk off all the food you just ate, or browse the shops while you wait for your table.  This is your typical burger and beer place, and I probably wouldnt recommend the alcoholic shakes.  Id stick to the regular shakes for half the price.  Another good thing about this restaurant is that you can build your burger however you want it. A definite plus for those picky eaters, or the people who like everything under the sun on their burgers.

HS6SuG6xu1Hdd5CHylPQTg.text: We waited 50 min for dinner on a Sunday, but were able to easily distract ourselves and make the wait go faster by visiting the neighboring mall stores.  The wait was well worth it; you'll have to study the menu for a while to figure out what to order because not only is there a wide selection of burgers and drinks/shakes to choose from, but there's a million different combos of burgers you can customize.  Luckily, they have a page of specialty burgers so that you don't have to make those tough decisions.  I stayed simple and picked the organic-y, grass-fed beef burger cooked medium-rare on wheat and added only swiss cheese, tomato, and sprouts (I wanted to be able to fit the burger in my mouth).  I probably shouldn't have ordered anything else because I couldn't finish it.  But what did we decide to do?  Since there were four of us, we each can order four different type of french fries and all try each others' fries!  Fat fries, skinny fries, sweet potato fries, and seasoned fries, I think.  A few more people at our table and we probably would have ordered the rest of the types of fries on the menu.  The fries were good entertainment (and too filling), but clearly the burgers are the superstar here!  Unless you have a huge appetite or order JUST a burger (hard to do given the wide menu selection), you'll probably need to take some to go.  Don't overlook the drink/shakes section.  They serve alcoholic milkshakes here, like a "French Kiss" (Vanilla ice cream, Godiva liqueur, Kahlua, chocolate) or an "Irish Coffee" (Coffee ice cream, Kahlua, Jameson, Caramel, Chocolate syrup, Chocolate coffee beans).  And don't just drink a Guinness beer.  Have a Guinness BEER FLOAT (Guinness, Coffee ice cream).  If you're more of a Blue Moon beer person, they toss in Raspberry Sorbet into a glass of Blue Moon.  What a great way to kill two birds with one stone (having a drink and eating dessert).  Learn from my mistakes; leave room for the Alcoholic Milkshakes and/or Beer Floats.  I didn't and now I probably will have to make an excuse to visit Vegas yet again to try another burger variation and finish it off with an Alcoholic Milkshake!

wOqpNfq8epmRn0ZcAqsQZQ.text: excellant service. burgers are Great. for the price they should include fries or onion rings. cant wait to go back.

cMYQoAJtIJ_aqIJSzALQEA.text: Great option for people staying at/gambling at/visiting the Mandalay Bay and Luxor. We had a party of 6 for a team dinner at a convention. They don't take reservations for parties less than 20, but fortunately they were able to seat us after only a 10 minute wait.  Decor is nothing special, but certainly comfortable.  Our server was friendly and efficient.    Orders in our group of 6 included 3 of the Kobe burgers, 1 angus burger, 1 natural beef burger, and one salmon burger.  We shared an order of skinny fries (good, but nothing special), sweet potato fries (good), and onion rings (very good).  Everybody enjoyed their food immensely.  I had the natural beef burger, cooked a really nice medium, with jack cheese, guac, and caramelized onions (which the waitress suggested when I said that I needed something else on my burger).  Mmmm.  Very good beer selection--both on tap and in bottles.  Two people got milkshakes (non-alcoholic ones).  I got a taste of the nutella shake and it was terrific; really, really thick and chocolaty.  Will certainly remember Burger Bar for future visits to Vegas!

155Ntm3gW7hBy9Uqfidlaw.text: I had the buffalo burger with sweet potato fries.  It was good and the fries was great. However, I would of given this 4 stars if the prices wasn't so steep.  I think I spent 30$+ for my burger and the rasberry beer float.  That was really good though.  The wait was a bit long but I was enjoying the beer float.  Yummy.

rNwjYheHw3wxCF29dzijlA.text: It's pretty good but I'd have to say that the prices are a little steep for what you get. Had the all american and it was a very good burger. Don't know if it was 15 dollar good, but good. The fries were ok, but not fabulous. Tried someone's onion ring and it was DELISH. Next time would go for those. Dining companion also had the kobe beef burger which was divine according to her - didn't get a chance to taste. Saw decadent looking shakes.....yum. Thought about the foie but was happy I didn't get it  - I was plenty full....

H6f0aQ_0lhjWLDYcPUj1UQ.text: Burger Bar offers a good burger and good beer.  It is cheap by Las Vegas dining standards but still a darn expensive burger anywhere else in the free world. (Average burger price around $13)

3I1P-6ObWIo_UU7vQ9ZtfA.text: My favorite casual restaurant in Vegas!!  Great burger selection and a fun atmosphere.

sJ4-ewR98dYdGSnlzhc5Kg.text: Really liked this place.  The options are endless!  I ended up ordering a kobe beef burger with blue cheese and roasted peppers with skinny fries.  I would have liked the fries a little bit more if they were fresh-cut, but they were still good nonetheless.    Note: it's in Mandalay Place, which is the mall that connects Mandalay Bay and the Luxor,  so make sure you're not wandering around the hotel looking for it, because you won't find it!

V2FXJ6WMImNFm5xHAhbjVA.text: First of all it's the most anyone will probably pay for a burger in there lifetime at least for me i'm sure! But overpaying for food of humble origins is just part of that Vegas thing for good or ill and I have long made peace with it. The place is accurate in it's name as a bar because the size of the place I feel plays a factor in the long lines. Vegas is about huge volumes of people and this place is smaller then allot of restaurants around the strip so planning accordingly goes a long way to starving less. Personally I say what breaks this place apart from great places I have had burgers is not so much that its miles better. But rather the options to assemble your perfect burger is staggering and the possible combinations equally so. Think of it as your one shot to make a burger in your image and then devour it like a hungry god and you get the idea of this place. If your just ordering a regular burger that you think will surpass the regular burgers back home it might be able to but not by huge margins.

oEuEIoDUKsDiNADACbhuFA.text: This place has delicious burgers!! I hadthe low carb specialty burger and was extremely satisfied!  So juicy and flavorful, he really hit the target here.  The prices were reasonable for Vegas, and I would definitely return!

lRhe8wUfmED6Hbg7EbACgA.text: Awesome food, Terrible waitress. So my wife and myself joined a few friends and had a great meal. Unfortunately our waitress was a complete idiot. We get our bill and split it with cash and a card. Guess that was too much for her to calculate. She comes back with my card and over charged me by 20$. So she takes it back and then does it again. So me being nice and thinking she might've had a bad day, I ignore it and give the extra 10 now that she over charged me and would leave it as a tip. She explains to me that the over charge would be off in a few days. I get home yesterday and check my account and come to find out that she had charged me for the full bill between my self my wife and her 2 friends and took the 40$ in cash for herself. Trying to rectify this. The only upside is that my burger was decent but wouldn't recommend this to friends or family.

r_AyYDCqJVOkmFF-Xr8pGw.text: A great place if you wanna watch a game and get shit-faced. I came here for lunch with some friends and there was 45 minute wait! My Kobe burger was really good. I ordered it rare with grilled onions, avocado, and pepper jack cheese. The cooks forgot to put the cheese and didn't give my friend her chipotle aioli sauce. The skinny fries were fine but not fresh. I recommend the buttermilk zucchini fries and onion rings. Our server was fine and prompt with refills. I spent $32.00 on my burger, beer, and tip. I like this place, but probably come only if family and friends come into town.

N-6VXiz4bkv7NCosoH0HRQ.text: The best burger i've ever had. It is amazing. Might as well name it Build-A-Burger. The service was good and the amount of food is great. I have nothing bad to say about the burger. I will come here again when I make my visit to vegas.

w2trtpXsMOgmsOqU149zWQ.text: Would I have waited in the line going out into the hallway for this place?  Probably not.  But for our last meal in Vegas it was a good one!  We were waiting to go grab the luggage and hit a cab to the airport, but neede3d some grub.  I'm not a fan of anything in the Luxor so we headed over to Mandalay.  The service was *eh* but I love being able to put all sorts of different things on a burger!  Yummy!  Choices of cheese and veggies!?  If only they didn't charge $1 or $2 for each item I could have made them like I do at home.  But seriously, $1 for guac and $2 for fresh avocado?  I think my partner got more guacamole on hers than my sad little piece of avocado.  And then I'm adding a whole extra star for having Shiner Bock on tap!!!  It's hard enough to find it in Chicago, and I sure wasn't expecting to see it on a beer list on vacation!  Thanks for ending our trip on a high note!

ir6XxVsuuV-WTK4nrS8lbw.text: i go out to vegas twice a year and since i was introduced to this place last year, i've made it a point to go here every time now.    i can't stop thinking about that buffalo burger.  i'm telling you, they are sooo good. they are lower and cholesterol and fat (not that i care THAT much) but i just like that slightly gamey taste and tenderness. and the way that they prepare it there is awesome.    i love their red wine and shallot reduction and caramelized onions. and of course sweet potato fries. their angus burger and kobe beef is good as well. if you like bacon, their jalapeno bacon is very good.   my only complaint is the wait and the fact that you can't make reservations.  but i think it's worth the wait!   oh! and they have an extensive list of beers from all over the world.

PvwC-yJcdivnecqyF3k8qQ.text: The burgers here are very good, it is a bit pricey for them though. I had the american kobe beef burger, not as good as regular kobe beef but still good. Also the jalapeno bacon and sweet potato fries is very good. If your looking for a good burger I would suggest this place.

-f1601QQ1P1U7hTq1FEgnw.text: Went here also for my birthday.  The food is a bit more than I would have though.  I ordered the Kobe Burger which was really good.  Nice soft and tender.  You can also add on stuff such as cheese and grilled onions for $1 more each to truffles which were about $30 extra to add on.   The sweet potato fries were a bit addicting, but the regular fries were just like Burger King french fries.  Nothing special.  The service was friendly and fairly responsive.  I liked the atmosphere, and there's even a television embedded into the wall at the table you sit at, too bad I couldn't change the channel not that I paid much attention to the telvision anyways.  If you have the money, why not.  The burgers are nice and big.

AnJOLGnB22DBXO0rgRM3cA.text: Tasty burgers any way you want them, and a good beer selection!  Lots of TVs for game-watching, and the servers are friendly.  We were there on a busy night and they did forget about my beer, but brought it by eventually.  The Kobe beef burger is not worth the $$, in my opinion.  It's good, but not life-altering.

cGcqoNYR-2SHqqDjB6ZiWQ.text: Still as good as I remembered, esp. the zucchini fries.  Took a newbie and she loved her Angus burger with cheddar.  As much as it hasn't changed, I'm afraid a lot of other burger places have caught up in taste and quality.   But it's still worthy of a visit.

rCPFi2wllRNvxbMmBFt3zw.text: A total waste of a cab ride. Thankfully we didn't have to wait in the 45 minute+ line that seems to always be here. But it was really pretty average. Better than a Carl's Junior $6 burger but far below a decent back yard BBQ. The boyfriend and I shared a buffalo burger and sweet potato fries. It was ok, nothing special. No special seasonings or expert cooking or fine meat. No one at our table of 6 said "wow that is a tasty burger" well one person did but she eats everything and it was her idea to come here. And even she mentioned a back yard burger would have been better. I generally go to restaurants because they cook better than me. So for the cost of our burger I think I will buy some Worcestershire sauce, a package of ground beef and have a little something left over to make up for the cab fare we wasted coming to this place.

TV7Q4lqMXYzpAJFiy5NJ5g.text: Very average. My self-made Kobe beef burger (that is, American Kobe beef, not real Kobe) was AIIGHT.  The pre-made Angus burger was worse.  And my sweet potato fries were burnt!

lWz75TpIFFOAs7HqJyesmA.text: burger bar is officially on our "must do" list every time we're in town!  this time around, i did the pink monkey shake and mac n cheese croquettes.  it was a bit early in the day for a burger.  both options were super tasty.  i did take away a star this time around.  our service was a bit slow and i think that $20 for a lamb burger was pretty expensive.  it won't keep us from coming back, i just think there are better items on the menu than a $20 burger.

9LWSdHy-T5w8R7UHEm2tzQ.text: I am only giving this place a 2 star because our waitress did her best. It started off ok with putting in our names. we were told we would have a 10-20 min wait, I'm ok with that.it turned out to be 30 min with people who came after us being seated before us. we were a party of 2, pretty easy to seat. I got a migraine while waiting outside so long so when we were seated at a table in a noisy area I asked for a booth because they were a little enclosed, I was told we would have to wait another 10 at least. I told them I need to order a drink to take my medicine and couldn't wait any longer. we were told once we received something we couldn't change seats. so when our waitress came and I expressed my opinion she went to find the manager whom I told what happened. they gave me my drink then let us move tables. the food was just ok, the prices a bit high, I liked the burger bar at NEW YORK NEW YORK much better. we went there twice and perfect both times!

YHdLIK7U5l0PJGT40EC2ew.text: Bad service ! Bad meal ! Way overpriced ! Atmosphere , BORING !!! Should have known when tables were empty of people ! ordered burger with cheese , when I got my meal , no cheese . When I told waitress of mistake , she went to get a slice of cold cheese for me to to add ! This is a 15 dollar burger ! When I mentioned it should be returned and cheese added , she did ! Food came back with cheese and bun stuck on top half way ! Cheese was stuck to bun ! I've warned you , do not eat at this here ! Spend your money at a nice restaurant !

Fbl3NfWOjY5DxoobxnNbKA.text: Good gourmet burgers, sweet potato fries, and TVs in each booth...but if the wait is long, forget it....not worth it.

BkXuYGBMR9x6i213QM-QLA.text: So I went to Vegas to meet up with a buddy of mine for a weekend of craps.  We decided to head over to this joint on a Saturday afternoon after hearing so much about it.  First, I was somewhat disappointed at the selection of burgers.  For some reason I thought there would be more exotic meats like venison, or wild boar, or ostrich.  I ended up getting the Wagyu Burger.  While the burger was pretty good I'm not sure that ground Wagyu makes that much of a difference.  What really impressed me was the zucchini fries.  The seasoning on the breading was da bomb!  There was a large list of toppings for your burger but I honestly don't know that I wouldn't rather be at In N Out.

O2JMiI-jfda00BLePjvpcg.text: Visited twice on successive nights. The first night I had the kobe burger, then the second the herman keller. The kobe was nice, but I didn't get the feeling that it had been pampered with fresh beer! The herman keller buffalo burger was very melt in the mouth. I ordered it medium rare, but it turned up pretty rare. Seems like they err on the rare side here. Beer selection was fantastic, with a good range of belgian as well as american beers. I had a delerium noel yesterday, which was awesome. Like the delerium tremens, but smoother and sweeter. Might have been the last bottle, but they've got plenty more.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

y6wF2ZHfKQGgboqVPc-rrw.text: I want to give the place five stars but I can not, being that I didnt eat a burger here and I found a hair in my cesar salad when i was finished eating it...The service was great, my friend ordered her burger and asked for no pickle, so I asked the server if i could have her pickle and she said sure, and brought me like four more pickles!! That was awesome, cuz that meal I was totally feeling veges not meat... The cesar salad was pretty good too, I like their croutons, two thinly crisp slices of bread!! way better than blocks of croutons!! Next time in Vegas I want to definitely try their burgers, the vege burger looked pretty good and so did the kobe beef one....

WaB9gdsdUVgDZhSE-6TONg.text: I was in Vegas just for fun!!  The Burger Bar is a great place to eat!!!! They have an outstanding staff and a great vareity on the menu for your burger. There selection of beer is excellent too... I would recommend to go here if you are looking for a low key place to have a great burger!!!!

ZkAxQ_CAlq6V1UDK3BjICg.text: My brother and I can here to eat a Kobe Burger and it was pretty good for the price which was $16.  It was nice and juicy and yum yum yum it was so good I can still have that tastes. It came with fries as well. =)  Anyways it is a small place and we found this place out from Rachael Ray back when she was on the food network =)

i-PIb8zEmth6sW8odFeQYA.text: After watching Huber Keller kill it on Top Chef Masters, I knew I had to try his Burger Bar at Mandalay Bay. My bf and I ordered an angus burger (medium rare and medium) with tons of toppings: pickled green tomatoes with a hint of jalapeno minus the spice, spinach, bacon, cheese, chipotle sauce, avocado, etc. (for two burgers). He ordered fried zucchini while I ordered sweet potato fries. He ordered a root beer while I ordered a root beer float. Each burger comes with the standard lettuce, tomatoes and onions on the side. We would've ordered kobe beef if it was from Japan. All the meats are farm grown though so it just tastes THAT much better. Highly recommended before you go on a diet. Meal was about 25 per person. Can't believe I inhaled my burger. My bf had to eat faster just to keep up. That's a first!

6PyZzrrB2I-rkeN-7qZilw.text: The Burger Bar is a solid burger place and a good option for a burger on the strip.  I had a buffalo burger, which was cooked well.  The meat was lean (as it should have been) and tasty.  The zucchini fries were super crispy and not soggy at all, and sweet potato fries were perfection.  It was expensive, though, for a good, but not phenomenal, burger.  All in, we each paid $20 each before tip & tax.  I would have been just as satisfied with In-N-Out, and about $15 up.

-Av4nTR84a0BR2BP8rTcsg.text: Discovered The Burger Bar this weekend and had the best damn turkey burger EVER! I'm totally willing to overlook almost being locked the restaurant when I went to the restroom (actually we all got a good chuckle out of this). GREAT JOB GUYS...I'll be back!

o_ue5IsUOv4d97bS1kyrtw.text: Best burgers in Vegas hands down. Always fresh ingredients and prefect bun meat ratio. Been here about a dozen times  and burgers have been cooked prefect and sides are hot (I luv the zucchini fries). Service has always been decent and it a bit expensive for a burger place but well worth it.

bwvo9_A3VOFmSprgmG1lug.text: The burgers here are delicious but not the best I've had. I liked it here because of the environment, the service, and of course, the food:) There was a nice lady who took a pic of my bf and put it on keychains for no charge..but of course you gotta tip her:) I liked this place a lot.

m0wm9XjdORiH3xr4v46u5w.text: I've had better.  This place is just average.  The service was slow, the order was wrong.  The burgers are small and leave much to be desired;  and lacked flavor.  I have been to several Burger places around the country and this doesnt do it.  Burger and Beer Joint and Shake Shack in Miami are much better and better value.

zIXFbab1gdYUHQew3-YiBA.text: Love their Kobe style burger; it's so moist and delicious.

vFesU-5SB81M8X-g1PtV-g.text: Stopped in for lunch during convention. Pricy burger but it's vegas cooked perfectly and value for money when u compare it to the food court at the convention center. I recommend the creamy peppercorn  sauce and pineapple on the lamb burger. I wii be back

DO370iwBQW7LHYQhA3qtWw.text: This place is a bit pricey, but the food I got was really good!  I got a Kobe Beef burger with their fat fries.  They also have some good Pepperjack cheese poppers.  I've never been thrilled with the food in Las Vegas because I think too much of it is "fancy pants".  But this was pretty good, nice atmosphere as well.

hK4y4CZWiccjHKnYHm8Isw.text: Always my first stop in vegas. I chosecto stay in Luxor just for its proximity to burger bar.

C878a7bxIEcFVG70Aa0YNQ.text: Average. Average. Average. The All-American Burger was allright but the Nutella Milkshake I ordered tasted nothing like Nutella. It was not bad but I was disappointed for the most part.

Ih2vE5i94mNWtrMu3WkChg.text: Yum yum. Had a great wedge salad followed by the slider platter with sweet potato fries. All made me happy. I dined alone so I sat at the bar watching big screen tv's. It was all good!

PX1gRNUCFSbZQLdiR9a8lQ.text: Food was great but the service was awful. We never even got refills on our drinks when we asked numerous times. Burger was the best part of the experience.

L80Umt-YWuXU_VFZE-uqmA.text: Best Burger we had here. I ordered the surf and turf. It was delicious. I ordered sweet potato fries and they were good well. My boyfriend ordered the buffalo burger. It was pricey but what do you expect for quality burgers in Mandalay Bay.

0nJzrOEAsYzgL2b0DQM8cQ.text: These burgers were really, really good!  Not to mention the generous portion of sweet potato fries with a nice basil aioli to make sure no artery went unclogged.  I went with the HappyNature patty on wheat with Monterey Jack and the regular assortment of burger dressings.   Mmm!  Top on that their good beer selection and you had me actually admitting I was enjoying time in the Miracle Mile.  I think that's illegal to admit as a local...

zEMEpV809smTQ0sd584pHA.text: Atmosphere 4/5 Service 4/5  Food 5/5: Country Natural medium rare with: Portabello mushroom Carmelized onion Onion bun  --Juiciest and most flavorful burger, in comparison to other highly rated burger joints like: The Counter, Kuma's Corner, Fatburger, Fuddruckers, Five Guys, In and Out.

CRqwtMLlrJTXzjn1_RfgHw.text: Very happy with service and food and staff. The BBQ and buffalo burgers were great. Med-well pink trough out as I requested. Try the fry sampler. Highly recommend oh yah try the shakes.

JjalttXGyiJM6GbJ2ShxFQ.text: We love this place and eat there every time we are in town. The turkey burgers are great and never dry! If you like bacon and jalapenos then you must try the jalapeno bacon. Don't forget to try the beer floats after your meal!!!!

9TpWj6gEiPo4cRXexV0xxg.text: Very good burgers. I ordered the Low Carb burger and it was excellent. Loved the portobello mushrooms!!! It also came with a side of greens and Cole slaw. The meat was very good and juicy. Our waiter was awesome and everything was great. My only complaint would be the location..I wished this was in the middle of the strip.

PE-lqNJREjs9P9xx3YwgrQ.text: Thought I'd give this place a 3rd try. Service so ridiculously bad. This restaurant should be ashamed of itself. The staff has an uncanny ability to avoid eye contact with anyone trying to get their attention. Food is generally decent, however waiting 25 minutes for dessert spoils the whole experience. Not worth it.

_qwZRgYjasj_WOpqBCbeaw.text: Great Burger and wings in a cool spot at Mandalay Bay. Had the American classic, it was outstanding. Perfectly cooked patty (medium), fresh toasted bun and very fresh veggies on it. The fries and my wife's chicken wing meal were also excellent. It was a good experience. Great food and service, and way less then you would pay at BurGR or some of the other Celeb chef burger joints.

94XhD2v2w3t32h7ERGkNCw.text: Heard about this place from the bf time and time again and told it is a must.   Went here as first meal in Vegas.   Had the regular bacon burger (i am too lazy to create my own). Burger had a nice flavor and was cooked perfectly.  Fries were skinny and crispy.   Bf had burger with egg on it.   He will give this place 5 stars.   Was a good burger but have had other good burgers.  Dessert was delicious.  Krispy creme donut with cheescake with fresh pineapple's and starwberries in the middle.   I highly recommend this!  Great beer selection too!  Would go back again for sure.

4ajNIWxUKx4HfxV_n9Wzug.text: First off, I'm a huge fan of Hubert Keller's TV show and had to visit Las Vegas to dine at his restaurants. Although his other restaurant Fleur (located in the same building downstairs) was somewhat disappointing, the Burger Bar served the best burgers I have ever eaten. I ordered the Hubert Keller burger the first time, and it was delicious. The sweet caramelized onion sauce that came with it was perfect, and the medium rare buffalo patty was cooked to retain the optimal moistness. My dad let me try a bite of his American Classic, also medium rare, and it tasted even better than my burger! I loved this restaurant so much I came here for lunch again days later. Unfortunately, I did not have as great of an experience. I ordered the American Classic, and also I still call for it to be medium rare, it was much dryer than before. I asked for grilled onions instead of raw onions, but they still gave me raw. I called sweet potato fries both times, but they were less crunchy the second time. The service also felt less attentive than it had during the preceding visit. With that said, the Burger Bar still remains my favorite burger place, and I would definitely return on my next visit to Las Vegas.

EIbKY0hXO54XBYTDuU0jSQ.text: The Burger Bar is one of the best burger joints I have been to. They have a great selection of craft beers and I don't even have to go on about the burgers. I would love to say I have many of the burgers but the fact of the matter is whenever I have been there I say I am going to try something new but I can't get past the kobe burger or the bison burger. Plenty of fantastic toping and the burgers are always cooked to perfection. The service is always fast and extremely friendly.

86I7CV8AFGeFurMqFv-BHQ.text: Recommended to us by the Concierge at the Bellagio, the Burger Bar was Las Vegas pricey. Unfortunately it didn't back it up with great food.   We had the buffalo, lamb and a beef burger. Burgers were cooked to order but relatively small (the bun was bigger than the burger). Taste was just okay (we have much better in LA) fries were pedestrian, service was dead slow (this was a late lunch and not a lot of folks in the place over the Christmas weekend!).    We tried friends' burgers as well, but no one seemed thrilled with their food. Consensus was, "We really don't need to remember where this is; I doubt we'll be back."

lG0pEk32xO_NZALul7yp9A.text: They have expensive beer, but they have a good selection. Some of the beers here were selling for like 3x what we could go to the store and buy it for in San Diego. Mike ordered his burger and I only had room for sweet potato fries- both were delicious. We ate at the bar and were able to sit right away. The service was a little spotty- didn't receive utensils/napkins until 5 min after we were able to get the bartender's attention.

0Y5auSq3rNsbk_S8Uev_ZQ.text: I have been dying to eat at Burger. Great atmosphere. Overall, not that good. Loved all the extras you could add, for a fee of course, but the meat itself was bland, bland, bland. I was so disappointed because we waited almost an hr & a half because they were so busy. My hubby said the same about his burger. Absolutely no taste other than the extras. We probably will not be making a trip to Burger Bar anytime soon!!!

ReSOraSxGYVEQUWqNFSaVg.text: all weekend long, my friends were looking forward to eating here to end our vegas trip. apparently, it was the best burger they have ever tried... so it was a must!   i must admit that there was a great selection of burgers, fries, and add ons. There is a lure to being able to customize everything on your burger, especially at a pretty decent price.   I'm not a vegetarian, but always interested in trying different takes on the veggie burger.. so trying to be adventurous i went with it! it was really tasty - a nice blend of veggies and rice, grilled to have a nice bite to it. Sadly, our waitress was not on here game that day and kept forgetting certain add-ons. I still feel if I got my avocados in my burger it would have really made it! oh well... the fried zucchini fries somewhat made up for it.   I definitely need to come back and try a 'real' burger since it seemed like everyone devoured theirs.

sHl_PtwLIF8oAwB8PXFkMw.text: You can't go to Las Vegas without eating a over top and overpriced burger and there ain't know better place to do so than Hubert Keller's Burger Bar. I like this place because it has a old school/new school burger joint look to it. They have a huge beer list and my server allowed me to taste three different beers before choosing the one I wanted which was nice. I went the Rossini Burger which is the grand daddy of all the burgers they serve. It was named after a XIXth century Italian composer whose love for fine food was legendary. Its Kobe Beef, sauteed foie gras and shaved truffles all on a onion bun with a side of a rich brown madeira sauce. It comes with a choice of fries, I chose the sweet potato fries, and a choice of a desert burger, I chose the PB&J!    The burger was absolutely amazing. I ordered medium and it came out perfect. It was very juicy and the flavors all pair well with each other. The truffles add a very nice earthy taste to it as the foie gras adds a nice richness to it. Surprisingly I was able to eat it with out it coming apart. The fries are were very good as well. I'm a huge sweet potato fan and like how they have different type fries to choose from. The PB&J desert burger is peanut butter mousse, raspberry jelly and sliced kiwi's all in the middle of a warm glazed donut. Its VERY rich but VERY good. The kiwi adds a nice refreshing taste to it which it needs with the richness of the peanut butter and the donut.   The Burger Bar has a wide-range of choices and will satisfy your burger craving while in Las Vegas. I will be back to try some more of Hubert Keller's crazy burger creations.

2iILR454cmEyCFb8AhgllQ.text: This is a Las Vegas tradition for me. Every trip i make I have to stop by and have a custom made Wagyu burger with carmelized onions, portabello mushrooms and American cheddar. Hands down the best burger I have ever had.   I first tried this place for their rossini burger, which was great but Im not really a big fan of the foie gras but for burger lovers you have to try it at least once  just for the experience.  It can get packed so call 30 minutes ahead and get your name on the list, this way when you walk up you are seated right away.  For me The burger bar is the perfect meal before I leave, this way win or lose I always leave Vegas happy.

tJI_zHXGw0fxbqFb56RBsw.text: Holy $h!t !!!!!!! Sweet mama that's good!! I still can't get over the coma inducing pleasurable aliment!!! Burger Bar sure knows how to win a girl and boys heart!!! Not only can you order your burgers like a drink "just the way you like it" but you can do the same with their sides.  My buffalo burger was just the best chunk of meat hidden between two fluffy bun pillows I've ever eaten!  The sweet potatoe fries were freaking just titillating!!! OMG....YUM! The drinks weren't all that great but who the hell cares! The food is vain and requires all of the attention, ANYWAY!!!

5qbsTb0xXawgVR4ILk7Diw.text: Take this for what it's worth as this review is mainly for the Vegas Vegan burger.  In short, I don't recommend it.  Eating this became too much of a chore.  When you have to resort to pulling out a knife and fork to eat a burger, you're putting in more work than necessary.  It can all be blamed on a lack of a bun.  Using two portabello mushrooms to mimic a bun sounds good in theory, but is outright disastrous when executed.  Vegetarians at least have one other option, the Chef's Veggie Burger, which sounds more safe (i.e., less messy).
