N5V49vnhLxaxJ43U8HMgrA.text: Best burgers ever. And good sweet potato fries two. We ate here twice in four days as it was a good deal, fast and so tasty. Great bartender too. She caught me trying to point out to my gf that we could almost see her crouch in her low slung jeans because she was so buff and lean... and I was embarrassed but bartender was not fazed. It was kinda loud and had quite a few families, which means yes some people spent attention they should have paid to the burgers ogling the dykes at the bar (us). but overall highly recommended.

3XAIYSSovQHP6Mw_htDI4w.text: An all American classic with a twist. Well I guess if you read through their menu there are quite a few twists. This place gives you an option to build your own burger or choose from 5 or 6 of their own creations. You start with the meat. You have options of buffalo, turkey, American kobe, or regular grass fed ground beef. This is where the fun starts...... After you choose your meat you then choose how you would like to top it. You can go as plain as American cheese and bacon, or you can fancy it up with foie gra, a lobster tail, and slices of truffles. Anyway you mix and match it, they know how to cook your meat to perfection.  Be careful of not "over-topping" your burger as you'll find it difficult to wrap your mouth around it.

doYbl8nhwJTsjU7ndb_h-g.text: This place is really cool because you can build and customize your own burger. This is the first time I have tried a buffalo burger and it is a lean red meat but it falls apart very easily. My bf ordered the kobe beef burger which is $60 and added on a lobster tail ($12) along with other fixins. He also had the peanut butter milkshake which was to die for. You can also customize your milkshake and put whatever you want in it. I didn't like the set up of this place because it feels like a dark bar.

njZXV8DtAO-LrdPuER3S_Q.text: I consider myself a burger expert - have to, there's fast food in the family - and so we tried this place, mostly because of the hype about the kobe beef burger.  I think it maybe that I just don't like the greasyness of kobe, and it tastes a little gamey (to me ...).  The place was okay, but just okay, and not a bad choice for a quick bite (if they don't have a crowd - but a crowd doesn't always mean good - have you been to Chipoltle lately?... shudder), the sweet potato fries are not as good as you think they will be, service is slow.  Menu is good, lots of interesting choices - but it would be a place I would go to because I was at Mandalay Bay doing something else, not that I would go to Mandalay Bay to go there.

RNsQnobDJXeRILaAT-27xQ.text: After watching Top Chef Masters, we really wanted to check out a Hubert Keller restaurant but didn't feel like we could splurge at Fleur de Lys.  So Burger Bar it was.  We went around 8:30 on a Saturday night and it took about 40 minutes to be seated (they give you pagers so you can shop in the area if you'd like).  J ordered the Blackjack burger (with Tapenade) and I got the hot dog sausage (Hebrew National!) although I couldn't have the sauerkraut because it had bacon in it.  The burgers/dogs was really good and the fries were great too.  We didn't try any desserts but they seemed interesting enough.  Now all i got to do is save my pennies and make a trip to San Fran....

mi7UvEjpKJsluwKyUCQQZA.text: Where do I start? Been to BB about 5 times. Never been disappointed. Order the Kobe, pepper bacon, blue chesse and portobello. Can't go wrong. Best $21 bucks I spend on a burger.

WScQkSyoiQ80EFsWb3OQfg.text: 5 star burgers.  I had one with spinach and mushrooms and it was one of the best burgers I've had in a while.  One thing, the way they are cooked is probably different than what you are used to - I ordered mine medium-well and it was pretty pink.    The chocolate milkshakes are yummy.  So are the "Antioxidant Lemonades" made with VeeV.  Sweet potato fries are delicious.  We had one of the dessert burgers after our meal and it was really good - just make sure you share with another person.  I can't imagine eating one by yourself after a meal like that...  These burgers are not the cheapest in town but you get what you pay for.  It's fairly reasonably priced - with the drinks, our bill came out to around $60 for myself, my husband, and daughter.

V-GJ1fiV1FhIIoYZoHNoKw.text: Holy guacamole...this place was everything and more when it comes to burgers.  On our last day in vegas, a few hours before we had to leave for the airport we decided we would give this place a try.  After losing every penny we had available I was a little hesisitant because of the price but I said whats another $20 burger at this point and ordered the kobe beef burger with mushrooms, grilled onions, swiss and cheddar.  This was by far the best burger I have ever had....ever...ever...no exaggerations.  My husband and I crave this place.  I just read a review saying there is one here in San Francisco Macys...its like my prayers have been answered.  We will be going there tomorrow!!!  Id go right now if it wasnt the middle of the night! Go...run...get a kobe beef burger..it was worth the money!

49Wb1hSvBtsf-iRrAxRq7A.text: ambience wise, this place is like a mash-up of umami burger and the counter and father's office. i'll say this: my kobe beef burger was so dry. i expected juiciness dripping down my hand. no wetness = no good burger.  thank god i had split this plate.  thank you zucchini fries, for saving the day.

EUkRw5SSzO_zuec4o8tHXw.text: Thumbs down!  Low quality overpriced food.  Can't say much about the service everybody else got but my waitress disappeared every 15 minutes.  Total time wasted from beginning to end of my meal for two people was 70 minutes.  Too long for a burger and chicken sandwich.  Nothing special here.  Will not return.

xcddWJXmxFP7lQLCpmhGwQ.text: Burger Bar is a must-do for us when staying on the south end of the strip.  Delicious burgers, with a dizzying array of options so you can customize them in just the right way.  Love the sweet potato fries and fried zucchini.  The beer selection is of excellent quality also.    It can be crowded and hard to get in at times.   However, note that if you are looking for seats at the bar, the bar extends further back than the portion you can easily see from the entrance.    I wouldn't recommend bothering with their specialty cocktails: the ones I've tried have been rather weak and unremarkable, thus exorbitantly priced at around $12.  I like to have some exotic drinks while in Vegas, so they would get five stars if they shore this up.

SEyBN_G6u2C2ZREnUP3BMg.text: I love this place!!!  The burgers are amazing, and I love the custom options. I got the free range beef (I forgot what they call it....not the angus or the kobe, the other one).  Anyway, I got that on a ciabatta bun with avocado, mushrooms, bleu cheese and baby spinach. AMAZING!  The only bummer was that they had a fire in the kitchen the night before so the fryer wasn't working and we couldn't get any fries. But we did get a side salad instead which was good.  I highly recommend this place, just be prepared to wait because it is VERY popular (we had to wait about an hour).

0-bOTsjlcOt1TU5NWTzd5w.text: While they do offer some of the best burgers I've ever had, they don't always have fries to go with your glorious burger. I was hoping to try their sweet potato fries today with my buffalo burger, but our server informed us that the fryer was broken. Something that would have been nice to know prior to our 1 hour wait.  Apparently this happens a couple times a year. Guess there's no such thing as a backup fryer. So, not sure how their fries are, but the burgers are delicious.

woLVCzd5TQUldtboa2DxVg.text: We went here for a quick bite after walking around for 4 hours.  The waitress was super sweet and always checking on us.  She was so friendly with the kids, they loved her!!  Each booth has a tv and the game was on so my kids were distracted ( a good thing!)  Great price.  $50 to feed 3 adults and 2 kids in Vegas is practically highway robbery.  The burgers were so good!  I would recommend this place to anyone with kids for a casual lunch.

Ivdueh_v1hlg4bx4QKeAoA.text: Awesome food - great beer selection. The wait staff was really helpful and made great suggestions. Prices were very fair for helping size.  Definitely recommend the sweet potato fries as well.

BujHWwSQwAjeQKRIjgPzFw.text: Trendy place with wonderful burgers.  Kobe burger is extremely tasty.  Many of the servers (2 identical twins) have been there since first opened.  Good service.  Lots of great toppings. Try the salmon with lobster topping.  A must try in Vegas.

ozpSnsB4tyv49DUPUGBwCA.text: I've made many visits to the Burger Bar & it's always great.  Some may consider it pricey for what it is, but just consider that it's owned by Hubert Keller & it's on the strip.  The burgers are fantastic & the zucchini fries with buttermilk ranch are my favorite.   They have an extensive beer selection as well.

MCdqEJEKCDapUOcacASPtQ.text: I've eaten here three times.  The food and the service are consistently good.  I've had one of each of the beef choices in a burger and have been pleased.  Burger Bar emphasizes beer (large selection) more than wines (not the greatest list of reds).  My husband tried the Rossini burger on a previous visit.  While he completely enjoyed it, I wasn't terribly impressed with the flavor combinations when I had a taste--mostly, the Madeira sauce just seemed a little too sweet that day and didn't seem to work very well with the other items on the burger.  My husband also had the dessert burger--again, while he loved it, I thought it much too strange.  I credit the attempt at being unique, original, and different, but I could have used something more basic, like a scoop of ice cream or a slice of pie.

ZxEXj0-GnTqpkOY00dhppg.text: This place is pretty famous. And pretty good. Had the Kobe Burger, and no complaints. It's definitely expensive, but not surprising. In a casino on the strip, featured on Food Network, etc. There were two of us, and our bill was $50 for two burgers and two soft drinks. It can get a lot more expensive than that, depending on taste. Only reason it's a three star for me is the price, and the size of the crowds (not their fault, though).

OeXz2AvjCRBCUQVrmo9Dzg.text: If you want a quality gourmet burger, look no further. When I went I had a kobe burger with prosciutto. Burger was juicy and very tasty. The kobe was so rich with flavor and melts in your mouth. The prosciutto was a good salty addition to compliment the patty. The bun was nice and toasty yet soft.  Recommend:  * Nutella shake: Liquid heaven. smooth & creamy, but can be rich (in a good way)  There is a location in San Francisco that I want to try sometime. Fortunately I don't have to go all the way to  Vegas to eat there.

Mx3WWhpYZsOaZlkyHhE2Uw.text: My cousin and I split the $60 burger.  It is absolutely heaven in your mouth. I swear my cousin and I were in a state of harmony and peace for the next half hour.  Kobe beef, foie gras, truffles, truffle sauce!!!  ::Drool::     This is where I tell my friends to go to when they want a good burger.

uHzwlhG0QjixGLj_pa1SUQ.text: Located in Mandalay Bay, on the 2nd floor, Burger bar is a burger joint that has some cool offerings! I had been here about a year ago and tried their veggie burger. It sounds amazing. The description sounds like it was made specifically for me. However, the execution of the burger falls seriously short. It's way way WAAAAY to mushy. Ew. Not at all how a burger should be. I didn't care for it so I didn't order it when I came yesterday. Yesterday, I ordered the salmon burger and zucchini fries. That "burger" my friends, was delicious. The only "complaint" I have, is they should have put a condiment on it. Either mayo, or some cool dill dip kinda sauce, that would have sooooooooo made it better. We were given so ranch dressing (or that!) for the fries, so I did put some on it. The zucchini fries were OK. They had some weird after taste that I think was a dried spice in the batter. Whatever it was, I didn't care for it. If they took that out, this would be 4 stars, all day long! Now that I think about it, they have all these cool condiments you can add to your burger and sauces you can order for your fries. I should have read them and maybe got one for my burger. Now that I know it doesnt come with anything, I'll order one next time. Price for a salmon burger, in Mandalay Bay, REASONABLE! Only $10.25....NOT bad at all! I was shocked it was so "cheap". Nothing on the strip is cheap, unless you find happy hour specials. I was definitely impressed with the burger itself and the place. Service was great. Waitress was always checking on us and refilling our waters. I definitely think I'll come back next time I'm in Mandalay Bay.

OqoJ2VCevNMxC4TpUY9vdg.text: straight forward: great service, only reason one star was taken off was: burger fell apart, wasn't constructed well, and over-pricey. Everything else though, food was bomb, etc. etc. Can't lie, food was good, nutella milkshake yum..

l9fff-HdR_gBF2LFxk_CUg.text: The skinny fries were awesome! Crispy with just enough salt. I had the sliders which were good, but I don't suggest them for those who prefer their meat well cooked. The sliders are all cooked MEDIUM with no substitutions allowed. My husband ordered the All American burger which was delicious! I will order that next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The skinny fries were perfect! Crispy with just enough salt!

hVv54fPTMhhKPAj1GId9fw.text: Not as good as Kuma's in Chicago (I heard they were talking to the owners about starting one out in LV.) but a good experience nonetheless.  Bro got the Surf and Turf burger....it was good, he said best burger he has ever had, but I personally wouldn't get it again....Lobster was unnecessary.   He felt like the meat itself was the best ever, and while I don't agree, I do think it was a fine quality burger.  The problem with the burger bar is like most of America, self-loathing marketer: the choices.  I got a bunch of stuff on mine, but would suggest keeping it simple.  On thing that worked out brilliant was ordering a portobello on top. They are so tasty and meaty that I took that with some of the other ingredients (avo and bacon) and made a second burger out of it. Highly recommend it!  Good sweet potato fries. Good beer selection.  Highly suggest the dessert burger!  Overall: Good place for a meal in Vegas that isn't too pricey and will satisfy most people....who doesn't like a burger?  Value: Alright...with beer it ended up being a pretty pricy meal for burger joint. classy or not.  Quick Tips: - Get the dessert burger (donut/cream cheese, raspberry sauce etc) - Sweet Potato fries - Don't order a bunch of ingredients unless you order the port shroom and then its like two burgers in one.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert Burger at the Burger Bar - Las Vegas

e_Jip9m0YEWM8zJ9Y2dZSw.text: One of my clients recommended I try this place out and it was great - it did not disappoint. Get the classic burger on the menu - I believe its called the american? Get the truffle mayo - it is so worth it. This is located between mandalay and the luxor. Give it a try!

hGI9Eunc-DUm7QwOjECHeQ.text: I was really hoping for a five star restaurant, but at the end the terrible service made me regret ever stepping foot in this establishment. Our server Harmony seemed like she hated her job and not very knowledgeable in regards of the menu. Additionally she was very rude and had a bad attitude. The food was delicious, but did not makeup for the experience.

EHgn-U1RBR5bsN7o-2sxhw.text: I ordered The Hubert Keller burger medium rare and holy s**#, it was perfectly cooked, moist and full of so much flavor that I can't stop thinking about!  This buffalo burger was my first and will not be my last!

H9rCS4ETH76RdsZJaBAjCw.text: Yes, we went here because we wanted to try another Hubert Keller restaurant. And compared to Fleur de Lys in SF, this was just okay, but hey, that's comparing apples to oranges.  This place was packed, but we didn't have too long a wait on a weeknight. I got a burger with blue cheese. Can't remember what hubby had but we both enjoyed our burgers. The onion rings were nothing special at all, sadly. The fries were good though. For dessert, we had the mint chocolate chip sundae, with creme de menthe. There was a huge puddle of the booze right in the middle of it, buried under a mountain of whipped cream. :-) Yeah, it was good.   The place was really loud so not great for conversation. We were tempted by the kobe beef, but just got regular beef and it was still pretty tasty. Overall, it was good but frankly I was expecting more from it.

gsrK_UkyCiHAzABseSqn8g.text: I ordered the sliders, three small burgers each with a different meat.  When they arrived no one told me which was which do I flagged down someone else to ask. Not a huge problem, but thats something the food runner should have shared.  The taste was good, not great, and the third was cold by the time I got to it. They were also overlooked and a dry, didn't finish them.  The beer list was a multi-page tomb, some fantastic beers in there. But the list of what was on tap wasn't there, for some reason that was on the back of the food menu.  The experience wasn't awful but I doubt I'll be back.

c1LW4EgO_EQ-UsijQe_frw.text: I was looking forward to checking this place out. The prices are decent and heard good things. So my expectations were high. While the burger was good it wasn't great, it didn't wow me by any means. The Burger spot inside New York New York is much better.

Kw0rB-jONXU9htIJdvACiA.text: The wife and I took the kid here for Christmas day lunch. They have beef, buffalo, lamb, chicken, and vegetarian. If you want to splurge they have a $60 burger made from Kobe Wagyu beef and foie grais with shaved truffles. Sounds amazing but it would take a lot for me to pay $60 for a burger.   Wife and I had the beef, which was good. Then we ordered the sauce sampler. Mind you this a Hubert Keller restaurant so you know it's going to be good. There were 5 sauces that were all amazing. They are great for the burgers as well as a dip for fries.   What really topped off the meal was the buttermilk onion rings. They were flavorful and delicious. They worked well with all the sauces plus the housemade ranch.   Go and enjoy!!!

7fwnDxDKRKYfJR780h2aeg.text: We ate here in the location at Mandelay Bay. We had just arrived and after a 5 hour flight, we were ravenous. I had the salmon burger with skinny fries and it was very good. The salmon was seasoned well, wasn't dry, and the bun wasn't a huge chunk of bread(trust me, this makes a difference). Now I will say again, that I was VERY hungry, so this review maybe slightly off, but I would give a another try. It is a little pricey though, but hey, you're in Vegas. What do you expect?

SEedx27HOaSxCZPHSg_ObQ.text: Hubert Keller, Thank you!  This is a fantastic burger spot, the only problem is the ridiculous wait you'll have to endure and the high prices for beer.  Seriously $22 for a pitcher?!?!  How do you know Burger Bar is legit? Here's how... Me: Peppercorn burger Waiter: How'd you like that cooked? Me: Medium Rare Waiter: It might still be bloody is that ok? Me: OMG YES! (rolling eyes in anticipation of amazing nom nom nomness)  The peppercorn aspect of the peppercorn burger actually sucked.  Not enough peppercorn flavor at all, I was expecting an all enveloping thick & crunchy crust of peppercorns.  All I got was a light sprinkling. The peppercorn sauce on the side didn't help.  Don't get me wrong, still a fantastic overall burger but lacking the essential flavor I wanted.  The sliders are great great.  Meat is very flavorful and juicy but you might still be hungry afterward. 3 sliders doesn't necessarily fill up a growing boy.  As for the fries, sweat potato fries are good.  The regular fries on the other hand were great.  They look like Burger King's fries, but are fantastic, thin, crispy, crunchy all the way through (not greasy at all).  I am a fan!  PS. They have an extensive beer list.  Get lost in it, try something new, try something different.

Fsc36UguQrTp6jDVT7ZdzQ.text: Its really expensive and the burgers are pretty good. You can save about $5-10 per burger and get a much better one if you just go to Red Robin.

_6Bjsb8rps9p_aUI7cZe2Q.text: Build your own shake, need I say more! and build your own burger with more things to choose from than you can even imagine. Six types of "fries" the zucchini fries, sweet potato fries, and steak fries are all superb. You can even get a sampler of fries where you pick three. This place never lets you down. Hands down the best burger anywhere!

j7vz8wKXBkPA98zu6BlbJA.text: I think I've started a new Vegas tradition!  I ordered the Hubert Keller Burger with buffalo and it did not disappoint on presentation, flavor, or savory goodness! I agree that the fries aren't all that great, but try switching them out for sweet potato or zucchini for made-to-order goodness.  There was an excellent selection of craft beers I had trouble deciding but ultimately went with the Sin City lager which was smooth & tasty.  The waitress was very attentive and made sure we had everything we needed. I was too stuffed after my meal to try any desserts but I need to sample that Beer Float next time and have my eye on that Kobe beef burger as well.  Check it out, you won't regret the 'experience' and for vegetarians there are veggie options too.

Ntrypvp6XoZeY1DtykHdQg.text: Another great experience...  Burgers, Beers & Service.  Sat at the bar again, which was good since the cook was asleep at the wheel and NOT reading his tickets properly.  I think all of us had something missing from our burgers.  The waitress was very nice about it and was quick to correct the problem... more than once.  It still tasted awesome and they've got THE best draught beer selection in Vegas!

L2aCvsXt8dL9eUP7osM2tw.text: This place is amazing- simply. Their veggie burger is awesome! It doesn't fall apart when you pick it up, and it's not soggy. The flavor of it is very nice and filling. The sweet potato fries are the best I have ever had- a lot of places do not know, or care, to make a great sweet potato fry. I got the Nutella milkshake and it was soooo good! Not only that but I have dreams of their burger desserts: the first one is a Nutella patty on a donut bun with passion fruit gelatin, kiwi and strawberries- the second is a donut bun with a cheesecake custard and pineapple slice (it tastes like an pineapple upside down cake).  It can get VERY pricey if you don't watch what you are doing. You can build your own burger and shake if you want, but BEWARE- it will be more expensive to do so than if you go with their featured foods.  Example: the Nutella milkshake was 7.00 (all milkshakes are, but for the Salted Caramel which is 8.75), if I wanted to make my own the ice cream to start with is listed as 7.00. Syrups and toppings range from 30 cents to 1 dollar. Add whip cream? 1 more dollar. Liquor? WAAAAY more than a dollar. So, unless you feel like raking out nearly twenty bucks, go with one of their featured shakes.

V0JduRRB-gyZdt6tThT3Og.text: I agree with the other rave reviews...the burgers are delicious and rank among the best I've ever had.  The ability to customize with (a la carte) fresh, high quality toppings is a plus.  This place does one thing extremely well and did not disappoint. The environment is raucous and noisy so don't go here for a quiet, romantic dinner but a tasty lively dining experience.

DOzLlGCF__UgpqOHM6lo1g.text: We really enjoyed the custom burgers. It was a nice meal. Music and service was good. The beer was a bit over priced though.

NhAnAib7xLrLdE-4Tj_QVA.text: One of the best burgers I have had, although since I was in Vegas on a bachelor party, my judgment may have been somewhat impaired.  Nevertheless, I went with the Angus topped with 'shrooms, cheddar, and peppered bacon, cooked medium.  I was surprised that the burger was actually cooked correctly given how busy the place was - it was juicy, flavorful and truly a great burger.  The sweet potato fries weren't all that special, but good enough.  Oh, and the beer selection here is excellent, as if I needed more reason to drink in Vegas.

nVHoyKM2ExMLLuzDX2Hi6Q.text: Did I seriously just wait for 30 minutes to get into this place for a burger that I had to douse in ranch so it would have some sort of taste? Why yes yes I did.  And not only did we have to wait so long for a taste less burger but it cost  $15 and didn't even come with fries. I would say I ordered the wrong thing, the black angus beef with pineapple, caramelized onions and pepper jack cheese but I didn't. Everyone in my group, a party of 9, basically thought their burgers sucked. The one cool thing: they offered lots of options and could make your burger however you wanted it. The down fall of this: The toppings didn't even make my burger any better. I would never recommend this place.

77OLOYpkXl1dgyDopjynXw.text: Good burgers cooked perfectly as ordered. Nicely seasoned fries and onion rings but stay away from the sweet potato fries. They must not be as popular as they were cold and definitely sitting under a heat lamp for quite a while. Beer variety and selection is the bomb.

RsHDhIpNxvDA0Su4fhJnLQ.text: What can I say, this is my favorite burger and fries EVER: kobe beef  burger, cooked medium rare, on a  whole wheat bun, with sweet potato fries. My mouth starts watering just thinking about it. There is nothing fancy about this burger, but all the ingredients are so fresh, and the sweet potato fries are sweet and crunchy. Next time I will try one of the other items yelp reviewers mentioned, like the Hubert Keller burger and zucchini fries.

1gFW3qwqyLI1mX0CkmRftg.text: After a long flight from Chicago to Vegas that got me in at around 10PM local time, my friend recommended we immediately make our way to the Burger Bar inbetween Luxor and Mandalay Bay as he heard good things about their milkshakes. Though skeptical, I have to say I was intrigued by the prospects of a good milkshake and a burger. Little did I know that not only were these milkshakes everything he had built them up to be but the burgers were incredible as well. Good texture, perfectly cooked and highly recommend a side of sweet potato fries - which are also amazing. And you'd be doing yourself a huge disservice by just doing the burger without the milkshake. The Black White Milkshake may well be he world's perfect dessert. Chocolate mousse whipped cream with chocolate chips and fudge swimming in vanilla ice cream? Are you kidding me? We went back the night before I left just so I could have another for the road! Nice atmosphere and good service both at the tables and the bar.

nKzPhsUzzj7XgHxa2d62lA.text: The burger was absolutely delicious.  I opted for the angus beef, since many on here said it was delicious on it's own, and both my stomach and my wallet thanked me.  Not once did I question bypassing the Kobe beef or buffalo burgers, tempting as they may be.  Amazingly juicy at a perfectly cooked medium, with mushrooms, peppers and caramelized onions on top, I'm not sure I've had a better burger.  Their housemade dijon was also a delicious addition.  The fries (tried both fat and sweet potato) were good and very reasonably priced but not exactly must-haves.  I also got dessert, sharing both a nutella milkshake and the raspberry float.  The nutella milkshake is a chocolate lover's dream, and luckily I am one.  Chocolate chips, chocolate syrup, chocolate ice cream, chocolate whipped cream and nutella.. yep it's as good as it sounds.  At $9, it's also a bit pricey, but hey, you might as well go all out when you're already spending close to $20 for a burger and fries.  The raspberry float was tasty too, even though I don't usually like fruity things.  All-in-all, an amazing burger place.  Definitely give it a shot if you're in the area.

LwXv2rsXN2mUMVnbbxu7ng.text: DON'T EAT HERE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  This place made me sick.  I read some of the other reviews and I don't know what in the world these people were thinking.  Now, I wasn't really expecting much cuz it was  a Vegas hotel joint but this stuff was disgusting.  Ordered the Greek burger...it was raw and mushy on the inside.  Sent it back...I never do that and it wasn't a big deal so I asked for it to be cooked well this time.  While I waited, I tried a bite of the chicken burger my friend was eating and I had to spit it out (also never spit out food!)  It tasted like an old hot dog...my friend ate it cuz he was hungry but later commented on the poor quality.  My 2nd attempt burger came back in the same raw and mushy condition so I asked for it to be removed from the bill.    Some random underpaid manager offered  to make me something else but I pretty much had my fill.  And all right before Celine!!!   Ugh   close down please.....

-mpdl64rCUi6Ba9YijrXLQ.text: The burgers are pretty good, especially all of the choices available for customization. The different types of fries are also good. My main complaint is the interior--it is cramped and not all that exciting. As well, the service is sometimes off.

C9kwU1tkoOdwhZbEAOqKQw.text: So I checked out Burger Bar in LV to see what all the hype was all about.  Unfortunately I was disappointed.  I had the top of the line Kobe burger which was supposed to be the "The King"  of all burgers because of the quality of meat.  So I'm thinking that I was gonna taste the way eveyone was hyping it up to be and it tasted like a regular charbroiled burger.  I ordered what the chef recomended so it had provolone and sat on top of a Onion bun because I didn't want anything to take away from the over $20.00 Kobe hamburger patty.  It  was nothing to Yelp about.  If I would of known it was gonna taste like that I would of ordered everything on it , cause it just was not what I was expecting.  For the amout I paid I would of rather have gone to FAT Burger  and got the Burger with the Bacon, Cheese, and Fried Egg it , located on the Las Vegas strip, and it would of came with a milk shake and a side as well.

_LbiuZNqPPbm1RspX2GOKA.text: Ok so with a name like Burger Bar, this was right up our alley. We stayed at Mandalay Bay & read about it so we wanted to try it. Apparently the new big thing is "spiked milkshakes" (which I am totally ok with). Burger Bar has them. I had the mint chocolate chip one. It was delicious...minus the chocolate whipped cream they had on top. I could have done without that. Each booth along the wall had little television screens in them. We are Phillies fans & we sat in a booth that luckily had it on. I ordered a turkey burger with cheddar. It was a little dry but it was ok. I was full from the milkshake so there was no way I would have finished the burger even if it wasn't dry. All & all we were impressed. 2 burgers, a spiked shake, a beer, & fries all for $50 tip included.

JCPAW88o1Nf7v3hG0Exlqw.text: I am sure you are all familiar with the traditional salad-bar concept. You walk up to a selection of ingredients and fix yourself a personalized salad. Burger Bar takes that idea and steals it on behalf of carnivores everywhere (but primarily in Las Vegas!). There is no need for a sneeze guard at Burger Bar since all of the available ingredients, or burger toppings if you will, are listed on the menu. They do offer pre-designed burgers that range from reasonable to not-so-reasonable price-wise, but the fun as far as I am concerned is in building my own burger.   For eaters more adventurous than I, which basically means everyone, Burger Bar is one of the few places in Las Vegas where I would suggest you go to frequently. With so many restaurants in Las Vegas it is hard to go someplace you have been before at the expense of trying somewhere new, but I try to apply that concept to dinner more than I do for lunch. Burger Bar, though a fantastic dinner spot, works well for lunch too. Each time you go, you can create a new burger blueprint like one you have never had before. There are enough options to keep you entertained visit after visit. And even though I basically get the same thing everytime, it hasn't gotten old yet.   Angus Beef + Sesame seed roll + Bacon + Cheddar cheese + Fried egg = Bliss. Add their Brown gravy and you'll wonder why anyone puts ketchup on a burger (and it's GREAT on their skinny fries).   When, not if, you go looking for Burger Bar, you'll find it in Mandalay Bay in the Mandalay Place.

svPo0uyDs6SKM0jHzQak6A.text: This is the best burger in vegas. You can make your own up from a large variety of choices on the menu. The sweet potato fries are a must have as well. Get a booth if you can, they come with a mini tv showing sports. There is a always a great atmosphere here and the staff are really friendly. Its gets quite busy at dinner time, but you can put your name down for a table and go sit at the bar for a drink. Its expensive compared to other choices in vegas, but the food and atmosphere make it worth the price.

dpRINZSk6onplBtIx-6dQQ.text: So my bf and I are in Vegas heading out for the night looking for a place to eat and stopped in at the Burger bar just as they were closing. To our surprise they served us at the bar anyway which was a nice gesture considering they were trying to clean up. The staff was very friendly and our waitress/bartender made me one of her special martini's with coffee beans in it to wake me up. She also gave me a souvenir bottle of water with a devil on it (very fitting haha). My turkey burger was cooked perfectly. I was very impressed with this place even though its just a burger bar.

4NwvIpD5RUzVCxntRiV39Q.text: I'd like to give this place 5 stars but the service holds me back one. The burgers and beer selection are fantastic. The wait staff is pretty indifferent. Get a milkshake if you are even slightly in the mood. they are amazing.

JcehL3hDKLMvTK9xJP6bpg.text: I'd really want to give this place a 4 star rating... but I think it only deserves a 3 star.  Located in the indoor walkway/mall halfway between Mandalay Bay and Luxor (closer to Mandalay), I've been to Burger Bar twice in Vegas.  The first time I had seen the place featured on a travel show and thought the idea was pretty cool.  You basically get to pick from a huge list of options to create your perfect hamburger -- everything from different meats, toppings, breads, and extras.  If you want a Kobe beef burger topped with lobster tail, yes you can get it here.  If you want a turkey burger with avocado, they've got it too.  So they've got the quantity, but I really think they lack in quality.  Don't get me wrong - the burger tastes good.  And damnit, if you don't like one of the toppings, it is kind of your fault for picking that.  But really, when it comes down to it, the burger just isn't amazing or spectacular like I'd expect from a Vegas burger joint.  The sides aren't anything to write home about either.  Their prices can quickly add up too since each topping comes with an additional charge.  So in the end, Burger Bar gets a 3-star rating.  One bonus: they have a solid selection of microbrews.

LgwAfMDAfLi8EngG_YngYA.text: I really liked this place!  Last trip I went to BLT and was not impressed at all.  After doing some research I wanted to try Burger bar and was not disappointed.  Thanks to all the folks on yelp that suggested this place.  Came here alone for lunch and ate at the bar.   Service was a little slow but, It was not slow enough for me to complain about it or give a negative review.  Would say so far the best Turkey burger I've had in Las Vegas.

UrEEP5rSWXuaHup_4AHirA.text: Kobe Burger was good. Fries were ok and so where the apps. They went homemade which disappointed me because I expected this place to have fresh cut fries and apps but I was wrong. We also got some drinks which hardly had alcohol in em. I knocked off a star for that and the fact the the fries werent fresh cut and the apps were frozen.

XVKRqd2AqCVkUIfuVUWItg.text: A very good, expensive burger. They have one in SF now, but I still think the Vegas version was much better.

SRAbXnCxEoZIz2OeKdz-3w.text: Hard to decide as it all sounded great. Bison was awesome.  It's Vegas pricing but not outrageous.   Would go back.

1tbCTaip1b9dOQC0Mf23GA.text: Nestled in between the Luxor and Mandalay Bay, Burger Bar is a haven for hamburger aficionados.  After a late night of partying on the Strip, Burger Bar is the best place to stop in and sober up (open until 1 AM on Friday and Saturdays).  If you're coming for a regular meal, you can't go wrong with the American Classic burger, with cheese, bacon, onions and tomato.  But if you just want a quick bite, go for the sliders.  You get 3 different burgers:  two of them with different types of beef, the other with buffalo meat.    But to make your meal really special, get a milkshake.  Each time I come here, I get the Nutella milkshake, which is the best milkshake I've ever had.  For some reason, the milkshakes are better here, even better than the SF Burger Bar.  I don't know why, but they are.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nutella Milkshake (i.e. the best milkshake ever!)

L5OcEYs0hPm4RZ1JxiQVPQ.text: Wow this place is pushing 1700 reviews? I'll throw my brief one in and watch it get lost among the rest then :)  I opted for the Hangover Burger simply because anytime I can get a burger topped with a runny over-easy egg I go for it! The burger was superb and the side of fries were decent and my plate cost around $14 which is to be expected at a joint right on the strip. The waitstaff was friendly and attentive as they could be while the place was pretty full. All in all, not a bad pit-stop after a concert at The House of Blues or perhaps a long night of shopping.  Their dessert options looked quite intriguing however I have not yet gotten a chance to order off of that menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hangover burger
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Basic Burger Bar meal

0QIJIXrl4EbPG1w5FCIXbw.text: We may have caught them during a extremely busy time since there were two large conventions going on.  The hostess was very friendly and kept our table open even though we ran late by almost a half hour.  The burger was cooked to my liking and my colleagues seemed to enjoy their lunches as well.  The servers I think could have clarified the options a bit more, but nonetheless the service was very friendly and prompt!

d2ghERhPc9tIS-GcWWsFdA.text: The Skinny: quote the hubs - "You can get this same s*(t for half the price at a hospital cafeteria or the frozen food aisle at Walmart. Frankly, Hubert Keller should be ashamed to serve such swill." (2) sticky seats, slow service at the bar (2) value: skip this joint and head to Five Guys or In and Out - way better in terms of quality, cleanliness and value. (2)  We went here for happy hour on a weekday and it was as boisterous and loud as if it were a weekend. This place is pretty hopping and there were a crowd of people waiting to be seated.  Luckily, we only wanted to try the happy hour so we were able to walk through and find a small space at the end of the bar to settle ourselves in. Another gentleman told us - "just grab a chair... that's what I did". So we did precisely that. Unfortunately, the seat that I stole was inherently sticky from some unknown substance which kind of increased the "ew" factor. In addition to this, it took a long while to get menus or heck! even get anyone to acknowledge our presence.  We ordered their buffalo wings, chicken strips, plate of 3 sliders and their wedge salad.  Their buffalo wings had a nice texture however it was nothing special to me. The seasoning of the wings was a standard hot sauce just like what you can get anywhere else. The dressing it was served with lack any sort of distinctive flavor - if you can't tell if it's ranch or blue cheese that's pretty freaking bad.   The chicken strips had a heavy slightly salty breading that tasted like what you'd get at any average cafeteria. Same goes for the fries.  The wedge salad was kind of disappointment because the tomatoes were on the mealy side. Yuck!  Finally their sliders. It was rather unfortunate that their meat is inadequately seasoned which ruined it all for me.  All in all, the food here is edible but hardly more than that. Given Hubert Keller's reputation, it should be way better than this. Factor in the cost...this place is a 2 star in my book.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wedge salad
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken wings
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken fingers

ra1RYg89auSs4qgIK2HZ2A.text: I've given this place two chances.  There won't be a third.   I tried this place a few years ago and wasn't impressed.  The food and the service both seemed so so, and for the price, so so doesn't cut it.   This time I tried the $17.95 Buffalo burger, which worked out to be $22.15 with a slice of cheese and a side of unremarkable fries.  When the plates hit the table, the fries we piping hot (two hot to eat), but the burger was just lukewarm and relatively flavorless.  My suspicion is the cook let the burger sit waiting for the fries he waited too long to drop to finish cooking.    When the waitress asked me how everything was, I told her "It's alright."  What a mistake that turned out to be.  I should have just smiled politely and said "great."  When she offered to get me another burger or whatever, I told her I didn't want to make a fuss or get something else.  She didn't listen.  Before I know it, the manager is standing over me explaining how they prepare the vaunted buffalo burger, how they sell about 800 regular hamburgers a day compared to only 20 buffalo burgers and take extra care preparing the buffalo burger, and how customer satisfaction is very important to him and to the server.  Bud, I know a lukewarm, relatively flavorless burger when I taste one, and I call this faux "service."  The visit by the manager was an unwanted intrusion upon a meal that was already disappointing.

T70M6TtHoxnOdO4ugjGhuA.text: Every second is a highlight When we touch don't ever let me go Dirty dancing in the moonlight Take me down like I'm a domino at BURGER BAR! - Jessie J (domino)  Hubert Keller and burger...what? I think it's an excellent choice for either lunch or late afternoon. There's a 'build your own burger' option that appeals to many people. The milkshakes looked good too, but didn't feel like it that day (summer approaching!).   I very much enjoyed my burger here at Burger Bar at Mandalay Bay. The bun was especially well done and all the condiments that it came with were crisp. The burger came with shoestring fries, but I would probably substitute and try one of the many other fries options. I was sort of in a rush so yeah, I kept it short and simple and had a satisfying burger without any fuss.

zt3KAdlKl8f3Bmx6gmn9-w.text: In Las Vegas and tried Gordon Ramsey's but the best burger we had was here.  However, being from California my favorite burger joint is still In n Out burgers, a double-double, protein style and animal style!  One of my favorite gourmet chefs is Hubert Keller and this is his burger restaurant in Vegas... Love it and will return on our next visit to Vegas!

_5V-CKv04CYAv78E8Nh9vA.text: My group and I ordered 3 Kobe beef burger with foie gras, total turned out to be around $200 because we ate wayyyy too much.   Foie Gras- ummm, not the best experience I've had. i drenched it in the burger sauce because I couldn't taste the scrumptiousness of the foie gras. I wouldn't recommend Burger Bar if you're solely here for that.  The nutella sandwich- which is essentially a chunk of nutella squeezed between two donuts and gelatin is a heart attack on a platter. Just make sure you exercise for the next 3 days so you don't die, because it's really yummy!

Hw5ul3MYozBQwkpUV9QvcQ.text: My bad for ordering the Grilled Shrimp Salad ($13) at a burger-focused restaurant. That said, it was still disgusting. 5 well-grilled and butterflied shrimp lay on a bed of completely plain mixed greens (no onions, tomatoes, vinaigrette, nada) topped with olive oil and red bell peppers/zucchini strips that had been cooked to death at one point and then set aside long enough to become slimy. It felt like I was hunting for worms in a lettuce patch. Never again. I left at least 60% of the salad for the garbage.  Bloody marys ($12) are a 5-star affair, if you're looking for a drink while you're there. Good tomato-to-spiciness ratio, and comes with cheese-stuffed olives. Yum!  I'd definitely give this place another go, sticking solely with a BURGER next time. My friend had the Hubert Keller ($21) and after the first bite said he jizzed himself. Seems promising. Til' then, cheers!

-o_Y-RAxEG7mtWkiKDS0jw.text: Amazing burger in the shopping mall at Mandalay Bay! What a find. Sat at the bar, no wait, was a little noisy, but it was a bar with food in Las Vegas. Enough said.  Worth the trip!

7vCqVStcy-uCArky9GifXw.text: Best burger experience ive ever had so far in vegas!  When we got there me and my bf had already perused the menu all week deciding what we wanted to order so I was thrilled that the food lived up to my stupidly high expectations.   I ordered the burger sliders as an attempt to test my taste buds to see if I could tell the difference between the different kinds of meat. Long story short...I couldnt. But it was still nice to get a variety of toppings on each one so that you dont get bored. The best thing though for me was stealing some of my bfs truffle mayo (which like all the condiments/sauces comes on the side) and putting it on each of my sliders. It was sooooo goood. Now im a sucker for anything with truffle so thumbs up for that. One thing they should do is let you order some of their toppings even if you are not making your own burger. Next time I think id want to try the truffle sauce.   Bfs burger was kobe with foie grais and some other stuff. He said he couldnt really taste the quality of the kobe either. The kicker was the foie grais which they give a generous amount of. Next time he said he would just order the angus meat as long as he had the foie grais.   Even as we were leaving and throughout that weekend I could not stop thinking about those little burgerw with truffle mayo. Burger bar I will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kobe beef with foie grais, carmelized onions, american cheese and truffle mayo on the side
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burger sliders!

n5oqU3EEPEleMFXWNHHo5w.text: I was in Vegas on business last week and a friend suggested I try Burger Bar. I wandered around the strip a bit then headed down the Mandalay Bay and got myself a little table. I decided to get the hangover burger. A patty smothered in "hangover sauce" and fat fries? Yes please. So delicious! Loved every bite and could barely eat another. Burger was cooked perfectly and fries were delicious!  Service was super friendly and fast! Next time I'm going to try one of the milkshakes that I hear are outstanding!

RWqN7KjUIzwjfDXi7vPo8g.text: Very good though not excellent burger due to presentation and quality of the meat.  One of the best options for balance of cost and quality by the mandalay hotel

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VCEa0ul6N64HZSpUnKO-rQ.text: I come here every time I'm in Vegas. Love it. Always great service and the food!... sweet potato fries, zucchini fries, the burger toppings - all the cheeses, caramelized onions, grilled zucchini. Do yourself a favor and just say "yes".

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Turkey burger with American, caramelized onions, grilled zucchini with delish sweet potato fries and Blue Moon.

Y3pJWIHApXlQoybkhTTcPA.text: Burger Bar had decent burgers, so I would have given it 3 stars, but for their extremely slow service, I could only give two. We were a table of 2 around late 1 PM, almost 2 PM on a weekend, and there weren't enough customers to justify the 40 minute wait time for food. We only ordered a burger each.   The burgers were large portioned, and tasted decent but not amazing enough for its high price. We customized our burgers, and I liked the variety of choices on their menu. The beef was tender and cooked very well to our liking. However, we both found the meat to be extremely bland, as if they had forgotten to season it. What saved the burger was the sauce that was paired with it, otherwise it would have been too bland to enjoy.   I hadn't tried any other burger joints on the strip, but Burger Bar certainly isn't any better than burger joints in LA. I can find gourmet burgers in LA that taste better, without the hefty price tag.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Customized Kobe beef burger

1N4yi3ns_Hj3M3N-2EkcJg.text: OVERRATED.  Can I just leave the review with that one word?  We visited Burger Bar because it was in the concourse that connected our hotel to the Luxor, so it was convenient.  A friend of mine also spoke very highly of their food, so off we went.  The menu is much like Kuma's, but the quality of the food is much lower.  Maybe I've been spoiled here in Chicago, but we have a LOT of good burgers and burger restaurants.  Especially ones that make 'signature' or 'specialty' burgers.  That said, nothing at Burger Bar was particularly interesting or novel to me.  The food was good, don't get me wrong.  It's not like everything tasted gross.  I just think that the reputation of this place is more a myth since this place is just a burger restaurant.    The food is (duh) overpriced since this is inside a Vegas casino mall.  The drinks were decent and apparently the booze shakes were excellent.  Order one of those and tell me what you think.    I'd rather enjoy the buffet at my hotel next time since it's cheaper and offers a larger selection of various foods.  Meh.

m5U8D6xKumA5ExK5DP2zqQ.text: My husband and I just went here recently on our trip to Vegas. I have been telling everyone about this place, its really good! Its not the cheapest burger you will ever have , but its worth it. We both did the build your own burger, the jalapeno bacon is a must :)  we also did the trio of fries, onion rings & zucchini fries. When we go back next time we will share a burger if we get the appetizer , as it was just to much food for us.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

oTnYUR4PF2NlV2aSvKROcw.text: Great ambiance. Terrific service. The shake selection is fantastic. We ate there 3 days in a row. Definitely a place to count on if you are staying at the Mandalay Bay or Luxor.

j3n7HQsmg2LVYTvuNU_tUA.text: Good burgers, albeit expensive. Service leaves something to be desired. Buffalo meat is very lean and dry. The 2tier is pretty greasy (no antibiotics, etc. Forgot the name). Did not have the wagyu this trip but have in the past, don't notice much difference in flavor. For a $7 difference in price, I would stick to the cheaper meats and load up on better add-ons. Don't forget to add the sauce...

HKK8mT0eJQTlduoZKk1xXw.text: This is my favorite burger place in Las Vegas, and we always stop here whether we're on vacation or just passing through. After a disappointing trip to the San Francisco location, we were torn whether or not to come back, but we're glad we did. The Red Velvet alcoholic shake was terrific. It tasted just like a red velvet cupcake (complete with frosting) and it wasn't overpowered by the alcohol. I ordered the kobe burger with seared foie gras and the truffle perigord sauce. The extras are a little pricey but it was quite tasty and enjoyable. They have great dipping sauces for the fries as well, and I'd recommend the white barbecue, which is sweet, and the truffle aioli which combines the traditional garlic aioli with an unmistakable hint of truffle. Great food, decent and prompt service. Can't wait to go back!

il4WDkee_9w3CbkeTCs0FA.text: A must if you are staying at Luxor or the Delano! So many choices to create your own sandwich! Should be called the Sandwich Bar but their burgers are the best!

JM2UazbaaglpMjBrDTU2Eg.text: Good old Burger Bar. I hadn't been here in years until last week when I was trying to kill some time before a concert at the House of Blues. I returned this week after seeing Lion King.  I've become a bit of a craft beer enthusiast recently. I still don't know what I'm talking about, but I do enjoy a good brew. I noticed Ken M included Burger Bar on his "Craft Beer Revolution" list. I never would have thought of Burger Bar for that. I just pictured it as a place for expensive burgers. That's changed of course.  On my two recent visits, I ordered a Salmon Steak sandwich with some sprouts. At $8.50 (plus I think 55c for the sprouts), it's one of the cheapest things on the menu but I find it absolutely delicious. I get the salmon cooked medium and it comes out perfectly.  On the beer front, I went with the Deschutes Inversion IPA on my first visit and the Burger Bar Seasonal on my second. I'm a big fan of Deschutes anything. The Burger Bar Seasonal is currently a Hefeweizen by Tenaya Creek Brewery. Being a local brewery, I had to give it a try. I really need to make my way up to Tenaya Creek one of these days.  Burger Bar has kind of fallen off my scope in recent years. Now that I know I can get a good salmon sandwich with a great beer to go with it, it's back on my radar.

_GcvQ5VhlVGATVNxpEqwCg.text: The food was excellent. We loved the bun selections and sauce options.   I had the sweet potato fries and they were excellent. Will definitely make this a regular spot while in town!

JU8VesUfX1Ps4AO4HTNUVA.text: We went in for just shakes and appetizers! Nutella Shake was good, minus 1 star for the missing hazelnut topping. The Poblano Poppers and the Zucchini Sticks were good. Burgers looked good, kinda wishing we would've came here for burgers instead of Gordon Ramsay's BurGR which was a total let down! Definitely coming back to try the burgers next trip! Wait was around 15mins in the evening, not bad. They take ur number and txt u when ur table is ready. They also have TVs at every booth which is super cool!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nutella Shake...pricy but good

RYAnop9htS4uDD-CoqPWUg.text: Came here with my cousin, and this is one good place that has great burgers.  I had the Black Angus Burger and my cousin got some salmon sandwich with pineapple.  Mine was great and hers was awesome too.  This was a simple visit before we headed to the Shark Reef but I will be experimenting with the good stuff during my next visit!    My burger was juicy and made perfectly.  I had some blue cheese on it for more of a unique flavor.  My cousins salmon/pineapple combo sandwich was delicious too.   They were all good portions enough for a person and a half but I guarantee you won't be disappointed with your burger if you ate here!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. M for Mmmmmmmm!!! hahah

fSfki8ZXtP9jPfWi6-uVrg.text: This had always been our regular spot in Vegas, but may not be next time. The menu said fried pickles but they weren't available. Our waiter was awful, kept screwing up our orders. The meal took almost 2 hours- for burgers and a shake (way too long).

14T5l9mAxB33nZXMyRO_tg.text: I've held off on this review for quite a while, but after strike 3 here I felt compelled to finally write my review. I'm sure this might be hit or miss, but at least this experience has repeated itself.  The concept of the build your burger and of course the Hubert endorsement is a reason that fills the seat, but my love for the Burger Bar unfortunately stops there.  I have gone on 3 separate occasions and the first 2 I have had issues with the burger and recently it was now my wife who had the "Irish Luck" with Lunch.  The first two times I had the build your burger and both times they had come out raw vs. the medium that was requested. I normally am not a complainer when I eat, but for something like that getting sick is not my forte.  Recently I went and this time it was my wife's burger that was red and dripping blood which was inexcusable. She ordered sliders and she even said it best "how can you undercook a small patty"?  Beyond those experiences, I feel the overall flavor of the burger itself is just not there. I was looking for a little kick or at least something that doesn't leave me looking for a soda or a "dolled up" milk shake. I'm now on the hunt for a new burger establishment to satisfy my requests.

gWE1QEIafBULyFtVWj3iGQ.text: Decent food, but not outstanding and service was slow. Everyone in our party ordered from the make your own burger list. There are many options to choose from. You begin by ordering your protein - beef, turkey, lamb, buffalo, or veggie, then you choose your bread, and toppings. Each topping is an additional charge even the ketchup and mustard is extra. We also ordered fries with dipping sauces (also each item an additional charge). The restaurant was nearly empty, but it took over 40 minutes for our meal to arrive. The burgers were tasty, but not worthy of a 40 minute wait and a $17 price tag. With all of the awesome restaurants to choose from in Vegas, not sure that I would return.

dwCcHZyGJds90pEWRolhew.text: I ate in incredibly gluttonous meal at the Burger Bar a few nights ago and had a "meh" experience. I got the Rossini, which featured wagyu beef, seared fois gras, shaved truffles, all served with a black Perigord truffle sauce. I must say the beef was perfectly medium rare, as requested. The fois gras was a thick slab that was not nicely spread out over the burger. The sauce was tasty but was too salty. The bun was completely forgettable. Overall, NOT worth the $60 price tag. The flavors were rich but weren't well-balanced. A few more well-chosen ingredients to round out the burger would've made a huge difference.   The beer float paddle was innovative and worth the one-time experiment. Only two of them worked very well, though, which included raspberry-flavored ciders -- maybe because my palate expected something sweet. The bitterness of a lager mixed with strawberries and whipped cream was undrinkable, despite how tasty the whipped cream was. And although Guiness and coffee ice cream go well in theory, I'd say empirically the two are each SO good on their own, it's a disservice to combine them.   Ambiance is non-existent. At the comfy booths, there are TV screens about the size of a square foot flashing some sports highlights and a ton of ads throughout the entire evening. It is completely distracting, seeming to promote ADHD over any meaningful human interaction. What's worse, there is no way to turn the screens off. (If you have low tolerance for this, use two knives to wedge one of the black napkins over the damn thing and try to enjoy your meal.)

qY8p0SG3J0TRMnBst3DyYw.text: Got very ill about an hour after eating here and when I called the next day the manager I spoke with was very rude and said how do I know it was our food that made me sick. No apology no nothing...

b7LQycAeU2aWWYT49NloXw.text: We frequent this place one every two or three months, not only as it's the spawn of one of my favorite Chef's (Hubert Keller) but these burgers are made with some of the best ingredients in town.  The sweet potato fries are a must as well.  I'm a self deemed foodie so I'm all about customization.  I know you are never supposed to mess with a good thing (as the majority of menus TELL you what you will be ingesting), but I enjoy Chef's approach where you choose your protein, bun and toppings.  Sometimes I'm not always in the mood for the INSERT NUMBER here, so this type of menu opens you up for multiple visits.    During the last visit I had to go with the Angus (mid-rare) on Ciabatta (for the crunch) topped w/ Blue Cheese (addict), Avocado and Carmelized Onions w/ a side of Sweet Potato fries.   Burger came out in about 15 minutes and it was gone in less than 5.  The crunch of the bread w/ the combination of the buttery avocado, saltiness of the blue and sweetness of the onions made me have instant happy face.  Very satisfying meal and we will be back next time I swing by Mandalay.  Next time, i'll have to try the Milkshakes as I saw these being served to the Mid-Westerners at the table next to me who were raving that they were "GONNA DIE" because they were so good.

BVreot5aKn-DRPtmKZeCAw.text: Get an egg on it.  Yummy.  That it's all.  Really... Just saw that Yelp decided that my review is too short.  What more do you want, people?  It's yummy.  And, put a damn egg on it.  Sheesh.

8uucHx2Az43yNt5zN1G2Fw.text: Overall I have to say that I like the burger bar but I'm not truly convinced. Since this was my first visit we try to sample as much on the menu as possible. For appetizers we had the alcoholic mint chocolate chip shake and the macaroni and cheese croquettes. I enjoyed both but the alcoholic shake needed a bit more liquor, however the croquettes were amazing!   I chose the classic burger with Angus beef and skinny fries and also sampled some of my boo's salmon burger. I ordered my burger medium-well which I think was a mistake because it was a bit on the dry side. (I think it would've been perfect had I ordered it medium.) However, the salmon burger which was also ordered medium well was perfect and still very moist. (Note: the salmon burger does not come with a side.)   The staff was overall very nice in the ambience was great. I think this is a trendy spot, not really a "locals" hang out. I think this place is fun and I wouldn't mind going back but it's not an everyday experience because the food is quite pricey.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Alcoholic Mint chocolate chip milkshake... :)
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mac and cheese crochets

0w4U4xKGzbN3ZAWwYUbx4w.text: After walking for a while to find it we ate here and were impressed. The burger was excellent and it was so big I couldn't eat it all. The onion rings were too too. I definitely recommend this place.

vBS4JO3fEfgIj-dAOTYCdA.text: Herbert Keller's take on an American tradition.  Located along bridge between Luxor and Mandalay Bay. Burger Bar has established itself over the past years as a standard in higher end gourmet burgers.  The menu here has some nice selections and variety for most who enjoy a great burger, healthy and not so healthy options are available.   When approaching with a group make sure to grab a reservation. Most nights of the week can be busy as Mandalay Bay and Luxor are generally busy but when a convention is on it can be packed.   My recommendation is the Spicy Lamb Burger. As lamb can be little hard to find in town, Burger Bar seems to get it right. Most the burgers will come with fries, but are able to changed out for salad if need be.  One also great aspect of Burger Bar that isn't really talked about is the Beer Menu. They carry a fair amount of local and nationally crafted beers that is rotated out month.  Overall Service: 4-5 Food: 4-5 Cleanliness: 3-5 Coming back: yes

NfOzAsckyOKY9lACuFs1Tg.text: So glad to have gotten a chance to finally try this place. It's tempting to pass up since there are so many great restaurants in the hotel alone, but people in the group were up for burgers and it was a good option after several business meals.  The drinks were good. I didn't go Kobe (someday, someday), but the burger and steak fries are more than enough for me. I went purist here. Even the vegetarian in the group seemed satisfied. Which says a lot for a burger bar.

U0T7T4Y1VSqBHCAg8Ptdug.text: Awesome place. Located in Mandalay Bay Hotel. Good beer list and extensive menu, with obviously their specialty is burgers. I built my own with a fried egg and I followed it up with a chocolate shake. The service was great. My favorite place for burgers and can't wait to go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burger Bar Las Vegas - Best place for Burgers!

OJzBdTtZkAhZXXSBI15fAA.text: Had a dining credit. Wasn't busy at all and got a table pretty quick for 9 people.  We all got Kobe burgers either onion rings, skinny fries, fried zucchini and multiple milk shakes alcoholic and regular.   Burgers are fine big enough to split but you have to buy toppings which is kinda annoying. Without toppings the burgers Would be bland.  Skinny fries okay? Always love onion rings,fried zuchinni was good to. Perfect amount of friedness( is that a word?)  Milk shakes were amazing, both types and even if u want to customize it further they were okay with it.   Only con was food took long time to come out

sdI566DkTxmGWSrp4UuqTQ.text: Maybe my expectations were too built-up.  But I have to say:  Burger Bar was alright in a few aspects but generally, kind of a let-down.  Like any typical eatery on the Strip, they really stick it to you on drink prices.  Learn from my experience:  get the Burger Bar-tender to make your cocktail without so much ice.  Still, the Bloody Mary was delicious, served with a really crunchy full-size celery stalk.  Beer on tap was alright.  Strawberry Breeze, on the other hand, was weak and only so-so in flavour.  And further made worse, with a truly pathetic looking frost-bitten strawberry on the rim.  Trust me, this drink would *never* have passed muster, had the Executive Chef/Owner even glanced at it before it left the bar for the customer.  Really left a bad impression-- just that one detail.  Burger Bar's servers were competent and cheery.  The hosts at front were less engaging, and very distracted.  If you want to have a meal at the bar, no problem no wait... just go straight in.  However, securing a table requires more patience than it should.  The booths were nice and comfortable.  Food-wise, it was... good.  But I can't say extremely satisfying.  Portions are not generous.  And way over-priced drinks leave a bad taste in one's mouth.  The lamb burger was thick, juicy, cooked exactly as ordered.  Tasty enough.  The condiment, though-- some kind of diced red pepper salsa mixture that came with-- was the real star of the dish.  That brought out the best in the lamb patty.  Burger Bar's Sliders were a trio of different beef varieties, done to medium just as requested.  Tasted fine, very good meat quality.  Buttermilk zucchini sticks and Skinny fries were crispy, light and nice too.  This is a costly burger joint.  I kind of want more value for above average food.  Going to have to do better than this, Chef Hubert, to get me to return.  Signed,  Slightly Bummed Out by the Burger Bar

7jyzBCDnoskwIvtNm_xXvw.text: I was really waiting to eat here, due to the extensive burger menu. We had a party of eight and they told us it was a forty minute wait. An hour fifteen minutes later we we're finally seated. Sitting at our table we were given our menus but never introduced to our server. Twenty minutes passed as we were passed about eight times by various servers, but never acknowledged.  Luckily, one person in our party called the hostess desk and told them we did not have a server. Within minutes, the manager came by apologizing and finally giving us a waitress. We were even offered a free round of drinks. The dissatisfaction in my face and stomach was not repairable.  Food was ordered and still wasn't happy. I blame the service solely on the manager. If the manager was on top of the staff this would never happen. The apology of miscommunication is inexcuseable. If the table is assigned to you, you should attend to your table. Burger bar, you got my money today but never again. No matter what city, country, or planet you are established in!

1PrELOTNw4Bqq6JQBnjfxg.text: I had the Kobe burger with a Kahlua milkshake.  OMG, I thought I'd died and gone to Ireland.  It was my first Kobe burger and it just melted in my mouth, I don't remember chewing.  Hubert Keller is a burger genius.  You spend a little extra money but it's a great treat for yourself to have.  Awesome!

ItQYxSgTyeR6odzyzwc5wg.text: I'll have the Kobe Beef burger....wait, $60 for a burger. NEVERMIND.   I've always wanted to open a restaurant just like it. It started when I made burgers at home, I used top quality beef, with any toppings I could think of. So when I came here...  I'd ordered the black Angus burger with grilled onions, blue cheese, mushrooms, Swiss,and prosciutto. I made a burger just like it at home and it taste almost identical. I didn't have the Ciabatta bread.   I would come here everyday, if it wasn't so far away.   I love beer and burger combo. It's almost as good a Hot girl and bed.

pka5FbYA-s99WFkHVdPpDg.text: You can do some crazy things with burgers here, add lobster or foie gras (sp?) or even truffles. But if you keep it simple with their angus burger it will still be goooood.  This place is located in Mandalay Place which is the shopping walkway in  between Luxor and Mandalay Bay. The prices are definitely steep, you start at $8.95 for a regular burger but then your add ons like cheese, mushrooms, etc, cost that extra cash. Fries and sides are extra too, by the time you're done you paid a pretty penny for burgers and fries. I recommend the sweet potato fries.  Service did not check on us once after the food arrived, maybe he knew we were trying to be cheap cause we split a burger and he didn't bother??? HAH probably.  edit***   Went to Gordon Biersch and ordered a burger, I swear it was just as good, and probably cheaper.

Q4jRfHVxNfaYQU2HQ2NjGg.text: Yummy in my tummy!  So many choices it was exciting! I was pretty overwhelmed by all of my options so I had a pretty basic burger: Angus beef on ciabatta with jack cheese, avocado, and bacon. But it sure was delicious! I had a hard time paying $15 for a burger though, which is why I couldn't give 5 stars. The dessert menu looked good too but I was stuffed by that time.  Next time I'll get more creative with my burger creation!

CWt4TxcHrWXshRyEA8gdlw.text: Definitely got food poisoning here.  Went here around 8 for dinner, sat at the bar, ordered the Herbert Keller Burger (buffalo, spinach, blue cheese) medium.  Service was quick, food took a while, burger was more rare than I'd expect when ordered medium, the sides were just barely browned and it had way too much spinach on it, which was kind of cold.  Anyways, it tasted good.  BUT four hours later on my flight back home I break out in sweats and nausea sends me to the toilet.  I know you're warned about eating undercooked meat...  Could also have been the spinach...   Other 1 star reviews mention getting food poisoning too.  Definitely will not be back.

PcTLX5n01YvkP8DeBap7kw.text: I grew up in Montana. I know a good burger when I sink my teeth into it. Imagine my surprise when the best burger I've ever had the opportunity to experience (at a restaurant,) came from Vegas.  The kobe beef burger is worth every penny. The service is great, Sin City beer is good. There can be a bit of a wait, depending on when you get there, but it's worth it.  Doesn't quite compare to the fresh burgers my dad used to make, but it comes damn close.  If you love burgers, you have to check out the Burger Bar.

Xp9dt-i540PVMTimve70JQ.text: On our trip to Vegas a couple months ago, we stayed at The Hotel at Mandalay Bay.  Saturday evening, not feeling like going out into the hot desert air for food, we decided to stay at Mandalay Bay and look for some good, reasonably priced eats.  Yeah, I know, reasonably priced eats at Mandalay Bay, good luck, huh?  Well, we didn't find them.  We saw Burger Bar in the restaurant list in our room and decided to check it out.  Upon arriving, we looked at the menu outside the place and it was a little bit more than we wanted to spend on a late dinner.  We left and walked around the shopping area and by the restaurants inside the casino area and confirmed what we already knew, no cheap eats at Mandalay.  With no better ideas, we went back to Burger Bar.   It was pretty busy, and there was a wait for a table, so we decided to sit at the bar where there was no wait.     Burger bar has a pretty wide variety of meats, cheeses, bread and toppings for you to build your own burger.  They have a veggie burger, turkey, lamb, Angus beef, Ridgefield Farm beef and Kobe beef.  Once you choose your meat and bread, you can add cheese and other toppings as you like (but of course, each topping costs extra).  They have the usual topping like bacon, mushrooms, onions, chili and peppers.  If you're feeling adventurous (and have some money to burn) you can get some of the more exotic toppings like shrimp ($6.00), lobster ($12.00), foie gras ($12.00) or black truffles (1/3 oz for $30.00).  To go along with your burger, they have fat fries, skinny fries, sweet potato fries, zucchini fries or onion rings.  Finally, if you don't feel like a burger, they have a marinated chicken breast, a salmon steak or a few different salads.   After waivering between the Angus beef burger and the Kobe beef burger, I decided what the hell, I'm in Vegas, I'll go for the Kobe beef.  I decided on mozarella cheese, fried egg, mushrooms and jalapeno bacon for my toppings and a side of fat fries to go along with it.  Should have been a five star burger, but it wasn't.  I would have been way happier with a Fatburger for 1/3 of the price.  I haven't had a lot of Kobe beef, and I had high expectations for it, but it seriously let me down.  It tasted like angus beef, nothing special.  I asked for it medium and it was overcooked too.  Kind of crunchy on the outside.  The toppings were good, but again, nothing better than what I could have gotten at Fatburger.  The fries were good, but that isn't tough to do fries right.     Overall, a disappointing over-priced burger.  Four stars for the selection, but minus two for the taste and price.  The only reason I would come back here next time I'm at Mandalay Bay would be to get a milkshake to go.  Sitting at the bar, we were right in front of where the servers made the milkshakes.  Whole milk, real ice cream and Hershey's chocolate syrup, the perfect chocolate milkshake!!  They also have vanilla, peanut butter, strawberry, and banana.  Mmmm...chocolate banana peanut butter milkshake...drool.  I sorely regret not getting one.  It was, however, enjoyable to watch the cute waitress make them.  Darnit, now I have the Milkshake Song in my head...

P1V_XeRG4c6Tknhyz922Pg.text: Stopped in at Burger Bar for lunch with some friends and really enjoyed it. I think combined the four of us couldn't have asked for much more.   I went with the grass fed burger with bacon and cheese with the fat fries. I could taste the difference between a normal Angus burger immediately. The burger was cooked right and the peppered bacon was thick and delicious. Overall the menu was vast and offered a lot of options for toppings and sides.   Friendly staff and plenty of TVs if your into watching sports while you eat.

-_NrJ346JXXjfPn2K3T_Ew.text: I am in love with this place and can't stop thinking about their burgers!   I came here about five years ago and ever since, I've always kind of had it in the back of my mind every time I'm back in Vegas... but then, I never bring it up in front of my friends because I think they'll think I'm weird since I don't like burgers at all... or I even second guess myself and go "no, it couldn't have been THAT good... I don't even LIKE burgers!" so then I never ended up going back... until now.  My boyfriend is the reason I decided to mention Burger Bar this past weekend, because I know HE loves burgers and I told him "babe, since YOU love burgers, let me take you to this cool place I know!" He didn't even really want to try it out at first because who would trust ME as as burger critic?? I got the veggie burger the first visit for Christ sake!  But let me just tell you, that just validates my point even more. This place has something for everyone. They have salads, veggie burgers, no-carb burgers, vegan burgers, salmon burgers, chicken burgers, turkey burgers, angus burgers, kobe burgers, anything you can think of, they'll put in between their delicious burger buns (the bread is oh-so-good!) and voila -- the best burger experience in my life, hands down!

hs7_gK4x996FX5YiMRyjDg.text: My first impression of this place was that they take a perfectly good thing like a burger, stuff it with goose livers or lobster and charge north of $40 for it. I know how badly you want to spend that much on a burger but if you find the sheer force of will to contain yourself and get one of the regular burgers, you'll be very happy. So, that's worth 3 stars. The fourth is for the amazing selection of hard to find beers. They have a beer list that looks like a wine list.

5opgYe8rLOGMnEstGHPQCA.text: This place is the best thing about Mandalay Bay. The burgers are delicious and the shakes are really good too. It's gonna take more than this to get me back into Mandalay Bay (see MB review for details) but if I'm craving a burger in Vegas, I would go here.

6wlSrjCbq9EfQdM57yeCfg.text: Vegetarians, take note:   This place makes me want to be exactly who I am... A judgmental, overbearing, discriminate, anti-carnivore.   The veggie burger here is simply divine. Get it with whatever you want.   Don't believe me?  You want a fried egg over easy on your burger. You go there, sister.   You want a solid gold amulet encrusted with emeralds on the side? They have that too...   Order the $2.50 red wine shallot reduction. Slather that shit on.  I like blue cheese. They give it to you in bricks on your burger. Bricks. Although last time I ordered it, Richard Z was so disgusted with me for doing so he wished e-coli on it/me.   Worth the cab ride to Mandalay.

Xk3bRX7pBnwesqGUcKjoRg.text: Burger Bar is my favorite place to get a burger on the strip! I love the bison burger! Its a must!

v4rShO_mqzuZCCqTnWJ4pQ.text: Well, I guess I'll be the first to give a not-so-great review.   I so love Hubert Keller from all the cooking shows (and actually, I rode in an elevator at Mandalay with him- but couldn't get the nerve up to say anything! DOH!). I had high expectations, and felt so let down.  We sat at the bar, as the booths and tables were all full. The service was friendly. We ordered the strawberry mojitos to start. They were not good. They tasted like cherry 7-UP and the strawberries were so big they clogged the straw- so you couldn't get a sip without scooting your straw around and trying to dislodge the strawberry.   We ordered the mix of 3 fried things and 5 sauces to share, and I ordered the veggie burger. I found it a bit daunting to choose from all the little extras for the burger. I did try a couple, and, in the end, my veggie burger ended up costing around 15 bucks (with no fries...those we had to pay extra for).  We chose the mozz sticks, sweet potato fries, and regular french fries for our combo. For sauces, we chose the spicy ketchup, the tartar sauce, the cinnamon sauce, the chipotle aioli....and I can't remember the other one. They weren't horrible, but none of them were special.
