Vc-xwHORcgG3Hj0faySmpg.text: Of all the celebrity burger places that I've eaten at, this place was definitely my No.1. I ordered for the Hubert keller burger (of course I did!) and my husband ordered for the Marinated Chicken burger. Our burgers were great! Cooked exactly the way we wanted it and FULL of flavour. They have such a great selection to choose from, lots of toppings and options for people who choose not to eat beef too. We did not get a chance to try their epic bloodymary, which we hope to do the next time we visit Las Vegas. The chef's skewer on that looked awesome. Hopefully, the next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Hubert Keller Burger. So so so good!
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our orders

-XN-gA60mPKcieXOzkNsUw.text: Only 3 in the world. I have been to the Vegas and San Francisco one a bunch of times. Never have I been disappointed. The burgers are good, the damn wings are good! Their milk shakes and alcoholic milkshakes are super delicious!!!

Fu_REnDzzgIahJEQFo1Vgw.text: Excellent burgers here. So good that I had to make a return visit this trip back to Vegas. High quality ingredients with great customizability. Tough to beat the burger here. The sides (onion rings and sweet potato fries) were much less impressive. The beer menu was decent but could definitely use an upgrade. If you come for the burger and don't want to break the bank, this is probably the best option at that end of the strip.

4tR_ZX_ojSNMFY8dzVcfpQ.text: Let's start with the hostess: she took our name for a reservation and said it'd be about 20 minutes.   Instead of lining up against the wall and waiting like a bunch of common criminals, we walked around the casino, did other stuff, and checked back about 20 minutes later.   The hostess said she'd already called our name and that she'd call it again later when a table opened up.   Fair enough -- it was our fault for wandering off. She called another name "party of [same amount of people we are]," again, again; obviously this mystery party of 4 was not around.   I said "we could take the place of the  people you're calling, you know." To her credit, she got it and seated us in one of the several empty booths (so, is anticipation part of the dining experience or is there some seating system whose logic eludes me to this day?).  The food was excellent. I'd caught the chef's (not that I expect that he personally made our order) show on PBS (that's how hard I party) and it lived up to expectations. Our waitress was nice and friendly.   If  you're at Mandalay Bay and want to have a gourmet burger, this is what I'd recommend.

3kMLZp0lv-3YK0wA0M4wVA.text: The buffalo burger here is to die for.  Extremely flavorful, tender, juicy... *drool*. So good.  But because this place is one of my favorite burger places (and I don't live in Vegas) there is a huge wait just to be seated. Your best bet is to find a spot at the bar to order your food and such. Oh, and make sure you know that it'll cost you about $25+ per person. I was tempted to get the $60 burger but I think I'll wait till it's my birthday to try that one out. Also, the sweet potato fries are awesome. If you don't like their sweet potato fries, there's something wrong with you.  Here's how this place breaks down on my top ten burger list: 1. Burger Bar, Las Vegas (NV) 2. Healthy Junk, Anaheim (CA) 3. GBurger, La Habra (CA) 4. Left Coast Artisan Burgers, Seoul (KR) 5. Abbey's Burger Bistro, Baltimore (MD) 6. Shake Shack, NYC (NY) / Five Guys (VA) 7. Gourmet Burger Kitchen, London (UK) 8. Burger's Priest, Toronto (CANADA) 9. Root Down DIA, Denver (CO) 10. In-N-Out, California (CA)

IGaXFwvaFWBvZZyHsr-WXw.text: We waited in line for about 30 minutes and was getting anxious about just how good could this place be...  And True that, THIS PLACE IS AWESOME.  Their burgers are ginormous with even better taste.  Definitely recommended.

83GAPT8k9nfuxZaaH5TPpA.text: The burger here is good but not great.  I like the concept where you can build every single part of your burger starting with the type of meat.  I found the ingredients fresh and good for the most part.  The burger was tasty and satifying but not one of the best that I've had.  The french fries are fine - nothing special.  The service was pretty rotten.  It took almost 45 minutes to get our food and the restaurant wasn't that crowded.  I kept asking the waiter how we were looking and he said a few times that my burger was going right up.  Well, it wasn't.  The people sitting next to me sent their food back to the kitchen.  It looked like the burger was way undercooked.  Lucky for me that I didn't have that problem.  A fine place for a burger but far from outstanding.

rzwF3kxjscgf3FcI8xIiFQ.text: Fantastic burger in such a small place.  The cheese could have been thicker, but the meat was nicely cooked. The skinny fries were tasty and I appreciated the SEA SALT!!! I wish other restaurants would catch onto this simple concept and how it makes food taste much better than iodized. Big plus for having Franziskaner Dunkel-Weiss on tap! What a great beer.

aum8D-0xNxXkKnnQhdzTpQ.text: So i came back and ordered a Nutella Milkshake. OMG!!!! I heart Burger Bar!!

7v6s4jLfd5lJCwfGLlpDGg.text: GREAT burgers (outside of mine!). I had the buffalo cooked rare ...and served perfect.  My kids had the kobe and it was very good as well, but I preferred the buffalo.  Great sweet potato fries.  Many toppings available and a nice change of pace from all the big, expensive meals we had in Las Vegas.

JSYuvRG0yhRFThnSO9S-BQ.text: I just ate the most expensive but the best burger ever in my life. $60 burger sounds crazy but it is totally worth it. You can taste each layer of ingredient of the burger. Foie gras, truffle, kobe beef are the best combination for burger. Fried zucchini and sweet potato fries are really good. My wife had Blackjack burger and it's very good.  Highly recommended.

sUeKOGwQfSC20ycnDRk37g.text: This was a pretty good burger and a convenient informal place to eat in Las Vegas.    Because I had previously eaten at Huber Keller's flagship restaurant Fleur  in San Francisco, my expectations were really high.     That place is fabulous.    Here, well its a burger bar and not the best of burger bars.  The restaurant is very noisy.   I know that is the fashion for gastro pub type places, but for us, it was hard to talk.   The burgers and toppings were terrific.  I liked the reduction sauce that came with my burger.    The service was terrific too.    But the buns were ordinary.  The french fries were good, as good as McDonalds, but not great, and the onion rings were disappointing -- maybe frozen, i don't know.  Father's Office in West LA, or the Back Abbey or Eureka in my hometown of Claremont CA get everything right, the burger the bun, the sides -- Burger Bar has a ways to go to match the best of this genre.

iSiLZH3j4TM4d35GaYP3LA.text: This is the bomb ass burger joint. The best EVER!! There is no other burger that I have ever had that is better than this. Sweet potato fries that are out of this world.  This is burger heaven. You can get whatever you want on it. I would go with the Kobe burger it is to bow for. The burgers are cooked heavenly. The cheese melts over to the side and blends in with the burger juice and makes you salivate just looking at it. It beats anything in my hometown in Seattle. There is no equal. Grab yourself a tasty adult beverage and sit down and eat one of these puppies. Ignorance is bliss!

DVxI7dtpzfyn-6_pyArMdg.text: Note: Try on clothes at neighboring stores BEFORE eating here. Or else you won't fit into those cute pants in the window you had your eyes on.  With that being said, Burger Bar is a fun experience when you're in Vegas. It's in the midst of the hotel/shopping area, so if you're going for a quick bite this is kind of inconvenient. Make an attraction out of it, visit the hotel and go shopping so parking & walking here is worth it.  The table backs are high for privacy, so the next table won't see how big of a slob you are when the waitress brings your 10 ton burger and you drip 5 tons of it onto your lap.  Totally customizable, if you're not gonna drink alcohol then try one of their shakes (maybe with alcohol IN it? just a thought. hey its Vegas!) and their side items.  Here was my first time concoction.. - wheat bread - turkey burger - bbq sauce - jalapeno bacon (yum!) - and a fried egg  If that doesn't say fat kid, I don't know what does.

EmNEGRylMEYCRICkDrIc9Q.text: The Hurbert Keller burger is to die for !

0lIcrh3MeRnMbeV6OjAW4A.text: Awesome place to eat with a casual ambiance. It is located in the Mandalay Bay shops. There are booths you can sit in that have personal TVs. We all ordered customized burgers and mine came with mushrooms, cheese and truffle mayo which was delish! We also ordered the milkshake and sweet potato fries and it was all great!

UDkAtRuT3B_5u5hkcKop3g.text: I'd go back!  Girlfriends and I came here on a Thursday night before watching Sex and the City and it was a good thing we came early! There was an hour wait for a party of 3.    A friend and I ordered and split the Kobe Burger, added swiss cheese and portobello mushrooms on it! My mouth is watering right now! Hahaha..it was very good! We also tried the sweet potato fries and they were yummy, but i kinda missed the regular potato fries!  The only thing that sucked was their service was kinda slow. Reaaaaalllly slow!!

IDdtq2xENpVjFOr7B9wfvg.text: No question Burgers are  so juicy. A MUST PLACE TO GO ..not only the burgers why i keep coming back. What else ??? Their  MILKSHAKES of course. Love love love their shakes. NUTELLA SHAKE YUMMMy

jr88gFVmB1KIGoGkCrDnsA.text: My Low-Carb burger was served with a wedge of pickle, slices of onion and tomato, small side of coleslaw, and pesto dipping sauce.  The beef patty was standard round about a good inch thick, moist and tender, and was loaded with grilled peppers and mushrooms (which was a total bonus for a veggie freak like me)  The pesto sauce complimented the meat quite well.  The sweet potato fries were cut thin and long, but its got a good balance between the crunch on the outside, and softness on the inside.  The coleslaw was thinly shredded, standard stuff.  I'm big on trying new things, so I recommand it to people who haven't been.   But I would only go again when I'm ready to try the $60 Rossini Burger!

KGzDDVirBoYz4jbqsrVBTA.text: Just visited last week and Burger Bar is better than ever, I honestly do not understand one negative complaint for this place, the burgers here are ASTRONOMICALLY good, I've eaten in a lot of places in Vegas now and I have to say this is the best burger available.

drbPNnu37tLhtgLvkChDrg.text: PLEASE READ BEFORE YOU GO HERE!!!!  The food is just forgettable. Trust me, it's not all that at all. I went here because it was owned by one of the Top Chef Masters and I had to give it a try.  Rating from 1-10 ( 1= poor 10= very good)  Quality- 5 out of 10 Taste- 5 out of 10 price- 4 out of 10

urLH_MvHaYvbzNrLyATdgg.text: Well, if I recall correctly, there's three types of beef burgers, a few choices of bread, a few types of fries  and a few beer on tap, but one bartendress that made us come back more than once. What friendly service. :) Also, I was eating too much expensive food and needed to get back to earth and not be too addicted to Vegas. The bartendress looked like a trained dancer, I wished I remembered to ask her. Which reminds me, there is a whole lot of trained theater dancers in Vegas. Five stars for that.

fPYsUvOYaAzR0ooFzeXy7A.text: For an "expensive" burger place, this place is very good.  We had three "create your own burgers" and one salad.  All of the burgers were cooked as requested and very good.  The Cobb salad, although a half order, was big enough for at least two people.  We had three "big" fries and one order of sweet potato fries - both were cooked perfectly.  Service was very prompt and friendly.  If you're looking for something a bit fancier than "In-n-Out," this is an excellent choice for a good burger.

iZvulFAH9bMc6NIqenPGRQ.text: I believe there's only one in Vegas and how befitting for such a great sit-down burger joint! I wouldn't call myself a burger kind of person but I do consider myself a man of great taste. And flavor! Mmm :9  "I stay Gucci down to the socks!" (c) Christopher Wallace.   I live by a motto of never believing in something because of the hype. Not that I'm too good to give a little attention to pop culture, but just because I go in it to find out for myself and walking into Burger Bar with that same exact mentality. I almost ALWAYS, ALWAYS call a restaurant when I'm on my way to let them know that I will be paying them a visit. I give them my name, ask if it's busy, and the amount of time it will take for me to go from "here" to "there" so they can expect me. And that is exactly what I did:  "Hi, my name's Aljamin. What time do you guys close? ...Late? Awesome! I'll need a seat... no... just me. Great! What was your name again? Awesome, Joel! I'll be there in about 15 minutes. Thanks again!"  99.9% of the time, my table is already set. And that it was! +1 for Joel at Burger Bar! Excellent customer service and superb follow through. The menu is EXCELLENT! I browsed through it and a bunch of stuff made me "oo! and ahh!" First thing I noticed was the most expensive burger on the menu: Kobe burger with foie gras (duck liver), black truffles, caramelized onions?! Mmmm.... I couldn't afford it at the time, but hear me Kobe burger! YOU WILL BE CONQUERED! Haha!  If you know what a salad bar is, you get the idea of what Burger Bar is like. You pick your meat, your bun, your toppings, and a side. I went with the Kobe beef, Swiss cheese, on a wheat bun with caramelized onions (lettuce and tomato come with it), and a succulent red wine reduction sauce on the side. Order you some sweet potato fries and you're set! Once you destroy the burger, get the Nutella shake for dessert! Magnific!  I would definitely come here again and create my next masterpiece!

NLXcTIEs-ksnrRZgJ0b0UA.text: As far as veggie burgers are, this is an elite burger! You can get it with 30+ toppings, and no mattet how you havevit, you can't go wrong! Love love love!

uP41Ytb-HsCu140yf__0ig.text: Hooray, we dropped in during our stay in Vegas. It took us forever to find it, because we followed the deceptive signs in the casino leading us to the "Restaurants". We did a full circle around the entirety of Mandalay before finding it in the hallway where it is tucked away.   Great burgers! I was skeptical, but pleased. I had the Angus and husband had the Wagyu. He couldn't stop raving about it! I had a bite and wasn't that impressed (my burger was incredible as well). Definitely a matter of personal preference. He said it was worth the extra bucks, while I wouldn't have cared.   Will definitely keep this place in mind for our next trip.

K22CNbm_JWsyIdl65f-GDA.text: Had the signature Hubert Keller burger. It was excellent, and as I do really like buffalo it was worth the premium (if you haven't had buffalo before you should try it as it really is different / better).  Had the normal skinny fries (great) and ordered the spicy ketchup (a must). Also ordered the homemade dijon mustard (awesome). The fries were so good with aaforementioned ketchup that I neglected my burger.  Also had their poppers and with the ketchup - awesome.  I highly recommend this place - best burger I have had in a long time, if ever!!

LJXM-mYYs0qDY-1S-5859w.text: Whenever I go to Vegas, I eat at the Burger Bar because of their delicious burgers and exceptional salted caramel shake.  I am even more impressed with the staff and management of the Burger Bar because I hosted my wedding reception of 21 guests there last weekend. I made reservations over a month ago so we didn't have long to wait. They arranged tables through the center of the restaurant because they don't have a private room.The service was excellent (I think the server's name was Gina) and our food arrived quickly and perfectly prepared. Thank you Burger Bar!

yGxjkztBKk9eSET0da4t-A.text: Long wait but worth it. The food was great. I love a place that let's you build your own burger with things that are so yummy, I had a hard time choosing! Reasonable, good food, great service!

DmmvAmyD0vdHr-k6SPgkZw.text: With so few choices for vegans in Vegas, especially in an "Ive got beer munchies big time and I want to eat now" type of situation, the Burger Bar is a sufficient choice. Deemed the Vegas Vegan burger ... how clever, their vegan selection includes a nicely toasted bun, a huge portabello mushroom cap, fancy greens, tomato and a laundry list of exotic and standard sides you may add on, some at an additional charge of course.  I was thoroughly satisfied with my choice of toppings, all of which I cannot remember now due to mass beer consumption.  I do remember ordering a pitcher of their Oktoberfest, which was tasty yet way too heavy to be drinking with burgers (vegan and regular) and fries. Luckily, its Vegas! So we got ourselves a couple of to-go beer cups and went happily on our way. Our pockets a bit lighter, but not by much.  The selection of beers here is impeccable, mostly bottled, but many on tap as well. I dont think that I would return for the vegan burger, but I would definitely come back for the beer.

LKaCFtBqTmTP7ApYDf3VAg.text: After a late night at the pai-gow table at the Luxor, my boy and I headed up to our room. I woke up at 1200, when our friend Mike was leaving our room. I realized we had missed our check out time! My head dizzy and my stomach queasy, my boy and I quickly packed our bags and headed out the door. After a discrete snooze at a bar, I woke up knowing I should eat (but not really wanting to). We headed towards the Mandalay Bay looking for food. Nothing sounded better than the Burger Bar, why? The hangover burger! I know it may sound kinda odd, but it was what the doctor ordered. I was able to share the burger with my boy and make it safely on to the plane a couple of hours later :)! Highly recommend it if you hit the town hard the night before!

9LAYfurTJQXqDOePpf-7Zg.text: Had burger bar for lunch, and was very underwhelmed. Got the build your own burger, ordered a chicken patty with avocado on a ciabatta bun and that is literally all i got. The chicken was way too big for the bun, and it was totally flavorless. Not to mention the wait times. It was a good 30-40 minutes after we ordered that the food finally came out. Service was good, but the kitchen needed to speed it up!

KEwTsLss5cXJ2b-I1yq6cg.text: I work nearby and have found myself eating here multiply days a week! It's not just burgers, I often get the chicken sandwich, the salmon sandwich or even a salad! There are tons of apps also which are to die for, plus a milkshake bar with adult milkshake options!! They always have fun upbeat music playing and the staff if great. If you haven't yet tried burger bar you have to!

uwPlpRpPU6-QHzRCByF1gg.text: The best veggie burger ever. It doesn't get better than the Burger Bar. Everything is delicious and made to order. If you have room left after chowing down the best burger you'll have, get one of the yummy milkshakes to go. So good!

EXCjq-uK4TUIQlgcLYifWw.text: After agonizing over my restaurant choice for my last dinner in Vegas before an early morning flight, I settled on Burger Bar. I had the pleasure of dining in upscale restaurants the entire week, and was looking for something more relaxed. Since, my ingredient standards are high, it couldn't be just any old burger place... When I saw they had a Waygu beef burger on the menu, I knew that was exactly what I wanted for dinner! I ordered it "build your own burger" style and added smoked Gouda and truffle mayo. I'm not usually one to go for mayonnaise, but the server highly recommend it as it is one of their house made specialties. Soooo, when in Vegas... I also added a small organic greens salad, which was lightly and perfectly dressed with a tasty, subtle vinaigrette. The burger was cooked to perfection, and practically melted in my mouth. The Truffle Mayo was an excellent complement! Rounding out the meal was a small side of skinny fries. Just like the Mayo, fries are not something I usually eat, so if I order them they have to be darn good for me to bother with the calories! They did not disappoint. I had the fries with their spicy ketchup which was a great choice! It tasted like it had a jalapeno infusion. I decided to go for one of their signature milkshakes for dessert, since I was on a serious splurge. This is where my review went from 5 stars to 4. I ordered the Nutella milkshake, which is chocolate ice cream blended with Nutella, topped with homemade chocolate whipped cream and crushed hazelnuts. The flavor of the shake itself was good. Where it fell short was: it was missing the hazelnuts (no one stopped back to check on me & fix it), and nearly half of what was in the glass was whipped cream topping, as opposed to actual milkshake. If I'm going to spend $10 on a milkshake, it better be a milkshake not whipped cream. The service was good; the server did a great job helping me pair toppings to complement my burger selection. I will definitely go back again, I will just look for dessert elsewhere.

t3lpfgQtYdhqezwg0dATBQ.text: Pretty good food. Always busy though. Decent service. Great milkshakes.

e2q-B87a8V6uPsGYbUUQfA.text: Is it cliche to give this place 5 stars??? I don't care! I would agree, this is probably among the best burger places in the city.....Yes, the prices are more than what you would pay at Apple-bee's and/or In-n-Out.... but OBVIOUSLYYYY this is a much more quality burger and you do get what you pay for.   For my experience:  I sat at the bar. I didn't plan on it, but there was no wait.. and I was hungry! Overall I highly recommend sitting at the bar, there are plenty of bartenders, they are attentive and right there when you need them. If I were to be sitting in the restaurant, I would prefer to be in a booth because the tables seem like you would always feel in the way.   For our eats we STARTED (which was a mistake) with the Nutella shake. I will dream about this delicious thing for the rest of my life. Something this tasty shouldn't be allowed to exist. If you love Nutella, you will fall in love with this incredibly easily. Its topped with fresh cocoa whipped cream, hazelnuts, and chocolate chips! I will drink this down before I die.  Burgers: I really wanted the buffalo burger(which they serve here) because I love buffalo and its better alternatives to beef. But, I stuck with turkey. Turkey burger with provolone and guacamole on a ciabatta bun. This baby was steamin when it came out. Fresh off the grill. I really appreciated the guacamole they had here, fresh and yummy, and its obviously not for dipping chips in, and they understand that. It is for spreading and the consistency of it was beautiful for spreading! All the burgers come with lettuce, tomato, and purple onion on the side... and a pickle spear:]   My friend got a burger as well, and she also got the zucchini fries, PIPING HOT also. These were good, and a good change from fries.   Sadly, I couldn't finish my burger because of the delicious Nutella shake. I will definitely be back here for my indulgence and gluttony, but next time I will fast and make sure Burger Bar is the only thing to be in my stomach that day.

4qzl3XPjq-31NhUQZjb7MQ.text: Hands down BEST milkshake EVER! Nutella milkshake, yeah you rock!  Now the burgers... SO big I could only finish half of mine. Can't remember which one I picked right now (went back in Nov) but I can still remember the taste! So moist and the bread so soft and fresh!  And dessert... it looks like a burger but was really a donut! Your eyes played tricks on you and your mouth was confused but oh the taste was delightful! Seriously get the burger/donut for dessert! Can't go wrong!

i53Fi8k4zh7krdgJHtQUFg.text: Service was terrible.  Server was so hateful.  Even the food runner dropped food and ran. Server didn't ask if we needed anything until we were practically finished.  Turkey burger wasn't fit to eat.

11MFqkC5Az98H7dXvCg6Qw.text: There are some foodies who love the classics, especially when a restaurant offers a classic perfected.  As one of these people, I've spent much of the past year hunting for the best burger in Vegas.    If it's not the best burger restaurant in Vegas, Burger Bar is in the top three places in town offering ground meat on a bun.  The restaurant's decor is simple -- think neighborhood bar tucked away in a casino.  But the menu is vast.  It's a high-market grocery store's collection of meat, vegetables, cheeses, sauce options.  Put simply: Burger Bar is [bleep]'n fantastic.  The cooks prepare the patty perfect to order (I'm a medium rare kind of girl).  I had my bison burger with blue cheese and cucumbers.  The cheese was appropriately pungent and tasty and the cucumbers were fresh and crispy.  And the whiskey milkshake I ordered was brilliant.     Sure, it has higher prices, but the cost is downright decent considering it's located on the Vegas strip.

bo0FNG8GjFRQ7FJA1IkLJg.text: My husband and I ate there last night. It was a little rancid smelling-- like when you take out three day old meat from the fridge and ask yourself "can I grill this or throw it out", then the answer always is throw it out.. Well, I ordered wings which were very very small (like Cornish hen size) and my husband ordered a burger as rare as they could serve it... I know, not a good idea. My husband has been vomiting all morning and the hotel room smells like that restaurant smell!! Really gross!! Sorry!! We won't be dining there again. I don't think I can give 0 stars??

j3_zkQ4v0HjLPYjqnFeYEw.text: I LOVE Burger Bar. i have been there about five times so far and even tried the Rossini ($60 burger). The price tag on the burgers is well warranted as i have yet to experience a burger that compares.  There is usually always a 15-20 minute wait during dinner time and if you are super hungry that can be annoying. For me, it has always been well worth the wait. Overall the staff is friendly enough, service is solid -- nothing exceptional but also nothing to complain about. The food, however, is what earns this place a five star rating. I have had several burgers off their menu and the Rossini, of course, tops them all -- but for more budget oriented people I'd recommend the Buffalo Burger or the Kobe beef burger.   I had the Buffalo burger with grilled onion and avocado along with zucchini fries on my most recent visit. It was good but i should have ordered it medium instead medium well. I think with Buffalo meat being lean and dry naturally it is best to order it a bit juicier. Kobe beef burger was simply amazing and I have no complaints about it. The skinny fries are okay, as are the sweet potato fries and zucchini fries...I don't know, I have never met a fry I didn't like..  I truly believe that you can't go wrong with anything on the menu at Burger Bar.

UVDXSp4ZOevhEo1Yzkwx_g.text: hubert keller has perfected all things culinary. It's as simple as that. this is the only place Ill go for a buffalo burger anymore.

WO1tntgf7Oo9d-o3X4zyUw.text: Very disappointed with my recent visit.  This place has gone downhill since my last visit. I visited this place when it first opened decided to go during our LV vacation.    Food: 2, sliders were dry, nothing like what is shown on hotel tv.  Kobe burgers were average at best. Service: 2, got my salmon burger order completely wrong, probably gave me someone else's order. Ambience: 3 average, best part was the free photos at the entrance, nice touch.  Probably not going back, sorry Hubert.

lhKZOcsJeaL5lcQiq_6-_w.text: This place is LAME! First the burgers suck ass. I don't understand why it gets a high rating. I order the sliders, the crap was cold and my buns were rock hard. I've had a better burger at Denny's. Finally to top it off the waiter got upset with me because I gave him a shitty tip. Well if you give me shitty service, I'm going to give you a shitty tip jackass!

bkn2_H5SktBoOPLvs_lTxw.text: The challenge with this Bar is what to have. Of course a burger right. Yes of course, you have to. No brainer, done deal. But they have a wide, wide choice, and then if you visit during the non-cocktail hours, there is the innocent Milkshake. Good grief these things are like crack (at least I'm assuming).   I have to say the burger I had was probably top 20 for me, but the Milkshake was top 5 all the way. I'm a guy, I don't do fancy, girly, Milkshakes, it's just not right.  Except in Vegas. The coast was clear, and oh did I indulge. The perfect meal for the late afternoon, after the night before.

R_lZFTFG3eRq4JlvNalVhg.text: You would think they would try to hire a better staff for a location on the strip. The hostess didn't even greet us and stared at us blankly when we reached the podium. Is it so hard to say "how many"? Our server was incompetent and not friendly. My glass was empty for about 10 minutes and a server who wasn't even ours had to refill my glass. The bus boy cleaning our table had better social skills. The food was okay but for the price I'm paying for a simple burger, I would at least like better service. I heard the Kobe beef was good so give that a try if you come here because the regular burger wasn't worth the price for me.

fKFwo_6vMio9fu8jC-Yefg.text: I go to Vegas often and this is always my boyfriend's and I first spot every trip! It never lets us down, from the amazing service to the even better food!!! When we are really hungry we start with the mozzarella sticks which I love and I always do the build my own burger and he always tries a different one every visit. I am not one to leave a plate completely clean, but every time I eat here even if I'm full I can't help but finish everything because that's how good it is. The skinny fries are also great with their chipotle aioli sauce on side. There is always a wait here but I'm telling you it is worth it!!! Never disappoints me, best Burger place :)

zLEiOveU4o4hRzk23Aj73Q.text: It's ok. There are definitely better burgers out there. If you are looking for a greasy hangover burger, try something else.

3XcT7SpR8g4YSGIEdSyQJQ.text: 3.5 stars   New Year's Eve at 3pm, sat at the bar and we were served immediately. The bar server was very helpful. I ordered Blue Moon on tap and boy on an empty stomach, it definitely went to my head quickly *smile*. I ordered the Hubert Keller burger $20 with sweet patoto fries and my hubby ordered an American Kobe beef burger $16 (not to be confused with the Rossini Kobe burger at $60 with truffles) with added choice of toppings + $4 and a side of onion rings.   As I waited, I noticed that the restaurant looked like a comfy burger joint, with booths and tables. The booths each had a mini flat screen so you can watch while you eat. There are two bar areas, for those who do not want to wait for a table. Take a seat at the bar if you are hungry and want to be served immediately.   My burger came in a foccaccia bread with loads of blue cheese. My first bite was great, a mouthful of cheese, tender meat and chewy bread. I tasted my hubby's burger and mine was definitely the winner. The hubby's Kobe burger had lots of hard bits in it and that was surprising, especially if its supposed to be a Kobe burger.  All in all a good experience but I still prefer the Perfect Burger at LBS at the Red Rock Casino. I want to say that I will come back here but even if my $20 Huber Keller burger is good, it's still does not beat out the Perfect burger.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hubert Keller burger with sweet potato fries $20

XcqYZot-5OUTDWu4opwtGg.text: The burgers were top notch and made with care! The service could have been better. There was a very skinny young lady who didn't so much as crack a smirk the entire time we were there. One of my friends asked to look at the cook book and she came to the table with a sour face and practically dropped it on the table.  The burgers were so amazing I'd be willing to put up with bad service the next time I come to Las Vegas. The zucchini fries are a must. The fried mac and cheese was sinfully delicious!!!

TO8xo7b9AwZ5nIHjRhwo_Q.text: This is the perfect place to grab a casual bite before the Michael Jackson One show (it's right up the escalator past the will call, a few shops into the mall).  We showed up about 40 minutes before the show looking for a burger.  The bartender was super patient and got us a delicious medium-rare burger with 20 minutes to spare.  Excellent service.  Burger was on par with Shake Shack and the skinny fries might even be better.  Decent sangria and fantastic beer selection.

qwZ-frW4waUZE4BjlcFv3A.text: Food was actually delicious.  Service and prices were not so great when we went.  They delivered food with no condiment/side sauces we orders and food runner literally dropped food and left before we could alert him.  He didn't recall the food to ensure he was delivering properly ordered food and then we had to wait forever to get the sauces and the burgers were practically cold.  Bill was high for a burger joint even if at Vegas. Too many other good choices to have mediocre service

hnI-azaas83niHEqIR1mpg.text: Our waiter Damien was by far the best server I've had since I've come to Vegas!!! The burgers were well worth the price! I had  the classic angus burger with added jalapeno.. And it was juicy and delicious, the wedge salad was crisp and refreshing. My buddy had the low carb angus burger and she inhaled it! Will definitely be back to this place!!

YNju3LrMPx2JyZOeDKPYMg.text: Once I knew that Hubert Keller is the owner, my husband and I couldn't wait to go to Burger Bar. The cool thing is that we saw Hubert in the restaurant!!!! We had high expectation for the food!   I ordered the Black Angus Beef burger medium rare. The meat was very bland, and it was lack of seasoning. Bryan had the American Kobe Beef burger medium rare. But, the kobe beef was like the black angus beef which was lack of flavors. The meat didn't melt in the mouth. Nothing stood out and nothing special! My husband and I definitely had better kobe beef burger before. That was very disappointing.  For the sides, we had the buttermilk onion rings and BUTTERMILK ZUCCHINI FRIES. The onion rings were just fine. The batter was flavorful, but the crust was too thick for the skinny onion rings. On the other hand,  the zucchini fries had the same crust, but the crust was good on the zucchini. The zucchinis were cut thick, so they can hold up the crust well. It was a good combination. I like them.   My favorite is the NUTELLA MILKSHAKE! The shake was delicious! It was pack with hazelnut flavor, especially the nutella whipped cream. Every bite was nutella! Perfect for Nutella lover!   Overall, the food was just ok. I thought Hubert can do better, maybe his other fine dining restaurant would be better. For about $50 two person, Burger Bar doesn't worth the money in my opinion.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nutella Milkshake, American Kobe Beef Burger, Buttermilk Onion Rings
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Black Angus Beef Burger, Buttermilk Zucchini Fries
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Dxkniv3j-qKm9SqNtjS5LA.text: This burger bar is the best burger joint outside of Nicky  Rotten's in San Diego! We LOVED this place as their burgers were outstanding! This place will be visited EVERY time we visit Vegas! The surf & turf burger was OUT OF THIS WORLD, as were their sweet potato fries (and I'm not really a sweet potato fries type of guy)! A MUST TRY spot if you're in town and crave the best tasting burgers and don't want to settle for 2nd best...

J2T7Xh8aBob8zMGcw5jIvg.text: I had a beef hamburger on a sesame bun with sprouts, spinach, mozzarella, jalapeno bacon, and caramelized onions. I inhaled that burger! I also inhaled the skinny fries with the five sauce sampler. Portion control? Not a chance here.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The burger with fries and sauce sampler that I devoured without taking a breath

Cee6CCcHjt7t7xNNlVOhJg.text: The overall concept was nice and a good use of space. The Fry Sampler was just what our table needed; especially if you want to try a few things without gorging yourself before the main course. The Fat fries were nice and crispy, the zucchini fries taste great with ranch, and I was surprised at the flavor of the onion rings because I am not a big fan of onion rings.   I ordered the veggie burger on wheat, which was a nice portion size. The homemade dijon mustard is a must for this "burger".    Our waitress Mary was very friendly and knowledgeable of the menu.

KgvaQNul_lGncEEHAsiEkw.text: Burger Bar has ALL the basic components for a successful restaurant. A great array of gourmet burgers (customizable), fries (perfectly crispy regular and sweet potato fries), shakes, a great variety of tap/ bottled beer/ lager, a cool setting and finally "hot" servers!.  We arrived around 2 pm, yet the wait time was still a good 45 minutes. Luckily, we were able to find 2 seats in the bar (2 bar areas).    After settling down, I ordered the American Kobe burger-($16) w/ swiss-($.70) w/ a side of sweet potato fries-($2.85).  My bf ordered the American Classic (Ridgefield farm beef, American cheese, crispy bacon, tomato, onion, on sesame bun served w/ fries-$14).    As far as taste, both burgers were great!  I could not really distinguish the two apart, in terms of meat quality.  I would probably just go for the American Classic next time, as both provided commensurate levels of satisfaction.   The fries were outstanding.  Both the regular and the sweet potato fries were absolutely light and crispy.     My bf enjoyed his Polygamy Porter beer.  We ordered a Heath bar/peanut butter chip ice cream shake. He got 2 sips and i finished the rest.  It was an awesomely delicious, gluttonous, all-American meal.  Now off to detox.

Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Heath bar shake

0dItONZwWjISWh6sLhSP4g.text: Burger bar is a great joint in Mandalay bay shops.  They have a wide selection of meats. For example regular beef, Kobe beef, and my favorite Buffalo. You can add fois gras, truffles, or just about any topping you want.  The only down side is after you order all your add ons, you could be looking at a 40 plus dollar burger.  But I only come here when in Vegas so it is with it to me.

utfcNyZAQQR9GBSzTQRIUA.text: I came here once and it was just okay. I got the buffalo burger and it was not cooked very well. Pretty soggy.  The service was good, the server I had was very helpful and suggested the buffalo as one of her favorites. The wait wasn't too bad.

23UfrULfzyHPB1y0iqu4WQ.text: Awesome! I had a Kobe beef burger with cheddar, caramelized onions, pineapple, fried egg, and Jalepeno bacon on a pretzel bun. With truffle mayo and spicy ketchup. After 6 hours of traveling on a plane, that burger hit the spot. Service was good. The server constantly refilled drink. Definitely recommend and worth the price.

O83HmYkDIMVNmeyoGCM1AA.text: Funny thing is there is one in my city, but never had the chance to go.  I ordered the turkey burger that came with a salad and the meat patty was thick.  We also ordered a sampler of fried onion rings,'fried zucchini, and fried sweet and spicy pickle chips.  Our waiter gave great customer service.  We substituted one of our kids fruit for fries, and he did it right away as the food was coming out.  Although they forgot my ice tea, he offered to either take if off the bill or to go" and apologized.  Overall, it was a very good experience.

ZA8fu590-q-HgHm8SipInQ.text: The burger bar epitomizes great food treated carelessly.   On one hand, the flavor profile of the baguette burger was one of the tastiest I've ever had and the patty itself was absolutely perfect. On the other hand, there were so many ways in which the cooks could have made the concept shine but failed to execute.   The burger could have been the best I've ever had if the cooks didn't fumble the pass.   The bread was not toasted well and had a store bought quality to it. The burger/bun did not fit well together so eating was very messy. The arugula was not flavorful.  And the Brie chunk was too thick and didn't cover the burger either. The sweet potato fries were bland.   The whipped cream was delicious but the milkshake itself was not particularly thrilling.   The real low of the burger bar is the ambiance. Everything from the tables to the mismatched silverware to the fact that the booths are filled with TVs that the wait staff CANNOT TURN OFF make the burger bar feel like an airport restaurant. The staff were friendly, but seemed checked out to the point where I kept waiting for them to make a mistake.

N-x270CUGhpyS9dgyqSv3Q.text: I can't believe I haven't left a review for this place before. This is one of my favorite restaurants in Vegas. I get the Kobe burger every time. It's one of the best burgers I've ever had and comes out perfect every time. Prices are reasonable too. Everyone I've recommended this place to loved it. Even my sister who is a vegetarian found something she liked. Service is good.   I usually sit at the bar and watch a game or SportsCenter. The atmosphere is great. It's in Mandalay Place which is also the walkway/mall that connects Mandalay Bay and Luxor. I go here almost every time I go to Vegas.

Ibla75zk0f4K7pC2TULwfQ.text: Best burger I've ever had with excellent service to boot need I say more? Probably not but will I of course. The food here is awesome. My burger always comes out medium rare and I never have a problem not getting my toppings. I usually order the Angus burger with chipotle mayo, portobello mushrooms, caramelized onions and avocado with pepper jack cheese. Fat fries are a must of course and you simply have to try the awesomeness of the nutella milk shakes.   The service is excellent. The food comes out after being cooked perfectly and you never feel like you're being ignored.   This place is definitely my favorite burger but it also has my favorite shake. I have tried plenty of other burger places but always make my way back to burger bar.

UFHKiBxYDY5p4_DPaB5PTg.text: Am I a wimp?  I guess I just don't like it when the bottom of my burger bun is soaked with COW BLOOD.  i asked for my kobe burger to be cooked medium. last time i checked, "medium" meant slightly pink.. not bloody enough to soak my burger bun.  i def enjoyed the cooked areas of my burger but not the center. i only ate 75% of my burger. i did not send it back because i'm a wimp and didn't want anyone to spit on it.  my other friend who ordered medium also got rare.  order more well done than you usually do and you should be fine.

esZudfhz_wbGDJaUCWgX0w.text: Amazing food and drinks! The burgers are serious quality and worth every cent. The managment and servers were wonderful, very friendly, and informative. Added bonus- the sweet burgers for dessert.  So happy we tried this place and we will definitely be back.

LZoFdCgaKQ2QvrZBS3JYjg.text: fantastic sliders. my daughter loved it. the twins are cool and friendly :-)

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Party of fries.  Huge milkshake. Buffalo burgers

VKgYRzHRstkUYOTSbI_TqA.text: I didn't actually eat here so I can't dock their actual food(I assume it's good). I docked then 2 stars because they no longer have their vegan burger, but their online menu doesn't reflect this. I went there only to find that they only had a veggie club as a vegan option(with pesto which I found questionable as pesto is made with cheese).   My waitress was great and understanding, so their service is pretty good too.   But vegans be advised, this place isn't for you.

TS_M7uJuH8puzxSNXzKIAA.text: The biggest let down.  My first visit to Vegas and I did some hard research into what places I wanted to experience. The Burger Bar was high on that list. I didn't eat all day on our 9-hour drive to Vegas and was so looking forward to ordering a killer burger and adult milkshake. I didn't get that far.  We arrived shortly before 7pm on Friday night. It was packed. That was understandable. We were told it was about a 45 minute wait unless we wanted to sit at the bar. SURE! Let's sit at the bar. We were seated immediately and with a smile. Thanks!  We sit at the bar and was immediately addressed and we put in a drink order while looking at the menu. I had planned out burger after burger before I came here, but I decided to divert from my original ideas. I ordered a Kobe on an onion bun, with blue cheese, jalapeno bacon, caramelized onion, and a side of skinny fries. The wifey bought the American Classic.  Within a relatively short period of time our food came out...  well, her food came out and I was given a burger that was said to be mine. I looked at it and didn't see any bacon nor any sign of bleu cheese. I made mention of this, the bussboy didn't quite understand. I cut open the burger and inspected it: maybe Kobe beef with a ton of grill scrapings (these were "grilled onions"). The burger was sitting in the window for some time for it was lukewarm and the fries cold. I brought these issues to my server and he said "Are you sure? Are you sure there isn't any bleu cheese under the burger or bacon under the onions?" Really? You are kidding me: look at the damn burger. Bacon and bleu cheese can only be missed by someone never experienced in eating either. FAIL.  Understand that our food was brought out by a bussboy who didn't understand the various sticks and plastic they stick in the burgers to mark them. That's why my server came back 5 minutes later trying to stuff the burger I ordered in my face to eat instead. It was obviously cold at that point.  I took bites of the first burger, it sucked. Really disgusting. My stomach was turning and I could not eat anymore. Really disappointing.  We got our bill and they were willing to charge me a fucking arm and a leg for not being able to eat the burger I ordered. They then took the toppings off and charged us for the $17.50 Kobe beef. My wife insisted that was some bullshit (of course she was incredibly polite about it) and it was stricken from the bill. We paid for her food and drink and still tipped 20%.  Pros: It was all in all accommodating. People were friendly and we were seated quickly for an insane time of night. My food was comped for their mistakes. Their attitude was positive even when we were not.  Cons: Don't have bussboys serving food. This is the fastest way to fuck things up in a food service. Have those who are in the fold of the whole order be the one's responsible for serving, that way you can cut down on fuck ups. Problem solved.  I didn't get to have an adult shake... oh well. Not sure I will ever go there again to try it since there are tons of food options here and for my first experience of BB it was sour.

fIj1JCkoXb6qc0b11ya8ig.text: My husband and I had dinner here 2 nights ago. I got the buffalo burger and my husband got the nature source beef burger. The meat was good. We got it well done and the meat is still juice. My husband also got the pretzel bun and he liked it. I had the plain bun and it was good in a way that it is not the soggy kind. I asked for no pepper and no seasoning on my buffalo meat and they were able to accommodate that. I like my meat plain, that is just how I prefer. I usually feel that seasoned meat doesn't taste good as it masked the real meat taste.  The only thing we didn't like as much was the shake. We shared the salted caramel and it really tasted salty. I know we should have expected that it is salty but didn't anticipate that it would be salty enough to make me feel thirsty! It was like after eating msg! The shake does have a secret sauce called " Fleur de sel" in it and I don't know if that sauce contain any msg or fermented soy as my throat was terribly dehydrated and very thirsty after the shake. The toffee syrup in the shake for sure contributed to its saltiness too. After we went home, I had to eat an avocado and a plum which were high in potassium to counteract the trauma. I usually eat high potassium food as a remedy if I accidentally eat food with msg or high sodium. So if you can't handle sodium well, don't order the salted caramel shake, try another flavor instead.  The burgers were satisfactory but it is not a "wow" yet so we can only give 3 stars here. Especially when we know another burger place serving naturesource beef meat as well, and they can accommodate no seasoning and I think that this other place grills the meat better too. Burger Bar is very pricey too when considering the size of the meat they offer on the burger, so one time try at Burger Bar is enough for us. It is not the place for us to go back again if we have a crave for burger or shake in the future, there are better options in town.

Nm_bbgTsaFSP8la5M6MzZw.text: Unbelievably Slow Service!    Pumpkin Martini was awesome but the food was mediocre. Wait - staff friendly but very, very S L O W and unattentive. Would not return.

vaYduZy_VecKU8HEMye9zg.text: Next time I'm in Vegas and craving a burger...I'm coming here and I'm gonna order the Foie Gras burger all for myself.  OMG the foie gras was delicious, rich, and melt in your mouth yummy!  The strong mushroom flavor coming from the black truffles was oh so good too!  Honestly, if you're gonna splurge and indulge in a burger...come here and pay $60 for the famous Foie Gras burger.     ::I was kinda drooling while writing this review::

ZJ2Nr_y5abKJ2l6SGK9CzA.text: Its pretty easy these days to be a vegetarian or pescatarian and find something to eat at any restaurant, but with a name like Burger Bar, I admit I was a bit concerned.  This is the only place I have ever seen a $60 burger on the menu and trust me friends, I did not order it since it goes against the dietary needs. However, if I did....I'm sure my taste buds would be smiling and my wallet empty from the foie gras and truffles it was prepared with. This burger read deliciousness straight from the menu.  Moving onto my order:  The Vegas Vegan...after all when in Vegas, why shouldn't my be named after the city and its sinful nature? This meatless monster sandwiched a large roasted  (Roma?) tomato and slice of eggplant between two grilled portobello mushroom tops, and was surrounded by a ring of grilled zucchini and squash. To top it off, add a pickle and a large serving of skinny fries. Is it so wrong I thought skinny meant low fat? But there was nothing "SKINNY" about these fries but their appearance and they were delicious. My meal was good nothing to complain about but nothing to rave about either.  Good food and good service.

oCsxbbhEC_KZgC0V-rriRQ.text: Burger Bar? More like Burger Blah. Paid $30 for a Wagyu Beef burger that had NO flavor. Even adding salt didn't really help. Totally disappointed.

NlP81woATuB5JI7yP0TqTA.text: My burger was so amazing. Probably top 5 burgers ever in my life. I got it on a pretzel bun, which was a great choice. Everything tastes better on a pretzel bun. The sweet potato fries were also amazing. I'm not a fan of zucchini but their zucchini fries were outstanding. Next time I'm in Vegas I will be sure to stop at Burger Bar

R4j8ouXJxCdNYkiJd_-Tpw.text: I was visiting from Belize for a week and found the food here fantastic. It was my favorite restaurant while visiting. Best burgers I've ever tasted.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Made my own specialized burger at the Burger Bar

n5RYBiRcDm7Jsl6NOIc9hA.text: One of the best burger and beer spots around. I had been to the one in San Francisco a few years ago so when I saw this one I knew it would be an excellent lunch spot.  Great burgers, excellent beer selection, very nice servers and good fast service. Absolutely nothing bad can be said about this place.

Gh347ZyUnaklkciZWf19ww.text: When I first heard about this place and the famous $60 Rossini burger, and that my guy went without me & I was soooo pissed off!  All I talked about was going here, and finally 1 year later I made it!  Foie Gras, and shaved truffles on a kobe wagyu burger. What else can I really say!  I was thinking, oh my gosh, I'll never be able to finish this and it's gonna go to waste. But when this gem of a burger was delivered to my table I was pleasantly surprised at it's simplicity. It  was perfectly sized and not over garnished. It comes with a side of sprouts and little cup of brown sauce which you can drizzle on your burger, or use to dip your fries.   Some might think, well that's just silly spending $60 on a burger, but it does come with a dessert or shake of your choice.   All in all pretty damn good, and I look forward to trying their other creations!  Be aware that there is often a wait so make a reservation or plan accordingly.

KDEaXdsX4-Yd4kt32BkvKg.text: What can I say... I love the Burger Bar! My husband and I always make a trip here when we are in Las Vegas. We just stayed at Mandalay Bay over Labor Day weekend so we had a short walk to one of our favorite spots.  I have to say, the Kobe Beef is one of the best I have ever had. It is so delicious and just melts in your mouth. But if you want to keep it basic (and less expensive) the Angus Beef is a great choice as well! You really can't go wrong.  The only reason I am giving Burger Bar only 4 stars is because our server was a bit off. When we told him he left bacon off of one of the burgers, he said "well then there's a kitchen full of Mexicans I need to go yell at". It was so off color and uncomfortable for our entire table that we really didn't want to deal with him any longer.  Other than that odd experience, the food and ombiance is amazing.

PokTZtum5byY7s-5B9tuvQ.text: Over this place was VERY disappointing.  I went in with high expectations for delicious hamburgers and left feeling unsatisfied. lets first start off with the horrible customer service.we we're sat at a table and I asked the server if we could possibly be seated at the booth he rudely  said  those we we're being saved for larger parties.  After looking around and saw that they weren't very busy I thought that wasn't right. Our waiter then disappeared when I looked around the place I notice most people we're still waiting and that multiple servers we're just standing huddled up conversations.   All in all very disappointed!

RG8wXD9qIlWjq1amZxCDQw.text: I arrived at 5:30 and caught the last 1/2 hour of the happy hour. $4 , $5  sliders and $5 fish and chips.  The burgers were amazing and the fish and chips were solid.  2 beers and the food for $20 - a solid value for the high quality food.  I'll be back next time in town

zwQRJt8P698rcs52ECYhTA.text: Expected more beer on draft for how many beers were on the menu. Try the sliders to sample the wonders.

iNWCrJKoh5fibOZR_jJ1HQ.text: Best burger in Vegas.  Period.  I do not say that lightly.  You can pay an extra $10 to eat a slightly worse burger on The Strip.  Or you can go a bit East of the MGM and get a fantastic one.  All of their sauces are good, particularly the garlic mayo.

1cPFW23WeA_dIq_hWzgAaw.text: If this is what Mr Keller puts his name on he needs to maybe eat here one time. I would rather go to Red Robin than go back here. A medium rare burger that was brown all the way through and sweet potato fries that had sat under a light for who knows how long. 100% tourist trap Oh and the service Sucks too......

erJ-ELJOOy9OquVkUvBM-A.text: I was expecting something terrific and was disappointed. I ordered the Waygu burger with cheese and portabello. I asked for medium and it came med-rare (more on the rare side). Half way into my burger I bit into something that I think was a rosemary twig. It took me awhile to flag down our waitress so I asked one of the server to find her. When I asked them what is was, then mentioned that they use rosemary for the chicken breast seasoning....hmm, I ordered a $18 Waygu burger not chicken. They gave me a whopping 10% off. One of the folks I was with ordered the slider sampler. All of them- besides being tiny- were overcooked and dry. We ordered the mac-n cheese croquettes. They were good - but when they were delivered we did not have any dishes and one of us was missing silverware. Some of us had the skinny fries and some had the fat fries. They were OK.   Overall, not impressed. Almost too many choices/toppings.

8GKAWXW0BPdxFJw_9-VinQ.text: Yes. Yes yes yes yes yes. I've always wanted to go to one of Hubert Keller's restaurants (Fleur de Lys being at the top of that list). But since we were in Vegas, we decided to hit up Burger Bar. Okay, for the record, it took us for-ever to find it in the casino, our fault for not being able to navigate I suppose.  Food: Obviously known for their burgers, the range of flavors starts with a run-of-the-mill cheeseburger, to a fine dining Rossini Burger (Kobe burger, sauteed foie gras, shaved truffles, and a rich brown sauce). I settled somewhere in the middle with a Bacon, Cheddar Kobe burger. Very juicy, great bread (a choice of 4), and well-seasoned onion rings. Fries were also really good (offered thick or thin). But the coup de grace was their shake. A nutella shake. NUTELLA....SHAKE. It's freakin genius and I have no idea why it's not sold everywhere. It originally was suppose to have chocolate ice cream. When I asked the waitress which shake I should get, she suggested the Nutella shake, but with vanilla ice cream. Let me tell you....I will be forever grateful to that waitress. Possibly the best shake I've ever had. Rich, creamy, topped with a chocolate whipped cream and garnished with hazelnuts. Friends also had some alcoholic shakes, which were also really great.   Service: Awesome service. Aside from the life-altering choice my waitress helped me with, the servers were good about keeping our glasses filled and coming around every once in a while to check on us.   Overall: I wish there was one near San Diego, alas, to eat at a Burger Bar you must be in Vegas, St. Louis, or San Francisco. But a great restaurant, with awesome service. Oh, did I mention there was a tv in our booth? No? There was. It was awesome. Forewarning: They don't have restrooms in the restaurant and the trek to the bathroom is nice little stroll. But who cares when you can have one of the best shakes ever?

0548JQ7Mky85ZbXnG75q0g.text: We ate here before watching the Lion King show. Let's just say I wasn't impressed. The reviews raved about the food and I was expecting more, I wasn't dissatisfied just disappointed. The place is small, like a dive bar and not what I expected.  I ordered the salmon burger with skinny fries. The fries were crispy and tasty but I have had better salmon burgers at Fuddruckers! I guess I expected since we were in Vegas (where things are bigger and usually better) the salmon burger would blow me away. That it did not, it kind of tasted like it had been frozen for awhile and didn't even taste like seafood. I expected more fishy, I like my salmon tasting like fish at least even though it's a burger. The bf got a regular old hamburger which he was not impressed by either. He said he has definitely had better and by the end of our meal I wished we would've saved our dinner to go somewhere else at the Mandalay Bay. We did end our meal with a strawberry banana shake which was yummy and I would return to get a shake but definitely not coming back to eat a burger.

FZsja0e-X3J5P3o9Nl0Ohg.text: A generous 5-stars (we are talking about a burger here) because of the large number of options and quality ingredients resulting in high replay value.  If I had the option to add lobster, foie gras, and truffles to my burger everywhere then maybe Burger Bar would only get 4-stars.  So long as I don't die from cholesterol poisoning I'll be trying the $60 Rossini in October.

TL5rWmdjBD0K8JpS3t85YQ.text: The Best Burger Ive ever had. The kobe beef is amazing, the reviews speak for itself you wont regret going here. Worth the money.

zKkSqK6EqRPGpnQLxCR86Q.text: This place rocks.  The kobe beef burger was the best burger I've ever consumed in my life. Perfectly cooked, and with nothing special on it...it was amazing.  Perfect texture, you can actually taste the sweetness of the meat.  To top it off, they offer ranch zucchini fries, which rocked.  I'm a huge fried zucchini fan, and this did not disappoint.

oRJ1UKH7kgwIaVV-mR217w.text: Best shake I have ever had...the French Kiss shake with Bailey's and Kahlua...and this is coming from someone who worked at Baskin Robbins through high school. Burgers were awesome. My boyfriend and I chose the angus build-a-burger. Burgers were cooked perfectly and we really liked the ciabatta roll. The jalapeno bacon was awesome. The chipotle aioli was really mild and good for dipping the sweet potato fries.  We will definitely return!

9ato9EWu1L6Xg7ZlSv-fwA.text: KOBE BEEF BURGERS ARE AWESOME!!!!! YUMMMMY! About and hour wait to be seated but the burgers are worth it! I last visited in  July 2008....and I'm still think about 'em........!

fFguqJMC_B8ZoE1Dp-Ddgw.text: Better than average burger good fries but at what point is 20 dollars much money for a burger, fries and a coke.

SiFWDK_RD8OfVee-uFiUaw.text: ok hubby was craving burger so I yelp but that morning I was watching TV and they were talking about this place so perfect, the wait is long but of course if bar available you go ahead, the prizes might scared you the most expensive burger is $60, hubby order the Hubert ke that one is $22, I order a caramel latte so good $9.25,and I order the vegas vegan it was big but good also the salad the wedge so good only thing is that I don't like blue cheese but hubby said that it taste better with it. so if you want to eat burget it here just remember is $$$$$

oKQ-zUkBTL0Bo471E_1Hsw.text: I'll start this review by saying that I was told by a good friend that this place had the "best burgers" he had ever had.  And when I'm told that anything is "the best", it almost always fails to live up to the expectation.  Burger Bar fell victim to the same curse.  A buddy and I were in town staying at the Luxor for a trade show that was at the Mandalay Bay, so aside from the recommendation from another friend, we had to walk past Burger Bar every day to get to the Mandalay convention hall.  We almost didn't make the stop, because like usual, Vegas had sucked the life out of me and made me feel sick to my stomach within the first 8 hours of our visit, and neither of us had much of an appetite as a result.  After passing by a handful of  times, though, we decided that our last meal (fitting title for a terrible trip) would be at Burger Bar.  We arrived around 6PM and the wait was 45 minutes.  Instead of being impatient, we saw this as a good sign of things to come and put our names down before heading to waste a few bills and brain cells on gambling and booze.  When we came back and got seated, we were both impressed with the layout of the place.  Booths have private TVs, and the adjacent tables have great views of flat screens that overlook the decent-size bar.    The beer menu was extensive, and I learned that Burger Bar prides itself on its selection of "rare beers."  Although I opted to drink wine, I can confirm that the beer selection here is second-to-none.  They had something like a minimum of 4-5 beers from more countries than I could process in one look.  The only problem is that a person can only drink so much beer when they are eating large amounts of beef.  Not a bad problem to have, though.  Now to the food.  My buddy and I both ordered the Kobe Beef Burger, his medium rare, and mine medium well.  When they came, all looked delectable...until we took a bite.  Mine was barely medium rare, and my friend's almost kicked him in the mouth it was so rare.  I swear I heard the thing "moo."  So we got the attention of our nice waitress, informed her of the situation and asked for a re-order.  But instead of smiling and apologizing profusely, she tried to argue with us about what our respective burgers should look like based on how we ordered them.  Oh boy.  She finally sensed our quickly rising frustration, apologized and took the burgers back.  About 5 minutes later, we get our original order, but they were the EXACT SAME BURGERS, pieces missing from our last bites and all.  Now I'm not one to waste things, so this normally wouldn't be a big deal, but considering the waitress already arguing with us, and the fact that this place claims to be one of the best burger joints to be found, I would expect that they would cook us some new burgers.  I guess I'm expecting too much.  So my friend and I ate our decent, not great, but decent, burgers and moved on out as quickly as possible.  Needless to say, neither of us were thrilled with the food or the experience, and it would pretty much take a free meal to get me back there.  I'm not going to pay close to $20 for a burger and iffy service, when I can go to McDonalds and at least know what I'm going to get.  Bye-bye Burger Bar...

qVlj-2JAMJ8XYAhY7rosnA.text: I don't know why people rave about this place so much. It's basically a burger joint decked out in McCormick and Schmicks style. The burgers are good, but overpriced. I loved the sweet potato fries. Delicious. The burger was good, but not worth 10. The server/service was okay (there is always a line to get into this place), but he forgot my beer (even though they were out of what I originally ordered, so it was doubly delayed) and it took forever to get it. I probably would not go here again. I mean, guys in polo shirts and white tennis shoes and their dates. That's what this place is. Zzzzzz. There are so many other dining options in Vegas, and there's nothing special about these burgers. In and Out, in my opinion, is far better.

ykaydBjSjAtJ5hy1caF-vQ.text: The Burger Bar restaurant in Mandalay Bay is one of our favorites when visiting Las Vegas. The burgers are delicious, fries too. Kobe, buffalo and black angus cooked to order. My husband loves their large beer selection.  You may ask for a small taste of a new beer selection also. I love their cole slaw.  So many sides too, like avocado, pineapple, sprouts, jalapeno bacon and carmelized onions. The ground mustard is amazing!  Their salads are nice.  The shakes are awesome, many varieties.  They have a "burger" dessert made from a Krispy Kreme donut for the roll and a nice slice of nutella for the burger!  Erin is our best favorite waitress at the Burger Bar.  She may have a twin, but there is only one Erin!  Many solo peeps sit happily at the bar.  There is one chicken dish.

Lyf1QJJhOv32HKUOUNP_Wg.text: Me and my friend came here for lunch.  We both had the veggie burgers and she ordered the sweet potato fries.  We both loved our veggie burgers!  They were home-made delicious patties, not the frozen pre-made patties. Yes, we are both very much meat-eaters too, but were feeling guilty after stuffing our gullets at the Wynn buffet the night before.  If I were 10 years younger and 5 pounds lighter, I would have also ordered one of their fabulous malts.  They had quite the selection to choose from!  I kind of regret not getting one now.  Service was fast too.  I would come back here again.

HNMF1HbGOgBm4R90UksbrQ.text: Not bad. Much better than I expected. We had 2 Kobe burgers and 2 Angus burgers between us, plus an order of skinny fries and another of buttermilk onion rings. Everything was tasty and prepared as ordered. Nice bartenders, too.

4NokvBzQniGK8w2d9tSUoA.text: If you like a great burger, you are LOVE this place!  I have been almost every time I've been to Vegas.  The first time I went, it was only because I heard it was Hubert Keller's restaurant and once I saw the menu, I was not dissapointed.  I love that you can build your own and choose from an array of top shelf items.  You want bacon, you have 3 options (regular, pepper & jalapeno); onions, 3 options as well (raw, grilled or carmelized) and that's just the basics.  You can even start with a Kobe patty and add foie grais and truffles if you're up for it.  The sides are awesome too.  The zucchini fries are off the charts good.  If you want a place to get a great burger and just chill out for a while, this is place to do it!

HOHY5nbnlNHdpgbQ-buDIw.text: About 3.5 stars but not really worth the money. I had the Kobe Burger $17 and fries $3. Cheese Cake Factory Kobe was better!!!

ahOSY5lGDMuoa0-kgSB4MQ.text: One of our go to burger joints in a town full of awesome burger joints. Great juicy huge burgers (easy to share if your wife is being nice). The burger is the star but then they add on interesting pieces that pushes it over the age. Homemade tangy ketchup, different types of fries and lots of selections. Love the mushroom burger. I also like that it is also a great bar as much as a burger joint. Don't miss out on some of the best bar tenders in town mixing some awesome drinks. It's a great late lunch place where you can get an awesome burger and a few pops. The grown-up shakes are awesome.

Ih5jlkIdILMYzBD3lsvGog.text: 2.5 stars rounded up.   I was not impressed by the Kobe beef burger. Even with a side of truffle mayo, it was nothing special.   With so many other gourmet burger options out there, I can't really say that this was one of the better burgers I've tried.   The service was great though. Our server was very attentive and friendly.

-hEKR2zpkVOEI_Q_BhsU-Q.text: For an expensive on the strip burger joint it was so good! I was shocked by the phenomenal service I had received. We ordered a angus burger with bacon and aioli, it was literally cooked so perfect (medium rare) I was crying with each bite.  Their 20$ ultimate Bloody Mary was really bad. It was so thick and the burger and chicken wing we're really bland. I wish I would've saved the 12$ and got a normal one. It was so hard to drink and burned my stomach after every sip. It was like a clamato spicy smoothie yuck.  The wedge salad was perfect. It was really large in size and reasonably priced. The bacon and bleu cheese combination really worked with the iceberg lettuce and it went amazing together.  Their French fries are really good also and were great with the aioli I got for my burger!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ultimate Bloody Mary was really gross
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burger and wedge salad

LEDDqq7sVaSXc98nEnWEsg.text: First of all, beer selection, come on!!!! Estrella damm on tap, hello?!!!!!!!!!! I was pleasantly surprised to find out they carry a beer I haven't had in years because it is so hard to find =)  We came on a weekend. They took us right in and got our drinks right away, but the food took a while. We ordered the kobe burger and the wings, which came with fries. Do not be deceived by the size of the burger, it is pure genius and deliciousness! The fries were so yummy and also the wings. I wasn't hungry when I came to this place, I just wanted a drink, but after smelling the food, I just had to get my mouth in there!

4ZYnzqfYF8D7HXQHZf_qgQ.text: Great burgers & great atmosphere! Whatever kind of burger you can think of, they've got it! Don't hesitate to try!

hstHOAu37xPHfGoUEkwg9Q.text: Meh!   Super slammed around 7:30pm, we were quoted a 45 min wait so elected to walk around the Mandalay Bay Shoppes.  It was nice that they'll text you when your table is ready.....  The place is super loud & music is blaring so don't plan on talking to your neighbors... or even yelling.  They won't hear you  There was an impressive list of beers & we chose chocolate stout & a Killians red.  Veggie burgers all around w/ a variety of fixings, all on pretzel buns.  I am loving the fact places now offer pretzel buns b/c they rock!    The patties were homemade but cooked on the same grill as their meaty selections - I mean come on!  There are a plethora of burger places who have the routine down & keep things separated.  It shouldn't be impossible for you to do the same  They forgot my avocado; brought out wrong bun for the Mr; I had to ask for silverware & we were never checked on after the orders were placed.....we were flagging down anyone who would give us the time of day, to fix all our issues & errors  But for filling a pre-show need, as well as an awesome beer selection, have to say A-OK.  For meaty crossover & forgetting almost everything, I've experienced better.  I'd never actually seek this place out to enjoy a meal.  I don't do it in SF; wouldn't do it again in Vegas

ifoujrrmrsyZd69eBB398w.text: Stopped in before a concert. My boyfriend ordered the BYOB: Kobe (style, Wagyu) rare, bacon, egg and the usual veggies. No onions. Skinny fries (thin cut, not low fat obvi)  He says: "burger was cooked just right beef tasted great but all pulled together it was just mediocre considering the $29.00 price tag for the burger alone.... Subpar." He continued that the service was really good and that they "know how to pour a Guinness" apparently most places don't. "Our bartender / server as we sat at the bar was great" As for me...   A tiny bit over priced for mediocre food but vibe was chill af. Stop in before a show.

x-fo5XyizMAJtmp0TM8Npg.text: This was my second time at Burger Bar. I decided to give it a second chance because of the great reviews. My first experience was fine but nothing special. This time I ordered the Wagyu burger with the truffle sauce. I went with the $7 Wagyu upgrade because it was described as "melt in your mouth" but it was really cardboard in your mouth. I've eaten a lot of burgers in my life and this was one of the driest I have ever had. Also I paid for a $1.50 Brie upgrade and $1.50 for the pretzel bun. The pretzel bun was rock hard and the Brie was almost non-existent. The burger was also luke warm and the fries were cold.   I would have returned it but it took 30 minutes to bring us our food so we were crunched for time. I couldn't get the waitress' attention because she was busy chatting so I had to stand up and walk over to her to ask to speak to a manager, the waitress came back with a "discount" of $2 off of a $30 burger. How generous...Gross, overpriced and bad service.

m_itQwCD2vEkt85A2nbqCw.text: I was meeting a friend for lunch near the Excalibur hotel; he's a local and suggested we might try Burger Bar which is located a quick monorail or moving walkway ride away at the Mandalay Bay, as he'd heard decent things about it.  It was actually a good choice!  We were seated right away, ordered drinks and ordered food soon thereafter.  From that point on, service was great, our waitress checked in on us at least 3 or 4 times during the course of the meal to ask if everything was OK, and our drinks never got below a few inches from the top of the glass before they were topped off (though at one point, the staff did top off my Sierra Mist with ice water by mistake).  I had the classic burger and fries, which simply came with lettuce, tomato and pickle.  It was a bit spendy at $15.40, but to be honest, it was one of the best tasting burgers I'd had in a while so I thought it was worth it.  My friend ordered the sliders and fries at $13.85 and was also happy with his food.  Soft drinks priced out at $3.75 each.  Touristy Vegas prices perhaps, but the food here was good and so was the service.

hz0ebQN63CnYyNE3up8K-Q.text: After dining at Hubert Keller's Fleur next door and Fleur de Lys in SF, thought it would be meaningful to dine at Burger Bar the other day.  To my surprise, the experience was mediocre at best. Upon arrival, the hostess informed me that there would be a wait for a table but the bar was open. Upon entering, the restaurant was merely 60% full with open tables?!?  Started off with the Hubert Keller Burger and it was okay. The buffalo was bland. The caramelized onions and ciabatta bun were definitely better in my book.  The side dish of sweet potato fries and onion rings were also mediocre...seemed frozen.  Portions were huge and the staff was accommodating to split the burger.  Total was ~$15.5/head after tax and tip.

Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Onion Rings - $3.55
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hubert Keller Burger Medium Rare Close Up

0Sxrxh2ncljMk-r8IG7f8Q.text: *THIS IS A GLUTEN-FREE REVIEW!*  If you love burgers and fries, but have celiac, eat here!    First off, I have two words for you: STEAK FRIES.  Ok, let's make it four words actually: Celiac-safe steak fries.  I gotta be honest with you, I didn't even order them because I had a feeling my giant burger would fill me up (I was right - good call, Teenie!) but the waiter did let me know that they are cooked in totally separate, safe fryers, not with anything breaded or anything like that.  So again- steak fries are safe for those with celiac!  Now the burger:  It was good.  It was damn good.  And I almost couldn't believe they gave me a gluten-free bun, but rest assured, they did:)  I ordered a build-your-own turkey burger with swiss cheese, avocado, and button mushrooms.  It was one of those burgers so big you almost can't even fit it in your mouth but then you're like, "Oh it's goin down."  GDFR.   Bonus:  I also got a good whiskey mule there, served in the traditional copper mug  (why do mules always come in copper mugs anyway?)  A couple things to know about this establishment:   #1)  It's not in Mandalay Bay itself, but in the shopping mall part of Mandalay Bay.  (That totally tripped us up while we were walking around the hotel and casino looking for it next to all of the other restaurants.  You will not find it there!  Go to the shopping mall part of the hotel) #2)  It's kind of small and loud #3)  Our booth did have a little TV tucked away in the wall (basically at eye level) which was cool for watching sports while eating  So there you have it - a burger joint safe for those of us with celiac.  Go ahead and get smashed in Vegas and enjoy a burger here.

JQ7ZshAQuCj8iy4Qe3ssqg.text: Excellent service, Sam the manager is great and attentive! Wonderful food, highly recommended

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

C891D8Mo1F7e5SH9CR3H5g.text: Burger Bar is located in Mandalay Place in the Mandalay Bay Hotel! Upon our arrival we noticed the long line of people waiting to get in. So we decided to sit at the bar and avoid the 30 min wait! The place was packed and quite loud! We sat down and looked over the menu, so many choices. But the three of us girls opted for the build your own burger! I ended up getting the veggie burger and they chose turkey burgers. And since the build your own doesn't come with fries we decided to share the fries trio. yelp.com/biz_photos/burg... The build your own comes with lettuce, tomato, and onion on the side so I decided to go with sprouts, smoked gouda, and jalapeno bacon for my add-ons! Yum!!! yelp.com/biz_photos/burg... yelp.com/biz_photos/burg... My burger was juicy and I really loved the flavor of the jalapeno bacon, it gave the burger a little kick! I enjoyed each and every bite of my juicy creation. Service was excellent as the staff was refilling drinks, making sure our food was perfect, as well as bringing us extras! We were extremely satisfied and I look forward to returning during my next trip to Vegas!
