Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. (Build your own burger) Veggie burger with jalapeño bacon, Smoked Gouda, and sprouts!

C3bHI_8kOfLfjv6gP7BYIg.text: Not going to lie, I was a little tempted to order this $60 Rossini burger that was on the menu just to say that I've had it. Unfortunately, it sounded too heavy before a night out on the town and drinking, so I opted out.  This is located in the strip mall at Mandalay Bay. I've walked by several times, but had never been in. While you're waiting, they have a free photobooth outside to take some photos. You can either social media tag them or e-mail to yourself. Cool little perk and makes the time go by faster before you're seated. I'm sure there are some great photos as the drunks come rolling through.  A full bar is available and they have a ton of beers to choose from and there are various televisions on different sporting events if you're into that sort of thing.  What I tried: I created my own burger with the Australian Kobe beef with a ciabatta bun, spinach, swiss, fried egg, tomato, and chipotle aioli. This was served with skinny fries that were thin and crispy, just the way I like 'em. The burger itself wasn't everything that I had hoped for. As you know, I feel like I suck when it comes to building my own masterpieces, so I usually opt out. I should have stuck to my own habits and done so again.  I don't think that the spinach necessarily worked on the burger. It was sauteed but really watery making the rest of the burger super moist. I order the meat cooked medium and the combo of spinach and medium meat juices didn't really blend well. To be perfectly honest, I couldn't tell that the beef was that much better than the normal patties that my friends had in their sliders. Next time I will opt for the black angus beef and save myself $8. But at least I can say that I tried it.  I snuck some onion rings off of my friend's plate. They were pretty damn delicious. The onion was sweet inside and the outside was crispy and airy. They stayed crispy throughout the whole meal and I was tempted to order a second round. I was too stuffed, and that weird burger combo kinda gave me a stomach ache. Again, not their fault, I chose the flavors.  Service was good and everything came out fast. Our server was patient with some of my drunk table mates- I'm sure they get a lot of the crazy banter all the time.  I wish I would have tried one of their desserts. They have a good variety of shakes (both alcoholic and non-alcoholic) and something called a chocolate burger.  I would come back and try one of their other burgers and will sub for a side of onion rings. This place is more expensive than a typical restaurant, but it's expected since it's inside a hotel on the strip. Live a little.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yep. A $60 burger.
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mozzarella sticks.
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Skinny fries.

76sj5_3LnoXbw7WG10jKsQ.text: After watching Top Chef Masters, I'm a big fan of Hubert Keller. Who else can manage to cook a 5 star meal in a dorm room using a hot plate and a shower stall? I also admire his diverse interests- not many chefs can boast about being a DJ in their spare time!  Anyways, I was excited to try out his Burger Bar restaurant when we were in Vegas. We got here around opening time, and there was already a line forming to try out the delicious burgers. Although we had a large party, we were seated promptly.   We decided to order the chicken wing appetizer, and I had a nutella shake to start out with. The chicken wings were good, but quite small compared to other chicken wings you'll find at other places. The nutella shake was beautifully presented, with elegant swirls of chocolate syrup laced on the inside of the cup. The shake itself was smooth, rich, chocolate indulgence, topped with chocolate whipped cream and a sprinkling of whole hazelnuts.  Although I didn't order the beer float paddle sampler, a person in our party did, and it looked amazing! (See pictures for the evidence!)  Although the Rossini burger was indeed tempting, I decided to forgo the $60 price tag and order the signature Hubert Keller burger ($22). After all, why not order the owner's favorite burger? It was perfectly cooked to order (Medium rare), with tender, flavorful buffalo meat, spinach, blue cheese, caramelized onions, with a lovely red wine sauce on the side. I'm not normally a fan of blue cheese, but it meshed well with the other ingredients. The only slight negative was that the burger really needed the red wine sauce on the burger, otherwise it tasted like it lacked a little seasoning. The fries that automatically came with the burger were decent, with a nice crisp outer layer.  Maybe if I strike it big in Vegas one of these days, I'll splurge on that $60 gilded lily of a burger, but for now I'll go for the other signature burgers!

xe3jfK-LS5DS5JPIYc6r9w.text: Stopped in for a small snack and a drink. Ordered a drink called "Adios %@&%!# Tea", which is a very fair name. Tasted good, one of those "there's no alcohol in here" drinks that 5 minutes later you realize there was.  Just wanted a small snack so ordered the mozzarella sticks off of " The Fry" menu. They were pretty good, i always look for fried cheese where you can tell they were house made. These are good enough to make me think maybe, but probably not. Good enough to order a second helping of the fairly priced appetizer.  The one negative was the button to change the channel on the TV in my booth didn't work, apparently a known issue as hostess informed me when i was seated. You can request a channel, which i did, but it never changed, so i was stuck watching a very old movie on "El Rey".    The service was strong to quite strong, server "Damian" was very attentive, i did not have to ask for anything.  Overall, a solid experience, no hesitation to return.

TLxp928VeEHsJ-V6ukPjAw.text: The burger was to the point it was good yet expensive but worth it depends on what you're getting on the menu. I had a bacon burger medium well and it was one of the greatest burger my mouth has ever tasted. And the milkshake was so ggggooooodddd. I will come back again

_x2Ozk2CUzOpgDmy94bXxg.text: Great place for lunch in the Mandalay Bay Shoppes.  10 of us were seated within 15 minutes on a busy Saturday afternoon.  Surprised to see more than one vegetarian option! Makes me happy!  I got the veggie burger, which was good, but a bit on the dry side. You can actually see the vegetables inside the patty and it broke apart a few times which to me is a good thing, because it tasted and looked like it wasn't a frozen patty. I would ask for sauce with it because it was quiet dry when I got it. The whole wheat bun was just okay, I would try another option next time around.  The skinny and fat fries were good. They weren't too oily and I loved the presentation. The Nutella Shake - delicious! Yum! Cute glass it comes in!  Service was pretty good, and I liked the vibe in the restaurant.

FH2Kj7xKshl9p3Dru2TSGg.text: Burger bar with so many choices...  I've been here several times & remember my food choices to be favorable but on the most recent visit it wasn't. I chose the burger bar sliders which gives you a little variety and who doesn't love that?!?!? My burgers were dry and so were the buns :(  Couldn't we hit them with some butter?   When you come to a place like this & pay more for a strip location & a well known chef your expectations are high. Mine are because Keller is a master. I absolutely love his show on PBS & watch it every weekend! Not only does his food look amazing but he's such a fun & interesting person to watch. The French accent also works :)  So my burgers kind of sucked. My skinny fries were good. Luckily the ladies in my group seemed to enjoy their burgers & I should have just ordered a burger. But the sliders should be great and honestly they don't deserve 3 stars but I'm giving it because my prior experiences were good and I'm hopeful someone in the kitchen will taste them & improve on them.   With that said, there's a reason why Keller is where he is and has so many great spots and I'm not taking anything away from him. Maybe I had an off night, not sure. The service was great. They were packed. Overall a fun time for everyone in the party except my sliders.

Z-SP8jFNtR66T_hSCaH4FA.text: This is a real gourmet style place, you can dress up your burger how you want with what kind of meat you want too. Some options are lamb, Kobe, angus for example that is cooked to the temp that you prefer. It can be down basic to super fancy while tasting amazing!  I got a pretty basic one, angus with lettuce, tomato, onion and American cheese with pretzel bun. I was very happy with their quilts of meat, not just some random fast food patty but one you would expect in a nice place like this. The pretzel bun was amazing, can't go wrong with getting that for your bun.  The burgers are done right here!

fHZhSe1LbJIVKqgpUthmoQ.text: I hate giving bad reviews but I had to based on the incredibly rude waitress. We were sat right away and our waitress came over to take our drink order  (I think her name was Michele or st least that's what our receipt says). I don't drink and ordered a non alcoholic drink, and right of the back she gave me attitude for not ordering alcohol. She just walked off in the middle of us ordering. Then more attitude because I wanted to substitute the cheese in my food. She never checked in on us, had to ask the bus boy for drinks. The restaurant was empty so there was no excuse for her being such a crappy waitress.  The food was good and prices were average for the area (high). But skip this place, the crappy waitress just ruins the food for you anyways.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

39jdIw1H48nNgk1jG_bS5g.text: There was a long wait when I showed up on a Friday evening, but I managed to find a spot at the bar no problem.  It's expensive here, but what isn't in Vegas?  I think it was $7 or $8 for a beer and a relatively basic burger and fries ran close to $20.  But it's a really good burger.  Cooked to order and done exactly as you ask, the meat, bun, and cheese come out picture perfect.  Their fries are really good as well.  Service is ok and I was impressed to see every booth had their own TVs.  If only I had saved some room for dessert, because everyone else's milkshakes looked pretty good.

_CaY_c4OCSkB2437OV3Agw.text: Great spot to hangout and have a couple drinks, shakes, and food while in the Shoppes at Mandalay.   First of all, it's a little bit of a walking distance from the Mandalay Bay parking lot, but no more than 10 minutes to get there. Upon entering, it's darkly lit and has a trendy feel to it. All of the booths have a tv screen and our particular booth in the back had a plug for you to charge your items (be careful...it was on the side of the wall, so I feared my long hair would get caught on it). Good addition, bad place to put it. However, The booths can be very roomy- we sat 6 of us!   Overall reaction: service was good, but as soon as it got busy, it was harder for servers to make their way around the tables because of overcrowding.  Burgers were okay (I had the sliders, and my brother had the hangover burger). Not bad, but not amazing in terms of taste. However, there are some burgers on the menu that have a much higher price range, and if I could afford it that night, I'm sure those burgers would've been amazing!   **One thing I did love were their shakes! We had the Salted Caramel Shake & the Irish coffee shake(yes, with alcohol) , and both were delicious and came out with beautiful presentation. If you'd like to add more toppings/mix-ins you can do that, too! There's a whole list on the menu for you to pick from. Try it out! :)

8ockUX4Y_lOnKPrjLEdQNQ.text: Service is good and food is decent. They have a buffalo burger available which I love. Remember you should always order buffalo one step down from your normal wellness you like on a beef burger because it is very lean. I went the make your own burger route and it was quite tasty. Onion rings were decent also.

bvKcG0FXjTIbVKagtQozXQ.text: He buffalo burger here is about the best you will ever find.  But if you can afford it, they have one that's even better- the Rossini is a Kobe style wagyu beef burger with shaved truffles and fois gras.  I got mine as a lettuce wrap with no bun.  They should make you wear a tuxedo to eat something this decadent.  You'll never look at a burger the same ever again!

Wait staff and bartenders were beyond helpful and knowledgeable.  They introduced me to a beer I haven't tried before based on what I was looking for.  I have to say they hit the nail on the head.  Nice place, clean, friendly, and very convenient to Mandalay Bay.

Been here a few times and most recently had the Rossini and switched out the Skinny Fries for the Fat Fries, my date had The Greek and we shared one of the awesome classic shakes - absolutely mind-blowingly delicious!  It was the only place open for a late-night bite after we saw Michael Jackson's One.  Vegas/Celebrity Chef prices but worth the splurge both calorie and $$-wize.

67Sw0AAxNozXsF4BtpxzMg.text: Went there with friends from out or town and we had a pleasant meal. We all ordered burgers which were pretty good and had original flavors. The skinny fries are amazing and they give you plenty of them with your order. The service was just a little slow in the beginning when we ordered our drinks (non-alcoholic) but our Server was very friendly and knowledgeable. Great atmosphere and a nice relaxed vibe makes this a place that I definitely will come back and visit again!

R8pb37npSlKwO8K8thlH-g.text: Pretty solid burgers.  You have the choice to get standard ground beef, bison or Kobe beef.  The Kobe beef is pretty tasty.  We ate at the bar because there was no room in the restaurant.  Very good ingredients on the burgers.  I went with brie cheese which was a mistake.  Otherwise was very pleased with everything.

_i8F1fXLgDs0pfVaT77YDQ.text: This place is worth a try if you're in the mood for a burger and fries. The sliders were perfectly cooked and were more filling than I expected. You can't go wrong with the fry trio either, the zucchini fries were the star of the show but the onion petals and fat fries are worthy in their own right. This place does an excellent job at what they do and I'd come back if I was in the area and wanted more burger and fries.
