FxJk4O-APikvb2j4o0JNuw.text: This is located in mall between Mandalay Bay and the Luxor. Had lunch here today and built my own burger. Protein started at $12. Then my pretzel bun was $2 and the cheese was $1.25 which I had two different kinds. Finally the bacon was $1.80. I'm thinking $18 is high for a small burger. It was tough to locate under the big bun. Food tasted good and staff was friendly so that pushed it to four stars.

8srjk0xSP3kl9fCB9NvE2w.text: Been here a few times over the years, decided to return. Sat for 10 minutes before we were greeted. The place was not that busy. Once greeted, our server was ok.  After ordering, the food took about 30 minutes.  Food was pretty much worth the wait. Wife had a salad - she loved it, everyone else had burgers that were excellent. Temps as requested. Had the staff been more communicative this was 5 stars.   Not a quick burger, but excellent.

CXCNT914z7xsOlbvvTOv3w.text: Its Sat. Night, avg. Busy night at 8pm. Had a drink while waiting for our burgers. About 845 our waitress comes and says they lost the food ticket order. WTF. So a quick reorder and it's off again......858pm food shows up. Now I'm not as hungry.  Burger was pretty good, fries were hot and the hangover sauce was tasty. Now, the Chocolate Chip shake was delicious. (Alcohol included)  Funny thought, our waitress was having plenty of laughter while waiting on tables, probably how the ticket was lost.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate chip shake

HhzW89-4Hhxe39McTide6Q.text: Yea it's nothing special. Heard that it used to be better.  Not many people inside and yet the wait to get the food was long. Got the three beef sliders. Too dry and small piece of meat. Too much bread. You expect better burgers at a burger place. I rather go to In n Out.   It actually doesn't make sense to get burgers in Vegas anymore as there are too many other good places to go to.

nJqFEkDCKFQKeMueHhl_yw.text: I came here a couple of years ago and wanted to give it another chance.  I read some of the reviews and ended up ordering the Kobe burger with fat fries. Stayed with regular toppings, that was my first mistake.  I waited almost 30 minutes after ordering which was long since the place wasn't busy at 3pm.   The burger was tasteless for a Kobe one and the temperature was almost room temperature.  The fries were hot and okay.  I was disappointed and won't come back.

GpXR4Wk2gwm1gupoZ9pyNw.text: My family all enjoyed their meals. The food was top quality and soooooo delicious. The service was absolutely great. Speedy and friendly. The location is clean and organized. The beer selection is great. We had a great time here and I would recommend this location to anyone

ahK7A9aEHpRfOlgxGs8lkw.text: Wife and I dropped in on a Sunday -- they were pretty busy so we sat at the bar instead of waiting for a table. That was fine. Then we ordered the problem here is for most part the burgers are ala carte. Which means it can get pricey. For example if you order a Bison burger that would cost $16, if you wanted cheese, bacon and mushrooms that would cost you another $4 or so then if you want fries or onion rings it adds another $3.25 to $4.50. You can see how this adds up in a hurry. Now I haven coming to Las Vegas for more than 30 years and the food options at the properties has gotten way better but along with that (big shock) way more expensive.  The wife and I got two turkey burgers shared a side of onion rings had two Budweisers and the bill totaled high $40s with tip it was high $50s.  The wife thought the turkey burger was pretty flavorless and close to tough which as she said for what we were paying she expected more in the way of a solid dinner.  We have eaten at Burger Bar several times in the past and thought  it was better but several years ago they took the Greek salad off the menu. The Greek salad was really good. And the Bison burger which I have had several times in the past was good then -- I can't imagine the quality has dropped.  The atmosphere was good there were plenty of TVs which meant we could sit statue bar and watch the Falcons Sunday night game.   The service was decent as always.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

u6GMpd7cgtNYPjxTWpEs4A.text: Ahh the choices they give you! I have to say I have been here numerous times as it is a good place for a consistent burger. The different bacons are my favorite thing, the foie burger is really too rich but good. The turkey burger is great just make sure if you get the waygu burger you get mid rare I have had a few over cooked burgers I unfortunately have sent back. The bar is a good place to sit also the fries with different dipping sauces are wonderful.

Vt-nr-XwtzsGpf0a9zwLdg.text: No........ you're not drunk!! It really IS the best burger in Las Vegas!! I always go with Kobe Beef burger and strong dirty martini. Can you really go wrong? Did I mention the DESSERT BURGER?! My taste buds are leaping for joy as we speak!!   Make reservations or leave extra time to stand in a long line.

NxCIclZzUW2x6hPP0DBXKA.text: The night we went it was PACKED and there was a 1 hr wait for a table so we had take out instead, and that only took 20 minutes.  The burgers faired pretty well as take out but there were a couple of hiccups.  Once back in our hotel room, we found that they only gave us 2 of the 3 burgers we ordered and 1 of the burgers had extra toppings, all the toppings of the burger that was missed.  Thankfully, the burgers were pretty big and we ordered 3 sides so there was enough to share.  We had the American Classic with a fried egg and a buffalo burger with caramelized onions, mushrooms and cheese/bacon/fried egg.  One of the two fried eggs popped on the way back to the hotel but it was still pretty good.  The buffalo burger was very juicy and perfectly medium rare, even though it was 25 minutes before it was eaten.  The sweet potato fries were ok as were the regular fries.  The mozzarella sticks were not great but that's because they were take out, if they were eaten right away at the restaurant, they may have been better.  The best part of this meal was that when we called the restaurant to let them know they left a burger off, the guy immediately accommodating and  said the meal would be comped for the mix up.  Pretty good customer service!  That's Vegas for ya!

ofE72fG1i-WNKj04A_LHNQ.text: This bar is short of another star because of the service. It took a while to get seated, maybe because there was 10 of us. When we got seated, it took a pretty long time for the server to take our orders. My friend and I joked that they are going to get 18% gratuity anyways, hence the crappy service.  Otherwise, the food was great. My friend and I decided to split our meal because we had buffet earlier plus it was already late at night. We ordered the chicken hawai'ian burger; we told the server we were splitting. So when our order arrived, we had separate plates each with our own half of the burger with almost a plate full of the sweet potato fries. So as far as the burger, my friend and I didn't expect it to be really tasty. I was surprised that chicken would taste really good with the sweet sauce that comes with any hawai'ian burger. The sweet potato fries was bomb! I couldn't stop eating them... I was glad my friend and I split the meal because we had the same amount of fries that folks ordered individually.

tX5YzCzaT2suXeHD_Tcv-g.text: How the flying frickity frackity does this place have 4 stars on over 500 reviews?   This place was crap.  We waited over a half hour to get in here and I ate a burger for the first time in over 2 years and I was very very much reminded why I gave up such things.   I figured if I was going to eat a burger after all that time I was going to eat one in a restaurant by the darling Hubert Keller.  After such a memorable Fleur dy Lys experience, we figured we certainly couldn't have a bad burger joint experience.... but we did.  The cheese is placed on the burger far too early on the grill, therefore it all melts and slides off, by the time it gets out to the table there's pretty much no cheese.  My bun was soooooo soggy on the bottom that I almost gagged.  The raw onions, flimsy and flavorless, the tomato orange and unripe.   What a disappointment.  My husband was equally disappointed with his fancy burger.    There was nothing that could have gained this place a 2nd star.  Service was shit, even the soda was flat and syrupy.  I'm seriously trying to figure out how our experience was so 1 star compared to all these 3, 4 and 5 star reviews?   What are you all comparing these burgers to?

LoLKMKAxmwBGogF1225ptw.text: I had the Hubert Keller burger and the buffalo was surprisingly good.  I wasn't expecting it to be as juicy and flavorful.  My only complaint was that the caramelized onions and blue cheese overwhelmed the burger.  Others at my table had the Kobe beef burger or the Black Angus burger which were good, but not out of this world.    I would definitely come back to try the buffalo burger again, but would probably opt to build my own and take the less is more philosophy.

e5FhTBCrc_V3OPGfji4iEA.text: There lay in Mandalay Bay a burger bar...(1/24)  So average, you will wonder why the hype. Amongst the cheering and yelling of the Colts and Jets fans, we (the burger bureau) took a seat at the bar to indulge in the "finest" burger in town.   The menu shows a lot of promise replete with choices of signature and build-your-own burgers. They suit all spenders ($14.00-$60.00 +). Plenty of liquids are also available to wash down your desired selections.   I put in my order for the American Classic--sans cheese, picked up a side of Zucchini fries and elected for a mug root beer.   The Burger Breakdown: The American Classic shared the white oval plate with the Zucchini fries, a pickle and the fixings on the side. The fixings: a slice of raw onion, green-leaf lettuce and a slice of tomato. The burger was cooked to a perfect medium--yet desiccated. This was the first time I have encountered this anomaly. I was disappointed with the lack of jus (fats and oil that were missing). I reached for the root beer after every bite. Yikes. The zucchini fries were well seasoned and made up for this average burger. The burger was fair sized but only fair-flavored.  The presentation was lack-luster and the meal could be described in one word: LACKING. In an otherwise unforgettable trip to Las Vegas, I cannot wait to let this burger slip from my mind. While the selection was plentiful, the choices fell flat across this Burger Bar.

Fwixr-B52Qy71-o6fp9fXg.text: Let's get to good stuff right away  +Nutella Milkshake - absolutely delicious.  +Built my own Kobe Burger w/ Bacon, Avocado, and Chipotle Sauce on the side.  - Regular fries and Sweet Poato fries were not good. I wish they were better, because it would have made the entire meal perfect.  - Service was standard and the wait time for 2 people on a Saturday afternoon approx 15-20 minutes.

6iBO9TiZsS1JVRkNN-mUjg.text: Hands down my favorite burger place it it does come with a price. The Kobe beef medium rare is my FAVORITE!!!!!! they have sweet potatoes fries and skinny fries too!!! They also have great zucchini fries. The service is always good even if you sit at the bar but it can get pretty packed so make sure you go before 7pm and you can usually get a booth right away but durning rush it can be like an hour or more wait AND YOU CAN'T MAKE RESERVATIONS.....so annoying especially if its an hour or more wait!

B_MQ9llZdcNxLNJ4BxJIXw.text: The rating is based upon last 3 visits. Service has always been great, burgers are awesome, however, utterly unimpressed with ridiculously over breaded onion rings, and lackluster zucchini sticks on most recent visit. Stay with burgers and sweet potatoe fries and all is right with the world.

ob5BOinsMJC149MR5f3pWA.text: So after years of hearing that we need to try Burger Bar, my husband and I finally decided to take the plunge.  Burger Bar is located in Mandalay Place, which is the shopping area between Mandalay Bay and The Luxor.  There are lots of restaurants around this area and valet is a breeze at Mandalay Place.  Husband and I got right in and had a seat in the booth.  They have a HUGE beer selection (which had the husbands attention immediately!)  But we decided just to do burgers and fries.  I had a Kobe beef burger, on an onion bun, with a fried egg, mayo, lettuce, tomato and onion.  I had sweet potato fries with this.  I ordered the burger cooked medium and I'm glad I did!  If would have ordered it medium-rare, I think the burger would have come out moo-ing at me!!  (mind you- i'm all about medium-rare on a good steak!)  The husband had the American Classic with sweet potato fries.  We both agreed that we would have rather went to Red Robin or Stripburger over Burger Bar.  For one, you would think the Kobe beef would have great flavor.  Not even.  It was OK at best.  Husband said that he thought it was "pretentious to charge that much for a burger that tasted like that."  After both our burgers and fries (we had water to drink) and after tip, we walked out paying $45.00.  Definitely a cool place, and I'm glad I tried it, so I know that I don't ever have to go back.  Definitely disappointed!

Bld7M_kTc6JsuIOnvrDI2g.text: This place is horrible! We ordered two burgers and waited 45 mins for it to arrive. The place wasn't even busy. To make matters worse, I got sick from their food. The waitress only offered some sparkling water and when I told her that something was wrong with the food she just said oh sorry you don't feel well and brought me the check. We didn't even eat the other burger. I was sick the whole night. I called the manager the next day and they refused to believe me since I paid cash althought I told them exactly what I ate and what time I was there. She said she has the check the tape and when she did she lied and said it only took 18 mins for burger to get to us. Not True !!! They offered free burgers and I would never eat there again. She was so rude on the phone. Horrible experience expensive burger so not worth it !! Go to bachi burger. Much better service and delicious burgers.

75u59pgzddlb6Js142R4SA.text: Burger Bar is a loud, crowded, but deliciously wonderful place. The burgers are perfectly cooked to your liking. I ordered mine medium and it was perfectly pink all the way through. I did the customize your own burger. I opted for the Kobe Beef burger with grilled onions, cheddar, avocado slices, and skinny fries. Perfect and delicious, loved the skinny fries nice and salty hot and crunchy. The milkshakes look fantastic but i was so full there was no way I could fit more in.   Definitely would go again!!  Only complaint they said 15-20min wait but it was more like 30-40. Very popular spot.

9oAjjM88jiZnB-BQlctleg.text: Good burgers, good quality ingredients, slightly expensive in some cases I think.  Their milkshakes are the bomb though, wicked awesome.  My main problem is that I can find a burger just as good elsewhere for way cheaper.  Ergo only 3 stars.

WEKnzIVvJ1UgIMllUIlLaQ.text: Located in the Mandalay Bay mall area, this place is a nice place that was very popular. I had the basic bacon cheese medium rare.  The meat was perfectly cooked.  A good char on the outside with nice a pink in the middle.  Not as juicy as I would have liked, so the Angus meat is lean.  The bun was a regular sesame bun. I was hoping for a brioche at that price.  It wasn't as good as a Bachi Burger.  My friend that the surf and turf.  The hardest part is putting the burger back on the plate.  It's too big and just falls apart.  Sometimes, bigger isn't better.  I don't think I would come back based on the price of the food.  It's good to try once.

G_EnCu-d0tvdikba4o3A0A.text: Not a bad place.  Food was good.  Burgers were a little bit pricey for ok for a place off of the strip...

VYoe2L0atwZGXN-sNFYUJw.text: It's all about the Kobe Burger!!!  You won't want another angus beef burger again!!!! The kobe beef is way more tender than angus beef. My friend got the angus beef and you can totally tell the difference.  I topped my burger with grilled onions, pepper jack cheese and mushrooms. I love this place. It's a little wait but it's totally worth it. Loved the Nutella shake too. =)

LlSVhwxJkm9daCHQrNmi_w.text: We always have to eat here when coming to Vegas.  Great Kobe beef cheese burger!!  If you wanna splurge on an extremely flavorful burger...BUY IT!  Don't put anything on it but cheese (Definitely No Ketchup) so you can taste the True flavor of it.  Their ice cream sundae are also very good with many different toppings.  Good eats peeps!!!

BZ5a2o7yoihmnH-IgeQTSw.text: I've been here a few times and the servers have always been friendly and attentive.   The burgers are decent, a bit pricey, but then it's Vegas.  I do like how many beers they have on tap and they even have the lambics on tap.  The onion rings are quite delicious as well, but that can also be because it was just the right thing to soak up the alcohol.

6euKOih7ETiwc6vmgVXKfQ.text: Burger Bar expected more, but got less...   My friend and I split two burgers so that we could taste a little of each.   Customized Buffalo Burger w/Pepper Jack Cheese, Jalapeno Bacon, chipotle aoli on a wheat bun and a side of fried pickles encrusted with jalapenos.   +Jalapeno bacon was awesome.. very tasty now if i only could find some in LA   Chef Burger - Blackjack Burger - (Black Angus, monterey jack, tapanade, tomato, lettuce on a ciabatta bun)   This burger was alright... here's my problem though, when it comes to burgers I believe that the toppings should compliment the flavors of the hamburger not be where the majority of the flavor comes from. The burger wasn't seasoned well or the flavor of the beef just wasnt there.  In the future, if i were here to go again, first I would not go unless there was no wait because they do not take reservations. Secondly, I'm fine with paying $35 for a burger and what not BUT it better be worth my money which it wasn't. Thirdly, maybe this is why I like to adventure off the strip and not eat over hyped food.

J1ofN84LBtR0a90O0_5oHw.text: Food?  Good.  I was definitely a fan of their Sweet Potato fries with my burger.    Ahh the service.  I would like to just say that after this experience I sent an email from their website to the location letting them know about our bad experience, and no one ever contacted me.  Hmmm...what does that say about their commitment to their guests?   So I arrive at burger bar with my two sisters and a mutual friend in tow.  We approach the hostess stand and let them know we are a party of four.  So the host grabs the menus, walks us to a table, sets the menus down, and promptly walks away.  Doesn't say a single word to us during the entire interaction.  Not "Your serve will be right with you", not "Right this way guys" Nothing.  Just dead silence.  Awkward.  So our dude of a waiter comes up and takes our order, our food comes out, and the guy comes back to check on us once.  Everything came out perfectly we tell him.  So as the meal continues, our drinks get empty.  We kind of all glance around, but no one has seen our waiter walk by in at least 15 minutes.  So finally another server walks by, his name tag read Damien, and he glanced over saw our drinks were empty, and brought over a pitcher of water.  So another 10 -15 minutes goes by...still have never seen our unnamed server...our meals are well beyond finished, and Damien walks by again.   "Has your server checked on you"  "No"  So he says he'll be right back, and comes back with our checks.  So we pay, and I don't think too much about it until as we are leaving, my sister and I look back and Damien is cleaning our table.  She walks over and politely asked him if he was getting our tip or the dude who took our order.  He informed her that when he went back to check on the server and find out why he hasn't been attending to his table that the guy had left for the night and hadn't reassigned our table to anyone.  So..thanks Damien for your server and F-U dude who deserted out table.

1x0P2JdIhPfg1PnqFfBPTA.text: I'v scoured the earth looking for the best burger (and are continuing to do so).  As of the date of this writing, Burger Bar is in first place.  This place rocks, you can build your own burger or go with one from the menu.  If your cardiologist isn't satisfied with the bacon cheese burger (my favorite(, you can add delicious sweet potato fries, fried zucchini, or the traditional french fries.  Oh, and a Nutella shake basically seals the deal on the best place to nurse a Las Vegas hangover.

CCoh_FNfaPUiUNBkOBNySA.text: CHIMAY CHIMAY KO KO BOP  Not the best Kobe burger I've ever had, but you gotta love all the accoutrement including grilled onions, blue cheese, the ORGASMIC jalapeno bacon and Chimay on tap.

2ZSQOMrcl28H1Hhyo3pxig.text: Rossini for the win!  $60.  I will never forget it.  Nor will I ever order it again, because I think my memory would be spoiled if I ever re-tasted it.  Must remind everyone again that we were in Vegas, where money is thrown around like in Monopoly and the atmosphere can cloud your judgment sometimes.  All good.  I think I would've had non-buyer's remorse if I hadn't ordered it.    Went with a group of 10 around noon on Saturday.  Waited all of 5 minutes.  Seating was cozy with a table pushed up against a booth table.  Clean, polished wood, part sports bar, part diner atmosphere.  Had college football going on the tv in the booth and the waitress was cool enough to change it to a game one of the guys requested.  The menu was ka-razy.  You choose your patty and bun ($8-16), then pick from toppings separated into categories (from cheddar to guacamole to jalapeno bacon to shaved black truffles:  $1-30).  Then, you still have sides, dessert burgers, shakes, and an extensive beer menu to sift through.  I was overwhelmed.  I had to go with the package deal, the Rossini.  American kobe patty, onion bun, foie gras, shaved black truffles, madeira wine sauce, served with cracked black pepper, coarse sea salt, and a truffle oil sauce on the side.  The burger was like butter, juicy throughout without much spillage onto the plate.  The flavors in the burger were so rich, I had to really slow it down and thoughtfully taste.  Therefore, I was pretty much done two-thirds of the way through.  But that would've been $20 of burger left so I continued to chomp away.    The fries that accompanied didn't suck, but they weren't memorable.  Tasted some zucchini fries, those were pretty good as well.  Might have gotten tired of them if I had to eat a whole serving.  Your choice of dessert burger came with the Rossini (something I swear I didn't see on the menu) so that was pretty cool.  I chose the chocolate burger--sliced donut, chocolate ganache patty, strawberry slices, passionfruit-pineapple gelatin, and mint ($3.95).  Looked like a cheeseburger, so cool!  Tasted pretty good but grew tired of the ganache.  I thought the cheesecake dessert burger was better, cheesecake was light and almost fluffy.  My chocolate loving homegirl would beg to differ though.  So all in all, I was satisfied with my $60 purchase.  Burger, fries, and dessert.  Another friend loaded up his burger with toppings and it ended up being about $30.  Plus, I figured I'd hit the slots later and recuperate some funds.  Whaddaya know, won $100 on one of those flaming 7s dollar slots.  Sweet...

PbqiZCwcK4YYQZPRJN1Amg.text: During a trip to vegas for a friends 21st birthday we had lunch at Burger Bar and man is the food great here.   Its a little pricey for a burger place but cheap for a good vegas food.  I remember the sweet potato fries being amazing and constantly dream about going back to vegas just for the fries.      Anytime a friend tells me they are going to vegas, I tell them to stop here and they always tell me what a great suggestion after they return.

9Ja-cB4gmyHmg0RkNF4sHg.text: Ordered the $60 Rossini Burger RARE with sweet potato fries and a side of zucchini fries.  Shared with a friend, and it was not only filling but DEEELICIOUS. It came with a dessert burger which I ordered the cheescake burger and that was also delicious.  The Rossini Burger was a lot smaller than I expected but it was soo good.  The way to order the burger is rare.  Hands down.  Its the only way to enjoy the True flavor of the meat.  The burger came with this delicious sauce and truffle salt and freshly ground pepper.   Heres what you do. Add the tomato and the bean sprouts to the burger, sprinkle some truffle salt (aka CRACK) on the meat, pour some of that sauce, and take a heavenly bite.  Totally worth the money.  However since I'm not rich, I probably wouldn't order it again.  It was a great once in a lifetime experience and everyone should have in Vegas!  Burger bar is awesome.  Prices are fair for Vegas.  Service is great.  Beer selection is VERY VERY impressive.  Lots of great beers on tap.  I would definately make this part of my vegas routine whenever I'm in town!

FdUW3za2LV_0PvJGMtwwzQ.text: Suprisingly my parents are almost as big of Vegas buffs as I am, except I have the club knowledge while they have the restaurant knowledge. They took my boyfriend, brother and I to this place and I must say for me it was a "alright I'll go" type of thing. I'm  not really into restaurant burgers, I usually take something lighter.  Boy did this place give me a slap.   It's a build your own burger type of menu, everything from the meat (veggie included), to bread, condiments and everything in between. It was soooo good!!! I'm usually stop at halfway, but I ate the whole thing!!! I would suggest the thin fries over the thick, they taste much better that way.   Not only is the service great but they have individual mini TVs at each booth to entertain you!  All in all, I cannot wait to go back to this place :)

_bZ0D_pBzXTa0m-nYWJxrw.text: LOVED LOVED LOVED LOVED the burger.  Only issue was the incredible olive tapanade there was suppose to be on it, was only on the center of the burger.  Which i am sure was probably not intended.  But once I half way through and all the flavors bursted onto my pallette... MMMmmmm!  We ordered the signature "burger desserts".  BIG DISAPPOINTMENT? why? well, i am sure when Mr Keller came up with the menu and said "warm donut... blah blah", he meant a "warm donut".  I got an ice cold donut with non melted "chocolate ganache".... I sent it back. And it looked as if they put the top of the donut burger in the microwave. So i went to pick up the whole thing again, and the bottom was ICE COLD. needless to say, i was upset, and sent it back.   So, all the components are there, I am thinking there is one person in the kitchen (or more...) that is not up to par.  We will be back again, but hopefully the chef that day, will not.

sAnuK14wUoWUfrBWEKrVjg.text: Frankenstein's monster was made out of bits and pieces of unrelated human beings.  So if Frankenstein's monster was staying at Mandalay Bay, where would he eat?   The Burger Bar, where you can have a hamburger made out of seemingly unrelated ingredients.  Kobe beef, lamb, fois gras, lobster, black truffles and avocado are just scratching the surface of the mismatched concoctions that come alive at the Burger Bar.  This isn't a buffet table loaded with burger toppings, but made to order concoctions of your own design (though they do have some pre-designed burgers to choose from).  The creative genius doesn't end with the burgers though.  A selection of Beer Floats are available as well.  That's right - Beer Float.  Ice cream and Beer.  We're no longer serving Mary Shelley's Frankenstien and now serving Mel Brook's Young Frankenstein.  And that's not all bad.  When my wife pointed out the Beer Floats, she laughed.  Unflinching, I immediately ordered the Beer Float sampler.  5 different micro-brew style beers, with 5 different flavors of ice cream.  I have to admit, most of them tasted better than I thought they would, and my wife who mocked me for ordering them was also slurping them down (I don't ever need 5 scoops of ice cream).  While I cannot say that the Beer Floats are the best beverage I've ever had, I can say that it was offered.  The burger however, was one of the best burgers I've ever had (second only to Detroit's Miller's Bar).  The Burger Bar is a 3-star setting with 4-star prices and superior burger options.  Strap it to a table, expose to lightning, and you have a place that even a monster could love.

juwFrJ-8loqfYUSv64Zu9g.text: Burger bar was ok.  Was good, but for me, it didn't live up to its expectations.  It's not only rated so high on here, word of mouth has a pretty high standard as well...I liked the onion rings, although you can't really mess that up.  The milk shake was good as well.  But the burger which was the whole reason I went there just did not do it for me.

ZoJ5vdeGXNMvpPcMpigMFg.text: This place is located inside the Mandalay Hotel and we were staying at the Venetian and we decided to walk to burger bar not knowing how far it was. The walk was astronomicallllllyyyy far and I thought to myself that no burger was worth this s-word. And for a minute, I could of sworn the hotel was moving further and further away from us.   But we finally got there, and all of us ordered our food. I didn't know you can fry pickles which is super delicious btw. I had the black angus beef with bacon and grilled onions and it was amazing. From what I heard, it's the same as the Kobe Beef Burger for half the price. But  do you know what also was amazing? meeting Sam Worington from Avatar, thats what! He walked by our table and he was extremely humble and was nice enough to take a picture and signed some autograph.   sooo in retrospect, the walk was totally worth it!! =)

PqErDQJPghAC-_mcb-kxxg.text: I started with the deep fried jalapeno pickles.  Highly recommended.  If you have vinegar based pickles the only real way to eat them is deep fried.  After looking over the menu I didn't want the $60 kobe truffle burger.  Not going to spend that much before finding out if these guys know what they are doing.  I got the Hubert burger.  This is blue cheese and caramelized onion based burger on ciabatta.  I got onion rings on the side.  The onion rings are not bad but not better than say ... Carl's Jr.  I've had plenty of better ones.  I ended up eating only a couple.  The burger itself was great at first.  I was so happy to see they got medium rare right.  However as you keep on eating the caramelized onion really dominates too much and the last few bites get bad.  They say chefs care most about the first and last bites so this burger fails.    The service was great.  I don't think I'll be going back as this place just doesn't stand out.  Bill was $36 for lunch for one with no alcohol so it's steep for the quality.

yx03dCpdFg_zjFXSMrxWag.text: Since this was my first time, I kept it simple...Black Angus Burger with Bacon on a Sesame Bun. The meat was very juicy and tasty. We also had the skinny fries and the onion rings...both were great. I also had the strawberry beer, which was good. I will definitely eat here again!!  One word of advice, be sure to specify how much pink you want. We asked for 2 medium well burgers, but one came out more like medium and the other medium rare.

-Y2FDzSJ2PcQK4vzWbozhg.text: Yowza!  Who needs condiments when a burger is supremely juicy.  I'm super picky and I love the concept of adding whatever topping you want.  I had tomatoes, cheese, and spinach on mine.  Mmmmmmmmmmmmm.

eZ907zDIBY3ZNUwop-ncdg.text: Burger Bar, located in Mandalay Place, is a hamburger lover's dream! The restaurant's name says it all, as this place is literally a "burger bar" where you build your own burger. They do have some preselected options as well if you're indecisive, but I recommend building your own. Each burger comes with the standards (lettuce, tomato, onion, and a pickle). But this is the fun part!  Let's start with the meat (or non-meat) selections: angus beef, another beef I don't recall, American Kobe beef, turkey, salmon, and veggie. From there, it's off to bread. They had everything from plain to whole wheat and ciabatta. The best part, however, is all of the other fixings! From cheese (blue, mozzarella, cheddar, swiss, etc.) to other burger oddities like foie gras, they've got you covered. My burger was a turkey on plain bread with mozzarella and peppered bacon. As a side, I had the buttermilk onion rings, and they also offered fries and sweet potato fries. Check this place out!

UkE3q6hXoJPwFLUiigzKHw.text: YUM! I've been waiting to go here for the past THREE trips to vegas.  FINALLY I understand what the big deal was. The fries were SOOO good! We got the skinny, fat, and sweet potato fries. I was surprised how good the fries were. The burger didn't stand a chance. As soon as the server placed it on the table. I quickly suited my burger with the appropriate condiments. Smooshed the burger down as FAR as I could. Shoved the burger in my mouth and didn't speak again until it was all gone.  In the words of my friends "sometimes you just have to close your eyes to savor the goodness."

JDhaADzOz2-8-GYvJpkEdg.text: I'm giving this place four stars because my gf works here and I have to say, the burgers are decadent.   I had no idea where to start, so I asked my friend for a recommendation.  She suggested that I get the kobe beef pattie and then add on as many toppings as I like.  I think my eyes were definitely bigger than my stomach b/c when I got the burger, I almost passed out.  I couldn't finish the damn thing.  I chose mushrooms, cheese, spinach and jalapenos b/c I didn't think that lettuce, onions or tomatoes came with the burger.  Der, I know.    The sweet potato fries were crispy and perfectly cut - not too thick, not too thin.  My friend ordered the $ 66 burger, which I found to be too rich for me.  But I'm just a simple girl, so what do I know, right?  Foie gras and kobe beef was not the right combo for me.

lIiKGKTubvicrQ295-G-IA.text: Hands down....the best burger I have tasted in my life was here. I simply can't wait to go back!

2FbimnxBy5IaopujRiW7Sw.text: God... All I heard through out my whole meal was a drunk boyfriend with his mouth full saying "OH MY GOD THIS IS SO GOOD"..  Yeh.. it was good but not great.. I walked from Bills Gambling Hall to Mandalay Bay for the burger bar. I think the walk was not worth it. ANYWAYS, I got some type of burger not quite sure.. it was good... we sat at the bar because there was a 20 minute wait for a table. Our server/bartender had HUMONGOOOOOOO boobies that were really tan... too bad she was about 40 years old ):  yeh.. other than that. uhm.. not too impressed..

YBLQFQ0w579HlgHXoT2DuA.text: I swear, if my friends drag my ass to Vegas only to suggest eating at dumps like Denny's, Outback Steakhouse, or McDonald's, I will slap a b!tch!!  As expected, our wait took about 60 mins since my group size was 19 to begin with. They don't take RSVP's, you have to throw your name down on the wait list for first come, first serve.  I've been a fan of Hubert Keller's Fleur de Lys in San Franciso, but I was surprised to hear he also owned a burger joint in Vegas. I love the idea that you can build your own burger however way you like it.  There's 3 different types of beef you can choose to start with, $8-$16. Want cheese? Add $0.65. If you're a foie gras lover like I am, add $12. Black truffle sauce, add $5. I also ordered their sweet potato fries, they were pretty good - but I've had better at The Counter in San Jose's Santana Row. ;-)  Overall, this place is definitely worth a return visit for lunch and/or dinner. Grilled foie gras patty for $12? Hell Yeah!!

5lhSReGLGu5GHQtFWgLWuw.text: As far as High end burgers go....My Kobe Burger, medium rare with foie gras, spinach, mushrooms, made me happy. In effort to save cows, I refrained from eating red meat for a while until I was ready to take on the gusto. My burger was pretty expensive, the fries were...fries....Ok who agrees with me that in n out fries suck @ss? But this joint has great music, creative cocktails, and a laid back ambiance that I dig. Right across from this Tea place at Mandalay and next to the infamous Chocolate Swan. This burger is definitely the shiznit. Not your greasy spoon shiznit. Just somewhere where you can say "I just spent a hundred dollars on a hamburger!" Eat this Europe. The French didn't even invent french fries! But this place - Mmmm desert burger. Donut bun....chocolate heaven in the middle...yea. Novelty...maybe even gimmicks. But hey it's worth the experience :)

mVlXjsTSYL6cbaYyuqltDA.text: Unfortunately my friends didn't like this restaurant that much the last time I went to Las Vegas, but I thought it was great. You can "build" your own burger depending on the ingredients you want. I'm gonna have to dock a star because the one time I went there, our waitress was SO slow when it came time to place orders. Once the actual food came out though, it was worth it.

Qnw8_JOz89eYpTZIWeALMw.text: quality of their meat is great and it's cooked per your request. i ordered medium, i got medium. it can be a bit pricey with many of the add-ons being $0.65+ each (e.g., cheese, bacon, grilled onions, jalapenos, etc).  the problem is with their lack of seasoning. a little salt and pepper goes a long way. had our burgers been properly seasoned, i think this could've been really good, buuuut they weren't.

I-e78VFlDRqD4brcrXCDiw.text: ate here last wknd and was a bit unpleasantly surprised to find out that they changed their veggie burger to a pumpkin based patty full of brown rice and veggies. the burger was very large (think of a cow patty) resulting in it being squeezed out from the bun on all sides, as for flavor it was a bit on the bland and texture-less side. i would prefer the orig patty....hopefully they are just trying out a new recipe since it hasnt been updated on the menu?!

yeopplCRSU1Sax8wO89b7g.text: bf and i ate here when we went to vegas.  i was searching out burger places cause i am secretly competing with him to make the best burger (he thinks he makes an amazing burger).  i was never a big burger eater but i am eating as many burgers as possible now so i can perfect my recipe and since we were in vegas i couldn't pass hubert keller's burger bar up.  we arrived here and it looked super packed but we didn't care and sat at the bar.  pretty loud ambiance and was a little difficult to keep up a conversation.  extensive beer list but we had magic hats.  really good beer which i've had before.  so on to the food i mean i was kinda drunk by then and hungry so food should've tasted good so burger bar had a +1 already on my end.  i made my own burger with the bison meat and i forgot what my bf had.  the burger patty was pretty large, looked juicy, tasted good but like... not amazing.  it wasn't really memorable and it was pretty expensive which i expected but for being expensive i wanted something mind-blowing.  fries were ok.  i mean i guess if you just want a big normal burger then eat there but don't set your expectations too high.

TUNTPNaaFlLVS2pk9AH6hg.text: Yummy decadent burgers...this was the place for it.  I was only here once but it was a memorable visit.  We had lunch, sat in a comfy booth with our own personal tv and had the Kobe burger.  Delicious!!!  I also had the shrimp salad which was very good too.  Feeling like a burger, head over to Mandalay Bay and enjoy.

Mbn938kwGMjjL4225nm-Ow.text: One mean burger. Great quality and lots of options. cool atmosphere too. I loved the deep fried dill pickles.

XLRzq5TY-bGQK3QGG10UMQ.text: Awesome burgers and great brews. Try the Rochefort 6, a great Belgian beer that I'll be looking for in the future.

mLRhahlZwJyraRJWzY-4vw.text: Had the best burger ever here.  Ordered the angus beef burger with some jalapeno bacon.  Tried some turkey burger that was pretty damn good too.  Gosh, so tender, sloppy, and juicy.  Prices were reasonable unless you like to add tons of toppings.  Highly recommended.  Service was kinda slow but overall a great place for a fancy burger.

15EWnRpjnken6QxpbqMRcA.text: I had the awesome American Kobe Beef Burger with the fat fries! woooooo that was some crazy moments of awesomeness. Great flavor, well cooked, excellent service, great drinks. yay! i'm a fan.

E6Gs7C6xH90tDSNcAK1FOg.text: What a great hole in the wall at Mandalay bay! Fantastic top notch selection in beers, great hamburgers to fight the drinking and hangover battle(s).  What a nifty little hidden gem!  AMAZING beer selection, it's gotta be the best in VEGAS!  Cute workers there, this place is all good.  It's the only place in MBAY I'd recommend eating at!! HIT IT UP beer and hamburger connoisseurs!   I'd recommend putting some avocado (aguacate) on your burger yo!!

TP7PNICDpdkdrjlzuV4yng.text: If you start a burger with good beef- it is bound to be good.  A veggie burger on the other hand is not so easy- and this place hits it out of the park.  The flavor is mild so I recommend kicking it up with some of the yummy add on's.  I added spinach, caramelized onions- it was the best ever.  We showed up just at noon- and sat at the bar.  The service was quick and the food was perfect.  My partner got the $60 kobe, fois, truffle burger and she said it was cooked to perfection.  I tried the sweet potato fries and they were nice for a change.  This not for the person on a diet.  It is worth a wait- or try for the bar.  Believe the hype with this place.  I take off one star because the donut dessert was disappointing.

aEbC9m5SZC09gfNR2UYWxQ.text: Not much that I can add that hasn't already been said.  I visit LV 5 or 6 times per year (business) and I always make sure to come here.  Because I dine by myself a lot, this is the perfect place to come and sit at the bar, have a burger and a beer.  Their beer on tap selection is great as well!

45B3Xqz7tvARRgdt4mvGVg.text: I am in love with the sweet potato fries!  I ordered the slider which came with 3 different mini burgers (one of them is the buffalo burger).  The portions were just right for me and I got to try three of the special burgers.  The buffalo stood out the most, not only because it was buffalo meat, but it was the juiciest of the three.  The food is pricey but it's worth trying.

OwypdB1Rj7TDvEqgmwuokQ.text: I was in Vegas several years ago and remember having an awesome bacon cheeseburger here. I am in Vegas again on business, and have since given up meat to get healthier/lose weight. Well, Burger Bar has 2 burger options (one vegan, one vegetarian). I ended up getting the vegetarian burger, and it was awesome. Service was really prompt without being too in your face or talkative. I wouldn't have minded a little friendly chit chat, but he at least kept my drink refilled and was friendly enough. I would definitely eat there again.

I2Yex420lgSI4iMk7othwA.text: I have to say that the burgers here are good, but you would expect them to be damn good for how much you pay for a burger.  We tried both the kobe burger and angus burger and both were extremely good and tasty.  Fries there are not special, in fact McDonalds fries are better.  I dinged them the most on service.  The waitstaff was very very slow and really did not seem to make an effort to get our food to us in a timely fashion.  I woudl recommend this place to anyone who is in the area and craves a great burger, but frankly, if you had foie gras and kobe beef at home, I dont see why you wouldnt be able to make an equally good burger on ur own.

uXdQ_5LBlfFdeHic5egM1w.text: Killer Burger!!  What can you say about Keller? He really knows how to create a burger! I ate the Surf & Turf Burger. Its Black Angus, grilled half lobster, grilled green asparagus on plain bun. I paired my meal with Lost Coast Tangerine Wheat beer.  Good times!

SdYY_BTv8WPGX-UEVVlb_w.text: Take my review with a grain of salt.  I went to this place because it was voted one of the best burgers in Vegas.  They have a LOT of burger options, so if you are looking for something different, this is probably the place to go.  I got the cheapest burger on the menu - which was still like 15 bucks.  The burger was thick and juicy but not great.  I honestly would have been just as satisfied with a Red Robin burger (now you know where I'm coming from).  The next step up is a 22 dollar burger, which to me is an obscene amount of money for a burger.  The service was good, but the dining was very cramped - which was probably the biggest surprise about this place.  The coolest part about my visit was that we got to see Hubert Keller.  If not for that, I'd probably give it 2.5 stars.  If you want a rare and expensive burger and a chance to see a famous chef, go here.  If you are just hungry for a burger and don't really care, go to a cheaper place that you know you'll like.

yQkjNhmgajvbIeDeisI3nw.text: The burgers here are oh so yummy! I wish they had something like this in Chicago. The one thing that they need to seriously improve on is their waiters. Our waiter was so terrible. He wasn't helpful at all and he didn't stop to check on us at all. We waited forever for the check. So back to the food being yummy. Fries were good and I loved that we were able to customize our burgers. I had the veggie burger which looked weird but it was so good. The others had the buffalo burger and kobe beef. We were all so happy with our choices. I liked the atmoshpere of this place. We didn't have to wait for our table so that was a big plus.

KT-ReMmMbHlTDxPsGV6IaQ.text: i loved it! there beer selection was very large and had different type of burgers. mine was on point and will def. re visit if im back in vegas!! waiter was a little slow but because we were in a large group we didnt even notice it!!!!

silDHKIQ4J2ImSd3wZWvXg.text: $20 for a burger???!!!  Well...after trying one I call it a bargain...melt in your mouth Kobe beef.  My boy did the grand pooba $65 burger with Kobe, Froie, and shaved truffles...worth every penny I was told.  Cool bar, and well...you guessed it...PHENOMENAL BURGERS!!!

4h0kTDmlIgIZoK1ixGcn4w.text: For what it is, a "burger joint" they do a pretty good job.  If you've read my other reviews, you know that I don't eat red meat, but my boyfriend considers himself an aficionado of sorts.  He makes an incredible burger (that even I will eat).    Anyway, back to Burger Bar.  There are several options:  beef, kobe beef, buffalo, turkey, or veggie.  Then you choose the bun, then the toppings, and then you pay an additional fee for thin fries, fat fries, sweet potato fries, onion rings, zucchini sticks.  I went veggie burger.  For toppings, I went with avocado, colby jack, grilled onions, and oyster mushrooms.  To make up for the fact that a veggie burger costs about $2.00, they had two thick patties stacked on there.  It was actually really good.  I was impressed.  I had onion rings on the side, which were good as well, although, I think they were frozen...no big deal, this isn't a gourmet meal.  Brian, my boyfriend had the Kobe beef burger, with a fried egg and swiss cheese.  He said it was the best burger he's had in a restaurant.  He loved the burger and the thin fries.    Overall a great burger, either veggie or Kobe beef.

E_eKkpzwBj9oN0R-X-TIZw.text: Yum.... is all I can say.  We tried the Kobe burger and the sirloin burger.  Both included something different, from bacon to avacado, to mushrooms and onions.  Very good, and worth the wait.       Have you eaten at the Counter?  I find it to be simular.  Expensive, not your everyday burger thats for sure.  $16- $20 depending on what you want on it.  Taste sweet potato fries and zuchinni fries. I recommend to share if you aren't a big eater!

4UHt5dPPZGNF2zg6GxCUHg.text: My all-time favorite place to eat anywhere. I have no complaints. Let's see:  - Best burgers I've ever had. Spring for the American Kobe beef patty, it's so very worth it. Everywhere else I order burgers medium-well or well-done, but this one is deserving of a medium or medium-rare. Delicious. - Best beer list I've seen in a while. All sorts of good things to try and tons on tap. I think the tap is like 6-8 feet long. - Sports on TV, including personal TVs in the booths. - Awesome toppings for the burgers and the fried stuff is so damn tasty. - Nice servers and friendly bartenders. Sometimes the host stand staff can seem a little "inexperienced" but that doesn't detract from the dining experience.  Just so freakin' good. I can't say enough about this place. I've dragged people all the way down from the Las Vegas Hilton just to have dinner here. Yummy yummy yummy!

6tB6cVUTg7EfXP9mq5jeHA.text: Yet another thing still melting on my ass.  But it was worth it.  The Kobe beef burger is the best burger I ever had. The sweet chocolate burger is the best burger I ever had. The last burger I will ever have will be at the the Burger Bar.  I could be weighing 400 pounds and it'd still be worth it. I could be weighing 500 pounds and it would still be worth it. I could be weighing 600 pounds and it may still be worth it.  Great beer selection and very decent pricing too. And the chef is French, bien sur.

zafl_Gk2_TwH_zROKQTZPA.text: I had the pleasure of eating at this establishment twice in one week while traveling for a conference.   First of all the atmosphere was nice and un-pretentious its not a very big establishment but both times I went right around rush hour it was busy but still room was found for me (both a table and the bar) the staff were friendly and I had great service  I built my own burger both times sticking with the more reasonable angus beef both times  The food was great the sides were nice and hot and good portions that never left me wanting more. The burgers obviously hand made were almost the perfect thickness big enough to make them nice and moist holding in the juices but thin enough to allow the sides room to act on their own  The beer and drink choices were great with many varieties of taps and a full bar  The two things that keep this from being a 5 star is some rather large variability on burger doneness  (one was perfect the other borderline underdone both ordered at the same medium) as well as being a bit pricy for what you get   Overall if I am back in mandalay bay ever I will easily visit this place again

0Ov40DivG-HcQ9C1TRNHEg.text: A must go anytime in vegas. Gourmet burgers and huge selection for making your own. I have heard the service isn't as good the last few years but my experiences have been the best every time. Girls don't like slutty girls, we judge, it just happens. And all the girls working there purposely have extremely low pants, stomach showing low cut black tanks with lots of make up and so my initial thought was....figures, vegas. BUT, all the girls have fantastic customer service and do a great job, so i figure go on with your hot selves. But it's the burgers and milkshakes that keep me coming back. There is one that opened up in SF but the vegas one is still better!

dJEFGALFK89r4e7zq3xvDg.text: make sure you get THIS.  rossini burger - sure it's $60 but you're in vegas!!! i know you're throwing $100 bills on the blackjack table like it's nothing. just splurge....because it's the greatest burger of all time.  foie gras, truffles, and kobe beef? GAME OVER.  and you know what else is game over? when you lose at pac man. hahaha worst joke of all time.

S1mn2N-dWn8tY_QCXIUlRg.text: I would give 5 instead of 4 but the service always sucks, however the burgers are amazing!

4IjeqL7BrjRID6dSghTtEQ.text: Try the beer float paddle. Needs chipotle aoli for the sweet potato fries,

YVgoN-NmmPj3XL2ivGkQyw.text: My boyfriend and I choose the Burger Bar to dine before attending the Michael Jackson One production!  I ordered the Kobe Burger.  I would not say it melted in my mouth as the decription said on the menu, but overall it was a good burger. The cocktails were great and the service was good!

pdstxvkvpGa4f1tI9hTZug.text: I was expecting something amazing as I am a huge fan of Gordon Ramsay.  The food was good but my burger came out wrong twice.  First time it was missing a topping and second time it came out welldone when I asked for Medium.  The server and manager were apolgetic and the burger still tasted good.  They had a great beer selection and our server was very knowledgable.

5L2CC1V2nFAqzvwcnAWlBg.text: This was my 1st meal after landing in Vegas recently. Keep in mind, I was starving. But it still wasn't that great. If there's food left on my plate, I'm sorry but you didn't cut it for me. At least we didn't have a wait =)   It was actually a lot of fun going with a big group, seeing what everyone chose to customize their burgers with. We also each ordered a different side so we got to sample all the delicious fried varieties. I think the sweet potato fries were my favorite.   I think I got the country patty, or something. It was dry and a tad overcooked. Choose wisely..

8ENNo6VISvGWxSHRvUVhbw.text: Burger Bar was good but it was not fantastic. We started with zucchini fries which were okay and went with the fat fries which were luke-warm and tasted stale. After reading a few of the reviews about the great beer menu I tried the Troubadour Obscura after delving through the extensive beer menu! I picked it because I love a good stout, but this was the worst beer I have ever had, but that has more to do with my choice than anything else.   As for the burgers I went with a Kobe burger with egg, bacon and avocado and my wife went with the Kobe with pineapple, bacon, and aioli. First I am glad I ordered mine medium-well because the wife ordered her's medium and I swear I heard it moo! I was expecting an amazing burger but it was really only so-so. I have had better burgers at in-n-out and it definitely wasn't worth the $75 bill.   The saving grace was the Black and White Milkshake which was to die for! The shake was thick enough to eat with a spoon and had large diameter straw to accommodate the big chunks of cookie dough in every sip and the chocolate whip cream on top was amazing!!!   The other thing that earned the 3 star rating was the excellent waitress. She had plenty of suggestions based on what her likes were and she was there every time we even thought we need something!

sUMQ8tdyoNIBt0N0kSairw.text: Went here after hearing about a friend that got the $60 burger.  I wasn't about to since I detest fungus, but I did get the mid-grade angus steak burger with cheddar and "skinny" fries.  It was a delight to eat and I appreciated the quality of the meat, seasoned well, and the extensive choices including 5 different buns (I had whole wheat).  Lettuce, tomtoe and onions were nice quality and cheddar really had a sharp taste that I liked.  After losing a lot of money gambling, the price seemed reasonable for the experience.  Good water-filling service.

gwYLHP5rtMJZQxTJIL9TAQ.text: This place is only good if you are starvvvvviiiiiiiiiing!!! I ordered the veggie burger and it didn't look anything like what had been described about it on the menu. Honestly it was like a little five year old was back there making burgers. My fries were cold and craptacular. The first time I came here it was great this time complete plop! The only reason I ate the shit was because I was so hungry.  Has gone down hill and that is the honest truth

pR8RhMXxADSTTdi5118lNQ.text: These were some of the best burgers I have had in a while. We ordered the Kobe Burger and it was nice and tender, juicy, and beefy. The bun was just right, not too soft or too hard and didn't take away from the taste of the burger at all. It is a bit more on the expensive side as burgers go, but I'd pay that much again to eat one (actually going to go try the new one that opened up in San Francisco Macy's).   The ambiance is a classic kind of mix between sports beer bar and steak house. Rich dark colors pervade the establishment. The server was really nice and attentive.  It's found in The Mandalay Bay Mall area. We stayed in the Mandalay, so we received a coupon book and it had the Burger Bar in it. Not sure now, but I hope so!

hus7af81FxNQHLBi5I62Qg.text: I have NEVER had such an amazing burger. The zucchini fries fries are also to die for. I long to visit Vegas again just so I can go back to BURGER BAR!!!

Os5NbOCKBIf9TtYUhX0YXw.text: I am a big fan of keller, but this place doesn't live up to the hype.  I ordered the famed Rossini burger for $60.  My foie gras was grainy on the outer portions, which I had never experienced before, and I order it every where I go. My shaved truffles we ice cold. The beef was cooked perfectly however.  I also ordered the Nutella milkshake. It tasted like an extremely rich chocolate milkshake, nothing like nutella which I love so much.  They had a kids menu also. My son ordered the kids cheeseburger  which was about an 1 and a half in diameter...  My other son got the chicken strips, and my wife got a plan cheeseburger. Add on a couple of sodas... and the total price with tip was around $140.00.  It was a let down. Over priced. Underwhelming.  I prefer BLT burger in the Mirage.

2ONuo5S3YFeQ_xjsp3qlJQ.text: Had the Lamb burger and skinny fries, the draft sampler and the Nutella Milkshake.  Great food.  Great service.  A bit expensive, but what do you expect for a restaurant located in a Vegas casino, right?

uiFiK3fD5JbpglwKtLfwBg.text: The is a great location. It is casual. It isn't overly expensive. However, a) it is noisy (tough for a table of six to have a conversation. A table of four would be fine, b) The Kobe Beef Burger - might be worth it..however, I asked for welldone and it was delivered medium. I didn't know until I took a bit. At issue was, they would redo it, but it would take 25 min, in 25 min I would be the only person still eating. Please, listen when your customer places and order.   Overall, my impression was, Hey, we are the Burger Bar, if you don't like us, then you don't have to come to our establishment, go somewhere else.   Not what I expected. Again, not a bad place - just be very clear to your server and recognize that they want you in and out -- The service I've had at Red Robin has been far superior.

0wWr06gCcca3Vu4OoSbsTw.text: We went to lunch here after researching and trying to find the best burger in Las Vegas.  We went here for lunch and found it delightful.  The host stand gave us an estimate of 15 minutes for the 7 of us.  They take your phone number and text you when the table is ready, which is great because it is in a mall and you can walk around.  We got the text a few minutes later.  Unfortunately, when we gave them our name, they pointed us to a table that strangers were already sitting at.  Somehow, 4 people we didn't know were sitting at our table.  They didn't make them move, but they did scramble to put two tables together in the back and get us seated in a few minutes.  The waitress was fantastic (one of the two identical twin waitresses there).  She refilled our drinks every few minutes.  They have a huge selection of gourmet burgers or you can build your own.  Everything was delicious.  The fried pickles did have a little too much breading though.  This being the first, it is still one of the best gourmet burger restaurants in Vegas

ku2930goKh0T6KNGtfWj5A.text: despite being able to use a mandalay gift card.....that was not mine, it hurt spending $23 on a burger.   kobe beef, baby spinach, cheddar, avocado, carmelized onions, jalapeno bacon. real good burger but just can't handle that price.   if i was going back id go free range beef to knock $6 off.   onion rings are by far best of side dishes.

RF0fLdq29s9hNzijSAqzFw.text: Amid all of the Las Vegas glitz, glamor, and fancy restaurants, Burger Bar delivers the best Kobe Beef Burger. They offer the most trimmings I have ever seen including truffles. My favorite combinations are blue cheese and bacon and portebello mushroom with lettuce and tomato. Their sweet potato fries are in line with the rest of Burger Bar's excellence. While it is little more under the radar among the Celebrity Chef restaurants in Vegas, it is a must visit for both locals and tourists alike.

plrs-1llQU26mbY6jMulJA.text: Finally! A place that knows how to make a delicious veggie burger! It's sometimes difficult me to eat at restaurants, especially those known for their meat dishes, but Burger Bar was fantastic! And their "Sin City" beer, comparable to AmberBock, was refreshing and perfectly complimented our meal.

Lj1ZyhvFT7KIZTSASRxtqQ.text: I stop by this place on one of my business stay at Mandalay before catching an early evening show, which if you're doing similar, just want to find a place for a quick bite, I'd highly recommend, the bar in front has a good selection of beer, bartender were attentative,  you get to enjoy your meal, the nicely cooked burger, while watching the TVs throughout, then head on to your next thing at LV.

DDc8pFVRCHvFnjpoa4YzJQ.text: $10 burgers worth it in every bite great flavor and cooked to perfection ! You can find a cheaper burger but not a better burger! Try the zucinni fries they too were great as were the spicy pickle fries! a favorite of mine in Vegas! and the best beer selection anywhere i have been

5DhCYzjVblFEWuJMFFWFkw.text: Really loved this place! Much better than BLT (of which I admit to being a fan). I think the meat was tastier here. Husband had the angus burger with a coffee shake. Loved it and ate every bite! I had the three slider sampler with fries. The fries were nothing special, but the three sliders were so individual in flavor and texture - really enjoyable. I think we've found our new favorite Vegas burger joint!

yKvdGRw6k5-CvWeIetwK_A.text: Very glad I made it here. Split an expensive burger with my gal. I eat ~4 burgers a year as they all suck. But this one was terrific. Great beer menu too. Always a nice supprise to find euro beers on tap. There cheap burgers too, which I bet are yummy too. Waitresses were nice and friendy and boobie. Not sure i'd go for a dinner, but its a great lunch spot.

1DrKhWGvMwhYmaF7yQSmzg.text: I'm leaving Vegas a big fan of the burger bar.  I had the buffalo burger with a bunch of my own custom fixings with a nice tall glass of beer.  Oh and the beer....they have about a million different options from all over the world.  Meal for two people....2 burgers, 2 beers, 1 side was about $45, which for Vegas is a steal.  Atmosphere is cool and the waitstaff was very attentive.  I'll be visiting again for sure.

BpI8OMpo1NIbBS4j-PcHxQ.text: $20+ for a burger!!!  Yes, the Burger Bar might be expensive, but they do make some of the most delicious burgers around.  I had the Kobe burger with cheddar and bacon on ciabatta, and it was giant, juicy and delicious.  My waitress was pleasant and attentive as well.  Despite the price, I'll definitely be back.

Ft6Vkld9lFTrtB6Y14_7SA.text: The Burger Bar is perfect for lunch or a cheap dinner. We spent $400 at Fleur de Lys the pervious night and were ready for something cheaper and different. We ordered a pitcher of Blue Moon and some burgers.  The burgers are pretty standard and the service is good.

uCMjjhgdMsoRZrOfh14qJw.text: 3.5 stars  the whole big your own burger theme reminded me of "the counter" in LA except less choices.   if i had won big the night before i would have tried the $60 kobe beef, foie gras, truffles, truffle sauce burger. i don't know if that would have been worth it though because the regular kobe beef burger was only $16. i added grilled onions, chipotle aioli, and pepper jack cheese on a onion bun. the burger was good and juicy... it also helped that i was starving.   i had fried jalepeno pickles on the side. for some reason... i was thinking jalepeno poppers when i ordered them. since that's what i wanted i was disappointed when i took the first bite. but after i got over it and took them for what they were... i enjoyed them a bit more. they definitely had a little kick since the pickles were marinated in jalepeno juice. by the end of the meal i was all pickled out since i had 2 pickles and all the fried pickles.   i felt bad for my friend who got the sliders. i mean seriously... the smallest sliders i've ever seen. first chicken wings! (see my review for "hot wings cafe")... now sliders!! i hate this recession!!!! i could have eaten them in one bite.

V9hIgXIH4Plo3u3sQUrWkg.text: Just got back from another trip to Vegas and this place was so good I ate there 3 times during my five day trip.  the burgers are the best in Vegas, and I have eaten at all the burger spots the city has to offer.  I ordered the Country Natural Burger and added bacon, caramelied onions, and cheddar cheese.  Burger was cooked perfectly and exactly the way I ordered.  The fries are ok- nothing special like the burgers.   On the 3rd visit I got onion rings and they were vastly superior to the fries.  Another bonus at this place is the staff.  Great service and very friendly.  Additionally, the hot bartender was wearing a tiny tanktop 2 sizes too small- defintely added to the dining experience.

yWigD3SbHNAkpNTgUY14Jw.text: We LOVE the Burger Bar and it's a must visit during our Las Vegas trips. Last time we went we had a group of 6 and know that groups are always a challenge for servers. However our very friendly and helpful server got it ALL right and when we asked for the mayo we'd forgotten to order she promptly delivered it cheerfully to us. Several of us tried the peppercorn burger, it was perfectly cooked and seasoned. Food was hot, cooked correctly, served in a timely manner. We didn't leave a scrap!

k02sRxb0L8gjNE6jtAJlsw.text: Hallelujah!  Definitely a fan of a joint that lets me dream.  Sure you can eat a cheaper burger elsewhere, but thats not the point! Indulge and enjoy.

KmXYmA__lPb0XbSwY3SFaA.text: At lass a Burger joint that compliments the sexy classiness in a gal. The perfect place to take your date when you are well past impressing them, the perfect spot to do a gals night out or just a gals luncheon before the spa or after the pool. The perfect next day hangover food a giant salad. And you know the guys gotta love a spot that has the most beers on tap I have ever seen in a burger joint. With a variety of eye candy running around decked out in Burger Bar outfits. You could even dine here with your family. Its cool all the way around.  With Apple Martini in hand I eagerly scope out the menu to see what famous creator Chef Keller has done to our all American Burger. I almost drop my martini when I learn its really True what they say...My God he put the ultimate on a burger, Foie gras! All I have to say after eating that meal is, how can I eat this all the time? The Kobe beef was perfect topped with Foie Gras. who'd a thought something so sexy can lay on top of an all American dish..the burger.  Seems like Chef Keller brought some of that classiness from Fleur with him to the Burger Bar.

0QqaNaUg1-pu77DoNLNUNw.text: I love the sweet potato fries.  The service was very good.  The wait time to be seated can be long if you go for dinner

HzFT13tdNGv1vrgxrFJ_cg.text: I was here last Thursday 8/12/2010 and had the Kobe Burger w/Sweet potato fries and a Nutella shake. All I can say it this place is the bomb. I never tasted a burger so juicy and flavorful. I had it w/ american cheese but it would have been fine without it as the meat tasted so fresh and tons of flavor. Nutella shake wasn't sweet , just right.  Had some zuchini fries too and it was great too. Everything here looks so good that I would come back here when I am in town again.

yMPBaa2yEG1iKoYsadrGeg.text: Second only to In and out, Hubert Keller's Burger bar is a top burger joint.  Ive been there twice and have tasted four different creations of burger and they are all delicious.  I love how many different toppings you can choose, and they are all high quality ingredients.  You can go from really fancy (truffles, lobsters, Kobe beef) or just plain ol american.  Either way, it can form to any wallet.  If you dont want to choose your own ingredients they have pre-selected top burgers, the Blackjack burger was really good.  I thought the skinney fries were too overdone, but the sweet potato fries were good.  This time around we tried a milkshake, the Black and White one.  OMG milkshakegasm.  Delicious, creamy, chuncks of cookie dough and homemade chocolate whipped cream.  If that isnt you thing, I hear Burger Bar has the largest selection of beers on tap ON THE WHOLE STRIP.   The french man created the best over the top burger joint- good eats with a healthy dash of Vegas Flash.

2XJEfF1kByHN_V7IqC9uZQ.text: By far the BEST burger i have ever had in my life. This would hands down be my last meal on earth if i had to choose. I always have the Kobe burger with caramelized onions, bacon and chedder cheese with a side of sweet potato fries. The meat is soo juicy and tender, it just melts in your mouth. I was in Vegas for the weekend and i had to eat here at least twice. I live in California so i had to get my burger fix before i left. I paid around $23 bucks for my meal but it was well worth it.

CfYIoJ9TtbIwtlnI7os31w.text: Oh man this place is good! Love to build my own burger with lobster on top!! The staff is very friendly and helpful when asking questions and the women workers here are HOT! Anyways i go with the spicy lamb burger which is a favorite, orion rings and shakes are just awesome I like this place a bit better the BLT burger at the Mirage due to a bigger menu and drink selection. When i think about a good burger in vegas i think Burger Bar!

7K33PMo_eD_pELpNSdfa2g.text: Great selection of build your own burger options. Yummy onion rings, great fries and the shakes are pretty damn good too

xH2C5mGK2arVPhk7S0v4Jw.text: Ho hum ho hum... I had high expectations for this place. But.... Service was painfully slow. Tried the Kobe burger, American Class, & Buffalo All DRY. Overpriced burgers. I never mind paying good money for a good burger But.... I'm leaning towards - Definitely SKIP this place.

OIifDopt4CBdTyvbijhH4w.text: My husband and I hit up Burger Bar any time we head out to the Strip for a show.   It's got great burgers and the beers are pretty good as well. I love their sweet potato fries and definitely recommend those! It is a bit pricey and can get crowded really fast on the weekend. The staff is so-so. The last time we were there our waitress ignored us to spend more time at the table full of guys. I was little upset about that, but not enough to stop going to Burger Bar.

UV4ItARpsMQRtbKio_ZxoA.text: I was here 4 of 6 nights, 1 night appetizers, 3 nights burgers & fries. Given that I went 4 times, I obviously like this place. The buffalo burger was excellent: moist, juicy, and properly seasoned. The lamb was good, perhaps too much cumin for my taste, but I definitely preferred the buffalo. The complimentary tomato, onion, pickle, and lettuce was always of excellent quality.  I always had ciabatta rolls, which stayed intact but yet had an easy to chew consistency. I always had my burgers with smoked gouda or cheddar cheese. My sides were regular or sweet fries and spiced ketchup. Definitely get the spiced ketchup, which is so much better than the Heinz variety. As usual, I ordered wheat beer on tap for drinks.  This place is not cheap. My individual tab ranged from $33 - $43, including tax & tip. But this is the strip and the burgers were some of the best I ever had. Normally I would balk at paying such prices, but I accept that the combination of location & quality mandate this.

n5OhN5CZPcRWAlvhSaObXQ.text: I had their bean burger which was ok. Fries were not included, in fact it is straight up burgers that are about $12 or more each. It was super crowded and noisy for a Thursday afternoon, so a little pre planning might be necessary. It is the strip afterall

DycvyTmF9XB6UnZekpuyfA.text: I've expected more from this burger joint. I always have to compare it with in-n-out. IN-N-OUT hands down. For the price and taste in-n-out all day long

oD7Azn81YmKNSTCyFvucRA.text: Favorite spot on the strip for a good burger. High quality choices. Expect a wait for a table in evening hours. Great setting with good service

ZR0BZeCLzuL1DAe0C-lvzQ.text: I loved the ability to build my own burger. Great ambiance. Big booths with televisions in them, friendly waitresses. Not overly expensive. I'd go back next time I'm in Vegas.

JmhsMyaUkPOaCSoFsDBnJw.text: My new fav in Vegas, I love this restaurant, so Cute and lotsa seating.  The zucchini fries were delish.  Milkshakes were yummy, we had the Nutella.  Beers were great.  We sat in a booth that had a mini t.v. that had the football game going.  The burgers were yummy and there's a huge selection; they cooked the meat perfectly nice and juicy!  Regular fries were great.  I will definitely hit up this place the next time I'm in town!

ZL2TaKg4b05dHv8CzHXhFg.text: I have been here 3 times. It's a bit pricey-as one should expect for a trendy spot. There usually is a wait but there's always an upbeat mood inside. The menu allows you to select from a combination of burgers, or you can customize your own from the bun in. The desert burger is a novel idea, but too much for me on my own. Great to share!

tXefh2d4twIZtsJoFFzS7A.text: While visiting Mandalay Bay, we were told that the bar was located in their shopping area. The whole place is relatively small and narrow, but the food and drinks are definitely worth it.   I'll get to the goods first... I had a Deschutes Mirror Pond and a Stone Pale Ale. My husband had a Hop Henge which I tried and then fell deeply in love with it. All beers were quality as well as the burgers! There were six of us and we all had something different and equally delicious. I had the Surf & Turf burger which comes with lobster and asparagus (on the burger) and my husband had the American Kobe Beef. They do have a Japanese Kobe burger on the menu for $60.00 and I'm sure it is worth it. There is also a build your own burger section on the menu. They offer a TON of options plus choices for those who don't eat meat.   My husband and I also split a milkshake which I could dine on every day for the rest of my life. All in all it was a great time!

wS8pcTpHFxC1qcfdDyivCg.text: This place is awesome!  Try my concoction the "doomed earth" burger - Kobe Burger, Foie Gras, Onion Bun, Caramelized Onions, Pepper Jack cheese, Oyster Mushrooms and Truffle Mayo.  That burger was damn good.  The Cherry on top is that they had my favorite beer ever on tap, Delirium Tremens!

SRznjp9vfx1MpzeVFCdaLw.text: Good place to get a gourmet burger on the strip. I may be spoiled by all the great gourmet burgers in L.A. for way less money. They offer many options and a build-your-own burger option as well. I had the lamb burger and didn't add cheese. Big mistake because it was a little bland without it. Everyone else's burger was good, except the vegan burger. I would definitely come back if I'm craving a burger in Vegas, but would go with another burger instead.

7Qyi7azSY7hlipj0BrZFEQ.text: This place was cool, I came and got their Foie Gras burger but was underwhelmed. In my opinion, it's not worth $60, even with a free dessert.  It was a nice atmosphere, but I will stick with the $10-$15 burgers if I ever come back

cwOV_viV6L4yNqgCJ1bpCg.text: I stopped by Burger Bar with a group of 12 at 8PM on Friday night.  They told us it would take about 40 minutes, so we left and came back at 8:30.  We were seated an hour and a half later at 10PM.  The entire time, we were telling the hostess to just split our group into groups of 4 or 6, and every time, they would just tell us, "it's okay.. it'll just be 15 minutes."  During that hour and a half of standing in the middle of the mall, groups and groups and groups and groups of 4 or 6 white people were promptly being seated.  It's a lot of fun to watch somebody show up, get seated, eat, pay, and leave, while you're still waiting for a table.  After we finally sat down (we demanded that they the let us take the next seatings regardless of the size of tables), service was good, and the burger was mediocre (maybe worth 3 yelp stars).  Not that good when compared to the Father's Offices and Umami Burgers of the world.  My nutella shake was pretty solid also.  But our experience was so atrocious that I've got to give it a 1 star.  So to sum up, Burger Bar might be worth the trip if you are part of the Master Race, but I am not one of the lucky few, so I will never go back.

hQVqQBhNlsc-PAck7t7hYA.text: Great establishment for a fantastic burger. I have only come once, but it was enough to leave an impact on me that I will come back for sure. My burger was cooked just how I like it and I didn't have to wait forever. The service was very good and everyone was friendly.

mY1-7XGHALEXBFyr82LXxQ.text: We were very excited to try this place based on all the good reviews we saw. But that is where the excitement ended. First, this is located in the middle of the hotel shopping area and is a walk from the parking garage. Big deal though, it was going to be a good dining experience, right? Wrong!  The service was ok, but the place was extremely loud. All four of us tried different burgers and they were just ok. None of us thought they were anything special. We also tried a couple shakes but they were nothing to write home about either. But really took us was the pricing. It is outrageous how much this place costs for a burger place. Steer clear of this place, there are much better and affordable places in town for a burger.

anrmjjkropdVWw1tFWqWew.text: O.M.G. Got the black and blue burger. SO good.   Staff was very nice but honestly the service was pretty slow.  Waited only 5 minutes to be seated, but close to 30 before we got our food.  Dont bother with the garlic fries, they were nothing special. They have a fantastic selection of hot sauces which made me pretty happy :)

k7nAl38hSwR8n4Bl4XaGCQ.text: Three of us dined here. We ordered salmon, a turkey burger and a beef burger. All meals were delicious. The server was okay. She wasn't rude or anything but the place was pretty busy. The food was delivered hot but beverage refills were few and far between. I would try this place again at a slower time of the day.

Dk545UKrGBWH_YnCKO7Hsg.text: I musta missed something here? We came here based on Yelp Peep reviews wanting to drink and watch the game. We already had food comma from today and just wanted a place to have a good burger and watch the game.  We ordered: - Hangover Burger - Baguette Burger - Lambert Rasberry Beer - tea   Pros:  - Fries came with our gourmet burgers; very good - burger meat was very generous and good quality  - burger was bigger than the bun - Lambert beer was good - booth seats had a TV each - lots of TV's everywhere  - big place and good for big groups - good customer service especially from Jessica - great location  Cons:  - Burger itself had no flavor so we had to add seasoning  - Burgers were small (looked bigger on the picture!) - Burger were super greasy  - The Brie cheese added to my Baguette burger was small that didn't even cover the burger.  - prices are high  I left a little sick from the grease of the Baguette burger I had. I ordered some tea to wash the food down and to melt the greasy feeling I had in my mouth. This place is great to hang out, have drinks and watch the games but we were not satisfied with the food especially at the price we paid. We may not be back...[34/100]
