Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baguette Burger with Brie cheese
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hangover Burger with no cheese...hubby no liky the salad sauce.

d7jO0XEi-1RIfYGsA3qAng.text: I came in around 10:00 on a Friday Night and I was seated immediately. The host was very nice and the service was quick and efficient.   I chose the build your own burger and I did a chicken breast burger with a multigrain bun, avocado, grilled onions, caramelized onion, sauteed peppers and it came with lettuce and tomato and a pickle. I then ordered sweet potato fries and a side salad.   I don't think I've ever been that satisfied with a meal. The sandwich was huge and so filling! So much flavor and amazing textures. The side salad started me off well.   I highly recommend coming here it is amazing.

rwrLFgOxMog6zvKDeG4W2g.text: Are you kidding me?  How does this place only have a 4 star rating?  How?     I just had a custom built buffalo burger, a combination fat and skinny fry and a black and white milkshake and I think I just replaced one of best nights in college.  This place is so underrated and equally understated.  Cool Pub style decor on the inside and a mall entrance on the outside.  But don't let any of that fool you, because the kitchen is turning out just incredible food, matched by equally fantastic service.  Put this on your list when you are in Vegas.  Period.

jF839xvX6Xij65JZUdtD7Q.text: Man, I'm so bummed because I forgot to take a picture!!!  Here's the run down on my order that was fantastic: Built my own burger  Protein: bison Bun: whole wheat (very solid bread choice) Cheese: pepper jack  Toppings : (you can pick 3, any more cost extra) jalapenos, blue cheese and baby spinach Fries: zucchini fries, this was the stand out item for me.

UgCLkycJAfKyO8ndq21LdQ.text: This may be my favorite new place in Vegas. I had the Bloody Mary and a side salad and my husband had the hangover burger. The service and food was unbelievable.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

oV80HIEuPHIGJE6lXl2aLw.text: Well first word that comes to mind is slow!  Went in on a Tuesday night around 8 pm. Maybe 8 other tables full. We ordered a burger and a veggie club. Took 25 minutes to get food. Really? Then had to wait for check when done because no waiter to be found.  Service - 1/5 Food- 3/5 burger was ok, good sweet potato fries. Location/ ambiance 3/5, loud music if you like that.

IdDbY1PaRD8eyz61P2Ijpw.text: Kobe beef burger was great. You can build your own burger with choices of 4 or 5 different meats, breads a good bit of toppings to choose from. A bit pricey but very good. The waitress was very kind and helpful. Great service.

O_vbmHQ-0BrYngAvBABgCg.text: Came here around happy hour, I didn't like how HR customers can only sit at the bar. The HR menu didn't have much options. We only ordered about 2 things off the HR menu, items were still a bit pricey for me, $6 for a regular milkshake. I also had the classic burger thought it was pretty basic for an $18 burger. Truffle fries were really greasy, strawberry milk shake had more of just a milk flavor. Our server was very nice however the food wasn't that great especially for the price you pay.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French kiss &amp; Strawberry

bPJtRUBhTU4DnbJpwJZDkw.text: I thought dinner at Burger Bar was good for the price. One of the few reasonably priced places near Mandalay Bay and I would recommend it if you at staying there for business. My Hangover Burger was cooked the way I ordered it and the steak fries were good. I thought it was strange the sauce was served on the side of the burger. If I came here again and was not on a budget I would have tried the lamb or buffalo burger.

Te1r-6VR1C72Q5QqyyATxw.text: Burger Bar: I immensely enjoyed my Wagyu burger on a sesame seed bun, (with American cheese, cooked to medium.) The ground beef was perfectly cooked, and tasted amazing. God bless the farmers of the Kobe region of Japan who first pioneered the means of raising such exemplary cattle.)  The fries were also enjoyable.   Beer was a tad hoppy, but perfectly serviceable

Uy76u8s7soAW0pNOweGxUg.text: Our team went here after a tournament at the close by convention center. We came because the empty pizza place next to it that we had a reservation at was rude and empty but since we were late was not sure they cooled seat us so we went next fire to a packed burger bar who was happy to make room right away!  Great waitress who got every right somehow and everything from the burgers  to the salad got rave reviews from the parents and players.

qFG0rUyCOiVGCD5GRUMkHg.text: Came here for the first time on Saturday evening, night before the 2017 superbowl. We had came here kind of late in the evening as friend came into town around 0915PM. By the time we got down to Mandalay Bay, parked, and found the restaurant, it was closer to 1000PM.   Oh side note, the restaurant is located between Mandalay Bay and Luxor, in the shoppes, more towards Luxor, so it may seem like a little walk before you see it.   We were promptly seated within a few seconds of requesting for a table. The place was fairly empty. 1/2 full or maybe less. Mainly with some larger groups.   Typically we don't really go to burger places unless this friend is in town. He's a huge fan and lover of burgers so its almost became a tradition to go to a burger place or a pizza place.   My party was a party of 4, 2 being larger guys, 1 tiny girl, and an average sized guy. We were sat at a booth. 2 larger guys can but definitely wont be comfortable sitting on the same side. These booths are more toward the smaller side, even for 4 people.   Our waitress came shortly to take our drink orders. Then a few minutes later, our meal orders.   Their burgers are more on the pricey side but as expected from a restaurant inside a casino, and from a more named chef.   I had ordered the reuben. Our burger loving friend got the hangover burger. My tiny female friend (lol...) got the American classic with bacon on the side (shes not a fan of bacon, nor am I), and our other friend got a salmon burger  ------------------  "The Reuben" consists of a black angus beef patty topped with sauerkraut, corned beef, homemade mustard and swiss cheese on a whole grain bun served with a side of skinny fries priced at $19.80  "The Hangover" consists of a black angus beef patty smothered in hangover sauce topped with chopped lettuce on a sesame bun served with FAT fries priced at $13.95  The "American Classic" consists of a black angus beef patty topped with American cheese, crispy bacon, tomato, onion on a sesame bun served with a side of skinny fries priced at $15.40  The "Evolve Salmon" consists of grilled salmon topped with roma tomatoes, baby spinach on a multi grain bun served with a side salad with lemon vinaigrette priced at $15.65  ------------------  Food came out fairly quick. Most of us ordered medium for our patties with exception for the "American Classic" being medium rare. They were all cooked at about the same doneness of about a medium. A nice crust with a warm red center. Also, another "consistent" thing that we felt was in all our burgers was the patty was severely underseasoned. My friend opened up her burger and went ham on sprinkling salt on hers. I just sprinkled sparingly before every few bites. A little salt went a LONG way and it definitely helped.   When my burger "The Reuben" first arrived, I was like WTCRAP I got 3 small slivers of corned beef? then my friend told me he sees it under the melted cheese. Lol almost flipped the table for paying such a higher premium for 3 slivers. With the added salt, the burger was fairly tasty. The bread used was nicely toasted, and had a good firmness to it without being hard.   Skinny fries was about the same thickness as, per se, fries from McDonalds. Not bad. Comes with a nice pickle spear too. Dunoe why the "Evolve Salmon" came with 2 spears vs our 1. Om nom nom pickle. XD   Friend had mentioned the "hangover sauce" is similar to thousand island dressing, maybe something like spread from In n out too. xD   All in all. Decent place. Friend thoroughly enjoyed it. Ate his own and finished my friends 1/3 left over. I've never been much of a burger lover so it was ok to me. Lol   Not sure how busy they'd be normally during normal meal times but it was pretty easy when we went. Took them quite a while to bring the check though.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Reuben burger

uiVoHOyBKYhZ_pUVydedHg.text: Reviews must expire because I KNOW I've reviewed this place.  I come here just about every time I'm in Vegas (24 times and counting) and never have a bad experience.  Their burgers are delicious and prepared to your specifications.  You can build your own burger which I recommend, or you can choose off their pre built burger menu if you have no imagination ;)  Their sides are all really good.  I once had their $60 burger which comes with Foie Gras, Black Truffles and Kobe beef and it was amazing..but I only recommend that if you had a hot night at the tables and up enough money to not regret it later.  Anyway, I've been here 10+ times and will continue coming back.

FYG5OOTuVb0BMoYVVKQ06Q.text: This is a must when visiting Vegas. The best burgers in town. Another hidden gem in New York, New York. The salmon burger is amazing!!! Great service. Very friendly and knowledgeable. Knowledgeable not only in the menu but also on the best shows to see.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

EuXJN707xCS3A4OB2Vi6Mw.text: Their happy hour is a joke. They obviously don't want customers. What a bunch of crap   I've eaten here multiple times but they have sunk below the line of decent deals. Last time I'll eat here

h5aG0SsViZHOGTdlkMON_w.text: The bartender was really friendly and the hangover burger was probably the best burger I had on this trip. My wife had the blood Mary and she doesn't eat wings so she gave me hers and it was amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XlP-qZtq3AsuZj1F_TDkWw.text: Greeted by the Smile of Ingrid. This experience could only get better. Ingrid made me a very tasty raspberry martini. It's my go to when I don't know what I want. Most places make it overly sweet. She made it very well balanced.   Ingrid recommended the mozzarella sticks. They were good. Very thin. Not too much breading on it. I dipped mine in ranch and it was great. Perfect size app.   I then had the Greek burger. It had a great Tzatziki sauce on it. With onions and pita bread as the bun.   My partner had the Baguette burger which was great. The bread was not hard like most baguettes.   French fries were good. Nothing to go crazy over. But still all together great meal and great prices.   There is definitely something for everyone if you love burgers. Some vegetarian options too!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ingrid making the best raspberry drinks
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fry trio

vnRdg06yWyxMouDPX09AwQ.text: I went here for my birthday dinner and had an amazing meal. I got a turkey burger and I think it could have used a litttttle more seasoning, but it was still great. The skinny fries are also tasty. And omg the milkshakes are next level. I got a build your own and it was probably the best milkshake I've ever had!

bGZLlWMioSXsAsdACeXCnA.text: A chance to get a taste of Hubert Keller, sign me up!   Bloody Mary is definitely worth getting (right balance of consistency, spice and tomato essence)   Hangover Burger was definitely a great choice, really fills you up and makes you feel alive again. Beware, if you order rare its going to be rare (I am glad they did it the way I like!). Fat fries were scrumptious   If feeling adventurous try Samichlaus, 14% per 11oz bottle....super smooth with a sweet finish  Service was friendly and really helpful (we had one of the twins that works there, she was awesome)   Overall Thoughts  I enjoyed my meal and would come back again if in the need of a bloody mary or a solid burger

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hangover Burger
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious

sgdsQohHu6du30CY_tB7eA.text: Horrible experience for our 25 person birthday party we held at this bad restaurant. PLEASE LISTEN!  Don't take your family to this restaurant. They don't care about you. They charged us for 33 people and our party was only 25 people.  2 plates came 15 minutes late. Please don't eat here. Go somewhere else.

zYAJIB-nbAZZq9rgLVkF5A.text: I have been to Burger Bar on a number of occasions over the years and have never really been blown away by the burgers.   On this particular occasion we were here for happy hour. Service was great from start to finish. Pleasant and extremely attentive by several different servers and bartenders. The drinks were good as well. Prices were right and I stuck with the strawberry mojito on special while my fella got a beer as well as a mai tai that he enjoyed for the most part. The happy hour food was les than stellar. The wings were probably the highlight, but they were a little dry and lacking in any real spice. The chicken tenders were sad and were similar to ones we could get at Denny's. The sliders were the least appetizing of everything we ordered. Lacking in flavor and after one bite I wasn't interested in eating any more.  I have had some good burgers here in the past but nothing particularly noteworthy. I do remember enjoying their sides quite a bit and after a relatively lackluster happy hour we ended our meal with the cheesecake burger that ended up salvaging our whole dining experience. Not the best donut I've ever had but the combination of cheesecake and fruit nestled inside a glazed donut bun was the perfect ending to our meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheesecake burger
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheesecake burger
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mai tai

95IkVkfriPw4SEfAHv1cxg.text: Came here last week while on a business trip...I was looking forward to getting something to eat and based on some previous experiences here I was anticipating a good meal. I sat myself at the bar because it was happy hour and thought about partaking in some of that, but quickly realized that I was going to a meeting in a few hours I skipped over that but did order a "Happy Hour" wedge salad for $6.95? Ouch! After a quick glance of the menu I decided on the salmon burger and ordered it protein style.  After a not too long of wait the burger came out and this is where some of the disappointment came in.  The burger was literally a piece of green leaf lettuce the salmon (no sauce of any kind) the salmon ($13.50) + avocado + bacon + some chipotle aioli ( now all of this is separate and added up to $7.70 Rip Off!) same lettuce tooth picked down. Not wrapped in any way or an attempt. Just a sloppy put together presentation that ended up just having to be cut with a knife and fork. But if I am going to be charged $21.20 for a burger then you better do it right. Well not this time and the only reason I am keeping this as a 3 star is because of past visits here and not entirely this one. One another note the lady sitting next to me also ordered a burger protein style as well and hers was put together just as sloppy if not more. So lesson here for this joint is not everyone likes a bun or can have one so this is something you need to nail. Maybe have your chefs go to Red Robin or the Habit to get some protein wrapping knowledge. Your flavors are great but your prices are high and if so you must deliver on everything.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Taste was good but the presentation was super sloppy! Salmon burger w/bacon, avocado...doesn&#39;t come w/any sauce so suggestion chipotle aioli

YIQJrCarMnLFI4OUpB3xLA.text: My boyfriend and I went back here for Valentine's Day. We had such a better experience! Our food came out much quicker than last time. DELICIOUS burgers and milkshakes. The service was very friendly.

c822BDysErc_U-yZGc4YKA.text: Worst burger and food I've ever eaten. Bacon was limp and looked half raw. Waiter didn't even care. Fries and zucchini fries were terrible. Only decent thing was the tater tots.

gMiERwuSzrFNznvot7B2SA.text: Mediocre food. Bar atmosphere with sports on the TVs. Drinks are good, but watered down and weak.  Service is friendly. Happy hour menu is quite limited for food.

nlmE_sO4ohiit5qXrV57XA.text: I've been coming to this place for years. I have always had great service and the burgers are excellent!

_OJf8uSwA8LxfxOEFmep4A.text: The food in this place was fantastic. Customer service was also stellar. Expensive for hamburgers, but they are of high quality. The vegetarian hamburger was exceptional and freshly prepared. Ice cream or flanks are optional. A decent choice of beer, my boyfriend was happy.

LYUo5IG-GwqSXPiGemmT2A.text: We were fortunate to come back to this place, it's always a MUST when we stay at the Mandalay. They have great Build-your-own burgers and delicious shakes! Great for a date night or even with friends.   My husband wanted to try the pretzel bun, he decided he probably should've just stuck with the regular white sesame. Wasn't feelin the pretzel bun. That's the only setback, otherwise, we shared one shake, got two burgers, and shared one skinny fries! The fries are soooo yummy.

YrYwn0HgGv-yJOWGQxOwsQ.text: Burger was delicious, we happened to come in  behind a party of 25, so our food took over an hour.  I'd definitely come back though.  The waitress tried to get our ticket in first, since we were servered after the large party.  The manager came over and apologized and comped our bloody beers.  Fries were delicious, the bar was very upscale, but prices were reasonable.  Make sure you order well done, to get pink center.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Fo96wmJJXBxE1jwfeaiW0A.text: My family & I enjoyed this place not only because of the delicious burgers but because it was kid friendly too. Its got this dark wood old bar scene vibe to it but there were TV's in each big booth that could hold 6 people comfortably. The  burgers were really good. They had different meats like bufflo & lamb burgers that were very tender & good flavored. The Truffle French fries were the best especially with the mayonnaise truffle dipping sauce, you must try for sure. Other than that we were full & content & will visit again next time we're back in good old Las Vegas!!!

ozYHjQQc5u0J8dVsDvg2sQ.text: HORRIBLE! Don't waste your money! With so many options of places to eat during your stay in Vegas you should def skip this one and opt for something else. We went here because it was convenient for us while staying at Mandalay and wanted a good burger. For 2 we had an adult milkshake, appetizer and 2 burgers it was $110, which we would be happy to spend if it was good food or experience but our service was terrible, the appetizer was nothing special and our burgers were not only cold but the buns were hard and they ad the wrong toppings, my husband and I just fixed it ourself because the waitress (once we could find her) seemed confused about how to help, never even came back to our table after that had to hunt her down for our ticket and never even offered so much as an apology. You would be better off to skip this place and try something else!

XP8eEwNS41rC9cx5RfP_EA.text: This meal was very filling for me.  I ordered the salmon burger and zuchinni fingers.  Salmon was moist and half the burger was enough for me.  Yum!

vQPLpgyEfNImi08PfVZWFg.text: Fries were bomb! Burger was like any other burger I had. Would probably eat here again. Service was good.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. American Classic Burger w/skinny fries (yum)

FJs906T5UZcXYpKhU4h-cg.text: Best burger in Vegas!!!! Their shakes are amazing!!! Fat fries are great!!!  Shake-- Oreo shake--  10 out of 10!!! Just delicious!!!  Fries-- 10 out of 10!!! So fresh and crunchy fat fries!!!  Burger--- 10 out of 10!!! Just the best!!! All the ingredients are so fresh and delicious!!! I love how customizable their burger is. Pepper bacon bacon burger with cheddar cheese and fried egg with ciabatta bun.

a-5L8T03XfOPWth_1RtmRg.text: The service was awful. It took forever to get our food.  My partner had the burger and said it was pretty good. The fries were good but came out a bit cold. The caesar salad I ordered had way too much dressing on it.   We had a blond waitress that told us the house water was good and filtered but it was not filtered of the chlorine. Yuck! We could not drink it and never saw the waitress again to tell her or order something else!  We had to request the check from another waitress....this rock star looking gorgeous asian woman with long dark hair, who we wished had been our waitress all along. She was very attentive to all of our customers.  Because of the bad experience with our original waitress and the lousy chlorinated water, this place gets 2 stars instead of 3 or 4.

E01VBGWjWNLkeXsLnvzP5w.text: Fantastic burger I'd recommend anyone.  I went for a custom one with the basic black angus meat, cheddar and I added some truffle mayo.  The meat is grilled, juicy full of flavour and tender, the cheddar was not noticeable but the truffle mayo was terrific.  The burger comes deconstructed so you can decide if you want the tomato/lettuce/pickle and onion  I would love to try a wagyu meat next time although it costs a lot more

Xa5f8lH7jatdn3w_pmyZ3Q.text: The food was fantastic! I had the low carb burger. Everything was fresh as I expected it. I'm giving it a 4 star rating for the food. Hostesses were great, we got seated right away. The server on the other hand, wasn't that great( I give her a 2star). We were a party of six. From the time we got there, which was 5:30pm to the time we got our food was 6:20pm. It took almost a whole hour to get our food. The restaurant wasn't that busy so it didn't make sense. We had to rush and eat our food because we were going to the Blue Man Group Show, doors opens at 6:30. Yea, it was a rush. This lady wasn't that friendly until towards the end. Yea she was probably waiting for her tip. We did tip $25, but honestly she deserved way less.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Low Carb Burger with a side salad and coke slaw. Very delicious and satisfying

JelPA7EwEr1gWdzT-Rp94w.text: Food was great! We both had burgers and fries, and loved them. Food was 5 star!  Waitress was friendly, but forgot about our cocktails. We knew she had forgotten, but could not get her attention to remind her. When our food came out we asked the man to grab her attention. Cocktails were amazing once we finally got them. When we got our bill it was charging us for 3 cocktails when we only had 2.... the same two that were 20 minutes too late. Service was 3 star.

-cG84TnfCBFITBlVUjllFQ.text: My friend and I were going to a concert at the House of Blues, and were hungry.  The restaurant where we were going to watch the concert at, had at least a 20 minute wait.  Since we were on a time crunch, we decided to see if we could find a place that was a little more accommodating.    Enter the Burger Bar.  As a fairly recent vegan convert, I was skeptical by the name of the joint.  It just conjures up unappealing visions of ground beef.  I figured they must have some type of veggie burger and took my chances.  Lo and behold, there was a veggie burger, and it sounded good, it was a chef creation with great ingredients that you would find in a vegan burger, even caramelized onions went into the making this burger...but it's not vegan because they put cheese into the patty, not on it.  I was hoping it was placed on top, and I could just order it without the cheese.  So disappointing.  But on the bright side, there was a Vegan Vegas burger, baby!  It had grilled eggplant, red pepper, and Portobello mushrooms acting as the bun.  No bread in this baby. I had a side of fries and a pickle spear.  It was delicious, and such a huge portion that I couldn't eat it all.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegan Vegas burger, baby!

gED4avYqC_LYPu4kmOlozQ.text: For me, Burger Bar was an intended destination -- not an accidental find.  I went specifically because I am a fan of Chef Hubert Keller and wanted to sample his take on burgers.  I really enjoyed it.  FOOD Because it's Hubert Keller, I was expecting an "elevated" burger, which seems to be a trend amongst respected chefs.  My burger fit the bill.  I took advantage of the "create your own burger" option on the menu.  You can choose from three different types of beef (angus, nature source, or Kobe), lamb, or buffalo.  Then choose from six types of buns.  Then choose from a seemingly endless menu of cheeses, sauces, and additional items.  My creation: the naturesource patty with smoked gouda, bacon, fried egg, peppercorn sauce on a pretzel bun.  I ordered it "medium" and was told that Burger Bar's medium is red inside, not just pink.  This was an accurate description -- and perfect!  My particular burger did not come with sides, but if you order from a chef's creations section, fries are included.  One friend in my party had chicken wings (delicious).  Another ordered the "Hubert Keller" burger which was made with buffalo and served with skinny fries.  She enjoyed it.  Another friend created a "healthier" and enjoyed it (though she said he liked Burgr by Gordon Ramsey better; I have not been there, so I have no comparison.)  We ordered steak fries and fried pickles for sides.  Both were great.  They also pride themselves on their shakes.  We did not try these or any type of dessert.  AMBIENCE It's...fine -- nothing elaborate or terribly unique.  Burger Bar is in the middle of the Mandalay Place shops, and it feels like a mall restaurant.  It's comfortable enough, but don't expect award-winning design or a "cool" vibe.  LOCATION At the Mandalay Place shops between Mandalay Bay and Luxor.  If you're staying at either of these hotels, it's great and an easy walk.  For those going by car, I suggest using valet.  Easy.  PRICES Fair.  I think my burger was about $20 with all my extra add ons.  If you add sides, a salad, and a drink, you could easily be at about $30 per person.  NUTSHELL It's a good burger.  I've been to Holstein's at the Cosmo up the strip, and it's comparable as far as quality and price (though Holstein's is more of an atmospheric destination.)  You'll enjoy Burger Bar...but expect to pay just a little extra than a typical restaurant burger.

YG73bYEZpHcdGTcFv0XHDg.text: The Spicy Lamb Burger is phenomenal! It's funny how hard it was to decide which burger to get when they really only had about 6 to chose from. Everyone in our party ordered a different burger, and all were extremely happy with their choices. I will absolutely be going back here next time I'm in Vegas. The service was equally as great as their food. They also have small TVs in their booths playing sports which is a nice change from constantly having to look around at the TVs on the wall. Good place to have a great burger and enjoy a game.

pgIh8RvXeml637fD5AWYeQ.text: A lot of the restaurants in big casinos put more emphasis on being eye-catching and different, while the food is too often an afterthought.   This isn't the case at Burger Bar. For serving some of the most common food in our culture (ground beef), they really do it right. Sure, it's a little more than a fast food burger, but you'll leave more satisfied.  All the burgers are tender, juicy, perfectly cooked, and the service has been top notch every time I've been there. The little TVs at each table are a nice touch also, particularly when you're with a couple chatty friends who are busy "catching up"; it gives you something to do while you savor your meat.  Highly recommended when you're in the mood for a great burger.

-HfW9h2YL9LQYwGUmFwTZQ.text: After my first visit to Burger Bar, I concluded that the side dishes were the real selling point here. My second visit recently confirmed this hypothesis.   In fact, the zucchini fries and mac and cheese croquettes are arguably the best sides I have ever had at a burger establishment. As a result, I debated whether I should rate Burger Bar with five stars for that reason alone. In the end, I had a hard time doing so since burgers are supposed to be the focus.  Overall, what I have learned after two trips here is that the American Classic is better than the Kobe Burger. And that the side orders are consistently amazing.

DWtw6xDof7Bqin7P7m_qhA.text: Their drinks are so fun! Definitely make sure to try the boozy shakes. We had a chocolate mint alcoholic shake and it was the best drink I had in Vegas! I heard they have a good Krispy Kreme Shake too if you're into that kinda stuff. On the cocktail side, I don't remember what I ordered but it's a mojito with mint and strawberry puree - ladies, make sure to try that one too! I would totally give them five stars for the drinks. However I didn't care too much of my entree sliders. So all in all they get four stars!

88Bmh0ZTVTsXeK-2AIkVag.text: I realize this place is on the strip but this place is still over priced for burgers of this quality. I got the Kobe burger that was $17 (no side). My girlfriend which is not bad but it was small and served on a flat metal platter/ plate. The service was ok, it's not to serve burgers. My girlfriend got the baguette burger which was also $17 this was the smallest "burger" ahead of sliders that I have ever seen.  The whole time I was thinking that I could've just went to innout instead.

zzFOqIRptLb4izK5TE-hfQ.text: There's a loooong wait here for a reason. Burger Bar is awesome. The best thing about it I would say, are the endless options (customizable burgers, drinks, etc). Not to mention the deliciousness. Burger prices range from normal to ridiculous ($60) for those with fancy tastes. There was turkey, salmon, normal beef, Kobe beef, etc, with all sorts of fancy toppings available. (The expensive one had truffle essence...I still have no idea what that tastes like). We ended up splitting a Kobe burger (they charge for splits, ugh!) as pictured (media4.px.yelpcdn.com/bp...). The patty was impossibly tender and wonderfully seasoned. We ordered a dipping sampler for our fries ( media2.ct.yelpcdn.com/bp...). It was super-fun to try all the sauces. I liked the chipotle sauce the most. I also got seriously what I consider the most luscious Strawberry Margaritas ever (media1.ct.yelpcdn.com/bp...). I had TWO of them. There was a lot of fresh, sweet strawberry puree in there, as well as scattered mint leaves for to make it even more refreshing. Last, we topped our meal off with dessert. There were many, many choices available...including alcoholic milkshakes, with customizable flavors (pick the liquor, pick the flavor)! Amazing. We settled on the dessert burger, which consisted of donuts sandwiching a sheet of passionfruit jelly, kiwis, strawberries, and gnutella (media4.px.yelpcdn.com/bp...), accompanied by a drizzle of raspberry sauce and a dollop of whipped cream. It was soooo cute and yummy. I loved Burger Bar!! Next time I'm getting an alcoholic milkshake...

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. dessert burger (passionfruit jelly, nutella, kiwi, and strawberry sandwiched by a donut)
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. kobe burger and fries
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. dipping sauce sampler

0y7kH-Cp09jL82Oz-Qx3nA.text: Came here with friends.  Large beer selection, plenty of options.  Made a custom burger with jalapeno bacon, pepper jack cheese, chipotle aoli. No burger is complete without SWEET POTATO FRIES!  Yum!!  =)   Will definitely be back to try their shakes!

XbV0xN-_H2PCbChewV03rA.text: Truly outstanding burgers and a great selection of beers  The best burger in Vegas at a reasonable price.  Truly stellar meat - I chose the mid-grade USDA prime 'Naturesource' - combined with a great potato bun and fresh toppings to make a perfect, perfect burger.   It didn't hurt that they knew how to make a 'rare' burger - it was warm yet still red inside with a nice char on the outside.  The skinny fries were hot and crisp and the beers were excellent - an ale and a fairly obscure stout.  The place is often packed - I chose to eat at the bar instead of waiting for a table.  I'm usually a bit leery of eating at the bar....but the bartender was excellent.  She was obviously used to people eating at the bar and knew how to give sufficient attention to someone needing both food and drink.  As the evening wore on (I was waiting for a late show) I tried the pepper jack cheese shots.  I still don't know how much I liked them - they were crispy on the outside and nicely spicy but the inside consistency was kind of like a cheesy, potato-y, croquette.  I bit weird...yet yummy.

9GYvJkdyaueSwHQ4-JCcgw.text: Pretty pedestrian.  Ordered chicken wings as an appetizer.  I actually think they were sparrow wings they were so small

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Now serving baby pigeon wings here at The Burger Bar. I guess that is what I get for bordering something other than a burger

ZzShaO_h1TBsktjl2_yqNw.text: Really good burgers... Staff is great at the bar... at the tables they have been a little slow. The sliders were good for a snack. This is one of my go to places at mandalay bay.

byo2VjznhUDjUngujZAvQg.text: This place was delicious.  There was a 20 minute wait and when our time came they offered us the table right in the opening of the place, you know, that table where everyone waiting to be seated stares at what you're eating.  No thanks, we said we'd take the next table. We ordered 2 custom burgers.  We also got a fry sampler with thin fries, macaroni and cheese croquettes and onion rings.  We had 5 dipping sauces to go along with it.  The "what seemed to be manager" took our order because the person who was suppose to be our waiter didn't seem on the ball.  The dipping sauces came out immediately, but the fry sampler which the manager said would come out first, well it came all at once with the burgers.  We didn't eat it all though since we were so into our burgers. Great place, but the service was lacking for the price we paid.

SUJZ9rKNge-Qzq4YvR0PIA.text: This place is not disgusting, but its definitely disappointing for the price.  The only reason I'm giving this place 3 stars and not 2 is because our server was super sweet and attentive.  My hubby spent the whole meal commenting on how her and another server looked quite similar, turns out they were twins.  Anyways,  I had the Angus w/swiss, mushrooms, and carmelized onions.  It was fine, but was far from the best burger I've ever had.  I also had the fat fries and a Carmel Latte (I think that's what it's called) shake.  They were both like 3.5 stars, but the value was terrible.  For the price it should have been spectacular.  Disappointed again by a celebrity chef.

eXRn41fgovosmTBG9r4KZQ.text: Excellent food, excellent service. I can honestly say I remember every meal I've had here. Food is awesome. Shakes are awesome. Definitely a go to restaurant when we have people in town visiting. Prices are reasonable. Good variety of beer/drink choices.

psOMp6vYW6N0DBtuZJA5vw.text: Definitely one of the top five burgers of my life and I have had a few.  Natural source beef, smoked Gouda cheese, pepper bacon, and truffle mayo.  Order that and thank me later.  Beyond the phenomenal food Burger Bar gets five stars for the following reasons.  1.Our waiter Sergio (I think) took great care of us.  Good recommendations and excellent timing.  2.  The prices are cheap by Vegas standards.  Burgers for two with a fry sampler and a few beers came in around ~50$.  3.  The hostess made a mistake and seated us in a section that was set to be occupied by a large group.  We were seated for maybe 5 minutes when the manager came over, apologized profusely and politely asked us to move a few booths down.  Our group was fine with his apology and had no problem with moving.  He insisted on knocking 20% off our bill which was an unneeded but nice gesture.  The manager also made sure to check on us and seemed genuinely concerned that we had a good time (which we did).  4.  They had an excellent beer selection.  Over the last few years I have been happy with good beers making their way to Vegas and Burger Bar has jumped on that bandwagon.  I had a few Dogfish Head 60 minute IPA and there were three or four more beers I would have gladly ordered.  Burger Bar.... we will definitely be back.

oeMCXpN9QavjwrYxs6zsxw.text: I like their burgers but I wasn't overwhelmed by their deliciousness. Next time I think I'm gonna start with a milkshake and move forward from there cause I never get around to it. Not enough room in the tummy ;( My husband had a buffalo burger and he loved it. I split a burger with a friend. I'm always annoyed when they charge you a split fee. Next time I just won't tell them I'm splitting my burger.  Overall I'd say they are good but not great.

6eeYcBDeu_Gf_M0ORCOpFg.text: The mozzarella sticks were not what you expected from a great chief. The fried pickles were subpar as well. The Kobe beef was outstanding the truffle was great a bit over cooked. Overall 8/10 taste in burger. The server was pretty horrible. No eye contact no hello and no people skills. Nothing genuine in that place.   I am visiting Vegas and with really amazing other options it was upsetting to waste my choice here.

zUICwfOiOX5YKChcoO6l1w.text: can you say FABULOUS?!   So... being a fan of Mr. Keller, I was eager to try out the infamous BB...and boy was I glad we did!   First off, I love that they let you create your own burger...pick your protein, your toppings, your bun, your sides... voila, it's all YOU!   I picked an angus beef burger w/blue cheese, seared fois gras and carmelized onions. Needless to say I was in burger HEAVEN with one bite of this concoction! The fois gras was cooked perfectly and covered the patty so no little smear here folks! One little word of caution: we had ordered our patties medium rare but when a friend's came out first and she had medium, we realized that medium was medium rare to them so order one level up IMHO.   We also had the trio of fries and fried zucchini... all very good and the dipping sauces were a lot of fun and tasty too!  Definitely worth a destination visit folks....wish HK would open one of these in LA! :-)

PTbub43g53GDI5DT8OSrbA.text: Wandering the mall awaiting a ride after my Luxor stay, I stumbled on this as the best looking option, not too crowded (except for Mr. Charles Barkley who wandered in shortly after I did).  Burgers exorbitantly priced: is it worth it?  For a one time deal probably borderline:  the Kobe beef burger was thick and flavorful, one of the better burgers I have ever had.  But still a burger.

XswTaOHNij2hSMe4PzP6qw.text: Bloody Mary. SOOOOO GOOD.  Just don't eat the burgers if you're a burger lover because they aren't all that good. It didn't have taste.. Even with toppings. Had the sampler plate and it just didn't do it for me.   IN-AND-OUT FTW.

YL5kOfULC4K9qRndESBpyQ.text: Love this place! Been coming here for 3 yrs. All my trips to Vegas include lunch at the burger bar. Did I mention, every day of my trip. Kobe, awesome! My fav, the buffalo! Sh'weet! Fancy shakes are amazing. Service us top notch! I enjoy the bar but booths are cool with your own tv. Can't wait till my next trip.

EjWxWd0DQoPYzGoNAxrRRQ.text: Enjoyed the Fry Sampler we tried--sweet potato fries, fried zucchini and onion rings.  Cinnamon honey mustard dip was amazing with sweet potato fries.  Peppercorn burger was nicely done.  Salted caramel milkshake was too rich for my taste and I was done after first try.

FhUgjscPW48kfvd2fDDQ4Q.text: Lets put it this way, after leaving BB I had what I affectionately named "The Burger Baby" as in my stomach looked reminiscent of when I was about 6 months pregnant - all from a turkey burger no less!   The first restaurant we hit on our recent trip to Vegas was Burger Bar, my husband was dying to try it out - The Hubert Keller hype and all.. I had a turkey burger with bleu cheese, caramelized onions and sauteed mushrooms - he had the minis and we shared the fantastic panko crusted onion rings. Everything knocked my socks off, I was seriously enjoying myself. The burger I ordered was HUGE and I ate a good 95% before giving up and giving in. My only complaint would be that they do not serve Mich Ultra( I know, you dark beer lovers are shaming me because they DO have a great beer list - just not what we prefer!) so we had to settle for a pitcher of Mich Lite. Boo.  We will def. be back, next time with a pair of stretchy yoga pants or something!!

n2_fJGgdhym009HaxzSNNQ.text: Impressive burgers.  My medium-cooked angus burger was one of the best burgers I've had in a long time, nice, thick, juicy, and pink in the middle.  The fries are pretty good, and others in my party really enjoyed the buffalo burgers.  The beer selection is impressive.  Mmm, Boddington's & a burger.

br4SHfGAUtawXW-xhakVzA.text: Pretty good burgers and the fries are decent. Service is hit & miss. Been there twice and the first time the service was horrible - the staff that day were the typical Vegas douche-nozzles who were paying more attention to their own conversations than the customers - not many smiles either. The second time I went the staff was great - very attentive and friendly. Make sure to build your own burger.

CIYsnCJwcB6Uf9kT0_Mjjg.text: The name says it all, great burgers and a great bar.  There is usually a wait for a table but they have a ton of bar seating which is also great for watching sports.  I am drawn to restaurants with a quality beer selection and this establishment is one of them.  If you are feeling like a high roller you can order a kobe burger but I think this is a waste of money.  Build your own, order a great pint, and enjoy!

953B2gJDcTta8kOChBBOqA.text: truly a meat-lover's paradise... okay, they have stuff for non-red meat eaters and even veggies, too.  two Angus burgers (with blue cheese and swiss respectively), skinny fries, fat fries (which are not steak fries) and two pints were quite tasty.  I was dying to try the Rossini but didn't... the $50 I saved was better spent elsewhere.  Sports lovers should sit at one of the booths -- you can watch the game du jour in slack-jawed silence while you eat!  Yeah, it's kind of expensive for a burger, but sadly, it's a good deal for palatable food in a Vegas where cheap AND tasty food no longer seems to exist.

Rt8oienAWZVI5tDrLKgyFQ.text: Haven't had beef let alone a burger in YEARS and for my best friend's welcome wedding dinner was hosted here at Burger Bar, I ordered the Kobe burger,(just for her, cause I love her) which was decent. I don't see what the hype is all about. I did forget to put condiments and my lettuce and tomatoes on my burger, LOL. (I'm such a burger retard!) I did like my fried garlic zucchini. I also ordered the salmon salad which was DELISH! I really like the restaurant, good vibe, busy, and great service. Next time, I'd probably stick to my vegetarian, bean patty burger, or maybe try the turkey burger...Not really a red meat kind of girl =P

o7hS5jaA-2-yxGPr7ZboDw.text: I came here last weekend in the afternoon and there was no wait for a table. I enjoyed a turkey burger on a whole wheat bun with bacon, onions and guacamole. The burger was really good, although the guac could use some work. The sweet potato fries were tasty although not in my top 3 of spff selling establishments. The raspberry iced tea was disturbingly good and refilled regularly. The staff was nice and my companions all liked there food. The Burger Joint can be found within the Mandaly Bay Resort & Casino.

Wfr6N5Sq98zvaPenS7Kp0A.text: Very busy and popular joint, lots to see, good food.  The people watching is excellent, not as pricey as most Mandalay restaurants, a lot of good reasons to hit this place up.

pAA0t33hUbiAiQYtoOvosA.text: 4.5/5 for me deducting .5 star for our  weak drinks and waiter who was very quick but had zero personality and hated his job/life. So glad I won some money after the lion king show so we could eat here. It was either win some money and eat here or lose my last 50 and have dorritos for dinner and breakfast. It was a bad trip on the gambling front.  The food was wonderful! We had the onion rings and skinny fries. The fries were good but the onion rings were outstanding. Onion rings are one of my favorite foods and these did not dissapoint. Im wondering why there are not so stellar reviews on them. Trust me there good.  I had a the black angus, with pepper jack, jalapeno bacon, lettuce, tomato, pickle, mayo, ketchup, and mustard on an Onion Roll. The burger was a cooked a perfect medium rare and I mean absolutely perfect. The meat tasted very good and it melted in mouth. A perfect blend of fat in the meat. The jalapeno bacon was crazy good and Im wondering when I can have that again. Im gonna go out on a limb and say this was the best burger I've ever had. I cant think of another that was any better and Ive had a lot of burgers in my day. The onion bun was also delicious.   My girlfriend had a similar burger and she was also very impressed. If your at Mandalay Bay its a must and its even worth a 15 dollar cab ride for this place. Highly reccomened. I wish I would have got a shake to share for desert.

wI7RPw9_kr4-29hYJ4GXWQ.text: the hubert keller burger was probably the best bleu cheese burger i've ever sunk my teeth into. bleu cheese with every bite. sliders were good, but the buffalo slider was the best out of the 3. onion rings & zuchinni sticks are amazingly good. i was sad that i was only able to scarf down a few fries, the burger alone is a gut buster. the fries are good tho, dont get me wrong. they got 24 beers on tap and a GINORMOUS selection of bottled beer as well. this place is awesome!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sliders
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hubert Keller Burger
Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hubert Keller Burger-buffalo, caramelized onions, baby spinach, bleu cheese on a ciabatta bun

wSKeJEhJBDuhQRsPLnlfuA.text: My hubby and I love this place. I swear I wanna eat there every time I'm in Vegas lol. They have the best burgers anywhere. I've done the build your own with kobe beef I've had the Hubert Keller burger amazing the burgers are huge juicy and cooked to perfection. The bar is one of the best I've ever been to. They do an amazing caramel apple martin It's not on the menu anymore but the staff here is so great they will make it if you ask. The fry sampler is a must there regular fries are great crisp with a cream interior and the mac n cheese croquettes are yummy melting chees perfect pasta fried just right. The pepper jack cheese shots were also amazing with a nice punch of heat and the best zucchini fries I've had anywhere. We got ours with the sauce sampler I would highly recommend the basil aioli as a dipper and the spicy ketchup. If you go anywhere in vegas this is one of the must go super staff great food great drinks it doesn't get better then Burger Bar

4duQz_NMtm_v58DwptYH9Q.text: Amazing burgers!  We even saw Robert Duvall chowing down on one when we went.

K97ifpwT_llfwx3z6L8zYQ.text: this is one of those occasions where i wish yelp would let you give 1/2 stars  i am a beer snob. i will be the first to admit it. so i was pretty damn excited to learn that what i have been told is the best beer bar in vegas was next to my hotel. the beer selection was solid. the prices were pretty on par with the average beer bar back home in chicago. i did notice few very very out of season seasonals which makes me wonder about their turnover on bottles and kegs. having pumpkin beer in stock in july is just strange.   the bartenders we chatted up were super nice. i commented on one of the beers in particular and the bartender called over the beer buyer to tell him what i said. then came the part that irked me. the buyer asked me about chicago beer and the breweries here. i said a few sentences about 3 floyds in particular and mentioned something about having had some of their super limited dark lord a couple of days before. the buyer was very clearly not interested in hearing what i was saying even though he had asked the question. he basically smiled and nodded but did not listen at all. this too would be fine, rude but fine, had he not 15 minutes later while i was in the middle of eating come up behind me and asked me to tell him about 3 floyds and this dark lord beer he had heard about. frustrating situation. i don't really understand managing a beer bar and not wanting to talk about beer.   in the end the price wasn't bad. the burger was pretty good. nothing amazing but pretty good. they had a ton of topping options and out of sight onion rings.   all and all we were here for about 45 minutes and as can often be said for a good bar. come for the beer, stay for the food, enjoy the bartenders, avoid the management.

xcQ_IX8kmzngENAUm5R6Mg.text: The burgers and beer available here can hold their own.  Excellent flavor, consistency and selection of toppings.  Just don't go too crazy with all the toppings.  It's like wine pairings.  Find the toppings that match up well and won't ruin or overpower each other.  I had the Angus burger on chiabatta bun with prosciutto, Monterey jack cheese, and the red wine reduction sauce.  The sweet potato fries weren't the best I've had, but still tasty and a great compliment to the burger.  Ordered some smooth Stella to wash it all down.  The environment was alright.  The place could be a little bigger, but nothing to complain about.  Friendly service doesn't hurt either.  Ranks up there with LA's Father's Office.  Better burgers... not as good drink variety or ambiance.  I'd come back fo sho.

y3Yrg0gEbN5Nf0cKKpqOAg.text: Quite possibly the best burger I've had. How many times have you ordered a burger medium rare and it comes out pretty much well done? Not here. My blackjack burger (ciabatta bread/jack cheese) was THICK and cooked perfectly, a little crispy on the outside and very JUICY on the inside. Even the included skinny fries were pretty good. At $14 it was totally worth it. I also had a twinkie milkshake (great idea). It tasted great, but probably not worth it for $9.

hOUYXCx_o5FseGWLT-MBwg.text: Okay, so everyone loves the Kobe Beef burger. The first time I went I tried it and I was not impressed at all. It seems like such a waste of great meat to just grind it up. Maybe it's because I'm not used to the flavor or I didn't like the idea of paying that much for a burger but I didn't think it was that great.  The second time I ordered the Country Natural and customized it to my liking; I was very satisfied this time. The meat was juicy, the bun was tasty, and the sauce gave just the right complimentary flavor. The fries were also seasoned and cooked perfectly so that they were nice and crispy but not burnt.  The food took awhile both times but the server was nice and she had all these cool tattoos. I like.

92jv2gHb5Rd-RKHLzmtOSg.text: After spending a good 25 minutes across the way at Lush, I felt like my masculinity was challenged by all the essential oils and body scrubs, so what do I decide to do?    Burger Bar!  This place is for the guy's guy.  Cute female wait staff and hostesses wearing as little as possible, little TVs at every booth with big ones along the wall showing manly shows like ESPN and Poker tournaments, two full pages of exotic beers and other booze, huge burgers with any kind of topping you could dream of, and five kinds of fries.  I simply sat in and soaked up the testosterone, and all those girly exfoliant soaps were washed right out of my mind.  The main focus of Burger Bar is the burgers.  This place has burgers with many options for a total customizable meal.  First, you choose your burger meat, with the basic being their Ridgefield beef for around $8.95, Angus beef for $10, Kobe Beef for $13+, and even a veggie burger for the Vegs out there.  You can choose from among 5 different buns, and the whole thing comes with lettuce, tomato, and onions on the side, for you to put on at your leisure.  On the right side is a long list of toppings for your burger, ranging from the mundane to the extravagant.  For example, you could have grilled onions on your burger, or cheese, or bacon; you could also have a half a lobster tail, shrimp, foie gras, or black truffles.  Each topping comes with its own price to add to the burger, which makes it easy to overspend.  With sauces as well, you could be paralyzed by the sheer number of choices.    Not to worry!  Burger Bar has selected a few choice "Chef Burgers" for you, with toppings pre-chosen and an accompanying price.  One is a simple burger with just the meat, the bun, cheese, and some bacon on it, for about $12, I believe.  The top of the line is a monster called the "Rossini", which sounded like they just wanted to take the most expensive and rare items and put them all in one burger.  This burger contains the Kobe beef, along with grilled foie gras, the black truffles, and a few other delectables, for a whopping $60.    Overall, I liked it.  The service was prompt, but tended to leave you alone most of the time, the food was really good and very filling (I made my own choices, it was good).  The coffee here sucks, though; don't even bother with it.  All-in-all, walked out paying $35 even with tax and tip for two people.  Not bad at all.  I might have to come back when I'm rich to try that Rossini...

BAPmzGieXPBwZh95iS0ytw.text: I stopped in here when I was vacationing in LV last weekend, and it was probably the food-highlight of the trip.  I had the Kobe beef burger with peppered jack cheese, caramelized onions, and the typical burger toppings.  It was fantastic.  The onion rings were also delicious, and the bloody mary I had was hands-down the best I've ever drank.  I don't think I'd go out of my way to visit this place again on my next trip (considering how many places there are to eat in Vegas,) but it's definitely worth checking out if you're close-by.

vtgrhcjVctL0IFqf8exhTQ.text: This bar is so great.  They have my favorite Belgium beers, delirium tremens.  Their burgers are so delicious and so are all their desserts.  I can't wait to go back.  I loved it.  Also, bar and wait staff are very nice.

dNDLvVvUfS1aS8Zpn6lyYg.text: Had two custom burgers with sweet pot fries and fat fries. First burger was bison with grilled onion, bacon and fried egg. Second burger was Kobe onions, american cheese and fried egg. We thought both burgers and fries were real good. Side note get one of the shakes, we had Nutella shake and it was amazing.

Fgt4eUPVe3KuCQ3sRJUVOQ.text: Awesome Burger. I had the Buffalo! It was 17 bucks, but it was well worth it. Also ordered sweet potato fries, which were delectable.  THere's a few different burgers to choose from, but you can't go wrong. Definitely the best meal I had in Las Vegas while I was there recently. Highly Recommended.

jhxm25RnZ5BrzfurEu8flA.text: Delicious!!! Friendly helpful staff, crazy milkshake combos and gourmet burgers. I got the perfect 10 Gouda cheese Carmelized onions on a pretzel bun!!!! Sweet and savory with sweet potato fries. And they have a bunch of different dipping sauces!!! I chose cinnamon honey mustard for my fries. Uhg I need a nap now

7v8CnhKKXSsKS3EDHX5Rkw.text: Um....not the best burger I've ever had, not even by a long shot.  I know it's popular, but my experience was not particularly life changing.  It could be that I was trying to be "healthy" and ordered a salmon burger.  It's pricey, and for me, it was simply okay.  I don't think I'll go back anytime soon, unless it's free or there's a super good discount.  On the upside, the service was good.

AQUKwgxwv4vx-m3V0IZVRA.text: I walked into this place thinking ok, such a tourist trap, 45 min wait, awful design, and basically inside a mall inside a mega-hotel: this place has got to be overrated.  God damnit, it wasn't. It was absolutely wonderful. All I'm talking about is my burger. I've decided to forgo the typical review of atmosphere, appetizers, drinks, etc because the burger was just THAT good. My friend and I split the Kobe Burger with a thin layer of aoili, provolone, carmelized onions, and the winning topping, as always, a fried egg.   Cooked medium-rare, aka to perfection, this burger was everything one dreams about. Melty-cheesy-juicy, full of flavor, oh my gosh. It's 9:30am. I want one right now!  If only we hadn't split it and had each paid $20 for these burgers... but unfortunately that's kiiiiinda a lot for a burger so $10 each for such a life-changing experience was alright by me.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kobe Beef with Caramelized Onions, Provolone, Fried Egg and Aoili

Qb8pbUfnJK3ueS_til2pcw.text: Special burger was good but slider was little too dry. The restaurant was not busy but took a long time to get our foods.

NR4s-kGOJ7Ee9nZdx7j-sQ.text: We actually went there yesterday and it was so good! buffalo meat was cooked to perfection! Great service! I'll be going back!

X2jOp-j9HsHy5HJRNRqh6g.text: A bit pricy for the quantity.

J1nrVtuV0w3B8s9-VnMByQ.text: Probably one of the worst restaurants I have ever been to. Since I travel for a living this is really saying something. My server Rachel? had one of the rudest personalities imaginable. She messed up a beer order and then just said go ahead and keep it. I thought that was great until she came back 5 minutes later and repossessed the beer. When asked why she was taking it back she said "you did not order it".  I said you gave it to me and she again said you did not order it. Mind boggling. I inquired again 10 minutes later and she still had the same attitude. It gets better though, the food was horrendous. I had a turkey burger that had absolutely no seasoning or taste, two other people got burgers that were not even close to cooked right (think medium well that was actually totally red raw), and the fries were soggy. Sending back the burgers just gave our server more attitude.  Horrible service, bad food. Do yourself a favor and skip this place, there are tons of other great restaurants in town.

-i4OXg8oxjdFrbW93a0Mjg.text: From the creative genius that brought you the Fleur de Lys restaurant, Hubert Keller brings you the Burger Bar. This place leaves most gourmet burger places in the dust. With its various choices to build your own burger.. to the chef's signature burgers... it's not your typical burger place... definitely and certainly not.  Last year, I selected the Hubert Keller burger which was a buffalo burger with caramelized onions, baby spinach, and blue cheese on a ciabatta bun. It was delicious however there was one burger that stood out on the menu that I was hesitant to try at first. The $60 Rossini.  Fast forward to a few weeks ago, I decided to test out this burger to see what the whole hype was about... to see if a burger would be even worth that much to me. What crazy person would pay that much for a burger and why??  Well.. nonetheless I was curious and crazy enough to do it. I must say, though I can see how some people may not find the Rossini not not be worth the exuberant amount they ask for.....   I found it to be utterly delightful!! From the juicy tender kobe beef patty, to the foie gras and black perigord truffles.. I was difficult for me to find myself eating a regular burger after having taken a bite out of this burger. The madeira sauce complimented the burger wonderfully and going halfway into the meal.. I just thought to myself.. I just ate $30 worth of food right there.. and as I contemplated if this whole meal was worth the money and hype.. I decided that the answer was a definitive and crazy, YES.  Finishing off with a cheesecake burger.. it was a nice wonderful experience... Also, I must note.. I was there with two other people from the SF bay area.. and we watched the Giants win the World Series as we finished up our meal. Ahh.... definitely a cherry top finish.

1D2dr7nUk0QW9a05-x62MQ.text: Great Burger !!!! Probably one of the best burgers I've had. They offer a good variety of options to make your own creation

qol2ZFbgNCIxLJ34fuP2cg.text: Yum!! I go to Vegas a lot for business and am always stuck in the hotels and convention centers. I look forward to the Burger Bar and always have a pleasant experience! The best thing there? The zucchini fries! The best sandwich? The salmon 'burger' on ciabatta, with sauteed portobello mushrooms and spinach. Actually heavenly. I can't wait to go back!!!

4cNn7x9-CtxLlSBA2Y2FQA.text: Such a good place. The gf bun is potato based and so good I was questioning if they gave me a gluten free bun or not. I had the salmon burger, gf steak fries (not that great) with truffle mayo and aioli, which I highly recommend

c5qzXfTNUvihQZF1HGwToA.text: Love Burger Bar and make it a point to go every visit to LV.  They even had one of my fav beers that wasn't even on the menu, Samichlaus Classic Bier.  Great Kobe burger with truffles and truffle sauce but that was enough for me.....couldn't indulge in any sides.  Also had the perk of meeting the Celebrity Chef Hubert Keller!!!  That part made my night.

N2Re9ypsD4jdrePyCUOa-Q.text: It is an Hubert Keller restaurant in the mall next to Mandalay Bay (you can access from the inside of the hotel).  He has several other restaurants there but this one was more casual and sounded delicious after a night out.  Their Nutella milkshake is AHHH-mazing!  No really.  Their burgers are quite tasty and plentiful and I really recommend the fat (steak) fries and the sweet potato fries.  And the pesto aioli?! MMMMM MMMMMMMM good!

pZXfWHmaAjO-BUBQ6qzEDg.text: I had higher hopes for this place. Met my friend here for lunch one day and to start off our service was really poor. The restaurant was 85-95% full between the bar and  tables, but there seeemed to be plenty of staff so not sure what the issue was. The server was slow to get over to us and to take our order. She was not friendly and it looked like she didn't want to be there or serve us.  Our food came out after 30 minutes and my burger was dry and not good at all. My friends burger was fine, she said it was alright but we both have had much better food elsewhere.  The prices are high as well for such crap meat. Go to stripburger instead.

7WsKcwyKaAL5NHzpOK6Itg.text: Solid beer selection. Limited menu for those not looking for a burger, but I'd expect that. Burgers are good but pricey. I went with the sliders and they weren't over cooked. They know what a medium burger should be. Kind of cramped. You may wait for seating

6Zw6plC1oH4nQ2ScB_rN6A.text: Came here Saturday after 3PM, had to wait around 10 minutes for a table for 4.  I've ordered the $60 Rossini burger (wagyu beef topped with foie gras and shavings of black truffle).  The burger was tasty, but I could do without the black truffle, and opted with just the foie gras.  The Rossini includes side of fries and either a standard milk shake or a hamburger dessert.  Our waitress was ok, came to take our order and then disappeared for the remaining of our meal.  The fries were overcooked, but I did not have a chance to tell our waitress to bring another.  Most of our service was delivered by the hard working bus boys.  I had to order extra beer from the bus boy as well, since our waitress seems to be hiding from us.

6HlayueZRQqVntohnIgmtw.text: BB is a great place to go for a unique experience not just another burger Of course the prices are high but it's gourmet burgers not fast food  You can customize any burger just the way you imagine it  It's worth every penny   Cool spot to go on a date  A must if you love burgers

dLo1gJgXdTlDv3q75btJwg.text: OMFG! Easily the best burgers I've ever had, perfectly cooked, juicy, and just plain delicious.  Wound up eating here twice in four days, which says a lot considering how many cool restaurants/cafes there are in Vegas.  I'm a stickler for tradition when it comes to burgers so I just got cheese with avocado the first time, and cheese with grilled onions the second - can't really fathom putting all that filler on my burgers when the patties themselves are so damn good.    Other pluses - teriffic beer selection, very reasonable prices, and a congenial wait staff.  A classy place all the way, but I expected no less from Hubert Keller.

3LIUFshZ1_GL2UECgZmgPA.text: So my friends and I were in town for a conference, and we're trying to find a place that's better than fast food but wouldn't require reservations or dropping 40+/person.  We actually did the random restaurant picker @ Urban Spoon and got this place.  I was really impressed.  I had the Kobe Beef burger medium rare which was awesome as well as both sweet potato fries and onion rings.  The food was great, the service was fast (esp considering our waitress had a table of 15+ right next to us), and I'd definitely go back for 2nds.

oeHrk1SdQQ9woJBU-DGv7A.text: I could not have been more pleased with this place!  We went on a Saturday night around 11 and sat at the bar to avoid the wait (it was only 15 minutes but we were hungry). Our bartender was superb and stayed on top of the beverages and checked in with us frequently.  I had a turkey burger which had a depth of flavor that is lacking in many restaurant turkey burgers. I added pepperjack cheese, avocado, and the usual lettuce, tomato, onion.  All great. Even better was the sweet potato fries!!! So many restaurants seem to have difficulty getting them to stay crispy but these were perfect and full of flavor.  My friend got a bacon, egg, and cheese burger and was in love as well.  The best part about this place is the fun milkshakes!  My friend got a Murphy's Stout "float" with coffee ice cream, tons of yummy whipped cream, and chocolate covered espresso beans to garnish. I am not a beer drinker or a coffee drinker, but I had a taste of this and it was pretty damn good!  I ordered the Mint Chocolate Chip milkshake which was so sinfully good. It had mint choc chip ice cream, peppermint schnapps, CHOCOLATE whipped cream (!), and two big fat Oreos to garnish.  Oh man this thing was a meal in itself but soooo good I finished every drop.  It's pricey, but it's Vegas and expected and worth every penny!

-iNOSK72yx8EVV_yPPVNzQ.text: The food was bland and the service was slow.  My Mom ordered a shrimp salad, and it had a ridiculous amount of lettuce in it.  The burger was undercooked and had no flavor at all.  I was not impressed, expecially for the prices.

Gf5-srXHWoGW9S_2iX3Vig.text: Good food and fast turn around, which is great in Vegas since you don't have to wait awhile if you haven't made a reservation. Our server was uber friendly and fast. So nice to have service with a smile!   My burger was cooked perfectly at medium rare. I ordered the peppercorn burger which is the only thing I would change about my order. The sauce was really mild and runny. So that made it hard to taste, especially as it was running out the side, but one can always dip!  Reasonable prices if you are looking for a quick place to grab something to eat without putting a lot of thought or planning into it.   I didn't try one of their shakes, but they looked tasty and heard they are delish.

mGweHXT1KEAtEG4tEn-yeQ.text: Definitely not a six-dollar burger.  My husband and I were staying at the Luxor and happened to wander into the passage connecting the Luxor to Manadalay Bay when we came upon the Burger Bar.  I first heard of the Burger Bar from the Food Network.  The Burger Bar is an upscale burger joint.  To me, it was like a chic version of Red Robin.   The wait was only about 15 minutes.  We were seated at a booth with a TV on the wall.  My husband was happy because ESPN was on.  Wow, burger, fries, and sports... the perfect combination for every guy.  There are two options when ordering your burger.  You can order pre-assembled burgers where the ingredients are chosen for you, but there are no substitutions if you go this route.  Or you can order the patty and toppings individually to create your own customized burger.  I chose to create my own burger.  I ordered the cheapest patty (relatively speaking) which cost $8.95.  My toppings included pepper jack cheese, avocado, and cinnamon bacon.  My husband ordered the Kobe burger which cost twice as much as my "cheap" patty.  The Kobe beef burger is NOT worth the extra cost.  Between the el cheapo patty and the Kobe, go with the el cheapo.  Fellow Yelper Mike L. mentioned he got a free dessert with the Kobe burger, however, we didn't get a dessert, nor were we offered or aware of one.   The zucchini fries were excellent!  Crispy and hot!  My husband also order a Sierra Mist with a shot of peach syrup.  This drink was so sweet that one sip would rot your teeth.  After a sip of this sugary concoction, my Coke tasted like water.  Our waiter was a bit on the cranky side.  He was very robotic when it came to taking our orders and seemed agitated when we asked for ranch with our zucchini fries.  Perhaps he was a little disgruntled because he had to work on a Saturday night...  Grand total for burgers, fries, and drinks (sodas) for two at the Burger Bar came to $53.00 with tax and tip.  OUCH!  The Burger Bar is great for the upscale clientele who craves the "poor man's palate" of burgers and fries.  For burgers, I'll stick with Red Robin.

2m1i8JQFaGL7yV90jxD0gg.text: "i love burgers, and i love bars, and when the two come together its like a great burger bar fireworks"  good burgers, good beer, no complaints at all. And now there's one in SF i need to check it out. Oh and for added fun - we enjoyed playing the "are the waitresses twins?" game.

PSbbIShy9vX1E6qt4OttkQ.text: I hadn't been to Burger Bar in about 10 years so we were pretty excited to try their burgers again. Very underwhelming experience. Overpriced and cooked improperly. Burger patty to bun size was way off. 2 burgers, a shared order of fries and 2 glasses of wine should NOT cost 65 dollars and if it does it better be outstanding. Instead, it left me wishing I had gone to Fatburger or In and Out. I would recommend either The Dillinger in Boulder City or Bachi Burger for a True gourmet burger. Better prices AND better burgers. I won't be back to Burger Bar.

0T5VoRNOwIuLlmmkt-5Hhw.text: I have been meaning to go here for a long long time now. It has been on my list of places to try in Vegas for at least a year. Why you ask? Its all because the wagyu burger! It was this past Friday night and I ordered mine like I order all my burgers medium with caramelized onions and mushrooms with a side of fries. The burger is definitely among the best I have ever had. The meat is juicy and tender! The price is decent after taking into account the elevated Vegas pricing at every restaurant.  Would I come here again? Definitely. Considering some of the other expensive choices you can make for dinner in Vegas, the food was great and I was definitely satisfied after eating it! A 4 star!

oUp3pN4TYz42Apgk-maMAg.text: Just the two of us, me and my BF; went on a Saturday night; not too long of wait, luckily they were about to clear off one of the booths; we wanted to check it out because it's by Hubert Keller...seems like a nice guys...at least on Top Chef Masters. :)  Atmosphere/location: located upstairs at Mandalay Bay; very casual bar atmosphere; booths have its own small TV screens tuned on a sports channel, nice and cute...but I wasn't paying much attention to it because I was hungry to devour some burgers!  Food: -we resorted not to order the $60 burger (with foie gras and truffles...not your typical backyard burger heh?)...maybe next time? or not -kobe beef burger: ordered it with onion buns, provolone and grilled onions (which they added in addition to the red onions that already comes with); the taste? meh, it was alright, not the greatest, it was kinda drier than we liked; sweet potato fries were excellent! -hubert keller burger: buffalo burger with blue cheese on ciabatta buns; nice and juicy, liked this one better than the kobe burger; skinny fries were alright, I prefer the sweet potato fries personally -beers: nothing extraordinary; you can also order samplers but the selections were not anything exotic that I wanted to sample -they have all kinds of milkshakes and beer floats but we didn't get them...lactose intolerant :(  Service: fine, no complaints  I don't know if I want to go back and pay $20+ for each burger (if you order "build your own burger" they charge for extra toppings). Nice experience for once but I think In-N-Out will do just fine for now.

MlvNSN3RSZ-AYQ7cSPrwZA.text: We walked from venetian to mgm and then to burger bar (basically all the way down the strip) so by the time we got there I was starving!   (-) - 17 bucks for my kobe beef burger.  - adding avocado cost 1.55 (ridiculous) for three small slices - burger came and they forgot to add avocado to mine.  - inconsistent medium rare patties, some were really pink in the middle, some looked well done  (+) -sweet potato fries  My burger was good, I didn't think it was anything special and not worth 17 bucks. Service was ok, I dont know if it was the waitresses fault I didn't get the avocado or if it was the kitchen. It also took forever to flag the waitress down and get a pen for our credit card stuff.  For the 24 bucks I paid in total I'd rather have spent it on gambling or the wynn buffet.

PYygUmEfEz_fi-CGSJ0g2Q.text: My husband and I ate here the day after we got married. It was great, just us! We stopped in with our large whale bone from Fat Tuesday and they let us in with no problem. I ordered the Ridgefield Farm burger...I think thats what it was called....anyways it was the cheapest one at $8.95 and it was awesome! My husband ordered their Angus burger and he really liked his too! I added on american cheese, and their grilled onions, I put on some lettuce tomatoe and just used A1....it was seriously the best!! My husband added bleu cheese and pepper crusted bacon, he put on some lettuce and tomatoe too. His condiment choice was a little bit of A1, mustard and ketchup. He loved his from the first bite! Looking back at it I would have liked to order the American Kobe, but I guess I'll have to do that next time! We are definitely coming back! lol  We live near The Counter and was told "its the best..." so we ate there a month or so before our trip to Vegas. It totally sucked! This place is waaaay better! Its all about the burger here not about it's trendy location or who's seen eating there like our local Counter restaurant.

Tbq-ypAkHSG7vkIT4HXWeg.text: During our entire trip to Las Vegas, we wanted a burger, and we were longing for a nice, cold, tasty beer.   Las Vegas is not only a desert environmentally, but in terms of quality, there is a sore lack of good beers, good wine, good whiskey, and good food at reasonable prices.  In terms if beer, it was quite difficult to find anything other than the usual swill.  In fact, this is the only place we managed to find a nice selection of beers - and they weren't $10 each either.  We were told at the entrance that we would need to wait 30-45 minutes, so we sat down at the bar and managed to find a few beers we hadn't tried before.  One was a Black IPA from Stone Brewing Co. and my wife had something else, I think it was European and smooth.  We talked about beer with the bartender and a fellow sitting by us and the bartender offered us what's called the Deschutes Black Butte XX, a variation on their Black Butte Porter, but much better.   We thought about the offer and decided we would wait until we got our burgers.    In the meantime, we continued to talk about beer and convinced the fellow next to us to try his first IPA - Dogfish Head 90 minute (they were out of the 60 minute).   I'm not sure what he thought about it, but he certainly agreed it was strong and hoppy.  The wait didn't seem to long, and we eventually sat down at a table and started to wait for our burgers to arrive.  We ordered their buffalo burger and their American Classic (basically a bacon cheeseburger).  I asked if the waitress if they made their own meat, and indeed they did.  The burgers were among the best we have had.  Juicy, tasty, well cooked, no fillers, quality meat.  During our feast - these burgers were big - the Black Butte XX arrived which made our  meal even more delicious.      If the burgers weren't enough, we decided to have dessert, well I decided, because my wife was quite full, but the dessert burgers looked good.  My wife's burger was marginal, but I had a delicious burger that was basically some fruit, whipped cream, and donuts for the buns.    In any case, when I return next year, which will be for DEFCON, I will have top my visit off with a trip to Burger Bar.  You can go to some big expensive, overpriced restaurant with a chance that you'll actually get something of quality, and I'll go to Burger Bar.

onAgdyI7pXutWgfxx9BRhw.text: Amazing burger, one of the best I've had. Just got a cheeseburger, but the meat was thick, perfectly cooked and very high quality.  Good price for a burger on the strip ($12), amazing price for the quality.

BnJanrjoB-aCXYUJvxQcEg.text: Not a lot to add to what's already been stated in previous reviews.  I chose the Hubert Keller buffalo burger and the sweet potato fries.  Best burger I've ever had!  Service was good and we were seated promptly.  I think the prices are reasonable for gourmet burgers.

WjxBGrnj4cEYPS6EUKUsAA.text: For food quality to dollar value, it's hard to do better than this place. You can't go wrong with any of the burgers or my personal favorite, the pulled pork sliders. I'd gladly pay double for this level of food elsewhere. Plus - the staff is phenomenal. Incredibly attentive. It's my go-to place in Vegas. (Especially if I've had a tough day at the craps tables.)

SWLh1Sv51KvFAFbeMvYMBw.text: Burger bar is bomb! Hubert Keller burger is bomb! Next time I'm in Vegas I'm trying the burger with foi gras in it...if I win money in Vegas though (it's a $60 burger)

_Az5isIWaGVsBghSWpVB6A.text: Whenever I go to Vegas, I absolutely have to stop by Burger Bar. It's  my favorite burger joint ever, a shame they don't have one in So. Cal. This is a build-your-own-burger place and they have an amazing selection of meats and things to put in your burger. The last time I was here, I ordered a regular angus patty with grilled onions, American cheese, prosciutto, bacon, and garlic aoli on the side. I love the onion rings here! They are the type that when you bite in, the whole onion doesn't come out! How nice. A little on the pricey side but worth it. Huge portions too!  A little hint... This place is almost always packed and usually there's a crowd outside waiting. Helpful hint, find yourself a seat at the bar!
